column13: Had a $5 smoothie. It was banana. It's a bit overpriced for $5, but we are at Lifetime. I expect overpriced everything.

I have been a Lifetime fitness member in Illinois since 2001 and grab a bite in the Lifecafe 3-4 times a year.  The service is good and menu selection is decent. For reasonably priced items order from the daily specials.  

Once I tried a natural bubbly energy drink from a can and threw it out because it was close to the most disgusting drink I ever had. 

Also, Lifecafe should install an exhaust hood fan to vent outdoors above the oven.  It would help the gym not smell like food!  Currently, the air circulation system grabs the food smells and pumps it throughout the club.

The worst Mediterranean bowl in my life! It only looks good on the menu. 
$9 for a brown mush that looks like it was leftover for a week, can't even tell what vegetables were there. Quinoa was super dry. 
The $6 salmon I added onto this bowl was thin and dry, and very small 1/2*2*2 in. 
I've lost faith for Life Cafe's food after seeing this dish.
Good food but it seems a little airport deli in prices... $3.50 or so for 3 oz of diced chicken breast with pesto?

No other place offers a 5% discount for using cash, do they??? What a great incentive! But better than that is the band that is here tonight.....3 Aces.....old rock and roll and some old country....excellent job guys!!! And then there is Jess our server: really good at customer service, keeping our glasses filled and offering the $3 burger special with fries that cannot be beat for a late night dinner on Friday. This place is clean and comfortable, with friendly people and a great place to hang out! Thanks for a great night out to a new place that we have never been to before.  The live band was a big bonus tonight too! We will be back.

I was torn from giving this place a 3 star or a 4 star. I decided to give this place a 3 star. I decided to go out with my fiancée and do a groupon lunch. There were two offers. 40.00 value for 4 or 20.00 value for 2. Obviously we took the second.

Pros...

1. The waitress was great. Very friendly and smiling all the time. She was also the bartender. There weren't many people there so she was doing the double duty of waitressing and bartending between us and a couple sitting at the bar.

2. My fiancée ordered a tuna salad sandwich and corn on the cob with chili spices. Meanwhile I had fish and chips (i.e. fish and fries). It's a Catholic city so many bars will have fish and chips in the Chicago area. The food was really good, warm, and they give you big portions.

3. Menu had many options. For some reason they had a lot of Mexican food options. Not bad.

Cons...

1. As much as I like hole in the walls, this place did look like it needs some serious updating. Walls were drabby, out of date furniture, etc. I sort of felt like it was a bar from the 80's. It did look like it was rundown. It was very dark inside on a very sunny day. However they did say they will have a patio in a few weeks outside.

2. We waited like 20 minutes to 30 minutes for our food. I think there was only one person in the kitchen. To give a benefit of the doubt, it was dead time so they probably saved money since they they were not expecting us. 

My fiancée and I decided that we will most likely not come back. 

Conclusion...
Good place to grab a quick food. Somewhat inexpensive. It was worth the groupon deal we had so go ahead the first time and the judge yourself. I would rather go to Bdubs then here, but still not a bad place.

I have been to Ceasar's several times (all at night) and every time I go, I keep getting let down.

I am NOT a drinker, so the only thing I can rate is food, service, and atmosphere.

Food: 3/5
The menu at Ceasars is pretty extensive, and about what you'd expect from a bar, and then some. Their Mexican food is tolerable for what it is, but not, by any means, a "home run". I haven't had anything but the Mexican food. Do not get the fish taco.

Service: 1/5
The service here is slower than a boat on land. Servers are nice and friendly, but I've waited for up to 45 minutes for food. On top of that, last time I was there (March 2016), they were having trouble with their card machines.

If you're wanting entrees relatively quick, pick another place.

Atmosphere: 3/5
Atmosphere is pretty normal for what you'd expect at a sports bar, no Mexican decor at all, which doesn't really matter to me. Can get crowded pretty quickly, I would not suggest groups unless you're sitting near the front. Also, it gets loud by the speakers on karaoke nights.

- - - - - - - - -

All-in-All, If you're looking for better, faster Mexican food in the area, drive a little bit further east on Lake st to El Burrito Tapatio, or west, to El Burrito Fantastico. If you're looking for a slow time with a reasonable bar atmosphere, go to Ceasar's


Caesar's Sports Bar
2/5 Stars

First time visiting this bar and restaurant. I am a big fan of beer and sports so this place is perfect for me. Good atmosphere, great prices, great TV viewing angles and better than most bar food. Will be returning again in the near future.
very slow during weekdays, food not tasty, feels like frozen food that was warmed-up. they do have plenty of TV's, slot machines and karaoke on weekends....

Cesar's for Breakfast - Not again- 
There was  8 of us -  we got there at  10:10 am Sunday - we did not get our food until -11:11 it was only-2 who got theirs   then at 11:24 3 more meals arrived, 11:37 last 3 came!  Some Food was cold, and pancake was uncooked,  and didn't get  side of sausage or pancake , bacon was crumpled in pieces vs long strips. The only girl waitstaff there was very nice tho.
Food was just ok , Menu has spelling , grammatical errors and prices omitted ,  we should have know better to  go to a sports bar for breakfast , not sure what type of software their billing system is but the bill was difficult to understand.they left the walmart stickers on syrup containers . Does that mean jars weren't washed?   
Hoping lunch / dinner is better.

Awesome place and food.  Very friendly staff and .35 cent wings all weekend! 

The burgers and shrimp dish is very good.  They also have live DJ on Fridays and weekends.  Average prices and a casual place.

I would recommend this place for family dinner during the week and a place to relax on the weekends or watch the Bears game on the large TVs...

Place is nice.  Clean nice staff.good lighting everything a bar should be...  But I love wings...  Love wings! 

And they use same oil for their fish as they do for their wings....  Big no no I don't want fish tasting wings. 


Also check your bills.  Two of the two of us were over charged on the bill then shorted on change haha 

Drinks are cheap and fresh but.... math is not their strong point.
Came here just for a drink but decided to grab some food and let me tell you... BEST WINGS EVER! They fall right off the bone.

The steak tacos IMO are still some of the best that I have had even tho they have raised the prices to $2.50 ea. Still a fair price for what you are getting.

One of my slight beefs with the place right now is the prices of draft beer. You never know how much you are going to pay each day. Every day and every week seems to be different. Miller Lite on one day can cost $1.00. The next day it could be $3.00. The next day the same draft beer can cost $4.00. If you want Blue Moon it can cost you $3.00 one day, $4.00 the next day and on Sunday it will cost you $6.00. I find the prices to be the highest on Sunday. Stopped going on Sundays because of that. 

It still is a fun place to watch hockey and football games. They have satellite TV so they can pick up just about every football game you want. Very good picture quality on their TV's.  Almost everyone in the place seems to carry on a conversation with you unlike a lot of places. A friendly local bar with friendly customers.

The tacos and chips and salsa (could be a little more hotter) are really good IMO. I am not a big fan of much else on their menu. The gyros are OK but I have had better at other places. I prefer the spicy version. The steak fajitas were not as good as I had hoped. The nachos are pretty much chips, steak, a little cheese, sour cream and guacamole. I would like to see more cheese, lettuce and tomatoes. Personally I would like to see the wings with either no breading or their own homemade breading. None of this pre made packaged stuff.  But then what do you want for .60 ea.

The hamburgers are frozen patties. Not my preference. They do offer a grass fed beef hamburger (not on the menu) that is pretty good. The fries w/ the grass fed beefburger are suppose to be organic. You have to ask and see if they have it in stock.

Still one of the the best local friendly places in the Bloomingdale area.
Good food plenty of tv's nice environment but service is "hit & miss".  Sometimes good, other times wait staff is not as attentive as should be
Great service to start. Food was good. Plenty of TVs to watch games. Great neighborhood bar and grill!

I jumped onto my Yelp account to see how one of my new favorite places to frequent for lunch was doing when it comes to business reviews and I was egregiously disappointed. Only 9 reviews and 3  1/2 stars, surely something was amiss. Come on Yelpers we can do better than that! Then as I read them I began to see the trend. An issue with having staff during peak times is apparent. I get it and totally understand. My coworkers and I had a night where our drinks kept going cold on a Friday night because Marisol had gone on break. So chances are that if you had a good server it was Marisol. 

For those wary of checking Cesar's out, be aware that Cesar has hired more staff (I met a new girl this afternoon that was super friendly though so I remain hopeful). Clearly this hiring issue is something that any new-er business will experience growing pains over. Especially as word spreads and they get busier for the night crowd. 

I have found that Cesar's has an A*mazing lunch special menu--tacos, burgers, wings at a decent price. They should be much busier during the lunch hours than they are. The menu doesn't need to be so large when they make such amazing chicken tacos. Perhaps I should talk to Cesar about this. Don't get me wrong, when you are hungry you are...HUNGRY! (((GIVE ME MY FOOD NOW))) As for the margaritas, I admit that they are definitely a bit on the strong side and perhaps should be saved for a night out before a weekend (if you can finish more than 1 I'd be impressed). However, among all of these things Cesar's has become a place my coworkers and I frequent. It's become our version of the bar 'Cheers'--where everybody knows our names and faces. So, if you've given Cesars a bad review, try them out again at lunch if all else fails you cannot go wrong with the chicken tacos!
Probably the worst bar I've been in if you go you better check your bill I've been there 4 times and every time they over charge you stay away service is horrible to
I had the chicken fajitas this past Friday and they were AMAZING!! By far the best fajitas I have ever had!! They also had $2 Heineken draft pints!! Just an awesome time!!!!!!

This place has very good tacos and it is good to see this area have another bar to replace legends. The place has one pool table and a menu mix with American and Mexican cuisine. Not a bad looking place and much more better and classier place to visit that the numerous taquerias popping up all over the place in DuPage County. I much rather go to a place like this than those anytime. The service was good and look of the place great for a far away strip suburban mall a hundred yeards from the street.

Nice neighborhood Bar and Grill they greet you at the door they serve pretty average food the atmosphere is fun and the people and the place our patrons are nice the price is very fair and moderate nice place to go to they do things for the community like fun razor
Great place to hang out! Karaoke on Tuesday,  Friday and Saturday.  Food is awesome, especially the tacos and their homemade salsa!

The food is actually pretty decent however for a Mexican place the margaritas weren't really very good at all. I'm not complaining because I don't mind a strong drink but this shouldn't have even been categorized as a margarita. It was more like tequila with some lime just and stuff. All that aside, we kinda like the place because it's something new and different.
Great bar, excellent place for a drink afterwork! Prices are cheap! Also good food and service!
Terrible service, terrible food, terrible drinks.  I have to assume that it's friends of the staff that is giving good reviews....

We were going some where else and saw this place from across the street. We stop by and they had the .35 wings going on and we were hooked. The staff is friendly, the place is clean, they have live DJ music on Fridays , they have a lot of TV's to watch your own favorite channel or team on, the bar is big and plenty of adult beverages to choose from. Please remember this place is new and if it gets busy service might take a little longer than normal. I am just saying...

Came here from the reviews from Yelp and was not disappointed.  Some of the absolute best sushi I've ever had.  Great staff, great sushi, and nice and intimate.  I suggest the yellow submarine roll!!!

This place is a hidden gem! Never thought I'd find good sushi in these parts. The service was outstanding, the servers were super nice and pleasant. For appetizers, we tried the baby King Kong which had the perfect balance of creaminess and crunchiness. My husband ordered the Sake/Salmon Don which was great - it was $17 but it was a big portion, came in a huge dish and was beautifully-plated. I ordered the Double Salmon roll and Alaska roll and both were excellent; the salmon was fresh and buttery! They have their house salad listed on the menu for $4 but I believe the miso soup and salad comes free if you order sushi. I would double check though. Also worth pointing out that the prices are very reasonable! Almost, if not all of the special rolls are $10.50 each and the regular ones are $5 and up. If you're a huge sushi eater like my husband and I, then you know that is way cheaper than you would get at most restaurants. 

The ambiance is nice, pretty quiet. They added some decor and I think they tried to make the place look somewhat fancy but you can tell that the building is quite old. Nonetheless, I think this will be our new go-to sushi spot in the area.

3.5 stars.

An overdue review for one of my oldest bookmarked locales.  I don't mind driving a ways for great sushi, and a plus that Renita M and I could finally catch up a bit. 

Strip mall location. The restaurant is a little cramped and there's nothing special about the décor. In our section of the restaurant (there are two) it was pretty plain.  But clean. 

We ordered edamame to start but was pleasantly surprised that we each got salad and miso soup as well.  Our order was just some nigiri and maki so perhaps everyone gets the extras.  
I loved the ginger dressing--it was light and creamy and a nice change from many sushi houses where their ginger dressings are often over-powering.  The miso soup was pleasant--nothing too special. 

Our sushi choices were fresh and well-made. White Dragon Roll, California Roll and another I can't recall.  SWT, Red Snapper and a couple other nigiri pieces.  Our meal was satisfying and at a reasonable price.  

My son got the shrimp and veggie tempura appetizer for his dinner and he enjoyed it as well. 

Nice spot, friendly service.

Sushi obsession must always be fulfilled and that includes when I'm going into new territories (aka Carol Stream). Kinta had wonderful reviews so we decided to give it a go. It can be found in a strip mall along with a 7-11 and you're met with friendly workers inside.

Their bento boxes are mighty pricey! $17.50 for chicken but it sure comes with a ton of food! It might just be worth the hefty price tag as we pulled out box after box for the bento box portion of our meal. Their teriyaki chicken was decent though nothing I'm over the moon over and just ever so slightly dry.

For my main meal I had a couple of their basic rolls - Spicy Tuna Roll and the Philly Roll. Their spicy tuna is quite spicy and comes with cucumber (not listed) but I liked it. Same goes for the Philly Roll - a solid option and I liked it just fine. Both were sloppily rolled though, not neatly/tightly done so they were falling apart a bit. 

All in all, Kinta Sushi is a viable option when in the area though I wouldn't make it a destination spot. Their sushi chef needs to tigheten up the game a bit, as well!

I'm giving it 5 stars because the food was delicious and authentic. I was happy to see two Japanese sushi chefs at the sushi bar. Sushi was excellent. I will go back again while I am in Carol Stream. I was a little hesitant to walk in because it looked like a dive on the outside and it was next to a 7-11 store. But once in, the food was presented well and came quickly. The waitress was very eager and hovering.

It's been a few years since my first review and I can only stress how awesome this place is. We usually dine in (sometimes do carry out) and have never had a bad experience. The place is always busy but never to the point that there's a wait. The servers and sushi chefs are always smiling and gracious hosts, often bringing miso soup or a house salad with fantastic ginger dressing free of charge. 

I love the wakame salad and sashimi. Several rolls are stand outs: American Dream, Lady Roll, Terminate, and Volcano. Sake don is generous in amount of salmon and rice is usually very good. 

I've never had a glass of sake, beer or wine here but I think it's adorable when you ask for a Coke and they bring out a tall glass of ice and cold can of pop.

I was psyched when I saw a well reviewed sushi shop here in the suburbs of Carol stream. Not only psyched but also shocked. My husband and I, if we could, would live on sushi all day every day 365 days a a year. But unfortunately my name isn't Kim and his name isn't Kanye ( or maybe rather FORTUNATELY) but either way we don't have the funds to eat sushi every day!

So we checked out the yelp reviews and pictures and gave it a shot. We ordered pickup. 

My favorite item was the jalapeño bomb. Those were delicious. I feel like pickup was not the best option for this place because the food was not as good as we had hoped. I think if we had been eating in and consumed the food as it was coming out freshly made then I would have liked it better. 

Some of the rolls were so big I could barely fit them into my mouth in one bite. The items tasted somewhat fresh. Everything was packaged very nicely as well. 

All in all, I would say it was an OK experience. Maybe we will give them one more chance when in town again and we will definitely dine in next time. 

If you take anything away from this review then it's this: If you are coming here for the first time, dine in.

We just moved to the area and I have a love of sushi! The boy, not so much! We compromise and find places that serve other things. We saw the great ratings for Kinta and thought we would try it out! Maybe it could be our new sushi grounds!

I ordered the Kinta Bento Box. You get a little bit of everything! They start you with miso and salad with ginger dressing. There were 2 spots that had steak and chicken with veggies. Then there was a spot with tempura veggies and shrimp. The last spot had 3 pieces of Nigiri and 6 pieces of Maki. It was way more than I could eat! I took the meat and veggies home for lunch the next day! Everything was fantastic though! The cooked items were perfectly done just to the right temp and the sushi was fresh.

The boy ordered the Beef Yaki Udon noodles. He also started with miso and salad with ginger dressing. The noodles were cooked nicely and had a great flavor of the beef! The steak was perfectly cooked too! It was delicious! 

This is a small place, so if customers linger at their tables you'll have to wait. It got really busy for a Friday night! They did quite a bit of take out while we were there! The servers were really sweet! We'll be back for sure! We'll even stop in for take out!

I went to kinta sushi for dinner tonight. I had one of the worst experience. I been going to kinta sushi from last four years. So with new management or new chef they are charging extra money for each substitute (vegetables). I asked substitute veggies for meat.  Vegetables are cheaper than meat. Technically they are not adding extra stuff on my sushi. I am still paying for meat still I am not going to eat that. I feel like they are just charging people extra money!

AMAZING food. Honestly the best sushi in town. Service is good as well. Atmosphere is intimate and relaxing. I personally try to eat lunch there, the prices are unbeatable. Dinner is a bit more expensive but still reasonable. Great restaurant, don't let it's sketchy location (next to 7/11) fool you.
Did take out yesterday and was pretty good. Tried the King Kong roll and seaweed salad, both were really fresh and good.

I've been eating at Kinta sushi for years and it is my all time favorite sushi spot! It is the only great tasting sushi spot that is easy on your wallet. 

My favorite time to grab take out is lunch time (1130-230). The bento boxes are the best lunch deal. I always get the tempura box which comes with California roll, deep fried sushi, deep fried tempura, salad, soup, and rice for only around $10.

I have a lot of dinner favorites as well. Some good appetizers are the M-80 and baby King Kong. If you like heavy sushi, you will love the King Kong (my favorite). I also recommend the terminate roll, spider roll, and deep fried spicy tuna!

Some sushi places  receive their sushi delivery late Monday or Tuesday. This fact is even more clear as some fish-centric restaurants are not open on Monday. After many lunch hour taste tests, credible colleagues have discovered that Kinta's fish is MOST FRESH in preparation for Monday lunch rush. Even more so than on a Thursday or Friday, We recommend visiting early in the week if you are in the neighborhood. Kinta typically does not disappoint.

xSakeCheersx

Love to come to Kinta for sushi.  Always fresh fish,  always great service,  cozy atmosphere.  Miso soup and a salad come with an order of signature roll. Would recommend to every sushi lover. Thank you Kinta!

I have read good reviews and wanted to check out Kinta Sushi for several months. I didn't think twice about calling ahead and at the time, I do not think they had a website up with the hours of operation.  The times that I tried happened to be for lunch on a Saturday and dinner on Sunday. They are not open during these time. So make sure you get their hours of operation ahead of time before you head out there. Finally on a Thursday night, my family got to try out Kinta.  

My husband ordered the King Kong roll and I ordered the Shrimp Crunch Roll and shared. Both were good.  They do not have a very extensive menu like other sushi places, but what they made was good.  The server was really nice and the sushi chef was very welcoming.  The place wasn't very crowded, for it is on the small side, but continued to have a steady stream of customers.  We also had miso soup and salad.  They gave us complimentary soup and rice for our little boys. We enjoyed our rolls and thought about ordering more, however, our nights out with our boys do not last long.
Delishhhhhh quick great for lunch. The Sushi was fresh.

Definitely an A-OK experience.  We arrived about an hour before close on a weeknight, figuring we had plenty of time to eat before causing any problems.  There were a few other couples there, but it was by no means crowded, so we were seated right away.  Our waitress was very sweet, potentially a little too shy.

We split a couple of rolls and a couple bottles of hot sake between us.  As others have mentioned, the rolls are very wide- most slices took two bites for me to be able to handle.  I forget which rolls we ordered, but both were very good and we were pretty well stuffed after splitting the two of them.  The order came with a gratis bowl of miso and salad, which was a nice touch (and something I typically have only seen at the AYCE places, where they would prefer to fill you up sooner than later).

The only major downfall about eating here was that they were obviously ready to close up and head out the moment we got done.  A lady who appeared to be a manager or owner kept walking around to see if we were done and they started breaking down tables, cleaning, and otherwise getting ready to go home shortly after we got our food.  A few of the staff were sitting in the booth by the front door, obviously waiting for the last couple of patrons to finish so they too could get out the door.  It made the entire process of wrapping up a little uncomfortable and felt a little rushed.

We order company lunches from Kinta Sushi from time to time. The food is decent and priced ok. One gripe, does not accept AMEX for payment. The place is kinda small so not great for large groups, but take-out is great.

Saw this on the nearby page on Yelp while I was looking for dinner after getting back from the city.  I like sushi and saw it had nearly perfect reviews, so I was excited to try it. Seeing as it was 9:00 and they closed at 9:30, we were only a mile away so we jumped in the car. I too work in the restaurant industry and its a pain in the ass when customers walk in when it's close to closing time, so I get it, but we do not ever turn anyone away even if they ask to be seated a minute before "closing". It was 9:11 when we walked in the door. We asked to do take out so we wouldn't be in there after the closing time, but they denied us any service still. Disappointing!
Wow best sushi I have had in the area. Better than Abashi and 4 seasons TL's in Bartlett. Reasonable prices, my wife and I will be coming back soon. They definitely know how to make sushi here.

Food is fabulous but the service was awful. This is the first time we have not left any tip on our bill. Had to ask for service after waiting for at least 10 minutes. Asked if I wanted rice, told her yes and she never brought it. Never asked if we wanted more water or if the food was good. Had to ask for check. Never brought it. Had to get up and go to register to pay. Shame because the do is so good.

Kinta is a favorite place of mine to get some good quality sushi, sashimi & rolls.

A lot of the rolls here are different & yummy meaning the fusion of textural components really worked for me. The Yellow submarine, Miami & Godzilla are my favorite rolls here (tried more than half of the rolls on their menu.) 
The highlight for me is the sake (salmon). I tasted no hint of fishiness & nothing but that natural sweet flavor and fresh salmon taste. I always order 10 or more salmon nigiri (fish over rice) every time I come.

I have yet to dine in here, all my orders were carryout but I'd love to make it a date night sometime.

Of all the times I've been there, (over 6) there was only one mishap. I ordered 6 pieces of salmon nigiri and received only 4. I called back and they offered to fix the problem if I drove back.. apparently I already had one too many sake shots and decided not to drive, but nice gesture. ;) No doubt I'll be back for more.
First time trying this place tonight and for a small fast take out/ some what sit in place the rolls are flame.  I will go back

This will definitely take over as my new day-off lunch spot! 

I ordered a bento box off of their lunch specials ($8.95) that included shrimp & vegetable tempura, a house salad, tuna & avocado roll, and grilled calamari.   Their tempura comes with all of my favorites: shrimp, sweet potato, zucchini, & onion! Great crunchy & flavorful batter! The grilled calamari was a little overlooked but the sweet teriyaki sauce and it's grilled flavor were great.
This place is my jam, what's not to love?!

Ok, so this little gem of a sushi shindig is in a crappy, old strip mall on Gary...have lived in the area for years and driven by more than a dozen times without noticing.  Went in for lunch today and was surprised by the huge menu of rolls.  I cannot comment on the sashimi/nigiri as I had a Maki C for lunch which had a Cali roll, tuna roll and spicy salmon roll.  They all tasted fresh.  As always the spicy roll could be more spicy for me.  I like spicy to be spicy.  But it was still delish.  The rolls weren't pristinely shaped to dazzle your eyes off but I am definitely coming back again.

You have to over look the strip mall and pull in, then look past the interior of this place.  It's small, a little dark and not too shiny...but do try the Taco/Tako Yaki....fried octopus dough with shredded tuna skin on top.  Melt in your mouth, donut hole sized bites of fried dough with octopus in it.  These are a little spicy with a brown sauce drizzled on top.  Don't be scared, try them.

True story: before this place, I wouldn't eat sushi. I'm a pretty picky eater over all and the thought of raw fish just did not do it for me. I was craving miso soup, though, and this place was really highly reviewed on Yelp and I figured I could get chicken teriyaki if I wanted a more substantial meal. 

But when we got there, my more adventurous friend convinced me to get one of the dinner specials that came with California rolls and a couple of pieces of nigiri and to just suck it up and try it. Oh boy was that a mistake. Since that day I have been to Kinta almost every week. I'm completely addicted. Every waiter there knows me and a few even know my regular order. (California sunset, California roll, and the vegetable tempura appetizer) But I've seriously gotten almost every roll on offer and all of them are delicious. 

I've tried a few other local places with similar ratings but none of them hold up. Everyone should try this place. Everyone.

Absolutely LOVE this place. Their sushi has to be the best Ive had in the area, and their prices are pretty reasonable.  You walk in and are instantly welcomed. The chefs even bow and thank you! You don't see that everywhere. 
I come here for their delicious bento boxes, Miami rolls, tempura green beans, and their miso soup and house salad! You will definitely want to come back.
Five stars for their delicious food and welcoming staff and chefs.

I went here during lunch and I have to say the inside doesn't match the outside. The inside looks much better. I ordered the Maki C, which included 3 sushi rolls: salmon roll, spicy tuna and California roll. It was quite a long process to get my food and so I was starting to get worried because I was on the clock. The food finally came and I thought it was alright. It was a little dry; I found it hard to swallow and had to keep drinking water. I finished my meal and was waiting to get my check (since I saw other customers paying at the table). No one came so I just walked to the front to pay. I was full but was not too impressed. I also let smelling like fried food, which I did not like very much.
Went a few days ago and had sushi rolls. Great food, very reasonable prices, and outstanding service. Will be coming back soon!
Great sushi, great miso, great everything. Keep in mind that the person who answers the phone is very hard to understand, so either hope for the best or order in person.
Amazing sushi. Great service. Very reasonable prices. Definitely recommend any night!

I have ordered take-out twice and so far, give this place 5 stars just based on the two times I've placed an order. The special maki rolls are delicious. They even have a few Korean items on the menu, which I am particularly partial to because I, myself, am Korean. The staff are very friendly. I picked up my food once during lunch hour and found that the restaurant was very crowded, which says something to me.
Came back here after a while, had a lunch date with my hubby. I just love the service here: the staff are friendly, attentive and polite! Food is great as well! You will leave smiling!

My friend and I have been here a handful of times now and we love it. Always great, friendly service and we haven't been upset with anything we have ordered. The jalepeno poppers (i forget if that's what they're called on the menu) are phenomenal

At the urging of fellow Yelper and real life friend, Kate R., we tried Kinta Sushi last week.  My husband has been on a sushi kick for a bit now and while I am learning to like it...even the raw items...it is more his favorite and not mine quite yet.  You may want to keep that in mind while reading this particular review. 

We drove up and I tried to pre-warn him that this sushi hot spot was located in a non-descript strip mall.  Apparently, he wasn't listening too well as he was not impressed by the outside of the building and the empty parking lot.  With plenty of hesitation we walked inside.  Color me plenty surprised as it's quite nice and cute inside!  They wanted to seat us in the main dining room off to the right hand side, but I wanted to see the chefs in action and requested a table straight back near the sushi table.  They agreed and we were quickly seated.  There were two chefs ready to work, but we took a while to make our decisions.  There was a lot to consider.  I decided to try some beef gyoza while my husband started with some Chef's Choice nigiri.  I loved their gyoza!  It was served piping hot with a nice dipping sauce.  There were five pieces and they were a nice size.  Ultimately, this ended up being the vast majority of my dinner because I filled up so quickly.  The nigiri was a hit, too!  The yellowtail was the fan favorite and the whole dish was a success.

We moved on to ordering some additional dishes.  And because my eyes are truly bigger than my stomach, I ordered a spicy scallop roll (cooked) and a shrimp tempura roll (yes, cooked).  My meal came with a little side salad.  The dressing was creamy and very tasty.  He ordered more nigiri and a roll that was raw and served with salmon on top.  He really enjoyed it, but said the nigiri was so good that he could have just stuck with that all evening.  I ate a bite of each of my rolls and brought them home to my son.  I was just too full from the gyoza.  

The restaurant started to fill up a little while we were there and there were quite a few carryout orders.  I think maybe we were a little early at 6ish.  We had excellent service from both woman who were hustling back and forth.  The dishes were cleared promptly and the glasses were kept full.  

The prices were competitive.  My sushi man confirmed he would absolutely stop by for dinner again and I would concur.  Kinta Sushi has made the go-to list for dinner options.

Went to this place on a recommendation from a friend. Went Saturday night and the place was busy. Had several different types of sushi rolls and wasn't disappointed in any of them. The decor is kinda bad but the food is awesome

Lunch specials here are a steal. You choose a protein and it comes with three sides and miso soup. My favorites are the mackerel (usually they don't have it though) and kinta sushi combo for lunch, so give those a try! The salads are always great and tempura are in generous portion. Also, recommend the taco yaki appetizer, which is small but delicious.

My past experience here has sort have been disappointing because I waited literally more than an hour for my lunch to come out. This was during lunch time where most people have only an hour lunch break between work. I was compensated with ice mochi, but hopefully that this will be my only bad experience here because all the other times had been great, keeping my review at a solid 4.

Since my favorite Japanese/sushi restaurant closed I've been on the search for a new fave, but gosh darnit it's so freaking hard!

I had pretty high hopes for Kinta since it was recommended by a friend, but it fell short of expectations. Upon walking in we awkwardly stood there waiting for someone to greet us and the "host" stand is oddly placed on the other side of their wall divider with employees back to the entrance, very weird.

Our service was good, someone always followed up with us and our food came out fairly quickly.

Shrimp and vegetable tempura app (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kinta-sushi-carol-stream?select=nWQfimLdQgnLsnQKfBWOpw#nWQfimLdQgnLsnQKfBWOpw): how can you go wrong with tempura? Hot, crispy, and I believe they gave us 3 shrimp versus two, +1!

Complimentary house salad (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kinta-sushi-carol-stream?select=nWQfimLdQgnLsnQKfBWOpw#LjmvAuQQcMQ2bd5MVnM-nQ): I love free things and appreciate the complimentary item.

Chicago Crazy (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kinta-sushi-carol-stream?select=nWQfimLdQgnLsnQKfBWOpw#lF5Tsl1K4QAaLdPKO3gwxw): I couldn't believe my eyes when I saw they had this! This is my all time favorite roll and Kinta did it almost right. I didn't find the fish as fresh as it could be.

Rainbow (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kinta-sushi-carol-stream?select=nWQfimLdQgnLsnQKfBWOpw#Or1gkwm52DhcnTuWWxdLhA): it wasn't a melt in your mouth type of feel, not bad though. 

King Kong (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kinta-sushi-carol-stream?select=nWQfimLdQgnLsnQKfBWOpw#V7CLqNHnABasIWXe6NE67A): I can see why it's called the King Kong, this maki is huge! Definitely overpowering, but pretty good.

Godzilla (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kinta-sushi-carol-stream?select=nWQfimLdQgnLsnQKfBWOpw#V7CLqNHnABasIWXe6NE67A): our favorite, can you tell we like tempura?

Overall, Kinta is A-OK in my books. I'll continue my search and once I find my new fave I'm sure the whole world will know.

EXCELLENT 

Service: 5/5 

Environment: 5/5  Clean, neat, organized 

Food: 5/5. 

This was the first time I was able to talk my mom into trying sushi. She was hooked!

I tried the following:

* KING KONG $11- Fried roll with crab meat, spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, avocado, cream cheese then deep fried and served with eel sauce, wasabi sauce & spicy mayo
   -Rating: 5/5 it was sooo good!!!

* SPICY SHRIMP ROLL: 4/5--- $5
* SPICY SALMON ROLL 5/5---- $5

Price: very reasonable

Overall: 5/5 

Love this place. This will be my go to sushi destination in town. Very friendly staff.
First time here didn't know what to expect. Very good and reasonable, friendly staff. If you like spicy the King Kong was good. I will be going back for sure!!

Best sushi in the burbs!! I Have tried multiple  
sushi places and the taste is not there.My go to place.
Best sushi in the burbs!! This has it all...fresh! great service!! Fast!! Consistency!! A ton of food for your money$$ at a very fair price!! love the soup and salad you get with your meal!!

Best Sushi in the northwest burbs. Service is amazing. I rarely go out for sushi, but when I do it's always here, and even when I don't visit for months my server always remembers me and my usual order. Food is just as good as the service. 110%

Hmmmmmmm.  A little disappointed fellow yelpers.  Almost 5 stars. ... Really???  Barely 2.5.    Sushi was adequate at best.   The presentation was very blah. ....   I've had better off a sushi truck, or grocery store sushi. 

The Idaho tasted like corn syrup mixed with maple syrup. ... blech. No Eel in the Eel sauce.    The waitress didn't even know what Ponzu sauce was. 

I'm going to rate this low in hopes it will drop this below 4+starts to hopefully guide others in search of decent sushi elsewhere. 

Seats of an old BBQ restaurant??   Yikes. ...  Not coming back here. 

Honestly 2 starts might be a stretch

I was unsure about this place just bc its just in a little strip mall. But wow am i ever glad I checked it out! Super delicious, really fresh fish and a very attentive staff. My husband and I love it for quick date nights bc its so close to home.

I'm a fan. I love this place. I need to come during their lunch time because they've got amazing lunch specials.

I brought my boyfriend here for his birthday dinner. He enjoyed it very much as well. The service is good. The sushi is great. I don't remember exactly what we had but it was fresh and delicious. This place is small so I would not recommend it for a party or group more than 4.

Take a look at my pictures for proof of eye and mouth watering food.
I go here several times a month and have never been disappointed. Sushi is fresh, servers are extremely friendly.

Kinta Sushi is a suburban gem in a generic looking strip mall right across the street from the Carol Stream police dept.  This restaurant is so nice to have right in my neighborhood. Wonderful sushi and specialty dishes that never disappoint. The Wakame Salad is amazing and SO healthy. My favorite is the King Kong.  Spicy goodness!

So sad that I have to update my review for Kinta! This review is purely on the takeout experience, as the food that I've had (both takeout and dine in) has always been great and flavorful. I refrained from writing about my last experience, thinking it was a one-off, but after last night, I don't think it was.

The last time I got takeout from here, I failed to check all the boxes (or any boxes for that matter!) before I left. We don't live that far from the restaurant, but far enough that it's not just down the street. When we got home, we found that the order that I was give was NOT the order I called in. It was completely different! When I called about it, they were apologetic and offered a credit for our next meal.

This time, I called in another phone order and had them repeat the order to make sure that it was right. They quoted 25-30 minutes for the takeout order. I arrived closer to the 30 minute mark since I also had kiddo with me. Those with toddlers know that a wait at a restaurant can go either really good or really bad. Totally depends on how the wind blows! When I arrived, they asked which was my order, and I had a bad feeling when I saw her face. While I waited, I had no less than three other takeout orders come and go before I finally asked where my order was. Kiddo and I were coming up on waiting for 20 minutes. No one really gave me a straight answer as to where my order was, but there was very hurried and frustrated Japanese being thrown around between the workers. Our order finally came, but with no explanation or apology until I asked for the owner. He also had no explanation, which was disappointing. Once I got all the bags and kid into the car, I came to realize that they probably did not start our order until I walked in, as I had 3 rolls of basic sushi (no bells or whistles) and an order for noodles for the kid. I'll still go to Kinta, but definitely for dine in rather than take out

Yum! Solid sushi for a fair price (many regular maki rolls are $5-$6). It's also nicer than I expected inside, despite being in a strip mall. The service is nice, and quality is also just as good if you order your sushi to go.

I went her because this is my girlfriends favorite place to go in her neighborhood. I will admit I skeptical because of the strip mall appearance, the strip mall looks old and dumpy and it is easy to overlook this place. The inside is cozy, dim lit, with both tables and booths. I like the set up because the seating feels private in most areas. My girlfriend took the liberty to order since she was the expert here. 

We ordered a soft shell crab appetizer, best ss crab I've ever had, crispy and just delicious. She ordered rolls and I'm sorry I don't remember which, but they were all very good and full of different flavors. The wait staff are very pleasant and cheerful, very knowledgable about their menu which is a huge help. I have since been here two more times and have yet to be disappointed with the food or service. I highly recommend this place, it is a diamond in the rough.

Exceptional attention to clients and attention to detail in presentation of dishes! Love their sushi rolls, specifically the Tataki and Miami rolls! Great service and nice atmosphere that you wouldn't expect from the exterior of the restaurant. Come try it!

The rolls (the volcano was magnificent), the Bento boxes with lots of interesting flavors, colors, and textures to try, the mackerel, the vegetable tempura - everything was delicious down to the rice and miso soup, The issue I have with way too many of the staunchly Americanized Japanese sushi places is their heavy hand with the salt, or whatever they term sodium, whether it's MSG or soy sauce or both. At Kinta, I couldn't taste salt at all, yet every dish was flavorful and satisfying! Put them in a more kitschy locale and they'll be overflowing in 5 stars!!

Hands down my favorite sushi spot ever. The only reason why I didn't give it five stars is because they need to expand their space as well as franchise! A bigger menu would be nice. My older sister took me here for the first time back in 2009, and my life has forever changed. If you don't know what to get, I highly suggest the Baby King Kong, the Mountain, M-80, 911, their yaki udon (beef or chicken, both are delish!) and their fried green beans! The Baby King Kong is my favorite though. If you happen to not receive a side of their salad, make sure you do, because their salad dressing is bomb!

Don't be discouraged by the sort of shady shopping center where this is located at.
The place is cozy and the service is great, our server was very attentive and kept checking on us all throughout the night. 
We ordered a few different rolls (BTW: I love the fun names) and my favorites where the Black Jack, Spider Crab Crunch Roll, Terminate and Yellow Submarine, we were also served miso soup and salad before the rolls and everything was absolutely delish!

Lunch special- 5/7/5 pieces

Waitress had cute laugh
Fresh fish and cutely named rolls
hole-in-wall..Content

Oh, Kinta. We go way back. 

I have to credit Kinta for my love of sushi. I had tried it before, and I've had sushi countless other times after Kinta... However, Kinta is the standard I hold other sushi to.

The freshness and quality of Kinta has ALWAYS been it's reason for being the best in the area. It's like a hidden treasure tucked into a small business strip next to the Carol Stream P.D.

Everytime you walk in you are greeted with a hello from behind the counter. there is ample seating now that they expanded into the new area. The service is always quick, and it's a smaller place so if you need something faster just grab any of the servers walking by. The prices are very comparable to other restaurants also.

4 stars for suburban sushi. 3 stars for anywhere near an ocean sushi.

And affordable.

Still a favorite, I will tell ya that when they were expanding we did have a few fail moments but it seems they worked out the kinks and are beck to being great!  we exclusively get takeout.  TIP. If you like wasabi ask for more, they give just a little bit (sucks to ration wasabi when you love the burn!)
I've been here many times for lunch.  They have great lunch specials.  There isn't much seating but I've never had a long wait.  One of my favorite little spots for lunch.
Best around. Had the Gyoza and wanted a second helping. Also tryed the roll with melted mozzarella and it was quite tasty.

I love Kinta. I usually order sushi rolls off their lunch menu, which, gives you 3 rolls for less than ten dollars. The quality and service are great and the prices are fair.I have been to quite a few sushi restaurants but this one stands for serving high quality food for a good price.

I love coming here. The food is great, and I love the mushroom appetizer that they have. Service is fast, and attentive. Lighting is intimate for a date or a meeting with friends. I would always recommend this place to my friends.

I love this place as it has never disappointed me and I mean it when I say never.  Their attention to details and taste are what separate them from the rest despite residing in a small location.  Their lunch specials are ridiculous.  

Service is polite and attentive.  I swear that all of their appetizers are excellent from the baby king kong rolls to the asparagus beef.  The sushi quality/taste is very close if not the same as the "city" quality/standards, but especially consistent.

Also, they haven't let all the positive yelp/reviews get to their head as they still strive to be the best with their prices and offerings.

I used to love ordering from here, even if they were slightly expensive because the food was good. We walked in there yesterday to have a late lunch/ early dinner at about 2:12pm. Not a single person but the employees were in there. We sat down and before the waitress even said hello she told us that we needed to order from the dinner menue because the lunch menu closes at 2:30. We said we would just order everything right away because we knew what we wanted. She took our drink orders and walked away. 5 minutes later, a different lady comes to our table and tells us they are now closed! I'm sorry. You're doing so well for yourself that you didn't care about a check that would have been at least $100?! So rude! Horrible customer service. Who does that?! Not to mention, as we were walking out, they were cooking food. Give your money to another restaurant that deserves it!
Owners are so welcoming, you always get a complimentary miso soup and salad with your meal. Signature rolls are all delicious. And I love the low key atmosphere.

I've always come here since I live right behind it. It's a cute hidden gem you would never have known it is the best sushi in town! However I always ordered take out & it will be enough for a family of 4 people and they have been stingy with the soy sauce, wasabi, & ginger hence why I'm giving it 4 stars. Food is awesome! But giving out 1 package of soy sauce & etc has been getting on my nerves lately, so make sure you ask!

Kinta, what can I say, this establishment is pretty impressive for a sushi joint out in the burbs.  I've been here quite a few times, but haven't had the chance to given a review.  The sushi here is fairly priced and I recommend coming a bit early since the place does get crowded pretty quick in the evening. I have also been here during lunch on a Tuesday and it was packed as well.  

Went out last week with a group and was seated quickly, the restaurant was pretty packed on a Thursday night.  The waitress was kind and seated us quickly. Received the complementary miso soup and salad.  Ordered the Takoyaki, very good and the price is reasonable compared to many other places that I have been too.  For rolls we ordered the Lady Roll, Double Salmon Roll, Chicago Crazy, and the Volcano Roll.

I recommended starting off with the Chicago Crazy roll, some may not be a fan since it has lettuce in it, but its was very refreshing eating this roll then moving on to the heavier rolls.  The cuts of fish were large and fresh.  The salmon and tuna were the melt in your mouth kind! Avocado in the rolls were large and fresh as well.

We also ordered the Bibimbap, which came out in the stone bowl and the rice crisped up nicely.  I would of liked more meat in my bibimbap, but overall it was very good.

Must-trys are: the signature Kinta roll, Baby King Kong appetizer, and the Tatoro Kani roll. I don't know what it is about the Kinta roll, its super simple but so good that I get cravings for it, and its only $5! This place beats sushi restaurants I've been to in Chicago. Fresh fish, unique rolls, and very affordable.
Best sushi I have ever had! It's our favorite place! The service is great and I would recommend this restaurant to everyone who likes sushi!!

Food was good, don't get me wrong, but a coworker and I went for lunch after a conference and the service was nonexistent. I've never been so tempted just to walk out, and they probably wouldn't have noticed anyway because they totally forgot about our table and didn't check in with us for almost an hour (at which point we went up to them and asked for dessert, more water, and the bill). I will never return. I could only imagine how awful the service is during a dinner rush.

We never go here physically to eat... because we have 2 young kids that just destroy the aura and enjoyment of eating food leisurely with 2 sticks.  So this review is primarily on the sushi rolls that we order over the phone and take home to eat once the kids are down for the evening.  

It took a while to find a decent place in the suburbs for sushi and this place hits the spot.  For me this place has good prices and good sushi,  Delicious rolls overall, rice was tender, and the fish was fresh. Creative Maki combinations too to note!

We spent $50 for sushi for 2.  They threw in 2 miso soups complimentary.  (I am always appalled when restaurants charge for miso soup.... it's just broth with tofu for God's sake!)

Anyway... maybe one day we'll actually dine in and enjoy the sushi sans kiddos!

I am in love.
Thank you yelp, I love you for giving me this gift that is Kinta Sushi. This is the best Sushi I have had in the suburbs and maybe at all, I am trying to think....yep maybe at all. I loved every bite and what a great value. I left full of sushi salad and miso. I came starving and left full and boy, it was under $50.00 for three people.
The service is gracious but a little scattered but I don't care, just as long as they keep bringing the fish they can do anything they want.
I could go into specifics about each roll or sashimi but why?
Let this ring true to you: go get in your car and go right now. 
Not too many of you though I still want to be able to get a table.

Their environment is relaxing.
The lunch deals are to die for such as the bulgolgi box. My family love their free salads and miso soup. I think they have a nice way of how the chefs are preparing your order. This place will completely give you a food coma. The first bite of your meal will make you melt.

The sushi is very fresh and has never disappointed me. I do recommend the godzilla roll--my brother always makes us order it every time we come here. They always start you off with a complimentary ginger salad and a miso soup too!

The service is pretty good. The last time I was here, the waitress gave my table a complimentary scoop of red bean ice cream.

The food is excellent here!

I order the same thing every time because it's so good. I usually get a mountain roll, Miami roll, house salad, and miso soup.
Amazing sushi as usual.  Its nice and quiet on a Friday night.  This is the 2nd time I have at here, I mostly get take out. Friendly staff and great food!

Excellent!! Flavor, quality and quantity!! Great value. I travel every other week and sample many sushi restaurants and would rate this at the top of the list. They serve miso soup and salad with dinner in addition to food orders. Highly recommend!!

This sushi restaurant is great! Although it is in a bit of a hole in the wall shopping center, it is a hidden gem. We visit about once per week to get our sushi fix. They give you miso soup and salad before your sushi. Their prices are pretty similar to other local sushi places.q

Nice little place. The outside is a little sketchy but inside it's the cutest. So many awesome sushi items. I'm already planning my next dinner trip. The only suggestion is to bring out as many items at once. We received our hours items well before our sushi.

The first time I went to Kinta I went with a friend on her recommendation and was a little unsure of it given its location but I was not dissappointed once our food came. Actually from the moment I walked in, the place had a welcoming and relaxing ambiance. The fact that the food was great just made it all a package deal! Have tried several rolls and my favorite are the Miami, Deep Fried Spicy Tuna and King Kong. We've ordered some of their dishes as well but really I'll keep going back for the sushi.
Simply the best! Good quality and always fresh. Highly recommend going there for the lunch specials and. also trying the king Kong roll
Favorite Sushi place! Foods always fresh and delicious. I suggest the Miami roll if you like spicy and crunchy! Only negative thing is they are closed 2:30pm-4:30pm.....

I love this  place. Its my favorite  sushi near me. Its a bit  hidden but let me tell you. You will not be disappointed. I will keep going here. Wish they were open Sundays but oh well i guess ill go monday

called for take out and they said they wouldn't take a phone order cause it would take a hour and a half... they said if I came in and placed the order for take out, that would be ok.  

they didn't even ask what my order was... could of just wanted a roll.

so I could only have take out if I came in and ordered it, then waited for a hour and a half...

Another time, I didn't get soy sauce in my order and when I went in to ask for some, the employee said to me, about five times, things like "are you sure"  "they usally do" "what did you order"  "did you check the whole bag"

the lunch specials are a good deal , but if you go at dinner time there's often frustrations

I was really excited to find this little sushi place so close to home. I placed an order for pick up and while I had a bit of a hard time understanding the waitress on the phone, she was super nice in person. I was craving sushi however was also 6 months pregnant at the time so raw fish was a big no no! The waitress  suggested I try a smoked salmon sushi which  turned out to be quite good. My order was ready within 15 mins for pick up. The sushi itself was fresh, and price affordable!  I think I've found my new go to sushi place :)

Everything about this place is good

put down your phone get off yelp, and drive here immediately.

Lunch specials are very reasonably priced.

I don't usually give a place 5 stars, but this place was excellent. It is small, unique, and the sushi is great! Better than great!  Fresh sashimi, the rolls wete unique and flavorful. So different from the usual. This is high end food in a strip mall...but don't be fooled! Can't wait to go back!

This was my first time here.  My coworker and I wanted to try something different for lunch so I ventured out a little further from work to this little gem of a place! The service was very quick but sometimes forgetful but understood since they seemed very busy.  The edamame was steaming and delicious almost more then I could eat..  My sushi, especially the spicy tuna was amazing!! The smoked salmon could use a little something to it but overall my plate was empty. can't wait to go back and try all the different kinds when I have more time to explore the menu!

We have a serious lack of sushi restaurants in this area so when we discovered Kinta, tucked into the little strip mall, we knew we had to try it! We're glad we did. They have a huge menu of appetizers, sushi, and dinners. We pretty much stick with sushi, and have tried many of their rolls. They have a good selection of creative rolls and lots of more mainstream rolls as well. Last time we were there we tried the shrimp and veg combo tempura and it was the best tempura I've ever had--super light and crispy, the way it should be. They also give you miso soup AND salad with your meal. The staff has always been really friendly as well. We've put this on our list of favorites.

I have to agree with the other reviewer about the toilet smelling. I used the bathroom the last time we were there and it smelled really bad on there. That's my only negative though.
This is my favorite place to go for sushi. It's relatively cheap and you they have generous portions. The sushi is always on point.

We had initial reservations about dining at Kinta as it was a sushi restaurant in a strip mall, but after our friends recommended it to us, we decided to check it out. We're so glad we did!

The staff is extremely friendly and attentive. They have never once messed up an order, and the wait between courses is very minimal. The restaurant is not that large, but you don't feel claustrophobic even on its busy days. Kinta recently added an additional wing, undoubtedly to accommodate all the new happy customers! And while some don't like the 90s music they play, it's always one of the many highlights of our visits. 

We always enjoy the house salad and miso soup they bring out at the start of the meal. The salad isn't the run-of-the-mill, iceberg lettuce-laden concoction that passes for house salad at other places, and it comes dressed with a delicious sweet glaze. The miso soup is delicate but still very tasty.  

Our favorite dishes are the jalapeno bombs, the American Dream Roll, and the King Kong Roll. The King Kong has a nice crunch and is topped with that delicious sweet mayo glaze that's also found on the jalapeno bombs. The prices are very reasonable and Kinta doesn't skimp on the portions.  What more could you ask for?

I love this place!  Don't let the location or the decor fool you.  Kinta Sushi is the reason I love sushi so much. The staff is friendly and accommodating.  The food is consistently fresh and the prices can't be beat.

You can't go wrong with the King Kong or Miami rolls but the traditional rolls are just as good.

It was ok, my chicken was cold they served us all separate at the table every five or seven minutes they would serve someone at our table instead of all at once? It was wierd, then out drinks never refilled i was finished with my tea and nothing, the food was ok service strange.
This place is Zabiha Halal, overall this is place is a little dirty, and the service is slow, but the food is good

*Sigh* It appears that my quest for decent fried chicken that I do not have to drive into the city for will continue unabated, as this place was barely passable. Good fried chicken is not quantum physics folks. Let's break it down shall we? And I will add my thoughts on how Brown's Chicken stacks up in turn. 

1) Chicken needs to be decent quality-
Highly doubtful in this instance, or it would of been far more succulent and meaty. 

2) Use of good flour mixed with appropriate seasoning to emphasize taste:
It was good and crunchy, but it was devoid of much flavor. They do have hot sauce available, but if you have to douse your chicken with hot sauce then there is obviously a problem. 

3) Make sure chicken fry oil is changed out regularly so it does not give the chicken that "burnt" taste (ideally pan fried):
No dice from Brown's chicken on this one either. 

4) Chicken is not over-battered:
Nothing sucks more than biting into a piece of chicken that seems huge, but the reality is it just has a layer of crust 2 inches thick. This is one area Brown's did decent on, but one out of 4 is not going to cut it. 

This place is simply not legit by any true chicken lovers standards. The biscuits were not very tasty either. Kind of doughy with a hint of flour. Their fried okra (a personal fav of mine that I was actually excited to see on the menu) was greasy similarly lifeless.  The lone highlight side dish was the mac and cheese, which was really tasty, but this was hardly enough to elevate this place's overall rating. Looks like I am going to have to make a pilgrimage to the ghetto sooner rather than later if there is ever going to be a decent 2 piece and a biscuit in my future.
Disgusting place.  Walked in, crumbs everywhere, old dry chicken under the heat lamp, small kid walking on the counter.  Stay away.  I walked out.

Worst place on earth. Went there and ended up throwing my food on the counter & leaving. Rude lady does not know customer service. Stay away, This place does not deserve to be open. Food was poor & the staff was bad.

There for lunch. Pedestrian fried chicken, nothing interesting. Maybe a good take out option if no other option. Eating there is miserable. Or at least was today. So cold... Thermostat on wall said 53 degrees! Asked for ketchup, tried to take one out of bin,  5 were stuck together by some goo. Gross. Television stuck on The Chew at ridiculous volume... Unbearable. The show and volume. And the booths are small. I'm not that big, felt very cramped. I didn't order soda, but it appears by the sign on the machine refills are $1.00 - ridiculous. Onion rings tasted burned, though weren't, leading me to think they are overdue on changing fryer oil. And flimsy plastic forks, not ideal for trying to eat chicken.  And again, cold. Found myself eating fast just to get to car to warm up. Given the myriad of other choices in the area, doubt I will ever go back.

Brown's Chicken is under new management. It is Zabiha/Halal. Since I was a kid, I've always loved their fried mushrooms but lately it has been greasy and unappetizing. Well, we went this Monday and all I can say is that they're BACK!!! The fried chicken was really good. I anxiously anticipated their fried mushrooms and they were simply delicious. It was like a blast from the past. We also ordered meatball sandwich from the menu. It was really good. The owner is nice and friendly. Only gripe is I wish they were faster but was worth the wait.
old food, bad service

I love me some fried chicken... BUT!! Not from this place! The Indian man behind the counter was not very pleasant and I am guessing he was the owner. If you wanted to change anything in your meal it was a dollar up charge. The chicken was alright, kinda crappy and as for the sides... Very tasteless and gross. The place itself was pretty run down looking. We should have just left the moment we stepped foot in that place but we were hungry and it was already 7:30pm. The Browns in Palatine is a lot more fresher with their food.

The panseratti is a treat from childhood. Any spare tire I have on my waist, i blame it 100% of this beautifully delectable fried pizza. 

I have been moving and this is a place I always miss when I move away. Good staff, always on top of their game. Thank you Rosario's for doing the community a real service.

Rosario's is a terrible business. Probably as bad as they come.

I had ordered from them a couple times previously, and the food was pretty good. They send coupons to us, and I in turn thought to order from them.

Well I just tried ordering from them a few nights or so ago, and everything seemed to be fine until I got a call ten minutes after placing the order that they don't deliver to our location. This makes no sense, because they have delivered to us a couple of times already. I also have seen other people in our apartment complex order from them on occasion. He said that he told somebody here that they don't deliver here anymore as it was too far, but it wasn't me.

I wouldn't have been upset if they had told me upfront when I called to place the order that they no longer deliver to this location, but they actually charged my card first and then called back to tell me this. That is how you know this is a bad business. Rather than just delivering one last time to a place you have been to before you decide to cancel the order after you already accepted payment. Now I have the misfortune of having to check my bank statements to make sure that pending order goes away after the order was cancelled. If not I am going to have to call in and get a refund for the food that was not delivered. Incredibly inconvenient!

I actually just checked their map of the places they deliver to on their website, and it still shows us as being within the area that they deliver to. Maybe they want to update that map? Also, maybe you want to stop sending coupons to a place where you won't deliver to. I just got new coupons for Rosario's in the mail. Why would they still send their promotions here if we aren't able to order from here? The food isn't bad, but the place seems to be poorly organized and cares little for customers. Don't order here if you don't want to waste your time or be in jeopardy of being ripped off.

I got a crazy hankering for some real food after being faithful to the gym during the week, but decided I wanted to stay as healthy, yet tasty, add possible...and that too at a pizza place...here goes nothing. 

I got a menu flyer in the mail, and thought some of the items looked pretty tempting.  Using their online ordering system, I ordered a 1/2 Italian style chicken and a side of meatballs.  The chicken was, to say the least, boring.  Extremely bland, skimpy, and just tasted like it was baked with a coating of oil for crispness.  The meatballs were decent, but the marinara was on point.  Extra star for the free fries (it's the small things, folks) and the soft yet crusty italian bread.  I'd like to try their pizza during one of my next cheat days...
This is the best pizza around.  We order every weekend.  The pizza sauce can't be beat. They cater, too. The customer service is exceptional. They always make me feel like my order is important.

I've had pizza at every Chicago tourist trap, mom and pop place in the near by burbs, and can honestly say Rosario's is my favorite. I've been eating here for 5+ year and never had any bad experiences. So happy to live a minute away!

Meh. I ordered myself a GF pizza with chicken, pineapple, and BBQ sauce. Way too much pineapple, but I could barely find any chicken - a premium topping that costs more! Plus the GF crust was the worst I've ever had. Seriously, I've had several better FROZEN GF pizzas at home in the oven or on the grill. If you're looking for a quality GF crust in the Roselle area, look no further than Frato's at Roselle Rd & Weathersfield Way. Aurelio's in Addison (near Marcus Cinema) also has a good GF pizza. My SO ordered a chicken parmesan, and she was disappointed with how dry it way. The coleslaw is super cheap for a reason. Bland, soggy, colorless. We won't be back.

Don't waste your money. It was good about 4-5 years ago but something happened. Changed their pizza recipe and downhill it went from there. Cheap pizza cheese. Flimsy on toppings. Thankfully some competition moved into the area.

Great food:) I suggest the Chicago style pizza !
Also, they have the best pasta sauce around. The vodka sauce is my favorite. They have a big menu so there's something for everyone. Also there are gluten free options.! I order every week and I've never had a problem with my order. The staff and owner are very nice and easy to talk to if you have questions. This is a great restaurant with great food and I can't wait for when they expand next year!

Been coming for over 15 years for their panzerroti.  A bit disappointed on my recent visit as the panzerroti had very little sauce and only 4 pepperoni slices inside... this is not the rosarios I've been used to. 

Restaurant is clean and staff is awesome as usual came home disappointed... willing to give it one more shot before I compete give up on them. 

They have amazing thin crust pizza that's perfectly crisp, light and flaky.

We love Rosarios! Never, ever had a bad meal here! Just had their stuffed shells. Delicious! Love their pizza and lasagna! My neighbor loves the pepper and egg sandwich. I love the eggplant dinner. Best take out in the Roselle, Illinois area! Beats anything in Schaumburg, Illinois as well! Don't miss this gem in a small strip mall that's largely empty. Give them a try. I guarantee you won't regret it!

I ordered a half pepperoni, half sausage thin crust. The pizza was fine but no part of it was anything special. The sausage was a little bland and the crust a bit too chewy for my taste.  I wouldn't jump to order here again but I wouldn't complain if it were served to me either.
Have gotten their pizza many times. Way too many onions and stale pizza dough EVERY TIME. DAY old crust. Not good at all. Also very expensive.
Best Chicago pizza ever from the crust to the cheese and sauce and toppings it's the best

Very consistent and good food.  I've had the pizza, panzerottis, pasta, and breadsticks and all were top notch.  Good and quick delivery and good customer service.  I would say this is one of the top pizzas in their area.  Definitely recommended!  I prefer their thin crust over the thicker/stuffed varieties.

This is another pizza night gone Bad! We decided to pick up two pizzas the usual order,get home & one of them is the wrong order! Husband calls them and young lady answers he exclaimed that it should be 1/2 green pepper & beef 1/2 pepperoni,not everything all over. Of course all of the drivers she said,were to busy that you will have to come back, our children will not eat peppers. After driving back keep in mind they asked for the OOPS pizza back! With no apology, refund, or discount SHE states mistakes happen! I find that we're good tippers,and here's another one (when you make the mistake Own up to it) they should have DELIVERED another one on the FLY!

Found in the Moneysaver dropped in our mailbox.  Called up & ordered the Panzerotti special (buy 2 get 1).  20 minutes later I am called & asked where our house is.  As I'm explaining, the manger jumps on the phone & asks me the cross streets with plenty of attitude.  Then I'm told they don't deliver to us.  The 20 minute delay to notify me is the issue, not their delivery area.  Also the rudeness of the staff on the phone was unnecessary. 

I would have changed it to carry out but not after how we were treated.  Looked promising too.  Plenty of other choices.  #avoid

Pizza is pretty good from this place. I have to say, thank you for getting rid of the extremely rude guy/owner who used to always answer the phones. He made me not even want to call in because he was that difficult to deal with. He is gone now, or least doesn't answer the phones anymore and the staff who answers is now very friendly.

This was my childhood pizza from 1979-1983. I have had it a few times in later years. It's the best thin crust. I have lived in the Chicago area all my life, and it's the best, with Aurelio's in the south suburbs deserving a nod, I must admit.
Best pizza around!! The sauce is outstanding and the panzerottis are to die for!

What happened to this place, When I was a kid i used to order here all the time with my family and it was the best pizza and calzones  you could get in the area. I feel that since the Father retired and passed it on the food has slowly lost quality and value.
My family used to order from here about 3 times a month from this place and now we have been looking for new places to try cause our go to pizza place just isn't what it used to be 

The pizza which used to be a staple in the house is either over cooked now or just skimpy with the toppings, it shows that no one cares over there and quality isn't a concern anymore.  The sauce is flavorless and cheese leaves a oily and disappointing feeling of satisfaction. 

I dunno what really happened and at this point I don't care anymore, after multiple tries and failures, I have been disappointed that a staple of my childhood has now been reduced to this. There are too many pizza places in Schaumburg to keep trying anymore.

Before, i would have given this place one star based on the rude man who always answered the phone and made it seem like you were a bother and when you said you were paying with a card he would say, number? Just all out rude. I wouldn't even want to call my order in, that is how bad it was with him. But now i believe he is gone, retired, fired or maybe no longer the owner. So much better now. The pizza is usually always good just sometimes a little light on the sauce but toppings are great.
I've been coming here for decades.....decades

We heard Rosario's had good pizza, so we ordered a large stuffed pizza - half sausage, half mushroom.  

We ordered it as "Carry Out".

We picked it up, drove home, and settled in to eat.  Coats & boots off, table set....  ahhh, we couldn't wait to dig in to our pizza.  

Open the box, serve some up.......The pizza was 100% olives.  

No sausage.  No mushrooms.

I called Rosario's and they simply said "oh - guess we made a mistake".    Then - silence.    I said "that's it ?"     and I heard "wellllll........... I'm not sure what we can do about it now".  

No "I'm sorry".  No "Oh, we will make it right -next pizza's on us".  No "oh my gosh, we will make you a new one right away".  

Epic fail.

Rosario's has quality ingredients . You can taste the state of Wisconsin when the gooey cheese does the cha-cha with your taste buds. The ratio of cheese to crust to sauce is nothing short of magnificent. It would seem like it would take generations to perfect this pizza artistry. I'm not surprised that a family member of V And V in Bartlett owns this . Order Rosario's, if your disappointed I would make an appointment with a doctor, because you are not well.

Pizza doesn't get any better than Rosario's.  Chris and family know how to make incredible food with fresh ingredients from scratch.  They load their pies with cheese - I recommend ordering it well done.  

Don't know what else to say other than that you just can't find a better pizza anywhere.  Everything else on the menu is quite good too.  They cater too, and it's always a smash hit.  

Not a dine-in restaurant.
Excellent pizza family owned and operated. It is nice when you call and they remember exactly what you want. They also support local schools and community events.

This is our favorite local pizza place. The pizza is awesome. It's a hearty thin crust that is delicious. We love to order our pizza well done and they cook it perfect for us every time, nice and golden brown. Rosario's also has the best panzerottis! They are huge, basically a whole pizza rolled up, gooey cheese, sauce and sausage inside, absolutely delicious!

Their pizza...it is very sub par, dry, and unflavorful.

Their panzerotti however, is the best in the burbs and don't you forget that.
They have the BEST CHEESE!!!!!!! The best double dough! And because I HAVE to have french fries with my pizza, they DO HAVE THE BEST FRIES! Everyone is great and they remember you :)

I miss Rosarios.   I didn't move a super distance away, but just far enough for it to not be my go to anymore.  I frequented Rosarios for years when I lived a few minutes away.  The pizza is excellent.   The crust is perfect, sausage has the right bend of spinces and the sauce is tasty.   Definitely a keeper in my book.

Not as good as it was years ago.  Crust is either too dry or chewy, sauce is either too sweet or too sour, and when the pizza gets delivered to your house, or in my case, hotel room, the pizza is always less than piping hot.  I'd rather spend my cash somewhere else.

I say adios to Rosarios!!!!
Been going here since 1985.  Great pizza...cheese is natural and tastes great, sauce is seasoned well, and the owner and his family are very nice friendly.

First of all, food was great. But the customer service is so horrible I had to give it one star. They were beyond negligent in delivering my order, they initially delivered my partial order and said they would come back  (5 hours late! My older parents were in their pajamas). They then had the gall to call and ask if we even still wanted it after saying it was on the way three separate times, but delayed because the driver was completing other orders first. (It sounded just as ridiculous to me, too) When I finally spoke with the manager the next day he was so rude to me he went from throwing his delivery driver under the bus saying it was all his incompetence to insulting me for saying I would not come back. We ended civilly enough, but there is no universe where an OWNER should raise his voice at a customer. period.  (and mind you I never raised my voice or even got heated, it is after all JUST pizza).
