This was a month ago and I wasn't going to write a review because I thought he may have been hacing a bad day and he assured us I would get a full refund (despite ordering and eating the pizza). However, I never receive any compensation, aside from a rude phone call asking the last four digits of my card number to perform such a refund. I had a suspicion the owner was full of hot air, but this failure to follow through on a promise just shows it. If you want to support a family owned business, go somewhere else. This rude and unprofessional owner does NOT deserve your time.
They usually get our order right but lately they haven't.  They have forgotten our salad twice and when we ask for extra thin they give us thin and sometimes the cheese is different.

My whole family loves the pizza from this place! We've tried tons of pizza places around here, but nothing comes close to being as good as the pizza from Rosario's! Delivery is always fast and food is always great!

My best friend loves the double dough.  I order their thin "extra thin", but it's still OMG delicious.  A real Italian pizza, makes you feel like a warm fuzzy.  They are somehow related to V&V in Bartlett.  Enjoy!

I come to this Potbelly's whenever I'm in the area.  The service is always top notch here and I've never had a problem.  The place is clean and the food is always prepared well.  One of the things I really enjoy is the live music they have once in a while.  Once, there was a guy playing the guitar and singing some classics.  We sat there even after we were done with our food because it was great entertainment.  

P.S.  Try the brownie cookie if you haven't before!

I love Potbelly so I decided to order catering for a work event. The process was really easy, I worked with Karen and Steve and they were both very pleasant and accommodating. The food was delicious and ready at my pick up time. After the order, I needed to refund something on the bill (my fault- my work is a tax exempt non profit and I forgot to mention that  before ordering) and the process was really positive. They were probably sick of all my emails with questions but they certainly never acted like it. I would completely recommend them for catering as well as popping in for lunch or dinner!

I LOVE Potbelly, and after a 4 year stint in MN, I'm excited to be back in IL closer to Potbelly! 

I love the food, soups, shakes. I often will order a piece of soup bread (a piece of bread with 3 - 4 diagonal cuts to make it easier to rip apart, only $.99!)

There is a great secret menu - the Lucky 7 (a wreck with double meat, using the meat from an Italian) is my favorite. One of my favorite things about Potbelly is that you can customize your sandwich any way you want. Meatballs on your a Wreck (a wrecking ball), they can do it! I also love that their chicken and tuna salads are meat heavy, not tuna heavy. I also like that neither have onions (you can add onions if you want, but it's not in the salad). 

Also, if you have a problem with your Potbelly experience, if you go onto their website and let them know, they'll do something about it (I know for a fact they then go to district and store managers with customer feedback), and they reward you with two free sandwiches for your bad experience. That's a company that cares, and I like it.

What's hilarious is that this potbelly will yell down the line what tour order is but there is no one at the end listening to it. The order ends up getting re-asked at the end of the line. It's a kitschy thing I'm sure they taught potbelly trainees but it is annoying. Food is good though, bread a bit dry but can't go wrong with the Oreo shake.
Best American fast food in the country. There shakes are the best.  Very good for small party's.

Great Gerkin, I'm impressed! I know Potbelly is 'just another fast food chain', but this one's location and staff is pretty exceptional.

First off, $1 giant pickles! If that's not the way to a ladies heart, I dunno what is.

Second, they've got live music most lunches/evenings and the musicians are indie, local, and outstanding - not to mention the show they're putting on is 100% free! 

Third, Ifound my new favorite sandwich at potbelly thanks to my man-friend (meow!) and the super-chill closing shift guy, after they bonded over their distinguished ice cream palates.  

So, which 'wich the new best in show? THE ICE CREAM COOKIE SANDWICH!!!

They take 2 of their full size cookies (as big as a child's head) and smoosh mounds of creamy, delicious vanilla ice cream in between. And you get to pick the cookie kind, usually sugar cookie, oatmeal chocolate chip, and few other usual cookie flavor suspects, but apparently the real ice cream cookie sandwich cookie combo win is the chocolate chip brownie cookie with vanilla ice cream.  

Potbelly, you can put it in my mouth anytime.

This restaurant has such a cool look to it and had live music too today at lunch. They have outdoor seating which is also nice.

They added a turkey BLT toasty sandwich to their menu and I thought it was really tasty. Toasty tasty! ;) 

I like that you can get either bottled drinks or fountain sodas. I tend to go for the fountain sodas for free refills. 

I tried my first chocolate brownie cookie- oh my- how delicious! Everyone at my seminar (I saved it for later) sitting around me seemed very jealous. I wonder if it tasted even better because of that? ;)

The staff were quick and friendly and got us through the line in a pretty decent amount of time. 

Good food and good experience!

Yummy! They make one of the best subs in the world! You will not be disappointed when ordering any sub, but most if all when ordering the wreck!
Basically every sub is toasted, and of course you don't like toasted subs, that won't toast it. They offer around ten to fourteen different toppings, which have always been very fresh. 

They offer soda as well as tons of different juices, teas and bottle water. They also have some kick ass potato salad and macaroni salad. 

I only wish they had a location closer and in Schaumburg!

Good sandwiches here. Since there are so many Potbelly's around, I'd like to give this place a review about the service. The people are ALWAYS friendly here. The thing I love most about this location is that every time I leave, I feel a bit happier just by the way their staff is so loving and welcoming into this establishment.

The food is awesome as usual, just like other Potbelly's sandwiches. I typically get a Roast Beef or Wreck on Regular, both of which are exquisite sandwiches :)

A MAJOR plus they have is they offer BIG sandwiches now and I can actually leave the place feeling full. Give it a shot if you like toasted sandwiches!

We ordered the Wreck and grilled chicken. It said on the menu that the big size is 30% larger than their original size, so we both ordered the big. Ordered the grilled chicken without cheese, but unfortunately, it came with cheese. Tastewise, it was good and I liked the spiciness of the peppers, but my Wreck was leaking oil. Also, I don't know how the big size is 30% bigger than the original size. Maybe 30% more lettuce? Meh, I wouldn't pay $1 extra for 30% more lettuce. Nothing made it stand out for me to distinguish it from other franchise subshops, and I'd rather pay $6 for a different lunch option.

Yep, it's a Potbelly's, but a good one!

My husband LOVES coming here, and I try to avoid Sub/sandwich places because my parents had a love affair with Subway when I was growing up, and I just got really sick of sandwiches.  But in any case, I think this is a good location for this chain.

My husband always orders the same thing--the Pizza Sub w/ no pepperoni on wheat.  I have snuck a couple bites an I like it.  My personal fav is the toasted TKY and the vegetable soup. 

What knocks this down a star is the lack of soup TWICE in two weeks when I went there.  Talk about a bummer!

Oh, and get a pickle!  It's $1, and it's huge :)

I like sandwiches, but I wasn't immediately sold on Potbelly's the first time I tried it.  Good thing I tried it again.  Since my second time trying Potbelly's I have not gone back to the other sandwich places around.

I usually get the roast beef on white, but today I had the Italian sandwich, and I think it is the best Italian sandwich of any of the chain stores that are around (you know who you are!).

If you like pickles, their pickle oil gives the sandwich another layer of flavor due to the vinegary tang.  Exceptional!  Their bread is baked and I firmly believe that bread baked well can make a mediocre sandwich tasty, and crumbly, tasteless bread can make a good sandwich almost unedible.  Props to Potbelly's for their delicious bread.

I'm only giving this 4 stars, because this Potbelly's is located in a outdoor mall full of store blocks and one way streets.  Okay, whatever, it's a hoity-toity area.  So be it.  But it's the closest Potbelly's to work -- and everyone else's work too apparently; and it's busy most of the times I go there.

Still, I expect that I will be going to this Potbelly's at least four times a month or more.

WOW

I cannot say more about this awesome sandwich shop, but WOW! :)  

Overall ALL the Potbelly Sandwich Works restaurants have been awesome and the consistancy is impeccable! So, if you go to one you can expect the same quality sandwich at another.

Of all the sandwich shops chains out there, THIS one is my absolute best! It has toasted sandwiches, it has awesome chili, soup, potato salad, cole slaw, etc.  All taste very fresh and homemade (or pretty darn close if it isn't!)  

I always have either the Italian OR the Wreck.  I also enjoy the PB&J sandiwich(yes, you heard me) which is awesome(but messy) when toasted.  Their sandwiches are simple, but VERY flavorful(especially if you add hot peppers! yum!)

They also serve hand-dipped ice cream and yummilicous malts. They have other little sweets like cookies, ice cream cookie sandwiches as well.  

This particular location is QUITE busy especially during lunchtime, so expect to wait in line for a bit as they get your sandwiches done. As every sandwich is made to your taste, it will take a little bit to get your sandwich ready. But, oh man, is it worth it! 

Crispy, toasted bread(wheat or white), warm meats and cheese. Their homemade hot pepper mix is hot without being overly so. 

The restaurant itself is very clean and the music is upbeat and not overly blaring or distracting either.  Very casual, but not so much to make it look cheap.  The antique shop decor is interesting and adds to the ambiance of the place. 

Definitely want to go here if you love deliciously toasted sub sandwiches. If it were closer, I'd be going everyday. :)
Great service, healthy, clean and fast!!!  Great great !!!!

I love this place. Omg! not a sandwich eater but damn ... I usually get Multi grain thin cut turkey breast  sandwich and it's awesome , I never was into eating sandwiches but they changed my mind... it's toasted and healthy...:-)

Love them!! They have the absolute best shakes in the 'burbs, and their sandwiches are wonderful! I work in the same mall (The Arboretum of South Barrington), so it is very convenient for me. They are always friendly, cheerful, and quick to make sure that their customers are happy. I was walking back to my own store the other day, two chocolate malts in hand, and accidentally dropped one trying to get back inside. I called over to Potbelly's, explained what happened, and was ready to go pay for another one... They told me to come on back, made another one for me, and handed it off for free. They are spectacular, and I would HGHLY recommend them!!!!!
Excellent place, Excellent service, Great food, Great people, Love this place and stop by atleast twice a month. :)

I am so stoked there is a Potbelly's out here in the burbs. They have the best shakes! I used to get them all the time when I was in college in the city. I have to agree with Maria I have never been to a Potbelly's & not have excellent service. Best sandwhiches around & moderatly priced!

I was super excited when this Potbelly's location opened up.  It is hands down my all time favorite sandwich place.   Between the bread and their special sauce, any sub you get is bound to taste awesome.  Even their PB&J sandwich is so good.  And don't even get me started about their cookies and dream bars.  YUM!

I love Potbelly's.  I usually order the Italian or A. Wreck.  Really, really good.  The sandwiches are toasted and have a flavor that's unique and wonderful.  Service is always friendly and sometimes they have live music (a guy sitting on a stool playing acoustic guitar)  Highly recommended.

Located in a small building attached to the Westin Hotel in Itasca, Hirano Sushi has the look and feel of a traditional Japanese restaurant. The location is fairly small with about a dozen or so tables and a sushi bar.

The servers seemed to go out of their way to make sure I was happy. The green tea was really good, and they kept my cup full. I had a lunch special - their American mix which included a bowl of Miso Soup, a tuna roll and a spider roll. Reasonably priced, I walked out full and satisfied.

I was staying at the Westin for business and found this little gem downstairs attached to the hotel. The two women who work here are so friendly and kind! The sushi itself was outstanding....fresh and tasty. The prices are very decent as well! If you're staying at the Westin or ever in the area and looking for your sushi fix this is the place to go!

Surprisingly great! Waitresses are very friendly and very accommodating. I told the waitress I used to live in Japan (I hate when they say everything) so please tell me what is most fresh: suggested salmon and himachi- I ordered both -nigiri and it was very fresh! They also have my fav nigori sake- pink and cloudy :) I will def return when I am here on business it was connected right to the Westin hotel. In the winter this will be saving grace to not have to walk outside.

This is a great little hole in the wall that shares a building with the Westin and a corporate complex next store. I'm a big fan of sushi, have been to Japan several times, and I think this place has great sushi and great prices. The waitresses always take excellent care of me and are very personable. I've found the sushi to be fresh and feel like they always give me a good portion of fish with my order. I always encourage my friends to vote with their feet and thats why I give this place my business every week I'm at the Westin.

I frequent Hirano Sushi because I work about 1/2 a mile from it!  This place is a little hard to find if you aren't sure where to be looking.  It's located within the Westin Chicago Northwest hotel strip.  It does have an outdoor entrance that does not connect to the hotel for the convenience of those just coming for a quick lunch!

The staff is always friendly and seats you right as soon as you walk in the door.  I have never had a bad sushi roll from here!  With your roll you get the miso soup.  I tried the Chicken teriyaki the other day and was not a huge fan.  I will definitely just be sticking to the sushi rolls from now on! 

Great place for anyone wanting sushi during the weekday.  There are a lot of business people there between the hours of 11 - 2 PM.

My traveling companion and I are staying at the Westin next door, and we're looking for gluten-free dinner options last night. We spotted this place across the parking lot and thought we'd give it a shot. 

In my years as a gluten-free foodie, I've found that in eating out, unless a restaurant specifically caters to the GF crowd, your two safest cuisines are generally Mexican and Japanese. In the former, avoid flour tortillas, and the latter, avoid noodles and wheated soy. 

This means MOST sushi is a-ok, aside from eel, inari, or any of the specials with eel sauce. You can bring your own GF soy sauce (tamari) from home, or many restaurants are starting to carry it. 

When we arrived last night, aside from one other duo, the restaurant was empty. There was the sushi chef and two female hostess/waitress types. They were helpful...almost to the point of rushing us. We asked for water to start, and they took away the drink menus before we even had a chance to open them.

I'm not sure if they were bored or what, but two people fussing over my table every two minutes leaves me feeling a bit anxious, even if it's well-intentioned. 

We ordered nigiri and a couple of rolls. They were tasty, but nothing super-special. The fish was fresh, good, and prices were only slightly more than those in our hometown of Madison, WI. 

Overall, it was a solid, tasty meal, and a nice alternative to the prices I'm used to looking at on hotel restaurant or room service menus. I'll likely stop back if I stay at the Westin again, but I wouldn't go out if my way to eat here otherwise.

As far as sushi places go its pretty standard.  The service however was a little disappointing.  It took forever to get my rolls & then she never came back till she gave me the bill. No offer to refill tea or anything like that.  The food its self was fresh. I had them add masago to my rolls which made it better.  If you live in the area & looking for a local fix it will do the trick but i wouldn't drive out of my way for this place. It's hard to find, pricey & service is less then ok.
This place use to be great awhile back when Mr. Hirano and his wife owned it.  Now the quality is not as good.

While attending a seminar at the Westin this week, I decided to try something new. Hirano was my new this week!  Good choice!

Small with some inviting decor, swift waitresses and delicious food will bring me back again soon. It was kinda weird to eat in here alone, so I will either bring a friend or do carryout. It was busy on a Wednesday afternoon. But I still had great service. 

Gyoza. Hopefully I got that right. Better than a potsticker. This was a crispy treat!

I opted for a simple chicken teriyaki lunch special. A beautiful layout of chicken with large, flavorful (and colorful) salad arrived with a side of rice sprinkled with some Japanese seasoning. The rice seasoning was different and unique to me, but it was good. The green tea has caffeine, so I didn't try it. It smelled good though. Served a lovely lunch by some stellar servers...I'll head in again soon!

Sushi was excellent !!
The Kamakazi , and red point sushi was fantastic !!! Service was very good. Extremely friendly. Walking distance from Westin. Great Saki selection . Would absolutely go again !

I work in the building that Hirano is located so it is nice to have an in house Japanese restaurant only an elevator ride away.  

The service here is fantastic and the food follows in suit.  We are always greeted happily and served promptly.  I have gotten a lot of different things on the menu here and I have not been disappointed.  They are accommodating and understanding of your tastes and will remember certain things you do or don't like.  

When I want to stay in and get some good Japanese food I am glad that I have Hirano as an option.
Great sushi! Awesome customer service! The green tea ice cream is freaking incredible! One star off because the service is somewhat slow.

The food is fine and not the reason why I'm giving them a low rating.  I understand that sushi restaurants have a tendency to be slow, but this one is the worst I've seen.  My first experience was eating at the restaurant with another co-worker.  One of us ordered the box lunch and I ordered the sushi lunch special.  After waiting for 45 minutes, we asked where our lunch was and was told it was coming right away.  After another 10 minutes, we asked and were given the same response.  After another 5 minutes, we had to get back to the office and asked for them to put it in to-go boxes since we had to get back to the office.  They treated this as an inconvenience and it took another 10 minutes to get us our food to-go.  They offered no concessions, which I thought was completely inappropriate, considering our box lunch was soggy and cold by the time we got back to the office.  

The second time, I walked in and ordered their lunch special to-go.  I waited for over 1/2 hour and asked when I could expect my order.  I was told another 10 minutes.  After 15 minutes, I asked again and was told that it was coming right away.  I finally left after another 5 minutes.  

I believe part of the issue with this place is that there's a huge communication gap with the hostess.  I can tell she struggles with the language, but I don't think this is an excuse to tell me 'another 10 minutes' every time I ask a question about where my food is.

I worked in foodservice for 10 years so I am probably more patient than most when it comes to service. However, I have no patience for waitstaff who can't make commitments to fix issues when they occur and then make no apologies for that.  I am disappointed that this place has such bad service, since it is so convenient to my work and there's no other sushi place close by.  I'll purchase sushi off of a grocery store shelf before I go here again.

Had a taste for sushi on a Monday and decided to go to Hirano because I was meeting somebody at the Westin.  They say you shouldn't go to a sushi rest. on Monday because the fish is from Saturday (Sunday being the day the fish market is closed) and not fresh.  There are a lot of sushi places closed on Mondays and that's why. Well, the fish was less than outstanding and the rice was a little old tasting and my tuna was stringy. The salmon roe was just okay and not fresh.  

On the plus side, the staff (with the exception of the sushi chef)  was very friendly, there is a sake list and a wine list and I found a combination sushi plate on the menu, which is how I like to order.

I would go back there but not on a Monday.  When we left at about 7:45 the place was still mostly empty.  Their prices are quite reasonable but then I guess you get what you pay for.

The best sushi in the area. I've been looking for a go-to sushi spot for lunch and I think goldilocks finally found her favorite! 

The sushi rolls are fresh and delicious. Despite the prices being a bit higher than I'm used to (I miss myself a nice 3-roll special with salad/soup for $9.99) I will be back. It's adjacent to a hotel so I was expecting the prices to be higher anyway.
Terrible service and I do not recommend. Sushi can be found at many other places, but I decided to give this one a try. Might come back again if forced to.

"Hi, I'd like to make an order for pick-up."

That is how I usually order from here (last night included.)  Typically I'm ordering a 'sushi deluxe' or a steak teriyaki if I eat for dinner, but the lunch boxes are a good option for lunch.  Been going here for 10 years or so, and have never had a bad meal.

After picking up my order, I basically inhale everything.  I was going to take a picture of my order and post it last night, but I couldn't put the chopsticks down!  By the time I was done, I was still thinking about taking a picture of the empty containers, but decided against it...  The little salad that comes with the hot dishes is a nice contrast (has a tart vinaigrette dressing) to the other food ordered...I just wish it came with the sushi dishes also!

I am definitely a fan of this place!

Taking my life in my hands having sushi in the Midwest, but my craving rules tonite!   This restaurant is situated in what appears to be the Westin Hotel parking lot.  I only spotted it out of the corner of my eye, excited to see an alternative to Shula's at the Westin.  A small but inviting place with a wide selection of sake as well as sushi, sashimi, and rolls.  I ordered the Snow roll with King Crab and it was OK.  Very authentic Japanese restaurant I will try again as it promises more than I was able to try this time.

Eat here!  You won't be sorry.  I have never been moved to write a review for a restaurant before.  Yelp has helped me find so many great out of the way places. I feel that I owe the Yelp community a positive review of this great place to eat. 

It is a little out of place tucked in next to the Westin and a little hard to find.  My coworker and I went for dinner while on a business trip.  He was a little concerned as they weren't too busy. I imagine they cater to more of a corporate lunch crowd. Honestly had I not read the reviews I probably would have driven right by and that would have been a mistake. 

The miso was much more flavorful than I am accustomed.   I'm thinking it might not be a more traditional recipe but it is the best I've ever had. The salad was crisp. The sushi was fresh and as good as my favorite local joint.  The "Westin" roll was explosively flavored. My friend had a teriyaki seafood that he said was fantastic. The service was friendly and accommodating and the restaurant was very comfortable. 

If you are tired of eating mediocre chain restaurant food and want something prepared with care and pride, this is the place for you.

I absolutely love Hirano. I work in the same building as them and have been dining here almost weekly for the past five years. Their lunch specials offer a fantastic quality of sushi at a fantastic price. However, the best part of the restaurant is the staff. They always greet me with a smile, ask about my children and even gave me the most beautiful part of chopsticks for Christmas. I can't recommend the service or food high enough. Thank you, Hirano, for years worth of delicious lunches!

You would never know there was a quaint and authentic little sushi restaurant, smack dab in the middle of the Westin Itasca hotel. 

When I'm out working in our Itasca office, Hirano is usually one of my favorite lunch spots. Authentic in their Japanese cuisine, they use fresh and flavorful ingredients. In the 5+ years of eating lunch here, I've yet to be disappointed. 

The restaurant is fairly small and can get busy during the lunch rush. Service is typically very fast, and very friendly. They truly take care of their patrons. Fantastic! 

I usually order mostly vegetarian options, but there's also a couple meaty ones I enjoy. My favorites are:
- Edamame ((duh))
- Gom-ae ((spinach)) salad
- Veggie Crunch roll
- Tamago ((egg omelet)) nigiri
- Asparagus beef roll ((thin sliced beef rolled will asparagus and broiled with teriyaki sauce))
- Chicken teriyaki

I only wish I worked in Itasca more often, as I was a regular back in the day. The food is good, the service is friendly, and my non-fish eating needs are always met. Hirano always leaves me full, happy, and ready to face the afternoon back at work.

Very disappointing...the food, the service, prices, basically everything!  My husband, daughter and I went on a Friday night....we were the only people there which should have been a sign to leave.  We won't be back and I felt compelled to share my dissatisfaction so others won't make the same mistake!!

I decided to try Hirano because it's close to my house.  I placed an order to pickup for a few miso soups and three rolls, on a Sat night around 7:20 pm.  I was told 20-25 minutes.  Got there and had to wait a half hour.  It took 50 minutes total!  I was not happy.  The miso soups were in little containers, hardly half of what you'd get in a bowl, which I thought was skimpy.  The rolls were just OK.  The Dynamite roll was good, but Boston and Spicy Tuna were the just OK rolls.  I had asked for the Dynamite not to be fried and they fried it anyway, which accounted for about 5 of the 50 minutes I waited.  Will probably not go back, given there are many other places that are better.

This place is good and I will go back but I don't think it is Japanese owned anymore.  A lot of the items have a Korean theme which is fine but I know why the Japanese people I work with don't frequent anymore.
Great food and very quick service.
Skip it. Sushi is overpriced for what you get. Was traveling on business and this was convenient, but I will not return.

Wonderful. I live most of the year on the west coast, so im accustomed to very fresh seafood/sushi. Although I visit Chicago often I typically stay astray from their sushi. Iv never been impressed with it, Chicago is a much more buger/deep dish pizza kind of place. I checked into the Westin hotel in itasca and soon noticed the Japanese restaurant attached! (Yes, you dont even have to walk outside). :) . I was skeptical but went ahead and went in anyways. I was impressed. Its a very down to earth looking place but the service is impecable and the food was the same. Fresh, delicious, and brought in a timely manner. My cup was never empty and I left feeling very satisfied.

Well I eat here a lot.  (close to work).  And I have seen it grow over the years.  I only order certain items there but I like the sushi and the fried oyster dish the best.  The staff knows me so they are very friendly and the owner always talks to me.  If you catch it right the salmon is just awesome! I have eaten there over 30 times and I have always enjoyed the meal.  Some of the lunch special are actually a good bargains. Bottom line, they always take care of me and for that I give it 4 Stars!!

Food was delicious and the staff was friendly and attentive.  The sushi portions were about the size I would expect but the prices were definitely higher than what I'm used to in Florida.  Seems about par for the northeast.

Appetizer came out last which was a little strange but it was all so good that I didn't care!
This place is just ok i would say average at best. Since it is located in Itasca you will not have many places to choose from!
Love the chicken teriyaki lunch combo :-)
Fair.....Services is ok and the sushi was somewhat fresh.  The rice was under cooked which surprising but over all it was ok.

Went here for dinner last week and it was good.  The portions are a bit smaller than I would expect.  I ordered the sashimi combo 16 pieces and tempura appetizer.  Seemed like the sashimi was half the size of normal slices.  Usually they're rectangular, but the pieces looked triangular in shape so I'm not sure.  The two ladies were very friendly and nice although they did forget my tempura appetizer order but rushed to get it out once I reminded them.  

The tempura batter was light and the sauce was delicious as well, fish tasted fresh.  Place is not great place to take friends from out of town but reminds me of a local run business with minimal decor.

I went to Hirano because I was in Itasca on business and staying at the Westin. I ordered several pieces of sushi, miso soup and tea. 

It was a Saturday, and the place with the exception of a large party from a meeting at the Westin was empty. 

My green tea was cold, and was not refilled, although I am sure I could have gotten more had I asked. The sushi came and I was surprised that for each order, I only received one piece. The prices were rather high for one piece but I understand frugality. 

I finished my meal, and left paying somewhere in the neighborhood of 35 dollars for 4 pieces of Nigiri and 2 rolls. 

This place is in no way a bargain, and the fish while alright, certainly not poison, costs a premium price.  Although I expected the meal to be high, what this being a hotel restaurant. The check for a snack at Hirano's would have gotten me a steak at Shula's on the same property. 

Unless you really cant stomach the idea of calling out from the hotel, and steak or the room service is not your thing. I would have to say avoid this place, it is nothing to write home about.
Great food, really friendly staff.  No waiting at night since lunch seems to be their busy time.  I've been eating here for over 10 years, is an awesome place to eat.

Went for dinner and was extremely disappointed in the food and service. There was nobody in the place yet the wait staff was inattentive. We ordered a mix of nigiri and sashimi and most of the fish tasted like it was barely unfrozen and possibly old. The Salmon Skin hand roll on the other hand was very tasty.

Service was horrible!   But even more so, the owner/waitress that was providing the service was even worse.  The food came out extremely late and the the owner added an 18% gratuity because we had a party of 6. She new we were displeased with the service and yet she never even apologized.  We also wanted separate checks and she obviously showed us that she was not please.  I didn't like that at all.  She would have more than benefited with a nice tip, return business (as we would have come back), positive word of mouth (which by the way we did not recommend anyone else to come here) and a positive Yelp review for others to see.  Save your money and go some place else where even no service is better than the bad service we received here.

Hirano remodeled last year and was sold to a Korean owner.

I'm not fish monger, but I just can't pay city prices for a Korean dude to cut my fish in the NW burbies. So what you're left here is boring gaijin food cooked with mediocrity. 

they have cool lil gratis fried tempura flakes to go. I never understood the concept but hey! people seem to love it. There is also a full bar since it is officially a "hotel restaurant". the fish shioyaki plates are mostly overly cooked using half decent fish. you'd have to put a gun to my head to make me order teriyaki anything from any Japanese restaurant so no comment on that. As far as pricing goes, let's just say the lunch menu went up quite a lot since the remodeling. 

We come here for lunch for variety in case Tensuke/Mitsuwa gets really boring.

Well beyond expectations!!! Food and service was excellent. I ordered the Chicken Hummus, and my husband ordered a Chicken Schwarma Wrap. 

The atmosphere leaves a bit to be desired, but if were not for that, I'd have given them 5 stars. We ate in the diner and it wa really hot until a storm came through. I suggest take out from here and would order everyday, if I lived nearby. Yummy!

Limited seating, small and tight and not much of an ambiance.
Better to do takeout from here. 
Food comes out quickly and in styrofoam boxes.
Food was decent, good hummus and shawarmas.

Wow... the food at Falafil Hut is delicious. You wouldn't expect it from the small interior, limited menu, and two man operation but this might be the best Middle Eastern food in the area.

Everything is made to order so be prepared to wait. We ordered the chicken tawa rice (spicy), chicken kabobs, and chicken hummus. The wait was worth it because everything was flavorful and cooked well. Surprisingly, even the chicken kabobs were tender and juicy. The meat in each dish was seasoned well and not dry at all. I'll definitely be back to try the beef and lamb.

If you're like me and enjoy ethnic hidden jems, that then you must try Falafil Hut. Be patient when you order and you won't be disappointed.

Horrible customer service. Called to order a falafel plate for pick up. Person who answered the phone was incredibly dismissive and sounded annoyed. Told me it would take 20 minutes. He even hung up the phone without asking if there was anything else or "thank you see you soon". I brushed this off and assumed maybe they were really busy. When I entered the store it was completely empty. As I approached the counter there was a man leaned over it looking at his phone with his butt crack showing. I said "hello". He glanced up and looked BACK AT HIS PHONE. I said "hi I ordered for pick up." He looked up at me obviously annoyed and responded "IT TAKES TIME". I said "okay" and walked out of the store. With a million falafel restaurants in this area I refuse to spend my money at one who doesn't appreciate the fact that I chose them out of all the others. 35 MINUTES LATER he called to let me know my order was done. I explained that due to his lack of hospitality and attitude I would not be returning. He responded "okay" and hung up the phone. No apology, no explanation, no care. These people obviously do not care to make money nor do they care that competitors are popping up left and right. Side note-- in the time it took me to leave this place and him calling me back, I picked up a falafel plate at a nearby restaurant. So not only does the customer service suck they need work on food prep.

I always love it when I discover that places extremely close to my apt. have awesome food. Falafil Hut, tucked into and almost hidden in a strip mall in Hoffman, does not disappoint in the least. I drove by this place daily for a solid couple of months when I moved here without noticing it. It's strange, but so many of the businesses in Hoffman almost appear like they are trying to hide from consumers. This stands in stark contrast to down the street in Schaumburg where where merchants are about as obnoxious with their marketing as a whorehouse in Tijuana. I have payed this joint a visit a good dozen times since first checking it out. Considering how into restaurants that I am, if I have been anywhere more than 5-6 times in such a short time period, I would say it is safe to assume that the food is on point. 

The menu here is simple and short, but all you really need to be mindful of if you have never visited before is the Chicken Shwarma. Order it in wrap or salad form and dig in, as your taste buds are in for a treat. The portion sizes are large here, but I'll bet you polish off the whole thing anyway as it is simply delicious.The meat is super tender and seasoned with what must be crack considering how addictive it is. You should drizzle some of the garlic sauce on it to give it that dynamite flavor contrast. This also cuts out some of the heat if you opt for the "extra spicy" version, which is my personal preference. Is it hot? Absolutely, but it is not melt your face off hot. I would keep a cold beverage nearby, but fans of extremely spicy food will find it to be mere child's play on the Scoville scale. 

I have tried several other items on the menu here (the lamb is a solid choice) but I always manage to gravitate back towards the Chicken. The hummus several of my coworkers are huge fans of, but to me it is just average. Though suffice to say that I am much of a fan of hummus just in general, so take that with a grain of salt. I did post a picture of the menu to check out since there is not one listed online. On most of my visits, both the fluffy pita itself and the vegetables have been extremely fresh on the wraps. Now granted that the chicken is so good that you could dip it in motor oil and I would probably still eat it, but it's nice that all the bases are covered. Pricing is cheap, with the wraps setting you back between 4 and 8 bucks. 

The staff here has always been very personable and helpful on my visits, especially when the owner is in the house. This guy obviously has a passion for the food he serves, which likely explains why it is so well made. Any good independent restauranteur out there is 70% foodie and 30% businessman. The owner loves to chat if it's not busy, and I have heard the tale of how his restaurant came to be on a couple of occasions. The YouTube food show "Sameer's Eats" has done an episode on Falafil Hut, which I am sure you can find with a simple Google search if you are interested. 

If you plan to stop in here on your lunch break, I highly recommend you call in your order in advance. Service can slow down to a snails pace during the weekday lunch rush, so plan accordingly. I would also plan on taking your food to go on since there are few places to actually sit. Since I just live right down the street this is not a huge concern for me, but to others looking to have the food piping hot, take your lunch break early as possible so you can score a table. 

There has been some instances of inconsistency when I have dined here, which prevents this place from 5 star billing in my book. Not surprisingly, these have always directly corresponded to times when the owner is not in the building. 

Overall, this is a great option for casual Middle Eastern grub. The prices are decent, the service is normally on point, and the Chicken Shwarma is to die for. Om nom nom.

This is a small joint that serves great food. The food is not authentic middle eastern but that's part of its charm. The NW suburbs is home to a large indian population and this food is reflective of the same. 

I recommend the Tava Rice with Chicken or Tava Rice with Beef. This is basmati rice with chunks of chicken or beef along with spices pan fried on the girdle (or Tava). This is street food at it's best.

This is a solid 3 because the chicken shawarma wrap really was good (4 stars), but the falafil were horrible.  I've had a lot of falafel in my day, mostly made by middle eastern cooks, and these were so gross I threw them out.  All I tasted were fried balls of fry.  Eww!  I took a bite of my husbands gyro wrap, which wasn't bad, but also wasn't anything too exciting.  I may be back for the shawarma, but we will see.

This is has become a almost weekly stop for us. I usually get a combo or super combo extra spicy and my wife gets the gyro wrap. Everything is always hot and super flavorful.  It's small inside and you have to call ahead but the food is very good.
Tawwa anything, yes please! Super combo so huge we split it and still had leftovers.  Gyros was flavorful and not greasy.  Next time I will call ahead for eat in.  But I'll be back for sure.

Amazing.

We stopped here one afternoon after a day of shopping. We picked up a chicken shawarma wrap to share. Just one. That was our first mistake. I almost didn't share it with the hubby. It was so good. I couldn't stop eating it.

A few weeks later, the hubs asked if I wanted him to pick up a chicken shawarma wrap on his way home from that area (we live about 30 minutes away). I said "yes!!" When he arrived home, it was still warm and it was delicious. A little of the sauce dripped onto my sleeve and I spent the next several hours sniffing my sleeve and dreaming of that wrap. 

He brought another home a couple weeks ago. I wasn't feeling it that night so I stuck it in the fridge. It was just as delicious the next day, reheated. 

The falafils are yummy too!
Been here many time, and this place does not disappoint. Super Combo is the way to go Chicken Shawarma, Gyros, Lamb Shawarma with hummus and rice.

3.5 Stars - I can't figure out if I am a fan or not due to some things being really good and some being meh. I gave them the 4 in the rating because I know how much half a star means to businesses.

This place is pretty small, 2 tables for 3 ppl each and 4 seats or was it 6? at a counter top facing the window.  So if you have a bunch of people, you may want to do take out instead.

Chicken and Gyro combo - The chicken was excellent and the Gyro was pretty good, it's the kinda they take off the spit and grill on the flat top before serving so it's crispier. I prefer it straight off the spit, I probably could have asked for it that way so I won't ding them on that.

Rice - the rice was nicely flavored and fairly fluffy.  

Garlic Mayo  - this was the bomb diggity sauce, I wondered why the guy kinda looked at me weird for a second when I asked for Taziki, I thought it was regular mayo. But he was very nice and gave me what I asked for.  When I tried the Garlic Mayo, dang!

Falafils - I am not a fan of these, they taste like this one packaged diy mix I had at home once, it was pretty dry and not that great. I would take a pass on their name sake sadly.

Lamb - I tried some of my friends lamb, it was pretty good!

FYI, the super combo takes like 25 minutes to make for some reason, so I passed on trying all their food today.

Service - the cashier guy has some issues understanding english but the cook is good and very nice!

One of the joys and fears and joys of moving to the burbs is finding replacements for (or not) to your favorite places in the city. Rejoice, I have found my chicken shawarma go to!

First things first, this is not a place that you dine in. When you walk in through the front door you are greeted to three uninviting 8 foot stacks of to-go containers. There is a counter by the window and some stools but you are better off just picking up and eating in the comforts of your own home.

Secondly, the food was delicious. The chicken shawarma/gyros combo platter wasn't the most generous (more rice please!) but was it tasty. Chicken pieces had a nice crisp without being overly dry.

What stood out, however, were the Tawwa (Tava) platters! Think middle eastern fried rice but tastier. This is where this place makes it name and should keep you coming back for more. Highly recommended!

I don't want to write a bad review but as someone we eats Mediterranean food often this was disappointing....especially the hummus. I eat homemade hummus almost everyday and this tastes nothing like hummus should! :(

To be honest, the quantity of the food was great by the quality of food was not good at all.....I prefer quality over quantity. 

Feels more like Indian food trying to be Mediterranean cuisine...

Came here excited because of the reviews and left disappointed...I will stick to pita pita cafe for now

Good middle eastern food for sure! They are mostly a carry out place though they do have a few chairs facing the window if you wanted to munch there. I had their shwarma wrap and it was delicious, only a little too much tahini sauce in there. I recommend calling ahead of time since they make their food from scratch and they do get busy so you might have to wait anywhere from 30 to an hour for your food.
Loved the chicken shawarma. So flavourful and delicious. The chicken kebabs are made fresh so call 20 minutes ahead and order or wait inside.  Will definitely be a regular patron.

Done takeout here a few times. Restaurant has a good variety of the usual Mediterranean fair -  hummus, shawarma, grape leaves, falafel and kabobs. You can either order a wrap or platter. The platter comes with rice and a side salad with pita. Quantity of food is plentiful. The spicy chicken shawarma and hummus is a favorite. Since everything seems to be made to order, takeout usually is ready in 15 min but on weekends the wait can be around 30 -35 mins. Not much of a ambiance, just a few chairs and a table or 2.  Definitely a must try !!

We went all the way from Chicago like 1 hour drive  had chicken shawarma and rice tawa with chicken and food was nice but we had worst customer service, still I said drove all the way from Chicago to have your delicious food..I am giving 2 stars only for the food was good..

I don't know how this place has 4 stars. I went there for lunch and ordered the gyros wrap, since they said it'd take nearly an hour for the lunch combo. The gyros wrap came with onions, tomatoes and mayonnaise???? It was bad. The price was pretty high too.

I am addicted to chicken shawarma at falafil hut. It comes with rice, hummas, salad, and garlic mayo. I don't know what they put in their food, but it is so good and I cannot stop coming back.  I like their shawarma more than the one from sultan's market. It's a small shack with two tables and a couple of seats at a counter. Most of people order for to go. I love you so much. Please do not change a bit.

I'm usually not so critical if something goes wrong with my order but I couldn't let it go this time as it turned out to be the third consecutive time my order was messed up by the same guy!

I ordered a chicken kabob and shawerma platter but came game to find out there was no 'combination' all of it was just kabob. When I called back to complain telling him it was the third time all he had to say was 'I gave you 8 pieces of kabob instead of shawerma chicken' well in a regular chicken kabab platter there are 8 pieces anyway so there was t any favor that he did. Moreover, when I complained that why do I always end up paying extra for a combination platter when I just get a simple kabab platter, he was bold enough to say there's only a 50c difference which again is not right and there's a $1.50 difference. I don't care about the money but this is not good customer service!

No doubt their food is really good that's why I regularly order from here but ever since their old workers left and they have this new Indian guy, my order is never right! This time I purposely spoke in his language (Hindi) assuming he wouldn't mess up but that wasn't any help either!

It's a small place that has a couple tables, but mostly for take out. I had the falafel wrap here. It takes awhile to make (about 10 minutes), but when I had my first bite I could tell it was fresh and made with love. Next time I would ask for extra garlic sauce though because I can never have enough of that!!!

WOW! Chicken shawarma was the best I've ever had! I asked for it spicy and it didn't disappoint! In fact everything I ate was amazing. I ordered a chicken kabob/chicken shawarma combo plate, falafels, and Small hummus. The hummus was good, just not better than moms... I will be back for sure! Well done Falafel Hut! Well done!

4 star only cuz of the wait time.. Which though is worth it.. I feel this place is understaffed.. Yet Mehdi and Hassan, busy guys usually, take it up equally and try to serve you as quick as possible.. Keep up the good work guys! Great food, great value.

So first off, I am indian and the quest for a mouth watering wrap is far and arduous. 

I would give this place 5 stars if I felt more welcome but its a fast food joint at heart. 

I stopped in yesterday after a while ( I live 30 minutes away else I would be there daily) I had the lamb shwarma and chicken tawa rice. 19 bucks seemed high but ahwell you only live once right 

When I got the food the shwarma weighed about a pound and when I opened it it was all lamb so Its a great deal. The shwarma gave me that juicy mouth watering taste I have been looking for enough spice to make you breath a few times more but the taste oh the taste. 

Next I ordered the chicken tawa ( I told the wife don't send me to restaurants hungry) its like 1.5 lbs a good amount of chicken its not biryani so the chicken is already in pieces ( love that) oh the taste I am writing this as I eat this to prepare to go somewhere else just in case the food isn't what it should be. Its spicy but not like a bunch of chli spicy but like deep spicy with layers. I mean I ordered it yesterday had it tonight and it will be lunch tomorrow not cuase I want variety but for the quanity. 

This place is my new go to for pick up desi spiced food. Oh btw there falafel is Lebanese style in a wrap not a pita but exceptional.

My friends and I ate lunch here one day, and after a very candid conversation the next day, we all experienced the same gastrointestinal problems. The food tasted amazing, but the after effects were not worth the savory menu items.

Skip anything deep fried; stick with the rice.

Pretty heavy price increase for a place you can't really sit down in. Now one of the higher priced Dozen Falafels $7 in the NW burbs, and not exactly the biggest either. 
I like the crust and heat when they are on and open, but am tired of things like the sauce tops not being on properly and spilling everywhere.
Still erratic, very good when they are on, and better when Achmed is there. A-OK

I love a place where when I ask for spicey, they give me spicey. I always always crave their tawa rice-extra spice-with garlic sauce/paste on the side. More of a take out place than a sit down and eat.
Every time I order out, I try to order the baba ganoush which is excellent! It's not always available, so be sure to ask.

I ate chicken shawarma and it wasn't prepared and marinated properly! No pickles in it and the pita bread was not not fresh and was falling apart when I was biting it. 

Accepting criticism is a virtue! If your food need improvement then it need improvement! Don't argue and become defensive. I love and eat Indian food, Mexican food, Italian food, but when I want to eat shaworma or middle eastern food, I should expect middle eastern and should get the taste I used to in my last 30 years of eating it everywhere in this planet. It's not about any race or color or ethnicity. Hope this explain my point!

Great food one of the better restaurants around the Schaumburg area,  service is a little slow at times. Make sure you order ahead of time.  It's not much of a dine in place but when the food is fresh it tastes amazing..
Excellent falafel, medium spice is the perfect amount. Really good for pick-up orders.
Amazing quality !!! Had there chicken shawarma with rice (spicy) that makes it extra good and tried there tawa rice with chicken(spicy)

Food is good, portion sizes are decent, service...JUST HORRIBLE!!! expect a veeeerrry long wait, and then when you return it still isn't ready :/. No excuses, they just don't care.  Just keep in mind the worst service and extremely long wait but food is decent.  For a cheaper better alternative with great cust service and Delish food, skip this and go to pita house on roselle road
Randomly stopped by to give this place a try and was not disappointed! The food was great. It was the perfect mix of flavor and spice.

This place is so good... sooooo good!

The super combo is more than enough for two people to share. It is amazing.
The chicken, lamb, falafil all just the best around. Pita so big I made a hat and walked around the office like Raiden trying to fight people.

Later on the super combo took me on a adventure in the bathroom that I and my coworkers will not soon forget. 

There in stall two, I reenacted the Saturn V Apollo moon launch. I was able to develop enough thrust to make Werner Von Braun smile down from the heavens with two thumbs up. Just when I thought my ride was over. The second stage kicked in with enough force to make me blackout for part of my afternoon thrill ride. 

Thanks Falafil Hut. I cant wait for my next colonic adventure!
The meat with hummus is heavenly and I could eat it everyday. This is the thing to order. The other items on the menu are good but go with my recommendation!

Falafel is not that easy to make right. Sometimes it can be too dry, bland or just simply not good. But falafel hut has got their recipe down! Their falafel is done correctly, crunchy on the outside and moist and blasting with flavor on the inside! The only thing that they could do better is using authentic middle eastern pickles instead of hamburger pickles, but nonetheless it was still tastier than many of the middle eastern restaurants that I have tried in Illinois. I'm from Michigan so I come from home of amazing middle eastern cuisine and so it makes it challenging to actually find a place that comes close, and this place almost does. I was impressed with their hummus as well, it's soo hard to find actually good hummus and not watered down crap they call hummus here! Overall I thought this little place has done their falafel and hummus very well! I would definitely recommend it, prices are a little bit more expensive at $5.50 for a wrap but it's pretty big and  its delicious!

The food was amazing. So flavorful and seriously delicious. It's spicy and tangy but not so much that it burns your mouth. The only reason o give this place a four star is because the wait time for the food to come out is long so I'd suggest calling in advance for your order.
Location: small. Housekeeping and hygiene: not too good. Customer service: poor. Waiting time: 10-15 minutes for two wraps. Food: not worth the visit

The food here is great, especially the platters. However, their customer service is pretty terrible. Phone lines always busy, being forgotten about when put on hold, not taking names for orders then forgetting what you are there to pick up. They need to tighten that up ASAP.

I tried Falafal Hut for lunch for the first time recently and am very satisfied. It's next door to our favorite Thai place so I've always seen it but never walked in. I was excited to see a simple menu and to smell a wonderful aroma of roasted meats and Middle Eastern spices. There's little seating -- 2-3 tables and a few bar stools along the window -- and was enough for me to knock off one star. However the 4 stars are so well deserved. The $7 Chicken Tawwa Rice was enough for me plus my leftover lunch the following day. The small menu allows little room for error. The food is authentic, made quickly and does not disappoint!
Flafil hut is always yummy. I have had the combination platter, chicken shawarma, and their flafel's. All the meats are cooked to perfection. Flafel's are to soggy but rest was perfect.

Best shwarma ever!!! 9$ and u can have it halved so that its enough to feed two .And this is coming from a very picky eater . I love how soft the bread is . And u can have him put hummus in it  yummy!! I love the beef or lamb wrap, chicken is aight but the beef is where its at ahaha i wish they open up another store close to home but its worth the drive , id post a pick but it was the last thing on my mind when i got it ...maybe next time i'll try :)
I literally drive 20 mins everyday to get their Spicy Chicken Shwarma wrap! Would I recommend this place? ABSOLUTELY!
I loved the falafel there but the hummus was a Lil cold but it was tasty I will go back but I'll tell them to please make the hummus last..
This is my go to place! I travel and hour in order to get food from this specific restaurant. Their food is amazing! I have gotten plenty of my friends addicted aswell. Keep up the Great work!
Best realistic arab food is ever encountered since morocco i just will not stop coming to this place the chicken shawarma is definitely worth the money
I have been going here over a year. Love the spicy Chicken Shawarma which is a must have and Chicken Tawwa Rice. Nice service. Good for takeout.
Tried chicken tawa rice here and it was delicious. Wait time is a little longer but it was worth the wait. Mostly a take out place but it is still very clean inside.

Just finished a spicy chicken shawarma, from falafel hut.was excellent. My daughters told me about this place. Everything is made to order . Food is fresh,it's a little place, set in the back of a strip mall. I had enough food for 2 meals. & it's reasonable price wise. The service was friendly as well . 5 stars in my review. Will be back there, the pita bread & homemade hummus was great too

The food here is outstanding I am addicted to it. The chicken shawarma platter is perfection. Comes with basmati rice too and a side of hummus. The shawarma wrap is a little different but just as good my favorite spot to eat when I'm coming back from woodfield mall. You can tell the food is good because there is always a line of people to get it.
Best spicy chicken shawarma I've had so far. Ordered ahead, so he always has it ready to go.
Good food. Clean little restaurant. Fast service and amazing food. Wraps are maybe just a little on the expensive side but overall it's a good place for a bite.

I came here hoping to really love it but it was just okay. I came in at about 6 on a Sunday and the place smelled really weird and was very dirty. The chicken shawarma stand looked really gross because it was all over the place. Regardless I ordered based on the Yelp reviews. I got the chicken tawa rice as it appealed to me the most. It wasn't the worst thing but it was super salty and their was very little chicken ! Overall if you're super hungry and this is the only thing you can eat then go for it ! Otherwise find something else
Its my favorite Mediterranean food joint. Very reasonable too. Only problem its closed on Sundays
Just tried Falafil Hut for the first time.. While it will not win any awards for it's decor, the food was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING !

Food is fair, service slow, the place is a dump so don't plan on bringing a date here and don't plan on going anywhere after without changing your clothes and taking a shower... Seems they save on electric by not turning the hoods on so you leave there smelling like you were working the grille... However the food was decent for what it is.. Advice order ahead of time run in and run out and eat in your car.
Cheap and good. I would highly recommend the lunch special, you're not going to get better food for $5.
Super small inside, no bathroom, but.... best chicken shawarma platter I've had, and same goes for the tasty falafil wrap. They should open a bigger place.

We found this place by accident and it made my day. It's a small place that's really more of a carry out restaurant. The food was soooo good. I highly recommend the spicy chicken schwarma and tawwa rice because it was amazing. The grape leaves and hummus were also good.  The falafils were just okay. If you like this kind of food or not it's a must try.

I really like the extra spicy shawarma that this place makes. I love Mediterranean food and I am a huge fan of shawarmas. The price here is reasonable and the quantity is great. I can eat one shawarma for 2 meals because it very filling to finish in one sitting. The owner here is very very nice and takes excellent care of his customer. He really knows to work the business but when he is not there, one of the other cook can be really nasty with the customers. He has been nice to me just once, out of the many times I have gone and I hope he fixes his attitude before he starts ticking customers off. He messes up orders and is incredibly moody.
If the owner is in the store, your in good hands but if the other guy is cooking, I would check and double, triple check to make sure I got the right order.
Their food is very healthy and not very greasy and falafils are really good too. The quality of the food is excellent. highly recommonded!

I typically come here for lunch when I crave some good spicy food. I come here for the tava rice and the garlic sauce, it's amazing. It's a small little joint but if you're with a small group it shouldn't be bad. The owner is very friendly. Definitely worth it.

The good- The food was delicious.  Had the chicken shawarma/lamb combo.  Very large portions. A lot of rice and huge piece of pita bread.  The bad- Dude taking the orders has a serious attitude problem!  Acted like he would rather be anywhere but there and any questions were an obvious annoyance.  The small seating area was dirty.  Rice and crap all over the tables.  Leaves and dirt on the floor.  Obviously had not had any attention after the lunch crowd. I would definitely go back because the food was very good, but will be prepared for rudeness at the register and less than clean restaurant.
First time here. Friendly staff. Good for a quick in and out. Specialty of the house? Spicy chicken shawarma. I ordered the wrap. Very good. I'll be back.

KNOWN FOR
- Spicy Chicken Shawarma (10/10)

I ALSO TRIED
- Falafils (8/10)

While I can proudly say that I've been eating shawarma long before the 2nd secret ending of The Avengers, I'm still not head over heels about it. That's why it's taken me a while to stop by, because out of all the weird things I get cravings for (554, pho, Pok Pok in Portland) shawarma never really gets called. Luckily enough, I decided to stop today by while taking my little shortcut home. 

Back when this place first opened, I was rushing home from work, and needed some kind of sustenance because I was about to engage in an 8 hour battle with internet dragons. Call me a nerd, whatever. Anyway, I bought a chicken shawarma, because that seemed easy, and I came home, scarfed it down, and threw away 8 hours of my life. I do remember it being very tasty and that I should write a review, so...better late than never, right? I'm pretty sure either the owner or head chef changed, because the food does look different. I'll explain...

SPICY CHICKEN SHAWARMA
When I first came here, there was a menu with 6 items on it, that's it. I also remember I wanted beef shawarma, but they only had chicken. Looking on their menu today, they definitely now have beef, and they definitely have a lot more than 6 items! Moreover, they are now also "The Home Of The Spicy Chicken Shawarma." Well, I'm a sucker for "Famous For" type of things, so I had to get it.

They shave some chicken off of the broiler and then throw it on the grill with some onions. I seem to recall it used to be served in a pita, but now it's served in a pita tortilla kinda thing. They take the tortilla, smear it with hummus, then yogurt sauce, some lettuce, tomato, and onions, then the chicken-onion grill, and then generous amounts of some other sauce, which I assume is the "spicy" part of it. Then they wrap it up. 

The thing is messy. The way they roll it up, it's very non-functional, as it's completely open on both sides. They need to get some practice from Chipotle or even Taco Bell.  But other than the messiness, this thing is awesome! 

All the sauces and the juices from the chicken make everything so tender, and the sauces really get around, because every single bite is just bursting with Mediterranean herby flavor and an absolutely perfect amount of seasoning. I hate raw onions, but the flavors of everything else really trapped the raw onion taste that I hate, and only let the very tail end of that linger as the flavors of the whole bite started to trail off. Even better, the lingering of the raw onion sort of enhanced the flavor, and made it last longer. The chicken was great, it never tasted or felt dry, and even if it was, it was in the company of so much juicy goodness that you wouldn't have known anyway.

This also comes in regular, extra spicy, sweet & spicy, and tandoori. All flavors I will try, now that I know how good this is!

FALAFILS
The place is named for them, and I guess they are pretty good, but 8/10 might be the best I could ever give a filafil. I can't imagine what could happen that could make me like a filafil any more than that. 

They used to serve these in the shape of a White Castle chicken ring, but now they're traditional ping pong ball sized and shaped. They had just taken them out of the deep frier and into the paper bag so the paper bag was practically transparent after I got home. The crunch was definitely there, although I'd probably have to call it a crisp, more than a crunch, because it's a bit lighter. It's about the same as most falafils I've had. 

FALAFILLING!
Messiness aside, that Spicy Chicken Shawarma is hard to beat! I definitely see myself getting the craving for it and, being so close to home, will probably be stopping by all the more!

Even though this small dive had really good chicken shawarma type spicy sandwiches, I'm giving them only 2 stars because their falafel are the worst I've ever had. It's really an Indian restaurant trying hard to be middle eastern. Fix your falafel or change your name, please. And make sure to give the customer his receipt. I can't just trust you didn't charge me $5 extra for bread that didn't come with the falafel.

I just want to say this restaurant is unappealing walking into but has the best chicken shawarma platter that I have ever had. Their dinner portion is enough for two people. 
I live in the suburbs and work downtown and every time I go into the office later, my boss and colleagues ask if I can pick up chicken shawarma on my way. I have yet to find a place in the city that compares.

Overall, excellent food and restaurant.

Food:
DELICIOUS spicy chicken and lamb shwarmas and (scooped-to-order) falafel. Hummus was very good. Rice was just okay. I would definitely order the same thing again (combination platter with lamb instead of beef). Also, the portions were large. 

Service:
EXCELLENT service. Ahmed (the manager) was cooking. He was very nice and talked to us. There were a number of orders being made ahead of ours so it did take a little while. But you can see all the food being prepared so you have a pretty good idea where your order is in the queue. It's worth the wait. 

Summary:
We really enjoyed it and will definitely be going back. Why not five stars? Well, it took longer than we expected and the rice was just okay.

It was decent just wish the spices were more authentic middle eastern. They taste more on the south asian side. The wrap was alot better than the mixed platter so I would recommend that instead. Portions are generous.

I got the chicken tawwa with rice. The chicken was cooked and seasoned perfectly. It juicy, spicy and had an extra kick that I haven't tasted before. They also give you a generous serving accompanied with rice and a small salad. Good for carryout

The food is great the people are great and the service is great. I have become a regular here and what primarily contributes to that is they always make your meal the way want it made even if there are many customers that they need to serve. Love the lamb shawarma here, go try it and I'm sure you won't regret it :)

Excellent food. I had the gyro plate. The food was tasty. I never had a gyro with rice, but the rice was very good. I would definitely recommend this place. The food was excellent and the service was great for carry out. We didn't wait too long.

I tried Falafil Hut today. You can tell that this place is meant to be a carry out restaurant they have limited seating maybe 11 chairs total. My little brother got a chicken wrap and i got a chicken salad. I told the guy at the register ( who didn't look like he was so happy to be there) I wanted medium spicy when i got the food it wasn't what I expected the meat was way to hot even for me ( I'm indian so I can handle my heat) and the salad was just regular lettuce cut up with onions. It wasn't anything special at all. All in all I've been to over 30 different middle eastern restaurants and this place is at the bottom of my list. Ohh and the tahini sauce tastes like it went bad. The place also needs to be cleaned or something to much dirt on the walls and stuff. Im giving it 2 stars because the food wasn't undercooked and It came out within 8 minutes. Ill go back to give it another try and hopefully i won't be disappointed again.
Thumbs up and one more star as promised from my last review. Thanks for improving your serving hygiene.

I go there monthly to get my SPICY chicken shwarma wrap! The food is made fresh immediately after you order it. Takes time...but it is hot and ready to eat! My son hooked me on to this place. He calls ahead and says it's always ready when you get there. I've got time to wait for a good meal! It would take longer if I tried to make it and not nearly as good.

This is pretty much the first review I've written, but this place deserves it. The food is delicious! I've literally made it a routine coming here 2-3 meals a week. Try the chicken shawarma roll, it's excellent!

The food here is excellent, have ordered from here many times and every time the food was delicious! I've had the beef shawarma, lamb shawarma,chicken shawarma, and the lunch special, great service, order ahead of time, the food is tasty, fresh and well worth the money and wait!
I've been there several times by now and the food is always fresh and delicious! Love their non-spicy chicken shawarma plate!
I recommend this place.. Food tastes really good and reasonable.. I enjoy eating chicken shawarma.. Hope u like this place.. If you want to try Mediterranean I suggest you this..

I wouldn't consider myself an expert on Middle Eastern cuisine, so I can't really say if this place is authentic or not.  But what I will say is their falafel wrap is sooooooo tasty!  

I usually get my falafel sandwiches from Pita House on Roselle Rd, but I wanted to try somewhere different and closer to the office.  To clarify, there is no falafel sandwich at Falafil Hut, they only offer wraps.  But it's still wrapped in a pita, it's not a flour tortilla or anything.

This was my first experience there, and I didn't experience the long wait times that other reviewers complained about.  Everything is made-to-order, but I appreciate that and don't mind waiting.  It took about 5 minutes to receive my wrap; not bad at all.

The place is small and kind of a dingy, hole-in-the-wall.  There are only about 4 tables, and a counter by the front window with about 4 stools.  I don't think I would count on being able to dine-in here because if they got very busy there will be nowhere to sit.  

Everything in my wrap was delicious.  The falafel were soooo tasty and all the produce in the wrap (tomatoes, chopped lettuce, and chopped cucumbers) were firm and fresh!  It had just the right amount of tahini so that you could taste it, but it didn't make the pita soggy.  They might have put a thin layer of hummus in too, but I'm not sure.  

I will definately be back the next time I'm craving falafel.  Next time, I'll probably phone-in my order ahead of time so it's ready when I get there.  I heard good things about the Spicy Chicken Shawarma, so I will try that too!

Spicy combination platter is pretty awesome here. Work closer to the place and go hereat least once a week. Most of the time end up getting the lunch special which is smaller quantity of the platter for almost half the price.
Everything in this place is bursting with flavors.  Had the falafil and gyro wraps.   Little dive located in a very diversified plaza in the Hoffman Estates.  Must try if in the area.
Excellent food!  I was looking for a good Chicken Schwarma sandwich and I've found it!  So happy!  This place is a must go to for my family at least twice a month!!!!!
Excellent chicken Sharma and falafel but no takeout menu! Can someone take a picture of the menu board so I'll know what to order next time.

3 words: chicken shawarma salad. Tastes amazing and is on the healthier side since its protein and so many veggies. We always get it to go and eat it for dinner (this place is meant to be more of a "to go" place since there is a small area for seating). SO GOOD!

I absolutely love Middle Eastern food. My girlfriend and I recently moved to Schaumburg and are always looking for delicious eats. We were hesitant about this place but decided to take a chance and let me tell you - IT WAS WORTH IT! Hands down one of the best Chicken Shwarma Sandwiches I have ever had! And the best part - they add jalapeños to it to give it an extra kick! The sandwiches are huge and we were only able to eat half each. Between the two sandwiches and the incredible humus we ordered it came out to be $16 for both, not bad! 

Would definitely recommend this place and will absolutely come here again. The only word of advice - order before hand on the phone, because the food is so fresh it takes about 15 minutes to get it! (That and the fact that its so hot in there is the reason i didn't put 5 stars)
Wow!!! Finally a middle eastern place with some spice and flavor. Great service and exceptional food. Be careful though,if you ask for spicy, that is exactly what you will get!

They are known for their Spicy Chicken shawarma and that's fine by me. 
Delicious!
5 out of 5. 
The sandwich is very satisfying and can feed two people!
I will come back to try their falafil too I heard great things about these chickpea delights.
We stopped by for a quick bite. Not a fancy place but nice people and great food. We had the chicken shawarma. Nice spicy. Really cool place. Will be back for sure.

I got the spicy chicken / beef combo plate. Didn't actually go inside - a friend picked it up for me. But I have to say... I've been to just about every Mediterranean place in Chicago proper, and this stuff blew me away. The depth of flavor is incredible. Hoping to check out the store soon and try more of the menu!

Was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food.  I ordered the spicy chicken shawarma platter (spicy chicken shawarma on a bed of rice, with salad, hummus and pita bread: $8).  The chicken actually had a good kick to it, which I was very happy about and even the rice was tasty and I usually don't like rice.  My only complaint is that I got my food to go and they didn't give very much hummus.  All in all, very good!

The place is not that great but the food is good. The fact that they don't have a restroom or any place to wash hands makes me don't want to go there. They don't give you a napkins, you have to ask for it. One night it was really cold and thier credit card machine didn't work. I didn't have any cash, but the guy insisted I have to pay him despite I go there almost at least 3 times a week. I had to run to the ATM and bring him some cash. That action made me never want to go there again.
Ehhh, The food is sub par. The first time was great, but looks like the quality dropped. I am not wasting my time for food that doesn't taste that great.
Amazing service! Great prices! The best Mediterranean food place in Hoffman Estates.

My Fiancé and I happened to stumble upon this gem of a place while shopping at Randhurst. 

We stopped in not knowing anything about it. Wow! We were in for a truly incredible dining experience! 

To start with, we absolutely loved the relaxed atmosphere. And, once my guy saw the huge tv screen for viewing of the Cubs, he was in heaven. 

Our waiter placed on our table a basket of warm, fresh chips and the most delicious salsa I've ever tasted! We even asked for seconds. He explained to us that they offer authentic Mexican street fare and recommended the tacos. 

I ordered Carne Asada and my Fiancé ordered the shrimp. They were the most yummy tacos we ever tasted! Two were more than enough. They were very filling. 

For under $20 we experienced a truly incredible meal. I'll be back this Friday with my daughter. I can't wait. I'm craving those tacos!

Positive: 
The QUESO FUNDIDO is DELICIOUS
Staff nice, good service
Fajitas were very good

Negative:
All burritos come with French fries(???)
Further, my burrito was presented like a panini

Did I mention how delicious the Queso Fundido is?

Yummy seasonal sangria! It was peach apple the day I went and was delicious. 

The tacos have lots of variety and are decently priced. Many vegetarian & fish options as well. The meat is well cooked!

Guac is of a generous size and can be ordered at various spicy-levels.

Overall an awesome time! And they give every birthday girl/boy a sombrero and complimentary dessert to take home!!

We stopped at Truco for a bite while waiting for a movie. While sat outside to enjoy the weather, the decór inside was pretty cool.

The complimentary chips and salsa were tasty! I have to admit that the brown hue threw me for a loop, but it had a nice smokiness.

I has the steak quesadilla ($10). It was VERY cheesy and the steak was tender. The portion was large, so share or come hungry!

It took a while to get waters, we had to ask for silverware, and service in general was pretty slow.  It might have been due to it being a Friday night (@7:45), but if that's the case, they should staff accordingly.

Each restroom (M, F) is a SINGLE. Plan on waiting.. 

I wasn't amazed, but wouldn't be opposed to a return trip.

My friends always pass by this place when watching at the Amc next door. Went to watch suicide squad but wanted dinner beforehand so picked this place. The servers were nice and friendly. Took my friends and I a while to order but they were patient and came back later with complementary chips and salsa. We had like 2-3 refills because the salsa was good. 

I ordered 2 carne asada tacos and the meat was delicious. Even though I ordered two, it was really filling. The table behind us got it and it was huge and looked good. Will definitely come back to try the taco salad bowl out.

I got a Review of the Day a few months back for my November review of Truco.  I have been back about 5 times since November and each time a great meal and good service.
