My last visit was on my birthday.  They came to table and sang, put a sombrero on me and gave me the cinnamon sugar tortillas with whipped cream and candle, but I digress.  The food is still stellar- I have only ordered the tacos and fajitas and each time wonderful and enough for 2 meals for the $20 price of the fajitas.

Don't pass up the tres leches, served in a mason jar, or the fried Nutella dessert.  You will not regret it!

Food was good. But like it's sister restaurant Mago's it is too fricken loud. Dinner is not fun when you have to shout at the person across the table all night. Bad music is piped in at a volume unnecessary for semi-casual dining. So I will shout this out to the proprietors of Truco: TURN THE VOLUME DOWN!

Finally, a taqueria in the burbs I can endorse, yes! Pretty much anything with a sugar skull on it is going to interest me, and such was the case here. I had been shopping earlier in the year and saw the glowing sugar skull signage beckoning me in, much like the sirens of the sea-- with much better results. ;) So, I popped in to pick up a menu, which seemed full of interesting and varied choices; so I filed it away for future reference, and tonight was the night I dragged my husband in. It's a nice, big space, very open, with a bar and some seating upstairs from what we could tell. I really like the open, airy atmosphere. 

You don't go to a taqueria and not try the tacos, so that's what we ordered, but first we were met with the standard basket filled with not-at-all standard chips & salsa. The chips themselves were thick, crunchy, properly salted and clearly made in house. The brownish & thick salsa (I know, that sounds terrible!) was probably the best salsa I remember having at any restaurant. Our server indicated it is a new salsa for them. I approve whole heartedly! It was flavorful with a tiny bit of heat in the background only, and just the perfect texture, clinging to each chip being dipped. It probably sounds silly, but we both were impressed and if they sold it in bottles, we would've walked out with a couple. This, was a very good start.

We opted for a totally unnecessary appetizer as between the chips and our dinners, it was all too filling. But, my husband ordered the queso fundido app, with added chorizo, served with corn tortillas. I tried one of these and I thought it was very tasty. It's a weird critique considering what we ordered but it was as most queso fundidos tend to be, too heavy, too cheesy and always cools too quickly into one big glob. Nature of the beast. It was yummy but wouldn't order it again (probably anywhere).

Between us, we ordered 5 unique tacos. My husband's consisted of a duck confit, a braised short rib, and a mahi mahi, each perfectly cooked, moist, not a dry or overcooked morsel in the bunch. My two included one smoky and spicy mushroom taco, and one poblano. All were topped with unique accoutrement that really set them apart. Things like huitlacoche (corn smut! It's a corn fungus), crispy potatoes (but these were like those crispy chow mein noodles you get in Chinese restaurants), and delicious salsas, and so on. EACH taco had its own unique flavor profile, not just a different star ingredient, plopped in the same accompanying ingredients, with everything tasting the same. Each was unique. All were delicious. It's also worth noting there are nice choices here for vegetarians, and even a couple if you are vegan. 

One complaint was that they are in the process of changing their menu so even though it says you get a side of rice or beans with your 2 or 3 tacos, now you only get that side if you order 2 of the same exact taco. So, being that this was our first time, we wanted to sample the tacos, and therefore had to pay extra for our sides of wanted. Kind of lame. P.S. The arroz verde was delicious, I'd prefer it without queso personally, and the frijoles charros were not what we expected; it was like a VERY soupy salsa with some pintos in there. What?? So odd.

Our server Gina was oh so patient and friendly, and was never too far away. Prices are way higher than your average taqueria, but this is what I would call an "upscale taqueria", so you are paying for the more inventive menu, and a slick atmosphere, which I'm okay with. Our upgraded appetizer, two non-alcoholic drinks, 5 tacos and 2 sides, plus the complimentary chips and divine salsa totaled about $48!! That's pretty high but I have to say, most everything was so good, I just don't mind. I ate my calories tonight, but I intend to drink some next visit as the margaritas and other cocktails looked pretty good to me. :) So I may have dragged the hubs in, but suffice it to say, we both definitely rolled out of there with very full and happy bellies! ;)
New to the area and was searching for a place to stop and have some lunch. Really glad we stopped here. Great tacos and margaritas. Can't wait to come back!

Was there today during their open house 123 event... they had awesome specials which we couldn't oversee. Got to sample/try pretty much all of the tacos, mole fries, and nachos gringos. 

Let me start off by saying these are not your typical Mexican tacos. Each taco has their own special twist such as nopales on a taco, the pastor taco has pineapple, the asada taco has avocado and cheese. Some of the tacos had some green sauce which was pretty spicy and also the pulpo (octupus) taco had a little bite at the end! You've been warned!!

Drinks are great! Tried the Rita margarita and it was very refreshing but they have a good selection of beers, tequila, and mezcal. 

The restaurant is conveniently located next to the movie theater so I would come back to grab a quick bite before catching a movie or vice versa. Cheers to Chef Juan on yet another great Mexican restaurant!

Went to see a movie and noticed on the way in they had a promo going on 10% off with movie ticket stubs....so of course we decided to check it out. 

Just had a quick bite since we had dinner plans later, but the tacos were awesome. Highly recommend trying the swordfish tacos, we both liked those even more than the steak! 

The space is super cute and the staff was very nice. I had a cocktail with jalapeño and had asked the waitress if it was spicy, she said it's pretty balanced but if I wanted she could put a little less in - very accommodating!

Very mediocre. Slow service and cold food. Was so excited getting the fajitas. That piping hot sizzling cast iron with caramelized veggies is what we were expecting like everywhere else.....ours came out lukewarm at best. 

Burritos are completely soggy. Either you put it on a dish smothered in sauce and mean for it to be eaten with fork/knife. Or if meant to be eaten in hands, don't grill it then. It completely falls apart. 

And the price of the meal ($80 for two people) and decor DOES NOT match the food and service :/ Will never go back again!

I want to really like this place as it is close to our home, the drinks, and atmosphere are really good but the food probably scores a 7/10 for me. Let's break it down quickly - 

Drinks: I had the blood orange mojito and it was really good; reminded me of when we were in Costa Rica. On anther visit, my friend got a traditional margarita and it was probably one of the best margaritas I have ever had. They had a pretty decent selection for beer; although the waitress did forget to remind us that there two sides to the menu (that was clipped to a clipboard and not necessarily easy or intuitive to look on the back) - to be nit-picking.

Atmosphere: It was really nice; very clean, approachable, bright, casual, and colorful. This is definitely a place that I could bring my family [two smaller children] or go on a date with just my husband. Always seems that the place has a good amount of people in it but enough seating to accommodate. 

Food: The 60% of this equation and probably the reason this is a 3/5 star review. The first time, my friend and I got guacamole, and then tacos. The guacamole was fine but what I really liked with the guac was that they served it with fried plantain chips. I had the mahi fish taco; which was also ok but probably lacked a little more flavor. 

The second time I came my husband and I got the shrimp ceviche to start. I thought it was ok; I love the plantain chips that they give with it and the shrimp tasted good but there was a little too much tomato and olive. Next time I would probably try the other type of ceviche. For entrees - my husband got the gringo nachos and I got the costilla tacos. Both had short rib as the main protein and, unfortunately, we both found the short rib to be a little dry and pretty salty. I was pretty excited about the Costilla tacos as I love corn and was excited for the corn esquites. I also thought the tamarind chile guajillo bbq sauce sounded really good but when I got the taco, I found that there was not enough of the sauce. I think if someone orders it, they should ask for a side of that bbq sauce. My husband's nachos were also dry and i would have also suggested extra tamarind bbq sauce. If the meat was not as salty I think we would have really enjoyed dinner but the main flavor was salt.

I will probably try it again as I really do like the atmosphere and drinks; maybe that was a one off time but if you are looking for authentic mexican this would probably not be my first suggestion.
You must try the Oh My Ghotto margarita when you visit. The steak marinade they use for the fajitas is amazing. It is what keeps brining me back.

We passed by this place a few times before but tonight we decided to walk in and give it a try.  
We sat down, ordered our drinks and asked our server, Peter, what was popular.  His answer was the burger.  And I said: What!!! Burger at a taco place?  You must be kidding!!!
So skeptical me was not buying it but I took a look at the burger menu and it caught my eye - The Mar y Tierra:  two patties, jalapeno jack cheese, guacamole, habanero mayo topped with a crispy bacon wrapped shrimp on a brioche bun.  One bite and I must admit, Peter was right when he said that I won't regret ordering it.  It was one of the best and tastiest burgers I've ever had.  
We also tried the camaron taco and carne asada - delicious.  I love the arugula, pumpkin seeds and goat cheese with the camaron.
For postres, we had the fresh hot churros with the chocolate dipping sauce and the nutella stuffed puff pastry.  Both once again were recommended by Peter.  
So hats off to you Peter!!!  You who knows your food well and hats off to the chef.  We will definitely be back!!!

How do I give this place zero stars? The worst Mexican food I have ever had. They advertise Mexican Street Food. I thinK that if they tried to sell this stuff on the street in Mexico, they would be arrested.

The dip for the chips was interesting. The service was OK.

I have to update my review because you can now order tacos individually! I ordered the spicy pork, pastor, and short rib tacos and they were excellent. They do not skimp on the fillings, and I left very full. The mole fries were a great appetizer. Good beer and drink selection and a vibrant ambience. Great changes!!
Margaritas too sweet but DON'T miss taco Tuesday! Also has a great kids menu and very kid friendly.

We stopped here after a friend posted something about the restaurant on Facebook.  I checked out the food pictures and everything looked so delicious, plus it was so close to the theater, that we thought we'd give it a try.  Our server was attentive and bubbly.  The food was different, but equally as good as their other restaurant in the Arlington Heights Metropolis 'Mago Grill & Cantina'.  And in general, it's a nice, open dining area with modern music videos playing on the TV and 'Mexican' dishes that go beyond the norm.

Overall, it was a really good dining experience. 

The interesting tacos are what called out to me while looking over the menu, so the two of us decided to try 4 different kinds. All of the tacos have unique vegetables and sauces, which I found to be delicious! 

Things to note:
No, this is not street food - these are gourmet tacos
Tacos are reasonably priced: 2 for $7 of the same kind or $4 each 
Quality ingredients - no chunks of fat or gristle was in the steak (yay!)
Horchata was sweet and creamy: $3 for about 16 oz glass 

Description of tacos we tried: 
PESCADO - Negra modelo beer-battered Alaskan cod, chipotle cole slaw
COCHINITA PIBIL - Yucatan-style pulled pork, chile habanero, purple onions, cilantro
COSTILLA - Braised short rib, tamarind chile guajillo,bbq, corn esquites, cilantro, serrano peppers
CARNE ASADA - Charbroiled sirloin steak, goat cheese-chile morita, cream sauce, onions, 
avocado, cilantro, farmers cheese

My favorite was the carne asada, because I loved the quality of the steak (note to the Chef: please don't ever change this, and I'll be loyal forever!)
My husband also enjoyed the carne asada, but really liked the pescado (cod) taco with the creamy cole slaw. 

We each tried all 4 (8 total tacos), but definitely couldn't finish them, so we have a whole other meal. I want to come back and try the rest!  Also looking forward to trying a margarita

If you enjoy "tasting" different foods, it's a great idea to come with a few friends and order a variety of the tacos.  

The only minor complaint was that we sat in the half booth, half chair section, and the tables there are so close to one another, that you can't help hearing your neighboring table's conversation. I like more privacy, but unfortunately they don't have any booths. So maybe not the ideal "date night" spot where you can talk dirty to your mate, but perfectly fine for families and friends.

Place is clean nice modern design inside. Open seating with a small bar area. Menu was not bad quit a few items I don't normally see in standard Mexican
 restaurants. Margaritas a totally overpriced for the size. $10 gets you a stem less wine glass serving. The 3 menu items my family members got were very good portions. The fries the serve with them were pretty nasty.  They should change their brand or choose a different type of side item. Overall food quality and quantity was ok. For the price it was not ok. Normally our family of 5 spends 1/2 as much and feel stuffed upon leaving. This meal was $80+
Interesting flavor combinations of menu items, fresh food, clean & good service. Will return.

My wife had some left overs from last night - mind blown!  Best steak tacos I've ever tasted.  I'm pretty picky when it comes to Mexican food.  This place is legit.  And no, I don't have to be Mexican to make this statement - lol!  Close your eyes and let your taste buds speak for themselves.  P.S. the stale tacos were as hard as leather shoes but the steak taco flavor won my taste buds over.

I'm so excited to welcome this place to our area. They are attempting to bring high quality Mexican cuisine to the burbs (think Rick Bayless). And I have appreciated their efforts three times already. The service is cheerful, attentive, and friendly. On one visit, my daughter (a foodie from birth) grilled the server on the English translations of the Mexican ingredients described on the menus. He was knowledgable and thorough in his explanations. Everything I have tried has been spot on. Tacos I have tasted: Camaron, lamb chorizo, braised short rib, pulled pork. My favorites were the shrimp and ribs. They still have you order two of the same but if you bring a friend, it's pretty easy to go tapas on this menu. My daughter tried the pulpo, and it was HOT (the waiter warned her, but she plunged in anyway).  He nicely brought her a cup of sour cream to cool the fire. I have also tried the queso fundido, which comes with half flour and half corn tortillas (it would be possible to get all of one kind if you ask). The sopes were amazing--deep mushroom flavor, delicious corn cakes under the shrooms, nice spicy green sauce underneath. The Plantanos I have had three times. If the plantain is very ripe, this is a sweet dish. If the plantain is less ripe, it will be more starchy. Either way, it's covered with some fresh cheese and sour cream and is really more of a dessert than a side. Eat dessert first. 
     The atmosphere here is like a hipster urban sports bar. They have a wall of TVs that show music videos and sports and news. (Music videos--how 1983!! And therefore super hip!). The walls are white, ceilings and windows high, floor concrete, accent colors a pop of hot tropical vibe. Oh, the the TV wall is surrounded by a shrine of Oscar-statuette-like tequila bottles that are topped by skulls. The bar faces a huge window and only one TV. I did try one cocktail, and it was sooooo tasty I can't remember what it was. Bring me another!  Despite my description, there were families with kids here on each visit and they seemed very comfortable here. 
     The menu is clearly labelled with gluten free and vegetarian items. I'm no vegan, but a quick glance made me think you could get the V items to vegan often by the omission of cheese. 
     Check them out!  A great complement to our local places!
This place was so delicious. There tacos are fresh and staff was friendly. Definitely coming back soon for the shrimp taco.

At Truco Taco for the first time w friends, i usually don't eat mexican food, the chips you get on the table are not good, tho the salsa is. I ordered a burger, its more of a big cooked meatball on a bun. Does not taste grilled. The taste is more like ham then hamburger. I only ate a little, its not the right taste for a burger. The fries all were burnt for everyone, this really is not my type of food.

Don't buy the burgers here, they don't taste like burgers, fries are burnt, chips don't taste good. 

The staff was nice and polite.

I would not eat there again or recommend it.

Truco=trick in Spanish and boy does this place deliver on that. Great location, great decor, great music and drinks. 

But maybe someone read the reviews about all the salt and cut too far back on the seasoning!!! Regardless of what you ordered as far as tacos they all tasted like chewy blandness. 

I'm going to Taco Bell...

Did someone say tacos!? 

This place was the best decision I've made all day! To start, the chips and salsa they welcome you with is delicious. The chips are the best chips I've ever had! We ordered the guacamole, the raspberry sangria, two pork tacos and a delicious burrito and everything was great. The service was top notch and I can't wait to come back for the ten million other things I saw on their menu! Great choice for dinner before a movie at Randhurst (it's right next door!). Cheers!

We came here on a Monday night. The decor is modern and looks really cool. The restaurant atmosphere had a really nice vibe to it. There is a huge TV screen somehow divided into different sized screens with different shows being televised. Our server was friendly and attentive. The tacos were good, but I expected better given the price point. We ordered the Gringo Nachos, Tacos de Pulpo, Tacos de Calamares, Tacos de Pato, and Tacos de Chorizo. My favorites were the Tacos de Calamares and the Tacos de Chorizo. Since the restaurant is fairly new, we will eventually give it another chance. But for now, we will stick with Big Star and Antique Taco!

Good food, not your standard Mexican fare. I ordered a trio of three different tacos - short rib, pulled pork and carne asada. Carne asada was my favorite by far, though they all were good. Husband had the chicken enchilada, which seemed more like a chimichanga and came with fries, which I thought was weird for a Mexican place. Mojito was good and they had a decent cocktail and beer selection. 

The place was busy for a Friday night, but the wait wasn't terribly long. Nice ambiance. 

The only negative about our visit was the service. While our server was nice enough, he would completely disappear at times. This meant we had to wait long after we were ready to order drinks and food. We didn't bother getting second drinks because by the time we were checked on again, we were ready to go.

Convenient location, next to AMC Randhurst. (Restaurant offers 10% off with ticket stub.)

Our new favorite place. Not your typical Mexican restaurant where you get a gigantic plate of food covered in cheese. This is closer to authentic street food. Don't mess with the torts or burritos though - go for the tacos! That's their specialty! Margaritas are tasty too and not blended - yay!  There was a mariachi band there one night when we were there. Normally, I'm not a fan, but these guys were really good so I didn't mind.

Went there once, it was just ok.   The place is laid out strange, and the lit up signs in the place are odd at best.They have a taco deal. You get 3 tacos, but you can't have 3 different types of meat or fish.
 All have to be the same. Not sure why, even though they are all the same price. It is like fast food, with a twist. Drinks are ok. Beer is over priced. Servers are young and clueless.

We like the ambiance but the food was just OK.  I had two tacos & They were kind of plain in flavor.  My partner got a burrito it was just OK -a little less flavorful than Chipotle.  At least they give you chips and salsa when you walk in. That was very good.  The customer service was good 4/5. We were very surprised they couldn't do a simple substitution for us.  I would say its not worth the $$.  Its missing flavor, wasn't anything spectacular. A bit disappointing.

Chips and salsa are great, and the place is really nice inside. But the food... OMG   5/10 if that. Guy is trying way too hard to reach outside the box. If its not weird tasting then its bland and mush.  :(.   Last time here

Scene: Went here after a movie (4:00ish). There was not a rush of people walking in here, and the restaurant was not crowded.

-1: They did not have anyone greeting us at the door, so we awkwardly stood there for 2 minutes until a waitress asked us if we needed a table. We actually decided to just sit at the bar since there was only one other couple there, and she said you could order food from the bartender.

-2: The bartender was behind the bar, but took 10 minutes to take our drink order. At this time we decided we should order our food as well.

+1: ordered a drink called Jamica, it was really tasty.

-3: our food, we both ordered tacos (shrimp tacos and Carne asada) took 40 minutes to make. They were bland and unexciting. Not worth the wait.

-4: during this 40 minute wait our drinks were drunk (imagine that) but the bartender was barely there for us to ask for another, and he never offered us another. When we got our food we had to eat it while sucking the ice out of our cups. Not one staff member noticed this, or would make eye contact with us to ask for a water or another drink. The couple next to us also sipping on ice. 

Don't let the fun decor fool you. It's not good food, and the staff is very untrained.

I'll have to write another review when I come back to try out the food, because this is solely on margaritas and chips. I'm very impressed with the environment! They give a casual but fancy feel that can welcome anyone. The bar is comfortable and the bartender was very friendly! He was telling my fiance and myself stories about tequila and himself after he made us two of the most delicious drinks! Not only are their margaritas refreshing, they look beautiful too! Also, the sauces that come with the chips the give are so smooth and delightful! I can't wait to come back for lunch or dinner! Great spot to stop in, especially before or after a movie (the theater is right next door!).

this place is pretty cool, our waiter was helpful and attentive. 
I got a steak torta and it was really good, not your typical torta but had some flair to it. 
My boyfriend got their steak tlayuda which kinda looked like a pizza! it was crispy and cheesy and yummy. 
My boyfriend got their house margarita and he said it was good, very lime-y.
I tried their horchata and it was okay, it was a bit too sweet for me

I can't wait to come back and try some different things here, the atmosphere was great and i'm glad that this place is at randhurst i hope they are here to stay!

Overall, disappointing. We consider ourselves foodies and like to experience new things in and out of our area.  Came in during the week for lunch and immediately were in awe of what a cool space this place has.  Beautiful and interesting art decorates the walls with a modern feel.  

Service was overall the most disappointing factor of our visit to Truco.  We are pretty laid back, but the younger server that was working was incredibly inattentive and we waited about 15 minutes for our drink order.  Sadly, there were only two other tables of guests in the restaurant, so this was slightly annoying. We also never received water or were given the option.  An order of guacamole was placed as an app, and that came out moderately quickly and was delicious.  

About 5 minutes after our app came out, a man (whom may have been the owner/manager) came out with our entrees.  The table was pretty small, and the guacamole and our app plates took up most of the table space.  He stood next to our table, slightly annoyed, holding our tacos.  We joked that we were out of room and received no response.  So, we (ourselves) moved our app plates to the empty table next to us so he could set our entrees down.  Get a clue, man!  Hilariously, our dirty plates stayed on the empty table next to us throughout the rest of our meal and were never removed. 

Overall, the food lacked seasoning, which is funny after reading a multitude of reviews stating their food was too salty.  The guacamole was the best thing we ordered.  My wife had an order of shrimp tacos with rice, and I had both a mahi and pastor taco with beans.  She had wanted to order two different tacos, but "wasn't allowed" because the side of rice or beans would be an extra charge if the two tacos weren't the same. *Confused*. I paid the extra $4 for my beans to sample two different tacos. They were "meh" and under-seasoned.  

This place could be great. They have a wonderful location, interesting menu, and (from what I hear) a very experienced and inventive chef.  However, the odd and poorly executed service overshadowed our experience and I don't think we will be returning.

Their food is relatively inexpensive, would be good if it came with to corn or flower tacos instead of one since depending on you're orders, the food breaks threw one soft corn taco. Otherwise they have okay quality meat and good start of dish of fresh salsa with chips.

Great location, service, and food. They provide decent chips and salsa to start you off and have a variety of dishes to choose from. I have been there a few times and have enjoyed the experience every time.

This place is phenomenal! Chips and salsa are so amazing! Salsa is like nothing I've ever had--complex, mild, with a smoky roasted flavor. 

We ordered a mojito as well as a margarita . Both great. 

Tacos for us--carne asada was awesome. The sauce is what made it perfect.  Did not care for the Barbacoa taco but the carve asada was excellent! Can't wait to come back

Wow very impressed with the food and service.  Ordered the Cochinita Pibil Taco with the arrozo verda. Topped it off with the Key Lime Tres Leches and the El Day-Efay Coctele. Great waiter (Alfonso ). Will come back again. You will not be disappointed.
Love this place - affordable good authentic (says the guy with a French last name) food! Service is exceptional! I make this place a treat to myself for lunch!!
Stopped in for the first time. Sat at the bar  and watched Basketball....Cargado Guacomole was awesome as was the Two Brothers Ale.

Salty. When the there is a pattern of reviews that say the food is salty, you need to cut back on the salt. Guacamole: salty. Rice: salty.  Beans: salty. Tacos: salty.
What drew us in?  After eating across the street a couple of weeks ago, saw big letters on the sign in the back of the restaurant: cochinita pibil, mole poblano, tortas. Mmm.  Not your typical 'Mexican' taco, enchilada grub. Menu continued to intrigue - more than a dozen different types of tacos with a variety of inspired combinations.
Tried to order 2 different tacos in my order, but that wasn't allowed. Really??  They need to be more flexible. It's not like cochinita pibil, barbacoa and braised short ribs are made to order.  Sadly you are left without an option to sample more than 1 of the appealing choices. Also, it would be nice to have the option of adding a 3rd taco onto the order. See where I'm going?  Sample 3...  By the way, I did order the cochinita pibil and asked if I would have to shoot the cook after I ate it (ala Once Upon a Time in Mexico; if it was too good; to restore the balance...).  I don't think anyone there has seen the movie which, along with being a great movie, came with director Robert Rodriguez' recipe for puerco pibil.
Other comments - great chips and salsa (always a good indicator in a Mexican restaurant); tiny margaritas, good mojitos; a little pricey. 
Will I come back?  Definitely. There are still a number of things I'm looking forward to try. Hopefully with less salt next time.

Okay food, bad service! Will not come back.

Ordered carne asada torta, menu didn't mention that steak will be deep fried, it arrived panini pressed burnt, deep fried steak with no sauce. Food didn't taste mexican at all. Pretty disappointed!

Not so good taco or margarita. I was wondering why it was kinda empty there on Mother's Day. The tortilla was fell apart and it wasn't hot. The taco was not that flavorful. I think the taco needed double tortillas. The margarita was too sweet. And it was like a purée of sweet fruit not frozen ice.

Oh Margarita, how I love thee.  We have visited twice!  The first time we ate at the bar and tried the different beers.  Then I had a margarita, just perfectly made.  The tacos are small, but very good.  Not enough for a meal.  Cheese dip and handmade chips were salty and yummy.  The second trip we shared a flatbread with goat cheese, shrimp, tomatoes, and it was so melt in your mouth delicious.  And more margaritas!  The decor is shiny, trendy, and it is fun to watch passersby through the windows.  Cannot wait to return!

Excellent food, the drinks were great too. I ordered the shrimp tacos and they were very different than what I expected but exceeded my expectations with a delicious sauce and goat cheese, I also ordered the michelada and I can't wait to go again and enjoy another one!

OMG, Truco Taqueria is fabulous!  You want a great meal with FRESH ingredients and quality meat?  You need to go to Truco.  My husband and I were going to a movie yesterday and decided to go in for a quick bite.  The atmosphere is upbeat, the service is incredible, and the food, delicious.  Marco was our server and he was personable and made us feel at home!  The rest of the wait staff was warm, friendly and brought us our food in record time!  This restaurant is owned by the owners of Mago in Arlington Heights.  Would highly recommend!  Way to go, Marco!!!!  Thank you for a wonderful afternoon!

Love the steak tacos! Great quality meat and its always hot ready to eat. Love the salas and chips it's delicious and crispy! You get what you pay for and its quality food not a hole in the wall place although I love those places for something super fast, tasty, and greasy but trucio is more of a sit down kind of restaurant. I also like the drinks!

Went to this place with high expectations, but left feeling like 'eh'. Nothing really special. The chips and salsa are actually pretty good, and create a good expectation for your upcoming meal. The beer selection is solid, however the service is S-L-O-W.. Took about 15 mins to get the drinks, then another 10 mins to come back and take the order. I got mixed fajitas with shrimp and steak and my wife got the chicken ones.  Mine came out about 30 mins later with 3 large shrimp and about 6 strips of burned steak with about 3 pounds of veggies. The shrimp was ok, although overcooked a little, but the steak was just terrible. That shit was cooked this afternoon, and then reheated in a pan. Dry, burned, and bland. Just terrible. Order more drinks while eating.. Took another 10 plus mins to get, so was already done with my food and for a fresh beer.. Oh well. I would give this place one star, but the waitress Sarah B was super nice and bought a round for us because of the slowness of everything. She was a sweetheart, but the food was just terrible. Wouldn't bother going back again. Oh and the chicken was dry , reheated and bland. What a disappointment.

Stopped in here for dinner while staying in the local area. For starters, they give you 3 fried corn tortillas and a couple of dipping sauces. I guess this is their version of chips and salsa. The one sauce tasted like liquefied refried beans. For my entrée, I went with the Barbacoa tacos, which is basically the shredded chicken tacos on a corn tortilla (flour available upon request). They had a list of tacos to pick from (all $7) and you get two tacos, but you are not allowed to mix and match your two tacos. I don't see why this rule is in place given that they are all the same price anyway. My taco lacked flavor and the chicken was on the cool side. Hoping things would improve with dessert, I ordered the Key Lime Tres Leches. This was not your typical moist Tres Leches that I'm used to having and ultimately, I left disappointed. The only positive that I can give is that the water was refreshing and the service was good.

So my boyfriend and I went there for dinner tonight, which today is Friday, I guess a bartender called off, so the drink services was super slow. After 30 min I recived my two  margaritas, which were really really good, I asked the food runner why it to ok so long to get our drinks, and she explained that a bartender called off, and she told the manager about our wait time, so the manager came over and  apologize for the inconvenience, and put out 2 drinks and  appetizer on the house, really good management, also the food was really good we both got two tacos and the Mexican style corn, if that wasn't good enough the manager also took our expired groupon for full value. The restaurant had really good Mexican food I would recommend coming back for the fun  atmosphere and good management.
Overall - good food, good service. Had the shrimp tacos - so good! Mula to drink - was different but good. Came in early and it filled up quick. Convenient to the movies next door! We will be back.

Looking for Mexican? Not your regular Mexican food, this is very different 
It's pretty good I just always make sure I say put all the sauces on the side cause that ruined my first time but went gave a second try without the weird sauces they put on everything!! but it's pretty good not great

The Margaritas are truly the absolute best I have ever had. Food great. Atmosphere fun. Great place before or after a movie at AMC

Staff was pretty fantastic as well. Love this place
We enjoyed four tacos and a margarita.  Peter provided great service, sat outside on the patio.  Will be back again.

I came to this place twice before and here's my review from those visits....

Heavy handed on the salt and expensive for the serving size. The passion fruit mojito was very good however. If this place want to stay open...they need to focus on the flavors and not rely too much on the use of salt. Pricing should also be re evaluated.

Service was inattentive.  We're really polite helpful diners and the youth and what we believed to be a lack of experience got tiring after awhile.  You know when the service sux when your neck hurts at the end of the meal because you're trying to find your waitperson.  She kept walking by and you think she'll check on you, but total obliviousness and weird attitude.  Not welcoming or personable at all.  I hope they fix this because they don't deserve to have bad waitstaff after all the money that was apparently invested.  

The food:  The chips were good.  

That's it.  We had 2 dinners and unfortunately we're not fans.  I can see the chefs work hard, but I would find it hard to believe they think much of anything that's put out tastes authentic.  I grew up on 26th street & East side Mexican food, so it's not like I don't know what's good on the tongue.

Turn down the lights! It is so bright inside truco. I ordered the best margarita ever...it was far from best. It was way too sweet and had little to no booze and was served by a bartender that hated his job. They brought out tortillas and salsa which consisted of a liquified guacamole and a bean dip. My friend ordered a grapefruit margarita that wasn't any good either. I had high hopes because Mago is amazing. Willing to give it another try but not impressed on round 1.
This place is amazing! Fresh ingredients and all the food is delicious! The drinks are unique and amazing too!

This place is great!  We have dined here a few times and we love it.  On Tuesdays they have a special for Taco Tuesdays.  Everything on the menu was great, only downfall was the service seems busy but the staff have a large table section - maybe hire a few more waitresses.  We will be back many times to come and hopefully this place will be around for years to come.

I don't recommend coming here unless it's for the bar. I ordered the Carne Asada (2 steak tacos) and the ingredients just didn't seem to go together. They tasted bland, not like an authentic carne taco. Also ordered the Chopped Ensalada and that had absolutely no flavor (the menu said there was some kind of vinaigrette) but I didn't taste anything but jalapeños and leafs that were just dry.  

The environment is nice and the place is very modern. Our waitress was friendly but not very helpful. She recommended the only thing that I liked: my house special margarita. 

Overall, this was definitely a waste of money ($80). I think this place has potential because of the location but the menu needs a fix.

Observations:
-Some of food was excellent. 
-Much of the food was not...
-Some of the tacos I had were super salty
-The tortillas which they provide in lieu of chips were not enough when compared to a typical bowl of table chips.
- The menu descriptions were not completely accurate for a number of our items.
- The food took a very long to make it to the table. 
- Numerous staff members were joking around or on their phones when tables were waiting for refills, bussing, orders, etc...

Overall: I think this place has a lot of potential and may become great in time if they take customer feedback to heart.

Best Margaritas in Town, I don't care what anyone says! If Kim Jung Un can admit it, I can admit it too!  The Bartender/Manager Eddie is the only real reason we keep coming back. He makes the best drinks in the area. I recommend this place to everyone!

EDIT:
Get the patio opened up next to the bar window so you can grab drinks at an outside bar area too :)

To start off the mojitos are made fresh and had a wonderful balanced taste. The horchata had excellent flavor, not bland. Fire roasted salsa was smoky and fresh. We loved the sides of the beans and corn, very tasty. All the tacos we had were fresh and had nice flavors. 
You have to be willing to converse and wait for your food, since it is made fresh! They do not rush you.
We would go back anytime and enjoy the food and drinks!
So I sent my friend to the restaurant and he said it was incredible he has been a long time food connoisseur

We've been waiting for Truco to open for so long, and finally they did!

Delicious cocktails, house-made guac, authentic and interesting tacos and tortas. Ask questions if you're spice sensitive, and enjoy attentive service.

Music was good. Drinks were better. Food was bland. Service could've been better. Just another high class Taco Bell IMO. The white people were expecting more! Maybe put some salsa on the table to mask the bland food.

I would say this place is just ok. I don't think it's worth the $10 for two tacos but I have to admit, the tacos were really good. I got a side of the rice which  was bland and nothing special and my friend got the beans which were extremely salty- she couldn't even eat them. I think the most disappointing part was the Micheladas that we ordered. They were AWFUL! It was sour and the mix was tangy  and had oranges in it and it was just weird. I had high hopes since I heard that it was owned by the same people that own Mago, and its down the street from my house but was very disappointed. Would I go back? Maybe but probably not

Great service and terrific people who work there. This one bus boy, "Connor" I think his name was. Really made my night with his small talk about delighted appearance. I'd highly recommend this place to anyone.
Went for drinks. Atmosphere is very light and fun. Drinks were good. Service was very good. The girls who took care of us were very nice and attentive. Would definitely go back!

The waitress Consuelo was super sweet and helpful. The first time I was there she recommended some delicious dishes that did not disappoint! The horchata was to die for! I've been coming back since, for the food, atmosphere, and great service!

Excellent food for the prices. The tacos are fantastic, especially the Carne Asada. There is a good variety, so you can try something new on each visit while mixing in some old favorites. The cocktails are very good also, I like the Mula and my wife really liked the Margaritas. This place is a regular stop for me.

The food is five stars! 
They could have done little better on the space utilization. Ridiculously small bathrooms for a place that size. Feels goofy to wait in line to use the bathroom. 
But definitely a must to check out.

First time in this restaurant and not coming back. Service was ok but food was really bad we ordered two cemitas, the smoked pork they put in them was in really big chunks and salty. Steak milanesa seems like it was deep fried and very tough piece of meat. They were not even busy to try to make things right. When i went to the bathroom there were cases of tortillas pilled up nex to the bathrooms door? Do they have a better place to put them ? Overall bad experience

Went here tonight for the 1st time with 2 friends. We sat inside. The music was on the louder side and the ac was blasting on us. The restaurant decor was very nice and the staff was friendly. We all really liked our food, very fresh ingredients and it came out quickly. The Rita was good, but small and $9.99,  only $2 less than my entree. 
Def plan on coming here again for the food, but will bring a sweater or sit outside and order a cheaper drink!

Wanted to try this place with a friend as it is relatively new. Started off as a bad visit as my friend almost face plants on the entrance floor for a poorly placed rug and wet floor. Then we get in and there is no hostess... she is running all over the place as a line builds. Then when she returns she goes to the people behind us and doesn't even acknowledge that we were standing there in front of them. The gentleman behind us was nice enough to point out that we were first. Then they seat us at a table with one chair and bring in a little uncomfortable metal chair for me to sit on when there was an extra normal chair at the table next door (which they later exchanged at our request). They then brought my friend the wrong drink which she was too nice to return. And my Margarita with salt had a giant blob of salt on the side of the glass... which is super weird as I'm not going to lick the side of the glass for salt... that's just gross. The chaos calmed down a little after we were brought our food... which was slightly over mediocre. The waitress we ended up with was at least attentive and friendly but the bus boy kept trying to take away our half eaten food while we were still working. I want to like this place but the awful service left a bad taste in my mouth. Meh. Also the food was way over priced... 7 dollars for 2 tacos (with no rice or beans) and you can't mix them. That doesn't even make sense, what difference does it make. Also the full corn tortilla is not a hip way to reinvent the chip... it's just annoying. I give this place 6 months.
I love the margaritas here! The service and food is great! I come to truco a lot.  Thank you guys for the great food, drinks and service!!! I recommend truco to everyone!!!!
Great mojitos, service and atmosphere, mediocre food! Carne Asada were the best tacos!!! Prices fairly reasonable. Menu could have a few more selections. Wish the tacos came with sides.

Amazing food, drinks and atmosphere. Best order of guacamole that I've had in a long time. However, if you bring the kids... There are not any plain or kid friendly items. 

I think the only thing that will get this restaurant in trouble is their wait staff. Not one server/hostess looked happy to be there and service was a little slow. But, they did just open 3wks ago!

Edwardo the GM brings the feel of Mago to Truco the sister restaurant. Alfonso is an awesome server and gave great recommendations and was so personable and helpful. There wasn't anything I didn't like. Great dining even with the kids. Muchas gracias!

Kitchen is slow, place is loud, service is good.  

Tacos are hit or miss. The hits are great, the misses disappointing. The corn taco shells really bring all the tacos down. They're tough and chewy. 

This place is a mixture of good and bad features.

This place is awesome. Great margaritas, very interesting, but delicious guac. Charro beans are great,  fish tacos great. I've loved everything I've tried. I tend to like the greasier, hole-in-the-wall taco shops,  Truco is not one. It's very fresh tasting, but still delicious. The executive chef is the guy from Mago in downtown Arlington, so that might give you an idea of the flavor palette he likes to work with. For what it's worth, i think truco is wayyy better than mago. It feels more casual and street style (minus the lard). One cool thing is that they give you tostadas to break up instead of chips, which is fun for the kids to crunch and play with.

Have eaten here 2 times now. They changed their menu from the last time. You now receive a choice of rice or beans with your tacos. Still, they do not allow you to choose more than one type of taco. That is a downer. Tried it on a Monday evening before Christmas. Very busy at the theater but empty in the restaurant. While the server was very nice, she seemed to be the only one in the restaurant. Slow-slow-slow. 
Food was not consistent. Sangria was great but pricey. Chips and salsa are amazing. Tacos, which I loved last time had to be sent back because the fish was overcooked and chewy. Another person ordered their shredded pork tacos and flavor was not great. Carne Asada taco ordered was the tastiest.  For price point I want consistantly good food and not have to return it.
Ok. Nice decor, decent pricing, ok food. Service was lacking and it took them forever to get our bill right.

Love love LOVE this place. What a great addition to Randhurst! Their summer mojito (coconut) is the stuff dreams are made of. I hope they decide to keep it year round. The food is amazing too. Anytime someone comes from out of town and we are eating locally we take them here. Absolutely love it.

I got carry out from this location and overall I would say like many restaurants in this area it was pretty fancy.
The restaurant: beautiful. Colorful, great open seating, two floors. I was very impressed. Very nicely decorated just a beautiful space. I liked the modern bathroom.
The food: I got an assortment of tacos. Firstly they come on corn tortillas not my most favorite but I saw you could ask for flour after the fact. I got mahi mahi- this was not the best. It wasn't flavored well not enough salt and the quality of the fish wasn't my favorite. The shrimp were better they have pumpkin seeds in them and some kind of creamy sauce I liked it. The best were these vegetarian poblano tacos. Watch out-they are spicy! But really good! It's a crunchy soft combo so I liked it texture-wise as well as flavor wise it was a big hit with me. I also got an appetizer of corn with cheese and mayo? Or sour cream? I dunno it was good but I didn't understand if I was supposed to eat it plain or with chips; do I did both and it was good both ways. It is a dish served warm. The house salsa I really liked, it was flavorful and really good. I agree with the other yelpers, the whole tortilla as an appetizer is awkward. Mine was fried not soft but you had to break them and stuff, I could have done without the extra work.
The service: I went at an off time so it was quick people were friendly but no one asked me to sit while I was waiting for my food and it was 15-20 min. It would have been nice to be asked.
Price wise: ~$25 for what I got, not amazing but not horrible. It was a lot of food so it was ok.
Check it out, there are a few items that I still want to try, it's a beautiful space I think they are just so new they need to work out the kinks.

I visited Truco the other day and had the best experience.  The food was amazing and had the quality and uniqueness that is true gourmet. The manager was highly attentive, he made sure we were satisfied before we left. The server was so knowledgable she knew exactly what we were looking for before even we did. "Oh my gatos" is a must have, the drink was beyond amazing definitely exceeded my expectations. The place was beautiful very modern Mexican  with a margarita bar twist making it unlike any other Mexican restaurant I've visited. I will definitely go back again.

Tried Truco for the first time last night. Tacos are rather "chef-y", so if you are a Taco Bell person this is not for you. Our waiter explained everything very well and was very knowledgable. I don't like spicy food, so the waiter recommended the camaron (shrimp) tacos with chile de arbol pesto, quesco fresco, and pepitas. SOOOOO very good! Shrimp cooked perfectly. My son had carne asada tacos - yum! The frijoles ranchero were spicy, but good. The esquites - supposed to be roasted corn - I think was canned corn. The bottom was watery, the corn had no flavor and definitely not cut off a roasted ear of corn. Not even one kernel had any char or roasted flavor. I wish Chef good luck and hope his Truco does well here.

We went to Truco for Taco Tuesday....2 tacos for $5.   What a dea!  The carne asada tacos were the best.  They had a chipotle salsa and a slice of avocado on top.  So good!  Our server, Tanya, was awesome.She gave us a lot of good recommendations from the menu.  I will definitely return with my husband to try out some of the other menu items!  The only suggestion for improvement would be better signage.  The restaurant only has a small sign.  The side of the building that faces the Costco parking lot needs a sign!

Worst service by far!!!  Waitress freaked out when asked to split a check.  Acted like it was the end of the world.  As a server it is part of your job to either assume all checks will be separate or do the simple thing and ask!  Clearly she could not handle the whole 8 tables in the restaurant.  I'm pretty sure the buss boy was taking a table at one point.  The manager on duty doesn't know how to do anything but be a greeter and fill up waters.  Here's a free tip for management, hire more staff during the lunch hours or fire the waitress who cant do the job she applied for.  Food was mediocre at best.

Upscale, modern Mexican place.  This means the portions are small, and you will not recognize anything on the menu.  For example, as an appetizer you dont get the typical large basket of chips and salsa.  You get a few fried tortillas, a very bland salsa, and some watery refried beans at room temperature.

Portions are very small.

I get they are trying to run an upscale Mexican restaurant here, but I think you could alter the menu a little to appeal to the rest of us and our teenage kids.

I had high hopes for this place, having heard that the chef from Mago had moved here. I have been there three times now and honestly, the only thing I thought was really good was the Sangria. I have had carne asada tacos, short rib tacos, chicken quesadilla and guacamole. None of these were outstanding; just okay. My husband said his fish tacos were just okay but he thought the frijoles were outstanding. The service was weird. We were there last  Friday night and there was hardly anyone there. We had a young lady server who was overly friendly with my husband but would not look at me - even taking my order. He asked me the next day if I thought there was something funny about the server and mentioned that he noticed she wouldn't interact with me. Maybe she thinks she will get a better tip from focusing on men? Not sure but it was very strange. Anyway, I will likely go back and hope that, one of these times, I'll hit on a dish that knocks my socks off. And if not, I'll enjoy the sangria.

The neatest thing of this place post remodel? They have meal deals. All the meals are under 3 bucks.  I got #3

Gordita Supreme - it's that meh meat with normal stuff, it completely soaked through the wrapper and there was stuff everywhere on my tray by the time i finished eating it

Doritos - come with the meal, it's a bag of doritos that I enjoyed more than the gordita

Drink also comes with it, mango iced tea was a bit light on flavor but good overall

I hope they open for breakfast earlier, they open at 7 for it right now.

It is practically never that I give an establishment 1 star, but this particular TB was just asking for it.  I get that this is a "budget Americanized Mexican chain," but the overall experience at this particular location had really gone in the toilet.  3+ minute wait at the drive up intercom, then another 7+ minute wait in the drive up line.   Completely unacceptable, as it wasn't even busy inside.  On top of everything, the flour tortilla for the chicken soft taco was so dry it was actually crispy.  And I specifically asked for no sour cream on the 7-layer and guess what...ding ding ding!  Sour cream.  Thumbs way down, Taco Bell.
Bad service, takes too much time for dine in orders. Taco shell smells old burnt oil. Manager with attitude not to help, but just make cheap money..

Taco Bell... you are soo unhealthy with GRADE D meat....when people talk about the meat...i get disgusted..then think & say I won't go there...but then again here I am..once in awhile.. it's ok to let the bad stuff in your system.. right?....

why are you tasty?.. I get tempted when I enter Taco Bell with all the options....it looks tasty...well some of the photos do at least....and the prices are reasonable... ~$5 for 2 tacos and they have some deals under $10..... not bad...

I used to go to Taco Bell almost once every week in the past (3 yrs ago) to accommodate for my vegetarian friend/co-worker during lunch time... I did slowly get sick of eating it on a weekly basis......but sometimes... if you don't eat it in awhile.. you begin to kind of sort of miss it....ignoring the fact that it has bad quality meat.... my mind says no, but my mouth says yes...

I think Taco Bell is a ideal cheap fast food option for vegetarians only because the meat quality is bad.. so it's probably healthier to go with tacos w/out the meat.....and just replace everything with beans..hoping that it doesn't create you too much flatulence...hah....but seriously...cheap...fast..good...

This location's drive through is really really busy, but the sit-in is pretty empty....I'll see older couples or young high school students here often...

Food:
Nacho Cheese Locos Tacos: I love the shell...but it's very fragile.. it breaks very easily so eating the taco can get messy...maybe you can just get a bowl and crush everything together...tasted delicious.. :) 

Cheese Nachos: just cheese poured over tortilla chips... $0.99...I wouldn't recommend it.. get $0.99 fries instead.. it's very bland... and the cheese quality doesn't seem that great.. and they don't give you a lot of cheese.. :( ....

Cooler Ranch Locos Tacos: sorry... this is on my next to-try list... my friend tried it and said it tasted good...hope that helps...

Customer Service:
The cashier was friendly but it seemed like she didn't know how to fully use the register...the customer in front of me wanted more time to think so he told me to go first... so that would mean she would have to void his order.. but she didn't know how to...so she went to the drive-thru cashier and entered in my order... i thought that was really odd....hm...


I'll come back again for 1 taco... every visit = 1 taco only... :)
The prices on the menu are different from what they charge you the manager don't seem to care I don't see why they put him in charge I know it's a chain they don't care about their reputation

Shitty service, employees must not understand english because I clearly say what I want, and read the order back. They STILL NEVER GET IT RIGHT. Not one time was my order correct, then THEY SKIMP ON THE FOOD, and when I ask for extra sauce I get literally 4 packets. Not even kidding....

The prices are expensive, I am paying for one person but its like it was paying for two.

I like this place... nice people behind the counter. The food was good and hot.. seems like a nice place.. I kinda spent too much.. but I got #8 meal 3 soft tacos and be an burrito and loaded griller.. it was a big meal for 8 bucks..

I can relate to some of the reviews here. I also had a couple experiences in the drive thru where they took way too long to get the food made. It seems like they always have poorly trained teenagers working the drive thru and they are constantly messing up orders. Unfortunately this is the most convenient location for me, but I try to avoid at all costs when I can.
Mexican pizza is good, but not fast service

I would give them zero stars if I could. I just got home from going through the drive through of this taco bell. My husband and I just wanted something quick to eat after a long day. We waited in the drive through lane for 35 minutes before getting our food. We noticed the guy in the car in front of us had a large order, but as he waited in front of us for his food and almost half an hour went by, we got more and more irritated. Why wouldn't they ask him to pull forward into a parking space, so the line can continue moving and not hold up the??? That would be common sense right - clearly too much to ask. When we pulled up to get our food, we quick a quick appology. Once we finally got our food, got home, and started eating, I found that the sauce on my chicken quesadilla was missing and there was also no sauce on my husband's cheesy gordita crunch. Ugh, it wasn't even worth the ridiculously long wait.
I've never had a problem with this Taco Bell, better than a few around my home actually.

One of the worst Taco Bells around. Cold food, small inconsistant portions, dirty work stations and rude help.
Taco Bell is lucky to get their order right 1 in every 3 times of going there. You ask for hot sauce you get mild. Ask for no beans, get no meat. Whatever they want to do, they do it. If you compalin they act like they can't understand.

I 
Love
This
Place
Always
Fresh
Burgers 
Always 
Fresh 
Fries
Amazing
This
App
Always
Wants 
More
What
More
Do you need to say??? It's amazing!

I went here for my lunch break one day because I had a taste for a burger. Never again. Well maybe no time soon. Don't get me wrong, the burger was good and the customer service was also good, but their food is way overpriced! My burger and small fries was almost $11! It was a nice sized burger and the cook gave me plenty of fries. I think they would get more customers if they lower their prices. 4 stars for the good food and customer service only.

I've been to the Mt Prospect location a number of times over the years so I have a frame of reference. Both locations look virtually identical and have the same very limited menu:burgers, hot dogs, fries and overpriced soft drinks.

I had a double bacon cheeseburger, hot dog and Cajun fries. Granted, this is a lot of food that isn't exactly healthy, but it's my choice.

The burger and grilled hot dog were well up to Five Guys standards, which is to say fairly tasty, fresh and seemingly made to order. The bacon cheeseburger featured a nice sesame seed bun, a decent amount of bacon and an ample portion of nicely melted cheese. Their beef is only mediocre (there's nothing juicy about it) and they tend to overcook which makes it somewhat dry.  

The fries, which is usually their strong point were positively AWFULL. It was apparent they had been cooked long before I placed the order and had been lying around. They were hard with an unpleasant harsh taste. They may have been heated up just before they were served as the outsides were mostly burnt.

Had I been dining in I most likely would have demanded a replacement or a refund. I ordered for carryout and it shouldn't be necessary for a customer to have to sample their food before leaving the premises.

An experience like this makes me reluctant to return to ANY Five Guys location.

I usually don't review chain restaurants because unless the restaurant has done something extra-good or extra-bad, they're usually all the same.

However, I had never been to a Five Guys before, and it was so damn good they deserved a review.

Their fries are amazing. The burgers are perfect. They don't serve much more than that, but what they do serve is fantastic.

I'll definitely be hitting up some of the Chicago locations now that I know how good they are.

Love this place!  It's got that laid back style to it.  It reminds me of those small burger joints in the ol' neighborhood but at the same time something new and trendy.  It's on the pricier side for burgers but it's a gourmet burger!  And yes a burger is automatically a double and you completely build your order down to every ingredient.  They give you tons of fries and they are always fresh which is nice!  And the peanuts are a nice touch while you wait or even to go.  This location is always quick and handles crowds quickly.

Not impressed. The fries were good and hot. The burger was only okay. It didn't have a lot flavor, though it did taste fresh. There area lot of good burger places around so I really have no need to return here.

When Five Guys came to town, they arrived with a vengeance. Not all of them offer the ultimate Coca-Cola dispenser but they all have unlimited peanuts to giveaway.

Burger v. Little Burger is the difference of one hamburger patty. They also sell Hot Dogs and Fries.

Their list of complimentary toppings is generous. I like mine with ketchup, mustard, American cheese and pickles.

Good tasting burger, prepared to order and cooked until the cheese is melted to perfection. The potatoes are fresh, cut and fried on premise.

They need toothpicks for when the sesame seed from the bun lodges between your teeth.

Quality = Quantity. In case you don't get it: Expect to pay more for better quality food. Don't let their prices intimidate you. Here's what we do to keep our tab under $20:

HIM= Burger w/ Bacon & American Cheese, Small Fries, Soda
 ME= Little Burger w/ American Cheese

The amount of Fries is more than enough for one person...
We buy one drink when refills are involved!

For a burger place this place is wonderful.  Fast and friendly service.  The prices were on point.  The portion sizes were hugggggge!  I love the atmosphere of the place.  The cooks and cashiers are always smiling and happy!

I've been wanting to try this place for a while as I've heard  good word-of-mouth reviews of the chain. It's always one of those places mentioned when people talk about quality, outstanding fast-food.

For the most part I agree, the burgers are cooked to order, served hot, and taste very fresh, both the beef and the condiments. The fries are excellent, some of the best I've ever had, fresh-cut, skin-on, served piping hot. Delicious food no doubt.

Now for the negatives. First of all it's just way too expensive. I expect these higher quality burger joints to be more expensive than the huge multinational chains, but a single "small" cheeseburger, small coke and small order of fries should NOT come out to over $10. The burger was most certainly delicious but a the patty was a little thin for a $5 burger.

Another fault is that Five Guys falls into the American cliche of serving ridiculously huge portions of their food. The "small" order of fries (costing $3) is enormous, I could only eat about half of them, and I was more hungry than usual. I can't imagine anyone ordering the large fries, unless it was to share with several other people. Why can't they just sell truly small order of fries for $1.50? It would still be a good portion of fries (like a typical medium fries at most places) and it would drive the price of the meal down to about $8, which would be a a little more forgiving to both the wallet, and the waistline.

I'm kind of over Five Guys... except for the french fries - this is the only thing that has been consistently good with respect to the food.  The burgers seem to have shrunk over time, yet the prices seem to keep going up.  Nothing was wrong with the burger I had - it tasted good, but when we got the burger we looked at it and said "where's the beef?"  The thickness of the patties is now about as thick as something from any fast food place...which wasn't the case when Five Guys first opened... 

With respect to this particular location, compared to other locations I've been to, this was probably the least busy - but that may have been due to it being a holiday?  Not sure.  

I am not sure that great fries would make me a regular customer...now if they added a great milkshake that would be a whole other story!!

A typical Five Guys restaurant  We were there at 5:30 on a Friday and it was completely empty, kind of a surprise.   Nice friendly staff and very clear restaurant.  Service was quick and burgers and fries were hot, fresh and plentiful.  Unfortunately my burger had green pepper and not the mushrooms I ordered but not a big enough problem to send it back.

First time and preordered online for to go order for client meeting.  Lots of burgers done different ways and all delivered right on!  Everything was hot, tasty an awesome burger!  The employees were great at helping me pull together extra condiments for the order.  Will definitely go back and loved the ease of ordering online!

It's like any other Five Guys--delicious! There's no real secret to Five Guys burgers other than fresh ground beef, no fillers, and seasoned with salt and pepper. It's the kind of thing people used to make at home before they got lazy and started buying frozen pre-made patties or pre-made microwave burgers.

The fries are also freshly cut and delicious!

If you're allergic to peanuts however this is not the place for you. They fry their potatoes in peanut oil and also have shelled peanuts to nibble on while you wait for your burger.

Just like Omaha's (which was realy good)

I saw this on my way to a referee clinic, and had to make it for lunch.  I had tried Five Guys based on a friend's suggestion, and man, was it good.  The key was: is the formula location specific?

The good news - it isn't.  I got the same juicy burger with fries (and when you ask for fries, you always get more that you bargained or paid for) that I got from the Omaha location, with great service and a clean restaurant.  It's so much better than the standard fast food - the burgers are made as you watch - no drawer burgers here, the fries were made fresh, and well, it's just darn good.

Why 5 stars for non-haute cuisine?  Because it rates it.  This must be fairly new, since I don't see a lot of reviews, and there weren't many customers on the day I went (11/30/13).  I have no idea why - great burger, great service.  Just a great time.
It's ok. A little over rated and a little overrated. Would I go back, no since hamburger, fries, and coke was $13.85. This it's a regular size meal.

This place is all about Burgers, Hot Dogs and fries.  There is a Vegetarian side of a veggie sandwich, grilled cheese, and cheese vege sandwich.  If you're about burgers and fries, this is a good place to visit.

The burgers are good, not the best but very fresh and delicous fresh toppings. What really shines here are the fries. They're strangely addicting and they just pile a ton in your bag waaay past the fill line of the container!  Free in-shell peanuts tops it all off. Normally this would just be 3 stars, but the fries and peanuts barely gets the 4th star.
The burgers are great!  The fries have a burnt taste to them. Maybe the oil needs to be changed.
The burgers are awesome, it's Five Guys. At this particular location, the staff was very funny and friendly. It was slow so they were cracking' some (funny) jokes. Very entertaining.

Can you say best bang for your.... cluck?! HA I crack myself up... but seriously the grilled chicken family meal, as others have gushed, is such a good deal!  And it's really good chicken too.  My daughters and I came here after doing some errands and got the 12 piece to go.  My 5 year old would not stop eating it when we got home.  I'm not sure if she was just that starved (what a great mom) or she had never experienced chicken cooked that well (again, such a great mom).  We'll definitely be making a return visit, even if it's a 20 minute drive for some grilled chicken!

This place is really good the chicken is flavorful and tender the beans are really good although they have bacon in them I just picked it out the Mac n cheese it runny not my fave they were very nice and it was fast and hot and a really good price three piece with two sides only 7.75 I want to try the gac next time

We carry out from this place quite often. The larger family meal includes 12 pieces of chicken, 3 sides and 2 packages of tortillas for only $21. Aside from the great price, the food is authentic and tasty. Chicken has great flavor and is very juicy...even the white meat! Our favorite sides are the beans and rice. (Don't bother with the mac-n-cheese.) There is also a small salsa station so you can take a variety of homemade salsas.

So I finally got to try this place and I was so excited and it was awesome except for the fact that it's super super dirty. Now mind you I went in at around 3pm and it was dead only one family sitting at a table and the place was torn up. Food all over the floor, the salsa bar had salsa spilled and dry meaning it sat forever like that.also flys all over the place and it's fall so thy shouldn't be lol.  Ewwww the food was so delicious and I just love the rice and horchata . It was so crazy cuz there was 2 girls standing there doing absolutely nothing but playing on there phones. lol. Omg ladies have some sense and clean ur messy place. The manager must not be experienced enough and has no business owning a restaurant that's discussting.  So just a little disapoonted cuz  I was so grossed out me and my boyfriend just decided to take it to go it was so so nasty. Im kinda sad I won't be back but after that experience I'm sorry I've never seen a restaurant in that condition my whole life.
LOVE the food here, chicken is fantastic. My boyfriend and i get the family meal for 15 dollars. 3 sides of your choice and 8 pieces of chicken, and 2 packs of tortillas. Leftover for days!
Great chicken meal at a great price. Chicken comes with grilled jalepeno and whole green onions!  Yum. For sides, order rice and beans. The beans are amazing.

The chicken is amazing! Super juicy with great as ado flavor. Only thing that is negative is the Mac n cheese, lacks flavor and cheese is too runny!!!!! 
Rice is like the ordinary, beans are pretty great!
Definitely recommend the chicken!!!!!

We were bike riding through Elgin and stopped in for lunch. The food was really good, the prices were very reasonable and the authentic atmosphere was enjoyable. If you're in the area this is a must stop. The chicken platter and the steak tacos for our favorites.

This is an awesome little gem.  My husband and I rolled the Yelp wheel of fortune one night and found this place over the summer.  We keep coming back for more!  We always order the same thing...the 1 chicken family order with grilled green onions, rice, and beans.  The chicken is so succulent and flavorful.  I can't even begin to describe how good it is!!  It comes with corn tortillas and variety of salsa from the salsa bar.  This meal is plenty for 2 people with left overs for days.  

The staff is friendly and service is quick.  There's always a line when we go, which means the food is amazing!

Definitely a must try if you're in the area!
Been coming here for a while now. Chicken is moist and flavor is fantastic. A lot food for the $ - wish side portions were bigger tho since we love the beans and rice.

My Husband and I love Casa del Pollo Asado.  The Dinners are fantastic & the prices are a great value.  

I recommend the Grilled Chicken Family Meal.

The Salsa Bar is awesome!

Try this restaurant - it is a gem.

This place is awesome. We placed a large catering order for a birthday party and I was an hour late to pick up the food, so they had to sell the chicken so it wouldn't get cold/go to waste. No problem! They have so much of their tender and delicious chicken being cooked all the time they were able to redo the order in like 5 minutes. The chicken is served with tons of grilled onions, and the beans were very good as well.

Great whole roasted Chicken comes with your choice of three sides something like mashed potatoes or macaroni cheese or roasted onion and peppers or Mexican rice or great beans rancheros so few more choices I'm sure. and they have like 6 different types of hot Salsa! And all your orders come with corn tortillas! and when you having family over I just call and order the tray w like whatever you like 3 or 5 chicken's and I can assure you everyone will love it! if you don't like it something wrong with you! :) :)
The chicken is so delicious. Only chicken restaurant I go to.  The price is the best for the family meal. 2 thumbs-up!!

I just got back from checking this place out. Been dying for some grilled chicken.
All I can say is that, THE CHICKEN IS AWESOME !!!
I got half a chicken, corn tortillas 2 sides and a drink for under $10
The chicken is moist and tender with great flavor ! I will admit the place could be a little cleaner on the inside.
But the food makes up for it and they have a salsa bar. So far the 3 salsas I got today are yummy.
So if you are in the mood for GREAT grilled chicken stop by, WAY better than any other chicken place I have found.
I am glad I work in Elgin, I will be going there a lot !!!
Staff was super friendly and got my food very quick.
Please check them out !

My girlfriend's sister brought takeout from La Casa del Pollo Asado for dinner one night, and we were stuffed and satisfied. She brought us LCdPA again, and we were hooked! The chicken is absolutely delicious and juicy, and the sides are also very good. They serve their chicken in four sizes: 1 1/2, whole, half, or quarter. You can get either the grilled chicken (asado) or the BBQ (en salsa barbeque). We've gotten the grilled chicken, which is bursting with flavor (especially since the skin is left on) and is accented well by the grilled green onions and jalapenos that come with.  

I recommend picking up a "Family Order." That comes with either 1 grilled or BBQ chicken, which is cut up into 8 pieces or 1 1/2 grilled or BBQ chicken, which is cut up into 12 pieces, plus your choice of three sides. The beans are excellent, although they are not what you might think of when you think of Mexican-style beans. These beans come with more broth and have pieces of bacon floating around in all that brothy goodness. I don't even like beans, and I found myself gobbling these up. We also get the rice and the chips / guacamole, which are both very good. There's also a salsa station where you can pick from an array of sauces. 

The prices are very reasonable and the food is great. For $15-$20, you get a delicious, well-balanced and fairly large meal. You can't beat that! So skip that KFC or Popeye's family meal and head over to La Casa del Pollo Asado! (I understand that LCdPA and KFC / Popeye's serve different kinds of chicken, but with the family meals you're essentially getting the same thing: chicken + sides).
good chicken, but what's holding them back is their service. this is the third time I've had to wait an hour for my food. don't think I'll be coming back.

I order the chicken taco lunch combo.  Although the ingredients were fresh, the taste was a bit blend and the chicken was a little dry to my liking.  Overall, the meal wasn't memorable.  Perhaps I didn't order the right item since everyone else on yelp seemed to be highly satisfactory with their experience in this establishment.

I've been driving past this place since they opened and I kept telling myself I would stop by to try their food especially when you see Police Officers eating there.  The two times that I went there the food was delicious. Not too mention the short wait time. I ordered the half chicken with 2 sides of rice. The macaroni isn't too bad neither. I will definitely be going back.
I recently tried your chicken, rice and beans at a Chicago Mustangs game and it was delicious! I will be visiting soon... I want some more!

Best Chicken in town!
And very good price too will definitely recommend to anyone who likes good quality chicken!

Easy parking! Ordered the half pollo Asado and it came with 2 sides. Rice and grilled scallop onions were great! They also have a kids menu the the kiddos enjoyed. Wish they had chicken nachos! I'm sure it would be amazing as well!
Great chicken. Authentic Mexican food. Park across street in free parking lot.  Highly recommended.

My older, adult son invited me to join him for dinner at La Casa del Pollo Asado.  My younger, adult son joined us.  Each of the three of us is a self-proclaimed connoisseur of Mexican cuisine.  Anyway, we know our way around the cocina.

Who doesn't like grilled chicken and/or steaks?  The House of Grilled Chicken will traject your tastebuds lightyears from backyard grilling.  It's all in the preparation, seasoning, and the Scrumptious Sauce & Scallions that provoke your taste buds to scream for more while your stomach "yelps" back "Take it home - no more freak'n room down here!".

I've been eating beans and rice all my life.  With all respect to my late mother's beans these frijoles are a very close 2nd and the fluffy Mexican rice is a tantalizing accompaniment.  

The guacamole is of perfect taste and consistency.  Do you like salsa?  Nothing like the variety of Salsa selection that they offer here.  Checkout the Salsa bar once you pickup your meal.

It's a fun place, but the atmosphere is not fancy or memorable with Mariachi music in the background.  La Casa Del Pollo Asado is a self-service, clean restaurant with a very friendly and courteous staff.  They have been in business for over two years.  Plenty of parking in the open, free parking lot about 40 yds away.

Disfrute de su fiesta.

Best Chicken in Town 
Will definitely  recommend to anyone that likes good chicken! $$$

Best chicken in town is a good summary. The birds taste like they're brined /marinated expertly, and roasted perfectly. Somebody really knows what they are doing here. Liked the sides and the salsa bar a whole lot. 
Found a new favorite take out place!
