They have some Extremely snobby chicks working there with they're hair up and not done and looking all cracked out. Will give this place another shot since the food is good.

You can't beat Moretti's for a good sports Bar experience, the place is huge, the food is very good for the price, the beer selection is outstanding, i usually get pizza, i like the nice crispy crust, but I'm not a big fan of the corn meal at the bottom of the pizza, why? it takes away from the pizza, stop using it.  I will keep coming back, best place in the area to take on a game, eat some good food and not go broke.

Great place to spend time with friend and for example watch a sport. There is plenty of tv to do it in Moretti's. Great appetizer-Char-grilled spicy Italian sausage with roasted peppers and onions and delicius pizza, my favorite is thin crust with mushrooms, pepperoni, green pepper and sliced tomato. If you live in the neighborhood and want to eat some delicious pizza, this is  the place to go.

I love their food. The pizza is awesome especially the Asiago crust. I love their Jack Daniel's burger and their buffalo chicken sandwich,  delicious. Delivery times are a little long,  always usually an hour or more, but well worth the wait.

I had my wedding shower here last Saturday, because my family loves the food, and we wanted a casual place to eat and drink. We had a large group-- around 50 people.  

My mother and my aunt have been planning for months, calling back and forth, visiting the room my shower would take place.  4 visits, and many phone calls to CONFIRM we had an upstairs private room booked. 

We arrive, and "whoops we overbooked, sorry."  So my shower was crammed in the front room with all of the regular dining guests, they didn't have enough chairs, and we had to FIGHT to get $100 off our $2,000 bill.  Great food, TERRIBLE MANAGEMENT.  Our waiter said-- oh did (forgot name) book your room? My mother said yes, she said "oh, then I'm not surprised, this happens all the time." 

DON'T BOOK YOUR PARTY HERE.

Had dinner here the other night with my family. Waited twenty minutes to get seated no big deal. Once we were seated waited twenty minutes and nobody can to get us drinks or take our order. No I'll be right with you nothing. It took me to yell out across the restaurant at a server to ask if anyone was working our table to get service. Food was mediocre at best the Service sucked. Will not be coming back!
We order food for a birthday party and they forgot part of the order. If we didn't come back we would t have gotten it.  Overall good food.

Great food! Reasonable prices. And the staff... out of this world, always friendly, go above and beyond! Was there for the pizza deal on Tuesday, such a great crowd and the staff couldn't do enough for you.  Wow!

Large menu with a lot of variety. I chose a 12" sausage and mushroom pizza. Cooked perfectly. Quality cheese, nice crisp crust. Sauce wasn't to bad. The rest of the crew had pasta. Nice portions and well prepared. The service was good and the food came out rather quick. This is a large place. That said, I can certainly see how the service and quality of food can diminish with large crowds. Great place for youth sports teams/families to gather as a group and unwind.

I've tried several dishes from here and honestly the food is really good, the reason for the two stars is service.  It's horrible for that sole reason.  I've gone here maybe 4 or 5 times and I've been double charged 4 or 5 times!  I'm yet to order from there and not deal with it.  Sometimes the people answering calls seem to have no training whatsoever!  It's a shame because their menu is excellent.

I go here when I have the patience to tell you the hard honest truth!

Hosted a party of 25 yesterday in the Garden room and everything was exceptional. From my initial contact with Daniella to book and determine menu thru the outstanding service of Sam, who made sure the food table was always full and all special requests were handled quickly - I couldn't have been happier! I've been a Morettis fan for 20+ years but this was my first time at the Mt Prospect location. The restaurant was clean, well maintained and the food/service met the high standards I've come to expect in a Morettis Restaurant.
Food and service were both very good. Have the BBQ chicken salad and it was delicious!

I came here on a Thursday for half-off burgers and $2.50 Miller Lites. This was my first time here and the burger was very good. I couldn't put it down. The fires were very low quality and I would not recommend them. The wait staff was very polite and fast. I would come back here.

I really like the Moretti's locations just not this one.  The menu is fabulous, love the drink and food specials.  Always something new and seasonal to try.

However, the staff in Mount Prospect is less than stellar.  The manager seems to walk the floor without ever noticing what's really happening in this building.  Perhaps a little less chit-chat with the staff and more with the customers would bring a better vibe to this location.
My escape from work.  I've had half macNcheese/half barbq chicken and half macNcheese/half margarita pizza. It's official. Pizza in the burbs is better than the city

Horrible, unfriendly service. Staff just did not want to be bothered. They acted like they were doing me a favor. When will these businesses learn that if you want repeat business you must treat customers with respect!
Will never spend my money there again!
Ordered delivery from Moretti's in Mt. Prospect to be delivered 1.1 miles away to a hotel we were staying at. The driver calls and tells us he's lost and his head is spinning?!

Heard the pizza ribs and wings were good.  But wanted to try something different 
Got sausage and peppers with pasta... Ok but blank.  My husband for the Tuscan grill
Steak overlooked chicken dry no flavor to the shrimp for 19.00 way over prices
Service good

Like the food but the staff seem to be completely retarded. Service absolutely sucks. Placed an order for delivery and we waited an hour in a half before calling. They took my boyfriends number down wrong so the delivery driver came and left. The girl told me he tried buzzing himself in and didn't work. Then my boyfriend gets on the phone and she said the delivery driver tried knocking on our door and no one answered. That is absolutely impossible since you have to be buzzed into our building. Either way she had an attitude problem and clearly was a moron. Will never order from this location.

We just had a pizza party in the garden room after a rehearsal dinner. I am so happy with the excellent service and food. Jackie did a wonderful job for our party of 20 that we had it in the garden room. They were very professional with their contracts and being upfront about the cost. I have always liked Moretti's for their wraps and pizza. I would totally use them again for a large group. Everyone enjoyed the two side dishes which we chose chicken fingers and mozzarella sticks. The salad and dressing was delicious. Equally delicious was the pasta and the pizza.The garden room is on the main level not too far from the bar and close to the bathrooms. Thank you for a wonderful evening with excellent service.

food was good but they butchered my name and my order twice now.  called to make an adjustment ( get rest of order)  and got left on hold  for some time and gave up.  Two strikes won't give them a chance for a third.

Just moved from Edison Park and was happy to find a Moretti's so close to my new place...but this Moretti's is not the same by any stretch.

The pizza was bland with a severe lack of sauce and the atmosphere was obnoxious due to the fact that the entire restaurant is open air with little to no division between the bar area and restaurant seating. I had to listen to obnoxious construction workers spew profanity at the top of their lungs as I ate my flavorless meal.

I'll go back to Edison Park if I want a real Moretti's experience.

I have to echo what others are saying about the service: mediocre. 

I want to say the place is short staffed and huge, the size making things worse. The waiters are either around one of the cash registers (maybe training??) or nowhere to be seen. When they do emerge (you have to pay attention), catching their attention is tough, they seem to either have other things to do or too focused on, well not you. 
I don't think the waiters are bad, rather the management. 

It's tiring. Also it has happened 4 times now, all around lunch hour. 
The food is pretty good, and that's coming from a non-chain- and a non-sports-guy. I'll try the Schaumburg location again next, a little further but not horrible. I think they have better service. 

You would think that the owners would do something about the several reviews that consistently point out the obvious. Maybe they don't give a damn.

There was a work party at Moretti's Mount Prospect. It was okay. 

The parking lot or should I say super remote not well lit cross a creek parking to get to the main lot was creepy. But the parking was free.

The party room was downstairs. The downstairs has a Grandma's basement vibe with the old tile floor and wood paneling and dim lighting.  Which was okay for our purposes that evening, but I would not be hosting a wedding or shower or anything here. There is no restroom on the lower level which was kinda goofy but not the end of the world.

The food was good and there was enough of it. The bartender was attentive and pleasant. Prices were fair.

We went tonight and had the ribs special.  The ribs were fantastic, as were the coleslaw and home-made potato chips.  It was a great deal--full slab of ribs for $15.00.  We had a great server, Brittany.  We come here quite often since it's close to home.  We normally have pizza, but went for the Saturday night special.  We'll definitely be back on a Saturday!

Food was great, service was too. Would have rated it higher except the cigarette smell was overwhelming. We sat at a pub table near the bar. Even in the middle of a huge room our eyes were burning from the cigarette smoke. There is a revolving door that people were going on the patio to smoke. Ever time the door spun the room filled with smoke. YUCK

Top-notch thin crust pizza. I recommend asking for extra sauce to make it a bit more flavorful....

As a restaurant, i feel a lot of the entrees are overpriced. Maybe that's just "sticker shock" from when this place was "famous freddie's" years ago, and had amazing dinner deals for bachelors such as myself...

The MAIN reason why it doesn't get 5 stars is because you can't get a pizza after 9:20 at night. What the hell is that? It's not like we're living in some hick town, and you've got ma and pa cranking out the pizzas, and they need to close the kitchen down so they can get up with the chickens....

There are plenty of people who want late nite pizza. If they just kept the kitchen open for pizza deliveries alone, i think they would do quite well.  Thank God  i'm not into 420 or some such thing, or i would really be mad at them. As such, i'm just KINDA upset for their non-partier's schedule when it comes to pizza. C'mon boys...you're in a MAJOR market here...deliver pizzas later, PLEASE...! At least until 10:30....!!!!!  At 9:20, i'm just getting started, sometimes....

Went out for dinner and our waiter Micheal approached our table to make  sure we have been waited on. He was nice and friendly.  We want his manager to know that u have a good server there! When my husband did not like the chicken appetizer he was gracious enough to comp it.  Very attentive too! We really enjoyed the pizza and the bruschetta app was very good. We will b back

I ordered a pizza online tonight and after an hour passed I called the Mt. Prospect store.  A girl answered and I asked where we were with the delivery.  The girl put me on hold and came back and said it was on its way.

30 minutes later I call the store again...this time I speak to two people on where is my order and they claim I don't have one.  They even begin debating me on how I called the wrong store.  I shared I hit "redial" and asked why were they telling me my pizza is on the way if I didn't have an order there.

Needless to say... a manager got on the line and basically began debating me as well.  Clearly... they are not looking for business.  I clearly agree with the writer who said the staff is retarded.   Good thing there are plenty of pizza restaurants in the area who want my business and are willing to treat me with respect.

There is no reason not to give this place five stars. If you are going here looking for a fancy pizza with broccoli, sundries tomatoes, and carrots, go somewhere else where they don't serve pizza. This is about as basic pizza gets. Place is great. And if you have kids, you can get as loud as you want and messy. They even offer a make your own pizza for kids!  Great thin crust pizza.

Pizza crust from here is so delicious! Nothing compares, just right amount sauce and cheese and not extremely greasy either. Bar drinks good as long as there is not a huge crowd of peps. (then you have to wait a bit)

Like the other Moretti's locations, this location has pretty solid cooking and a good selection of food at great prices. In fact, they seem to have more food specials than other local restaurants of this chain (which tend to have alcohol specials instead). The half price pizza on Tuesday nights is a great deal.

Had a great experience here! Went with a friend who needs to eat gluten-free and was happy to see choices for her. For me though, bring on the wheat! I split a stuffed crust pizza that was heavenly. It was a little pricey but how cool is it that you can get a stuffed crust pizza that's actually made with high quality ingredients. Plus because it was so heavy, you don't need a lot so there's left overs. Atmosphere was great for watching some playoff hockey! :)

Mmmmm. Good thin crust.

Tastiest crust in all of the burbs.

Their pizza's are worth a drive from Worth! (JFGI)

Fantastic thin crust pizza and great pan pizza too.  Went there tonight for mile high cheese lasagna and it was delicious and a huge portion, enough for dinner for tomorrow night too.  We also ordered the coconut breaded fried onion rings which were out of this world with the dipping sauce.  The place is huge and is basically a sports bar.   I like that it serves such excellent Italian food in an informal setting to dine in. Prices are very reasonable.  Highly recommend!

I would give 4 out of 5 stars for the food, because I enjoy many of their dishes (I have tried the burgers, chicken, pasta, pizza, and almost all of their appetizers and salads), but the 3 stars is for ordering delivery, which is not consistent as far as the quality of the food goes.  My husband and I often order pizza.  We like a very crispy crust, so we normally tell them to make it well done.  The past couple times we ordered the pizza and had it delivered, we didn't tell them well done, but the pizza itself just wasn't very hot, and it looked like the mushrooms were barely cooked.  We almost always order fries with our meal, and they were always nice and crispy when we got them, but the past few times we ordered they were just so-so, not really hot and mushy.  Last week the fries were completely undercooked and so soggy and limp I couldn't eat half of them.  I wouldn't complain had the food always been like this, but it seems like the food - at least what is delivered - is a lot less fresh than it used to be.  We live across the street, so there shouldn't be a reason why it's not hot and at least moderately crispy.  I really like Moretti's as a whole, and the girl Nadia who usually takes our delivery order is awesome!

A person I was meeting for a work lunch suggested this place when I said I like "hole in the wall" local type places.  I was not disappointed, the atmosphere was great and the food was fantastic.  The only problem was that I was working and just walking in the place screams... have a cold beer...

I would definitely be a regular at this place if I lived in the area.

My brother and I went in last night to watch the Blackhawks and the Bulls. We sat down at a table in the bar area in front of the projector screen and waited 15 minutes before a server came over to our table--which was a real quick "I'll be right with you." After which we waited another 10 minutes.  A trainee came over and took our drink order and a few minutes later brought our drinks but couldn't take any food orders which was fine because we were waiting on one other person.  A minute later our server came over and asked what we wanted to order to which we told her the same thing and she just walked away without saying anything.  We finished our first pitcher of beer and ordered another from the trainee because our waitress still had not come back. Once our third person came our waitress asked if she wanted a glass to have beer to which she replied yes--the waitress came back and threw it down on our table and walked away.  During the first intermission of the hockey game we ordered food from our waitress; I ordered the Jack Daniels' burger medium, my brother the Jack Daniels' burger well done, and his gf the gluten free lemon herb chicken with mashed potatoes.  Our burgers came out and they looked exactly the same--neither one was what we asked for, and his gf's mashed potatoes were so garlicky they were inedible. Our waitress never came back to our table to ask if everything came out okay.  The next time anyone came to our table was after we had stacked our plates on the edge of the table in hopes that someone would notice that we were finished with our meal.  A guy came by and took our plates and then our waitress came by and without ever actually stopping at our table asked if we wanted dessert--which there's no way should could have heard our answer since she was already 10 feet away.  At this point the second period of the hockey game was not even over yet--which decked out in our Blackhawks gear it was pretty clear we were there to watch the game--but the waitress dropped off a bill at our table without saying anything and walked away.  About 10 minutes later she came back and asked if it was all set and we let her know that we actually would prefer another pitcher of beer.  Again, about 15-20 minutes before the game was over she dropped off another bill and walked away. I happened to have a $10 off coupon that I wanted to apply and we waited 15 minutes for her to come back before I went up to the bar and asked the bartender to adjust our bill since I could not find her at all.  Once she brought it back again we noticed that she charged us for a pitcher of something other than what we had ordered and that was more expensive--which was another hassle to get changed. My brother had to walk around the restaurant looking for her.  

We watched our server interact with other tables fine--they were bigger parties and probably spent more money than we did--but I live 2 minutes away from Moretti's and dine there often and was incredibly disappointed in the way we were treated.  We weren't in a hurry and would not have minded waiting for quality service, however, the entire time we were there we felt like we were an inconvenience to our server and that she was trying to rush us out of the restaurant. It was a very disappointing experience and I will take my business elsewhere when I want to enjoy a meal and watch a game.

Will never order again.... And let me tell you why.  Order a couple weeks back.  After about an hour and 15 min called to find status,  was told it was on the way with their deepest apology and I would get a credit on my next order.  Called again last night to order and asked about my credit and was told they have no record of a credit,  and no they won't honor one because they don't know if I'm telling the truth or not.  I said I will not be using them again and the girl on the phone simply says ok.  HORRIBLE,  ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE!!!

Being in the burbs for the holidays means coming up with places to go eat and drink (and eat and drink some more).  Hearing that this was the same Moretti's from Chicago that I heard about, I suggested ordering pizza for here.  I should preface this by my review is only about take-out.  

The pizza was good. We ordered the thin crust cheese and also one with cheese, onion, and tomatoes.  Everyone, including our picky eater, was pleased.  I liked that it was thin, but soft and not too crispy.  What knocks it down a star was that it wasn't all that hot. It wasn't a long delivery trip and yet it was just lukewarm when we got it. It didn't taste as fresh and hence no raving review.  I am assuming my gripes with this may be solved by actually eating at the restaurant. 

I'd go there and check it out again, but I'd be less excited about getting the pizza to go.

At this point, I can't say I'm a fan of Moretti's. For months, one of my good friends raved about how great the food/deals were at Moretti's. 1/2 off pizzas on Tuesdays= $6 pizza/2 people= $3 pizzas?Why not. So I went for the first time to the Mount Prospect location, and I was expecting a lot. 

We ordered a pan spinach pizza. Meh. I've had a lot better elsewhere. I also ordered a pina colada and was disappointed with the result. The bartender made something that tasted like a watered down margarita with lime. This was definitely NOT a pina colada, so I sent it back. They finally brought back something that tasted like pineapple/coconut, but still very watered down. Grrr..

To be fair, I'll give Moretti's another shot. I've been wanting to try the Edison Park location, since I frequent Snuggery. I hope it fairs better.

Let's start with pros - the food! Thin crust pizza is always great and salads as well. Kids love the make your own pizzas too!  

Where they fail is the service. It's almost laughable how bad it is. No welcoming smile or even a hello from the hostess stand. Waitresses are all standing around chit chatting rather than checking on tables or clearing dirty dishes. We had to find our own plates and silverware from other tables. And of course no thank you or goodnight from hostess stand when we left. 

Bad customer service but great food seems to be the common theme among reviews. Shame on the management for not keeping the front of the house in order. The food is only thing keeping this place open but hello this is Chicago, pizza capital of the world - we can easily find another place to spend our money down the block!

I'm a bit disappointed in this location. Our office orders from here regularly and we have come to eat in the restaurant multiple times. I'm starting to think it's out of convenience, but this should not be the reason to eat somewhere and continue to eat somewhere repeatedly. 

They are a good place for after work drinks and apps and their patio is nice in the warmer months. They have bags and a fire pit.

We ordered out from here a week and a half ago. There were two of us who ordered their Grilled Chicken and Avocado Club. They were AWESOME!! There was this basil-butter (almost pesto-like) stuff that really added a freshness to the sandwich. There was also 2 gorgeous strips of bacon and a nice piece of mozzarella cheese (which I has substituted for the provolone they normally put on this sandwich). Everything we get from Moretti's is messy and typically pretty decent. For $20, two of us can have a decent lunch. 

There are two of us that work together who eat lunch out about once a week. He buys one week and I buy the next week. Last Friday, it was my turn and I suggested the same meal we had the previous Friday because that pesto butter was sooooo good and we both were kinda drooling looking forward to lunch out on Friday. We ordered about 12 noon for pick up at 1:20 pm. I went to pick up. Waited for about 10 minutes for the young lady who helped me and after all the waiting, she found our food was in the hot box by the hostess station minus one item we ordered, so I had to wait even longer. When I was back at the office and started to eat it was like the food was sitting there since we had placed our order at noon. The fries were cold and chewy- ICK! and the sandwich was nothing like last week's. It was like it came from another restaurant. Limp bacon, hardly any cheese and that lovely pesto/basil butter stuff was no where to be found :(

I'm sure we'll be back but not in a big hurry to return unfortunately.

I had the Crispy Chicken Romano and it was alright. The sauce was good, just the potatoes were instant. You can tell...they looked and tasted instant. I won't eat here again due to the fact that they are WAY too expensive!!

Plenty of TV's to watch all your chicago teams play, you've gotta try the moretti's BBQ pizza thin crust with mac n cheese a with hot peppers a close 2nd (other then pizza haven't really eaten anything else), service is a hit or miss here, last night Jennifer made sure our drinks were always halfway filled, other nights you're trying to flag down someone for some water.

1/10/12
2 guests for lunch 1:30pm

The other day I was at Moretti's Mount Prospect with my 80 year old grandmother and the service by Leslie was absolutely terrible.

Leslie, our server, was rude when seating us (no host during lunch).  She didn't say ONE word to us...she just wiped the table off while we stood there and then dropped the menu's and walked away.  Not a huge deal but that was just the beginning of what was to be an awful experience.  

I'm not sure what is expected of the servers by Moretti's management but In my experience the server would welcome you with a smile, tell you their name and if they were going to leave right away would at least tell you they will be with you in a minute.

We ordered two apps, the stuffed mushrooms and the onion rings.  20 minutes later we still hadn't received our appetizers and I saw Leslie chatting with co workers and drinking Iced Tea at the bar.  I knew from working in a restaurant that apps usually take between 5-15 minutes on a busy day, but it was dead.  By the time Leslie decided to go into the kitchen to check our food her other table had already closed out and left.   

When our apps finally did come out the mushrooms were cold and the onion rings were cold, tough and chewy.  Leslie didn't know this because she disappeared after dropping them off at our table.  After several minutes of looking around for anyone who worked there I eventually stopped a guy who was walking by our table, I asked him to tell our server that we would like to see her.  He was nice enough to ask what he could do and we told him about the toughness of the onion rings.  He came back shortly after taking our onion rings to the back and apologized for the inconvenience and said that he tried them and they were not like they should be and a new order will be out. 

Leslie did appear shortly after that but didn't even come by our table.  She went directly behind the bar.  I'm assuming that she was closing lunch and she was responsible for the bar and the dining room.  That being said; there were only two or three people at the bar and no other tables in the dining room.  Why didn't she come over and ask how we were doing???  

13 minutes later (yes, I timed it) Leslie decided to go in the kitchen to check our food and of course the rings were ready, and probably sitting there for some time as well.  When she drops them off at the table she says "I had the cook make an extra onion ring for me and I tried it, it's the way it should be now..."

We ordered a 12" pizza to split.  We decided to go all out getting a Tuscan vegetarian and the Asiago stuffed crust since we saw a sign as we came in that said 1/2 price pizza on Tuesdays.  When we received the bill I was shocked to see that our pizza was not 1/2 price and when I went to the bar to talk to Leslie about the charges she informed me that it only applies to after 4pm.  

Upon leaving I checked the sign again and in black marker there is a hand written note that states after 4pm but I still felt duped....The size of the hand written note is much smaller than the other writing and it blends into the background of the sign.  Seriously who the hell approved this?? 

We were both completely appalled/disapointed by the experience and I'm going to tell everyone I know about this.  Plus with a Rosati's right across the street I know where I'm going next time for pizza.
They have a small gluten free menu. The GF pizza is good! The Italian cobb salad was also tasty.

Top 3 pizza place in Chicago comparable to Papa Passero's and Roundheads. The pizza is top notch and the service is thorough and efficient (not too many "is everything ok"). I will surely be back with out of towners for football. I definitely recommend this place for everything from family night, dates, meeting some buds, or alone time having a beer and catching up on thoughts.
We had a large family pre-Christmas party and ordered several pizzas and the Italian Cobb salad.  Everybody loved it.  Though the Cobb salad didn't have egg for some reason.

In Chicago for flight so stayed overnight in Mt. Prospect. Ordered from Morettis and were bowled over with the delicious food! Rosemary Chichen, delicious. Garlic Shrimp delicious, minestrone, same, calamari fritti, same, and the Parmesan crusted salmon was out out of this world. Even got ice cream with the fantastic apple tarts. All delivered. wee bit early on Super Bowl night for a very reasonable price. Have never done better. Flying home thru Chicago and will order from them again.

love this place!!!!
they have great pizza, great staff that always help us when we call for delivery, the delivery guys know us.
food is always fresh, if we ask to over cook they will.

love the thin crust, nice n crispy

Best BBQ Chicken Pizza i've ever tasted....enough said!

Actually, they have really good burgers too!  The inside feels cozy and the staff is ultra friendly!  They practically know my co-workers as we always go there to cater our food for parties!

I am a long time fan of Moretti's, both the Edison park and Mt. Prospect locations. However, our last visit to the Mt. Prospect Moretti's was sadly disappointing. 

It was a weeknight around 5:30 PM when we arrived and despite standing at the hostess station for at least three minutes, no one ventured up to greet us. After going to the bar and requesting to be seated, the bartender was able to flag down a passing waiter who ended up being our server. A nice guy, I don't remember his name, but he was pleasant enough. After getting our drinks for us, we ordered our food. The deep fried coconut onion rings were spectacular, but my wife's pasta entree arrived without the chicken it was supposed to have. Odd, since it was one of their signature dishes. I waited patiently while the kitchen fixed up her plate, but it wasn't too long. We had to ask for bread with our meal, something that should have automatically been offered up along with the water we had to ask for as well.

Onto dinner. Everything is tasty, and the special I ordered is quite good. And that's the problem with Moretti's. The food is always good, but the weak service and little things that get overlooked tend to distract from the overall dining experience. Sorry guys, if you want more than two stars, you'll have to do better.

While I thought the food was great, the service just made it not worth ordering from them ever.  I ordered for food to be delivered, requested that buffalo wings to be served mild because a child will be eating it.  Reiterated, a child will be eating the wings please make sure you note that it's mild.  ordered tiramisu with my order, which arrived 10 minutes after all my food were delivered that were 10 minutes late.  In other words it was delivered at separate times.  Then i called to complain about the wings, and hostess Nadia's exact statement were, "i'm sorry about that, not sure what i can do now" Instead of suggesting a solution, it was more of can I get off the phone now? So I realize she's not a decision maker, nor is she credible enough to make that decision, I requested to speak with the manager Charlie.  Who was nice enough to give me a credit of 25.00 from my 61.00 order.  I thought, okay they're redeeming themselves, but when I checked on my bank account this morning I see not one 61.00 charge but 2 charges of 61.00 + instead of giving me a credit they charged my account 34! So do the math, I was charged 156 total!!! All the 5 stars may have been just the food, because I admit they were good.  But the people, well, not sure how they can redeem themselves with this...but i am planning on contacting they're bosses bosses, because taking my money so fast within seconds is not right, and returning it after 72 hours makes it wrong.

I ordered a cheese thin crust pizza for delivery . When it arrived an hour later it was lukewarm and over cooked. The cheese was very thin and brown. The crust was dark brown. There was only a scant amount of sauce. Overall, it tasted like it was made hours earlier and reheated. YUK! .

I have to say that the store contacted me today with an apology and offer to make it right. You can't ask for more than that. They may have had a bad night.
Feels like home.....this what the staff will treat you here. Very friendly and entertaining ambiance. Food is ok and always have a great deal everyday....
The food is ok. The wraps are a safe bet. However the service is slow. Would recommend for take out or delivery.

Went to this place last night to watch the Bears game.  I actually like the big screen TV's everywhere! It's a great place to watch sports and their thin crust pizza was pretty good. 

 I also liked their bucket of beers deal for $10! The Dj was fun, they had prizes every quarter.  This place is good anyone 21+ Will be back to try other menu items or to watch another game, hopefully when the Bears start winning.
Here with some sister wives. Pizza is good. A lot of seating for parties and nice size bar. And all four of my girls look hot tonight...

My supervisor and I stopped in for the first time from our lunch at a corporate office nearby and we were very disappointed. When we first walked in, we waited for about 5 minutes before we were acknowledged by the staff. The person who finally seated us offered a table at the back of the restaurant when most people were being seated at the front so we asked to be seated at a booth in the front instead. The booth had no condiments or lunch offering signage so I took the initiative to take it from the booth behind us. It took about another five minutes before our server decided to make an appearance and ask us if we'd like drinks. We advised her that yes, we would like drinks and that we are also ready to order. We ordered the baked Rigatoni and when the server brought it to us, we were appalled by the small portion and bare meal. The server noticed the expression on our faces and asked if we needed anything else so we asked "Does bread come with this?" She said "sure" and brought a loaf of bread. I did notice that other tables were being readily served with loafs of bread. So, I tried to rationalize with supervisor suggesting that this small portion of pasta and bare meal may be a lunch portion for $7. Well, our meal turned out to be $16 each and to be courteous, we left a 20% gratuity. Paying $20 each for a small portion pasta dish with unsatisfactory service left a really bad first impression. It is highly unlikely that we will ever return to this restaurant. Moreover, we will advise our fellow associates, family and friends against them making the same mistake.

As soon as we walked in, I knew we had made a mistake. I could kick myself for falling for the ads/restaurant pictures, but being relatively new to the area, who knew? 

I was expecting a "nicer" restaurant. If you are looking for a fun place to watch "the game," or a casual night out, then you would be in luck! Otherwise, keep the prom dress at home!

We were seated in a booth underneath a HUGE screen that I could have sworn, said "Property of AMC Theaters" on the back, as it was immense. I like the Cubs, but not when they are overlooking my salad and bread sticks! We asked to be moved, and all got alittle better...until... the waitress was asked about their wine list, and the response was a very limp, "this is my first night," with no effort to find someone to help her with the question. 

Fast forward.. the menu was ok. I split a 12 '' pizza with a family member (good enough for 2 people, pushing it for 3 people). Another family member had spaghetti/sausage. 

The service from the other staff members was good (our waitress's trainer came over to check on us).

The atmosphere was lively for a Friday night. Again, a fun place for a casual evening. TV"s were all over the place, and there was ample parking.

Terrible food, terrible service, terrible music.  
A group of us went on a Friday night, there was a cabaret singer (a very bad one) that had the place mostly cleared out, but it still took over half an hour each time we ordered drinks, over a hour for buffalo wings, and when the dinner orders FINALLY came one was completey wrong.  I asked for silverware and got a cup full of knives.  
DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY!!!

This location does not represent the Moretti's brand very well. I have been here 3 times now and every time the service has been really bad, there was no one at the host stand to seat us, the servers are inexperienced and all males. They have plenty of TV's to watch sports and such but something is just off about the place. I'll go to the Schaumburg location before I go to this one even though this location is closer for me.
I liked it better as Famous Freddies, but the food isn't bad, and it's right across the street from my apartment.

Up until recently I'd only always had their pizza, which I adore when I'm in the mood for Morettis. On this most recent trip to their Mt Prospect location I grabbed a late night meal with my buddy, who's a pasta fiend. That night they had  1/2 off pizzas, hungry from a long night of work we got Buffalo wings, the Italian trio (which includes Lasagna, Chicken Parmesan and Linguine Alfredo) and a Tuscan Veg pizza. Good thing I had Oogie S. with me, he can pack food away easily. The wings could've used more buffalo sauce, a few drops drizzled over wings which were prepared quite nicely. The Italian trio was tasty and a great deal of food which could easily be shared by two as a meal. I was told that the Tuscan vegetarian pizza had a spicy flavor to it, which to me didn't, maybe to others. It was a good vegetarian option and the vine-ripe tomatoes were flavorful which complimented the pie. Business was dismal at that time of night so service was nearby. This location has nightly food and alcohol specials as well as live entertainment. Check their website for details.

We walked up to the hostess station and up walked a person who worked there. She  then proceeded to turn her back on us and start entering in things on the computer.  After she was done (about 5 minutes later) she WALKED AWAY!!  I was almost like OK let's leave.  So then I made eye contact with another waitress and she politely came over and seated us.  I explained what just happened and she apologized.  We were seated and then approached by the woman who ignored us initially to take our order.  GREAT..... so it goes. We order.  He got the turkey club avocado and I got the Italian Cobb salad.  We also got the onion rings.  Food was good...server...not so much.    She walked by us twice after getting our food and didn't even acknowledge or ask us how our food was until the 3rd time by.  We had to ask for boxes and the check.  Our server also served as bartender.  Note to owner-Hire a Hostess and Bartender for lunch and realize that people have a hour for lunch, AKA get in and out quickly.
I haven't Atr in the restraint but have had it delivered several times and yum.  We order the appetizer combo and. A pizza and it was delicious and delivered hot

Must say we like this place.  Something a little different with pizza, pasta, burgers or salads.  Nothing fancy but good food and our server was tremendous.  Fun for the kids because they have a "make your own pizza".  They bring out the crust, sauce and cheese and your kids can build there own (kitchen will add the meat if wished).  All in all good place.

Ive been to this location more times than i shouldve. I think the one time i was satisfied with my experience was the very first time we went. GREAT food every time we go. The Parmesan Breadsticks are wonderful and the pizza is always good. That being said you might as well order it to go because once youre seated youll wait too long to have your order taken and you better plan on telling him or her everything you want for the night because you wont see them again until they bring the check. Make sure tables around you have extra napkins, plates, and silverware because youll have to take it off of those empty tables.

I went with a fellow bartender to meet some other industry folks and was incredibly unhappy with my overall experience.  As someone who has worked in service, I understand that things happen and when the place gets busy, the staff can't always be completely on top of it, but our server failed to recognize that my friend and I had joined up with the other 5 people already sitting there for about 10 minutes.  I let it slide, as it was busy.  But when she forgot to bring our beers, I was disappointed.  She apologized and said she would get a round and took our order.  When our pizza came, I saw out of the corner of my eye some movement - which turned out to be a mouse.  My friend jumped up on her chair, which caught our server's attention.  She came over and I let her know that the mouse had gone back toward the kitchen.  She looked far too nonplussed but still brought a manager over.  I'm not sure if it was because we were all still in our bartending garb, but he actually made a joke about 'guessing it's time to call an exterminator'.  Not really funny, dude.  When the bill came, the manager didn't comp a thing, even the drinks our server had said she would.  So much for at least trying to keep us happy.

Since Wapaghetti's moved out of the area, we have been searching for a great pizza place and this it!!  Tried the pizza last Saturday and just loved it.  Then went to a graduation party they catered the next day.  Italian sausage, beef, lasagna, everything was delicious.  I may never cook for a big party again.

Owner/operator, Art is always cheerful and accommodating. He recognizes and acknowledges his customers.  Thank you, Art, for providing the BEST pizza, Italian food and service around!

Everyone needs to try this place.

My Family and I love this place. We have been ordering from here for a long time. The pizza is always perfect. The staff makes me a buffalo wrap minus the wrap, which is AMAZING!!! The staff is friendly and the deliveries are always on time. I highly recommend this place. Great food, Great Service, what more can you ask for!

I have been ordering stuffed pizzas (usually sausage and jalapeño) from Tre Amici for 6 years. Dinner guests consistently rave about them. As a bonus, Arthur, the owner, is a solid guy with great character.

We have used Tre Amici in the past for work events in our department and today we catered a baby shower for a co-worker and I just wanted to leave a review saying that the food was delicious, arrived on time, and we got everything that we ordered the way it was promised.  Not to mention Arthur was accommodating and very thorough.  We saved the menu and will be calling them again in the future.  They really set the bar for customer service with me. 

Thanks!

The saddest thing about me moving from Palatine to McHenry may be that I rarely ever get to eat this delicious pizza nowadays. 

Great service, friendly people, excellent food. I mean all of it. Some pizza places you wanna stay away from the wings and other such things. Not the case here. Their wings are fantastic. The Bruschetta is also really fresh and delicious. 

Can't say enough about this little slive of greatness.
Love their double crust!  If you like thick bready crusts you will not be disappointed.  Get it pie cut for the best experience.

After my pizza was delivered to me ice cold and slid the one side I called and asked to speak to a manager the manager that was there n explain to me that he wasn't working. The manager was out delivering pizzas and that he was the one that delivered my pizza. No one bothered to even contact me back. After I contacted them the next day because I never heard from anyone, I  talked to the owner the owner said that there really wasn't much he could do but offer me a partial credit after I insisted something be done.
Hands down the best pizza in Palatine. I'd put their double dough sausage against anyone's sausage pizza! Great service, great food, great people!

Great food from Tre Amici!!! We love the thin crust pizzas (especially the Fab Four) and always use the catering for our family functions. The food is excellent and very friendly people who work there. Friends of ours have started to go there too. We have used the catering menu from here for many of our family gatherings. The food on the catering menu is excellent and you cannot beat the lasagna as it is really stuffed with ingredients.

Moved to Palatine in 2006. First thing we always do is try all the pizza places in the area. Tre Amichi is by FAR the best! NEVER disappointed.  Art is a super nice guy. Never had a bad experience there. I am never not in the mood for one of there Pizzas.

First time trying Tri Amici and used their delivery option. Ordered their cheesy beef pizza. It arrived hot which was nice. But the pizza itself was not very good. The crust was doughy not crisp like you expect for a thin crust. Also both myself and wife had upset stomachs within 30 minutes of eating it. Although this was the first time ordering from here, it will be the last.
Try the white pizza my husband raves about it! My favorite  is  the  stuffed! Owners and employees  are the best ! Thanks for the great food and service!
The white pizza with double crust is delicious. Pizza was nice and hot when it got here.

Tre Amici is close to my heart. Well, it's also close to my house. Well, it's also in the same location I worked in high school, when it was a difference pizza joint. See what I mean? Close to my heart. Exactly.

The pizza by the slice is still around, and it's still fantastic. I've since moved to Dallas, where pizza isn't anywhere near the caliber of Chicago, and upon returning to visit, I stopped in to say hello. I bought two slices to go and they remembered me!

They have excellent pasta and salads (their antipasto salad is still one of my all-time favorites) too. My family likes the baked ziti and I love the mostaccioli. I think it's the sauce that does it for me here. Other places just don't have it. Super friendly, fast delivery, and excellent food. 

If you're looking for something more than carry out, you can check out their restaurant location in Elk Grove off Nerge and Meacham.

Wowza!  Best pizza in Palatine!  Being a pizza snob, I researched this place too before I ordered it.  I'm so glad I ordered it one day for lunch a few weeks back, because it exceeded my expectations!  Since it was so good, I ordered catering for a business meeting of thin crust pizzas, salad, and brownies.  All 15 people loved everything!  I am definitely a long-term customer!  I talked with the owner, Arthur, a couple times too, and he was very pleasant, helpful, made sure everything was perfect, and cared about me as a customer.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

...Another fine restaurant in my SIster's neighborhood... We ordered the Poppers for me, 1/2 cheese, 1/2 pepperoni thin & crispy for her kids. 

I don't know why but the Poppers are always better when they come from a pizza joint. The pepperoni has a kick to them but no heartburn this evening! The crust was just the way we like it and no one gets the cheese wrong. 

We ordered a medium. Between 2 kids and me, there are only 4 slices left! This is pretty good tasting pizza. I'm impressed. I understand why my Sister recommends this place. The kids especially love it!
The pizza is fantastic and the service is exceptional!  The staff is always accommodating and know how to make a great pie!!

Website menu does not list prices. 12" Thin Bacon and Garlic pizza delivered cost ... $18 +tip. Biggest gripe was that Pizza contained 1-2 strips of Bacon total and a single garlic cove. Really? 

Beyond Stingy and a terrible value for the cost.

Hello!  6 stars for their Italian Beef!  Seriously wicked delicious.  When I came back to visit family I needed my Beef fix and we ordered from here.  Lordy, next time I will ask them to just give me a vat of the beef with the juice and gardineiras (sp?) to eat.

I wonder if they can deliver to Miami?

This place is a life saver, in the winter time we hunker down to watch games and we can always count on them to deliver mighty good pizza, pasta or sandwiches. 

In the summer, after riding the Palatine Trail, or Deer grove, nothing hits the spot more than a large peperoni pizza and a six pack of beer. 

Spring and fall, are just as good ! A place for all seasons, Tre Amici is your friend in the Northwest Suburbs.

I had Tre Amici's thin crust for the first time the other day and I was pretty impressed. Not a whole lot of thin crust stands out for me, but this place is tops. 

I saw that someone commented about the sauce at being "bland" and I have to disagree. I was actually a little surprised at how good I thought it was. It's not your typical pizza sauce, to be sure. It has almost more of a pasta sauce taste, but I really liked it. Their crust is thin and perfectly crisp. And the other thing I liked a lot was that I could taste traces of basil in the pizza (maybe in the sauce?) The sausage and mushrooms were lovely and more flavorful than I've had anywhere else. 

As far as thin crust goes, this place has definitely jumped to the top of my list. It actually might be the best thin crust I've ever had. Can't wait to try some of their specialty pizzas.
Had a delivery, which was prompt. Thin crust pizza was delivered, price was right, pizza was great!
Outstanding pizza. Great crust and they don't skimp on toppings!!! Garlic bread was a bit of a disappointment but I will let it slide since pizza did exceed my expectations.

My three friends, I would totally give you 5 stars if you didn't charge extra cheese as a double ingredient. This is my only complaint about you. By all means, charge it as an extra ingredient, but really? An extra-double-ingredient-cheese-charge is excessive to me. 

Other than that, I've been ordering from them for years now (so obviously they are that good or else I wouldn't order just on the point above alone).
Their pizza has an almost perfect thin crust that's not too doughy but doesn't taste like cardboard either. They've got great sauce that is at a perfect ratio to the cheese and toppings. It's just greasy enough without being too greasy where you have to soak it up with a napkin. I've never had a bad pizza from here. The delivery is super-fast and the pizza is nice and hot, which is always a plus in my book.

If you like spinach on your pizza, you'll love theirs. Yes, another double ingredient charge, but this time it is understandable and totally worth it (I am not an unreasonable woman). You see, it has somehow been sauted or otherwise infused with garlic. So as much as I resent certain excessive-cheese-charges, they will always have me at garlicky spinach. Just amazing.

Tre Amici has the best thin crust pizza in town, the exact right amount of cheese, for my taste, and a crispy crust. For Chicago style, go to Lou Malnati's or Gino's East, but for thin crust, this place is it.
Loved the "Chicago Style" pizza.  The buttery crust is awesome.  Add some Meatballs and Mushrooms and what a meal!  Try it out. You won't go wrong.

Hands down the best thin crust pizza in both Schaumburg and Palatine areas. Our favorites are the extra thin crust mushroom or sausage mushroom. Crispy thin crust, perfect amount of cheese and always tasty and fresh ingredients. Definitely worth a visit!

We have been ordering from here since before they changed their name, and I can say not much has changed but the name(s).  We really love their pizza, but they also have other good food.  Their Grinder (whatever it's called now) is great.  I would say we order from here at least 2-3 times a month and have never been disappointed.  It is great to have such a good establishment close by, somewhere you can count on consistency and customer appreciation!

O-M-G on their thin crust pizza! I had their veg out pizza with spinach, mushrooms and green peppers and this is definitely the very best thin crust pizza I have had in the suburbs and possibly in my lifetime and that's saying a lot  because I have consumed from many different pizza places on a quest to find the best.  I have definitely found the best thin crust and I would imagine that their other pizzas are just as fantastic.  Crust was perfect and sauce had just the right amount of spice and flavor.  I've tried the other highly rated pizzas in the area and NONE compare to Tre Amici!  Thank you to the others who rated this highly which is what enticed me to try it.  I hope others will now try it too.

My personal favorite slice of pizza in Palatine.  I like the double dough crust, chewy and hearty.  I'm a pepperoni fan, but really like the sauage here.  They pile on the cheese.  Great pizza and sandwich place, always good and always friendly.

In making the Palatine/NW burbs lunching tour, Tre Amici ranks as a decent pizza joint.  Their quality is pretty high and the crust/dough, while a bit thick for my taste, is actually pretty tasty and I can only assume the niche they're aiming for.  Nice cheese and sauce balance and overall they seem to know how to make a good pie. I think the place is carryout/delivery only?

I believe this place is take-out and delivery only but it's really great! My favorite is the stuffed pizza with green peppers. And everyone is so nice! The service is really wonderful and I've never had to wait too long for my meal. They are always very nice and get my order right every time! The menu has a lot to choose from so it's great for everyone and all the food I've had from here has been PHENOMENAL! I'm very picky when it comes to my Chicago pizzas but this place is one of my favorites!
I don't eat pizza as often as I'd like any more, but when I do, I go to Tres Amici.  I love the food and I love the way the place feels like a family business.

Great Bar. Excellent experience on my 1st time there. I will be back. 
If your into horseracing and betting this is the spot. OTB. I wish I knew more about it and honestly interested on learning about it. Great beer on tap. Nice bartenders and attentive. Good food at amazing prices. 
If your a mature person you will enjoy it.

I went here for a Sunday Funday birthday party this past weekend with a group of about 20 people. There were a few other tables scattered, but they placed our group in the back so we'd have some privacy. I wasn't drinking so I can't vouch for their drinks or beer, but their cheese pizza was pleasantly surprising! I ended up eating more than I care to admit. Bonus: On Sundays, their food special is $10 cheese pizzas! I also ended up getting the nachos later on, which were FULLY loaded and only $10. Definitely a great value. My boyfriend and I barely made a dent in them. Also on special were $15 beer towers. Service was great and TVs were plentiful. I'd recommend this place!

Love this place 100%! Been finding myself coming here once a week lately. The $3 any beer on tap special on Wednesdays is awesome. The service is great, very polite and always on top of their game. Food isn't too bad either. Plenty of food and drink specials throughout the whole week as well. TV's everywhere, pool tables, darts, it's a great time! Check it out.

This place was horrible. I really wanted to like it but everyone in my group hated the experience. I was under the impression it was a sports bar. Sports memorabilia everywhere, huge flat screen TVs, pool tables and everything else yet on football Sundays they don't play the sound on the football games. Instead, I had to listen to Justin Bieber playing on the Jukebox. Makes sense. 

On to the food...
I had a group of 5 and we ordered appetizers and a pizza. Our appetizers came out fairly quickly and were tasty. Our pizza literally took an hour and a half to come out. After 40 minutes we flagged down the waitress and asked her about the pizza. She said oh yeah, your sausage pizza I'll check on that. We said no, the pepperoni we ordered. She said oh yeah, that's what I meant. Never a sorry or anything. 40 minutes after that it came out and looked like a frozen tombstone pizza. We all sat there and looked at it like seriously, this is what we waited an hour and a half for? 

On to the beer...
When we got to the bar we all sat down at a table and ordered a table tapper. After 15 minutes of not seeing the waitress again we finally saw her and asked her where our beer was. She said oh yeah, they're changing the keg. 15 minutes later we finally got it. Apparently takes that long for them to change a keg. 

This place just sucks. Service is horrible, food is bad. We were a table of 5. 4 of whom are in the restaurant industry and are usually forgiving with some things but this was just bad.

To top it off, waitress did not apologize one time about the 30 minute wait for beer or hour and a half wait for frozen pizza. 

Take your business elsewhere.

I ended up hitting crazy pour alone on a late night. I made the mistake of thinking because they had a $10 large pizza offer from 10pm to 12am the kitchen would be open.  The 160 TV's is crazy but not really a big deal.  As it's a really large area. (bar, video poker room, 2 patios, OTB area with another bar and the large pool and dining area.) Some of those TV's are dedicated to the OTB (off track betting) part of this place. 

I take it on game nights and weekends this place is packed but wasn't so when I got in. So slow my waiter was playing darts with a few co workers in the inside patio behind the main bar.

Lots of option for drafts/bottles and wine. Pizza was okay. I was asked did I want thin crust pizza but didn't taste thin at all. Pizza wasn't the "worst" but I wouldn't order it again. The bar food is what I was looking to try out. Speaking to my waiter she mentioned the panini sandwich's is usually what she eats the most here but do enjoy the wings as well. 

From a guy prospective it really is a nice chil and hang out spot to come to and will visit again just hope the bar food items are much better than the pizza I had.

Awesome food.Great selection of beer and ciders. Friendly staff. Fair prices and good specials. Fun atmosphere to catch a game. If we lived closer it would be a regular haunt. Do yourself a favor and get the Arancini with extra vodka sauce. Yes it's that delicious.

Not only is the food top notch (panzerotti was what i had ) but the service was even better.  My server Samantha knew all the specials and had recommendations for me that were spot on.  She made sure i was good the entire time i was there. Her beautiful smile was infectious and set the tone for a great ending to a long stressful day at work.  Thank you so much

I cant believe its taken me so long to write a reciew for this place! On my top 5 places to go this is one of them!! Huge Huge Huge fan of their pizza & Vodka pasta! Great place for groups! The have 2 huge projectors against the wall for game nights! They have the cutest outdoor patio with a fireplace! Wide variety of beer & drinks! Great weekday specials too! Highly recomend this place.

Stopped in here because Wildfire was packed., first appearance was promising, outdoor patio was packed and the place seemed lively. The restaurant was full so we went to the bar section which was partially reserved~ so we had to stand and wait for chairs to open. The menu didn't really appeal to us, so we opted for a couple of drinks instead.. prices are average or on par with wildfire., so instead of staying we left and went to wildfire.

The food has always been good here, which we like to enjoy while watching the Hawks play. however, last night, they were not very accommodating  when we asked them to turn on the Hawks pregame,  We were in the main dining room and all four large screens were turned to boxing and the UFC.  There were two birthday parties going on as well, that took up most of the area, and no one appeared to be watching any of that,  The  one "manager" did turn on one large screen and two much smaller screens that were a minimum of 15 feet away. There were no TV's tuned to the game in the bar, even though, like the dining room, there was a great number of  people wearing Hawks gear. Just as the game started, they switched off the audio portion and went back to the UFC/   Highly disappointed  as  we have gone to Crazy Pour several times in the past to eat and catch the game.   We paid our bill and walked out.  Note, we have stopped going to other places that have done the same thing, all the while claiming to be Hawks bar.

Not too shabby at all! I didn't know what to expect, but my friends had come here before and said it was a good time.

Our usual bar that we go to didn't have any free table for the Blackhawks game, so we came here instead. We were seated right away (it's a big place with plenty of seats), and immediately noticed how many beers they had and a wide food selection. They had a $3 special for any of the beer drafts, which is in same cases a steal for a bar. The service was pretty decent all night, it was very busy so not perfect, but understandable. They have a lot of TVs and big screens throughout the whole bar, so you can see a game from pretty much any angle. 

As far as food goes, we ordered the pretzel bites, which were good. I eventually ordered the pulled pork sandwich. It was good, I wish there was a little more sauce, but still a good sandwich. The only other complaint I have is the cushions in the booths are not very comfortable - you sink into the seat way too much. Both my friend and I agreed, so we switched to a table which was better.

The manager talked to us about 3 times and made sure everything went well and that we were happy. I saw him making rounds throughout the night. That was impressive to me, you don't see that everywhere.

I feel bad for giving this place the review I did after my recent visit. The service is much better here and the food is still good. A manager of some sort actually contacted me after I posted my previous review and tried to rectify the situation but I never gave it another chance. We will definitely be returning!

TOTALLY disappointed in the service we received  from the hostess Olivia and our server Dana. This was our very first time at Crazy Pours. We walked in no one greet us, which was understandable due to it was a Full house. We were able to find seating on our own. When we saw our server we asked if we could or drinks. She was very rude and instead of taking our order she asked.."HOW DID YOU GUYS GET HERE" next was the hostess Olivia slamming  menus on the table and waving a list. 
We finally got our drinks and the server give us the check at the same time. SO RUDE.. you would think we would order more drinks?? So we ask for the manager.. we get a guy stating he is the owner.. Ops so we explain that this is our first visit and the rude service we got. All he said is ill take care of the drinks. Really?? What about the poor service?  We left our drinks and walked out. Went to Real Time in Elk Grove Village..

This commotion was due to a waiting list that was never explained to us.

After some co-workers told me about this place, my friend and I decided to meet up after work to celebrate our little christmas together over some drinks and food. We arrived around 5:30 on a Thursday night and the place was pretty busy by the bar. We were greated by Michelle and she was great, she ended up being our waitress. She went over all the specials and told us that we had about 20 minutes to order something for Happy Hour. She even let us try some samples of beer before ordering them. Her service was very good, very friendly, attentive and just over all made the experience what is was. Very good!
I ordered the Thursday Burger special for $6, burgers came on a pretzel bun, and I didn't want the fries, so I was able to substitute a side salad, and that was filling in itself.
At the end of our meal, we took a quick survey and were given a $5 off our next visit. 
I live in Villa Park and it took me almost the entire 2 years they have been open to come here. I will definitely be back! This place was good for a group, drink night, or any Chicago Bears or Hawks Game! 
They also had a fire going outside on the patio, but it was in the 30's that night so we didn't go out there, but I could see on a fall night, going and checking this place out with a nice cold beer!

For a sports bar in the burbs, it does its job well. Decent sized beer list, decent service, decent food, and an amazing array of TVs both personal and big screen.
Come here for a Hawks game (celebrate each goal with authentic fog horn, red police lights, and Chelsea Dagger) or just for a night out.

Checked this place out this weekend and I am so glad we did. The place is pretty big, its clean, there's many tvs, they have pool tables, OTB in the back, a room with gambling machines, a patio with a fireplace, and a very nice selection of beers. 
We got there fairly early in the day and there weren't many people there. That changed quickly though. I loved our bartender, Julia, she was friendly, professional and very knowledgable, that girl knows her drinks. I also liked that she made us newbies feel like regulars. I have to say that she knew almost everyone by name. I was impressed. After hours of drinking we ordered a pizza and it was good. The menu has a lot go choose from and they have specials everday. I have found my new favorite spot. Great beer selection, fun atmosphere and great service.

Average food. Bad Cajun fries (really over seasoned). Decent atmosphere. Pretty big screens for sports.

I'm not from the area. Just tried it because of the 4 star review on yelp.

I had my son gratulation party and my nephew birthday party here. The service was great. Noelle and Rob did an awesome job. They were very attentive to what we wanted and the food was great. Thank you for the great job.

Let me just say this, I was extremely impressed with crazy pour. I thought it was going to be this craft beer little place, was I wrong. Not only are the employees of crazy pour awesome but so is the management. My best friend wanted to throw his wife a surprise party there but didn't call to reserve a table, so I called 2 days before the party to reserve a couple of tables, I kinda figured that I wasn't going to be able to get a table let alone room for 20 people. I talked to the manager and he was more than accommodating. He went out of his way to make sure we had a table on what was going to be one of the busiest nights. I am extremely thankful for the crazy pour staff and management. I would extremely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good time tons of TVs good drink and food specials awesome place.
Great place to go for some beers and appetizers. Also had a ton of tvs so you could watch any sport you could imagine.

Free WiFi from the off track bet next door, and happening daily specials, Wednesday featured $3 drafts and $6 pulled pork sandwhich with fries. What's not to like?! The atmosphere is very much sports bar, plenty of room to toss em back with your friends. I wish I had one of these in my neighborhood. Most everything on the menu is under $10 so not going to break your bank and the bar tender was very friendly. What are you waiting for? Go get your pour on!

The fact that Crazy Pour is only 10 minutes from my house already makes it awesome. This place is pretty big with plenty of indoor seating and pool tables and they also have outdoor seating and outdoor TVs! Their food is pretty good and they have great daily specials: Monday - $0.50 jumbo wings and Wednesday - $3 ANY draft! Those are really the only two days of specials I know because those are typically the days we go to Crazy Pour. When I had the honey bbq jumbo wings I thought they were delicious and a big size, after 5 wings with some celery and carrots I was pretty full. Their sweet potato fries is a MUST, fried to perfection and delicious sweet! They play all Hawks games with sound and even have a horn for every time the Hawks score, it's pretty loud so brace yourself! Definitely fun times here.
What an awesome experience.  The food is great and the manager checked on every customer.  $3 dollar drafts on Thursday. Cold beer and great customer service.  Can't go wrong with this spot!
Went there for dinner and what comes to mind first is PUTRID at best.  Beer is warm, over priced and lines have not been cleaned in some time because it smelled

Ordered panzarotti was super soggy like wet paper don't recommend. Can't reserve table unless every single person is there to fill up seat. If a single seat is open prepare to stand looking at a table that could be yours.

This is a wonderful place! I bring my 11 year old son in to watch games and we sit and enjoy! Most places wouldn't let a dad and son go into a place like this but they are all about family!  They even have my son a Blackhawks history book! And gave him raffle tickets for the jersey even though he doesn't drink! They keep are arnold Palmers flowing and my son looks forward to hanging out there. All the waitress come by and talk to us and management treats him like the king of the crazy pour! 

The wings are awesome and so is the service! When I go to crazy pour I feel like part of the crew! And they know how to make it a "family" place when kids are there! Keep up the good work guys and you will be top place around in no time at all!

Bought tickets for the comedy show last night. Good time! Food was late, so they added pizzas to the menu. That was cool. The comics were funny. Totally recommend it if they do it again. Nice room, would like to rent it for a private party.

FUN bar. Huge seating and bar area with lots of TVs to watch the games. There are also pool tables and darts- a true sports bar. There is a sectioned off back area that features the OTB. Their draft list is elevated from the norm- I had Pumpking on tap, which I hadn't ever seen before (and it's the best pumpkin beer around!).

We ordered the nachos app to start, which was loaded with meat, cheese, beans, and had sour cream/guac on the side. The chips were super fried and had a little bit of a donut aftertaste due to the frying, so I didn't like those as much. The flavor of the toppings was awesome though, with quality ingredients. I actually went back to the nachos during my dinner portion- I couldn't stop thinking about them while I ate!

I also ordered one of their burgers and fries to eat (Don't judge me on this mounting calorie count!). The burger was flavorful, cooked as I requested and large. I took half home and could not wait to eat the rest the next morning! (You should really try dinner for breakfast, it'll change your life!)

I would not hesitate to return for a game, a date... anything!

Great atmosphere!  

We stopped by last night to meet up some friends I was really impressed with the setting. I have been there for lunch but the night time crowd is definitely a fun place to be. If your planning on watching a game or a fight they have tvs all over so you will not miss out on any of the action.  I also like the fact that they had a dj there playing  some of my favorite old school songs.

They have a game room with slot machine access at any time and people actually rotate so you really are not standing around waiting for a machine to open up. 

I really like the the crowd they have there it's a fun atmosphere with a large banquet  area I seen when I got lost going go the bathroom,which I have to say they keep really clean being a guys kind of place.  

The food selection is perfect  for that venue. Parking is all over this us definitely a place to chill out with friends or family.  I'm for sure going to be returning top this venue.

We've only been here plenty of times at night which is a blast... but decided to check out the breakfast this morning. Until the end of September they have buy one get one free breakfast! (Ends at 10am) it was delicious and everyone was very friendly and accommodating. Will definitely be back morning OR night!

Great food, awesome service, and cool people.  Jessica is the shit and did a fantastic job for us.

They even have not your father's root beer!

Came here once and was very surprised. You guys have a great selection of beer and the food is very good. You have an entire room dedicated to slots and an entire room for horse gambling and an entire room for private parties. The main area is all voluted ceilings with brand new arcade games, pool table and darts! This is what I call an any age bar. Unfortunately your dominant customers are the bikers and the gamblers but I'm sure in time the crowd will diversify, I hope lol. One thing I don't like though is you only have female bartenders. The new hire is also female but at least she's not caucasian. Firm believer in diversity, especially when I'm at the bar. Ps upon going my second time aka last week, the bartender remembered my name. Props! 

Bathrooms: Fantastic 
Service: Great
Atmosphere: New
Specials: 1/2 prices appetizers during happy hour. +daily drink specials

Love the food- great clams, amazing panzerotti in vodka sauce, and obvi pretzel bites!  

Julia is a great bartender!  Fun, crazy, and personable! Fun place!

I had my fiancé' birthday here. They were so flexible, friendly and organized! The food was really great. Our Server, I think her name was Stacey, she was ridiculously amazing. I was really glad we went here, and will be returning. Place was clean, staff was prompt! Thanks for the great experience Crazy Pour!

If you're looking for Sports Bar with decent food, a ridiculous variety of drinks and an exceptionally friendly staff than you have struck gold at Crazy Pour.

Food-wise I would recommend the Crazy Pour Burger. We're talking crispy slices of bacon stacked on an over-medium fried egg a-top of a thick juicy patty prepped to your liking. By the time you finish this monster (along-side with the fries that accompany it) you feel like you've been feasting for days. My girl says the hot-wings are phenomenal, and if you're in the sharing mood...order the giant pretzel..its obnoxiously big.

Drinks are great. The Hard Rootbeer is my personal fav. But if you're a snob for craft beers, then you've probably died and gone to heaven coming here. Drinks and food are reasonably priced. 

Atmosphere is clean, staff is friendly and the crowd seems pretty mixed in terms of age & race, so you get a pretty good social variety here. They have a Live DJ on the weekends and a gaming room with slot machines for those individuals who like to dance with lady luck. Overall, a great place that won't disappoint. When this place packs up...it comes alive quickly.

Let's call this a 3.5 star place. I was reading the Daily Herald and saw that one of their writers did a write-up on Crazy Pour, which is what first alerted me to this place even existing. Apparently it opened in September, but seeing as there isn't much on North Ave, I never saw it. Actually, you might miss it as you drive down North Ave. It's right next door to AutoZone, FYI.

My bf and I were looking for a place to watch the NFL conference finals and decided to check this place out. If you're looking for a Blackhawks bar, this would definitely be the place to be. We walked in just as the Hawks scored a goal, and off goes the foghorn, which scared the crap out of me. It's super loud, but I guess that means they do a good job of making you feel like you're at the game without having to sell your soul for tickets. There are tons of TVs and projection screens. Everywhere you turn, you'll catch the game. THey also have a sports ticker behind the bar, which is cool. No more squinting to see the bottom line on ESPN!

This isn't just a hole in the wall sports bar, though. It's pretty nice on the inside, though I could do without the pick-up lines WordArt in the bathroom ("Was it love at first sight or should I walk by again." Really?). They don't have a ton in terms of food. They have pizzas which looked pretty good judging by the people we saw who ordered it, and the burgers sounded good too. We both went for a panini and ordered some beer. They need to update that beer list, though, because every time we asked for a beer, they didn't have it. We had to keep looking back at the tap handles to figure out what to get.

Our food took a while to get to us, which was surprising considering there weren't many people there. I didn't mind too much since we were watching the game and having a beer, but I was hungry, so it was a bit noticeable. I wasn't too impressed with the food. They really shouldn't call it a panini. It was more of a hot sandwich. I'm not a sandwich snob by any means, but I do frequent Panera and I watch a lot of Chopped, so I know what the frick a panini is and this was not it. It was grilled cheese with bacon. And in fact, I could probably make a better one at home. The fries were meh. I would prefer fresh cut. 

Food aside, the atmosphere here is cool and great for a game. They also have off track betting and a video gambling room off to the side. I'll probably be back when I'm in the mood to watch a game, but I'll definitely be trying something other than the "panini" and I hope they update their beer list by then.

Been coming here since they opened.  The owners know what they're doing: fresh food, nice portions, friendly staff, and great atmosphere.  I can't comment on the venue during game time, but every time I've been here, I've never been disappointed.  The nachos are great, but my fav has to be the stuffed clams...so much flavor, and ask for extra bread to sop up the deeeelicious sauce!  Hard to believe they exist in Villa Park, and it's not the easiest to get to...but well worth it!

We had our company Christmas party here last night. What a great experience! The food was excellent, the service was friendly and the place is huge. The pool tables were free. I don't know if they always are or not. The washrooms super clean and the entire place is. I didn't gamble but plan to go back and explore some more! Huge TV screens everywhere.
If you are a fan of baked clams you should definitely try them here, the full order of 12 is 16 bucks.  Big place, good service and plenty of selections of appetizers.

A hidden gem!  So many places you can drive by many times and not realize what is there.  This place is way more than just off track betting which is in the west side of this very large venue.  A very large bar, video slot gaming area, pool table area, large sports viewing area, patio etc.  Dozens of craft beers on tap and weds. they are all only $3.
