I don't expect joints like this to have more than avg food but everything i've tried so far had been good and beaten my expectations.  Service is also very good and consistent and that takes good ownership/mgt who you will see around all the time.  I've now been 12 times and brought several family and all have also enjoyed it.
GREAT place to watch Blackhawks, Bulls or Bears!!  Sirens go off for goals & touchdowns.  The food is D-LISH!!  The out door patio is fun in the summer.  It's HUGE, clean, & friendly service!

Recently threw a surprise party here and my original plans fell through so I was on a time and budget crunch but the owner, Stafa, came to my rescue. He was so accommodating and really worked to help me in planning what ended up being a flawless and amazing party! We will never go anywhere else for big events! The food was out of this world and people from the party are still raving about it. So thrilled that we were able to work with Stafa and Sean and Crazy Pour definitely earned some new loyal customers!

Awsome bar and staff. From chicago worth the drive love this place and everything they have indoors and out. Coming back for sure. Plenty of tv's. Games  pool tables outside patio with fireplace   Bonus i give it 10 stars.  Hidden gem. Got to stop by trust me

Beautiful upscale bar in the neighborhood! Super clean, huge and also loved the decor. They have great deals every day of the week, which is just what young families with kids like myself look for when going out to a bar for drinks and dinner. The waitress was friendly and very accommodating, as we had our two kids with us. She made my son a special water with cherries to keep him entertained and gave him "refills". The bar has a great selection of craft beers and our food was excellent. It was delicious, hot and fresh. Our beers were nice and cold. Overall, we loved the atmosphere, beautiful spacious establishment, awesome menu and friendly attentive staff. Will definitely be a returning customer.
Awesome bar and sports book ! Great food and drink specials! Slots! Video gaming! Friendly staff! Love this place!

Another place in this area that I just wouldn't expect. At the end of the day it's a sports bar with a pretty great beer selection and good food. Only been a couple times because I'm an out of towner but each time the experience was good and the staff were friendly.

I had no idea this place existed. The last time I was over on this side of town, wasn't this a seedy OTB place? Regardless, it's fantastic now. 

There is a cute outdoor area which a fireplace which they turned on (It's gas) just for my chilled self. The waitress was nice, but kind of clueless when it came to drinks. She did not know what some drinks were ("straight up" confused her) and liquors stumped her as well (Campari, ftw) Basically, this is not a place to experiment with new drinks. Stick to your old favorites and you'll be fine.

One the menu for us that night was: 
-Southwest Eggrolls - I'm addicted to these. Anywhere I can order them, I do, and they always make me want another dozen orders of them #hungrygirlproblems
-Baked Clams- Our waitress forgot we ordered these, I think. They took more than a half hour to arrive! I wasn't impressed, as the "baked" portion covered the clams themselves, but the topping was soggy as a car wash sponge. Pass!
-WINGS. yum. serious. Get these. The hot sauce was perfect, not too painful but still acceptable for the fire-breathing dragon I was with. 

Good place for appetizers, people watching, and wings. I'd head back if I was in need of a buffalo fix.

Free Diamond pool tables, 2 of them, in good shape, like me. Aaaand food that is tasty. Aaand drinks, 2 fingers of Makers, nice staff. Feel bad they seemed understaffed for my company party. OTB also? Lets bet on those ponies!! Saw a kid in here, cuz they have TV's at some tables, which is a great way to bond with your children over a meal.

I went to Crazy Pour with my girlfriend on Memorial Day (5/26) to watch game four of the Western Conference finals between the Blackhawks and Kings. As an official Blackhawks bar, the siren thing is LOUD so be ye warned and cover your ears if you are sensitive to loud noises in enclosed areas when the Hawks score. Crazy Pour is therefore ideal for watching hockey but also a good place as a social gathering for friends. Hopefully they do this also for Da Bears during football season, too.

Immediately upon being seated indoors (we did not go out on the patio because it was raining and we wanted to watch the Hawks game), we were greeted by a friendly and vivacious server who suggested that we try the Arancini. Despite our server and us both agreeing that they were a wee bit skimpy on the VERY tasty vodka sauce, it was excellent nevertheless. After gobbling that down rather quickly, we then chose to order the jumbo nachos, which were fully loaded with quality ingredients but quite spicy even by my own standards (I love spicy food). They also have the 'Not Your Dad's Root Beer' beer, which I love. It tastes just like root beer and yet is a whopping 20% abv! Better yet, a pint only costs $6 there! The beer is moderately-priced and the atmosphere of this place is sporty. The location is a good but not great one. I do not think it is a good place for kids, either.

Additionally, it should be noted that Crazy Pour also has off-track betting, slot machines, a great selection of libations, cheap wings, an outdoor patio, myriad screens for watching all sorts of sports and other things on TV, and billiards tables. 

Ultimately, I give this place 5 stars because of the management/ownership of Crazy Pour. On Yelp we bought a $10 for $20 worth of food voucher. After dining, we were $4 short of meeting the $20 minimum purchase requirement with our food so, even though we were full, we were going to order an additional food item. Before we could do so, the owner Tiz came over to our table personally and generously honored the promotion anyway. I wish more establishments had that kind of accommodating customer service and they should strongly consider doing so, too, because it will invariably lead to more positive buzz on social media and more 5 star reviews on Yelp which means a win-win situation is created for everybody involved.
This place was a notch below ok. Food wasn't great but wasn't bad either, pizza crust could be cooked longer to make it crispy. Service was just what you expect at a bar.

The food was pretty great for bar food, and it was really nice to sit outside and feel the warm summer breeze (however long it lasts, we don't know so we must take advantage of it).

Our server was very friendly despite these two gentlemen near us that were speaking so loud about absolute garbage & I thought about backhanding them multiple times! 

Overall it was fun, and if you like to gamble it will probably be even better!

Stopped in here on a recommendation from the guys over at Ardmore Station Liquors.  They have a very good selection of craft beer, including (the evening I was there) Bourbon County Stout and Smalltown Rootbeer (17.5 version).  This was a pizza place before, but they have completely redone the inside and it is quite nice.  They do OTB and some gambling machines - not my thing - but it is a big draw for some people.  The service was quite good and the owner spent some time talking about the industry and some of the hurdles owners face.  The place is sharp and laid out very well.  I did not try the food, but they have a huge kitchen.

Julia was very attentive, easy to talk to and knows how to make a good drink!  We ordered some cocktails and appetizers.  The facility is very clean and has a great layout to fit as many customers comfortably as possible.  If you're looking for somewhere to watch a game, you can't go wrong here!  

Thanks for the great drinks, Julia.  Hope you make it to that concert!

We decided to try a new place and wow was that a mistake!  If I could give zero stars I would.   My husband and I went there at 5 on a Saturday. The hostess with no personality sat us at a high top where we waited ten minutes for our waitress who finally came and said "oh I didn't know you were here" said.  Ughhh not a good sign. We ordered the baked clams and a jack and a mixed drink. Baked clams came out and they were so gross and mushy. Ordered our steak tacos and a wrap. They were both terrible. Steak was fatty and the wrap was simply terrible. Our waitress had no personality what so ever.  Big disappointment and will never recommend it to friends.

I want to give this place a better review but too many terrible variables make it impossible. 

Let me begin by saying that I love to go out and watch hockey and cheer on the Blackhawks with the rest of the fans. I love the roar of the crowd and the lights and horn every time they score. However the horn at this place is terrifying! It makes your hair move and your skin vibrate. I watched one guy duck down the first time it went off because he thought he was in an attack.  

Next was the service. The girl was awkward, brought us more drinks when we didn't want any more and couldn't be found when we wanted to leave.

Finally was the music volume. I'm not an 80 year old grandma, and can hear just fine. Before the Hawks game began, my friends and I were there to enjoy some apps and drinks (at 7pm) and the music was so loud we couldn't hold a conversation across the table. To make it even better, the cranked it up louder!

To round out my review, this place received the 2 stars that it did because the food quality and options were decent, along with the decor.
Had great service. Plan to go back soon. Free pizza with Blackhawk games. What! Yes I'm there.

I have been here on four occasions, and the beers and ciders on tap are plentiful. I am particularly fond of the Ciderboys Magic Apple and the super potent - and it goes down like concentrated root beer- Not Your Dad's ....

The food seems to be hit or miss...I have had the hit chicken wings, and they were tasty, and sometimes (Monday?) they are 50 cents a piece. The chicken wrap was good, but their fried cheese curds are slightly rubbery.

Service here has always been good, usually attractive, sweet young waitresses who are good with follow-up, if not with beer knowledge.

The building space is HUGE, with an attached OTB and TV screens all over the place.

The acoustics, much like its sister restaurant, the Overtime Bar and Grill, are bad, bad, bad, due in large part to the concrete floors.

One Sunday afternoon I was in having lunch and drinks with a friend, and although the Daytona 500 was on, there was more noise due to a party of 12 year old basketball players. And while the kids were not out-of-hand or rowdy, the cacophony produced was obnoxious. Enough so, that we left early, and so too did a group of guys wanting to watch the race.

Other than that, I really do enjoy coming to this place.....

I don't know how it is during the day, but it's a great place to hang out late at night. They have OTB and a lot of space to hold parties. They have a great selection of beers and liquor too. The patio is also one of the best in the area. It is definitely worth a visit out to VP!

Just had a family celebration this weekend at Crazy Pour and it was wonderful!  Shaun and Tis were extremely accommodating for our last-minute booking.  The food was delicious and the presentation was upscale.  Our bartender, Alex, was awesome!  She was very professional and always attentive to our guests.  All in all, I would recommend having a large group event at Crazy Pour.  There is something for everyone.....sports galore, music, pool, outdoor patio with fireplace, OTB, and great food at reasonable prices.  Our family had an exceptional time and will be back in the near future.  Thank you to Shaun for your hard work and unending effort in making a difficult situation become a fun evening for all.

Went here for after work drinks a few times. Good selection of drinks. Ciderboys Magic Apple and Not your dad's root beer are 2 good choices. Daily specials are pretty good. Clean, spacious bar. Not what you really expect from the outside. Been waiting for it to be nice enough to check out the patio.


Edit:
This has become our regular after work spot. Everyone is super nice, the drink specials are good. And the Bacardi buckets are delicious.

This is a well managed sports bar and it shows in the staff. We have received great service and tasty food every time we've been there. The owner likes people and it flows down to the customers. Special call out to Sean and Ashley. Sean goes all the way with customer satisfaction and Ashley rocks the service biz. Thanks for a great neighborhood spot.

Huge beer selection and not just the usual "craft" suspects.  Food was very good & reasonably priced.  Beyond that it is a large sports bar and grill with tons of TV's sure to please the sports fan.  (we didn't do the OTB)  We'll be back again to check out the outdoor seating in the spring.  I saw a few complaints about the place being loud and I wouldn't disagree with the noise level but... what are you expecting?  It's called the Crazy Pour.

the pizza is free on bears games Sundays from 12-1pm. however it is just ok. and the service is still not perfect.  the meatball soup was pretty good, but that's about all i can say. i don't know if i will be going back.

i'll pass.

This is my new go to place when I'm in town. They have a very affordable and delicious menu. If you stop in order the arancini, it's fantastic. To add to the great food, they have a pretty nice beer selection. Their bartenders are always kind and sincere, and that is something that you tend to have a hard time coming across. To add to it all they have large flat screens everywhere so you can catch the current game or watch the races. I personally enjoy reading all the hilarious names of the horses, but hey, we are all there for our own reasons... I would highly recommend this place, seriously. GO THERE!

In a word ... OUTSTANDING !! 
Fun sports bar with OTB . The food is restaurant quality .. Wonderful appetizers . All of the employees are welcoming and sincerely friendly from the doorman to the servers to the busers and if course the owner !! 
A fun place with a DJ on the weekends , big TVs to watch sporting events .. A huge thumbs up for this gem .

Not a bad option for the area.  Big and clean, lots of options for beer drinkers, spirit selection looked good too.  Food is standard fried pup grub, nothing special but not bad either.  Prices were fair and service was good (although they struggled to honor my Yelp/Groupon deal).  Lots of TVs and an outdoor smoking area, looked like they had a couple pool tables as well...

Would visit again but wouldn't go out of my way...

Would give a 3.5 if I could, but it is definitely not a 3...

Stunningly great! I did a catering in this venue (the Platinum room) and the staff and ownership couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. They are a class act with a fabulous understanding of the hospitality industry!. And...the bar is awesome. Almost fifty taps, great food, and magnificent service. This place may be attached/a part of the OTB but I would easily belly up here for just a cocktail and ball game, I wouldn't even have to want to bet the ponies to hammer a pint or two. Not only will I be back, but I will be setting up a neighborhood event here where we get a couple of those table top beer taps, each pitch in a few bucks, and randomly pick great name horses for nice afternoon. Highly suggested!

I came here for the first time to watch some games and grab a bite to eat. I was impressed walking in by the decor and layout. Then it went all downhill from there. 1. It was empty, and I mean empty we were the only two people. It was 7pm on a Sunday. The staff just hanging out around the bar. 2. We ordered our drinks and they came out just tasting like soda water, but after the third attempt in getting a simple tonic and ice ordered they asked us to order something else. Really, tonic was too difficult!!! This just made us more nervous on the food. 3. We ordered Jumbo Chicken Nachos as an appetizer and we both ordered separate sandwiches as our entrees. We waited and waited for our appetizer to arrive, and we patiently waited over a few games of darts. Then all of a sudden all of our food came at once Nachos and sandwiches. How are we going to eat nachos and our main entrees at once before each of them get cold. I ordered a grilled chicken panini and out came a grilled chicken wrap. My friend ordered a regular burger cooked medium and out came a well done cooked burger. I am not sure who is to blame here, mangers, chefs, or the waitress. But Damn we were the only two people there and they couldn't get our orders correct. We told the waitress about the faults in all of  our orders but only to get comped on the nachos and a round of drinks, which is nice of her, but I feel like the manger should have taken initiative and done better. Regardless we left early and hungry and unsatisfied paying for food we didn't even eat.

Be skeptical of this place. I won't be coming back here again.

This place has a great atmosphere and we love coming here but I'm not sure it would be a true sports bar. Atleast for college sports. They played UFC on every single tv when a bunch of college football games were on including northwestern vs notre dame which I thought was a big deal around here. We asked them to switch to one of the games on ONE tv and they did, but then later got switched back. So every tv had the same thing on at once. It was annoying that we had to keep asking so eventually decided to leave and go somewhere else with football on. However the layout of this place is great and a good place to come if you don't have anything specific you want to watch.

Love this place! Food is outstanding.....fried pickles are one of my faves.... Burgers are great and pizza is delish.....I'm picky with my pizza!!!! Tons of tvs to watch sports, not a  bad seat in the house. Lots of craft beer to choose from.... Even the root beer beer......amazing! Great outdoor seating with a fireplace!
They also have slots and otb on site. Best sports bar around!

Came here on a Friday night... huge place with a very cool atmosphere. There are TVs everywhere and the volume is cranked up for any big game. We had hot chicken wings that were delicious! They came with an enormous cup of ranch (bonus points) and carrots and celery. I had fish tacos that were topped with slaw and came with lemons, sour cream, gauc, and salsa. They were amazing! My boyfriend had the Crazy Pour Burger, which was huge and topped with a fried egg; he loved it! We received friendly and fast service. We will be back and I highly recommend!
This place is so close to my house!!! Love it to watch football. Quiet where u can still talk and enjoy the game. Mac and cheese bites are a must have! Lots of tap beers and beer towers!!!

Great bar area. I am not crazy about lameness on other side of off track betting but the food and look here is excellent. I caught the first NFL game rooting for the Packers and there are tons of televisions here. If I had known what an awesome looking sports bar this p,ace is. Wold of caught the World Cup here this summer. They have television for individual booth and a party room in the back. The place is decored  nicely and has more than enough TV screens and will have the NFL ticket. Service was great and the food fresh and more than adequate and better than your average BWW. One of the better bars in West burbs

Nicole Michelle was amazing! She was attentive and friendly. She was most definitely busy but still did a great job taking care of us. We will definitely come back because of her. Great service and food, and hey the Hawks won. All around a great experience!!

Food is great, bartenders great, manager a new one I believe is great very friendly and accommodating but, a couple of shady servers we have seen dealing more than tips and food on more than one occasion, makes me a bit nervous going to use the restroom with what is going on in there, scary not knowing what could happen. Owner is extremely rude and arrogant. Other than the shady server and the rude owner, it's a great place... sit at the bar and don't ask the owner any questions you should be good!

Came here late night with a few coworkers after a loooooooong day of work. The parking lot was packed so we figured this must be the place to be. The bouncer was inside the door which I was glad because it was freezing cold outside. As soon we walked in, we went up to the bar and the bartender greeted us right away. We decided to just take up 4 bar stools up at the bar so we can order drinks faster. As I look around, there was a separate room with some casino slot machines. Behind us was a section that played current music loudly. Since that section is behind us, it made us feel like there was a big rocking party behind us that we are missing out on. The music was loud but it was still okay for us to chit chat and drink at the bar. The bartender throughout the night was very attentive. The drink prices were moderate. 4 premium shots ran me $28 each time. Yes, I spent quite a bit tonight and I blame it on work. Last but not least, the bathroom was super clean. I have a feeling that I may frequent this place more often when I am back from work.

This was our second time here to watch the hawks game.  I was unsure about coming back here after the first time because our service was pretty lousy, but tonight made up for it.  This time, Cheryl our server, was excellent.  It was a pretty busy night for her being it was a hawks game night.  She was polite and friendly, not overbearing or in any way pushy.  She seemed to know exactly when to come around and ask if we needed anything.  She seriously is a gem.  Amazing service.  On both visits, the food was pretty darn good, I really enjoy their fries.  An added bonus is that they haD my favorite beer, Oberon on tap tonight.  Hooray!  I'll come back for sure, I just hope Cheryl is working and we can sit in her section. :-)

Crazy Pour has spectacular staff! The appetizers are really good and there are some great daily specials.  I recommend the pulled pork.  They really need to offer flights considering they have a wonderfully diverse beer selection.  Seating isn't the best. I HATE trying to get out of cloth-covered booth seats.

My wife and I got lunch and it was pretty good. The prices are pretty reasonable and portions are good as well. What I liked best was the environment. This place is HUGE on the inside (despite looking small on the outside)and there are TVs everywhere, along with huge private rooms if you want. PPV events and NFL Sunday ticket are here so it's great if you wanna watch sports. Games and pool tables also, with tons of space. We got a booth and it was cloth cushioned and really comfy. Service was very good, our waitress was very friendly and a perfect balance of being attentive without being a bother. Clean bathrooms too.

For starters we got cheese curds and breaded mushrooms. They were good, the cheese curds being the more impressive. Also, we got a spinach salad which was ridiculously huge. Cutting it was a part-time job.

For my meal I got the Crazy Pour burger(bacon, egg, and cheese)and fries, bun was different, but it was slightly above average. Fries are nothing to get excited about but are good. My wife got an egg bacon and cheese panini and  she rated it a 7/10.

Also, rumor has it this place has amazing thin crust pizza.

Fun place, looks new, used a $40 yelp voucher (cost $25, which is why we got so much food).

I'd go again.

Bartenders are super friendly and prompt.  Inside decor is very nice and large.  Great place to watch a game, play pool, or just relax and eat.  They also have a very nice outside patio with a fireplace.

i have so much positive things to say about crazy pout.

first off i want to thank the owners thanks guys!

make sure you check this place out. it's kinda hard to find right next to auto zone. 105 e north ave in villa park. lots of things to do here!

i had a party for my girlfriends it was an amazing awesome time for all of us and we are all coming back with with other friends. so we kinda had our own room was very nice and a very sweet waitress dee p.s. that isn't her full name just not good at remembering thanks dee we all loved you . the owners let me bring in my computer to play my own music thanks again guys! 

ok some of my gf like to gamble and in this room are gambling machines caching they loved that, and it's otb yes another gf went there love it! after the gf party i fricken love sports i was in sports heaven and times some of the tv"s out in the sports bar had horse races and i love the races, now there is a separate room for just that so if that's all you want you can go there. 

next, there is pool tables 2 or  4 can't remember saying that brings me to the great drinks. 
next, a dj was there that night i fricken love to dance we made our own dance floor. did i mention big screen tv's
next, the food is awesome

i just have to say that is my kinda bar, sports and dancing all in one i was dancing while watching sports jk..

this place rocks!

we will all be returning very soon. i can't wait!

thanks again.

p.s. i could off left something out  did n't i say great drinks, so come check it out for your self.

I had a group come here to celebrate my birthday on a Friday night during a Blackhawks game. The bar area had hardly any people in it.. which was fine for us, but felt very empty and awkward.

Server was very quick and polite, don't remember her name but she had a nose ring and hair parted on the side. All the beer I tried was great, I'm not really picky and will try anything. I ordered the southwest eggrolls which were deeeeeeeelicious. 

I was hoping for a bigger crowd within this bar just because it then feels more fun? But otherwise a good time

Came back for a couple fabulous Bloody Mary's made by Michelle. Also an Excellent menu selection.  Try the baked clams!!  They are the best around. Actually this restaurants really has the best food in general. Bookmark it and try it soon!!

Great bar, tons of TVS, great beer selection/specials, CLEAN bathroom and good food!  And Jess is just about as good as it gets as far as servers go!  We play pool out of here for league and I come a lot outside of that as well - I love this place.

Great spot for some afternoon drinks. We are staying at a hotel nearby and searched for a local establishment to grab a beer. Great service, $3 craft beers on Wednesday, and half priced appetizers during happy hour. Servers were friendly too!
food was very good... at times it can be a little loud..; but if you like hawks games  this is your place to go.

I was hoping for more, really really more than what this place offers.  A great venue nonetheless, spacious and very inviting with many TV's and a ticker over the bar.  I came here with friends to bet some horses and left disappointed.   The food was horrible, I've never had worse chicken fingers in my life...half of them were breading and bad breading at that...I still am having heart-burn from them.  And they came with a tiny dipping of ranch...I ordered more ranch and was charged for it.  I was excited that they offered Fried Green Tomatoes but they were bland, bland, bland...not sure if they were homemade but it wouldn't matter...they weren't very good.  Excited about the beer I was, until a Two-hearted cost $7 when I can get a 6-pack for $10.  The food/beer experience was bad, I won't go back for sure.  The betting was convenient and good however.

I discovered this hidden gem yesterday. (Easy to miss on North Av.)  It's part of the OTB but separate from the betting area. Very modern clean atmosphere and  Hi-Tech with a great sound system and many HD TV's and huge projection TV's. The food menu was loaded with many reasonably priced chioces. I had the Cheeseburger Thusrday special for $6 which most places would charge $10. Nice thick, fresh, juicy beef on a pretzel bun with all the fix'ins and hot crunchy fries. A heck of a deal. The nachos are huge and delicious. There are beer specials every day. The service staff was very friendly and attentive. The restroom was immaculate too. I even noticed one of the workers wiping the legs of the chairs and tables. Impressive. I will definately be back to try otherthings on the menu. Plenty of parking too.

Big new and empty. Server Barbi salvaged the one star rating, she went out of her way to pitch the place. Said soup was from scratch but was alphabet? Nothing special here just a sports bar. Cant be cheap to operate, Uh oh....

No place within a 10 mile radius can compete with this place. With a warm and inviting environment, I felt right at home and always do the minute I walk in. Multiple bars, a private room for private parties, OTB, video gaming, multiple outdoor patios with a fireplace, pool tables and dart boards, an excellent selection of beers (craft, domestic, local, hard to find, limited editions, etc) that are updated weekly, huge whiskey and spirit collection... Not to mention the food! Amazing pizza (that they usually offer free during Bears games), the steak is great, daily soups and pasta, even fish tacos! All prepared and presented better than many restaurants I attend. The staff is fun and welcoming. All sporting and UFC and boxing events are all free to watch! Djs on the weekend. Any way you look at it, you can't go wrong, there's something for everyone. I'd suggest you to go check it out for yourself. The daily specials are definitely something to notice.

Have been to crazy pour a few times now.  We had high hopes for the sportsbar/restaurant.   Yesterday we went to watch the bears game at noon.   My husband noticed it first but the bar was sticky and just looking at it, it looked un-clean.    We were then given 2 menus in which the menus were filthy and sticky also.    They are known for their beer pitchers that sit on table top and have a spout like a keg.   Cute idea but we looked at every one of them and fingerprints were everywhere, just looked un clean.    Even looking at the windows going into the kitchen, you have to think who cleans this place.   Kinda put us off.     Bartender not only tended the bar but worked the first row of tables, where we moved to because of the condition of the bar.     Needless to say, service lacked because the bartender should be working the bar and getting the waitresses drinks for their tables, she shouldn't be a waitress also.    Lastly, we were sitting there watching the Bears do an awful job and I have to say started rooting for Miami (lol) and this big burley man from the bar turned around and confronted us in a mean and bullying manner.    The last we checked this was a sportsbar and a free country.    He kept taunting us for the first half of the game and actually threatened us.   Well, we felt very uncomfortable and asked for our check.   We did let the bartender/waitress know about this patron.   She did go discuss with owners.   I didn't expect the owners to kick him out but knowing the types of patrons that hang at this establishment, I won't be back and I would not recommend to anyone else.    The unclean feeling of the establishment and the unclean feeling of the patrons seem to equal a place I don't want to go.

Restaurant review
Stuffed pizza is the way to go. I didn't realize that I don't really like deep dish as much as I like the stuffed pizza. This does not come cheap as one pizza cost over $30 which is a little bit surprising given other options such as Gino's East. Although this restaurant doesn't really allow you to eat in our pizza was ready by the time it was promised it was promised there's plenty of toppings with the stuffed pizza crust was a little bit soggy but it wasn't excessively thick pizza. This would've been heavenly if I can be eaten at fresh their. I wish they would run some promotions to make the pizza cheaper

Pros: Great stuffed pizza even better than deep dish.

Cons: Expensive and cools off very easily on the drive home

Hidden deals:
There's $10 lunch deals and after you buy your pizza they will give you coupons that you can use for the next visit. You can also sign up for the E club and sometimes they'll give you a free appetizer

So we got a pepperoni thin crust and fried mozzarella triangles last night from Giordano's Bloomingdales location. First, the pizza didn't taste that good, but whatever - we usually get Lou Malnati's so I figured it was just a different taste and a bit dry. No big deal, right? Well now it's 10 hours later and both me and my pregnant wife have food poisoning from eating that garbage. I woke up in the middle of the night with lower stomach pains, well apparently she was having same pains and now we both have zero appetite, laying in bed feeling like crap. Went on yelp to see how many other people got sick from eating there last night.

What happened?!?!! So we got a stuffed and a thin crust. And both pizzas were just ok. Nothing too great. First the sauce on the pizzas tasted different than usual. Not in a good way. And then the stuffed pizza was sticking to the cardboard and some of the cardboard came off on one of the slices. Luckily we realized before someone would have eaten the cardboard. It was gross. Not happy at all with our past experience and don't plan on coming back.

Terrible service... The cashier was rude after they dropped the ball on my order. My boyfriend called in, they said 25 min, we showed up 30 min after and the pizza wasn't even being prepared because we saw them prepare it. The lady up front exact words were "well we are busy what do you want me to do, I can call a manager" great customer service (sarcasm). The manager on duty offered a free appetizer, if we wanted an appetizer we would have ordered one so we wanted our money back and cancel the order to go to Lou's (where we would have order from in the first place); he said he could not do that so we got screwed and now we are pissed off. Great way to remind me why we don't order or fine at Giordano's anymore...

I ordered a pizza online and verified my order to ensure it was absolutely correct. I didn't think it was that difficult considering half of the pizza was only extra cheese and jalapeños. I called and was promptly greeted by a very friendly staff member and was informed that she will get the manager. Another staff member came to the phone and wanted to know what the problem was with the pizza. I let her know that I was on hold for the manager. Her response was that he's busy. I explained the issue again and was told that she will go speak to the manager to see what they can do. She said they could replace the pizza and I could pick it up. I thought the situation should've been handled by the manager, not the employees. Furthermore, this is the second time this location made a mistake with my pizza. I will no longer order from this location.
Best stuffed pizza ever!!! I had spinach stuffed pizza and it was so good. The sauce is great the crust is like no other and I order more so I have leftovers. I can't wait to eat it again.

Called in an order for pick up. Jordan was super friendly. I ordered a medium stuffed sausage with half mushroom half onion. The crust is awesome, buttery and like nothing else. I also vote this pizza is the Best!  There are half a dozen tables inside along with a counter if you decide to stay and eat. This location also has a nice clean decor. Can't wait to try their new stuffed eggplant and ricotta pizza!
I love Giordano's and this location doesn't disappoint! I only wish it had a dine-in, I like to go out for pizza more than I like to take-out, especially this type of pizza.

Delivery was after time expected. When I called to check on the pizza they asked me if I wanted to pick it up since they were running behind. When I asked why so long they said their delivery time increased after she got off the phone with me. All it takes is communication. Call me back and tell me I would have come there 45 mins ago to get it.

I knew Giordano's had great deep-dish, but their thin-crust is also exceptional. They put the perfect about of cheese and sauce. They also cut their thin-crust in squares which is how all thin-crust pizza should be eaten, unless it's New York style.

Waited 1hr15min for what I was hoping was a going to be the go to family favorite deep dish cheese and sausage pizza.  But instead received what I can only describe was like a giant open faced mozzarella stick with little sauce and even less sausage(seriously none).  I brought this to the attention of the manager today to see if this was right, and was told there was nothing that he could do, but maybe next time they would do better.  Sorry but I'm not spending $30 again here hoping you'll get it right.
regardless of my bad experience, I was glad to quickly hear back from management's concern to make my future orders better. We will see what happens but its always good to hear back

I love Giordano's, it is one of my favorite pizza places. We were so excited when a location opened by us but unfortunately their customer service and management is the worst and we will not be returning. Do yourself a favor either go to a different location or order Lou's instead.

The five stars are for the deep dish spinach pizza! I have ordered the deep dish spinach pizza twice from this location and was satisfied each time. The crust is a light dough with a mild flavor which helps bring out the tomato flavor of the sauce, the spinach is fresh and delicious and the cheese is a perfect blend of goodness. This is my favorite spinach pizza! Each time I ordered this pizza I had different people eat the pizza with me and it was a HIT with everyone!

Had a taste for one of their stuffed pizzas recently as it had been a few years. A family member is on a gluten-free diet and said they could eat everything but the crust. 
Upon cleaning up their plate, I noticed this pizza is about 40% crust. The pizza tasted good but IMO there is too much crust.

We ordered 2 pizzas and a salad to pick-up from this location on Friday, 12/04/15. We regularly order pizzas from this location, and this time we ordered a medium deep dish cheese pizza and a small deep dish pizza with bacon and garlicky broccoli on it (side note: TRY THE GARLICKY BROCCOLI ON YOUR PIZZAS IMMEDIATELY.) The pizzas were both correctly prepared and very delicious as always. Unfortunately, the same can not be said about our chopped salad. We had ordered our chopped salad with the blue cheese and scallions on the side. The salad we received not only had blue cheese and scallions on it, but it also came with blue cheese dressing instead of the honey mustard dressing that was supposed to accompany it! It's a shame because the lettuce and other toppings all looked very fresh and delicious, but the salad was just ruined for us. I called the store to alert them of their mistake, and they said that they mixed our salad up with another group's order and offered me a $10 credit on my account for next time. Because of that error I would say this particular instance was not a 4-star experience, but due to the management offering us a credit and our experience at Giordano's usually being very good I felt generous and decided to give them the 4 stars and the benefit of the doubt that this won't happen again.

Best deep dish pizza I've ever had in my life. It was layered like a cake and although we ordered it to-go and waited until we got back to the hotel to eat it, it was still piping hot 30 minutes later. I almost freaked out when I found out I could have one shipped to my home. Hands-down the best pizza on earth!
Great thin crust pizza... Staff is polite.... This location is primarily for take out only as the dining room is only 3 tables and a counter.
Sorry to say . Will not waste my money here. Better ...St. Charles or Streemwood beats this wasteland. Spend well over  $100 here. Not anymore

best quesadillas evar!!!!! none compare!!!

(terrible al pastor tacos tho...)

Ramiro's Mexican Restaurant:

HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!  Ordered a taco of chicken milanesa and quesadilla de res (tinga de res). Instead of a taco they brought out a torta.  The chicken milanesa was nothing special.  The quesadilla was so spicy that my mouth was on fire from the first bite. I want to be able to taste and enjoy my food. Did I mention that it came with a side order of grease? Customer service SUCKED! Being that I wasn't pleased with my quesadilla order, the waitress said if I wanted something else they would charge me for it. REALLY?!  Went to Parilla Azteca for my quesadilla and was not disappointed.

The food here is amazing. My husband and I shared a burger with fries, and the Monterey chicken meal. The Ceasar dressing is made in house; and the best I've ever had. Our waitress was kind and prompt. The chef made a perfect well done (NO pink) burger, still tender and delicious. 

Kem's is Killin' it at the Holiday Inn!

Stood there for ten 
United and no one greeted me, obviously they did not want my money

The restaurant is nothing to write home about, nothing extravagent, nothing bland.  It has a small bar, booths and tables encircling it, and a salad bar I'm guessing for buffets?

They do have daily specials, but their menu has quite a few options on it as well.  My first time there, I chose the sirloin steak salad, and it was a generous portion, the 2 rolls I got on the side were fresh and warm, but the salad was good, just average.

The bartender did provide the two remotes to change channels for my pleasure, and I gave up after about 30 seconds. the satellite TV boxes are behind the TV's, so it has to be at the right angle.  

Given the location of the hotel in Itasca, there aren't many dining options nearby, about 2-3 blocks to the west there are, about a 5-8 minute walk.  But it will do for what you are hungry for

Dined here with a Groupon for date night. We came here after going to Geja's about a month and a half before for my boyfriend's birthday so I was eager to compare our experiences. 

We made a reservation for 7pm on a Friday night and did have to wait a bit even though we arrived right on time. We decided to sit at the bar and get a couple of drinks while we waited to be seated at our table. 

Once seated we ordered a bottle of the Michelle, Brut wine, but they didn't have any bottles left so we ended up getting a bottle of Savignon Blanc instead because they didn't have any other options for what we wanted.

We shared one serving of the Quattro Fromaggio cheese fondue to start and we both enjoyed it. The flavour was great and I liked the selection they give you to dip in the cheese. Also the fact that they mix it together at your table so you can see all the ingredients that go into it. 

For our salads we both got the Caesar which was nothing special, but you don't come here for their salads. 

For our combinations of three individual items: He went with Filet Mignon, Sesame-Crusted Ahi Tuna, and Sriracha Shrimp. And I went with Filet Mignon, Honey Orange Duck Breast, and Sriracha Shrimp. I have to say everything was delicious and fresh, and the dipping sauces were great to pair with the meat. We opted to throw in all the veggies at the beginning instead of cooking them individually. I thought it was the better option since they provide you with a slotted spoon so your food doesn't get lost in the pot. 

We knew dessert would be overkill so we just got our bill. Our server for the night was Shawn who was amazing. He provided us with top notch friendly and knowledgeable service.

Because it's only a 5 min drive for us, the prices are better, as well as the selection, we will probably come back here more often, but if it's for a special occasion we will go to Geja's because it is much more romantic.

My boyfriend and I went here last night for our anniversary and let me tell you.... This place is amazing!!! The atmosphere is romantic and intimate: dim lighting, light music, nice artwork. They do enforce a dress code, nothing too crazy but they do expect you to look respectful and professional. Our server was named Lily and she helped walk us through how to do everything since we've never fondued before. She was great and always right there when we needed her.

We both got the Land & Sea 4 course experience.

 It starts off with bread, apples, and veggies to dip in the cheese of your choice. We got Wisconsin Cheddar, it was good but I REALLY want to try the spinach artichoke next time. 

Next is a salad. I got the California & it was awesome! Mixed greens, tomatoes, candied nuts, feta cheese & raspberry vinaigrette dressing. So good!! Boyfriend got the Cesar and he said his was good too.

For the Land & Sea entree you get shrimp, herb crusted chicken, filet mignon and some more veggies. My boyfriend added lobster tail to his. We chose to cook our food in a seasoned vegetable broth fondue. It was pretty good but I found it made the chicken and steak a little chewy. Next time we agreed to try the oil fondue! The entree comes with an array of sauces like teriyaki, plum sauce, curry sauce, cocktail sauce, and tzatziki. All really good but the plum was my favorite. 

For desert you choose the type of chocolate you like. We choose s'mores chocolate. It was delicious. 
Melted chocolate mixed with melted marshmallow fluff and topped off with crushed graham crackers. Included with bananas, pineapple, pound cake, marshmallows, strawberries, brownies, and rice crispy treats to dunk. 

By the end of it all we were there for around 2 hours and we were stuffed to the brim. The price was as expected and I've checked prices for other fondue places and Melting Pot was the most favorable. for the price you pay, you get an amazing meal and to spend quality time with the people you love.

I can't wait to go back!!

Wish I could give no stars.   Hate doing this but after 4 months.  Not only will I not eat at the Schaumburg location but all others as well.  I'm done with all Melting Pot  restaurants because corporate has done nothing either.  I showed up without reservations on a Sunday, Father's Day, and was immediately able to be seated.  It went downhill from here.  First it took longer than usual to have the server come up.  When one finally did, my wife and I ordered drinks.  I believe she had their version of a Moscow mule and I cannot remember my order.  The drinks came back and were indescribably horrible.   Also the drinks were much smaller than that of the other Melting Pot restaurants I have frequented, Madison and Brookfield, WI.  Next we ordered our food,   I ordered the 4 course special at that time which included a Chicago style deep dish pizza theme, lobster tarragon salad, and I cannot remember my main course.  I had my wife and 12 year old twins with me, so we ordered 3 portions of the cheese.   After a long wait for the cheese (compared to my over 30 past visits), a manager finally came over with the cheese and advised that she needed to show our server how this cheese was made at the table.  Now hungry we had to wait for the manager to track down the server for a few minutes to come view how the cheese course was prepared.  Finally, she came back to the table with him and as she started making the cheese course he walked away to do something else.  The manager then stopped  making the cheese course to hunt him down again. At this point, my party was getting very hungry and when the cheese course was finally prepared, we were given a small plate of the 'select' dippers.  Understanding that this came with my order, I asked for more bread as the plate probably would not have allowed for one portion of cheese to be consumed.   Since the server had quickly walked away the manager who was still there finishing prep was asked if we could have more bread and veggies for dipping.  After 10 minutes, we had a finished plate of 'dippers' and still had a pot full of cheese.  The server finally came back and we asked for bread and veggies again,  this time he looked at me like I was an idiot.  Keep in mind I have been stirring the cheese in an attempt to not have it burn for about ten minutes.  We would finally get more bread but no veggies about five minutes later.  'More bread' consisted of 8 small pieces that again had no chance of consuming the cheese left in the pot.   We did our best to finish the cheese now semi-burnt, with what we had.  As stated before, I ordered three portions of cheese and again felt the three portions were a bit smaller compared to other locations, but can say it was an advantage on this day.  Also, I forgot to mention that while waiting for the cheese another server came by and sneezed on my wife, just looked at her, said nothing, and walked away.   At this point, my wife looked at me and said if you think we should leave I am willing to do so.   In 34 years, I have had numerous sub par meals out and have never walked out on a meal.  Tonight was the first time, so I walked to the front and asked to see the manager.  I explained that I would like to settle my bill and that I had a very negative experience and was choosing to end it at that point.   The manager just asked, "Is fondue just not your thing?".  I again stated the drinks were horrible and that I regularly eat at the Melting Pot.  I believe I stated I just wanted to cut my losses and leave at this point. After feeling insulted, I still wanted to finish this without making any type of scene.  I settled a $50 tab that consisted of 2 drinks and the cheese course with two portions (they didn't even get the portions correct).  The worst part is I still tipped 10% because of having family and friends who are servers.  

      The next day I did call corporate who relayed that they let the individual stores handle complaints first.  The general manager (GM) Steve called me a few days later.  The call left me feeling insulted since I was asked how the cheese burning was their fault.  I nicely explained how their heating element was working correctly causing the liquid base in the cheese to evaporate.  And the amount of time it took to get the meager amount of dippers, the liquid had evaporated causing the cheese to burn.  The end result was a $25 gift card.  I then advised Steve the meal was $50 and that no part of the experience was enjoyable.  He agreed to mail a $50 gift card and took my information down.  He however failed to get my Zip code for mailing.  After hanging up I believed he would just google the city for the Zip code.  Two months later still no gift card.  I called back and evidently he only works on Wednesdays.  I did get one call back from the three times I called but unfortunately I could not answer.  I have called back and called corporate again but this remains unresolved at this time, 4 months later.

My husband and I arrived 15 minutes before another no-reservation party of four but they got seated 10 minutes before us. What? While we were waiting we talked to the couple next to us and they said they were waiting for 30 minutes even though they had a reservation and had arrived on time. So they too were shocked that the no-reservation party was being seated before them. The group was made up of four young girls all dolled up... it really made us wonder if they were getting special treatment.

Server at the front was far from friendly. Half the time he was talking with his coworkers. When my husband and I told him we only wanted to grab dessert he sort of started ignoring us?!

Anyway, once we were finally seated it thankfully went uphill. Our server was wonderful and he constantly checked up on us. We got just one drink and the dessert set. We weren't treated any different or less  than other diners who were there for a full meal. Food was okay. Dessert is just your standard chocolate fondue with fruits/sweets, which is pretty hard to mess up. Quantity was small but we knew to expect that coming in. 

Came for the experience. Would I try going back for a full meal? Maybe, but most likely not.
Love everything about this place except the sauces. I wish they had more, better quality sauces. Drown butter would be great.

We had a groupon for The Melting Pot. Yep - that's about the only way we get out these days.  I was kind of excited about going here because we had been once before and really enjoyed it. My husband made reservations and we got there a few minutes late, but there were plenty of tables open. We were starving so were a bit disappointed when they didn't seat us right away. But, the part owner came over to seat us and apologized for making us wait. So, we were gently calmed by that. We were seated at a really great corner booth so away from hustle and bustle. Our waitress Courtney was really sweet, if not a bit Type A about her job. We got out of her that it was really busy and busier than they expected - after all it was only a Monday night! We assured her we were there to relax and not to worry. 

We ordered a bottle of Zin. The bartender came over himself to let us know they were out of that bottle so we ordered a Malbec from Argentina which was a few dollars less. Hey - I love wines from Argentina and Malbecs so when it arrived and it was really great, I was happy we didn't get that Zin from Cali. Later, for dessert (yea we splurged), I got a champagne. I think he must have either poured the wrong one or had one sitting there, because they brought us two - one on the house. One was very flat (maybe it was a Cava) and neither of us liked it. The other was my Prosecco which was tasty. Again, a nice gesture. I just cared that what I ordered was good.

Okay - so you've heard the small hiccups in our visit. But they were so small, I would only take off a quarter of a star. The rest of the experience was SO great and that's why I gave it a 5 star review.

The owner came over a couple times to make sure we were happy. We were.

Our groupon came with salad. Craig ordered his and asked for no iceberg and they were happy to do that. I ordered the one with all mixed greens and it came with just spinach. That's just fine by me - it was baby spinach and it was so tender and delicious. At the end I even dipped my finger in the leftover dressing because it was so good. 

The groupon included 3 choices of one section of entrees. I had shrimp, salmon fillet and Tuna. Craig had Tuna, Pork and Fillet Mignon. I got to taste his pork and he had some of my shrimp and salmon.  Lots of food here!! We also got the Mojo cooking sauce. This was another hiccup - for some reason this was a special order and we weren't informed. But, it was REALLY good and it was only 5 bucks extra so we just kind of laughed it off. You know - when your food is amazing and you are totally relaxed because of the atmosphere, little things are okay. Veggies are included - broccoli, mushroom, potatoes. 

So, the dipping sauces were delicious. I loved the yogurt and curry the best. The herbed butter was really great with the potatoes and the pork and fillet mignon.  They also had a plum sauce, a teriyaki, horseradish cocktail sauce and something else that was good but I don't know what it was. We didn't get any cheese to dip in.

We used our phone to time the cooking. I think they should provide a way to time your cooking because the meat is 2 minutes and the seafood is 1.5 minutes and the veggies are 6 minutes. In this day, everyone has a smart phone - wait, not my mom or my sister!! So, they need a timer. Maybe if we had asked.... But we were fine.

SO much food!!!  I was SOOOO full when I finished my food!  And it was really really healthy!!  No starches except a few potatoes. We both really enjoyed it.

I have a suggestion that they use induction cooktop so that the cooktop doesn't get so hot. Then the booth won't get so hot either.  Just me being an interior designer who knows that stuff.  And it is recent technology. So maybe in a year or two....

We ordered dessert which was not on the menu. We got crunchy peanut butter mixed in chocolate. My favorite was the marshmallow rolled in oreo and dipped in the chocolate. YUM!  They also had brownie, blond brownie, banana (yummy!), pineapple, strawberry, pound cake and rice krispy treats. All very good and we had leftover chocolate so plenty. Oh yea - we didn't think about it but the dessert was 10 bucks per person. OUCH.

On our way out, the owner asked us if we were happy. Yes. Delicious!!  And then we left to go watch the Cubs lose the 3rd Playoff game against the Giants. I got to bed at 2:48 am. Thankfully, my stomach had enough time to digest the food before I went to bed.

Go. Relax. Enjoy. This place was really good!  The food was fabulous. Courtney was really great and fast. The bartender and owner were very attentive. Definitely worth your time and calories!

Oh and they just redid the bar area. It looks really nice. They are putting in a TV. Yuck. But I'm probably the only person who cares about that. Interior Design again.

My husband and I made last minute reservations for our Anniversary and we got right in for our first time visit. From the time we walked in the door the friendliest restaurant I've been to in forever it seemed like...the inside was very nice and well kept! We ordered the Steak lovers entree and the Fondue Delight both were delicious! Wish we came here years ago!

So my boyfriend and I visited The Melting Pot last night for the first time ever to celebrate our anniversary. I have to admit I was a little nervous after reading all of the negative reviews but I ended up being more than pleasantly surprised! I am here to reassure anyone in the same boat I was that The Melting Pot was definitely worth the splurge.
Our server was Rafael (apologies for any misspellings) and he went above and beyond. He clarified everything on the menu down to explaining every individual dipping sauce that came with our entrees! He even brought us out a little treat after discovering it was our anniversary. 
So overall, the food was phenomenal and the service was exceptional. Not to mention how fun the actual experience of dipping your food into delicious fondue is! If I could give this restaurant more than 5 stars I would!

Very disappointed! We came in on Monday's 6 pm , restaurant is half empty and they told us they won't take us unless we have a reservation! Like you have half empty restaurant and you can't serve two people !? Never coming back !

I love cheese... So this is right up my ally. We came here in a date night, and it's a great way to spend a couple hours to really slow down and enjoy your meal.

The cheese fondue with veggies, bread, and apples to dip. That was delicious. But then again. I may be biased... I love cheese. 

The strawberry salad I had was awesome. I usually am not crazy for salad, but it was very yummy. 

The entree....We cooked the meats ourselves. It was a fun experience. You soak the meat in broth and then dip in these different sauces. It wasn't the most delicious meal ever... But it was more about the experience. I probably wouldn't come back for the entree, (expensive and not as flavorful as id like) but it was still fun.

Now desert. We got desert enhancements and turtle fondu. It was so so so delicious. Oreo marshmallows, strawberries, pound cake, rice crispies, and a decadent cheesecake slice, were some of our dippables. I love chocolate. So I was in love lol! We were sooo full but we pounded the entire desert.

We left 2.5 hours later very full and happy!  Will keep hinting on another date night here... Just cheese and chocolate though.

This wasn't my first Melting Pot experience. So I expected the long ENJOYABLE dinner experience. What I didn't expect was it to be so long and NOT SO enjoyable because of our reservation not being ready and terribly long service delays.

Our reservation was for 7:30 for two people for a birthday. We made them a week in advance in their website. We arrived a little early (7:20); the hostess seemed a little annoyed, directing us to the bar, saying "we will be with in a bit". We grabbed a drink (a glass of Malbec and the Mangolicious, $21) and at 7:50... Finally got seated in a mini booth in the back. The point of the reservation? Who knows... 

Our server was very sweet and very friendly but either she was over sat or overwhelmed. It took forever to get anything... To the point she was apologizing a lot, which was appreciated. But showed some flaws; either the restaurant doesn't know how to appropriately staff, the hostess doesn't know how to seat, the server was having a bad night, or the kitchen was slow. Either way, it made for a not good experience for us. 

We did the 4 course dinner. The 40th anniversary cheese was ok, I wouldn't get it again and I wouldn't tell anyone that they have to try it. It lacked something. Salads are salads. The actual meal was good (surf & turf and fondue delight). 

I agree with people mentioning that portions seem smaller, especially the veggie sides. 

Our chocolate fondue was good as well. We had the turtle. It think it's kind of cheap on Melting Pots part that cheesecake bites are an up charge now. 

The bussers were a bit pushy trying to take plates and dishes too. We were still eating and they were trying to take our dishes. It was very intrusive and obnoxious. It happened more than once too. 

None of these issues were worth seeking out a manager, but if one of the two wandering around the floor bothered to stop over, we would have gladly told them.   

For the overall cost, the experience should be better. Our server did her best, but can only work with what she's given too.

I wanted to love this location, but the service & condition of the facility lowered my rating to a generous 2 stars.  The host at the front of the house wasn't overly enthusiastic about his position. We decided to do the unlimited fondue and all started out rather well.  The server was personable and attentive.  After the cheese course, we had an over eager  buser whom felt like he was breathing down our necks for us to finish.  Brushed that off and had a fine salad course and main entree course.  Once again, the over eager buser was on the scene making us feel rushed and uncomfortable.  After our main entree, our server then asked if we were going to skip the last course since his other tables said they were too full for dessert!?!?   We said, no, we'd like the dessert course as it was part of the unlimited fondue special.  Mind you, we were not going to town on the unlimited aspect of the meal.  The only extra we asked for was a half portion of our main entree.  So, the dessert comes, and our server presents us with the check without asking if we'd like more dessert.  We did not, but again, his assumption we were done was annoying.  Soon after, the buser, whom must be in a massive rush to get somewhere , started to clear all the glasses from the table including my water which I was still drinking.  Between 3 of us, we spent over $200. I have never spent $75 on a meal for myself in my life.  It was a big treat,  and for that money, I expected the service to reflect that dollar amount.  The more I think about, the more upset I get.  I'm sure these gentleman would expect good service if they were spending so much of their hard earned money on a meal.  
As for the restaurant itself, it should be much nicer for what they charge.  The booth had tape on it, and the bathroom had a leaky roof complete with a Tupperware container collecting the falling water.
Manager Stephen is unprofessional, rude, and unable to own up to his mistakes. Felt like my group experienced age discrimination.  Would not recommend and will definitely not be returning!

When the thought had come up of a fun slightly fancy date we had decided on the Melting Pot. It was somewhere we had both been in the past and did enjoy so it seemed like a good choice. I had made reservations through their online reservations system for 745pm for 8-2-16.  We arrived early, about 720 so we waited in the car for a bit before heading in so we didn't have to stand around waiting on our reservation. We went into the restaurant about 740pm. There was no one at the host stand to greet us so we just stood around. Someone had come up to us and I greeted them with "hi how are you?" he responded by putting his index finger up as if to say "one moment" and just walked away with saying nothing. Several minutes later we were greeted by the actual host who sat us promptly and gave us menus, right at about 745pm the time of our reservation. The host had asked us if we had ever been before and we said yes. He then informed us that our server would be "Olivia" and she would be with us shortly. While we waited we noticed 2 other tables get seated in the tables around us and both tables were greeted with a server immediately and given glasses of water. We still hadn't seen our server or been given or offered anything to drink. at 800pm we both became a bit annoyed as it seemed everyone around us was getting service and we were not. By 810pm we agreed to leave and go elsewhere. 

How annoying! First of all, you make a reservation for a reason. Second of all, The melting pot is grossly over priced and if we choose to spend our hard earned money there, then we better at least get good service. Sitting for more than 20 minutes ON A RESERVATION is completely unacceptable. We will never return after this experience. We went to Big Bowl in Schaumburg instead and were seated immediately and greeted within 3 minutes by our server for our drink orders. Honestly, the food was probably better too :)

I love the melting pot. Where else can you go for a romantic or fun night of fondue ?!! The best part is the dessert!! Marshmallow, chocolate, fruit, etc dipped to your hearts content. The melting pot is great for both couples and groups. 

Service is fine, plenty of parking, and clean restaurant. The experience is also a lot of fun. What more can you ask for?

One word!!! Just avoid! I felt outcasted the waiters were super rude. The fun factor the waiters mentioned they are booked until for next 3 hrs but I was aware that they have online booking & guess what I went outside booked online for table after 15 mins. I will never ever step in my foot. Sorry melting pot you lost your true fan.

Valentine's dinner, rip off city! "Special Valentines Day" menu only, $65 vs normal $35-45 for same number of courses. Supposedly upgrades but minimal difference + 1 very small plate of deli meats w the cheese course. Per the manager Steve you have to pay for extra vegetables on the overpriced special menu where normally you do not. On the bright side, they did come out #1 in one area, we had by far the absolute worst Lemon Drop Martini in my life, & I've had well over 50 of them. Great job Melting Pot, if it's going to be bad don't hold back, & you didn't!
On the bright side, thanks for making it easy to give up on you, so many better places and better attitudes to visit then here. Steve, it's not all about profit on Valentine's Day, at least make an effort to make the guests or at least the wives feel appreciated.

Dear @TheMeltingPot,

When we arrived, at 6:25 for out 6:30 reservation, we were greeted by two hosts, a younger boy/girl pairing, that took our name (I gave my last, she called me by my first). and were promptly seated in a two person booth in the main dining area on the main server path. I thanked the gentleman for the table and asked him if there was anything more "private" available. I was informed that the restaurant only had one private booth and it was already taken. My wife was handed a menu, as was i, then a drink menu, then a drink special menu, then an anniversary card from the manager (nice touch) and we were rapidly told about the Fondue across America, specials and a host of other things that were given too quickly to comprehend. The young man told us that our server would be over in a moment to help us at our now very crowded table. The first thing i noticed what that there was no place to put anything down. The two person table was very small and was barely enough room for glasses let alone a table side wine aerator which we had used previously. THe small leather bench seat sloped to one side and I felt like I was sliding out the entire time. The wall sconce was covered in dust and shook when the table in the upper section bumped the wall. 

Our server came within 2 minutes and asked us if we knew what we wanted to drink. we said we were unsure, because the menu had changed quite a bit. The server told us that they had gotten ride of all the thick menus because they were in bad repair and then pointed to my menu and said that i had gotten it too close to the heating element and it was now warping. We asked for a minute on the drinks as we looked at the mixed cocktails and she promptly left stating that she would bring us water and took with her the wine list and wine glasses. (its important to note that we did not say that we didnt' want wine, only that we were looking at what drinks we DID want). When she came back she asked if we had decided on dinner and we said we wanted to order our drink first but we knew that we would be getting the 4 course meal. My wife ordered a long island varient, and I ordered a craft beer. 

The drink orders were placed and we were again asked if we at least knew what type of cheese we wanted so that could be started. Before we could make a selection the waitress stated that we should do anything except the cheddar (my personal favorite). I asked why and she said, oh, you could totally do cheddar. I noted that 3 of the 6 cheese fondues were a cheddar variety. I asked for one more minute to decide because the menu was very new to us and seemed complicated. she left. 

The bartender brought our drinks over and place my wife's down before handing me a bottle of beer and a glass. This young man was very unkempt; his hair was a mess, his shirt nearly un-tucked, and his tie was tied to his mid-chest (about 5 inches short). 

We ordered the Wisconsin Cheddar and considered adding a craft beer, but this was neither offered, suggested, or raved about. So we stuck with the traditional lager beer mix. My wife asked if the watermelon and feta salad was any good and the waitress rolled her eyes and said it just watermelon and cheese... I wouldn't do it. She then commented that the house dressing had changed and that she would bring it on the side. I ordered a Cesar salad and a classic meat fondue while my wife order a house salad and beef and pot sticker fondue with coq a vin broth. (Note: these have different names on the menu, but honestly, I no longer care what they are actually called.)

The cheese was brought out quickly and hastily thrown in the pot and mixed up with barely and explanation of was was going in the mix. A small bowl of rye bred, sour dough, and 3 pieces of pretzel were tossed on the table with a small bowl of apples and vegetables. Without so much as an enjoy, our waitress was gone. I snickered at my wife who rolled her eyes and we began to eat. 

The cheese as expected was wonderful, although the vegetables consisted of wilted broccoli and dusty white carrots. The bread was not super fresh, but probably within standards, but the apple was good. Before we were half way through with our cheese our salads were tossed on the table. 

I had much more, but let me TL:DR this because it keeps getting snipped by Yelp.... don't go here save your money or go somewhere else that will treat you better. 

    - Your Cheese, although thrown together, was still tasty. I finished mixing all the Worcestershire sauce into to it, and it was great.
    - The meal, was as expected but the portions are much smaller
    - The green goddess sauce is still one of my wife's favorites
    - The Chocolate, was rich and creamy.

The Bad:
    - Service
    - Atmosphere
    - Quality of dipping items
    - Cleanliness

My husband made reservations to melting pot in Schaumburg on July 29 and tell them about the occasion. (We got married at that very day and we choose melting pot to have dinner because we had our first date in melting pot).

We were greeted with a nice and warm welcome. When we were seated we had a wonderful romantic table decorated with rose petals, red roses in a vase, balloons and heart shape candles. Obviously they put lots of thought and kindness to make this happen and I personally want to express our appreciation to Mr. Steve for that. The food was excellent as always. After we paid the bill Mr. Steve come to us and fix a mistake on the bill. It was really thoughful and kind of him to show such care to Melting Pot guests. We want to emphasize it is awsome to have people with a mindset of caring and we very much appreciate Mr. Steven's hospitality. We had very special night in our special day because of Mr. Steve and his work. Thank you to Melting Pot for having people like Mr. Steve and cherishing our memorable moments.

Liliana was AWESOME! We had a party of five, most had never been here. Our dinner was great, she was very patient explaining everything, or food was very good, very fresh. Just an overall great experience!

Despite the many available tables we passed by on our way to our table, I was surprised by the 10 min wait time...Being our first time here and to a fondue restaurant I was expecting more guidance from our waitress and there was alot of waiting just to order rather than serving orders...this can be a pricey but fun experience! We had the four course meal- house salad, loaded baked potato cheddar for our cheese fondue-you can ask for refill on the bread, the original and steak lover for entrees and chocolate s'mores for our chocolate fondue-you can ask for refill on the strawberries, banana, pineapple, marshmallow, pound cake or brownies to dip!

Took my daughter here last night and was meeting her friend and mom there. Told the host my daughter and I were going to get started with dinner since our friends were joining us later just for dessert. He said he would get a table ready then DISAPPEARED! About 10 mins later someone working at the bar came up to us and asked if we were ready to sit (?!?!) and walked us to our table and handed us a menu- all while chomping on a toothpick. Waitress was pleasant and efficient. Bartender brought the wine we ordered in a decanter with no glasses (still chomping on his toothpick!) 
Food was mediocre, my daughter had never tried fondue so went there for the experience otherwise Schaumburg has plenty of well priced restaurants with great food, service and ambiance. Won't be going back!

We had a good dinner at the melting pot. This is my son's favorite restaurant. We started with the alpine cheese appetizer which was great and served with veggies, bread and green apples. I had the 4 course meal which was plenty to share with my son ( we added a children's entree of chicken for 11.99 and between that and the kids meal it was plenty). The service was attentive. It is a pricy place but nice for a special occasion.

HORRIBLE! Not worth even close to what they are charging. This was my first time trying Fondue and it will be my last. I have no issue w the ambiance of the place which was on point or to the service which was on point as well. My issue was with the actual food! I got the pick ur three cooking style. I went with filet mignon to be on the safe side, duck breast and shrimp. The filet mignon and the duck breast were split in chunks and ure cooking them yourself in this pot they give u filled w boiling broth. The broth was a watery weird smelling thing w a pinch of orange. I cooked my meat and some pieces i had to literally take them out of my mouth w a napkin to avoid throwing up! We had the quattro formaggi cheese fondue and while delicious it was $18 for a small bowl of it. I got the groupon which was $39 for $64 I believe and still ended up paying $62 (w tip) out of pocket! If you are thinking of trying the melting pot for dinner DON'T. At least not the one in Schaumburg

Went on a Thursday with four people for $99 special. Was afraid I would be late for work tomorrow. Server was way off pace. Solid two hours and that was without dessert. 

The four for $99 is not a great deal, order off the menu so you have more choices and maybe your waiter will actually serve you and pay attention. Have friends that visit more often, but go with a specific server who is very good. They just didn't seem up to the task this evening. 

Have had very good meals other visits and are members of the fondue club. This time will probably be the last for some time. Life is to short to spend that long receiving mediocre food from a disinterested waiter.

I rarely recommend restaurants, but this restaurant is wonderful. The servers are always personable. Nathan did a fantastic job, making sure we had everything we need, without overcrowding us. The Quattro Formaccio is always a good choice for the cheese course. The house salad with their Garlic and Wine seasoning is amazing. The S'mores chocolate fondue is both entertaining and enjoyable, when they flambé the marshmallow. Overall, I strongly recommend this restaurant.

I cannot begin to explain what an amazing experience I had here. It was a group of 4 of us and a sleeping baby  we had the best server, Linda. Hopefully if you go, you get her because she was extremely helpful very pleasant and since this was our first time she took the time to really explain and help us decide on our food. She made it very fun! We did the 4 course and everything was just incredible but the best part was the chocolate at the end we got the s'mores and the banana one and they were soooo good! All in all awesome experience and we will definitely be coming back!

This was a gigantic disappointment. We paid extra to have our kids attend a "little chefs" cooking class.  They literally were allowed to dump cooked mac in the cheese (that was apparently for the whole table, including adults) for $15. To make the chocolate one parent had to leave the table and take the kid up front, where they only had dark and white chocolate, not the kid's choice as advertised. We were charged more for our bottle of wine than we were supposed to be, and full price for every adult. The chef hats they were promised didn't fit, even remotely. This was poorly executed and management was unwilling to help, whatsoever. On top of everything else, the service was atrocious. I would have left happily, still, if the manager Nick would have listened to my concerns sincerely. Instead he was rude and combative. We are former customers now.

This started off as a zero start experience-but went way up from there.  We got there for five or ten minutes before an 8:30 reservation.  Half the tables were empty, but we had to wait 20 minutes for a table.  By this time I had started freaking our because I was on a schedule to be home to feed my infant.  Glad I said something to the host (who I assume to be the manager).  He immediately started our cheese when we sat down.  I wish the other courses would have come a little faster, but glad that at least one wait time was cut down.  I have been here before and love everything except the chocolate fondue (too much for me).  The cheese fondue and all the dipping sauces are my fav, as well as the yin yang martini.  The beef was especially awesome that night too.
