The only other annoyance was this table of women who were so loud it was ridiculous, but there isn't a whole lot management could have done about that besides move us (which we obviously did not have time for).  I mean there were even times we had to yell to hear each other across the table, and they were at least 3 tables down.

If you like overpaying to wait hours for small portions, this is the place for you! I had always wanted to try this restaurant, so when the Marine wives decided to get together for our monthly outing, I was excited! Being 8 months pregnant, I figured it would be a nice night out for dinner and I could be home at a reasonable hour. I thought wrong. Our reservation was at 7 and we were still waiting to pay at 11:15! I finally gave my
friend cash for my portion of the bill and headed home in hopes of not being up all night sick from eating so late. Never did I think I would maybe be home by midnight with a 7 PM reservation! 

We look forward to our monthly outings because we rarely see our husbands and the get-togethers provide some much needed "adult time." This experience was extremely disappointing and far from enjoyable. We had a group of 13 people crammed in a corner and only one server was assigned to us. It was quite a lot of work for him to even do drink orders himself, and about half of us weren't even drinking anything other than water! Needless to say, it was at least an hour in between courses and the portions were very small for the amount they cost. My salad didn't even have any dressing on it, but I was so starving by the time it finally came that I just ate it. I didn't want to wait another 20 minutes to get dressing. 

We had purchased Living Social vouchers prior to coming. That was a nightmare when it finally came time for the checks. The checks must have been run four different times until our whole group finally waited by the door, tempted to just walk out (it was after 11:00). The manager was involved at this point, but expressed no sincere apology. He said. "Thanks for telling us because otherwise we wouldn't know. We just thought you ladies were enjoying your time catching up." Maybe if he had come over to our table just once in the 4 hours we were sitting there he would have seen the look of boredom, frustration, and starvation on our faces. 

As I was walking out, I heard the manager, John, tell the group that dessert will be taken off the bill. Real
nice- one person ordered dessert and the other people who ordered dessert never even got it. 

This was a huge disappointment of an experience I very much looked forward to and the worst management I've ever seen in a restaurant.
Place is great. make sure you set aside a 2 hours window of time. it takes about that long to get through all the courses. great atmosphere.

I really did not like this restaurant. Had heard mixed reviews from friends, some who absolutely loved it and some who hated it. I fell into the latter and could never go back. Main reason being I got food poisoning so terrible about 3 hours after I got home. I mean bad. Honestly, even if that would have not happened, I really just did not think anything was that good. And for the price, you have to love it.

Don't get me wrong, they have some tasty food. The alpine dip was good, but the bread was nearly hard as a rock. Yummy dipping sauces. Chocolate fondue was good...5 mini pieces of dessert to dip with was not. For the price you pay, you should get so much more. 90% of this I could've made myself or done myself at home...melt some cheese, chop some chicken, cut up some bananas, etc. Much better to use your money elsewhere for some great (instead of mediocre) fine dining.

We went here for dessert only for our belated Valentine's celebration. We had the turtle fondue and it was pretty good. The waiter took a while to serve us at first but once he got to us it was fairly quick service. At one point he asked what were our favorite pieces. Near the end he brought out a small plate with just a few of those pieces and, "Yay desert!" was written in chocolate. That was a nice touch :) 

I also ordered hot chocolate which was just okay and served without whip cream. No biggie but in a place like that I would expect something a little bit more fancy. At the very least presentation over taste.

The food here is always awesome and tastes great. I have been here twice this week and maybe ten times total. That said...

The bathrooms here are freaking nasty. There's piss all over the floor. The toilet seat has cigarette burns on it, it's barely attached and does not fully flush. I've seen better gas station toilets. This is the second time this week I've been here and they have them in the same condition. If the bathrooms look like this, imagine how nasty the kitchen could be. 

Second time this week I had to send the silverware back to the kitchen because it was dirty.

If they got their act together with the bathrooms and the cleanliness here, this would be a four star place.

First time at MP. Nathan the server was amazing and very helpful with the menu. I had the four cheese to start. It was perfect. For entree I had the pick three. I chose duck, sausage and tuna. First time I've had duck. It was alright. The sausage was nothing special. And the tuna was a little fishy for my taste. For dessert I had the Original - chocolate and peanut butter. That's was yummy. The  manager cleared my entree dishes and brought my dessert. He was friendly as well. It was good and I'm glad I did it but I wouldn't go out of my way to do it again.

So, I have no not been here in about 8 years. Went in today (Sunday) at about 2:30. Took about 5 minutes to find someone to seat me and my son, even though the place was empty. Got seated, nice gentleman server. Couple things to note on service: he brought the wrong cheese fondue, although I didn't notice until after we ate it and checked the menu. Forgot the extra side plate of meats for the fondue, but eventually brought it, and I had sent back because we were on to the meat meal. Brought the wrong red wine, but forgot forgot to charge me for the second glass, so..... Nice server, but slow, and forgetful. Server was good at explaining the sauces, so that was nice. Ying yang chocolate fondue was delicious, def recommend. Price seemed fair for what we ate, service was forgetful, but attentive and tried. Would do again. Decor seemed a little dated, could use a nice brush-up.

Don't! Simply don't bother wasting your time, good company and money by going there.

I rarely write review about a place. But an experience this bad should be heard by many. This place either should get a reality check or learn how to do business in service industry.

It's been 48 hr since we've been there, but all of our clothes still stink like we were dipped in the old dishwater..

Nobody was at the concierge, we walked in at 5:30 pm, waited a few minutes, decided to walk in further to look if anyone was even in this place. Only 2 tables were occupied, walked around the empty tables. Someone we ran into ordered us to leave the area and wait by the door, so we did. Another party walked in, finally there were 6 different parties by the door by 5:50, someone came and asked "anyone with reservations?" I said "we came first, tables are all empty, don't you need to ask who came first?". He ignored and walked around the crowd and grabbed people who claimed to have reservation. After he grabbed the second party with reservation, I said I am leaving. The man at the door with an attitude said "be patient!" Without even looking at my face. If I wasn't there for an appointment with my other party, I would have walked out when the dishwater stink hit my face; which was a loud indication of unprofessionalism. I wish I did. Things got worse.

Food was absolutely lowest degree, mediocre, for the $$$ price range they charge. For 4 people, we ordered only 1 MEAL it was $16, 2 pop drinks, 3 salads $5.5 ea, 1 chocolate fondue. Bill was $102.00 with tip. I have not even eat or drink anything, but water!

People who says this place has good food has never eaten good food, obviously!

Waitress also had an absolute worst attitude, lack of elegance and experience.

We walked out smelly, angry and hungry. I will never ever go there again. Even if they offer free. Not worth to waste my time.

This was a huge waste of time and money last night. When you make a reservation for 14 people, you would expect expect it to accommodate 14 people. This was not the case. They shoved us in a booth with a table next to it that barely sat 9 of us. Then they pulled in chairs and put them around the booth. Very crammed and uncomfortable. 

They had the reservation a few days in advance and we were the only large party in there. Honestly I think they forgot about our party and stuck us where they could. 

The service was bad. I don't know if the guy was new or just not that great at being a server. It wasn't his fault really. He was clearly over whelmed and needed help. He was nice and you could tell he really tried. Alas, we didn't eat anything until after 9:30. 

At one point the empty pots in front of us had to be replaced because they were on for so long. The water had been boiling for over an hour and the server said, if we don't replace these pots and start new, everything will burn. 

The salad wasn't much of a salad either. It was a couple pieces of lettuce. Super small portion of a salad honestly. I ordered caesar salad and it had nuts in it.  I've never had a caesar salad with nuts before.  Honestly I was so hungry I didn't bother to complain. I just ate it. 

Dinner comes and it's fine, except I feel like all I got was meat. The side of potato, mushrooms and broccoli consisted of one small potato quartered, 1 broccoli floret and 3 mushroom caps. We were to share that with the 4 women at the one pot. 

Then to top all of this off we had living social vouchers. We told the server as soon as we sat down we had them and told him they were for dinner for 2.  We were all paired off so really all we would have had to sort out was drinks and if you ordered anything extra. This was a disaster when it came time to pay our bill. 

When we were there we watched people around us come in, sit, eat, and leave. A table was turned twice while we sat there! Never did I ever think I would be going out for a meal from 7-12. I would never ever go with a large party to this place. You may want to eat before going to. Portions are for people who aren't really hungry.

We got here and the place was not busy at all. Maybe 10 tables, we waited at the bar and the bartender had no idea how to make a drink. I ordered a southern comfort and ginger ale. She asked if I'd like that in a martini glass?? Then she told me how it was her first night she used to be a hostess. 

We sit down and our waiter was rude and not very helpful. I ordered another drink while we sat down and took 16 mins to get my drink and a glass of water. 

The manager was running around very disorganized. I would NOT recommend this place to anyone. Save your money and go to an organized place to eat

So this was my first time doing Fondue....I must say I was a little hesitant.  I wasn't too keen on what I had heard about me having to do all my own cooking!  Lol.  Well, it turns out that I had a blast!!  The food was delicious and it was alot of fun with friends!  I totally would of rated this place 5 stars but our waiter was a little slow.  We waited a half hour for a salad and he kept bringing the wrong drinks but as far as ambiance and quality of the food, it was great!  We had the combination plate which was chicken, pork, shrimp, beef, and I think filet....it was so good and believe it or not, so filling. I really didn't think this was going to fill me up because the portions didn't seem that big but they really were so filling!  This meal included a salad and a desert.  And just when you think your so stuffed, you have to indulge in the desert....oh my!  I must say, probably the best desert I have ever had!!!  I forgot the name of it but it was dark chocolate with bananas, strawberries, brownies, cookies, cake....oh my!!!  If you've been contemplating trying fondue....give it a chance, it's great, especially here!

Went here tonight w my two friends. I will say that the food was 100% amazing but the service was SO SO bad and for the $$ we spent there I was expecting much better service then we got. It took 20 min fir our waitress to say hello and take our drink orders, which they were short bartender so it took 40min to get the drinks that tasted like crap so those were on the house. Problem is, we got our cheese fondue and our waitress didnt ask if they wanted water while they were waiting for their drinks , they had to ask for them. We needed to remind her to add the red wine in our cooking oil, which that was the main ingredient and the reason we picked it!!!! Everything we asked for, it took at least two times of asking to get it! We were there for 3 HOURS!!! I could see if it was bc we ate and stayed and chatted... NO it was bc everything too sooooo long. We waited to be greeted and our drink order taken, four our first course to come, for the chocolate menu ( which we asked for before we started eating so we can be ready but never got) another 10min for our chocolate order to be taken... Ugh we were all so pissed and disappointed plus plain tired of sitting and waiting!
The bathrooms were very dirty and they had two chairs in there w all these stains on it , it was just gross i think i might have gotten herpes if i sat on one. Again, its way too nice of a place and spend way too much $ for there to be a nasty dirty bathroom, yuck! The cooking shows always say, take a look at a places bathroom and it will tell you about the restaurant... Hmmm maybe a repeat visit isnt such a great idea!

Despite having a 8:00 reservation, we are still sitting at the bar as of 8:40 with no table ready yet. When we arrived to no table, we reminded them that we had made a reservation. We were told very rudely "everyone has reservations". No apology, no "sorry, it will just be a few minutes", nothing.... just a rude response. Why take reservations if you don't have a table for them when you arrive?
We will not be returning.

We've been here 3 times in the past year and have had great experiences each time! We made reservations each time and were seated right away, except for last night. We arrived and were told it would be about 5 minutes before our table was ready. This was no problem to us at all, but the manager came over and told us to go order a drink at the bar on him! This was totally unexpected and very thoughtful, especially since it was only 5 minutes we would have had to wait! The bartender made us custom drinks and was very personable. The food is pricey but really good! Each time we went we did the four-course meal. It's a fun experience and not for those who want a quick meal. It takes a lot of time but is a lot of fun throughout! We've always been treated very well and will continue to go back! Would recommend this place to anyone! Especially for a date night!

I have been going to the Melting Pot for a few years now.  I used to go to the one in Buffalo Grove, but they have since closed down, which is even worse news to me now that I have found out how the Schaumburg location is. :( 

I came here 2/11/15, a Wednesday night, for a valentines dinner with my boyfriend (getting in ahead of the crowd).  I was so excited, literally have been begging to go for a year now.

We arrived and were seated promptly, it wasn't too busy especially considering it was a Wed. night.  My boyfriend and I both ordered drinks, he had an angry orchard, I had their white moscato.  Both were alright.  

Our server, TJ was alright.  He was not super attentive as we had long wait times in between pots, and he was not great at checking up to see if we needed anything while dining.  I know the waits between pots is usually existent, but for how slow the restuarat was, I feel we waited longer than usual.

My favorite part is the apples and cheese, luckily, the apples tasted pretty fresh.  The cheese fondue was very tasty, something with mozzarella and tomatos.  The bread and vegetables on the other hand, did not taste so fresh.  The normally delicious brown bread was SO DRY AND STALE.  The vegetables were dry and definitely looked like they had been sitting in a fridge for quite some time. Also, I noticed the portions they give you for dipping have decreased quite a bit, which is fine since you can get refills on these (which I did end up with more apples, thankfully)

Next was salad.  I always look forward to the caesar salads here as they are always tasty.  Sadly, when we received our salads, the lettuce was browning on the edges and tasted wilted.  Salad size was also significantly smaller than I remember.  

Next, we had our entree.  I had "The Classic" my boyfriend had the steak lovers.  We used the oil (bourggeoine, however you spell it).  The meats were alright, except the "filet mignon" which did honestly tasted worse than the teriyaki sirloin.  Also, the sides, veggies, potatoes, etc. were again way smaller portions than normal.  For our entree, our server was basically nowhere to be found so we were unable to request more sides.  Our server also forgot the batters that typically come with the oil, so we had to request these from the manager, whom by the way awkwardly passes and eavesdrops his tables FAR more than any manager should. Every now and then is great, but c'mon man, back off a little while we're eating.  

Finally, we had our chocolate.  So sad to see that the dessert treats they give you at the end have also significantly decreased in quantity.  We probably received about half of what I used to receive when I attended Melting Pot about 2 years ago.  No more cheesecake, far less fruit and dippables.  The strawberries did not taste too fresh either, pretty crunchy.  The chocolate sauce menu has been cut tremendously as well.  What used to be at least 8...9..10 choices, is now about 3 or 4, and they definitely aren't as adventurous chocolate flavors as what I've had in the past.  

Our bill was higher than I've ever spent at Melting Pot, granted I had two drinks, my boyfriend had one, but that is pretty typical for every visit I've ever had.  

Ultimately, I'm disappointed with the experience.  Everything was just a huge let down from teh last time I went.  Way less food, making it way less bang for your buck.  The quality of everything seems to have all around decreased, while the price seems to have gone up.  

I will not be going back, it is not worth the money.  This makes me so sad to say because I used to love this place, but it definitely was not the same experience I've had many times in the past.

***Another important thing to note: Maybe I'm crazy, but I definitely remember receiving a hot mitt cover to cover up the HOT fondue pot handle.  We never received a cover to this handle, which made it pretty difficult to do our fondue while the pot was spinning all around and neither of us wanted to grab the hot handle.

We were here with a group of 20ish to celebrate a birthday in the family. I did not handle any of the logistics of booking or payment, so I write this purely from the perspective of a guest.

The ambiance of Melting Pot is rich and romantic. Paintings of chocolate fondue, soft lighting, and sturdy furnishings set the mood. As far as restaurant layout goes, we were split between 6 tables of 4 right in the middle of the restaurant. I was sitting in a place that sort of felt in the middle of traffic, so I had to move gingerly if I needed to attend to my children or use the restroom.

Speaking of restroom, I found both soap dispensers in the women's room completely empty. The staff quickly filled them when I alerted them to the issue, but really? Such a "nice" restaurant should be all over things like that. I mean, they require regular filling, right? Also, no changing table, which is a huge drawback in my book. I did appreciate the seats in the restroom though, where I could at least perch to change babe's diaper.

As far as food goes, we had two courses. We skipped the cheese fondue appetizer, which I heard is widely appealing. We did enjoy our main course, for which each guest could choose 3 meats. I had sausage, shrimp, and filet, all of which were pleasing. I would recommend maybe skipping the sausage though, as the shrimp and steak were much tastier. My son found the chicken noteworthy too, so that might be worth a try. Several members of our party enjoyed the salmon and recommend cooking it for a shorter amount of time than is recommended (like, 30 seconds if you can stomach lightly coked fish).

Dessert, obviously the real reason anyone even eats here. Fruit, cheesecake, brownies, marshmallows, all dipped in chocolate? Yes, please! We ordered the white and dark chocolates, and it was a very pleasing combination.

Overall, the food was enjoyable. Not a good value at all, but a cool place to go for the experience. I can see why a 10 year old would choose it for her birthday celebration.

The reason I'm giving Melting Pot two stars rather than three or four, is due to the service. As I previously mentioned, our party was split among six tables, and I don't think they did a good job preserving the "experience" for us at all. Instructions for cooking were not given clearly to each table, and I would have liked an explanation of how the whole fondue deal is supposed to work. Instead, the attention given to each table was sporadic at best, and we didn't even see the chocolate being melted into our dessert pan, which I think is supposed to be a presentation. I also never got a drink refill I requested, and we had to flag down someone to ask each time we needed more water. 

This was definitely an enjoyable way to celebrate my niece's birthday. If you've never been to Melting Pot, it's worth a try, even if you never go back. On the way out, I noticed a Monday night promotion for $18.99 that includes cheese fondue and dessert. No main course there, but perhaps a better value and a good way to try it out if you're new to fondue. It took us about 2.5 hours for two courses, so do allow plenty of time for your visit.

I had to take a moment to review this location.  I have been to the one in Downers Grove but I wanted a local please close to the house for Mom's Night Out!  There were 7 of us and we sat at the bar at first and the manager bought us a round to start off our night...SCORE!  Then we were seated at a table by the window with a U shape with 2 chairs in the front.  Our server was training someone and I can't remember his name or hers but they were excellent. She answered all our questions as we had A LOT.  I think 3 of us were new to the Melting Pot while others had been but it had been a while.  The manager checked on us at the end to make sure our dining experience was good.  The only draw back was the time in which we were there.  Some of us opted for an entrée while a few just wanted cheese and chocolate.  That left them with nothing to eat/do while we "fondued".  Then one of the Moms became upset towards the end that she couldn't get her check right away so she left her cash and left.  I know fondue takes a while but I think we expected to be done by 9pm.  Our reservation was at 6:30 and we didn't leave til after 10pm on a Tuesday night.  All in all I had a great time.  We enjoyed the Crave Tuesday special which consisted of 2 glasses of wine, cheese and choclate for $25 on a Tuesday night.  There was also a 40th anniversary 3 course for $40 but none of us opted for that.  I personally had the filet, cheese (cheedar and alpine), cooking style Mojo.  The girls opted for the bunt cake chocolate (limited edition) and the toffee/turtle?

My boyfriend made a reservation well in advance for a very important occasion. I understand that the restaurant was having problems with firing some poor trainees in the very recent past, but having to wait another 20 minutes after our reservation to be sat was a little steep. And then waiting another 10 minutes to be greeted by the server. Our reservation was for 7:30 and we didn't get a bite to eat until after 8:30. 

I recommend the artichoke cheese dip and the caprese salad to start off with. 

As far as entrees goes, do not get chicken. 

And you can't go wrong with dessert. Yin & Yang was delicious. Although make sure to get a nice glass of milk! It'll make everything taste better.

I don't eat cheese. Seriously. I eat pizza with cheese and a little chicken Parmesan with cheese when it's well done, but that's about it. So why go to a fondue restaurant?  Well, at the request of my sister and cousin of course!

We went in on a Monday night after work. Both of them made separate reservations, so we were practically guaranteed a table. Oops!  Actually, we basically had the place to ourselves for the first half hour or so. 

We sat in front of the fireplace.  It was warm and cozy. I liked that a lot. I didn't feel like I was in a chain establishment based on the look of the restaurant. 

Our server was training a new server, but that went well too. The trainee had enough knowledge to keep things moving even without the trainer over her. She asked questions when needed, but it was obvious that she had either read "the manual" or watched video tutorials or something equally helpful. As the restaurant for busier, I do recall a little trouble keeping our glasses filled, but the service was decent up until that point. 

Since I don't eat the cheese course and just watched during that time, I had a salad, a duck/steak/shrimp combo and the dessert. The salad alone was worth coming back for. If it is available as a carryout item, I would probably even do that. The pine nuts were such a nice change up. I ate every bite!  Duck is newer to me. I've had it a few times at special events where it was part of an appetizer, but sort of hidden within the bite. There was no hiding this duck. I didn't love it. It is an acquired taste. And I'll probably try again, but maybe not at The Melting Pot. The steak I chose had a teriyaki style marinade and sesame seeds. I'm not sure why they bother because once I put the steak in the boiling chicken broth, the seeds fell off and I didn't taste any of the marinade when the steak made it to my plate. The shrimp were large and delightful. The veggies were plentiful and I was grateful to have a mushroom water at the table so those didn't go to waste. Note:  the potatoes take about ten minutes, so put those in right away if you want to eat them during your meal. 

Dessert. Ah glorious dessert. Another item that would cause me to visit here again without pause. We had the original which was milk chocolate and peanut butter swirled together to make a fabulously decadent dessert. Add cheesecake bites, brownie bites, fruit chunk, Oreo covered marshmallows and basically you've got my heaven on a plate. 

The cost was a little beyond what I anticipated for a chain in the suburbs, so keep that in mind. But if you plan things right and don't overindulge, this can be an ideal spot to dine.

We had reservations for 7:00 pm. We arrived at 7:10 and they proceeded to seat all the 7:15 and 7:30 reservations before us even when they came after us. We waited til well after 8 pm. I've never seen a business run like this. We should have been seated at the next open table like every other restaurant. This isn't a Michelin star rated restaurant, and after this experience, it's clear why they never will be.
Linda from #Schaumburg #restaurant is great. Cheerful, happy and helpful. Actually, all staff should have a #shoutout from Sam the greeter to other servers. Really warm and welcoming restaurant"
I wish I could give no stars. My husband and I had a date night resvervation for 7:00 on a Saturday. The wait was so long (30+ mins)  and the staff so indifferent, we left and ate at Whole Foods.

We never got to the point of having food! 

Had reservations last Saturday for 2 @ 7:45pm to celebrate our 8th Wedding Anniversary. We had requested a table in our online reservations. We arrived at 7:42pm and the hostess stated that we would be checked in and seated. With that regard, we assumed we would be seated shortly. 25 minutes pass and we are still standing there all while 2 open tables are sitting there ready for people to be seated. 

When I ask the hostess what is the issue is, she explains that they are busy and waiting for tables to clear up. I point to the 2 open tables and she turns and faces her computer and start with err, um, oh, well.... Not her fault, she is NOT properly trained.

The manager then comes over and I explain that we have been standing here for 25 minutes for our reservation and NO ONE has said anything to us, and that the two tables are sitting empty. He and 3 other people huddle around the hostess stand computer , they ask my name again , and they all seem disorganized. 

The manager walks back over and states they are busy, just because there are open tables it doesn't mean we can be seated and then starts to assimilate our not being seated to a doctors office visit and not wanting to have to wait for a doctor in the examination room. Great, you are really going to compare a dining experience to a doctors office visit? That was ridiculous so we walked out and went to another restaurant where everything was top notch and they made us feel they wanted our business 

How about when we checked in the hostess explain that they apologize, but they were running behind, would we like to sit at the bar or be updated as they progress. They could have avoided this whole scene.  PURE AMATUERS!!!

After visiting The Baking and Sweets show at the Schaumburg Convention center a little while back, and seeing The Melting Pot at the show, my cousin learned I have never been to The Melting Pot. After she came to from here shock that the Yelp Elite Member hasn't been to TMP, she informed me that they have a Ladies night deal where you can go for under $20 and try out several courses. Schaumburg's location offers this deal on Mondays, so we made some plans to visit! We called up my sis and we had a ladies date! See, Melting Pot management...attending the show was worth it! :)

I made some reservations online, per their recommendations, as did my cousin (whoops!) and a few weeks later, I met the girls for dinner and left the hubby at home to eat leftovers. Thanks for taking one for the team, my dear!

We arrived about 6pm to find an empty restaurant, but we didn't let that bother us. We were there to visit with each other. A major plus was the staff totally catered to us! We got to pick our own table and almost had the feeling we were kinda having our own private party! 

Our server and server trainee where very kind. Obviously, this gentleman had been doing this for a long time as he was very knowledgeable. That, and he was  training, so obviously, he was a seasoned veteran at TMP. The problem I had was that he was "comfortable". A few tips from me: serve from the left and clear from the right (or vice versa). Unfortunately, there was a LOT of reaching from across the other side of the table. Note: we were seated at a round table in the center of the dining room. Do not hand me my drink; please set it down in front of me. Do not stretch across the table to hand me plates of food, please come around and set it on the table. When you stretch across the table, your dress shirt can easily drag into the food on the table and it did. 

As the night went on, the service began to lack. We had empty glasses more than once. At one point I had to steal my cousin's water because I needed something to drink, and we had dirty dishes on the table a lot longer than necessary. For a while, we were without any servers on the floor. Everyone seemed to be in the kitchen so we couldn't even ask anyone to get our server for us. 

About the food: I loved it. I love small bites. The original cheese fondue was EXCELLENT! I enjoyed watching them prepare the fondue right in front of us. That was very cool. I should have skipped the extra protein and stuck with the $19 deal. The additional proteins were just too much food. I wasn't able to enjoy dessert because I was totally full. 

I think I would like to go try the location in Lombard to see how they roll.  I might be back, it was very yummy. I would just like to see some improvement on service when I return.

Great food, excellent ambience and very nice staff.  However, the service is sooo slow.  I understand a fondue meal can take time, but three hours is a bit much.  We were a large party and due to overbooking they seated us in a booth, very cramped and hot, which unfortunately took away from us enjoying the full experience.  We were all reaching over each other to try the only two pots at the table with way too many sticks cooking in each pot.  Then I would say it was about a 20 minutes or even longer wait in between each part of the meal.  Our server was very, very nice and polite, however he did not do a very good job of explaining the fondue experience; how to order, how to cook items, etc..   Fun and delicious place to eat with a nice and accommodating staff, but they need to improve their speed of service.

This place was great.  You should pick the server Ian if you want a great experience.  It was a little expensive for two people but was worth every penny.  We had the four course meal with cheese, salad, main course, and desert.  They have a contest for free fondue for a year.  If we win I think we would die after 6 months!  Ian was attentive explained the menu well and he was extremely patient while we made our decision. Not only did we have an amazing meal by he made our ordinary date night special with his wonderful personality. So thank you Ian. We will be back!

I've never tried a fondue place before so I was very excited to go. I went last night (thursday) and I was not impressed, at all. My date had made a reservation the night before but they said they couldn't find it. Luckily we got there 20 minutes after they opened and we didn't have to wait for a table. Our server was not the problem he checked up on us and made corny jokes. He also explained the menu very well for our first time experience. In the first round (the cheese) we were not impressed with how little the portions were and how there was not much variety. Then we got the salad & I've honestly never seen a smaller salad in my life. We both ordered the something "fusion" came with lobster tail, poultry and steak. The portions were not that big and our pot wouldn't come to a boil due to the stove malfunctioning. After a while it started to work. Lastly we got the chocolate and the variety was alright but the strawberries were bad and there was not a lot of fruit for dipping. I expected to be impressed but left disappointed. The bill was very high for such a lousy experience. 
Also the women's bathroom was very dirty having toilet paper all over the floor.

I had my birthday at melting pot and boy, didn't we have fun! Linda was our server and she was fantastic. Perhaps the best server I have come across in a long while. We each had a 4 course meal since we wanted to try everything. They gave complementary veggies, fruits and bread that we could refill. 

The food was good and the experience of cooking your food with your friends was exceptionally fun. The ying/yang chocolate fondue was the highlight of the night. We were stuffed before desserts, but were able to clean up the dessert platter simply because it was absolutely delicious!

Linda was very friendly, helpful and SO sweet. She surprised me with a nice birthday treat and lit a candle for me to make my wishes. Before we ended the night, she left me with a small gift. It was such a kind gesture that made the night a memorable one.

Great place to dine in and have an awesome time with friends and family.
Didn't have such a great experience here.  The food wasn't that great only reason I gave em 3 stars was for the wine!

It was my first experience at Melting Pot and it was not as I expected it to be...I must have expected a Cheesecake Factory feel or something better and a fun time?...

I would not recommend coming here if you like to have your food ready ASAP and want to eat and leave right away...but if you want something to do and want to use up time....it would be a good place to come too...I think it took my friends and I around 3 hrs to eat the 4 course meal (Big Night Out) because we had different pots for the cheese, broth/oil, and chocolate...it took a longer time than anticipated to cook the meat and with the cheese and meat cooking.. and then there was the wait time when changing pots...

I think it's something you can do at home...and possibly get better results with the food..

for the cheese, we ordered spinach artichoke and the cheddar cheese.. they were both good.. but i felt like i could just do this at home with a fondue set...

for the salad, I got house salad (everyone gets to choose their own salad)..it was pretty good....but not amazing or anything...

for the entree, we ordered oil and broth to cook our meat... however, i would just recommend using the broth to cook the meat because the oil is set to such a low heat setting that even if you put the batter on the meat, it comes off and you do not get the same taste that you get when eating any fried foods (ex: tempura...fried potatoes...)....it'll just cook your meat/veggies.. but the batter will all come off...

for the fondue dessert, we ordered the chocolate that was mixed with caramel and dark chocolate.... I don't think you can really go wrong with chocolate...so everything tasted good (well to me at least)

pros: fondue dessert was delicious (if I were to come here again.. I would probably come here just to eat dessert with friends..).....atmosphere was good for hanging out with friends....waitress was nice and thorough in explaining everything to us...atmosphere was ok..as it was Monday evening so the restaurant was not busy...

cons: there was wait time when switching pots..and the meat cooked very slowly since it was on low heat (probably due to restaurant liability so that customers don't get burned from the oil..)....nothing really amazing about the food...if you like to cook.. you can probably just fondue at home...

This place was horrible.  The waiter could not remeber anything.  It took over 20 minutes just to get a soda.  I paid over 250 for 4 people and when we left we were still hungry.  The bread was stale.  The cheese sauce tasted horrible.  You guys have been warned. If you eat here you will be waisting alot of money for nothing.
I love this place!! Always great food and excellent service! I always go to melting pot for any special occasion and I am never disappointed with my choice. A++

Given a choice, I would never go back to this place! Staff is extremely unfriendly and food is just alright. When it comes to cleanliness I would give them a zero!! Plates and cutlery were really dirty, I had to wipe everything a couple of times before using, nonetheless it was never clean!! We were waiting for our friends to join but the lady at the reception didn't show the courtesy to ask us if we wanted to be seated while waiting, later when we insisted she walked us to the table as if she was doing us a favour. Overall an unpleasant experience and we are never going back there.

Celebrated a birthday tonight. Between making reservations, changing reservations, being late on top of that, and then the actual dinner beginning to end.. We had a wonderful time and were always treated as a priority. Our server David was attentive and knowledge plus he had a good sense of humor which added to our fun evening. A bonus was the manager Steve taking the time out to make sure all patrons were enjoying their dinner/evening. We appreciated his time and added conversation to our evening because he was not only delightful but it showed he truly cared. I was skeptical to come to this location due to the average reviews however both our server David and the new manager Steve, I feel this place not only was deserving of a higher rating but also showed the passion to strive for all patrons to have an above average experience. I will definitely be back to this location again.

The wife and I came here for a murder mystery hosted by the Murder Mystery Company http://www.grimprov.com/ .  

It was a fantastic night with dinner and a murder.  I had been to a Melting Pot in the past, the Buffalo Grove location that is now closed.  I enjoyed my night and enjoyed all of the food.  The fondue style dinner is a nice experience if you haven't done it before.  I enjoyed all the food and the preparation was great.  But, personally I'd rather not have to "cook" my food to eat it.  When I go out to eat I want the food brought to me so I can put it straight into my mouth.  This is not Melting Pots fault, I'm just telling you how I feel.  Melting Pot is a nice place to have a fancy dinner and by participating in the murder mystery that night it added another fun element.  Our waiter was great and I would recommend coming here for a nice dinner.

How do you not like fondue? It's fun! Maybe if you are my dad who is a steak and potatoes guy, that doesn't like "silliness", but if you appreciate food and adventure. It's great quality, lots of flavors and sauces. 

You will not leave hungry if you do the four course experience. It's wonderful for anniversaries. I get the emails, made a reservation online, mentioned it was our anniversary and the promo code to get SIX free chocolate covered strawberries! 

When we arrived, they gave us a private booth with a happy anniversary card waiting for us. Every staff member, hostess, waitress, manager congratulated us and gave us a strawberry shortcake dessert in a martini glass with the chocolates bagged to go home, we couldn't possibly eat any more.

Honestly, I had not heard great things about the Melting Pot before I came here, but I came on Ladies' Night (every Monday night) with a group of gals, so I took a chance. I'm glad I did. In the past, I have made my own fondue, so I didn't know what to expect going out. I was surprised at how full and satisfied I was when I left!

The drinks here are not cheap....at all. I had a beer and that was about it. This is a place where you could definitely drop some money if you wanted to. Luckily when we went it was about $19 for a salad, a choice of cheese, and a choice of chocolate. We had 9 women, and we devoured 2 pots of cheese and 2 pots of chocolate - and we were all stuffed. This stuff goes a long way. So even though it doesn't look cheap, you will be full when you leave. If you run our if anything, they are happy to bring more. We tried the plain cheddar cheese and the brie & bacon. Both were great - the cheddar gets a little stringy. The chocolate was great too - we got the Ying Yang and Cookies and Cream. Everything was just as good as I thought it would be.

The hostess and waitresses were all very nice and helpful. They came to our table numerous times to make sure we had enough drinks, dippers, and to that we didn't have any questions. 

I personally wouldn't get an entree - you don't need it. It's just an extra expense and meat/oil. It's fun, (I've done it at home), but if you're looking to save money this is something you could cut out. This sort of thing is a treat for me. I would come here often, but I think I would enjoy it when I did!

My best friend and I are cheese lovers to the max, so this was our slice, er pot, of heaven. We entered hungry and left in the most massive food coma.

Our waitress was friendly and explained everything really well. When my friend and I began craving other things to dip, our waitress actually informed us of all the other options available (including some of our cravings!). She was kind enough to bring bowls of broccoli and all sorts of other stuff. That was super cool. A lot of other waiters probably wouldn't have done that.

After we dipped everything possible but our chairs, we were offered the dessert pot ... LOL. Yeah, when I get a second stomach!

All in all, the meal was fab and I'm so glad we went. I can't believe I've been hearing about this restaurant for so many years and didn't go sooner.

This was my first time going to the melting pot for a special occasion. The food service concept is different and fun for your first time but it's not something I would do again. Its also pretty expensive. The service wasn't bad but was slow at times. When it's your first time the server spends sometime with you to explain how the fondue  thing works and to set up the appetizers and other courses. I think my group and I were there for 3 hours for a 4 course meal. It takes a while to set up the courses and to wait for your meal to cook. You cook the meats for the main course yourself. 

We did 2 cheese appetizers, the loaded potatoes and spinach/ artichoke dip which was the best part of the meal in my opinion. Then we had a salad which was pretty standard salad. Then you choose your main entree which is raw meat (chicken, shrimp, lobster, steak, port etc.) that you cook in broth or oil at the table. You also get many different dipping sauces for the meat. By the 3rd course we were very full but made some room for the dessert. You get to choose what dipping sauce you want. We picked white chocolate/dark chocolate mix that you dip fruit, marshmallows or cake into. 

If I did go again I would only do the appetizer and dessert. The main entree is not worth the price.

Our family of five went to the Melting Pot and had a terrible experience. One of the two burners to cook the food was not working. When we told our waiter, he sent the manager over. The manager thanked us for telling him and he would make sure it got fixed, What??!!  The five of us tried to cook all our food In one pot. Ruined the experience and took forever! Two had never been to a fondue place and after this experience, has no desire to try it again. 
Terrible customer service and this manager should find another line of work!

I must say... this is one of my favorite restaurants! 
We've been there four different times, and have always experienced awesome service, very tasty food, and some of the most delicious cocktails that I've ever had! 

We usually always start with salads (very good! You can actually purchase their salad dressing) we always order cheese, which is prepared right in front of you, using all very fresh ingredients and spices. They serve you with a good size platter of veggies, bread and chips.. To dip in the sauce. I promise.. Even if you dislike cheese, you will love this! 

We've only ordered an actual dinner platter, twice. We usually were stuffed after salads and cheese. Of course wanting and making sure that we had room for dessert. Which of course, I will tell you all about dessert. :) 

The dinners are pretty darn good! However, the times we went.. they made us order two! They were not allowing us to share, which I thought was pretty crappy! It's darn near impossible to take home a doggie bag! They should considering allowing people up share.. after all.. you would make and sell way more! They may have changed it in the last month, but I doubt it! 
Clearly if it's a preplanned event that has been organized by the restaurant, let guest share! 
The dinners we have had.. are super good! Fresh and very filling! 

Dessert.. where shall I start?! You are given a huge plate full of fruits, cake, pretzels and other goodies... Can we say, yummy!! We honestly are always unable to finish the pot of chocolate. Heck, we have a hard time finishing any of their pots! All portions are very large, which is not a bad thing. 

Service has always been outstanding. Our first time there we had one awesome waitress! She was very good about coming over, making sure we understood how everything worked, and that we were OK and that the food was as awesome as we had hoped, which it was! 

They have some of the best darn drinks that I've ever had. They offer a very wide variety of wines, beers and mixed drinks. However, the drinks are slightly on the pricey side, still worth it. 

Overall, the place is awesome! 
It is something you can make at home, but it's nice to be waited on, and just enjoy yourself. 

I highly recommend making reservations a week or two in advance if you plan to go on a weekend. They tend to book up quickly.

Dessert was great, as usual. Service started out a little rocky--we then found out they were down three servers--but our waiter Kourtney was there to save the day! So sweet, personable, and very accommodating!

My family and I have gone here every Christmas Eve and have a great experiences.
After our last Christmas eve visit it may very well be the last. 
TJ our server was not at all attentive to us and the whole feel of staff has changed. 
We watched people that sat down after us server before us.
When we had to consistently ask for more water we finally complained. 
The management handled it awful. 
When we wrote to corporate and complained we never got a response. 
We also are very disappointed in the menu changes, just not the same.
Had a great dinner at the Melting Pot in Schaumburg. Our server David was very attentive and a good sport! Great food and great service! We can't wait to come back :-)

My girlfriend loves The Melting Pot so we usually go every year for her birthday. 

We've been to both Schaumburg and Buffalo Grove? (Now closed) over the past few years and never had any issues with the service. They have always been attentive and informative about the food as they serve it.  They left my gf a birthday card and it said Happy 9th Birthday!  We thought it was funny. 

The only downside is the price.  $100 for 2 people (water to drink) is insanity. I can probably eat for the entire month on that. It's not like you're getting a gourmet meal either. Don't get me wrong, everything has always been fresh and it's a huge meal when you do the cheese fondue, a salad, main course AND the dessert, but you can do this at home so easily......I wish we would!

I came here in a group of 4 and we had the 4-course experience. This place was overpriced, service was incredibly slow, and most of the food was mediocre. Definitely not worth the price I paid. The stars were for the fact that the dessert was at least pretty good.
Had a lovely evening. Jay out sever was great. Must have reservations. If they are busy they don't seat walk-ins. Dessert was my favorite course. May go back just for the yin-yang chocolate. Mmmmm!

Going to the Melting pot on a date is always romantic. The atmosphere here is romantic and I especially enjoy the booths here because they give you some extra privacy. The service here has also always been great. The cheese fondue is also excellent.  I really enjoy the beer cheese one :) While I find the meats to be good I don't feel like they are worth the price charged. Many places in the area have better cuts. The dessert fondue however is excellent and a must have. I also miss the beer and wine flights. They had them on the menu for a short time and they were great. Paired perfectly with each course. Last time we went here they were gone. Over all a nice place to go on a date.

My recent experience was terrible.  I have been to several other locations and have to say this one was the worst.  The service was awful.  Like one of the other reviewers, we were waited on by TJ.  It too forever to get drinks and for most of the dinner we were without drinks.  He rarely checked on is and the service was really slow even though it was not that busy.

I was not  aware until I arrived that Sunday was family night were free dinner is offered for children 12 and under.  I asked not to be placed near any young children and about 10 minutes into dinner they say a table 2 tables over with 3 kids including a baby that screamed most of the dinner. The drinks were terrible as well.  We orders the cherry drink, which I have order at other locations and was great-however at this location is tasted like cherry cough syrup.  The food was decent, which is why I gave 2 stars.

This location is definitely not on par with other locations I have been to.

I've never been to a place where the manager cut us off from ordering more vegetables instead of carbs with our meal. We declined the bread since we can't eat gluten,  and wanted more broccoli as a sub. They give small portions,  with several trips to the kitchen,  and after about 20 min and 4 tiny bowls of broccoli,  they cut us off. There were four in our party and the bill was close to $250 with a few drinks. We ate at taco bell after because we were still hungry. Of course we declined to eat dessert there to avoid spending more money on little samples.  Talk about massive profit margins and a brilliant restaurant idea! Kudos to the owner. I'd rather eat elsewhere for the price and quality.

I believe that I've outgrown the novelty of fondue. It's pretty good food but to need to sit still and watch food cooking for two plus hours is not the way I'd like to spend my night.

Fortunately, the folks that we went with were pleasant conversationalists and the waiter was somewhat attentive so we had a pretty good time.

The food was fresh, the veggies and fruits were abundant, the "big night out" salad was tasty (I had the spinach) and the cooking styles were tasty. 

Bottom line, if you've never had fondue and have nice company and a few hours to kill, check it out.

Came in here with a groupon this past sunday (groupon was only good sunday-friday) which was like 40 bucks for 60+ dollars of food. It was two salads and two entries. We upgraded to get a cheese and dessert as well which was honestly the highlight of the meal. I should add that I've NEVER had fondue before. The cheese was good, I'm not a big fan of wine so that did kinnda mess with  the flavor for me. I liked that the waiter makes it table side for you, by putting the cheese and other stuff into your pot to melt. We got the classic alpine so maybe the swiss made it a bit bitter? Not sure still ate it. It was pretty empty for a sunday which I thought was odd? Most people I know go out on sundays. The waiter was nice, very informative and professional. Def sounded like he'd worked there for a while. Now the meat course...this is where it fell apart for me. I didn't realize that basically your eating boiled meat. :x blech. I got the beef fillet mignon which should be like the best cut of meat right? Ehh I ate one piece and then the boyfriend ended up having to eat my portion. He got the pot stickers and shrimp which he was was good. But man the beef was gross. Just like...flavorless?? Would DEF never do the main course again especially since it was like 25 bucks a serving. Now the saving GRACE was dessert! We got the ying and yang chocolate dessert and it was AWESOME. Best thing I ate all day :) I think I will come back for dessert and cheese. But be prepared to drop some money! Before the groupon was applied the bill was around 110 bucks!! After the groupon it was still around like 40 something. Now the ONE thing that REALLY annoyed me was there was a waiter talking to another waiter behind our booth about how he's gotten stiffed on a check (only got a dollar on a 90 dollar bill). He was stomping around complaining to himself and obviously pissed. I think this shouldn't be done clearly in view of customers. I would assume if that table used a groupon like we did, their bill probably was only 10 bucks after groupon...meh dont know we still tipped well but I think people tip crappy because they've already spent 40 bucks on basically a coupon.

Oh and on a side note, they put us in this dark corner that was freeeezing. I'm sure they thought me and the boyfriend wanted a romantic dinner at 2pm but come on. There was plenty of well lit areas by the windows that was open. By the end of the dinner I was warming my hands on the fondue pot!!!

Also I'm seeing people got cheesecake with their dessert fondue. We did not get that on our plate. Which now that I think about it makes me upset if they forgot to give it to me if I paid for it.

My family and I went to this restaurant and as soon as we entered we felt immediately unwanted. The hostest and the owner looked at our family up and down and took a couple of minutes even to say hello. We asked for a table of four and the hostest said we would have too wait, even thought it was a wednesday night. The place was not packed at all, there was clearly a whole section of tables. When we finally got seated we noticed that there was a total of three other tables in our section, in short...They were not busy, they could of seated us quickly. The issue? Our race.

We were with our black father and white mother, and me and my sister are mixed race. When we sat down the owner very rudely explained that it was a fancy place and that my father could not wear his hat. The table next to us, had a couple where the man had a hat on. He did not ask him to take it off, as they were already on their entree. They asked him to take if off because of his race, this goes back to discrimination. 

All and all we felt discriminated against and worst of all it was on my 17th birthday.
Great food, fondue is always great fun. We had great service here and a wonderful time. I just wish it had some more affordable options.

Great options, nice price relative to what you get. The portions aren't as large as Gejas but the menu and price is better. If it wasn't in a strip mall it'd be a much more romantic option. Too bad it borders a taco bell.

Missed some of my old favorite like Mexican cheese.  That was the biggest problem.   Waiter was OK forgot my meat to go with cheese.  Only bother mix up but other wise good times .  Kids like to go. Nice time

Came here to celebrate my friend's 18th with five other people-what a treat it was!  We decided to go all-out with the four course dinner, starting with a tasty caesar salad.  After that we had the spinach-artichoke cheese fondue which I could have eaten all day, and on the other end of the table was the cheddar dip, which tasted too much like alcohol to me.  For the entree I had "The Classic" with everything from shrimp to steak bits, cooked in the Coq Au Vin which was very good with the proteins.  For desert we had the "Flaming Turtle" flambe which was also very delicious.  

The Good:  -Service was very good and attentive for the two-hour venture we had (Thank you Omar!)
                     -It was my second visit after a ten-year gap, and the menu has certainly    gotten much better and expansive.  
                     -Delicious cheese dip, entree and desert!

The Bad:  -Man am I glad that I was treated to this dinner!  It was around $50 per person so make sure that when you come it is for a very special occassion.
                   -Make sure you are familiar with fondue before you eat here

After a long day and some drinks, we decided to go to Melting Pot.  It was my first time but my friend goes all the time.  To be honest I was under impressed.  I appreciated the gluten free options and the knowledgeable staff but I was left with "mehhhh".

Our server, Alyssa was so sweet.

I will definitely go back but I'm sad I wasn't impressed.

Food at this restaurant is amazing. All the different varieties of salads and fondue is great. The server was amazing she helped out the table with everything since it was our first time coming here. 
Although it was a great food experience we won't be coming back here at all anymore. I mistakenly forgot a piece of clothing there and called right away to see if it was still at the restaurant, it was thank goodness. One manager told me he will hold on to it till I go back and pick it up. But when I went to pick them up they seemed to have disappeared and there was was nothing they could do for getting back my property they said they would hold on to.
Overall great food and atmosphere. Just if you go make sure you don't forget anything. It may be the last time you see it.

I planned a post-holiday dinner here for the team of professionals who work with my preschoolers with special needs.  There were 8 of us, and luckily there weren't any more, because I don't think anyone else would have fit at our table!  We shared 2 burners with the pots for fondue, and it was about the perfect amount of food.  We all did different versions of the 4-course dinner, and it worked out very well.  Our waiter, TJ, was very attentive, and did a great job of explaining the menu and offering suggestions for us.  

I thought the Swiss cheese fondue was absolutely amazing, and it was a substantial amount of food to dip in it (bread, broccoli, cauliflower, and apples).  I then had the Spinach and Mushroom salad, which was surprisingly good.  The "warm" salad dressing it was served with had me concerned, but it was delicious!  For the main course, I chose the Vegetarian plate, even though they were out of the onion rings described in the menu.  My friend next to me chose the Land and Sea, and the two of us shared the variety of items on our plates.  Everything was very good, with the exception of the chicken, which was just okay; not very flavorful.  The veggies in the Coq au Vin fondue were very good.  For the last course, we had everyone's favorite: chocolate!  We decided on the Flaming Turtle and the Dark Chocolate, both of which were amazing.  Multiple plates of strawberries, bananas, rice krispie treats, brownie bites, cheesecake, and marshmallows were served, and each bite was more delicious than the last (although the strawberries were hands down my fave)!

This is definitely a great place to go if you're looking for something a bit different, or if you've got a big group of people.

One tip I would like to share: if going here in the winter, when it is exceptionally cold outside (as it was tonight), do NOT sit near windows.  They are very drafty, and despite the warm burners in front of us, we were freezing the entire time!

Slow, slow, slow service.  Our meal took almost 3 1/2 hours.  We waited for every one of our courses.  No staff at bar area, and when someone finally did show up, they provided no receipt and overcharge us for a Lite beer and a house Chardonnay.  Claim they have a dress-code, but then seated a woman in a Blackhawks T-shirt & jeans.  Expensive with our meal costing $280+ for a party of four.  Lastly, reached out with my concerns to both the restaurant and corporate office and never received a response.  There are better restaurants in the Schaumburg area.

Four of us had the four course dinner tonight and it truly was not an enjoyable experience. The lobster tail was awful, the fondue liquid was bland, and the dessert was dry and disappointing. 

Our server was nice but not terribly effective with empty glasses lingering unfilled and crowding the tiny table. Service took just under four hours total, despite being told to expect two. This was due to long waits between courses 

The dining area is crowded, the tables are small and the acoustics are horrible. Conversing was painful all night due to the loud music and background noise.
Food was great, drinks were spot on delicious, and Omar is a fantastic server. Can't wait to come back!

Me and my boyfriend went here for our valentines day celebration. We had an awesome time! We got the fiesta appetizer and it was really tasty with a spicy kick which we loved. I wasn't a huge fan of the spinach mushroom salad, but I didn't come there for the salad so didn't mind. I got the seafood trio and he got the land and sea entree and we both were satisfied. I do sort of wish the menus were like before with the option to have a bit shared entree but it was still good. For dessert we got the s'mores chocolate fondue and it was really yummy! The chocolate was perfect and the dippers were fantastic, the only thing is I would have rather had the graham crackers on the side instead of in the chocolate. 
Ladies if you're looking for a good cocktail there get the meltini! Both times I've been here I got two meltinis and they are amazing! Service was good too, we were with Natalie and she was very nice and attentive. Overall great experience.

I had a few great experiences at this location so thought it's time to give my review. I had very enjoyable dining experiences at the melting pot. It's not a quick sit down dinner so you'll have to make some extra time for this type of meal but it's definitely worth it. Same with the prices-I'm sure they're above average-but you get what you pay for. 

I've never had a waiter/waitress that wasn't able to knowledgeably explain how the dining experience worked, or give food suggestions/recommendations, etc. So maybe I just lucked out there..since some other reviewers seemed to have an issue with that..that being said, I'd highly suggest those reviewers go back..I find it hard to give a place a bad review based on one server, one time. 

I would suggest looking up the menu online to get an idea before you go. There are so many different options of cheese and sauces to dip/cook whatever you choose..fruits, veggies, bread, different meats..They have such a wide variety. I almost forgot the dessert options..different types of chocolate fondue - to dip your choice of strawberries, bananas, pound cake, cheesecake, and more! (can't remember them all.) SO delicious! 

I've only dined here during the week so the atmosphere was nice & quiet. They have big, comfy booths which is great if you want a little privacy.

I used to go here often as a kid and just recently came back with my family for dinner. I had the bow ties with the marinara/alfredo mix and roasted peppers and it was delicious! The pasta was cooked perfectly and the sauce and peppers were very flavorful. I am not a big eater but I could have easily eaten the whole thing as well as the bread that came with. The only reason I didn't was because I wanted to save half for the next day! 

The service was friendly and the prices are reasonable. I would definitely go back again. If you are looking for good pasta and a causal environment, I highly recommend checking out Pastabilities!
Great place for lunch.  Reasonably priced and easy to follow menu.  Pastas and sauces are all very good! Time from order to eating is less than 10 minutes.  This now will become a frequent stop.

Someone used the word crispy when describing the eggplant parm - maybe they were confusing the crack they were smoking when writing their review with the food they were eating. There was nothing crispy about the eggplant parm I was served; it was mushy.  Average tasting.  Decent portion size for the price. Meatballs not good at all. Dish would have been much better with a piece of garlic bread than the plain bread that came with it.

Located in a quiet strip mall, Pastabilities may not come across as 'the place' to satisfy your pasta cravings. BUT don't be misled.

Appearances wise there is nothing exceptional. Its a standard order at counter, seat yourself and pick food when ready kind of set up. Food wise what I love is the fact that you can build your own dish - choose  pasta, choose sauce, choose veggie / meat add ons. 

We asked for Spinach Tortellini in Pink Sauce with Brocolli & Pine Nuts. We also ordered a portion of Fettucine in Alfredo Sauce with Mushrooms, Spinach & Chicken. 

The tortellini itself was nicely cooked. The Pink Sauce a perfect balance of white & red sauces giving you the taste of creaminess as well as a hint of sour from the tomatoes. The Fettucine Alfredo is some of the best I've had, top notch restaurants included. I have always loved the combination of cream & butter on my pasta (guilt!) The white meat chicken cooked through & through with the Alfredo flavors only made my eating experience that much more enjoyable. We had also ordered a side of garlic bread, standard bread nothing exceptional taste wise.

Pastabilities is such a great example that great food need not necessarily be in a fancy set up. Go ahead, explore this possibility!
Not so good!  The staff that works there leaves a lot to be worked on.  Ordered a chicken parm sandwich to go..and got home and ...no chicken...I called and was told....that happens and not to worry.
I eat here frequently  and I never had a bad meal, unbelievable Italian food for an awesome price! Owners and staff are friendly and make you feel like you're at home

All around good food. Enjoyed the eggplant parm.
The marinara sauce was tasty, very enjoyable.
I really appreciated the simplicity of the menu. 
It's a pleasure to walk into a restaurant and not be overwhelmed by a complicated menu.

Eating a nice Italian meal with my wife for about $20.
In today's world...pretty darn good.
8.5 out of 10

A friend and I were craving really good Italian, and decided to try out Pastabilities because it was close by, and had great reviews. Omg, we were not let down! I had the bow tie pasta with Alfredo, and my friend had the gnocchi with the normal sauce it comes in(marinara and Alfredo mix I think). Reasonable price, fantastic food, and great service! We will be back!
This little place has better spaghetti and meat sauce than most high end Italian restaurants in the city!!
Aside from the blatant gender discrimination of only having a baby changing table in the woman's bathroom (but not the men's), the food was good.
Great Pastas.. My fav alredo pasta
I went here today and the lady at the front was super nice. Food was good... nothing to write home about, but good. All in all, I'll come back.

Location.. Meh
Decor... Meh
Food.. As good as it gets!
The eggplant parm is the best i've ever had. Will keep coming weekly!

When I craved for pasta on a rainy day, yelp helped me to go to this place with its reviews. When I stepped inside, there was no any other customer except me!! So just thought of giving a try, I ordered a mostacciolli with pink sauce(marinara+Alfredo) and spinach tortilloni with alfredo. Mostacciolli and pink sauce were good but spinach tortilloni was excellent. It came with 2 pieces of bread. I loved the food and will definitely go back.

So everyone raves about this place but I didn't think it was amazing. Spinach ravioli is pretty good could be  better if it was spicier , the only have red pepper flakes as an option.  Also their bread is horrible, it was hard as a rock. The service was good though.

I'd like to update my review to share that I've eaten gluten free food here and I had no trouble whatsoever! I love their food so much. They now have gluten free eggplant parm and my husband got it so that I could try a bit (without committing to the whole thing). SOOOOO good. I'm going back again for sure! Yum!

I saw the reviews on Yelp and brought my extended family here. "Real fine dining," my cousin joked when we walked in. This place has the aesthetic appeal of a Subway sandwich place. I chastised myself for forgetting that you can't trust Yelp reviews of strangers who might have very different standards for "4 stars". How embarrassing. This side of my family is more accustomed to eating at places with... y'know... tablecloths and a wine list.  They're good sports though.

After we ate,y cousin apologized for giving me a hard time. "That was really good!" She said. I'm fact, everyone agreed that the food was all really good. My diavola ("hot and spicy pink sauce") was better than most of the fancy places I'd been in Highland Park. My wife's eggplant parmesan was fantastic - light, crispy, flavorful, not oily. The minestrone soup was good too.

It was also quiet so we could all hear each other.

They also have gluten free pasta which is nice for some folks in my family.

This is my new favorite Italian place, it's not a fancy sit-down restaurants but it has some unbelievable food. This is about as close as I can get as my mother cooking, and I love my mother's cooking. I live an hour away and I purposely find a reason to head out that way so I can get some of their food. They also have jars of sauce that you can take home and I bought some. I have not tried it yet but I assume it's going to be fantastic. I would recommend this place to anyone that is in the northern West burbs. The last time I was there I had a chance to meet the owner and his wife and they were very pleasant and down to earth. I haven't tried a whole lot of things on their menu but their meat sauce is to die for.

I think I have found my other go to place for a quick dinner.  I tried their pesto and I also tried their pink pasta sauce.  Both were super delicious.  I also had the I spaghetti and meat balls.  Everything they make is fresh and ingredients are bought that day.  That's what my co-worker told me.  It's a family owned restaurant.  The owner is a very nice personable man.  I will be coming here more often than more.
One of my favorites! Love everything on their menus. Fresh and fast service.If you love italian this is your place. You have to try it.
The food is decent. I can make better pasta and I don't cook unhealthy meals... I know how to use spices and flavors. This place is just so-so to me.

One of mine and my family's favorites! (In fact, I rarely made pasta dishes much after discovering this place.  They just did it so much better!!)

Eat in (smaller eating area - but still plenty roomy) or Carry out.  The dishes are delicious and the prices are EXTREMELY reasonable.  All of the dishes are customizable.  

For lunch or dinner....YUM!

The owner also does occasional lunches for the kids in the area schools (the ALL eat hot lunch on a Pastabilities day!!), and he is known to work with groups in the community and charities.  THAT matters!

I've lived in Buffalo Grove for the past seven years, and I've never gone into Pastabilities.  Frankly the decor leaves a lot to be desired and maybe that's why I've never ventured in.  However, looking for a quick meal last night, I decided to give them a try for carryout.  I ordered a gluten-free pasta with oil and garlic and added chicken, an eggplant parmesan, and a kid's ravioli with pesto.

For a place called Pastabilities, I was expecting better quality pasta and sauces.  The gluten-free pasta is now changed to rigatoni instead of spaghetti (which was fine), but the texture was just okay and it had virtually no flavor.  We had to basically drown the pasta with cheese to make it edible.  It was a similar experience with the kid's ravioli.  It was several dollars to upgrade to the pesto sauce, and I've had better pesto purchased from Sam's Club in a jar.

Wait - so why am I giving a 4-star rating if everything was meh?  The eggplant parmesan.  It's REALLY good.  It's not cheap at $8.99 which comes basically a la carte other than with a piece of french bread.  But it's not just a piece of eggplant with sauce.  They make it into a layered casserole masterpiece with plenty of cheese and sauce.  Texture is spot on, flavor is great, everything about this dish is perfect.  There's also no breadcrumbs for those looking to do low-carb or gluten-free.

I think this place is somewhere between 2-3 stars for pasta alone.  But then they get 4-5 stars for the eggplant parmesan.  We'll average out to a 4 star overall.

I loved this place. Whether it's for a bowl  of soup or pasta dish I've never been disappointed. Been coming for years now and plan to continue for the foreseeable future. Also  by the way, the best kept secret is the friendly staff.

Never really been into Italian food but this by far definitely has to be one of the only places I wouldn't mind going back to over and over again! You can make your own pasta and choose whatever toppings or pick from the selections. Their "pink sauce" is amazing which is a marinara and Alfredo mixed sauce. My personal favorite is bow-tie pasta with pesto sauce, mushrooms, chicken, and spinach. Their garlic bread is hands down thee best I have ever had!! They give you a good amount of food along with bread. A bit pricey if you add toppings but nonetheless definitely worth it!
Food is excellent.  Mark prepares a team meal for the Buffalo Grove football team every Friday too.  Love the pink sauce.

Boy, were we surprised when we walked in this place. Formica tables and ordering at the counter. The food was another matter. Quite good, made with great care and attention to detail. We had eggplant and chicken parmesan. Both were just about as good as we have experienced. Lovely marinara. Nice pasta. The grilled chicken was perfecto. The bow tie pasta with chicken, mushrooms and parmesan was amazing. The only weak spot was the minestrone. Fresh as could be, but lacking herbs and distinction. Prices cannot be beat. These people are nice!

Everything I've ordered here has been really good.  I recommend the eggplant parmigiana and carrying out. The food reminds me of a quality Italian restaurant but the dining room is very much like eating at a fast food restaurant.

To think it almost didn't happen.  I had read numerous extremely favorable reviews on Pastabilities but when I pulled into the shopping plaza and saw it was a vanilla looking store front eatery I had serious doubts about all those reviews.  I almost turned around.
Wow!  What a find.  Best in class!  This is my first review ever... mainly because the quality was off the charts so I feel compelled to share this culinary experience with others so they can enjoy this gem.
The minestrone soup was made from scratch and was delicious and generous in serving size.  I also had the mostaccioli with red sauce and meatballs. It was to die for!  If you love Italian food they will make your favorite dish just the way you want it!
Definitely will be returning.
Enjoy!

Tried this place last night and now it's definitely one of my favorites!! I had the spinach tortellini with mushrooms, mozzarella and chicken drenched in "pink sauce" which is a mix of Alfredo sauce and marinara (which was delicious)! Their garlic bread was also great! If you are in the area and are craving some delicious pasta definitely give them a try!

This place is amazing.  The sauces are fresh.  The options are endless.  My kids love it because they have toys behind the counter and the prices are super reasonable.

Sometimes the bread can be a little tough and the owner can come off crabby but he is a nice guy.  The cashiers are also super sweet and helpful when you do not know what to get.  One suggested I mix the pesto and Alfredo sauces. OMG it is soooo amazing!!!  Super rich but very tasty and a nice change from their usual.
Yelp you've helped me out again this place is as good as advertised. The gnocchi in pink sauce spicy is outstanding.

We love this place.  We eat in.  We bring home from Buffalo Grove to Highland Park (still hot and delicious!).  The variety of pastas and what you can add make this a really customized meal, and always delicious.  The sandwiches are also good - as is the garlic bread.  It looks like a fast food place, but you eat it like a fine Italian restaurant.

Like a previous reviewer, I too was very happy to find this place after moving to BG. It's got super-tasty quick Italian food. A local "fast-food" Italian place, if you will.

Personal fave: bowtie pasta with the Marfredo sauce (Alfredo/Marinara mix) with sausage cut into it. *MUAH*. I actually occasionally crave this dish. And the super cool thing is that I can call ahead, and it's ready in 10 minutes!

I think their food is quite tasty.
