The only think I've come across that I didn't care for is the "generic" pasta..which is pretty boring in my opinion - for example the pasta that comes with the chicken parmesan. The chicken is really good, but for that price I want both the chicken and the pasta to be equally mouthwatering.

Overall - a really great option for GOOD "fast-food".

Pros: Great food
Cons: a little pricey for what it is,
Should be 5 stars. Best hole in the wall pasta you will ever have in your entire life.

Great food, outstanding value. I've been going to pastabilities for years and tried something new for the first time. #87 was possibly the best pasta dish I have ever eaten. Angel hair, meat sauce, mushrooms, roasted red peppers and hot peppers.

This fast food Italian joint nails the sauces. Garlic and oil is well done, and marana and meat sauces are home made, with a fresh tomatoey zest. Try adding some hot peppers to make it hot n spicy for a small upcharge. Meatballs are tender and big enough to fill you up and the chicken parm is on point. Each meal comes with some Italian bread on the side and comes in at 6-8$ a fair price. Service is quick as well. 

On a sour note, pastabilities has shrunk their portions as of recent times to keep up with food costs. You get less noodles and less veggies in your pasta. Rather than shrink portions, they should cut out the bread. Carbs on carbs?

Still, the prices are just fine for the quality of the sauces and meats. I love eating Italian without the sit down table service and its not corporate so you want these folks to do well. I will be back soon!
Great!! In town from NC and wanted a delicious meal...exactly what I got!! I had the spinach tortellini with pink sauce, and mushrooms and I added chicken and mozzarella cheese!!! YUMM
First time at this restraunt Excellent food, great service, friendly staff. I'll be back soon. Looking forward to that!

Good quality food and a very reasonable price.

We go often!  And have for years

My favorite place for pasta. Forget your Olive Gardens and other Italian places. This place has them beat. 5 STARS easily given.

You can customize your pasta all you want here. But you owe it to yourself to try their basic meat sauce and meatballs. DELICIOUS. I used to eat here every week when I worked close by. Never once did I get remotely sick of it.

My Niece and I asked my sister to take us to some place new today. She decided to take us here for dinner; a place she hadn't been to since moving away from the area. I'm so glad she remembered... it turned out to be a treat for all of us!

My Niece ordered the Mostaccioli w/o sauce and extra bread. My sister ordered the Mostaccioli w/marinara sauce and bread. I ordered the Meatball sandwich w/friench fries and immediately wished I had more time to look over the menu. I feel like I missed the opportunity to eat healthier Italian food by going conservative. 

The portions are really good for the price, fast and friendly service. The busperson is quick to pick up after you. My Sister left him a $3 tip for her appreciation of his great service.
Great place for pasta and sandwiches! You can mix and match until you find the perfect combo of pasta! The food is great and the service is better!

This is definitely the place for custom made pasta.
Custom as in you can choose what pasta you want and what sauce you want and what toppings you want!

Also, need to point out that the map on Yelp is incorrect.
Pastabilities is located in the plaza on the corner of Lake Cook and McHenry in the same plaza as the Jewel Osco!

My favorite place to eat. I come here 1-2 times per week on my lunch break and have never been disappointed. All of the food is DELICIOUS and the people here are friendly and always greet me by name. Mark is an excellent manager. 
The pasta is always cooked to perfection which is hard to find, even in fancy Italian restaurants. I'm particular about it not being overcooked and I have never had that problem here (and I've been coming for 5+ years). I usually get the gnocchi with marfredo sauce or the mostaccoili with meat sauce and mozzerella. I've also tried the fettucini alfredo, homemade lasagna, and italian sub and ALL have been fantastic.
Good prices (though they do go up every so often), tasty bread, and great portion sizes. I will be back, probably tomorrow. :)

This is a small storefront restaurant that makes a big difference. What they do is pasta. How they do it is GREAT! You go in and pick your pasta, then your sauce, then your toppings. That simple. The taste of the food is anything but simple. The sauces are well seasoned, the pasta is firm and the toppings delicious. Stop in for a great Italian treat!! Although they have a few tables, this place is designed mostly for takeout.
The only complaint that I have is that their "garlic bread" is just plain (and hard) artisan loaf with no anything...only comes with a side of plain butter.

The pictures on Yelp are accurate, the average entree price is around $7.99, portions are a good size, and it's very tasty.  They are quick turning around your food in under 5 minutes.  On top of that, they use real dishes and forks/knives for a fast food restaurant.  When you leave, they will come to the table for you and remove your dishes.  

I was extremely surprised that they have an extensive low-carb menu for dieters.

I took 3 of my co-workers there on a Tuesday.... we came back there on Friday (a few days later) because we like it.  Look for coupons on their website.

Just had Pastabilites for the first time after a friend told me their chicken parmesan sandwich was top notch. He was right! Not an unhealthy amount of food, comes with a nice sized side (pasta salad for me) and the bread is delicious. I like the menu as I'm a big sandwich fan. They also offer a low carb menu that my wife will totally dig. I'd say to give it a whirl. Very affordable for what you get. I was impressed.

We are hooked on the cheese lasagna! It is so good, huge portion, great value. Every dish comes with a side of hot, tasty bread and butter. The chicken parm is good as well although I agree with other reviewers that the spaghetti with it is just average. They have tons of create your own options, will have to try that some time if I can tear myself away from the delicious lasagna! The kids meals are big and reasonably priced, comes with a drink and they also gave our son a prize from under the counter. Really nice people, too.
Ordered last night and pasta was delicious!  Had Saranello's pasta the night before and this was by far so much better!  Love the gluten free choices for my daughter.  We will definitely be back!!!

For a "fast food" Italian spot this place does not disappoint. Not sure the eggplant parm is the worlds best as they claim but it wasn't half bad either. Love the fact you can create virtually any pasta dish you want and get it minutes later.

The service was friendly and the sauce was delicious.  I recommend the "Garlic and Oil" for a lighter feeling meal.  The pasta didn't seem all that fresh or unique for supposedly being "home made."  Too bad, too, because I love fresh pasta!!!

We as an office ( Nierman Vision Center) eat here quite regularly and are always happy. Food is very good tasting and is prepared in a timely manner. Staff is very friendly and the place is always clean. Recommend when we have patients looking for a bite to eat.
Excellent!  I've been coming here for about 20 years and love the Spaghetti with meat sauce. The service and food are consistently awesome!

I think people are so generous cuz its considered a fast food place. It's a little bit better than frozen pasta from the market. I had bow tie pasta w pink sauce and mushrooms, spinach as toppings (came w little bit of onion). Came out to a little bit over eight dollars. Wouldnt go there again... u can get lunch specials at other pasta places for this price.

I work nearby so I have had Pastabilities for lunch on a number of occasions. It is always delicious pasta, whether I make the combo myself or getting their lasagna or ravioli and adding meat sauce. Cannot speak to health benefits of pasta. But if you want tasty pasta (different types) and sauce this is a great place.

Pastabilities IS AMAZING!

I grew up in this area and Pastabilities was huge part of my childhood / teenage years. They have been at this location for as long as I can remember. Mark the owner is super friendly and passionate about this place.

I love love love the spinach tortellini with pesto. Mixing the pesto with the alfredo sauce is really good too. Honestly I always have a hard time choosing what to get once I've been away because it's all SO good. The meatball sandwich on the garlic bread is killer and really good for lunch with a side of pasta. Oh and the chicken salad in the summer is the best I've ever had. 

It's really fast and reasonably priced. Good food, family owned and local. I miss it just writing this review.

This is a regular stop for lunch on Mondays in Buffalo Grove with the work gang.  The owner is their 99% of the time and is great.  The place is a great find for a quick casual Italian meal.  The menu is quite extensive with many pasta dishes ready to order or you may make up your own dish.  Also great sandwiches like Chicken Pannini, Chicken Parm, Subs with awesome quality meats.  Every day there is a different Special at lunchtime to keep things fresh for you and always reasonably priced.  Highly recommend and great on your taste buds and wallet!

Stopped in here, very hungry, low on cash, in the same strip-mall, and with the high Yelp ratings.  Boy oh boy were the Yelpers right.  Fantastic food (soup and Pasta) and great prices.  This is a no-frills place, and you can have your pasta however you like it.  You pick everything that hits the plate, and I especially liked that they had a whole wheat pasta option (linguini only).  The only reason this is not 5-stars in my book is because of the plain-Jane nature of the restaurant itself, but then again, that's part of how they keep their prices low.  Great place.  I'll be back!

I was really upset years ago when the Vernon Hills location shut down. I found this location and it's just as amazing. The bread is great and pretty much any dish you get there is top notch yummy. You'll walk away satisfied, with some for left overs and a big smile on your face.... guaranteed!

Yum! I have been here a handful of times during my lunch break, and it is great! I am the type to usually find a favorite dish and get it forever, but I have tried many of Pastabilities options. The "pink sauce" a mix of marinara and alfredo is very good. They are also GREAT for groups (my office has brought more than 20 people at a time and they always accommodate). There seem to be some great lunch specials too, and free bread with my meal is always a plus!
Okay if you are in the suburbs and you want a quick meal this might be the place for you. It's cheap and good what's not like about that? Great for the kids and on the go.

Great food that's actually homemade at great prices. It's literally addicting the quality is so good. Finding a place with awesome service and a great product is rare. This is defiantly one of the best places to eat.

We've lived in Buffalo Grove for almost 5 months and we just happened to give this place a shot recently and we were pleasantly surprised! Eggplant Parmesan & lasagna were amazing!! Tomato sauce was delicious....all at a very reasonable price! Can't believe i didn't try this place out sooner! Will be back for more!

This is my favorite restaurant on the planet. I know that every time I go there, there will be a quality, reasonably priced, italian dinner. The staff is always courteous and friendly and the food is ready in minutes after I call in my order.
This is a good place to eat or carry out. Many of us locals use them for our catering too. You will not be disappointed.

Fast, friendly and reasonable pasta, salads or sandwiches.  I would give this 3.5 stars if I could.  Gets busy at lunch, sometimes you have to wait out a few slowpokes.  I like their sandwiches, like grilled Chicken on foccacia or italian beef as they come with a side (such as a side of pasta).  Not too many quick pasta places, and this is pretty decent.
Good food, good value. Chicken parm's a winner

They have Gluten Free Pasta!!! It's made with Organic Corn and Quinoa Flour so NO wheat!! I can't explain to you how excited I am. I found out I had all these allergies and it can be hard to find somewhere to eat. They are really nice people and it's great food - GO!! :)

every time i go there, i feel so welcomed by cordial staff and owner, mark. the food is fresh, warm, 'and just the way i like it', as if mama had made it herself. pre-orders are welcomed, too, in case you have a tight time frame. i am hooked on pastabilities, no. 91, to be exact.

Another good lunch place in this vicinity. The sauces are all real good from garlic and oil to marfredo to regular marinara and alfredo. The pastas are all tasty and the couple times I've had a sandwich it wasn't too shabby either. Great spot for a quick lunch but tends to get real crowded at that time too.

Less than a month from my original review & time for an update? Yes!  Because now we have visited them a couple times for dinners, tried a variety of their amazing baked treats AND we've gone there for breakfast.  All of it has been top-notch delicious with friendly service! And truly the prices on their baked goods are fantastic...considering they are all made from scratch & you would pay double the price at Mariano's or another bakery for comparable items (but the goodies from Olde Salem Cafe taste WAY better than anything you get from Mariano's).   Here is my original review:
****************
Wow!! I cannot believe I have been missing out on enjoying their delicious meals, sandwiches & desserts for all this time! Do not let the rather sad looking strip mall they are tucked into fool you...inside is some wonderfully delicious food served and prepared by some really nice folks.    Thank you to the Yelp weekly Oktoberfest-themed newsletter for bringing this hidden gem to my attention!

On our first visit I had the Rouladen with roasted potatoes & the Hubs got the Hunter's Schnitzel with spaetzel (minimal upcharge for spaetzel & it was worth it though the roasted potatoes were delicious as well).  Both meals came with homemade rolls & butter and a plate with 3 kinds of vinegar-based German salads (carrot, cucumber & tomato - all very good).  We both took enough leftovers home for one more meal and in the case of the Schnitzel even 2 more meals so the portions are generous.  They have a good amount of sandwiches and appetizers to choose from in addition to the meals so I cannot wait to come back and devour my way through all their offerings.  They also serve breakfast on Saturdays & Sundays and I've head good things about that, too, so I pretty much just need to camp out in their parking lot for a couple of weeks...

I would be remiss if I didn't mention their mouth-watering selection of baked goods & desserts as well.  It's all from scratch and we had a hard time deciding from the display case...they don't have signs but our server (not sure if she is the owner as well? - but she was so friendly & helpful!) explained what each one in the case was.  Since we couldn't decide we took home 4 different slices of cake/dessert to enjoy over the weekend and we were not disappointed!  Everything we tried was so moist & tasty and even the 2 slices we had the next night were still perfectly moist & delicious.  I honestly don't remember the names of the desserts we tried but I don't think it matters what you get - it will be YUM-O!  Whenever we want to just pick up some dessert I will definitely go here instead of going to the market.

The service was friendly and helpful but not obtrusive...she gave us plenty of time to look over the menu and answered any questions we had.  Our water glasses & software drinks were promptly refilled when needed without having to ask and the main course food came out about 15 minutes after we placed our order.

Let me start off by saying WOW!! What a find. This cafe apparently has been here for a long time and I have never knew it. I just drove passed it everyday. 

The food here is delicious!! Homemade German food!

HOMEMADE in case you missed it! We went when the restaurant opened for breakfast and we ordered a few different plates. First plate was Eggs bacon and potatoes that are very well seasoned. Next was French Toast and let me tell you The French Toast is AMAZING!! Its made with homemade German bread its was lite and fluffy and ooo soo good!  Then we got a order of Apple Pancakes and just wow!! Your taste buds won't know what hit them. The location has just been expanded and remodeled and when you walk in everyone is so nice and friendly and inviting!! 

I would definitely recommend this location! Great food decent prices and good portions!

My boyfriend has told me about this place ever since I met him, this was over a year ago, and today we finally got to go! We both got Cuban sandwiches. Amazing. They are so delicious, juicy, and crispy. We also got a pretzel dog and white bratwurst to go with a side of fries, everything was perfect. My boyfriend also got a tarimisu to go and he loved it as well. The desserts were so beautifully presented.

I cannot wait to go back and order more food. Hopefully one day, I can stop by for breakfast! I recommend this place to anyone who wants to try something tasty. They also have gluten free items!

Great schnitzel and price, better than any other German restaurant I've been to. Very bright and clean place. Generous portions. I'm surprised it wasn't very busy tho we did come early afternoon. Everything except the hot dog/brat buns are homemade, even the little bread buns and the desserts. Nice hidden place. Definitely coming back again.

This is my new favorite restaurant. We come in several times a week now, and I have never been disappointed! The food is delicious - you have to try the schnitzel and spaetzle. I dream about that spaetzle. The desserts are to die for! Everything here is homemade so you can't go wrong no matter what you try.
Just had a delicious meal at Old Salem Cafe very authentic very pleasant very delicious this is a must visit

never come to this place for custom made cookies. I'm having a party and I wanted sugar cookies decorated with a "k" or an "e" and some cute simple designs. I know most bakeries don't do custom cookies but this place said they did and they promised me I would love it, so I accepted.After a week I went to pick up my cookies and I was so speechless and I felt my heart break. The decorations were absolutely awful the stars and hearts on them looked like blobs and you couldn't even recognize the letters. They charged me $85 for 110 small cookies but in reality with the awful decoration those cookies look like they were worth $20. I was so discouraged with these cookies I literally had to redecorate all 110 because ALL 110 COOKIES LOOKED AWFUL.

The food from this place has been nothing but amazing. My wife and I dine in often and have tried a majority of the menu. They are a full service bakery   (with a huge display case) and their brownies are to die for. The staff is super friendly and all their German food is home cooked fresh. We used them  for catering an event with brats, hot dogs, hamburgers, the most delicious sauerkraut, and the best potato salad I've ever had. It was a huge hit. The pricing was really reasonable. They supplied all the condiments as well as plating and utensils. Thank you Old Salem Cafe for an awesome and easy experience. Highly Recommend!

This past summer, I learned about the Olde Salem Cafe at a farmers market. I think it was the Schaumburg one. Anyhow, I had the most wonderful brownies that day they had prepared and I knew I would have to visit their storefront soon. 

I was in the area looking for a quick bite to eat when I remembered they were nearby. I turned right where I thought they were and I was exactly right. They are located in a small strip mall directly across the street from Long John Silver's. This is one of those "don't judge a book by its cover" places. Literally. The window coverings are kinda haphazard and it looked dark inside, but the open sign was lit up and so I wandered in.  

While it was dark inside and a little chilly, it definitely smelled fantastic!!  And I was greeted by the sweetest lady. It took me a while to decide and while I was working through my options, she took multiple phone orders. Looks like they do a great carryout business for lunch! Then a couple came in to take a look. I quickly learned they had been here before and knew exactly what they wanted. There is a self serve refrigerated case in the front filled with brownies, tarts, homemade banana bread, zucchini bread, blueberry bread, streusel, cookies and beyond!  They unloaded a bunch of items on the counter, paid and quickly took their sweet goodies to go. 

It was decision time. They make their own pretzel rolls. I absolutely had to try one. So I had a grilled chicken sandwich on a pretzel roll with fresh cut French fries. I also took home a yogurt fruit tart and a mini zucchini bread. Let's break it down:

The pretzel roll was actually shaped like a pretzel which was cute. But more importantly was how fresh, soft and tasty it was. This was a five star item!

The grilled chicken was a little but like a chargrilled chicken and a bit too charred in some areas for me. But it was seasoned and juicy in the center, so it was still pretty good. 

The fresh cut fries were lightly salted, hot and greasy. Aren't these the perfect adjectives for fresh cut fries?

The yogurt tart was suggested by the sweet woman working there.  I think it's about five layers. A cookie layer, a thin layer of something like jam, a layer of sponge cake, the thick layer of yogurt that didn't really taste just like yogurt but rather had a deeper thing going on there and a top layer kinda like jello but not. And the fruit. This was rich and creamy and awesome. Truly a five star item for me as well. 

I cannot comment on the mini zucchini bread yet because I haven't dived in and it's hibernating in my fridge at the moment. But it looks awesome and if it's anything like the rest of the food, I'm guessing it will be another home run!

Without a doubt, I will be stopping by again soon to try some more of their tasty treats and savory menu items.

This place is great! The food is like being invited to your German grandmother's house for dinner ... your grandmother who lives in Bavaria, that is. It is totally authentic, totally home-made, and totally delicious. They have a small but full menu, covering breakfast, lunch & dinner, all excellent southern German dishes. The Spätzle [home-style noodles with butter, salt & pepper] costs extra, and it should - it's among the best I've ever had, anywhere. The baked goods are outstanding, too, as you might expect from a business that is also a bakery. Each item is hand-crafted, so the service can be a little slow, especially when there are a lot of customers. This place is hard to find; I would have never found it without Yelp's help, and even then it was a bit confusing. The outside is a plain storefront in a nondescript strip mall called 'Olde Salem' - hence the not-particularly-German name. The business isn't really a 'Cafe,' either (although they have great coffee), it combines a retail bakery and a small sit-down restaurant. Ausgezeichnet!

Came by this place on the recommendation of a co-worker.  Located in a strip mall kinda plain inside but the people are super helpful and friendly.  The food is great. The Cuban was wonderful. My dad had the gulasch which was like a pork stew he was funny saying they should serve seconds.  

Fries are homeade and nice. The gravy from the gulasch went well with them 

We took home some awesome pastries.  Soo good!!  

Will definitely be coming back here.

If you like authentic German food this is the place. I have been working on a project nearby and I eat lunch hear almost every day. Keeping that in mind I have tried almost everything on the menu. That sausage platter is my favorite. Everything is made to order from scratch. The desserts are to die for.   Prices are very reasonable. And it is a very welcoming place. If you like German food and are in the Schaumburg, Hoffman estates area this  has to be in your "must try" list!!!

Family owned and operated cafe offering baked goods and homemade German inspired dishes. 
I don't eat desserts due to my diet, but their cookies, cakes and brownies are irresistible and taste just like how grandma used to make em. You can tell the owner puts a lot of love and care into her menu.

-German dinner platters 
-Cakes 
-Cookies 
-Family owned = Great Service

Just moved to the area, and found this place. It's off rt 19 and hard to see, but we won't miss it again. My kids got the German apple pancakes and loved them. I had the 3 egg breakfast, the toast was fresh made and delicious, eggs where cooked perfect and with butter, yum!, the hash was ok, the sausage links where different and delicious also. I can't wait to try out their dinner!
First time in today...had breakfast which was awesome.   Then got brownies for later and they are so delicious!   We will for sure be back.

Great food! I went in based on the reviews on yelp. Both owners are very nice! The owners spoke to be like they met me before very friendly atmosphere. The spatzle is extremely good. The Hunters is great. The mushroom sauce is delightful! The brownies are amazing as other reviews say. The black forest is very good as well.

I came for lunch the other day. I got some really tasty beef barley soup...really tasty. It was sort of weird that it was served in what reminded me of a hospital bowl minus the plastic cover. With that. I ordered a grilled cheese. Don't do it :). I will go back but will order more authentic dishes to critique. I so could have ordered better.

Great home style German comfort food. You can get a great Homestyle dinner like meatloaf, schnitzel, soup, dumplings , potatoes & gravy or if you're just in the mood for a simple lunch sandwich they have bratwurst beef and other local favorites with fries and the new dining room is nice and open the owner is super friendly and personally looks over the making of each dish. They also recently started serving German wines and beers which is a nice touch in the new expanded space. Great for a casual lunch or a meeting with somebody or to have a big group event in the private dining room. Have used them for a few catered events at work and everyone has raved about every selection we've ever gotten from there. They can provide you with German style catering or if you just need baked mostaccioli with mac and cheese and Sliders, they can provide that very quickly and the prices are very reasonable for catered events as well as carry out & dining-in

Orderd the pull pork sandwich and it was amazing ! The people were super friendly. The location is not the best but inside looks great and they have  amazing deserts to choose from and she makes them fresh each day!  Try the brownies! !!!

Just heard about this little place and had to try it. So glad we did. Super friendly service and the food like home cooking and priced quite reasonable. We definitely will be back to try more of their wonderful menu and will do our best to spread the word about this little gem of a place to eat.

Had the egg drop noodle and Kahlua Kuss (which means kiss in German) for lunch today at the Olde Salem Cafe. They serve "family recipes from Gernan Heritage". I've had their pastries before and they were delicious. They will be catering the jembalaya and kings cake at the Village's Mardigras business networking event Feb 17 @5pm. 

Check it out on Old Salem circle in the shopping center east of the Long John silvers on Irving Park Rd.
So good! Try this place! The goulash was amazing! Baked goods great! Catering provided. My friend had the salad plate and loved it.

Just found the Salem Cafe tonight and thought we would try it out for take out.  The service was fast!  It was very affordable, the portions were big and the food was good too... It tasted like home cooking! 

Looking forward to trying the pastries in the future.
We love the desserts ( especially the brownies) there but sadly it closes on Sunday when we really want some apple pancakes...

I was not sure what to expect but I am glad I walked in.  The food was good and it is all made fresh.  I had the pull pork and my wife had the Italian beef both were good.  The fries are made to order you can't beat that.  The location is the only down fall because it is easy to miss.  If you know the area it is in the plaza next to the Long John Silvers off Irving Park Rd.  The brownies were real good be sure to try them.

This little cafe is a wonderful secret!  My daughter eats here at least once a week.  She turned me on to Olde Salem Cafe last summer.  The food is DELICIOUS, the owners are charming, and when you walk in you feel like part of the family.  I have absolutely loved everything I've eaten here!  My husband is very picky about his food, so I wondered what he would think when I brought him here yesterday.  We both ordered the puled pork meal...and we both LOVED it!  The potato salad was genuine & he loved his fries!!!  It's too bad it is in a pretty secluded location.  I am telling everyone that it is in the strip mall on the side of Long John Silver's off of Irving Park Road in Hanover Park.

Seriously, people, you have to try this place!  You will be as hooked as we are!!!

If Kinfork were a movie it might be called:

Mall Food: Evolved
Swill & Fed's Most BBQulinary Adventure
Dawn of the Fed (get it? that's the one in the mall)

So, I went into this restaurant expecting to have a bad time. It's in Woodfield. The previous best restaurant on the roster was the @#$%ing Cheesecake Factory. So when it was good, rather than bad or only OK, I was pleasantly surprised.

What's good? Well, BBQ is a good place to start! Beer list is also spot on. I had a pulled-pork style thing, ordered spicy, and it actually came out spicy! Imagine my astonishment, spicy food in the burbs that I didn't have a Spanish name. 

So yes, if you're looking for the least-lame option in Woodfield, this is definitely it.

I'm a BBQ junkie and wanted to see how this place stacks up to KC, Memphis and even local places like Smoque and Real Urban BBQ. We stopped in on a semi busy Saturday night after the late rush. 

First the food: 4-5 stars for the food. Chicken was up there with the best of them. Whisky BBQ sauce is addicting. Sweet hearty and smoky. Excellent. 

Service: 1 star. Man I hate to put this in a review since I like to focus on food but this was bad. Got there at 8:45 ordered a drink that didn't come until 9:10. Then we heard the food didn't get fired up. We had to ask because a nearby table came after us, ordered and was already eating. 

Then we are told that the fish was burned so they decided to redo that. That's cool but then they had the nerve to ask us if we wanted desert after a dinner that took an hour and a half? It was almost closing time. 

My wife is the stickler and it takes a lot to get her going. She was pretty mad that we didn't get an apology from a manager (we are not the types to hunt a manager down) and we weren't offered a discount or anything for the ridiculous time it took to eat. 

My advice. Go to Real Urban BBQ. the food is close to the same and since it is served cafeteria style you don't have to wait for silly service like we received. It's BBQ folks. The stuff is smoked and ready to go. Should never take that long!!!

Just my .02

Was shopping at woodfield mall and was starving happened to see this place and we decided to give it a try. 

I ordered the brisket sandwich and also got a free appetizer from checking in through Yelp. The hush puppies were amazing. So soft and chewy and warm taste was just really good. 

The brisket was amazing it was cooked perfectly and melted in your mouth. It came with whiskey BBQ sauce and boy oh boy I couldn't get enough of that sauce. 

The inside had tons of tv kinda reminded me of a Buffalo Wild Wings But a lot nicer. Not a bad place to come by and watch football or your favorite team play. I definitely recommend giving this place a try if you like BBQ food.

If you enjoy good smoked barbecue meat, this place has a great selection.  Personally, I'm a die hard chicken fan and I was very pleased with my  order of the chicken club. Nicely grilled chicken breast with thick peppered bacon and avocado served on a wheat bun was delicious! Came with a side of skin cut French fries that were crunchy and super addicting with their house whiskey sauce. 

Check in to Yelp for a complimentary appetizer of the hushpuppies. Crunchy grilled jalapeños mixed with cheddar cheese make for a dangerously appetizing combination.  Pairs well with their house kinfork IPA beer on special this month for $4 dollars. 

Prices for entrees vary from 12-27. The sandwiches are roughly $13. 

Service was quick and I will definitely be returning for more.

Excellent pulled pork and tater tots! Choice of different sauces makes it interesting. Nice place, felt very clean, personable staff & reasonably priced. We were there for lunch and it was bright & cheerful, tables aren't too close together, which is a plus. Will return often
The hush puppies are to die for! Great restaurant in the burbs... Not your regular mall food and big serving size! Great atmosphere even though it's in a mall!

Quite possibly the BEST cornbread and hush puppies ever!! The burnt ends were unbelievable! Brisket incredibly tender and moist! Pork chop flavourful albeit a bit dry. And THEN the meatloaf!!! I can't wait for meatloaf sandwiches from the loads of leftovers we are taking home! Save room for dessert haha!!! The short list of sweets is down home yummy!!!

Despite the promising Southern-inspired menu, most of their offerings lacked one key component - flavor. 

Call it the "Curse of the 'Burbs", but just a dash of salt, a smattering of seasonings during the preparation, or even some fresh herbs would have elevated this food from mediocre to above average - and when you factor in their remarkable price-points and portion sizes, there's potential for success, even in a mall.

Since we were visiting from downtown Chicago, I had to do a double take when I saw the craft cocktail list - single digit prices. Yes. Hard to believe! The Moonshine Electric Lemonade was refreshing and potent, while my old reliable - the simple Old Fashioned- was perfectly built around a stiff pour of Forester's Bourbon.

On to the menu items: Down in the South, where I was raised, "Hush Puppies" (two words) are comfortable shoes. But "hushpuppies", the Southern fish-fry staple, are small, deep-fried balls of corn meal, white flour and buttermilk, typically flavored with onion powder or maybe a little finely grated raw onion. Kinfork's appetizer version of "hush puppies" ($7) are ultra-light, perfectly fried balls of a sweet, cake-like batter, dotted with pieces of roasted corn, diced jalapeno and cheddar cheese - but despite the additions, the little golf ball-sized blister of air were woefully lacking in flavor. Moreover, the peach crème fraiche "dipping sauce" tasted like a melted Creamsicle popsicle. Folks, the only thing that should be served with savory hushpuppies is honey butter. 
 
Keeping with the Southern theme, I ordered the Carolina Pulled Pork Sandwich - a massive (ENORMOUS!) tennis ball portion of shredded pork, piled on top of a toasted sweet'ish bun and topped with a watery - again, bland- coleslaw and semi-fried onion strings. The pork itself was so saturated in their "Red Vinegar Carolina Sauce", the bun disintegrated when I picked it up, and the tomato-y sauce masked what little subtle smokiness the meat had captured.

---FYI: The Great State of North Carolina is the only state with two distinctive styles of barbecue (and, yes, "barbecue" is a noun, not a verb, for some of us). Eastern style is typically whole hog barbecue, smoked over hardwood and mopped with a tangy apple cider vinegar, brown sugar and pepper sauce. And then there is Western style, which is pure evil. (Just kidding!) Actually, Western is almost the same as Eastern style, but they add a heavy dose of ketchup to their sauce (Sacrilege!), and instead of cooking a whole hog, they usually cook pork butts or shoulders, sometimes over wood, sometimes over charcoal.---

Kinfolk's attempt to blend the flavors of Eastern and Western North Carolina falls flat - there's simply too much ketchup in their sauce, and the heavy sugar and/or corn syrup ratio leaves a greasy coating on the pork that stifles the smoky goodness. The reason you use cider vinegar as the sauce's base is to "cut the fat" on the pork, for better mouth feel. Unfortunately, their sugary mopping sauce is just too sweet to allow the tanginess and smattering of heat to shine. 

The wife's Meatloaf Plate ($15) was a mammoth portion of three flat-top grilled slices of uber-tender meat planks. Again, a tiny bit of salt and pepper perked up the flavor. The mashed potatoes were tepid and tasteless, except for the oleo-like liquid pooled on the top, and the two tree-like branches of broccolini were so bitter they were almost inedible. (Maybe a little more blanching before tossing them on the plate?)

We'll certainly give them another try, with hopes they are still dialing in the recipes on their expansive menu. And while portion sizes are ginormous, the price points on all their offerings are spot-on. Service was excellent from our waiter, Chris, and we'll offer a big thumb's up to Justin, who steered us towards the restaurant while he was working the crowd in the mall on a busy Saturday night.

Great new dining option in the Schaumburg area! Actually it's right in Woodfield Mall. The good in that is of course a tasty option when shopping. The annoying in that is if you're not at the mall, finding and parking here as a destination dining spot!

When my friend and I went, Kinfork had just opened. We had some delicious food items but service had some big kinks that needed to be worked out (slow, overcharged on items/sides, not knowing the menu just yet). I'm hopeful all of these issues have now been ironed out because the food was quite tasty.

Grilled chicken portabello sandwich? Tasty and semi-healthy. I would prefer a slightly less hard bread, but hey! That's just me.
Tater tots? Really delicious! 
Mac & Cheese? Rich and creamy - liked it quite a bit!

All in all, Kinfork is a great addition to Woodfield & the Schaumburg area. I'm hoping for slightly improved service but that their food stays on point!

Visited Kinfork on a Tuesday night.  The ambiance was nice, and the booths were really comfortable.
    For an appetizer we ordered the KF nachos with pulled pork.  They were delicious, and the jalapeños were very spicy.  For dinner, we got the Carolina pulled pork sandwich and the turkey panini.  Both were great, but the pulled pork is the real star at Kinfork.  I would definitely recommend you visit Kinfork, and I would definitely encourage you to try the BBQ!

I really don't like writing reviews less than three stars. Being a statistics nut, I know there can only be so many on either end of the spectrum. Still, I love writing 4 and 5 star reviews more than lesser ones.

Kinfork seems to be a restaurant that doesn't know who they are.We chose to go there after receiving an invitation for their new tasting barbeque menu. They put up a large smoker on the sidewalk outside of entrance 1 at Woodfield Mall as a draw. The manager said they want it to be functional but are having trouble getting approval. (Who would think there would be an issue when there is a large, several hundred degree iron statue that kids walk by at a mall. No touching?

The tasting was not well prepared. We arrived a little after 5pm, right on time, and they were not prepared yet. Several other patrons also had tickets and were also waiting. The hostess explained that this was a simple tasting, outside of the restaurant by the non-functional smoker. After waiting a few minutes, we opted to go inside and order from the menu.

First, the service was disappointing. It seemed there were plenty of people working there, but many of them were standing around talking with each other. The waiter suggested one of their moonshine drinks. I asked what moonshine meant in Chicago. In summary, it is not what you would expect to come out of a still. The drinks are served fruity and sweet, just not my bag. I got a Pepsi (no Coke).

For dinner, my wife had pulled pork and I had the brisket. The menu clearly states that some like sauce and others don't so the waiter will ask how you want it. He didn't ask, and we did not think to tell him.

The food was served relatively quickly. I tried some of the pork. It was tender, juicy and loaded with barbeque sauce. As for my dinner, the brisket comes with four narrowly sliced pieces smothered in sauce. While the meat tasted okay, I wonder how much of the flavor was covered by the sauce. My meal also came with two sides. First, the baked beans were disappointing - it was bland and was more like bean soup (pintos and kidneys). There was a 1-inch cube of pork belly in the center of the bowl. 

I also had their roasted root vegetables. The yams were good. The carrots were just okay. The onions were inedible. There were other veggies in the mix I could not identify. I'd kind of like to know so I stay away from them in the future.

We said something to the server to bring as a suggestion to the kitchen. After that the manager came over to check on us, asking what we didn't care for and why. He did seem genuinely concerned. However, with every comment, his answer tended toward "we strive to be different and alter recipes so they have unique tastes. He offered us free desserts which we thanked him for, but said no. We didn't want free food. We did want them to know that they had some work to do to keep our business.

Pretty sad as there's nothing wrong with the place but nothing special either. And for a restaurant in the mall, thats a sure sign for slow business and eventual death. 

We ordered an appetizer and two entrees, and they tasted alright. The tab was close to $50!

Kinfork is a unique experience. Excellent drink and barbecue menu. Justin provided excellent service, anticipating our party's needs. No need to ask for a refill!  Highly recommend the Old Fashioned, hush puppies, garlic sausage, and pretty much everything else on the menu. Repeat venue for sure!

This evening I dined at Kinfork, and as always it was a wonderful experience. Although described as a barbecue restaurant, it is more akin to gourmet home cooking. The food is absolutely amazing, and speaking from experience, guaranteed to bring you back to explore their menu even further. They have a great bar as well, sporting moonshine cocktails that are as delicious as they affordable. The restaurant is staffed by very welcoming and considerate people, and are an absolute delight to talk to. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone in the area, and hope more people have the opportunity to discover this place!

This was visit #2 as the first was not too positive. The second was a great meal, the service was fast and our server, Sylvia, took great care of us.

Starter was nachos with pulled pork and their nachos are possibly the best I ever had. The crispness of the tortilla chips, the meat, cheese and jalapeños made a 5 star combination. My wife is not a big nacho fan and she scraped the platter clean. We had their hush puppies out first visit, and they are good, but the nachos are big so you can split a meal with those.

Our first visit we had the pulled pork and it was OK, this time we got the brisket handheld and they gave us some honey, whiskey bbq sauce on the side. The coleslaw on the sandwich was really good and the sauce put it up to an easy 4 star meal. Paired with the tater tots and it was very good.

The management stopped by any they apologized for our first visit being poor; they made it worth it for us to come back for visit 2 and there will be a visit 3. They are upgrading the smoker, they have a new chef who is creative and I am looking forward to the next visit.

Only 4 because I reserve 5 for places that I will go back again and again. 

We had some drinks at the bar and a grilled Caesar salad. 

I never had grilled romaine lettuce and it was fantastic. The taste really worked and the service was great.

I wish I had ordered more food but we had dinner plans for later that night. I will update my review when I go back and have a full meal.

Second visit won me back!  Hubby and I split the nachos appetizer and also split the brisket handheld with whisky BBQ sauce on the side and tots. Both dishes were lick-the-plate good!  The nachos now come with choice of pork or brisket (used to come with pot roast).
Hint *order bbq sauce with the brisket handheld. The coleslaw is delicious but the bread would have made the sandwich too dry w/o the sauce to add to it. 
Their nachos are $12, but big enough for a meal, or to share with several other friends. These nachos are so crunchy with just enough melted cheese throughout and sour cream and jalapeños all on top. Mmm!!!  I practically licked the skillet clean. 
Menu is updating 7/3/16. So a few things were different than what we saw in the menu. Actually we had a better meal because of this!
Sylvia is a very kind and attentive server. Not too hovering but refilled our drinks as needed without us waiting. Always a good trait. 
Corey, manager on duty, took great care of us and we are very thankful for his kindness to us!
Definitely gotta come back and try more of the menu to see if it's all this good. Also, we didn't leave any room for dessert. Will come again for their s'more skillet from the dessert menu!!!

I had a taste for a burger wtih pineapple that they make at Red Robin. So we went to Woodfield.  The wait was 25 minutes or we could sit at the bar and eat.  Nah!  So we left Red Robin and saw a sign for Kinfork.  We never heard of it so we figured we'd try something new. 

The place looked fairly empty but still there was a 10 minute wait. Maybe it was because of the party in the back room and they were staggering the customers to keep the cooks from being overworked.  Whatever.

My first impression was I didn't get a feel for the restaurant like it was cool or had a great theme or a certain energy to it.  It seemed odd that the waiting area was so big.  Considering the price they are probably paying to be in Woodfield you think they'd try to maximize the floor space to get the most tables.  In the lobby there are lighted cases with moonshine, and somehow they works into a rustic camping theme?

Anyhow, we got our table and after looking through the menu we started to wonder if we had a server assigned to our table.  Then I guy who looked like David Blaine (the magician) came rushing past the table and said hi as he passed.  I thought he was going to be our server, but then I thought maybe he was just being friendly.  He ended up being our server.

If you've read my reviews on fat in meat, you know I like pulled pork but it's hard to find sandwiches where they've trimmed the fat before they serve it.  That wasn't the case with this place. We had to trim off the fat.  Fortunately, I wasn't the one who ordered the pork, I went with the safe choice and ordered the burger. Because it was only a 5lb burger, I ordered the double.  A single would have been enough!

Our food came quickly and the burger was done perfectly.  The meat was right-off-the-grill hot and tasted like it was cooked on a barbeque grill.  This sandwich is why I gave this place 3 stars instead of 2.

Our server got our order right and it came out quickly so I'm not going to slam him for his service, but serious... he mumbled his words at high speed like he's said them 1000 times.  The problem is I haven't heard them once, even after he said them.  It was turning into a joke. At the end of the meal he brought the check and wished us a good day (at least I think that's what he mumbled) we looked at each other like, "What did you say...?"

My burger was good, but it's not enough to make me want to return.  The camping motif is not done well enough that is makes the trip to Kinfork more than just a place to eat. The inside, as far as interesting or fun go, is on par with Denny's.  Not the food, just the ambiance and decor.  If someone is telling me they have a theme then have that experience surround you... Like Buca di Beppo, or Bill's pizza, or Rainforest Cafe, or Ed Debevic's...  or even Bob Chins.

We came back to try Kinfork for a Monday night dinner.  Our only past visit was during a Yelp Elite event earlier this year in April, and Kinfork provided quite a memorable variety of good food and drink offerings during that outing.   Monday's daily special is 1/2 off on their 1/2 lb. Backyard Burgers, and being a good budget-minded retiree, that's what I had.   Wife had one with sweet potato fries, and I had one with smoked gouda cheese and tater tots (which were delectable).  We also got a nice generous serving of hush puppy appetizers with our Yelp check-in (very good and dipping sauce was a little on spicy side).  The highlight of the meal though was the burnt ends appetizer we also ordered.  These were nicely charred and blackened on the outside, and moist and boneless inside, and came with a nice pickle relish slaw.  These were miles better than the renowned BE's we once tried at Real Urban Barbeque.   The burgers were just ok, and the patties tasted of the frozen variety, but no complaints really given the daily special pricing.

Ooooooooooooh Woodfield Mall...how do I hate thee?  Let me count the ways...1) You're not Amazon Prime.  2) There's people.  So many people.  3) Why are you a freaking Labyrinth?  4) I should probably stop this list because it will never end.   

Seriously though, if it wasn't for my stop at Kinfork I may have committed homicide this day.  Luckily, there's a new restaurant in this hell they call a mall and they serve BBQ with tots!, have a Bloody Mary/Mimosa bar, the best macaroni and cheese you will ever have pass your lips, and there's beeeeeeeeeer, glorious beeeeeeeeeer.  What else could you ask for really?  Oh, and the place looks pretty cool too if you're into that whole hipstery/modern/industrial vibe.

We ended up getting smaller plates (the pot roast grilled cheese, soup, the pork belly sliders, and a mac and cheese meal with tots for the baby (which we ate every last morsel of...thanks, kid!) and all were good but the mac and cheese {and the tots!} was definitely the greatest meal that day.  Next time I wouldn't get the sliders because the pork belly was just too fatty (though I'm pretty sure that's just the nature of eating pork belly) but I would most certainly try some other smoked meat with that glorious mac and cheese.  As a matter of fact, I might just order everything off the kids menu and go to town.  

The beer list was pretty decent and like I said, there was a Bloody Mary/Mimosa bar since it was Sunday, which is pretty much the greatest thing ever if you can make decisions.  I can't,  so I sadly had to pass.  It called my name every time I passed it though so next time I might just have to bite the bullet and figure out how to make the greatest Bloody Mary ever.  Who wants to babysit and be my designated driver?

Yay! I'm a fan, for a few of the items. I'm a fan of  the mussels appetizer, the corn fritter appetizer and the single hamburger with fries.  My dining companions gave a 'just ok' to the meatloaf entree and the Carolina pulled pork sandwich.  The pork chop entree was overcooked so it was not juicy at all.

Service was slow.  I believe it took about 45 minutes to get our 4 entrees out to us.  I did not find the restaurant too noisy as some other reviewers have stated.  

Scrutinize your bill before paying.  We were charged for two ice teas when we only ordered one.  The server quickly corrected the total.

Tried out this new spot because I love their other concept- Rack House in Arlington Heights (which I just realized I've never reviewed for some reason, but I will next time I visit!!!). I just love the environment that they create! It's inviting and comfortable but still has a classy feel to it. I gave up cheese for lent, so many of the dishes I was unable to have, but my friend and I did get to enjoy the nachos without cheese. And I really mean we enjoyed them!!! There wasn't a single topping left on the dish. They had pot roast, jalapeños, diced tomatoes and green onion with sour cream graciously spiraled around the top. I do want to try them again when lent is over so I can indulge in the cheese that I saw on other tables portions, but I digress. For my entree, I had the barbecue brisket handheld, but I substituted the ciabatta for herb focaccia. BEST DECISION OF THE DAY. The waiter, Michael, said that the sandwich would be smaller because the ciabatta is actually bigger, but I seriously mean this sandwich was perfect. The brisket, just like at the Rack House, just falls apart in your mouth. If there's one thing these places know how to do- it's barbecue, hands down! The sandwich was also still very large! I finished it, but only had one of my tator tots because I was beyond full. Next time I will save the other half for the following day.  This visit I didn't try any of the beverages, but I saw that some of the same Rack House moonshine cocktails were available. I'll update my review when I try some of those too. :)

Highly recommend trying either concept if you're looking for a chill environment and amazing barbecue!!!

For appetizers we had the hush puppies and the nachos. Both were great!  Entres I had a half slab o ribs and my friend had the pulled pork sandwich. The sandwich I thought was fantastic. The pickles were a great combo with the pulled pork. Ribs were very good, fall off the bone food. I give them extreme credit for pulling off a great meal on a night when only 4-5 tables were occupied. Our waitress Kenyanna was absolutely fantastic!  Thank you for a great experience!

We ordered a lot of everything and shared, so below is how I'd rate my experience!

BBQBrisket A+
BBQ Ribs B+ 
Chicken wings C+
Server (Josh)  A+ 
Cheese Curds B+
Make your own Bloody Mary bar on Sunday's A + 
Mac and cheese A+ 
Mashed potatoes A+
Coleslaw A

By and large, style beats substance at Kinfolk. Which is partially because the style is gorgeous (modern camp theme, mason jars EVERYWHERE) and partially because the lunch entrees aren't where they need to be to justify the price. 

We kicked things off with hush puppies, served with peach creme fraiche. I was a big fan of the crumb inside the hush puppies, which had whole corn kernels and bits of jalapeño peppers in them. The outside was deep-fried to a nice, dark-brown color, leaving quite a few crispy bits. Overall I thought the appetizer was pretty well done.

As for the Carolina Pulled Pork, another signature item? The baked potato was pretty standard, with the exception of a bit of kosher salt sprinkled among the outside (an idea I'm going to steal the next time I bake potatoes). The inside was a bit dense. I had sour cream, which was nice, and butter in little plastic containers, which is an... odd... presentation choice.

It also came with cornbread, which was all right. This recipe is of the denser variety, with a few corn kernels and good corn flavor.

The pork itself was nicely tender but didn't have the smokiness I was looking for (the more, the merrier as far as I'm concerned!). It was paired with a barbecue sauce that claimed to be a red Carolina vinegar sauce but I could've easily confused with something bottled. Which gets to the main criticism I have of Kinfork.

The food is pretty damn basic. Just because the theme is campy, doesn't mean the food has to be campy too! The pork needs more smoke, and maybe some crispy bits. The barbecue sauce needs a lot more depth, starting with the cider vinegar. The potato maybe ought to be fluffed. The cole slaw needs to be better than the generic creamy stuff from Sizzler. My wife's salad mix needs fresher lettuce.

This might sound like a lot to ask, but it is a $14 lunch entree, and our bill came to $44 before tip (and we don't drink alcohol!). So I think it's a fair ask.

But look. If they improve the food, Kinfork has a really good future in Schaumburg. I hope, though, they're a quick learner.

Who goes to a restaurant and buys meatloaf? I did for restaurant week and I now understand why. The meatloaf was very good, a nice firm texture with the ability to break apart into manageable pieces then coated with a nice sweet bbq type sauce. It was very good!

It comes with brocollini which was cooked perfectly, tender but snappy and had a nice flavor to them as well.  It also came with mashed potatoes that were creamy and buttery.  There was some random seasoning in it as well which made it much better than normal mash.  

I find it interesting getting food that is very homey but elevated to the next level. Service was excellent, very friendly and welcoming.  

Also tried a few of the desserts

Strawberry Shortcake - it's more like a sundae kinda, it gave you the next texture of soaked in shortcake with a marscapone topping to give it some richness.

Peach Cobbler - Very tender peachy peaches.  It is topped with local, according to the server, Homer's vanilla ice cream. The ice cream is great. The crumbles are good as well.

Apple Cobbler - Apples that have been cooked to a gentle softness, not mush, made this a great texture contract to the vanilla ice cream. It also came with brown sugar crumbles that were much larger than the peach cobbler. I enjoyed it thoroughly. I normally don't like fruit based desserts but this one was great and I kept wanting more!

I was told that a lunch menu is coming, I look forward to that.

ordered the combo ribs & sausage link. 4 bones of ribs with a nice sweet & mildly heat bbq sauce. The garlic sausage was pretty good and grilled. nice size loaded baked potato, the cornbread was sweet which I like to have with my bbq but it was on the small side and the cole slaw was jus ok. overall decent meal cost on menu $22.

The food was ok at best. The service was on point. Plus there's no pecan pie. A BBQ place with no pecan pie? I was disappointed. The risket was chewy. The pulled pork looked like pure'dpork luckily it tasted better than it looked. The sausage links are on point!!

I saw that Kinfork was opening months ago, and then I went to their sister restaurant (Rack House Tavern) and they told me about Kinfork as well. Needless to say, I've been waiting for this place to open.

They are located in the mall (their sign outside is red, it's not very big). The atmosphere is casual, but nice. This is not your hole-in-the-wall place. They do take reservations, and even though we made one on a weekday at lunch time, we didn't need it. I don't know if they just are not busy in general, or they are not busy during this time. Anyways, we were seated right away. The theme is campground meets comfort food.

They have a full bar and drink menu, but since we were on lunch break, we didn't drink. We ordered the hush puppies, pulled pork sandwich, brisket sandwich, mac and cheese, and brussel sprouts. Everything was really good. They are light on the sauce for the sandwiches, but if you ask for some on the side they will give it to you. The menu is pretty similar to Rack House. There were a few differences...but for the most part it was the same.

The service was ok. For not being that busy I didn't feel like our server did the best he could do. It wasn't bad by any means. We waited a while to get our bill settled. This is important at lunch time since they are located in an area that is near many businesses (people are on their lunch breaks and need to get back in a timely manner).

I would definitely come back, but I feel like they need to differentiate themselves a little bit more from Rack House and improve their service. Otherwise it would be 5 stars.

While visiting Schaumburg, we went to the Woodfield Mall so some of my coworkers from Russia could do some shopping for those back home. We went to Kinfork for dinner.

I ordered the Whitefish dinner, which comes with a pretzel bread crusted whitefish, roasted potatoes, brussel sprouts and a mustard butter sauce. The mustard sauce was excellent, as it pairs perfectly with all parts of the dish. Unfortunately though they were rather stingy with the sauce. The brussel sprouts were a little under done.

They were out of quite a few of their beers (the ones I tried ordering).

The service was very helpful and they offered samples of some of the beers.

The prices are average as are the portions.

Today, my friends and I tried this new place for lunch. Our waiter was nice and polite and unfortunately I didn't get his name. Anyway, to make the story short, I ordered pork and beans for sides, and a porkchop with brocolli and fries for entree.

Well, when I got my porkchop, outside, everything looked great; however, when I started eating it, I noticed that it was not cooked the way I wanted it, as I want it to be well done (I wasn't asked by the waiter, how I wanted it to be cook, though). After a couple of bites, I was not able to finish it since it was a big portion, so I took it for to go.

I  went home and a couple of hours, got hungry, heat it up, then was trying to eat the left over porkchop when I found out, it was not cooked all the way. Man, what a waste. Of course, I didn't finish it, It sucks. :-(

I wanted to give you guys a credit for good customer service and great ambience, nevertheless, won't be coming back for second round. I'm sorry.

I say 3 stars because although the setting is lovely---hipster country I would call it, the food is ok. I was happy with the hushpuppies--light and not greasy at all, cant stop eating them...but the sauce with them was weird---that's the only word I can think of...weird--peach something and should not be served with those pillowy hushpuppies!! I had the flatbread which was strange to see flatbread on an otherwise 'country' theme menu. It was ok. Husband got some meaty monstrosity---brisket? pulled pork? I dont know--it was ok. He was very happy with it. Portions were a little small for the price but I guess you pay for being in Woodfield mall (which I would NEVER do but we were here for the Yelp event so we just gave it a try). It's nice for an evening perhaps with a group or friends but not somewhere I'd whine all day to go to. I did however like the mason jars everywhere....very country cute decor!! Oh and staff was just average..ok---nothing particularly fantastic.

This place is absolutely amazing. 

The atmosphere has this rustic chic vibe going on. They have these mini walls of mason jars, beautiful copper colored lights that gives like a candlelight feeling, and comfy chairs and booths. 

The service on all counts was great. From the hostess who answered my phone, the manager who gave me a quick mini tour, and the bussers. They were efficient and polite. As soon as I arrived they asked me for my reservation, anytime a plate was empty it was taken away. My server for the night was Nick. He gave great suggestions and had good timing. He asked how every plate of food and asked if I needed anything occasionally. I hate going to restaurants and having to flag down a person or wait 20 minutes for ketchup or a new fork-doesn't happen here. 

The menu also had a wide variety of food for people who are health conscious. Lots of different salads and healthy entrees like fish and chicken.

My husband and I took a road trip to Woodfield Mall yesterday to finish some Christmas shopping and were very intrigued by this little joint, especially since it had just opened within the past week.

We started our new culinary adventure off with some cocktails. I tried the "orange crushed," which our waitress Christin (who was very sweet and helpful) said tasted very similar to orange soda, and she was right. My husband had the "electric lemonade." I tried a sip and was reminded of a mature version of Mike's Hard Lemonade without the sugary aftertaste.

As an appetizer, we had the hushpuppies, and they were amazing. I haven't eaten too many types of hushpuppies in my time, but those I've tried have usually been nothing but rock-hard in texture. These were crispy on the outside yet easy to cut into with a fork. They also had a nice kick and paired fabulously with the sweet peach crème fraiche, which reminded me of peach yogurt. I constantly found myself dipping my fingers in it and demanded that the waitress leave it at our table as a sauce for my tots.

For our main meal, my husband ordered the "carolina pulled pork" with a side of tots. Being a fan of barbecue, I was very tempted to order the ribs but wasn't super hungry and tried the "chicken pesto panini" with tots instead. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't a bad sandwich, but it could have used a little more flavor, especially in the chicken itself. The tomato focaccia was good but got a little soggy after a while due to the pesto and juice of the tomato. I was disappointed to see that the tots were the standard frozen kind, especially when everything else we ordered appeared to be made from scratch. I tried a bite of my husband's pulled pork, which wasn't too bad, but not the best pulled pork I've ever tasted. Not being a fan of cole slaw, I thought the jalapeño kind garnished on the sandwich was rather tasty.

In addition to our starter cocktails, my husband also tried the "back porch." I took a sip of it, and it reminded me of a more alcoholic berry Kool-Aid.

I found the overall ambiance of this place warm and welcoming, from the decor to the entrancing smell of barbecue and alternative rock tunes blaring in the background. I hope to come back here again someday with a hungrier stomach to try the ribs!

Two stars...one for presentation of food and another one for the server (David I think it was)...lobster bisque had no lobster, am I supposed to presume it's artificial flavoring? Or did the back kitchen chefs eat all the lobster chunks out of it?? The hubby's meatloaf came out ok, broccoli cooked to perfection. My half slab of ribs was dry, no paying customer wants to discard chunks of rib meat or have to politely pull them out of their mouth because it's rock hard and questionable meat because it was cooked past the jerky stage....slaw accompanied was nice to offset the sugary sauce, the corn bread was OK, the baked potato was a rock!! A small side of sour cream was to accompany it, but could they add a little extra effort and add butter? Disappointed because I kept asking my husband to check it out, only to be let down

My brother and I went tonight because we were curious about the food. 
First off the look was very rustic. I loved every part of the atmosphere. Definitely can see myself watching the hawks with some s'more skillet after work. 

Service was good and so was the food. 
I had the pulled pork and my brother had chili. The chili was a bit watered down but good taste. However, they are still working out the kinks. 
Pulled pork was delicious but i personally like a more sweet pork and this was more smoky. 
Food tasted like something i would eat at my parents, home-cooked. 
I work at the mall so i like food that doesn't over do it. 
Will defiently be back on my lunch break.

WOW...My first time at Kinfork 10/4/16  was a homerun!!!  every thing i tasted seemed like there was a lot of thought put into every thing they served ,there are three sauces to grab from i really liked the whisky flavored bbq sauce, it was as good as candy, I had 4 wings pineapple dry rub ,frickin great, also got the free hush puppies app. from yelps site thanks yelp. For dinner i had the pulled pork & garlic sausage very tasty  it came with kick ass cole-slaw a giant loaded baked potato & the best corn bread i've ever tasted.....Its 3 now  hours later & i still feel great from all the good food. thanks kinfork cant say enough on how well taken care of i was by the good waiter Justin    ..... there is so much more im going to try from kinfork

Traveling on business and my room wasnt ready...took the free shuttle to the mall in search of lunch....tjis place looked local and promising - had the moonshine front porch drink - very tasty not to sweet! smash burger - wow might be in my top 10 burgers of all time and the tots were perfectly crisp!
Great drinks and excellent food!! Grilled cheese is spectacular.  Super friendly staff!! Jenna, Cory and Tony were a blast! Would definitely come back!

I came here for Mother's Day and ordered From their brunch menu, which is offered weekly, hence, not a special for MD. Ordered pulled pork eggs Benedict. 1st time eggs overdone. 2nd time eggs underdone. You can't be a brunch restaurant if you can't get the basics correct.

Stepson got the ribs, tried those too. Meat was dry and flavorless.

I was here for an event and got to sample several items. I loved the salads and sandwiches/paninis. It was all really fresh and still innovative enough without being boring. Pulled pork nachos were tasty. Meatloaf was just so-so, and I wasn't a fan of the dry rub on the wings. It was way too sweet without enough spice. The bbq sauce was a little too peppery for me. This is all very subjective, obviously. Maybe others love it. The coleslaw was spor on. The was really good. The desserts were fantastic - my favorite part! The smores, apple crisp (loved!), bananas foster, and strawberry shortcake (extra loved!) were all so good! I really like the vibe, like a modern/rustic/country feel. The waitstaff was so kind and energetic. I would love to back for a sit down meal!

My wife and i recently visited Kinfork during a Yelp event, and the food was wonderful, and the service was outstanding. We especially enjoyed their ribs, brisket and pulled pork; we will certainly return for those. The meatloaf was our next favorite, very tasty. The moonshine cocktails were very good and strong, I will be purchasing Old Smoky products soon. Kinfork is on our return list.

All of the food here is fantastic. My husband got the Southwest Chicken wrap which was awesome. I got the Chicken Club, and it was also very good. I wanted to try the brussel sprouts, so we got an order of those to split, and I'm glad I did, they were fantastic. Finally, their tots are amazing too! I would definitely recommend this place to most people, the meals are a little pricey, but they are huge. The chicken wrap could have definitely fed two people!

The service was great it was pretty empty during a weekday lunch time. I got the nacho appetizer it was gross I have to say. I wouldn't get it again but I think it was just the sauce the meat was in. My husband got a burger it was excellent. My son got kids menu chicken strips they were really Good the honey mustard sauce was SO good. Overall not a bad place I need to go back again to try something else. 

They also have like a party section which I'm really interested in for a big crowd.

We are visiting from Tucson and wanted to try something local. It's at the Schaumburg mall and open late, so it's really convenient. Service, atmosphere and food were all incredible! We had the hush puppies, the pulled pork sandwich, the loaded mac N cheese, and the moonshine cocktails. Holy cow was it fantastic. And our server Mike was very cool and welcoming! Will definitely be going again.

Delicious! Super surprised to find great service and food at a mall. Wings were good - try the dry rub. They were just a tad on the pricey side. Try the brisket - so tender and flavorful. Great kid's meals too. And goldfish while they wait for food. So thoughtful. And did I mention great service? Will definitely come back!

The place was okay.  We went there on a Friday after work for a 530 dinner and it wasn't crowded.  The pulled pork sliders were good, BBQ sauce was great but had to ask for some on the side.

The broccollini was terrible, it came out a stem of broccoli covered In chopped garlic and burned the throat. They did take it back and offer something else.

The Brussels sprouts were amazing.

Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to come here but if I was already in the mall, I would eat here.

I just got back from the Yelp Elite party (clearly I'm not an elite member, I tagged along with a friend) The decor was very clean, moden, and rustic. The event was perfect for a new business, it gave the customers a chance to explore the entire menu. It's more of a BBQ restaurant but there is a good variety of salad and a few seafood plates for the healthy eaters. The desserts were also delicious! Their specialty drinks involve moonshine (the mason jars fit perfectly with the decor!) I tried the moonshine lemonade and it was perfect, just enough kick.
All in all, this place is great for drinks and a app or dinner with the family. I will definitely be a returning customer.

People are nice. There were 5 of us and only 2 ate their meals. I got the grilled cheese which comes with roast beef and it was good. The bread was alittle too hard. Made the top of my mouth hurt. If your looking for a regular normal menu this is not the place to go. For 2 regular menu meals and 3 kids meals it was NOT worth the $82 we spent. In my opinion that place won't last long

Stopped in for lunch on a Wednesday at noon. Crowd was very light, staff was very attentive and courteous. I sat at the bar, great service from Tina. Many employees greeted me throughout my visit. Food was out fast and was very good. Nothing bad to say about this joint.

Kinfork is a wonderful new restaurant in Woodfield Mall. The employees are all extremely friendly and helpful and the interior is very cool. I tried a lot of different plates while attending a Yelp Elite event and was very pleased with almost all of them. I'd recommend the hushpuppies, pulled pork, all of the salads, and the moonshine cocktails. I was particularly impressed with their salads as I really wasn't expecting an American food/southern food/comfort food restaurant to have good salad. The leaves were fresh, the cheeses sharp, the choice of ingredients well paired, and the dressings were well balanced and really tied each of the 3 salads I tried together into its own unique and delicious side/meal. While I can't really figure out what to classify their genre of food as (it's not quite comfort food, not quite southern food, and not just typical "american" food), I did enjoy the selection and felt like the theme made sense. I'll definitely be coming back next time I'm at Woodfield Mall.

Two words describe this restaurant.  Yum-me!! Comfort food meets a twist of BBQ.  Delicious cute little spot located inside Woodfield mall. Hormone free and grass fed meat products. Oh, and the waiter was stating something about Mt. St. Helens playing a part in their stone oven. Anyways, my husband had the brisket. Very lean and delicious. He is from Texas, so he knows his brisket. The pot roast nachos were to die for.  Only thing lacking was that the food was just warm and not hot out of the oven, but besides that it is well worth a return visit.

Cute new place that would be great for lunch if I worked a bit closer, but makes for a nice after-work place as well. Our server was very pleasant and helpful. We started with the quinoa & kale bites, which were SO GOOD. They were 4 (I think) little patties with just a drizzle of the mint yogurt. I would go back for those alone, but I'll need to check out the hush puppies as well. They are very veg-friendly, so I had a hard time deciding what to order. I landed on the vegetable flat bred. Very light and tasty, but nothing to write home about.The side of broccolini was perfection though. My friend had the smoked turkey sandwich and loved it as much as the chicken pesto sandwich that had been her introduction to the place. We also shared the cornbread skillet, which was good but needed a little butter. We'll definitely be back!

Kinfork needs to find their niché. There's simply no draw to come back, I wish there was.

Unfortunately, there's not much making them unique from all the other options in the area. They certainly don't have the best burgers or BBQ. If this place was more like Hash House a Go Go, it would be great.

The Brick Chicken and veggies were truly fantastic! So much flavor and cooked perfectly. However, I still wouldn't come back just to have that. A lot of menu items are definitely overpriced (including the chicken). As tempting as it sounds, I suggest not getting BBQ here. I tried some of their sauce on the side with the chicken and it's definitely disappointing as others have mentioned - (just not good flavor). I'm glad I steered clear of the BBQ options. My friend got their burger which was good, but certainly not anything to write home about. It's great they donate a meal to Feed my Starving Children for every meal you buy though!

As another reviewer said, the food came out cold.  

I had the Grilled Cheese, which as Roast Beef as an ingredient.  Now, I realize the name of the Sandwich was Grilled Cheese, not Grilled Cheese with Roast Beef, but there was one thin slice on the sandwich, to me hardly worth mentioning.  The tomato on the sandwich was cold and hard.  And the cheese was not gooey, as the sandwich was cold.  I had it with Tater Tots, but only had one or two, as they had a weird aftertaste, perhaps the oil had been used too long.

My dining partner had the Brisket Sandwich, which was okay, but hardly any sauce on it and the brisket was tough.  Again, it was cold.  Also, as someone else said, the jalapeno coleslaw was tasteless, however the dressing did add needed moisture to the sandwich.  

Our server, when she saw I did not finish my tots, asked me why I did not tell her.  It was hard to tell her as she spent most of her time speaking with friends at another table and only stopped by immediately after we got our food, and we did not see her again until she brought the bill.

This restaurant was good. We went for dinner and were surprised that there wasnt a wait. The atmosphere is nice the resturant looks small from the outside but its really big. They even have rooms big enough for big parties or social events.  All the servers were nice and the food tasted great. I went with the Meat loaf which is enough food for 2 people. the meat was nicely cooked and seasoned and even had a slight sweet taste to it. For dessert we had the smores skillet which was also great if you really like marshmallows the skillet can be shared with at least 3 or 4 people. I would come again.

So I came here twice.

The first time I came here I had a great experience. I had gotten the burger with tots & the cheese curds were great!

The s'mores dessert was meh.  More marshmallows than there was chocolate & graham crackers.

The second time I came here I wanted to try something different & went with the Pot Pie.  It was a little too salty.  My fiance ordered the Rigatoni Pasta & he absolutely hated it.  I tasted it & it was really bland.  It sounded really good from what the menu had described. So that was disappointing, & he never wants to come back.
