The menu could be better in my opinion.  Appetizers come out really fast but then your actual meal takes forever to come out.


Service was great overall.

I've eaten food from here twice because I feel like you've got to give a new place a chance. Both times I did carry away and both times it took longer than the hostess told me. 
The first time I ordered the chicken panini with homemade chips. The panini was not very flavorful and also extremely soggy and the sauce kinda dripped out of the sandwich all watery. Not very appetizing. The chips were homemade so I ordered them over the frozen fries or tots, but they were really really greasy and I couldn't finish them. 
The second time I ordered their "smash burger" with fries. They don't cook burgers to order and when I received the food the meat could have been of any quality because it was over cooked and tasteless. The fries were average, for frozen fried variety. A big however though--- I ate this at noon and it's midnight and I can't sleep because my stomach still hurts. Ack. 
Maybe I'll give this place some time and then go back and see if they've worked out some issues. It's a pretty atmosphere but you've really got to stand on your food and at this point, I'd rather have Jimmy Johns which is unfortunate.

This was my first time here. The Cheese Curd's with White BBQ Sauce and Beer Cheese Dip with Warm Pretzel appetizer's were outstanding. I ordered the brisket dinner and was not impressed. It was dry and they put some type of liquid on top of it to try and moisten it. The BBQ Sauce was not tasty at all. However, their desserts were delicious when combined with the appetizer's is the only reason I am giving them 4 stars. I will go back to try other interesting entree's on their menu.

We went there for soft opening. 
Good customer service from our server. Nice and friendly atmosphere, loved those mason jars. Food was good.  Ordered Nachos for starter, it was okay. Had Grilled Cheese sandwich for main course which was good. Loved fries as well. And we finished it with Brownie Sunday which was amazing. I can't wait go in again. 
Overall, food quality was good and customer service was good.

We had a first time family dinner here on a Sunday night while in Woodfield Mall.  The restaurant was not overly crowded as there were many unoccupied tables.  Service was friendly, but it took a long time to get our food.  Once we did get our food, it was average, nothing outstanding, but not bad.  The salmon was good, but had a bit too much seasoning for my taste.  Sandwiches and chicken wings were just OK.  We wanted sweet potato fries, but they said they were out.  The strawberry shortcake dessert was presented in a goblet, sort of mashed together.  The cost was $6 and was OK, but nothing special.

For the quality of the food, I felt the prices were a tad high.  No bread or crackers were served while you are waiting for your food.  There are several large private function rooms.  There are TVs with various shows playing, some of which were not kid friendly.  Decor is casual and inviting.  Servers and greeters are very friendly.

My wife and I had been waiting for Kinfork to open for months. We are fans of the owners other restaurant Rack House in Arlington Heights. I can say that I'm a bigger fan of this place. The atmosphere which many people have already spoken of is superb. The music isn't overpowering, the lighting is great, not too bright or dark. 

For me, the reason I gave this restaurant 5 stars is for 2 reasons. First, because they have Schlitz on the menu. I'm a fan of the beer and knowing that I can get a 16oz tall boy for $4 is a win for me. Secondly, and much more importantly is the meat loaf dinner. I cannot speak more highly about how delicious it was. At $15 it was on the pricier side, but worth every penny. You will get roughly 8-10oz of homemade meatloaf. I can tell that they used both beef and pork the way every good meatloaf should be made, however so seldom is. You get a mound of real mashed potatoes and a plentiful helping of broccolini. They also layer a rich pan sauce on the meatloaf.

This restaurant feels like a modern take on the old-fashioned supper clubs. You can get a supper club dinner, however they have sandwiches and real, smoked BBQ. I will certainly be visiting Kinfork many times in the coming months/years.

The ambience is great - decor is top-notch (think Restoration Hardware). Good menu - reminded us of a gastropub. Interesting items and cocktails (moonshine is still being made?). Our server was a doll (Kirsten), and the owner took the time to check in with us (in a genuine effort, not an obligatory one). 

We recommend this restaurant to families, friends, and dates!

I ate at Kinfork last night with my family and we all loved everything we ordered, from dinner to dessert! 

We each ordered a different entree, and the portions were generous. The salads were very fresh, and the cornbread croutons were a really tasty edition. The pulled pork and fish tacos were also very good! 

Although service was a bit slow to start out, we all had a great time and the food was worth the wait! Definitely stop by Kinfork if you are in the Woodfield area!
Love this place! Delicious food!! Great service!! Enjoyed the chicken ceaser salad, filet and for desert we had strawberry cheesecake !! We'll be back soon!!

Everyone is Right! Order the nachos! Also had the wings with the jalapeno buffalo sauce and they were killer! Service was very good. The host who sat us was not all that great. he tried to stick us in the corner when the restaurant is not very busy so he could have put us at any table. But the service made up for it as well as the food.

Nice restaurant, cool campground theme and nice decor. It's bigger than one might realize for being inside a mall. It goes all the way to the back with private rooms. We ordered nachos, pulled park and a Mediterranean salad. Food was decent, might need a little work for what they charge, we'd probably go back anyway to try something else on the menu and see if we still like it.
I totally recommend this place.  Stopped in and split the man-n-cheese and chicken wrap with my hubby.  Both were so good.  We will definitely be back!
I can't wait to go back. Everything was good, but I'm craving a few of the appetizers we tried (including the Hush Puppies). Love it!!

I got the meatloaf. It was a nice, juicy meatloaf (3 slices) with some burnt, crisp ends but in a good way. The mashed potatoes are good, have some chunks in there so they're not whipped. I wasn't a huge fan of the pan gravy on the meatloaf but it wasn't bad, just a bit tangy for my taste. Good meal, overall.

Great experience and good food.  The ole smokey moonshine drinks are great!  Jenna the manager was awesome and gave us a tour of their huge facility.  Great place for after work or even for large events.

We had an awesome dinner and the drinks are fantastic, do not hesitate to come to this location and have Gena give you a full tour of the facility it's very impressive. This is a great place for a party or corporate event.

This place is incredibly tasty! Got the onion string appetizer and it was really good, even better than Hackney's! I got the burger with tots and the burger was juicy and perfectly cooked and the tots had a nice spice to them. My wife got the herb chicken breast will roasted root vegetables which was really good and even the roasted potatoes had a sweetness them from the roasted onion's juices. We also got a side of the cornbread which was sweet and tasty. The service was very good and did a great job, being prompt and attentive while not being overbearing. I'll definitely be back!!

If I had to give this a rating out of 10, my husband and I agreed it was probably around a 7 out of 10. I liked the atmosphere and decorations. I also liked the food.We used Opentable and were really happy to get in at our preferred time on a busy Friday night. However, my friends and my husband didn't like their food as much as I did. The overall prices were a bit steep for the quality of food and drink(the beers were flat) and our waiter was few and far between and not the friendliest. We were glad to try it out but will probably try another place that's less pricey and has more options to the menu.

Great service. We were greeted at the door and it was opened for us. We ordered the Hush Puppies which came out hot and fresh. They were delicious. We ordered the Cobb salad, which was huge! The price was great for the portion and it was delicious. We also got the pulled pork sandwich. It was also very delicious and a great price for the portion. I got a side of ranch which was one of the best. Our server was very attentive. We will be coming back again soon!
Large space serving tasty American comfort food. Libations were extensive and hit the spot alongside the food. Customer service was good.

I went to Kinfork on my lunch break for my first time today. The atmosphere is very welcoming, and the decor is really nice. We had great and timely service. I ordered the Grilled Cheese Lunch special. 

When my sandwich came to the table, I took a bite out of my sandwich and noticed there was no pot roast on it (there was supposed to be). I took another bite, thinking maybe it was just really small, but there wasn't any meat on the sandwich.  I then alerted the waiter about the oversight. He said that he would let the chef know and bring me a new sandwich. Which I thought was great. 

BUT, to my dismay, he took my sandwich that I had taken 2 bites out of back to the kitchen, the chef put meat on it (a sandwich that had already been eaten off of), extra meat on the side and brought it back to my table. I was shocked that this happened in such a nice restaurant. I ate the sandwich, and it was very good, but I was very turned off by the way this situation was handled. I don't know if I would go back to Kinfork after this experience.

Took the family for dinner after enjoying happy hour here the week before. Happy hour was great; dinner was not. Up charge to sub Brussels sprouts for veggie couscous seemed excessive. My husband's salmon was undercooked. The worst, however, was the brisket flatbread which is marked as a specialty of the house. It was dry and chewy to the point of difficult to eat. There was approximately 2 ounces of diced beef on top. There was so little sauce that I ended up dipping it into the white sauce from the hush puppies. I let my server know that it was not good. She said she'd let someone know, but did not offer to remedy the situation. We won't return- there are better, similar options in Schaumburg.
This place is phenomenal.  The roasted vegetables are so flavorful.  The corn bread is amazing.  The beer cheese dip is very yummy.  Definitely will return!

Can't rave enough about the service and food here. First time and we loved everything about Kinfork. Can't wait to bring people back. Food is delicious. Hush puppies were amazing and the aroma of the BBQ makes you wanting to try more food!! Try them as soon as you can

We were looking for a good American food restaurant and came across Kinfork. Recently open with good reviews we thought we'd give it a shot. Sadly the food and service was not up to par. We ordered side salads to start which were ok but lacking in quality and variety of greens. I ordered the Carolina pulled pork and it came to the table looking like it had been extruded from a large ice cream scoop. The pork was rather flavorless and just wasn't cooked well for what I'd expect of quality BBQ. My wife ordered the Pesto Chicken and was not impressed. To end off the dining experience on a sour note, the waiter dropped off the bill and credit card receipt without so much as a goodbye.
Great food, service is very friendly as well.  Josh did a great job suggesting is drinks and dinner.  Definitely a great spot amongst all the crowded restaurants at wood field mall
This place is great.. Really good bartender, appetizers are to die for.  Brisket was delicious.  Great place, we'll be back

Stopped in for a quick lunch while Christmas shopping. Good variety on the menu. Grilled cheese with pot roast, Bbq brisket with jalapeño slaw, pot roast nachos with bbq sauce. Settled in their signature smash burger, it was a good old fashioned burger. We'll be back to try more.

Food ok but served luke warm. It's too bad because the place has potential. We went on a Wednesday night and had high hopes that this place would be a new favorite restaurant.  Unfortunately this was not the case. The ambience and staff were nice but the food was sub-par. All the draft beers listed on the menu were available, food took a long time to come out and were luke warm. We had nachos, burger, bowl of chili and two beers which took 1 1/2 hours to be served. The sever was nice but it didn't make up for the food quality and lack of concern about the food quality. To add insult to injury the feedback card was already filled out with high ratings which I crossed out and added information  about the true  experience. I was  disappointed and felt our time could have been better spent at the numerous other restaurants in area. We will not be returning.

While visiting this area for a work related event we chose KinFork for a group dinner 25+.  Best decision of the day.  Terrific menu to satisfy any appetite and diet.  Service was second to none.  If I lived in the area this would be my go-to entertainment spot for larger groups.  The space was conducive to socializing and enjoying our meals in a timely fashion.  No starving while waiting for your large party to be served.  KinFork made me look good!  Couldn't ask for more.

Potentially great food. 
I always order a ribeye at every new Resturant I go too.  It's kinda my personal gauge. The ribeye was 35 dollars. Broccolini, mash potatoes and the steak. I feel like I'm seeing these same side at a lot of places lately.  I ordered it medium rare.  It came in a reasonable amount of time. The plate was nice and warm and the presentation was good.  The steak looked great  First off I tasted the broccolini and it was fabulous.  It was tasty and somehow infused with a perfect smokiness, best broccolini I've ever had. The mash potatoes were good but nothing special.  Then I cut into my steak. It looked perfectly medium rare. As soon as it hit my mouth though I noticed it was ..... Cold.  The mash potatoes and broccolini were perfect and the plate was warm but the steak was cold.  I touched other spots on it and it was all the same.  I would like to add though that the seasoning / chat tasted spot on.  If this steak wasn't cold.  It would of been great.   I told the server and he took my plate away.  A manager returned with my plate.  It was noticeably more charred. It was hot now, but it was also not medium rare any more.  When the manager returned to ask how it was I explained all this.  He apologized and asked me if we need anything.  I asked for another drink and he returned with it.  

At the end of the meal the bill came and nothing was discounted or offered up free.  Maybe a drink or something.  Nothing.   I didn't ask for a discount. But considering the experience I found it a bit odd.  

Overall I really want to like this place and I want to give it a second chance.  That steak had the potential to be great.  But I left a tad disgruntled.

This is the second time I've been here. It is nothing short of amazing. The server was very knowledgeable of the drink menu and recommended fantastic drinks. I recommend the ribs and hamburgers. The fries are the best!!! The s'mores desert dip is to die for. This restaurant is upcoming and the perfect atmosphere. Will be back several times In the future.
Hush puppies were a memorable experience for me!
Great place for a meal at Woodfield mall. I had the rigatoni and it was superb. My mom had the smash burger and said it was amazing. Would highly recommend.

In Woodfield mall.  We live in Schaumburg, and we actually drove to the mall to go here.  We typically avoid that area...but this was worth it!  Very nice campy, woodsy kinda atmosphere, but nice.  JR, our server seemed glad we where there. He was just the right mix of attention and service,,and super friendly.  Different wine list, craft beers and Moonshine is their specialty. Craft cocktails.  Hubs had BBQ pork with a vinegar sauce, and really good jalapeño Cole slaw.  Meat was cooked perfectly.  They have pretty much anything you'd like to eat at a campfire.  I had chicken breasts with grilled roasted veggies, as good as any roasted veggies I had.   Liked it here, comfortable, easy and good.  Putting it in our rotation.  How about a neighbor discount?:)
This restaurant was worth the wait. The food is delicious, the servers are friendly, and even my son was entertained by numerous kids toys for while we wait.

I would say that I am a fan of Kinfork. The food was great overall. I tried both the chicken and BBQ beef brisket and they are both very good. Though the chicken was a little over seasoned. 

I will agree with others that the service was slow especially for a Monday afternoon which wasn't busy at all. The waiter entered our order incorrectly which made the wait even longer. I was also given cold fries which is not cool. But before I could even say anything; someone from the kitchen brought out a plate of hot, fresh fries for me. So for that reason I was impressed because they corrected their mistake right away. The manager also came by and made sure everything was okay. 

I would probably go back to Kinfork in the future because the food was good and so was their service recovery.

The hush puppies and pot roast nacho appetizers were wonderful - the hush puppies were so light they almost floated above the plate. Next came the entrees: The ribs with sauce were fall off the bone great, those who ordered dry ribs with sauce on the side got room temperature chewy meat. The brisket was juicy, but again, room temperature; a big thing with the brisket was that the fat had not been skimmed very well and the portions were not uniform.. Most of the ten of us didn't get sauce, butter or sour cream on our platters. Some of the platters came out with the incorrect potatoes, so we were served at different times. Awkward. Meal could have been a little faster paced, but we didn't ask the waitress to speed it up. Prices were moderate.Sides and desserts were good. Would have been four stars if food had been hot and all served at the same time.
We live an hour away and this is our third time here. The hush puppies are amazing and the staff is great. And it's vegetarian friendly!

Great American food at reasonable prices.

Walked in on a Saturday night at 6pm with my wife and was asked if I had reservations, we didn't, but we didn't need them anyways since we got seated right away. Big plus.

My wife ordered the bacon burger and she liked it, they have a specialty mix of beef that they use on their patties, so if you're expecting your normal red robin tasting burger, you're not going to get that here.

I had the BBQ pulled pork sandwich and it was tasty! The pork had a great smoky taste to it, which I loved and I topped it off with some of their signature spicy barbecue sauce. They also had a great selection of beers on tap, which is good considering "ale house" is in their name. I had their Stonewood Amber and it paired wonderfully with their pulled pork sandwich. Well worth the money (both the beer and the food).

Much better. It's been a few months and we figured we would try again.  My mother in law took the plunge and ordered the ribs.  It took a second and I figured what the heck, we'll never know until we try. 

Either somebody's paying attention or they were having an off night back then. 

Ribs were great and love the choice of sauce. 

Keep it up.

We were there on a Saturday night. Wanted to order a certain bottle of wine only to be told that they no longer carried it. Had to choose another. 

The food was good. I had just a cheese burger and it was cooked properly and juicy! 

Had to actually go up to the bar to order another beer because our server seemed to disappear for a brief time. 

The place was not crowded at all. Not very busy. I wasn't impressed with the place. I wouldn't make a special trip just to go here...but it is definitely a place I would consider eating at again.
1st time here and so far so good. Seated immediately. Drink was acceptable. What was I thinking ordering Cajun food in Chicago? Jambalaya is not quit jambalaya.

We stopped by here for a quick bite before seeing a movie at the AMC down the street.  It was busy, so we sat at the bar and ordered some appetizers.  I got the chicken nachos, and she got an order of fried pickles.  As I said, we ordered of the appetizer menu, so it was a nice surprise to find that the portions were pretty big.
     Hopefully we can go back soon for a drink and a bite to eat off the dinner menu!

I was looking for a steak for dinner and found this place on Yelp and it was close to my hotel. 

I forgot that there was a Blackhawks game. The place was PACKED!!! Even so, they did find a place quickly to seat me. 

The server was running around to at least 10 tables and doing so with great efficiency.  She was awesome (Melanie?) and cheerful even under stress.  The beer selection is fairly large and the had a couple that I hadn't tried yet elsewhere. 

I ordered a steak bloody rare and I swear it moo'd at me. Perfection!!!!!  Great favor, wonderful garlic mashed potatoes and a black as night porter beer.  All while watching the hockey. I call that Man Night! 

I left a 25% tip and headed out for a cigar.

So Stonewood ended up being what I thought it would be, which was ok. 

We had a reservation, which ended up not really being necessary for a Wednesday night. This place is pretty big. They have a big wrap around bar and plenty of seating for big parties and others. 

They have a decent beer menu (especially on tap). Their list wasn't up to date (there were some beers on the list that they no longer serve). Honestly most of the craft beers on the menu I had heard of, but they aren't bad. They have a full bar if beer isn't your thing.

As far as food goes, it is all over the board. Soups, salads, burgers, steaks, wraps, sandwiches, you name it. I ended up going with the Turkey Burger served with fries, bacon, cheese, and a cranberry mayo. It was alright. The meat was dry and there really wasn't any flavor. The cranberry mayo was the best part. 

Overall they are decently priced (except the steaks). The waitress was very attentive at first, but then later didn't come around as much. She was good about splitting checks.

So it wasn't amazing, but not terrible.

This place was a pleasant tasty surprise. They have quite the unique menu along with you good old tried and true favorites. Unique burgers like she Elvis with bananas and peanut butter (yum). 
And can I say the TASTIEST chicken fingers because they are breaded with corn flakes and captain crunch yielding the most amazing party in your month both in taste and flavor. Can't wait to come back and try more things.

This bar is my go to in schaumburg. We pretty much live here after and sometimes before work. They are so nice and friendly and I pretty much always have a beer or drink in front of me as soon as I walk in the building. Tati and Chrissy are the best but I love the whole bartending staff  this is the cleanest bar I've ever been in.

I ate their recently while on business.  I got the pot roast and it really tough and the gravy was lumpy.  Not the best for the money.  I've eaten there before and it was better. Will give another try but wouldn't recommend the roast.

Came for dinner on a Friday night. We were actually over an hour early for our reservation. Appetizers were onion rings and the southwest egg rolls. They were both fresh and delicious! The southwest egg rolls tasted great made and was accompanied by chipolte ranch. It cooled off the egg rolls since there was a slight kick to them. The onion rings were served with saracha mayo. My husband seemed to enjoy them.
For dinner he had the fish n chips and I ventured out and ordered the Lousiana pasta dish with chicken. 
The seasoning within my pasta & chicken dish simply danced on my tongue. The sauce is a creamy delicious reminder of my very recent trip to N'awlins. If you have ever been there, this dish will bring you right back. 
Sadly, my husband was found of the restaurants version of tartar sauce but used the siracha mayo from his onion rings.
Stop by. You will be happy you did!

The food was good, I ordered the  burger with bacon and egg, with a side of tater tots. Everything was delicious, I ended up taking half of it home. I finished all my tater tots and I had a sip of my boyfriends angry orchard. It was very good. I also like the environment was the place it had alot of people, but it wasn't too noisy like other bars. I was able to hear my conversation with my boyfriend. Had a good time! Also,  shootout to the waiter Rhonda who was very nice!

I go to Stonewood Ale House at least once a week for their Cajun Tilapia sandwich, it's the best. Everyone is so nice that works there and the servers are great. we have had Mike a couple of times as our server for lunch and he is nice guy and took very good care of us!  One of my favorite places in the area!

Staying for just one night at a nearby hotel, we asked the front desk worker where to go that is not a chain and this is where she sent us. I had the inferno burger and it was cooked perfectly. There was just the right heat, personally I could have done more heat, to not kill my taste buds and enjoy the beers recommended by my server Hugo. The staff was great even to the cheap guest that didn't know how to read the coupon he had. I recommend this place and will return again for sure. Thank you Stonewood Ale House.

I can't remember ever being turned off from a place so fast. The two of us walk in 9:30pm on Saturday 8/13 and wait around the front door to be seated. Two waitresses walk past us but don't acknowledge us. A few minutes go by of us just waiting by the hostess counter waiting to be seated or told what to do. By this time another couple also comes in and waits with us. We all wait another couple minutes or so for someone to acknowledge us or something when a Hispanic guy with earrings and short, dark hair walks up to the hostess counter and leans his elbow on it while reading something on the counter. He is right next to us but says nothing so I say, "Excuse me, do we just go ahead and seat ourselves?" He takes a second to finish what he's reading, then looks up to say, "Nope" and looks back down at the counter.

At this point we just left. As we were getting into the car we saw that the other couple waiting with us must have had the same idea, as they were also walking to their car.

I could be more forgiving of the attitude and lack of service if the place was super busy or something but there were only a handful of people sitting at the bar and maybe four or five tables with people sitting at them. If this is the kind of traffic the place gets on a Saturday night, maybe it's a good thing we went somewhere else.

This is a cool place to hang out for sports or after work happy hour. They have a great beer selection. I love the stonewood ale. service is pretty prompt. they also have a lot of dining space. I had been there several times when I was working in the chicago area.

They have some pretty unique items on the menu which are surprisingly really good. I ordered the Elvis burger with chunky peanut butter, bananas, and bacon. It was ammmazing! My two other friends that joined me from Hawaii were more than pleased with their meals as well! Great service and clean! I hope to come back again to try their desert.

I found myself out in Schaumburg for a family birthday party at the ale house.  I'm not sure what I was really expecting as I've never heard of this place before. 

It seemed like the menu was pretty standard. You'll find burgers and fried apps like mozzarella sticks, with some steaks and seafood things as well.  This is the kind of place where you pretty much know what's on the menu before you walk in the door.  There wasn't anything that I was too impressed with but everyone I was with seemed to enjoy.  I will say this though, the inferno burger was Damn spicy.  And I can take the heat.  

For being in Schaumburg this place is just fine hence the 3 stars. The service and quality of the food was good. There was just nothing that stood out to me.  I'd say its a good spot for a family gathering as they are very accommodating for large groups.

This place is great! The food is awesome and most of the waitstaff is nice and friendly. 
I would give a 5 star rating if it weren't for Thursdays. The blonde Asian (day manager?) spends half the time flirting and the other half rolling her eyes at customers. Go any other day for friendly service and great food.

Have been here before and was looking forward to coming again today (now), but when greeted with a less than warm welcome for our party this is quickly tuning into a one round and patronage somewhere else. FYI when half your restaurant is empty a party of 10 with a reservation shouldn't be a problem to accommodate. 

Good food. Good beer. Oh, and the server was nice.

We ate here for a rehersal dinner,  nice looking restaurant had a nice banquet room. The food was good,  pasta was a little over cooked, and the salad was a bagged mix but other than that all the other stuff was nice. Good selection of beers, tap and non tap. The waitress in the banquet room was pretty slow might of helped if there was another helping her out. It was quite hard getting drinks. There family style catering was well put together though and there was plenty for out party.

My experience at Stonewood Ale House was kind-of a mixed bag... and left me not sure if I want to return.

We came in at 5pm on Sunday, a group of 10 of us, after the Schaumburg Boomers game, to have an early dinner and cap off a birthday celebration.

We were seated right away, as we had a reservation, in the "dining room" part of the restaurant, which was fine.  It wasn't too loud, and we were able to converse easily.

Our server was a little flaky.  One of my friends ordered a drink that is served with lemon, but there was no lemon.  I asked for a lime when I ordered my beer, but it came without.  When I asked again for the lime, she brought it bare-handed to me.  No thanks.  Maybe a lesson in sanitation, Stonewood?  She checked if everything tasted okay once, and then was pretty absent.

The food was decent, the portions were great.  I ordered the pork chops, and it was two LARGE boneless center-cut chops.  My man and I could've split this with an extra side dish.  Speaking of the side dishes - meh.  The "sauteed" veggies were 100% steamed green beans with zero flavor, and the yukon gold mashed potatoes were dense and luke-warm at best.  It's never a good sign when my man sticks his finger straight into the middle of his mashed potatoes to check if they're hot.

For the portion size, the prices were pretty standard... I just don't think I was impressed enough to go back.
We returned last Saturday and had a thoroughly enjoyable experience.  Once again the food and service was stellar

I went here with my husband for our sons birthday and the food was outstanding, and our server Amanda T was incredible. We never had to ask for anything, she was on top of it all. She also interacted with my son which I thought was going above and beyond. I would definitely recommend this place, and absolutely Recommend having Amanda wait on you. We will be back because of her . I believe I remember her waiting on us before and actually told her that she did a fantastic job. We'll be back again for sure.

After my first visit last summer, I signed up for their email club.  I have gotten many coupons or deals in the mail, but had not used them for various reasons.  This time we used a $10 off your $25 (food and bev) coupon.  Needless to say, our bill was really reasonable.

Hubby and I went for an impromptu date night and, once again, very happy with our meal.  He had been there for work, but we had never ate together here.  He ordered a BBQ Burger and I had the Blackened tilapia sandwich.  Food was GREAT.  He got a variety of BBQ to choose from that was at our table the whole time and my fish had a great spice to it.

And lets not forget the amazing service we had.  Our waitress was super attentive and his beers were coming out so fast.

Normally I really like Stonewood Ale House, but not tonight!

My husband and I came for the fish fry special. We were told there was a 25 minute wait but we could sit at the bar and eat if we wanted. So we sat at the long left table by the bar and started looking at the menu. A few minutes later a lady (hostess?) came over and told us we would not be served at the chair rails but could be at the bar.... So we circle the bar looking for 2 seats next to each other (which there weren't any). So husband and I resigned ourselves for a wait. 

We give our name and are told we have to give our phone number because they well text when our table is ready...wait, what? I tell them no, you can tell me when my table is ready. The male host says "or you could just sit at the chair rail?"

Apparently the right chair rail gets served but the left is for people waiting for a table? Have these people heard of signs?

I pointed out to the host that if services was not provided at the chair rail they shouldn't put menus their...but was told that he menus were there for drinks.

I almost walked out, but husband had a taste for fish and chips. Food came out in about 2 minutes and didn't taste particularly fresh. Chips were soggy. Way below what I am used to at this establishment.

If you are looking for an awesome chopped salad this is the place to go. I've never found another salad that can compare to theirs. Everything else on the menu is alright nothing else that really stood out to me.
Best chicken sandwich I've had in awhile! Excellent service and sweet bar. Great location if you're done being overwhelmed with shopping

We love coming to Stonewood! The menu is great and we've enjoyed everything we have had on the menu. Great beer selection, awesome service. The place is always crowded but it's rare that we ever have to wait for a table here. It can be tricky to find the first time and the parking situation is less than ideal, but this this is always a solid choice to come to for dining and it is usually the first place we think of in the Schaumburg area.

Went here for lunch right when they opened on a Saturday. The environment is really beautiful! The bar is large and they have quite a large selection of beers on draft and in bottles. I will definitely be interested in coming back to look into that more! I got the southwest egg rolls appetizer as my meal. It had just the right amount of spice mixed with savor. My fiance had order a side of chips, so I tried the different flavors of barbecue sauces they had. My favorite sauce overall was the Carolina sauce. It was sweet but not overly so, with a scrumptious seasoned aftertaste. The Smoky sauce was exactly what it sounds like. It tasted like the smell of an amazing campfire on a hot, summer day. I enjoyed this restaurant and look forward to coming back!

Nice bar/dining atmosphere and plenty of seating, even in the bar area. There were many TVs to watch sports events. Food was good, nothing to write home about. There's a good deal of menu options, but was a little on the expensive side. I walked out with a $20 bill before tip, and all I got was a cheeseburger, fries and a beer. Would be a good place to watch the game while trying beer and appetizer, but I would not come back for the food, as it is a little too pricey for simple easy food.

Nice place, able to book 7:00 reservations on Saturday at about 5:00 via Open Table.  Nice atmosphere, some flat panel TVs and the rustic decor.  Wide beer selection, but expensive ($6.75 a pint for draft).

Food was good for me and the family.  BBQ burger was very tasty.  Talapia was good.  Pretzel stick appetizer was good, but pricey at $9 for 4 sticks.  Without dessert and only two drinks, we would up spending $100 (chicken, 2 burgers, and fish).  Service was good, no complaints there.

Great service late on Monday June 20 after a Cubs game. Fish tacos were spicy but delicious. The rice and corn that waa served with them was phenomenal! Frickles were the best I've ever had (fried pickles). Egg rolls are way better than Chilis and I love Chilis Southwest eggrolls! Natasha the bartender was very accommodating and made our night great!

Stonewood deserves no less than 5 stars!

FOOD: Myself and 3 coworkers have come here for lunch regularly for the past few months and not once have any of us been unsatisfied with a meal. The food is reasonably priced and always delicious! My personal favorite is the salmon lunch special which you can get for the bargain price of $11.99. None of the lunch portions have left me hungry, and I'm not a small guy. Other favorites include the burgers, Thai steak salad, French onion soup (CHEESY!), and southwest egg rolls. Not to mention, the kitchen is open till 2AM!!!

SERVICE: ALWAYS EXCELLENT! I have yet to have a single bad experience at Stonewood in the year and a half I've been going there. NUFF SAID.

ATMOSPHERE: The place is... WOODY - Which I like. The bar is plenty big with plenty of tables filling the room. They also have party a room(s) for bigger events.

Overall, the 3 of us had never had a bad experience and I would and have recommended this placed to other friends and coworkers.
Awesome food and brews! I've never had a bad meal here and great value!  I will be every chance I get
The atmosphere is nice, the food is good, the portions are big, and the service (my server was Karla or Carla, not sure how she spells her name) was excellent!

My husband and I came to Stonewood a few days ago for Happy Hour. They seemed to have the best craft beer specials of any of the local bars. We were also surprised to find out that they had 1/2 priced appetizers as well. Each day features different beer and food specials. My husband ordered an Eliot Ness and I went with the Revolution Anti-Hero. 

The food is what you would expect at most bars, but all of it was good. We got the frickles (fried pickles) and the loaded potato skins. It ended up being about $8 for the two apps after the Happy Hour discount. The skins were my favorite because they were loaded with scallions and cheese. 

Our servers name was Chrissy. She was really nice and kept checking on us to make sure our drinks were always full. Since mine was in a can, she couldn't tell if mine was empty or not, but I ended up nursing it the whole time. I liked the ambiance of the place too. The walls are all wood walls and the lights are dim.  

I don't find myself in Schaumburg that often, but I would come back again if the opportunity arose.

Great Atmosphere and Great Food! I sat at the bar area and my bartender was phenomenal. I had the Chicken Pasta and it was very delicious. I recommend this place for some good food. They also brew their own Amber Ale.

This is a craft beer wannabe place.  Just ok beer list, but right at the top of the page, they advertise "Served at 31.5 degrees."  That's too cold even for their long list of industrial lagers.

I only had two craft beers and a plate of chicken nachos, but left $30 poorer.  Beer prices were typical, but the assemble-your-own chicken nachos were $9.99 for a few tablespoons of bone-dry chicken diced into tiny bits.  The four round crisp corn tortas were difficult to eat and were equivalent to 16 tortilla chips.

Can you believe the tax was 11%!?

My advice to the owners: lagers should be served around 40F and ales 50F, fix those nachos, and elect someone who'll lower your crazy taxes.
Food and service were great. We were seated quickly, burgers were good and you get large portions of everything.

We have been here a few times and every time it has been great. Good service and great food. Recommend their burgers, especially the elvis burger. Cajun seasoned tater tots are fantastic. Good mixed drinks, lots of seating and good atmosohere

Food pretty good. Have tried the Baked French Onion Soup, Chicken Quesadillas, and Key Lime Pie. The pie was served in a jar, and was absolutely delicious! Service always good. No mistakes on orders. Big menu. 

Loud when games are on, but can still carry a conversation. I usually read when I'm eating alone, and I haven't had a problem with the noise. 

They give you a $10 off $30 gift certificate for joining their email club.
Went here with some buddies. Good food and prices. I got a classic burger and it was really good. The wait staff is nice and they do a good job keeping up when it gets crowded. I'll be back.

Pretty solid place!  The service here is always friendly, the food is plentiful and fresh, and the kitchen is open super late, until 2 am (3 am on Fri and Sat).  The burgers are always on point, but my favorite is definitely the Beer Can Chicken.  It's a limited quantity item, so try to get it if you can.  I once got the last one, lol.  It's worth the wait, and very delicious!  For late night beers, burgers, or bar grub, give them a shot (pun intended) :)
A relaxed, decent bar with plenty of house draught beers, among them three in rotation. I enjoyed the appetizers and hefeweizen. Cool little spot in a decent location to the Schaumburg mall area.

Nothing special and wouldn't go out of my way to come back. Not a bad experience but not a great one. Got the frickles as an app, 7.99 and you barely get enough! That really made me unhappy. The meals were ok, got the pulled pork burger, very plain. Boyfriend got a chicken pasta dish, which was good but again nothing special. Will come back if we're in the area maybe, but if possible will go elsewhere for our next dinner out. Overall mediocre experience.

I had the bacon cheeseburger I didn't like it at all. It was so greasy and the burger was burnt tasting, I ate half and couldn't eat the rest. The frickers were good but they were really salty. Beer was good and staff was friendly. I would give this place a second chance if I stayed in one of the hotels near by again.

This place is pretty good. I wouldn't say it was amazing, but they do deliver on their promise. The reason this place isn't a 5 star is mostly that it's just not my type - sports bars and the beers that typically accompany them provide me of no interest. 

Aside from that, lets get to the many good things:
There are a considerable number of vegetarian options, which require some careful reading or you may miss them. Basically, you can get any burger with a veggie burger instead of beef patty with whatever seasoning combo they offer. This is exactly what I did, getting an inferno burger with the veggie patty, along with a pretzel bun.

I guess I missed the part of "the bun is small compared to the burger", because the veggie burger itself was not too far from being twice the size of the bun. That's not a complaint as much as simply being a surprise.

Also, when they say the inferno burger is hot, they are not kidding. It's not hot on the first bite, but it definitely builds as you eat the burger.  It was enough that maybe I should have skipped on some of the habanero, but I didn't. 

In addition, they currently serve (Seasonally) pumpkin ale, which is some good stuff.  Service was also friendly, and food was served pretty promptly.  So while this place is not my style, I think a lot of people would probably be happy with it in general.
This bar is so much fun. Great place to hang out, friendly staff and good food. The blonde bar tender is a riot. Always entertaining. Chrissy and Talia are the best!

Things I like about Stonewood Ale House:

1.  This place is HUGE.  I don't think I have ever waited for a table here ever.
2.  The beer list is pretty impressive.  I mean, if you are a TOTAL beer snob you may never be impressed, but even I can find several things I love to drink on their menu, and that's something.
3.  The burgers here are pretty damn good.  The peanut butter and banana burger was the bomb.  I know it sounds gross, but there is something about melty peanut butter and bananas on a sandwich that just make everything I hate about the world go away for a few minutes.  Elvis knows what I'm talking about.
4.  The menu is HUGE.  If you can't find something to eat here, you probably aren't happy with ANY menu and you probably shouldn't leave the house.  Ever.

Things I don't like:

1.  The fried pickles.  BLECH.  They're big slices of pickle (at least they're not spears, I suppose) and tons of thick breading.  Just not my bag, man.
2.  The service is hit or miss...you're really never sure how long you'll be there depending on how good or bad your server is.
Just had my daughters wedding shower here , and the food and service was exceptional. Jessica our server was great! Job well done by all there. I recommend this place to everyone
Really good food and nice atmosphere.   I'd go again.

That rootbeer beer.... AWESOME!

Went here with the wife and a couple of friends and we had a great time with drinks and appetizers. 

Food was delicious. A standout was definitely the cornflake crusted chicken tender thing. Just loved the flavor. Beer selection on draft was amazing as well.

Service was great and overall we were very pleased.

Only con I can think of was the place can be packed and parking hard to come by. I guess that's why they have complementary valet, but sometimes I just don't like using the service.

Not a bad place.  The beer selection is good, and the food is decent.  I tried the buffalo chicken sandwich.  It was huge, and I devoured the entire thing.  

The service was pleasant, but slow.  We came on a Sunday around 7pm, and the place was pretty empty.  Once we put the order in for our food, we never saw the waitress again.  We had to go searching for her to get the check so we could get out of there.

If you're looking for a place to get a decent burger and beer without paying too much, Stonewood is a good choice.

Very comfortable,  cozy place.  Friendly staff and delicious food.  Something for everyone on the menu. Had brought a large group in for a special birthday and all were extremely satisfied with service and quality of food.
Very good food. The chicken wings and nachos were spot on. The service was fantastic. The spinach artichoke dip was the only week spot as it was a bit too thick and rich.

This place time and time again seems to be my go-to when I am not sure where I want to eat.  They boast a large menu and have a few vegetarian entreea,  though I think they should make a small vegetarian menu with 4 or 5 items.

You can't go wrong ordering a burger here.  However if you want it medium, ask for medium rare.  Everytime I ask for medium its over done and when I finally asked for medium rare  it came out a perfect.  They also have really good fish and chips.

The beer menu is great and they usually have different specials everyday of the week which is awesome.  I usually spend about $16. That included my entree and 2 beers.

Lastly the only item I would skip are the fried pickles.  They only give you 5 and they are spears.  For a group of 4 it isn't enough especially since they are $9

You did it again!  That's right. 
Excellent setting, service, food and drink. Enough said.

Absolutely love this place! When the other places in the area are closed this place just keeps on going. Tons of great beers to choose from and the kitchen is open till 1am, perfect to get your drunk grub on. I've yet to have a bad experience with staff or food here. It's also great there are alot of substitutions for sides and even burger patties like a black bean burger. A good amount of veg friendly items on the menu.

Came across this place today while driving to a nearby hookah bar. I hadn't eaten anything prior in the day and was in the mood for a veggie burger and seeing that they have veggie patties I was like this is great! The menu is nothing more than a copycat of Red Robin. We decided to get an appetizer...frickles (their version of fried pickles). They were actually pretty good. For dinner I decided to get the southwest burger. It wasn't that great...pretty dry and the fries were bland...not to mention we waited a fairly long time for our food to come out (about 20 minutes) but the table next to us who literally sat down and ordered food got their food within 7 minutes. Within an hour after leaving the place I started to feel sick. What was supposed to be a relaxing night ended with me in the bathroom. The guacamole that came with the burger tasted funny and was warm. I figured I had gotten a mild case of food poisoning and am still nauseous. Needless to say I will not be returning to this establishment.

Be careful parking in the restaurant parking lot!  I have been a patron for years, ate lunch and left my vehicle in the lot for a couple of hours. Came back to get my vehicle. The manager had it towed....$172.50. When I inquired as to why it was towed the manager told me that he was sorry that happened to me. Expensive lunch! Who would tow their patrons vehicles? The manger needs to find a better way to occupy his time!

This is my boyfriend and I favorite late night bar in the suburbs- we often refer this to "Our Bar" hehe

Anyhoo... We have found ourselves here on countless occasions! What brings us back is defiantly the spinach dip, quesdillas and nachos!

Great atmosphere, awesome service and open late!

Everytime we come though we site on the restaurant side not the bar side; sometimes its packed on the bar side and gets rowdy but it looks like fun!

Kitchen is open late I think like 2 am or something

Bar is open until 3 am- the party don't stop

I got the black and blue berger, rare to match the title. It was absolutely delicious, the fries tasted fresh and the bacon looked like it was thick cut. Our waiter was timely and courteous. Thumbs up!

I've only been here once so my review is strictly based on a few cocktails on a Saturday night. 

The bar is quite large. It's nice for large groups and I can see hanging out here. 

They are fairly reasonably priced. Not so fair that I would go there regularly, but fair enough that I will return!

I would like to go back to try the food, and intend to do so.

The food here is very good, well cooked, tasty and perfectly portioned.  Came to watch the Blackhawks and while I wouldn't call this a sports bar, the number of tv's and layout of the bar is nicely done to where one has a good view of a TV no matter where he/she is sitting.  The servers are very friendly, albeit a tad slow (but I think it's because they could benefit from hiring a few more to cover table service better). 
  I was especially impressed by the music selection.  Great variety and upbeat without being too loud or obnoxious.  Prices are reasonable for the area and a nice place to bring a date, hang out with friends or even stop by for dinner solo.  The age range of the clientele is 20's to 60's and there is a separate dining area.
Would definitely recommend this place.

Closed as of 1-10-16.  Don't waste your time driving here.

Wasted 45 minutes driving out on a Saturday night.  A lot of good reviews, but I will not be returning to a place that isn't open during posted business hours.

I arrived 40 minutes early for the yelp event, and sat in the main bar area with friends to pass time- an easy feat at this bar. They have tons of draft, bottle, wine and cocktail ideas to whet your whistle. I ordered the Stonewood Lemonade, which was on special for the day, without looking at what it entailed. I was so pleased that it wasn't just like a vodka lemonade- it was more of an Arnold Palmer with a kick! Super delicious! We just had time for the one drink, but the bartenders checked on us multiple times, and it was more than one bartender too, which was great for those ordering multiple drinks- no wait! 

I've never seen a bar that had long tables, with one-sided seating. Interesting concept! One thing I didn't love was in the bathroom. The baby changing station was just the end of the counter, with a curled up laminated sign that marked what it was. I barely noticed it but would've been majorly turned off had I been leaning on the counter there or had put any belongings there. Overall though, it was a good experience.
You know, their crispy fish (cod) tacos are alright with me! It's that chipotle ranch, or whatever it is, that goes on top that really makes them stand out.

This place had good food and a fun atmosphere.  Casual and reasonable.  There wasn't a table available so I sat in the bar and it was pretty loud.  Overall a decent place to grab a meal.  I will be back.

If you have never tried a frickle.....YOU MUST! Been to this place a few times. Took my Mom there for frickles and burgers last week. Staff very accommodating. Fairly extensive beer menu which us always a plus and slightly away from the chaos of Woodfield mall...definitely a plus. Great for sports fans. Several screens scattered throughout large bar area.

My family and I go here about once a month. Service is always good, the food is consistent and the bar is huge. 

Pulled pork and pot roast sandwich is very good as is a plain old cheeseburger with tator tots. If they have cream of chicken soup, get it. Very creamy and lots of chunks of chicken.

Good food. Good atmosphere. Recommended.

The food was great. We just did appetizers. Frickels, lettuce wraps ands chicken tenders. They have not your father's root beer on tap. Our server Ronda was great, friendly and attentive. Would come back.

Great food every time I have visited!
I can't recall one bad dish so go all in. The bar area can get quite loud (especially in the winter when people don't hang out on the back deck). Super good - now go eat!

This place has the best spinach and artichoke dip and great beer on tap. The servers Heather and Ronda are the best!!!! Super friendly and their service is second to none! I will definitely keep coming back!!

I don't know why my friend and I had such high hopes for Stonewood Ale House but we had driven past the restaurant many times before and wanted to try it.  We finally came on a Friday night for dinner and boy were we disappointed!

First off, my friend ordered a strawberry martini and when it arrived the rim was scantily covered with sugar.  Then when she tasted it, it was pretty terrible.  It tasted like what fake watermelon flavor tastes like...and this drink was supposed to be a strawberry martini!   On the other hand, I ordered a Goose Island Matilda so my drink was fine. 

For our entrees, I ordered the jambalaya because I was feeling risky (I shouldn't have expected much from an Ale House but I was in the YOLO mood..poor decision!), while my friend ordered the carbonara pasta.  Our dishes came out pretty fast which was great since we were both starving.

My jambalaya wasn't bad per se but it definitely did not impress me.  It was moreso nondescript.  The andouille sausage wasn't too flavorful and was a bit overcooked in my opinion; the few slices of peppers in the dish also didn't help.  The jambalaya also came with a side of a breadstick which I thought was quite random and out of place.  As for my friend's carbonara entree, I didn't get to ask her exactly what was wrong with it but she did mention it was below average pasta.  

I could have handled the mediocre food because I was in good company but the service wasn't that great either.  When we were done eating, our waitress asked if we staying for longer to drink.  I still had half a glass of beer left so I felt like it was obvious we weren't done yet.  Then once she gave us our bills, she just stood a little behind our table waiting which made it a little awkward.  My friend and I planned on staying longer to just chat after dinner and our waitress kept walking back and forth by our table and even gave us weird side glances.  

I wouldn't recommend going to Stonewood just for the food.  It would be ideal if you're going to watch a game because they have a lot of TVs at the bar.  One good thing about Stonewood is the people watching.  They had a lot of interesting characters that night to observe if you're into that kind of thing.  Don't say I didn't warn you!
Surprisingly good food and drinks. Solid burgers, fish and chips and fish taco's.
Striked out three times on beers listed on the menu...should be updated. Food was as expected bar food. Service as well. Despite what Yelp and website says, they DO NOT have outdoor seating however.
Always great service, quick or zero wait times, amazing burgers, and clean and friendly atmosphere!!! Don't forget to try their Chili when you're there!!! It's to die for!!

Best thing about Stonewood - they serve liquor until 245am! So far this is the latest I've found in Schaumburg. It's such a chill bar, the service is always friendly and I always can have a relaxing time with friends. Food served until 2 & liquor until 245, top that off with food & drinks that are actually good - all of that makes it a usual hot spot for me.

My absolute favorite item on their menu is the Bacon & Egg Burger for $10.99 with Applewood smoked bacon, American cheese and a fried egg. The Crispy Cod Sandwich for $9.99 is another favorite of mine. If you're up for a something fun & different, try their Elvis Burger with his noted favorites of peanut butter & bananas for $9.99

I've tried every appetizer on their menu and my favorites are the Bavarian Pretzel Sticks for $7.99 and Potato Skins for $8.29. My company has had post work meetups here and Stonewood has always catered really well to us. We call Stonewood, they reserve an awesome section for us, keep an open tab as we rack up a slew of appetizers and drinks, and always have someone nice take care of us.

Thanks to these little work events I've tried a long list of drinks on their menu - they have MANY drink specials each day. That could mean a PBR for $2.50 (always reliable hipster cheapness), Two Brothers Domaine DuPage pint  for $3.25 (my personal fav),  Goose Island 312 pint for $3.25 (hometown classic) , High Life Bottles for $3 (old school. tried & true),  $4 Malibu Rum Drinks (classy), or Coors Light pitchers for $10 (go hard & cheap!). Check out their website for the daily specials or pop in to see what's good that night.

Join their MVP Club online & they'll email you some stellar free offers!

This was our first visit, with us seeking-out a place for a birthday celebration.  Had reservations for 6:00, joined their "Guest Rewards Club" online and received a $10 coupon, which we used on this tab.  Drinks- Lagunitas IPA, Bloody Mary (Absolut), Diet Coke. App- Potato Skins. Entrees- Meatloaf, Pot Roast (dinner not sandwich), Buffalo Chicken Sandwich.  Drinks were top notch, skins were B+ (I prefer buttermilk ranch over sour c side), Meatloaf was tasty but mashed potato side was smaller than hoped, Pot Roast was top notch, lean and melt-in-your-mouth tender, mashed potato serving small.  Buffalo Chix w/ fries was well received by our 18-year old.  Overall, the service was VERY speedy, with entree out just as skins were devoured.  There is a lot of stone on the walls in this place, so don't expect to carry on quiet conversation, as it is quite loud.  Also, if you drop a coupon, don't forget to tip your server based on the pre-discounted tab, since doing otherwise is unfair.  Server earned a 21% tip as she was competent, if a bit new on the job.  Other- I'm no skinny-minnie, so if you are an, um, generously-proportioned individual, such as myself, do not get a booth unless someone of average/small size sits on the other side.

Food was delicous! Fries were amazing and drinks were meh.
Seemed a little too pricey for me but would come back again.

I have never been here before and decided to try something new when I was in the area. I was NOT disappointed at all. The prices were great, the beer was cold and the food was delicious. I ordered the patty melt with chips. Amazing. I had a side of the buffalo wing sauce for my chips and that was so tasty I can't wait to come back for the wings. I have one piece of constructive criticism: in the interest of efficiency and not making customers feel like they are sitting at an empty table, always bring water on your first trip to the table. That said, I'll be back, keep up the good work and I'll see you next time!

I try my best to only write positive reviews, but after my experience at lunch I had to rate this place only two stars.

A group of 7 of us went to lunch today and while that is a decent sized group, the restaurant was not overly crowded.  We all ordered straight from the menu with no special orders.  Our food took a LONG time to arrive (about 15 minutes) and our server was quite absent.  We had to ask the hostess to find our server to tell her we needed our checks (we did separate checks).  I understand it takes longer to run separate checks, but the delay was not in the time to run the checks but in her even asking if we were ready for the check.

The food was good and there was a great beer selection (we could not partake) and this place has potential.  Be prepared for slow service when you go.

Service is pretty slow but idk if i was drunk but every time I order food from here its pretty decent.  The app platter was really good.  The nachos are okay and the wings are good too! Def good for bar food.

Quality service, quality food, great prices. The only drawback is the tiny parking lot but the free valet totally made up for that. We had so much food left over for the next day's lunch. We'll definitely dine here again!

Hubby and I went on a Saturday night w/ another couple. Told them when we made the reservation, that it was a bday celebration. Told them again when they called to confirm the reservation and she said "ok, we'll let your server know".. While the food was good (I had the stuffed burger--it was tasty but waaaaaaay too much cheese on it--literally had a huge mound of merks cheese--which I didn't realize it was this type of cheese until after it came---I was able to eat it after scraping off the pile of cheese), the service was just ok..our waitress seemed "bothered" to be there and just had a bad attitude. The place was nice..very big. A great place to go and watch some sports. The French onion soup was really good and the frickles were delicious!

This place smells better than it is. You can smell the wood fire through out the restaurant but the burgers are meh.  This restaurant is like Kim Kardashian, pretty on the outside but totally empty and clueless on the inside. The manager is stand offish and not friendly at all. Out toddler was in her stroller and he told us we had to park it at the front although she was at the point of almost dozing off. The restaurant was a ghost town with 3 tables out of 75 occupied on a Saturday afternoon. Our server was at the wait station cursing out a coworker like Dexter's sister Deb dropping the f bomb and the s bomb about 5 times. At least she was nice to us. The booths are narrow so ask for a table if you decide to go. We weren't too impressed and probably won't be back. 

One positive is their option to ask for a pretzel bun for any sandwich on the menu. Food came in a timely manner but it was a bit strange at how the Indian restaurant next to their location was packed with people as was Taco Bell across the street but this restaurant was empty with 3 times as many employees as patrons.

While 95% of the customers are watching the World Cup game, manager refused to turn on the ESPN audio for the game after multiple requests. 
They insisted to play a soft core pop music list that nobody ever care about. "We can't turn on the TV audio because we are playing the music." Common! It's a Monday afternoon and their business is slow and they can't cater the needs of most customers? Lame. Plus, they just lost a lot of potential business because none of the soccer watching crowd would ever return here for the rest of World Cup. 
Other than this borderline retarded, stubborn , arrogant management issue. I really don't have anything else against them. Ok environment and fair collection of beer, maybe because of their prime location in Schaumburg, they probably don't give a flying fuck about what customers want.

This place is pretty cool because the menu is pretty complete and the options are quite interesting. A lot of people complained about the prices, but dining in Schaumburg is a bit pricier than than the surrounding suburbs so it's not really unusual price-wise.

The most disappointing sandwich was the rib-eye steak sandwich. I expected it to be on french bread and thick but it was a thin slice in a sesame seed bakery bun.  The side of mashed potatoes was well seasoned with a nice consistency to it though.

The pot roast sandwich, bacon and egg burger, and BBQ burger were all competently done as well with a generous helping of fries.

I tried the creme brulee for dessert which came in a generous sized portion and had good flavor although it was slightly too sweet for me.

In general, the concept is good and the menu is complete, but it has the potential to be great with a bit better better execution.

Cool place, absolutely wonderful customer service!  My wife and I came here late, around 12:30 a.m. when not much was open.  After reviewing the menu we had decided that prime rib sounded absolutely delicious.  Knowing the intricacies of cooking prime rib, and the time we were ordering, we picked backups just in case.  When the waitress came to take our order I said to her "We would like to share the 16oz prime rib but only if it is medium rare.  If you can't do medium rare then we   will order something else".  The waitress assured me we could get it medium rare and we were excited.

Prime rib came, looked pretty good.  The outside of the meat was medium rare but the guts, most of it, was medium to medium well.  We ate around the outside, it was late and we were hungry, and ate towards the middle as well.  When the waitress came back I showed her our concerns but let her know we were eating anyways because we were hungry.  She asked if we would like another piece and we were pleased with this so we agreed.

Our waitress came back a couple of minutes later "I apologize, our cook says at this hour you received the most rare piece that we have".  Oh, that's too bad I though.  We decided not to get anything else as time was growing late.  Our waitress came back with the bill and informed us that because we were not satisfied with the prime rib that it was on the house!  I wasn't expecting that, a free beer or something would have been good for me!

Very attentive wait staff, extremely good customer service, and aside from the prime rib not being cooked to the proper temperature the seasoning was pretty good.  I will definitely give Stonewood Ale House another chance.  It is a great feeling to feel valued as a customer!  I hope they give me a reason to come back and change this to 5 stars!
Good lunch menu, very reasonably priced and delicious! Service was attentive and pleasant.

I had a great experience here and this is everything a casual drinking pub should be.  The service was pleasant, bbq ribs were awesome and they had a good beer selection.  The servers were knowledgeable about the beer which made the beer connoisseur at my table happy.

My husband and I walked into the restaurant, the hostess said it would be a couple of minutes, so we stepped aside to wait. They then proceeded to sit down 2 other couples ahead of us, who did not have reservations. She then came back to us, said there were no more tables available, and we would have to wait. We walked out.

We tried Stonewood Ale House on a Saturday night, with only about a 30 minute wait. Actually seated in about 20 min, which was great.  I had the battered fish tacos, which I thought were really tasty. They had a great chipotle sauce topping, fresh pico di gallo and shredded lettuce. Simple but very good. Hubs had his usual cheeseburger. He was raving about it, which he doesn't often do. He said it had a great char grilled flavor. We will definitely go back so I can try the burger. Very pleased so far.

I thoroughly enjoyed myself here. I went on a Saturday evening and it was going to be about a 30 minute wait, but we opted to sit at the bar/bar area instead. They have an excellent selection of beer and liquor. The food was amazing. We had the southwest burger and fish and chips and they were both absolutely delicious. Our waitress was very friendly, came frequently enough and served us well. I'm definitely coming back again.

Oh! And get the fried pickles/frickles! They are the best I've ever had!

Excellent dinner with all the extras plus friendly knowledgeable service. I will be back.
Just wish they had at least one craft brew beer selection.

Wow! I'd give it 6 stars if I could! Fresh food! Perfectly cooked! Good sized portions! Homemade taste and perfect service. Restaurant was clean and staff friendly and attentive. Many specials to choose from. We will be coming here again for sure!

We decided that we wanted to go out for breakfast and went here as we hadn't been there in a while.

It was very crowded with families but we were only three so we got seated right away.

The menu is extensive for breakfast/lunch restaurant.  Every thing from Waffles to skillets of eggs and potatoes.

Since it was 11:00AM, they were serving both breakfast and lunch. I had scrambled eggs with cheese and fruit, Kathy had  soup and Tim had a skillet of eggs, vegetables and hash browns.

We all enjoyed our meals and the service.  When I asked  for hot sauce, our server told me the types they had and asked what one I would like. Nice touch.

This was an enjoyable eating experience for us and I would recommend it to everyone that enjoys Greek cafes.

Stopped in here to meet a friend for lunch. This spot is a pretty typical diner type, family restaurant. I like these types.
I ordered a Turkey Club sandwich substituting coleslaw instead of fries. This comes with a soup which was New England Clam Chowder.
The soup was not anything special, just a thin version of this type of chowder. The turkey club was OK but would have been much better had they used real turkey instead of some type of deli style turkey. The sandwich was a bit of a challenge to eat, so I had to take out the middle piece of bread and some lettuce to be able to fit it in my mouth without dislodging my jaw.

Service was good and friendly, always a plus.

Cheers to All.

I love their Greek salad with the one of a kind Greek dressing.  Best Greek salad I could find. Love their rice pudding. Their salsa is home made. Creamy chicken rice soup is top notch. Turkey club is real turkey breast not processed.  Nice homey atmosphere. Love this place.

Palatine Inn is a typical 'Greek' restaurant.  The meals are consistently good, the waitresses keep the coffee flowin', there's a display case of desserts if you still have room, and if you want to have a triple scoop banana split instead of chocolate cake, they have that too.  If you're looking for comfort food in a comfortable place, stop here.  You'll leave full and if you're drinking coffee you may even leave floating.

I have been eating here for the past 11 years and have never been disappointed. This is about as Greek family diner you can get! I will break my review down for you in categories:

Food: They always have a kick butt amazing homemade soup of the day! My absolute favorite, seriously I have tried to recreate and have come no where close, is their chicken and rice soup which they only have 2 days a week *sunday and Tuesday I believe* It is outstanding! so creamy and just the right amount of salt. I feel that I have tried everything on this menu at least once so I will narrow it down to a few favorites. the GREEK CHICKEN dinner... you just can't get anything better. Slow cooked chicken in a lemon base sauce with cooked lemon on top served with rice pilaf... holy cow just amazing and such a generous portion. Also the chicken picante is outstanding as well, very close to the chicken dinner but I am almost positive the chicken dinner is the staple on the menu where as the chicken picante is only on special every now and then- both similar dishes except the picante comes in a creamy lemon sauce where the chicken dinner is almost like a lemon vinaigrette. the TURKEY CLUB AND FRIES is the best club out there; huge portion and I am a big fan of their french fries. the FRENCH DIP is very good as well. DESERT- depending on what you order, most of the time you get a FREE desert with your order. I always ask for a sundae to my liking and they always make it extra special with hot fudge, whip cream, cherries, and two of those wafer cookies *it may have been my waitress who does this because she has known my family for so long, I would ask for those toppings if you want them so you aren't disappointed if it comes to the table without them.*

atmosphere: family diner. would be nice if it got some updates to the interior; for instance new booths and tables would be nice but the looks of the restaurant does not stop us from eating there. It has a bar up front where you can sit and eat as well. The deserts are displayed in a front window where they are kept cool and it is very enticing. 

service: The servers are really nice. We have been served by the same woman and she is really nice and sweet. No one wants a rude or pushy waitress and I believe you will not find that here! 

great food, great prices, HUGE menu. I recommend this place to anyone:)

My husband and I took his grandmother here for dinner because she loves this place! It's a nicely decorated restaurant which gives it a charming environment. I ordered one of the dinner specials where it comes with soup/ or salad and dessert. The employees were all friendly and helpful as well :)

What Mark D said.
Good choice if you have a group unsure of what they want.

Lots of booth seating choices and a couple different rooms. The main room faces Rte14 and their very pretty rose gardens. I never feel crowded or rushed here, it's very comfortable.

Breakfast is served all day, but no poached eggs or waffles after 3. There is a 2x2x2 special that is not on the menu you have to ask for if you want a reasonable egg, bacon/sausage/pancake combo. Large salad choices, large menu, not expensive, not cheap.

The food here is ok and the place always seems spotless, but whenever I wind up here it is because all my preferred joints are closed. It's Greek run but nothing Greek that I really want like Mousaka.  I prefer Red Apple in Palatine for breakfast but they close at 3. The Continental in Buffalo Grove is a better option I think with an even larger menu and somehow always tastier. Cafe Fourteen has an ok breakfast but their lunch is meh and they close earlier than their posted 3pm.

A long time Palatine institution. A-OK

Typical Greek owned restaurant, with a large menu to select from. Food is good, nothing special. Good prices and servers. Serves breakfast all day. Good place to go to if its later in the evening and everyone is undecided on where to go.

Major disappointment.  What Greek style restaurant doesn't have yummy cream of chicken rice soup on Sunday? That was the one thing I was looking forward to and with the first spoonful I almost gagged.  it tasted like sour milk and I was informed they put lemon in it.  Took forever for our waitress to come back and I asked for a bowl of matzo ball soup instead. That was a bigger mistake. The broth looks yellow but it tasted like water and I don't know what they used to make the matzo ball with but it wasn't matzo meal. It had the texture and consistency of soap. And I thought i would try eggs hash browns toast and bacon. Any truck stop could do that. The bacon and toast was good, the eggs so so potatoes were nasty. When I paid the bill of almost 20 bucks for this horrendous meal and told guy you could tell he was thinking about taking something off but never did. I will never step foot in that place and I will warn others not to either. Pathetic.

Terrible terrible experience.   From the get go the waitress was extremely cold and rude. When asked what saganaki was she responded with its flaming cheese (which it clearly says on the menu).  She refused to give me any further details on it... okay so I won't order that and moved on.  I decided to go with chicken parmesan pasta pretty safe bet I thought.  Was the worst thing I've ever eaten.  It was super over cooked grilled chicken with mozzarella and what I can only compare to spaghettios sauce.  Everyone at the table sampled and agreed.  So I said I hate doing this but I really don't like this and would like something else.  The waitress rolled her eyes and said fine then what do you want.  I asked for the menu again so I can look through and she tossed one at me. I figured out my secondary option within a minute but she didn't come back for 20 minutes when everyone else had already finished their food.  So I said it took too long everyone's already done with their meal and she rolled her eyes again and just handed me the check!  And the worst part is when I went up to pay the manager asked how everything was and I said honestly pretty awful and he responded with "oh well" and then took my credit card and that was it!  Needless to say this will be my last visit here and I recommend everyone else stay away as well.
Place needs a little updating but the food and staff are great.

Seems like a standard family restaurant - yet when you look at the menu; they add a series of Greek fare to add to the list.

I live very close to this place. We've gone 20+ times. I never thought to write a review because I've done a lot for traveling, but not for walking distance from my home... (ooops.... should i have said that... hee hee hee).

I guess the fact that I've gone 20+ times speaks volumes, right.

I will say that the place over-indexes on seniors (people over 65) - it appeals to that kind of crowd. Yet... also is very family friendly with children's menu, crayons, games etc...

Really... a solid family restaurant with a disproportionate share of greek dishes - and a place where you can feel comfortable, casual, and get a good meal. Doesn't matter whether it is breakfast, lunch, or dinner.
Love this place... A place for a good home cooked meal.  Family owned and operated.. Great people!!
I eat here with my church group. the  food is always good. I like the different soups. thanks for letting us sit for a while and talk with no rush.

I love this place, from the 2x2x2 (two strips of bacon, two pancakes and two eggs any style) to the turkey club, all good is homemade just like your granny would make it. 

It's the type of place in the morning that the old men hang out at around 7am and talk to the waitresses by their first name, so it's a nice vibe whether you live here or not. I'm glad they hold the quality of food to a high standard after all these years of being in buissness.

My family and I came here for breakfast and it was amazing...fluffy pancakes, great hash browns and smooth coffee that just kept getting refilled without me having to hunt someone down. We be our new go to place for breakfast in the area.
