This is Palatines hidden jem..I'm in here once or twice a week and always order take out and have not been disappointed.  This is a great little spot and value wise it would be hard to find anything better. I have never experienced a rude employee as some others have mentioned. I love this place and know they will be around for awhile. Keep up the great work as I will be back as long as your in business.
I started going here a couple years ago. Now I stop in there a couple times a week. It has the best skirt steak and eggs anywhere.waitresses very attentive as well.

We've lived in the Palatine area for 36 years.  The Palatine Inn is our family's GO TO restaurant whenever we can't all agree on any other specialty restaurant.

I highly recommend you select from the daily special list which are always inserted in the middle of the menu.  There's are always selection of great entrees that will please the most critical palette ranging from a variety of meats to vegetarian delights.  Also, every dinner listed in the daily specials is inclusive of a great selection of delicious soups or salads, as well as a large variety of desserts ranging from ice creams to delicious cakes (I highly recommend the German Chocolate with a heap of whip cream) and pies; all on display.

Here's a hint for those who are 55+.  In addition to a great Senior Citizen section of the menu (same great dinners with full quantity of food, but offered at a much reduced price) the two main dinners offered on the daily specials are offered to Seniors at an additional discount.  

The food is scrumptious, the service is great, the restaurant is also inviting and clean, and the prices are always moderate to low.  My Final Hint ... Checkout "linkedoffers.com" for $5.00 coupons which are valid every day throughout the year.

KEEP UP THE GREAT JOB PALATINE INN!

Family owned diner
Great prices
A lot of food 
Had breakfast at 8pm Denver omlette hash browns PERFECT
My wife 1/2 Greek chicken 20-30 min also perfect
Place had a good crowd 
KEEP IT UP PALATINE INN!!

The Palatine Inn is a nice, old style Diner on Northwest Highway in Palatine.  It is well lit, well decorated (although perhaps a little outdated), and has a very extensive menu.  You want breakfast at 2AM?  Feel like dinner at 7AM?  They have it.

There are regular specials featured that include bread, soup or salad and the entree.  Daily specials also include desert. (Their pies are outstanding.)

The food was good and the service outstanding.  We'll be back.

Good place for a late lazy breakfast. Waitresses here are nice and not pushy like some places can be. Generous portions. I got spinach and feta omelet. Usually places blob the cheese on one part or another. The cooks aren't lazy here and it was prepared really good and consistent. I did pancakes instead of toast and I was stuffed. Im a big guy and can pack it away but this place gave me a run for my money. Which wasn't a lot. Extremely reasonable prices. 2 omelet breakfasts with pancakes 2 coffees(free refills too) plus tip and we only spent about $30. Will definately be back

Palatine Inn gets a solid three stars from me. They have your usual diner fare, as well as other dishes that go beyond the typical diner. One example is their grecian chicken, which is really great. You get several pieces of freshly broiled chicken in a yummy lemon sauce with a side of Greek potatoes, and soup or salad. I like their homemade soups, and I've never gone wrong with some staples like pecan pancakes, and the turkey club. Someone mentioned the place seems old or run-down, and I disagree. While it's not by any means hip, the restaurant has a homey atmosphere, and you can tell it's filled with local families that have been coming for years. It's nothing fancy, but it has a local, no-frills feeling. Great family-run, local place to grab breakfast, lunch, or dinner.
We went there for brunch on a Sunday and even though it was busy, the service was still great. The food was really delicious as well. The menu has many different options and offers breakfast all day.

I'm really not sure why this place only has 3 stars over all. I've been coming here for years with my parents and now my boyfriend and I go for at least coffee and dessert once a week.

This homey place is inviting and is a perfect mix of diner & blue collar restaurant.

Let's start with service. While this place is usually fairly crowded, it doesn't take long to get seated because it's a pretty sizable place. Mary Ann is our favorite waitress and we usually request her. The other waitresses are all very nice and accommodating, she's just our favorite. :)

Their whole menu (which is BIG) is done well. There are nights where 4 of us go two get breakfast one gets an entree and one gets a salad and it all comes out great and hot (or the correct temperature) at the same time. You really cannot beat their prices on somethings and if an item is more than $10 you can be sure it's worth the money.

Recent favorites of ours include

The half slab rib dinner - Ribs, side, soup or salad and dessert for 13.95

I LOVE the jalapeno burger (I change the cheese to mozzarella instead of cheddar). It's the perfect amount of heat and you can tell they hand make the burgers because the peppers are mixed into the meat.

The turkey club is a great deal and can easily be split for two.

My dad usually loves whichever fish is on special.

Their breakfast items no matter what time of day or what you order are always great.

For dessert options, rice pudding, and their apple squares are phenomenal.

Definitely ignore the bad reviews and give Palatine Inn a try!

Unless you pass by this place every day, you will never notice it.  I have lived in Palatine for eight months and it took me seven months to even notice it was there.  Anyhow, if you like the diners that have an old diner feel, this is the place to go.  The interior decor is a little outdated, which kind of brings a nice feeling to the restaurant.  The service was prompt, without any issues.  The food met expectations, and was priced accordingly.  I would probably go back here if I needed a quick bite for breakfast.

I am not sure how the lunch and dinner items are, but judging by the menu, it appeared that they had a huge selection.  I personally wouldn't go back for lunch or dinner, but I would go back for ice cream.  They have a pretty decent selection of desserts.

The great thing about this restaurant - outside of being able to order breakfast at anytime of day - is the fact that there are a little over ten billion things in the menu, giving you a serious amount of choices/variety.

Good prices, friendly staff. Great for groups especially if everyone has the taste for something different.

For some mysterious reason, my in laws enjoy this place. It defies logic. We have ended up here for holidays for several years now. The food never gets any better. I fully expect this place to be on "Kitchen Nightmares" one day. But that would imply, of course, that management knows there is a problem.
Everything here is dirty or rusty or old or all of the above. It clearly needs to be cleaned and updated.
The menu is equally uninspired, and worse, poorly executed. Because of the lack of options, I usually go with poached eggs. I mean, how can you screw up poached eggs? Well, you keep the shell on, of course.  Our waitress didn't even seem perturbed by it. I also had unripe tomatoes and tasteless turkey sausage. This place is overpriced, tasteless and bland. There's a pancake house down the street, a Baker's Square and a deli on the same avenue. Hell, there's a Burger King next door that probably has a cleaner interior and more menu choices. Save your money, save your time, save your gut. Go elsewhere.

DISAPPOINTING DINER

I'm a big fan of the Greek -style or homey diners every town boasts. Typically you find hearty, comfort food juicy burger platters filled with crisp fries and tureens of creamed soups. The menu and consistency pretty universal. 

Pulled in yesterday for lunch. First timer. And last timer. Experienced very poor service. For example, I had to hunt down our waitress for ketchup, multiple drink refills and napkins. When we complained about our food she just shrugged her shoulders in mock empathy, but did nothing to rectify it.

Speaking of food, my sister's pizza burger was dry (overcooked) and instead of dripping in meat sauce and mozzarella - the equivalent of a slice of cheese and a DRIZZLE of sauce adorned her burger. It was so scant on sauce that there was no meat clinging to it....as it should in meat sauce!

I ordered the Hungarian ghoulash. The description said strogonoff noodles, the picture showed strogonoff noodles......yet spaghetti noodles was what sat under my ghoulash. I couldn't wrap the meat around the noodles like I prefer nor did the gravy stick to the (supposed to be robust)  noodles; rather, it just slid off the skinny strands.

We did mention it to the manager who brought my sister extra sauce. Unknown to us till we were leaving, the manager put our entire tab on the house. That was very nice and most appreciated. The recovery was great. 

But in all honesty I just would have preferred a relaxing lunch buttressed by good service and good food.

I ordered a side salad (all the other salads were loaded with meat) and a fruit cup. My salad was so watery- and overpriced! $5 for a cup of salad? Come on!- so I only ate half. My fruit was dry and flavorless so I sent it back. Our waitress left much to be desired and wouldn't know friendliness if it bit her on the ass.

I should have listened to previous reviews that discussed lack of vegan/vegetarian options. I walk by this restaurant almost every day on my walks and there is always a substantial crowd. I figured it couldn't be too bad if so many people frequented the place. In fact, as I left there were about 30 people waiting to be seated.

Once the diners around me began eating I realized why so this place was always crowded. The garbage on their plates spoke for their taste in food. I was repulsed by some of the food I saw! One diner had a plate COMPLETELY soaked in some kind of white, thick, creamy gravy. 

Disgusting.

My family and I have visited this restaurant a couple of times and have been completely satisfied every time. The restaurant was clean, the bathrooms were clean, and the environment was comforting and diner like. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, especially for my picky children. 

I think the best part of this restaurant is that they serve breakfast all day. My family loves breakfast for dinner. Also I highly recommend trying the chicken parmesan, and the veggie stir fry. Those are my favorite dishes. Their menu is very large, and there is definitely something for the whole family. 

I would recommend this place for somebody who wants a good homely meal for the family and doesn't want  to spend a lot. Definitely a child friendly restaurant.
So my wife and I ate here this afternoon. She had cream of chicken and rice soup. Tonight she is deathly ill.

Sherman, set the Wayback Machine for 1970. Old fashioned flat omelettes, perfect pancakes, impeccable Belgian waffles, and service that my wife says came straight out of a 1970' s sitcom. They perfectly capture what breakfast was all about 50 years ago. I can understand why young hipsters don't like this place. But put on your time machine goggles and your sense of humor and enjoy!

Let me first say that several years ago I would've given Palatine Inn a higher rating. 

I used to love this place and would crave their cream of chicken rice soup constantly - I even knew the days of the week they'd rotate it in. It had that fabulous lemon flavor of a Greek soup mixed with the perfect chicken flavor and wonderful cream soup consistency. Sometimes it would have orzo instead of rice - both were fabulous! The other food was always great, too. 

Now don't get me wrong - they still serve up some good basic food. However, the cream of chicken soup drastically changed the past couple of years (and not for the better) - i don't even bother ordering it anymore. It is pretty much flavorless. No hint of lemon - and not much of any other flavor, either. As of late, the other food has been hit or miss for us, too. 

Also, we have had several experiences as of late with "less than stellar" service. 

It is unfortunate that something that was such a "go to" sure-thing-to-please-anyone kind of place has been on the decline with food and service. They aren't terrible - just not what they were. 

Hopefully they will start to "fix" some of these things and get back to what they were. In the meantime, our once regular trips have become less frequent for sure.

Hey, not bad!!

My dad lives in the area, and whenever I ask him if he wants to meet for lunch, this is where he suggests!  He loves it there, and who am I to judge Daddy's opinion?!

But I think the food here is pretty solid.  In most restaurants, you have to order a separate soup or side salad with your lunch or dinner meal, but here, it still comes with it.  The quality/quantity of the food is important nowadays!

Since their soups this past Saturday didn't sound very appealing, I was able to upgrade my soup to a salad for just $1.  Woohoo!!

But my hamburger was solid, and the fries were tasty.

I also like that each piece of bread in the bread basket is individually wrapped.  This means tons of people haven't touched it prior to my consumption (think about the "Fecal Vision skit from SNL if you don't know what I am talking about).

I KNOW I will be back here if my dad has any say in the matter :)

I love the staff here!  My kids have grown up coming to this restaurant, and the wait staff has always made them feel welcome and right at home.  

From the welcoming smiles to the lollipop for the kids as we leave.  The old time diner feel and the personal attention makes this place worth coming back to!

I have been to Palatine Inn a few times as it is Girlfriend's parent's regular place. I don't remember exactly what I got when I have gone with them for dinner but I do remember never being impressed. 

I went again today for breakfast, after visiting literally 3 other breakfast restaurants in the area only to find a full parking lot and no seating. Starving as I was, I decided to take a chance on the Palatine Inn just one more time. Who knows? Maybe their dinner doesn't paint an appropriate picture of what this restaurant has to offer! 

Wrong. 

I got the house skillet (broccoli, cauliflower, cheddar and two scrambled eggs) and it was really average. I would have been better off buying a bag of frozen veggies from Aldi and scrambling two eggs up at home - at least then the eggs wouldn't be mushy, cold and bland. It was a pretty disappointing meal, though I did try some of Girlfriend's pancakes and they were pretty delicious. 

Also, despite the fact that we went after breakfast hours we didn't receive a bread basket, which would have been nice considering how long the wait was on our food.

two skillets ended up being $20, which I thought was a little pricey for the quality, and quantity that we got. 

Not planning on going back here, I just am not a fan.

Dinner started on the positive side was a nice homey atmosphere, fast seating, and great soup, then morphed into a negative experienced.  While waiting too long for our entrees, we attacked the rolls only to discover they were stale.  When our entrees finally arrived, they proved unworthy of the wait.  Our waitress was completely disinterested, and never brought the napkins and butter we requested.  We'd been looking forward to the German chocolate cake to compensate, but no such luck.  It tasted like it had just been purchased at a 7-Eleven and removed from cellophane.  We headed out for a donut shop for coffee and desert.  'Nuff said.

Warm and homey, Palatine Inn is a staple of Palatine cuisine.

The cream of chicken, matzo ball, and chowder soups are always fantastic.

Pastas & Greek dishes are always good but like with most little diners, use discretion.  If taco salad is on the menu and you're not at a mexican place, it might not be what you're used to.

I just had dinner a a few minutes ago. Wow they have gone down hill! It's been a while since I've been there, but I remember the nice waitresses and good food as my family had their meals at Palatine Inn. They must have changed owners. I  thought the bread coming in plastic wrap was a good idea.. Cleaner. But why wrap dryed out bread, to keep it longer than a week? Being a Greek own business I thought I should stick with their special and had a gyro platter. Since I've had gyros from every carry out in the northwest suburbs, I figure this is going to be good. Not! The meat was dry out and sat in a pool of oil.  It tasted and looked like week old Spam.The sauce was more like cold cream cheese. I guess my memories of the family going to Palatine Inn are shot.

My rating is for their breakfasts since that's the only meals we've had here.  I can't speak for lunch or dinner.  But we come almost every Sunday and we absolutely LOVE the atmosphere and the food.  The service is very good, and their breakfast menu is extensive.  One of the things we love about it is the multi-generational clientele.  It's very neat to see grandparents, parents and kids all together for a family breakfast.  And their breakfasts are wonderful.  There's a lot of food and we've enjoyed everything that we've ever ordered.  My husband always orders his bacon extra crispy wherever we go, and Palatine Inn is the ONLY place that has been able to accomodate.  Simple thing, but small things matter.  Don't come here if you're looking for a "foodie" atmosphere (there are plenty of nice places for that).  Come here if you want a charming, nostalgic, relaxing breakfast with good food and nice people.

If I could, I would eat here everyday. The soups they offer are all great and the main courses are even better! They only offer somewhat stale bread wrapped up in plastic wrap but the place's main customers are mostly senior citizens so it's understandable. The atmosphere is very relaxed and the service is always provided with a smile.

Very family friendly. I really like their soups, and they change everyday. They have a nice bar area you can go and sit at solo. This is a type of place that gives you a bread basket. Ive had their fish before and it was decent.

Went here for dinner.  Once.  Will only ever go back to try their dessert if I'm feeling like risking it.  On a vegetarian friendly scale, I give them two carrots.  There is 24/7 breakfast, but other than that, your option is grilled cheese.

I ordered a veggie skillet with wheat toast.  The toast was the driest, oldest toast I've ever had at a restaurant.  The skillet was good, but near the end i found a small piece of something that looked horribly like meat...  or dog poop...  or something else that didn't belong on my plate.  the worst part was the service.  the server must've come directly from a funeral because she barely acknowledged us as humans, seemed bitter when we asked for anything like refills or condiments, and just overall seemed like a miserable person.  After my fiance asked for a box for his leftovers, she dropped the check and told us to "have a nice night" (someone should have told her face) and walked away.  We were thinking about getting dessert, but I think we had taxed her enough...
Grecian Chicken+Greek Salad with the house Dressing= the best $9.99 you can spend anywhere.
If you want a breakfast that will fill your gut at a decent price, this is the place to go!!

when people say the toast at the restaurant was dry it makes me laugh.anywhere you go the toast is gonna be dry,try it at home,take a piece of soft bread and toast it,and.....its gonna get dry.so please people when you write a review it should make sence!!!! i love the place and the food!!!

I am very surprised with the pizza here.  I'm sorry thin crusts lovers, I typically don't like thin crust.  I want to feel like I'm eating pizza.  I want to pick up a slice with substance and feel like I'm eating something a little bread-y and not a hot cracker with cheese on it.  I don't want to hear "crunch crunch" when I bite into pizza, ever.  And what's the deal with square-cut pizza? Seriously, someone please explain this to me.  What's the point of this?  When you traditionally or pie-cut pizza, every slice for the most part is fairly equal in ingredients and size.  But when you start making the pizza look like like tiny bathroom tiles, then you end up with really large center pieces with 100% cheese and toppings with no crust and then the neglected, unloved, edge pieces/step children of the pizza where it's like 60% crunchy cracker and only 40% toppings around the edges.  Now I'm no Pizzaologist, but I don't like those numbers. And be honest with yourselves folks, no one eats the edges, unless you're the sucker who stands in line first and has no choice.  Everyone else just gets the edge slices to be polite but deep down they just want to be pizza selfish and grab the giant, perfect, crustless "slices" in the middle like anyone with common sense.

So yeah, Mr. Beef's and Pizza was surprising.  The crust was soft and chewy and it DID NOT feel like I was eating a little cheese cracker snack, but a cheesy meal.  And believe me, they did not skimp on the cheese.  To make it even better, their sauce was light and actually tasted like tomatoes and not tomato paste.  There were some bites that actually had little chunks of tomatoes that weren't completely crushed in the sauce making process.  I love that!

Still a 3.5 for this place. I went here yesterday, Saturday, 6 August, for a few slices, fries, onion rings, and a diet Pepsi.

I ordered 3 slices, to eat 2 for now and 1 for later. The cheese slice was good as usual - piping hot and a bit crispy on the crust. The pepperoni slice had one pepperoni slice. One. WTF?!? I'll have to make sure I don't get this next time.

Anyways the fries were good, slightly crispy, and onion rings were nice, with a real onion, not minced onions. Had an odd malfunction with the fountain drink dispenser - it kinda exploded when I was trying to get my diet Pepsi some cherry syrup. Eh, oh well. I cleaned up and bit, picked up my food and went on my way.

Service was decently fast and food was good, just some foibles here. I'll be back for more.

Came here on a suggestion by a coworker. I tried the cheezy Italian Beef and onion rings. The beef was flavorful and well worth the stop. I thought the onion rings were top notch and perfectly cooked.

Mr. Beef has excellent Italian beef sandwiches and other sandwiches. Chili cheese fries or a big favorite with us as well as just the cheese fries. Personal favorite is the cheesy Italian beef on garlic bread. They have never messed up one of the orders going through the drive-thru.
Mr Beef you robbed me! Asked for a gyro salad extra gyro meat. Paid $11.77 and got a BS salad. Picture is posted. The gyro meat is weighed my @ss!! Never coming here again!!!

Stopped in here for dinner when we were in town for a few days. It was about 6:45 on a Tuesday evening. We waited a few minutes to order because there was a line but no biggie. I got the regular size Italian beef dipped and my husband got the gyro plate. Delicious. Being from Chicago I love a good beef sandwich and this did not disappoint. Everything was hot and yummy even the chocolate chip cookies were fresh and tasty. The only reason this gets 4 stars is.... PEPSI.  Serve Coke! That's a Chicago tradition.   Great place!

The beef sandwich is awesome on garlic bread

We have become regulars and will continue to be.
Hey Rich:
Tony was my barber for 20 years!  He was my confidant!  I hope he is well.

This has to be the worst pizza ive ever had....about 30 minutes after eating my cheese pizza with extra grease my gallbladder started palpitating. i couldnt get this down my system and puked this up. NASTY!

Shared the Italian beef sandwich and cheese pizza.   Sandwich was good fresh and plentiful.  Alittle on the spice side.  Cheese pizza was one of the best I've had in awhile.  Clean place.  Would recommend

Drive thru review: although I did not go inside, nor try anything other than the pizza by the slice - the experience and pizza is phenomenal.

Quality of ingredients: 10/10 cheese and tomatoes were soft as expected and crust had the perfect pop as you bit into it

Texture of pizza: 10/10 this pizza stays together when you're eating it despite it being served very hot and fresh

To go wrapping: pizza is served very hot even at 6:30PM. The pizza has plastic wrap to keep it from dripping or soiling the huge triangle box.

The pizza did not drip nasty grease all over, the balance of ingredients were on point, can't wait to try their deep dish on Thursdays.

OK, as I promised I came back to Mr.Beef to give it a try, last time I was incredibly disappointed, so in order to be consistent I ordered the cheesy Italian combo sandwich, I must say that it was a huge improvement over my last experience, the sandwich had plenty of beef, it was tasty and had just enough juice! So there you go! 4 stars!

Chicken Pesto sandwich on Ciabatta...a premium sandwich that we order time and time again.  As for pizza and beefs, we don't order them that much...just the Chix sandwich.  Tremendous sun dried tomatoes, spinach and oil makes it the best Chix sandwich in the NW suburbs.

I been exploring the menu over the years and my favorite items were their fried popcorn shrimp, chopped salad, gyros sandwich, BBQ beef, BBQ bacon mushroom burger, spaghetti and meatballs, and lastly their CHEESE FRIES!
Awesome restaurant!! I love how it looks like a 50s diner on the inside. Their deep-dish pizzas and gyros are great. Would definitely recommend to a friend!

We live in Texas but stay in Illinois for one month every year.  By far, Mr. Beef has the finest Italian Beef sandwich in the entire USA.  The flavors of the juice, the tenderness of the beef, and the taste Italian Bread is heaven....Their other items are to rave about as well...pepper and egg sandwich, hamburger, chicken....did I say pizza?  Well, it is fantastic too.  Go to a fancy, expensive place if you desire but for great food, this is the place.  And I say this as an expert Italian!
Love this place. They have the best Italian beef. Best option for lunch!

It's a really good slice of pizza with pop kinda place.  It's got that retro diner feel to it and serves some pretty good pizza.  The thin and pan are really good, it's the type of pizza that has thick cheese and sauce that is a bit sweet which is good, sausage here is good too.

It's quick and ok on the $$$, for a good treat...the chili cheese fries are really good.

I don't know about this low score. I ordered a gyro sandwich and it was one of the best gyro sandwich I had.
Definitely come again if in the area.

Went through the drive thru the other day.  My office is located nearby and I won't be back.  They were very slow and the girl at the window was borderline rude when asked for Ketchup and if there was napkins etc.  The fried shrimp and fries I got were soggy.  The cocktail sauce I inquired about that was definitely in the bag, guess what....It was not there.  This place has been around forever, but it has gone down hill.
Fifty's feel to it, old school diner seating.  Slices of pizza are always fresh and hot, best of all they are cheap

Yay! I'm a fan of their slices.  I only met Mr Pizza as I didn't feel like an introduction with Mr beef was necessary.  A slice and a draft of MGD for about $6.99 with tax.  A large enough slice with tasty sauce and a frozen pint of beer.  It was good.  Good za slices are hard to come by in this area.  Yes there are a number of businesses that sell pizza but not many sell decent slices.

Their slices are thin crust with that bread crumb powdered bottom.  Pastry type with a nice chew and tasty sauce with a crispy crust.  Any slice on hand is a mere $3 dollars.  

The place would remind you of 70s era diners with pink neon and vinyl booths.  The kind of place small children would find intriguing.  Speaking of children, this location has a separate party room that could seat forty with arcade classics.  One detail not known to the public is that they have a drive-thru.  I've eaten in this area for more than a decade and found this out about a week ago.  It'd be great if management knew the pluses with using signage.
Food is high quality for fast food, cool 50's interior lot of variety on the menu, a bit expensive but like I said high quality fast food is more expensive, I really like this place

Our car club has been hosting our club meetings monthly here for many years. They treat us very well. 

Food is always top notch from beef to chicken sandwiches and burgers. Not much of fan of their thin crust pizza. The pizza by the slice looks good though. Love the fries and the brownies are awesome. 

I've never had anything here that I didn't like. Highly recommended. If your in the area, stop in.

Great Italian beef and fries! 

I don't intend to pick on the other reviewers here, but I'm unsure why this place hasn't gotten better reviews (what's their beef about this place)... I've only had terrific experiences here at Mr Beef. Their Italian beef tastes great, as do their fries... I would only recommend ordering a side of their gravy because one may want 'more' than what they put on standardly. Perhaps their brand of hot peppers (Hot Giardiniera) could be better, but that's okay. Their sweet peppers are very good. 

Perhaps, maybe they may be a little more expensive than other beef places around, but not by much, but the other places aren't as good... The person taking the order have always been friendly & helpful, taking money and handing over the food. 

I'll definitely be back for more beef.

Food is good ... cheese fries rock!!! But as I was there eating on Sunday with my 9 year old son I happen to look up and notices that all the ceiling fans had soooooooo much dust and dirt on them... looks like they haven't been cleaned in 10 years NASTY ... They.looled like they were growing fur on each and every fan blade.

Note to the owners.... spend 20 bucks swifter makes a fan cleaning duster... CL EN YOUR NASTY FANS

We've had Mr. Beef for lunch during our training seminars, and it's always a hit. I'm a huge fan of the BBQ Bacon Mushroom Burger, it's pretty amazing. The fries are better than most as well. Otherwise, everyone at work has confirmed that the gyros are top quality. I would recommend stopping by and grabbing food. Maybe not the best atmosphere. Reminds me of a 50's style diner and maybe that's your thing.

We are only allowed a 30 minute lunch and my office is right around the corner from this place. 

A few of us come here pretty regularly and have tagged along a couple times. The first time I went was because I had a craving for Gyros. They were very good. The pita was fresh, and the meat was pretty decent. Their fries- I could go either way. They are not my favorite.

I have tried their fried shrimp, it's just frozen fried shrimp from what I can tell. It comes with a salad and the last time, it was pretty pathetic; wilted and such.

I have ordered their grilled chicken sandwich a few times and it's pretty good. Not a lot of flavor, though. I really order it because its on days I need some protein. I'm almost tempted to put salt on the chicken, but refuse to because thats so bad! :) I would like it if they put some seasoning or marinaded the chicken breasts.

I can't complain about the food not being fresh....that is not an issue here (minus the frozen stuff). 

Their service is good. The food gets prepared pretty quickly and they keep the tables pretty clean. 

Another plus is they offer a caffeine free diet cola (pepsi)! Not a huge fan of pepsi products, but it's caffeine free and diet, so I can't complain. This is hard to find at any restaurant. Glad they caught on!

I'm sure I'll be back soon. Perhaps, I'll try something else next time.

My favorite beef place of all time. Been coming here for years and nobody does a cheesy beef on garlic bread better than this place. Sorry to say that I don't think I've tried anything else on the menu because the beef is so good. I can say that the pizza does look really good I may have to try a slice next tome.

Bleh. They food is low quality and the shakes are tiny, I tried the burgers, big beef, and the cheese fries and was disappointed with all of them except the big beef which was decent. The place attempted to look retro, but just looked old with terrible smelling bathrooms and deteriorating decorations. Would not recommend.
Expensive food, and quality is not good. Lady that takes order is not friendly at all.
Don't come here expecting the food to taste like Mr Beef on Harlem. It is NOTHING like Mr Beef on Harlem. Blah!!
Wow, haven't been there for a while, won't be back. Food was good but MINI beef, hot dog, cheese fries, almost $14.00????? Criminal.

It wasn't bad but it was nothing to scream praises of it was average at the least as well as very expensive for what I eat cheesy beef and a slice of pizza the sandwich I could get for 5 bucks anywhere else there atmosphere was a bit dated boots were not new tables and chairs were not new you think charging prices like they are they would at least have a good Center furniture instead of one that is worn out and in need of replacement they probably should try a little harder the girl that takes the orders didn't even say thank you when I paid nor did she say goodbye as I walked right past the registers to leave most places say goodbye and thank you maybe this place is too good to do that and I just don't realize it anyway to get the same before I'll just go somewhere else and save myself five bucks
Cheap, quick, nothing special neither good or bad.

Cheese fries are amazing from here. Hot dogs are good, but stay away from the gyro's. I don't know what kind of meat they use, but it was almost shaved like a bbq pulled pork or something. It was really weird. Not a cheap place either for a ma and pa fast food place.

Mr Beef & Pizza has a lot going for them including way above average Italian beef sandwiches, and beef and sausage combos. Word of warning: if you like your beef juicy, ask for the au jou on the side (which they'll happily do) because otherwise they'll REALLY make it wet. Of course some people like it running down their arm, in which case get it wet. I also recommend the cheese and green peppers.

I've had their pizza a couple times, but the rest of the family gets it a lot and it's a solid 7 out of 10. Also, the kids love their kids meals which are a good deal - come with plenty of fries - and come in a little cardboard 1950s car.

Speaking of kids: totally family friendly. They've had some excellent magic shows there, completely free. I'm talking 6 or 7 magicians over nearly a couple of hours. It's off to the side in a party room. Again, the kids love that. They also love the video game arcade and the claw that grabs stuffed animals...that sort of thing. It's cheap entertainment for kids 10 and under for sure.

Have had a party in the party room too, and it was pretty reasonable with about 50 people getting plenty to eat and beer as well.

Final tip: their kiddie spaghetti comes with a good meatball and garlic bread and is very reasonable. For adults who don't have a huge appetite, it's a great buy and they won't card you even if you look over 10yrs old.

I don't think you'll be disappointed if you're looking for a good value beef in the Mt Prospect area.

the ONLY place to eat an Italian Beef.  I've tried them all and this is the best.  Beef here has a fresh taste to it-unlike Portillos which has a very chemically taste to it.  This is because portillos loads their beef and juice with an insane amount of MSG.  They don't do that here.  The sweet peppers they use here are the best and the hot are also very good.  Get the sandwich totally dipped.  Sure it's a little more expensive than other places but it's worth it.  Freshness doesn't come cheap.
This place  is expensive the  food  had  no flavor beef was super skimpy won't be back

I'm an event planner (side job) and good food is HUGE when hosting events. I am a regular customer of Mr. Beefs and have been for a few years now. The food is sooo tasty I decided to use the catering service for a bridal shower I hosted on June 21, 2014. I ordered the large beef's, baked chicken, mostaccioli, about 80 plus cupcakes (different flavors) and the key lime bars. I can not say it enough how GREAT the food was/is!!! So many guests came up to me during the shower asking who catered the food. I recieved several calls the next day asking where are they located. The Mother of the Bride MADE me order more of the key lime bars today!! 

I will be placing more catering orders for my upcoming events on Aug 2nd & 9th of this year. I live all the way in Berwyn with hundreds of resturants all around me and I will continue to use Mr. Beefs!! This is my #1 pick by far. 
Can't forget to mention how extremely nice and kind all the owners are. Customer service is by far important and they provide the best!!

Great food, great customer service AND they delivered to me all the way in Berwyn. 

If you're looking for a great meal, excellent catering, the best desserts you will ever eat you have found them! 

LaTasha M. Johnson

If you are in the mood for a quick lunch this is NOT the place, especially drive thru. I was second in line and it took over 20 minutes to get to the window. Judging by the person's reaction in front of me she had been waiting a long time as well. This is not the first time. I figured the first time must have been a fluke so I tried it again and it's still just as bad. I won't make this mistake a third time.

Went with the sandwich trio, beef was ok, meatball was weak, sausage was the best of the three.  Too much cheese overall and a little to greasy for me.  However I loved the cheese fries.  They are softer than I am sure some like but for me I enjoy when u need a fork because they are so engulfed in the cheese and are a little mushy.  

Pretty much your typical beef and hamburger place, 50's diner kind of feel.  Huge dining area.

2.5 stars would have been my choice but I always like to round up - overall good not great, no Portillos or Johnnies, but better than Buona for sure

Side note: my friend has the gyro sandwich and it looked pretty good, he was happy with his

Mr. Beef has definitely improved a lot since the first time I was there years ago. They have a really good Italian Beef with decent spice. Problem is that it is a bit fatty which leaves a lot more grease on your hands than beefs from other places. Still worth having though.

A tasty time warp.
I don't think a single piece of decor has been updated here since it opened and I hope they never change a thing.
The food was tasty, the service was fast and friendly and the atmosphere is tough to beat. 
The only downside would be the cost but my serving was huge. 

What I found particularly cool was I told the cashier that I had never been here before and I wasn't sure if a gyro was the route I wanted to go - he immediately offered to bring me a few pieces of the gyro meat to see if I liked the taste before ordering. I was surprised and impressed. 

The menu is pretty large. As you could guess, they're known for their beef (cheesy beef!) and pizza. There are a lot of other choices and not all of them deliciously deep fried.

Now that I know this place exists, I want to go back and I want to bring more friends with me when I go.

We are regulars that live down the street. I do agree that prices are high. Cheeseburgers are delicious! Best cheese fries around. I think we keep coming back because every woman that works the drive thru always greets you with a smile and always so nice :)

Okay I am obsessed with their pizza and chicken fingers but my god the people are the most miserable and rude people I have ever encountered!! It makes me not even want to go here just because of that! Every time I go through that window I get in a bad mood because they're so fricken rude!! I'm about to eat pizza I should be in a great mood! Smile and say thank you to your customers. It goes a long way!!!!

The food, portion and prices I am not to crazy about. Let me get the story from the begining...

Well I was waiting in line and the guy in frontof me ordered two packs of friest and a beef special. He spent around $20 on that... I spent about $10 for Italian beef, small fries, and NO drink. They also charge you for the gardedas.

I tried the italian beef and it was probably the most flavorless thing I have ever tasted. Italian beef is very flavorful and this tasted like they dipped it in hot water then hot oil. I also was not to crazy about the portion either.. It was the size of a TI-84 calculator with little beef in it.

The fries seemed like your average cheap frozen fries. Thus the fries were over priced. The small carton didn't help either and the flavor of the fries weren't amazing. 

I would probably not come here again because it is a waste of money. I generally don't say "waste of money" but this place is geuinely wasting your money. I recomend you go a distance and go to Mr. Pubs (Near the first McDonald)  if you are just looking for good food.
My beef was just okay and my fries were 50/50 -- 50% of them were done and 50% of them weren't.   I won't be back.

I went to a baby shower held in their side party room and immediately booked my husband's 50th bday party here.  This may not look off-hand like a good party place but it is AWESOME.  Rich, the manager I guess, is about the nicest person I've ever encountered anyplace and was so helpful.  They let us arrive 1/2 hour early to decorate and let us hang around an extra 1/2 hour as we trickled out since there wasn't another party afterward.  EVERYBODY LOVED THE PIZZA.  They served all we could eat along with all the salad we could eat and all the pop we could drink and were completely unstingy, keeping the table loaded with food and drink the whole time we were there and supplying us with tons of leftover boxes to take the extras home!!  They were also very unobtrusive as they refilled everything, it was like magic!  They allowed us to bring in a TV to play a tribute to my husband.  They told me several times that I could leave all of our garbage behind, torn wrapping paper, used dishes and decorations (how many times will you use those 50 year old decorations??) etc.  They allowed us to bring in our own bday cake and supplied free coffee, cups, and serving ware.  The serving tables were all covered and had table skirts.  Plus, when they new the amount of people we would have, they had the tables prepared with appropriate seating.  

I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to have a casual party for 50 or fewer people (we had about 45.  It was a LITTLE tight, but there is an additional sitting area attached to the main party room.

There is a stage where they put the serving tables that still has plenty of area for someone to stand and MC (we even crowded about 20 guys up there for a little contest of sorts).  

Plus the food is genuinely good and ALL the servers and employees we encountered were friendly and helpful.  Finally, THE PRICE IS RIGHT!!!!!!

I stopped here out of desperation because I was starving & didn't want typical chain fast food like most places that were in the area.  My buddy recommended this place because he's eaten here before & said the food was good.  I ordered a cheeseburger, cheese fries & a cup of water, my total was $8 & change.  As I waited for my food to come out, I kept looking at my receipt. $4.90 for the burger, $2.50 for the cheese fries, $0 for the water.  When my food  was ready, I almost laughed when I saw how little food was on the tray.  The burger was a 1/3 lb but looked smaller than a quarter pounder from McD's & had no flavor.  The cheese fries were good, but you need to use a fork since cheese is poured on the fries & they're a mess to eat.  Next time, I would try ordering fries with a side of cheese since the fries were good, but got soggy after a while of sitting in liquid cheese.  I was surprised to only see about 7 people in the place on a Friday night, but maybe this is more of a lunch destination.  I was a little disappointed at how little food I got for the price I paid, but that's the risk I take for getting a burger at a place that specializes in other things.  I'll try some pizza next time if I decide to stop in

I'm not giving Mr. Beef & Pizza a low rating for the food being any worse than other beef places.  Only food complaint would be their fries (not crispy enough for my taste).  
My 'beef' (haha) is with the service. It seems those working their drive-thru have never been told that friendliness goes a long way w/customers. I don't expect chit-chat, but even when there are no cars behind me - they move you through as if they are being timed. The girl working it today couldn't muster a 'hello', nor a smile.  Again, there was no line & no reason to rush me. 
This place is WAY over-priced & I see no reason to go back.  Plenty of good eats in this area with food that is just as good & friendly faces - which may not be important to others, but it is to this former Mr. Beef customer.
I love this place, reasonably priced greasy spoon type food.  Just stay away from the pizza and go for their italian sausage or beefs.

Okay so I went here with my 72 yr old mother, my 14 yr old niece and my 6 yr old grandson.  I myself am 43. Everyone left full and happy. We ordered the largest thin crust pepperoni pizza on the menu which we got for 1/2 off thanks to an Entertainment Book coupon. It was huge so we did end up taking some home but not as much as you might think. My grandson is a pizza fiend and he ate 10 pieces. (Not a typo). This kid loves pizza.

My niece opted for the Italian Beef which looked great and she said was delish. She ordered it dipped with extra gravy on the side but it came dry plus they forgot the gravy. They got us some right away when we went back. She had cheese fries too which I sampled and they were as yummy as any cheese fries I've ever had. Drinks are free refills you get yourself so the kids drank a gallon or so each. 

Since there are no waitresses you save on tipping so between that and the coupon we got a great deal for four people plus enough pizza leftover for my grandson's dinner. Since the service was slow and our order was wrong I knocked off a star. The lady who took my order at the register  looked bored and didn't know how to credit me for the discount so she had to call someone over and seemed irritated for the trouble. She also added an extra order of fries in her confusion over my niece's cheese fry decision but they looked so good we kept them. 

The parking is ample and easy to access. They have outside seating too and beer on the menu. The decor is cheezy but who cares? It was clean. Good place for kids. My friend gave me her Entertainment Book coupon so I'm going back for sure.

Ate here almost 5 times now and today was the 5th time.  Everytime we come here it's just delicious.  I had the grilled veggie CCiabatta and my fiance had the chicken ciabatta.  I love this place and everything was so flaverfull.  I do wish they invented more vegetarian items.

Won't go back!  

Items ordered:  2 steak sandwiches, a gravy bread and fries.

My steak sandwich had Nothing, nothing on it, no lettuce, tomato, etc. That would not really be so terrible if it were a good steak sandwich.  It was thin and the meat  was low quality and/or borderline on freshness.  My companion got the same thing, only on garlic bread.  I think that made his a tad better than mine.  No sauce on the side, just bread and meat and no good meat at that!

Fries- good. Gravy bread good.  I was hopeful this was like the Mr. Beef (On Harlem) that serves a kick-ass steak sandwich. Sadly, it is not!

I don't think the place is the best food in the world, by any means, but it's not a one star experience!

I've been going to Mr. Beef & Pizza for years, close to 20 to be honest, and it's a pretty decent place for pizza, beef, dogs, gyros, etc...  The food is about average for the type of restaurant that it is.  As for the pizza, it's definately better than cardboard!

There's also a party room that's great for kids birthday parties, family parties, team celebrations, etc... We had my daughters first and second birthday parties there and just had our kids' combined birthday parties there this weekend.  In the past, our friends have always enjoyed the pizza.  Personally, I'm board with pizza at the moment (have a 3 yr old son who would live on it, given the opportunity), so we had lunch by the head for the party.  We had Beef, Mostoccolli, potatoe salad, garden salad, mozzeralla sticks, fried mushrooms, onion rings and fresh veggies... we got a TON of compliments on the location and the food.  The price, for 45 people to eat, was actually pretty good.  The party room has games and plenty of room to set up activities for kids.

I'll continue to have my kids parties there as long as they continue to enjoy it and we'll stop by there every now and then because the food is good and the atmosphere is comfortable, regardless of age.

Oh, on a side note, they also do what Flukey's used to do with the old cars coming out on the weekends in the summer and they do slot car races over the summer too.

Yes, much of that activities are geared towards kids, but that doesn't take away from the fact that it's actually a pretty decent place to grab a dog and cheese fries on a Saturday afternoon if you happen to be in the neighborhood.

I stopped here after an alumni swim meet with 2 of my friends. I'm 5 foot 9, 160 lbs with a ferocious appetite. My one friend is 6 feet tall and weighs about 185 lbs and my other friend is about 5 foot 5 at about 220lbs. You can see, we're heavy eaters.

We ordered the Mr. Beef Deluxe deepdish. It sounded appetizing enough. Cheese, green onions, olives, tomatoes, sausage, BACON, etc....how can you not try it? the guy at the register told us it would take about 30 minutes. so while we waited we got ourselves an order of cheese fries to keep us busy.

as promised, 30 minutes later, register man comes out with our pizza. sets it down, and the three of us devoured the beauty that sat in front of us. the large, 14 inches if i remember, was plenty to feed three hungry young men. with our stomachs full and pizza pan empty with nothing but uneaten crusts, we realized that for less than 25 bucks, we had a great meal which was well worth the short 30 min wait.

of course if you want some great pizza, u should try lou's. but for good pizza at a cheap price to share amongst three fatties, this place does a good job.

the interior makes it a fun and relaxing place to sit back and have a nice conversation. added plus cause they serve beer. i mean come on, whats better than pizza and beer after a swim meet?......well, deep dish pizza and beer!
excellent beef and their juice was tasty and not just salt water

I haven't been here in awhile (used to go quite often years ago).  This place does make AMAZING beef sandwiches.  When I first started going, I'd get the cheesy beef with hot peppers soggy (the cheddar cheese is like that processed nacho cheese you get at gas stations, still very yummy tho!, the mozzarella cheese is the real stuff)..anywho, huge sandwich not stingy on cheese, peppers or au jus.  Really good cheese fries here too.  They have large fries and douse them in cheddar cheese (much better than the places that give you 'shoestring fries' and a tiny cup of cheese).  I have never tried their pizza, my ex did and he said it was terrible.  This was a good 5-6 years ago though...could've changed!

I came here expecting a delicious beef but was very disappointed. I don't get all the fuss. The beef was descent but the lack of spiciness in the hot peppers ruined the whole thing. The beef juice was thick with grease. The fries were good but didn't quite do it for me.

Unfortunately most of my co-workers like coming here, and it's one place we bring our contractors too. Don't get me wrong, it's not a bad place to go, there pizza is pretty good but I prefer the Cheesy Italian Beef. Avoid the burgers, there ar much better places for a burger. There burgers are juicy and a good size but they lack flavor, you'll end up putting salt pepper, ketchup whatever just to get it to taste better.

People you'll see usually work in the area or they have kids. I recommend it if you have kids. But I don't recommend this place for an every day or even week place.
Solid pizza joint. My husband likes going there when in the area, so I have to go with him. :) Good polish sausage, tasty-tasty pizza by the slice and cheap beer.

Good joint for beef if you're in the area and want some variety from all the other decent beef joints nearby. They probably give you the most meat on your sandwich of all the others, including Buona, Brown's Chicken, Johnnie's, Frankly Yours, etc., and their gravy is above average. The fries are decent, nothing to write home about. Service is quick and friendly, the place is large and always clean, and they have a huge menu, as man cannot live on beef alone. To that end, skip the pizza.

Food good even in the slowness of the afternoon.  The had a respectable mid day crowd.   Everything we had we enjoyed and even really liked some offerings.   Okay, kinda divey.  Kinda raggedy. Good value.  Not for the prissy diva.   Good for the buffet foodie in you.

All I ate was the sushi and it was actually pretty good stuff. I didn't even stop to look at the rest of the buffet. These that $10 for all you can eat sushi is a deal. Restaurant could be a little cleaner that's why I dropped a star off the rating but as far as sushi prep went, it was very clean.

Run away....  The place is filthy.  Greasy floors.  Carpet is black...
Buffet is ok.   When it opened years ago, it was great.   Not so much any more.

Bulk napkins stored on the floor.  Oh and use soap next time to clean the glass between booths...   OMG

Just came back from this place and we are feeling very nauseous.  Everything was cold on the buffet. Every dish had congealed into a cold block of grease. It was all tasting like cold, old grease and salt. Beside from the state of the food, this place is dirty as all hell. Why hasn't the health department closed it down! I'm going to go barf now.
Bathrooms are filthy. Table's not much cleaner. The buffet is scattered  (Things from the tray next to it all mixed.) But for 10 bucks....ya just can't beat it.

Not a bad place. I have seen this place at a lot of wal mart locations. They do have a stir fry area which is good. But overall, it's like any Chinese Buffett.

A little bit expensive though. For two dinners and two drinks it's 27.42. We had a 3 dollar off coupon.

It's above average clean. Service was good. But this place doesn't have the "wow" factor.
Great food! Good service and good people. This place has it all when it comes to hibachi style grill food with a buffet...can't beat it and the price is good too!
Not really much to say, the calamari and general's chicken were the best. The salmon sushi was surprisingly not fishy.  The tables are not the cleanest and the bathroom is not clean.

Decent restaurant for our family of 6. The stir fry area is the best bet. Other food selections are typical of Chinese buffets. Bathrooms can use more cleaning and updating. Overall ok and would return.
The worst buffet. Chicken is frozen and cold, old rice, everything is fried with no flavor, picked over salads and desserts. Go down the block to Panda Express for better quality.

Come on people, it's only $7.49 for a (lunch) buffet. Some of these reviews are way too critical. It's like criticizing the Dollar Menu at McDonald's - it's pointless. 
 
From the outside, the place looks sketchy. Once you walk it, it's crowded with a lot of families with kids running around. It's crowded because of the value - you get your money's worth for the price. I was expecting worse because of the appearance but I was pleasantly surprised. The fried chicken was crispy and seasoned well and the variety was plentiful. There were only a few sushi items to choose from but there were plenty of other dishes that stood out. The crawfish boil was also surprisingly good - the broth was spicy and unlike any crawfish that I've had before. 

I got my money's worth after devouring five plates of food. It's surprising that they are still in business because you are getting much more food for the price you pay. Haters are going to hate but you can't deny that you are getting more than what you pay for.

Best Crawfish so far.. Food choices are great.. very affordable!!! I gave this a 4 stars.. SERVICE..  one thing I can brag most about is the Server.. we are a group of 12 and he was very attentive. He kept our table clean refreshed our drinks and was always asking what else we need. He even gave us extra fortune cookies.. SPECIAL MENTION... SKY (DONT KNOW IF I SPELLED IT RIGHT).. BEST SERVER!!

In driving down Barrington Road in Streamwood on one weekend afternoon I came across a place called "Hibachi Grill & Supreme Buffet". They seem to be a chain as I was fairly certain I had eaten at a similarly named place before, but I was hungry enough to decide to stop in and give it a try.

The first thing I noticed was how crowded it was. Both the parking lot and the inside of the restaurant itself were jam packed. The number of little kids there might lead one to believe this was a combination Chuck E Cheese/Toys R us disguised as an Asian restaurant. If it's this crowded it has to be good right?

Once I got over to the buffet area I noticed a huge line of people queued up to get food at the Hibachi. Not wanting to wait behind 15 other people I sorted through what was out at the actual buffet. Pretty much everything I took back to my table was subpar, I got cheese wontons, various types of chicken and nothing stood out to me as being good. Realizing there had to be a reason for the long line at the Hibachi I got in the very long line and waited.

The Hibachi here works a bit differently than some other places with them cooking four or five peoples plates at a time. They had a pretty good selection of things to add such as noodles, rice, eggs, imitation crab, shrimp, other meats, mushrooms and so forth. After about 15 minutes of waiting my food was finally on the hibachi. The process for cooking all five orders at a time isn't fast either. I'd say each group of five plates takes about 10 minutes for them to cook. After around 30 minutes I was back at my table with a plate of hot food in hand. Now, it would be time to find out if it was worth the wait.

Everything was very well cooked, the choices of spices and oils they added worked very well. The eggs mixed with the noodles made a very good combination, the meat was well cooked. I was very pleased with the outcome of the food from the Hibachi and had the time it takes to get food from the Hibachi not been so long I might have gone for a second plate.

Overall I was pleased with the food off the grill from Hibachi Grill and Supreme Buffet. The actual buffet food wasn't so hot.  If you're willing to spend the time waiting for the grill (or go on a less busy day), it's definitely worth the price if you like grill food. I'm going to give this place a solid four stars and would definitely return here.

Ive lived here in streamwood all of my life, and when this popped up on streamwood 2 years ago i was instantly in love. It was cheap, elegant, very good food, and great customer service. 

Do's
The station to make the food is absolutely excellent i advise to keep going there.
They're meat on a stick is very good. 
Most of the food is good/

Dont's 
Never eat the pizza i'll rather eat shit than eat that, worst fucking pizza. 
Never eat the mac and cheese, so much cheese i'll get so much cheese stuck on my throat. some of the fruit is old all the time. 

Overall this place is excellent, put what can you expect its a fucking buffet. you get what you pay for. :D

Back again recently for another AYCE during the weekday. Without high expectations this place was not bad and not good either. There is definitely a interesting mixture of food typical of asian buffet. The ones that come to mind are fried shrimp, real tough roast beef that you cut yourself, a grill where you give the chef a bowl of items you want stirfried, they can also cook slices of beef on the grill but often overdone, very small sushi poorly wrapped and sashimi of unknown fish. What I do enjoy are the fried chicken drumsticks, steamed clams, mac and cheese, salt and pepper shrimp, and the sweet and sour chicken. You get what you pay for which is why it is so cheap. I would come on a weekday, less busy and no lines. The other cool plus is they did away with the self service ice cream and have the little ice cream cups. 

Hidden deals
Check online for coupon for additional savings. Usually comes with the local mailer

I could walk into this restaurant blind folded and know exactly where every dish is located because they never change their items nor location of where the food is. I will bet you anything that they serve the food from the night before as well. When we tried their the first time it was actually pretty good. But as my family starting going their more and more often we just got sick of it. I literally wanted to throw up. Anyways the prices are just ok. The service is ok and the staff is ok.  I really don't have anything to say because their dishes is god awful!!! I am really surprised all these reviews are wonderful. If your looking for a good Asian restaurant I wouldn't recommend this place. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!! Try Royal Buffet on Golf and Roselle Road. The food at least their isn't disgusting!!!

There is one redeeming quality about this place: the price. You get a buffet for around 13 dollars w/drink. (10 if you have a coupon.) 

I went here on a whim and I have to say everything about this place sucks except the price. 

Here are some examples:

The Atmosphere: 

Table was sticky, booth was torn on both sides, even the iced tea the waitress brought me was warm with all the ice melted. 

The Food:

Crawfish: were small and clearly dirty and not purged. 

Crab: small and  not cleaned

Salt and Pepper Shrimp: small and had huge black veins in all of them. 

Beef dishes: the beef was clearly spoiled and left a rotten meat after taste. 

Egg rolls/Spring Rolls: Soft and not crunchy at all. 

Wonton Soup: Giant wontons with very little filling and thick pasta-like wrapper that disintegrated after I touched it with a spoon. 

Stuffed Shrimp: Stuffing had no taste and the shrimp was tiny with a massive black vein. 

Hibachi: Food looks like its been left out to spoil all day. 

That was about all I tried before deciding to leave to avoid food poisoning. 

The Service: Decent because I did a decent job of serving myself. 

Conclusion: Don't come here unless you are desperate for calories because your money would be better spent at Portillos next door.

Came over here after checking yelp. I knew that it was a buffet and it wasn't going to be anything fancy. The good thing about this place is that it's cheap $11 for a sunday lunch. Fresh hibachi grill. Nice servers. The bad, sticky table, humid, and the rice was gross. I understand if they can't make a good dish, but you shouldn't mess up on the rice.  Would I come back? Nah. There's plenty of other choices around that I can get a better experience at.
Terrible grease pit..gross, dirty..

I went in there in the evening of July 2014. It was packed, and where we sat was very tight. The table was stickey, and I think if you were a very small person you could fit at this table! The food was gross, and stuff was hanging of foods that people dipped their spoons into! This place was awesome when it first opened but has gone down hill! I was sick when I got home! I will never go back, and I warn you to stay away unless you want to be sick!!

Second time eating here yesterday.

Service is okay.
Food is average but i must say they got the crispiest and juiciest fried chicken!
The place is cramped. Not enough space between tables.

PS: their sushi is crappy. Don't get it. They're consistent with its quality

My family and I always come here when I come to visit, and it has quite tasty foods. Most things are definitely on the greasy side but I enjoy the foods they have here. 

My favorites include the mac n cheese, beef broccoli with lo mein, BBQ Ribs (not very asian I know but it is well seasoned and tasted very good), chicken wings (its good when its piping hot and fresh out of the fryer!), crab ragoon, fried shrimp, steamed clams, this egg puffy sweat bread, and the ice cream!

I always mix two ice cream flavors together (for example, strawberry and vanilla to make strawberry cream or orange sherbet and vanilla to make creamsicle). Yes I know, so creative. :]

Service is very quick and there are waiters and waitresses always passing by to clear the tables very quickly. It does seem like a waste to have to wash so many dishes but they keep it sanitary by not allowing used plates to re-enter the buffet line in case of contamination. 

There is plenty of parking around this grill and it is very children friendly. I have been to this place twice and this specific location is much better than other Hibachi grills because of the variety it offers.

Place was pretty packed where people were all over the place and felt like a free for all with the food. Customers seemed rude and just cut in front of you when you are about to get food. Also, when the good food comes out, it seems like vultures swoop in and pile there plates up a foot high where the tray that was just brought out is gone within a couple minutes. 

There is a lot of greedy people where they seem to think food is scarce or maybe they think that if they bought food like shrimp in the store it would cost a lot, so they stock pile their plates trying to take advantage of the value? 

Overall, the place is dirty where the floor was sticky and food is very greasy. I didn't eat a whole lot of it or didn't join the bandwagon of being a pack of hyenas when food came out because I knew it would not sit well with me later due to the greasiness. Sushi rolls were also so small and was a D- just passing as sushi.

As a buffet connoisseur (--- being Filipino with picky-eating parents who don't have big appetites, the buffet is where we usually end up-- )

This place is pretty great.  Huge seafood selection.  Hollandaise sauce-like mussels, flavorful crawfish, salt and pepper shrimp, fried squid, clams, sushi.... this place has got it all.

Their barbecue ribs and chicken are also pretty good. -- i have yet to try the hibachi station.

What really makes this place great is how affordable it is. At most, it's about $10 per person.  SO affordable!

This buffet is clean and you can tell they try and make sure the food is quickly refilled and kept fresh. 

My only gripe is that the sushi was cold- i mean, it was like it was made overnight and just taken out of the fridge kind of cold.

But overall, really good. As with all buffets, some Items are hit and miss. I kind of like that the ice cream is in individual packages, but i do love me some soft serve too.

Absolutely worth checking out.

Just ate here tonight...Seriously I know this is gross but I cant keep off the toliet!!! I know its not other foods I ate today because I only ate here. There is NO reason for the crappies I have...Im not joking either...Beware of this place. I will NEVER come back!!! Seems like a few of these reviewers had diarherra from this joint!!!!

5 star service quality food ,and great price . I believe this is the best restaurant out there . I m talking from my  experience and what I saw at this restaurant . First they took u to ur table and polite ask what kind drink would u like .when u get your food from massive buffet and back to ur seat  the drink and straws r always already there.when u finish ur first plate and get more than come back to ur seat  ur drink hand been refilled and empty plate hand been gone. They will give ur check with cookies when u r eating dessert . What u get late they will refill food that  uwant  that s call service 
Talking about food taste I think food there always best and qualities . They serve calamari shrimp salmon crawfish baby clam that's my favorite stuff . Hibachi away is best  I can pick raw thing like meat egg and some vg ask experienced chef cook it right before u and cook as u my favorite season .
   The prize is reasonable 10.69 dinner 7.99 lunch . How could they make money . But there still have someone cheating age to got some discount and have eat and run away  pretend forget to pay

lots of people Busy place Drinks extra (not included in buffet price) Great hibachi! Some dishes are labeled so if u take them u will be charged dinner price... complicated Service was nice but i felt being watched.. creepy

It's your typical, mediocre Oriental buffet. Hooray! There were hits (pretty much anything with chicken, fried, or slathered in a sweet sauce) and there were misses (dry salmon, flavorless sushi, and that strange octopus dish they serve). The prices are super reasonable for the amount of food, ~$7 for lunch. At least some of the food will be a hit.

But let's be real, there is another reason to go. Seeing the labels that got lost in translation. It's a humorous little scavenger hunt. Perhaps you can find the "beef sannwich", "Itallian noodles", or the infamous "Franch dressing".

Buffets have been a staple in my life, for better or worse. A lot of the time, it's for worse (for the waistline or ego), but hey, a cheap meal is a cheap meal.

Buffets in general usually disappoint me. But they've always held a certain fun appeal for me since childhood. The freedom of choice and a plethora of selection with the prospect of finishing the meal with desserts. Coming back to your table with your plate of food selection. Seeing what your dining buddies voluntarily choose to eat & how much. I like the casual ambiance of a buffet too. The downside is that you can't bring home leftovers. When I go to a sit-down restaurant, I usually box leftovers, essentially halving my meal cost. Then there is quality control, along with sanitation.

When I go to a buffet, I try to select little amounts of items that pique my interest. An amateur would pile food, yet leave behind a lot of leftovers when the server takes away the plate. I feel too guilty doing that. So at this buffet, I got to sample a lot of dishes (I avoided the sushi station). Of all the items that I tried, I liked the chicken drumsticks the best; they reminded me of Korean gampoongi. The sauce was spicy and reminiscent of gochujang, spicy Korean chili paste. Crispy and non-soggy. Good size to them.

I also liked their fruit selection. Wasn't impressed with their desserts.

The only reason I would come back to this place would be for their chicken drumsticks. YUM!

This place was not too bad actually.  Once I saw that it was $10 for dinner I was expecting the worst.  The soups were actually really good and the rest of the food was pretty decent.  they also had a pretty decent dessert selection along with self-scoop ice cream (altho this concerns me a bit that everyone was scooping their own ice cream and the dirtiness of it all, but I guess it is a buffet...)

they also have a hibachi grill but all the cook there does is grill up your meats and veggies with some sort of butter sauce and no other options for sauces.  we had shrimp on our plate and the shrimp did not come out fully cooked.

The wait staff was pretty attentive to our drink needs and to clearing off our finished plates.

overall, the food was ok, and for the price of $10 a person, it's really hard to beat that.

Wasn't a great place per say.  It is cheap though, new interior, the sneeze guard near the sushi and the grill need to be cleaned hardcore.

Service was pretty good, but 45 mins wait on a Saturday and we got split up into 2 groups of 4.  They only had 3 tables that fit 8.  That kinda sucked.  

Lunch adult 6.99
Dinner 9.59
Kids cheaper
Drinks are extra
10% senior discount

Salt and pepper shrimp was  under cooked and not crispy
fried sushi was good, the rest was meh, not any sahimi that I could tell and every time i went up i might get like 1 or 2 pieces because people were swarming it and they could not keep up.
prime rib was tough and dry

beef tender loin decent
crab rangoon sweet and not the right taste
salt and pepper calmari tough and not tasty
baked egg was great and  unexpected
baked chicken was  peanuty and good
stuffed shrimp ok 
bbq ribs were fatty 
Bbq porkk not like meat places you find in china town
rib eye asked for rare and it was well done they also refused to cook a thick piece we found

waffle custard good
ice cream smooth slow line because of self scoooping 
 strawberry bleh 
pinapple  cantelope and  green melon was good

birthdays get a flower thimng w candles

Well... this isn't the best buffet I have ever been to, but its not terrible by any means

Plenty of choices including sushi, soup, American staples (mac and cheese, pizza), typical Chinese dishes (Sweet and Sour Chicken, Beef and Broccoli, etc).  Nothing was disgusting (yes, there is plenty of grease in some of the fried options), but I was never disappointed.

The interior is not the best, but who really cares when you are eating for $9.95 (or in our case $6.95--they always have coupons in Saver Magazines).  Our table was always quickly cleaned and they were quick on Pop re-fills.

If you are looking for a quick and cheap meal, this is definitely a place to stop at... but if you want something a little more elegant I suggest you hit up another restaurant.

Probably one of the worst buffets I have been in a long time. The food is super greasy even by buffet standards. Sushi has a weird food coloring added to it. Don't get me wrong - I love buffets, and I understand buffet is not same as ordering food, but this is really awful. The desserts are bordering nonedible. Both roommate and I actually have some indigestion/diarreha afterwards. Do not get the seafood. I only gave it 2 stars because staff was really friendly.

I TRIED
- Make Your Own Stir Fry (4/10)
- Sushi (3/10)
- Chinese Food (5/10)
- Soups (5/10)

Reviewing a buffet is weird. There's so many places to touch on, but I guess I've already done one before for Crazy II Buffet, which this is almost an exact replica of, so I guess I'll just keep going.

MAKE YOUR OWN STIR FRY
Just like Crazy II Buffet, not enough stuff. I'm spoiled with Flat Top Grill, but just the vegetable choices here are so slim. The worst part of it all, is that I have no control over the sauces. The guy behind the stove does. Maybe I'm just a control freak. I'd like to say that you should pass this, but it's such a big part of the place, that you're sorta gimping your experience if you do. Blah, whatever.

SUSHI
I'd say that this sushi is about on par with Todai, which isn't saying alot. The choices are very slim (maybe 5-6), and no sashimi, but the only thing that's good about theirs is that they don't pack every roll in a boulder of rice. However, you know that the rice has "been around" for a while by the way it comes off. Even the "freshly made" sushi have rice that sort of falls off in hard sheets. I guess you paid for it, might as well have some.

CHINESE FOOD
There is nothing special about their China Buffet. Nothing. It's your run of the mill Chinese food. Orange Chicken, Kung Pao, Mongolian Beef, etc. 

SOUPS
Egg Drop and Hot & Sour. Both are run of the mill too. Interestingly enough, they have a "Broccoli Cheese" soup, which is the first time I've ever seen that at an Asian buffet. It sort of...has no taste. It's textured like Broccoli Cheese, but tastes like...nothing. Sorta like how grits, you can vaguely get a hint of corn, you can vaguely get a hint of broccoli. Add a pinch or 2 of salt, and sort of like Grits, it goes down. At first I thought it was disgusting and put it aside, but I kept eerily spooning more and more of it, even though it was depressed sitting in the "discard pile."

WELL?
Considering that Super China Buffet is in our list of weekly lunch destinations, there's no reason that Hibachi Supreme Buffet can't be in it either. It's not like the food's inedible, it's just very run of the mill. If it closed down, I wouldn't cry.

This place is a steal when you go for lunch!  It's your all around typical Chinese all-you-can-eat buffet witha featured Hibachi Grill!  I've never seen a Hibachi Grill in a all-you-can-eat before.

The only tip I could give is to stay away from ordering a drink except water and to take advantage of the ice cream in the corner.  It's kind of hidden and looks old but inside is really yummy self-scoop ice cream.

Yeah, this place is either way over-hyped or I went on an off night. 
Considering I always see a line out the door, I'm hoping for the latter. I took my son last night and we were seated without a word other than, "What to Drink?" and not informed that was extra cost to have a drink.

We only ate from the buffet because the items for the grill were so unbelievably limited....I didn't see the point. The weird thing about this place is that the food looks awesome, but then you eat it and in general your first thought is, "Why does it all taste the same?"

Honey Chicken
General Tso's Chicken
Sweet and Sour Chicken
ANY CHICKEN
All tasted the same. 

The meats - like the tenderloin, prime rib, etc. HARD AS A ROCK.

I had to tip a server whom I didn't see the entire time we were there. 

I had an upset stomach when we left. 

Not a fan. Not a fan at all.

wait about 35 mins for a table on a saturday night. The food was decent. They had a large variety of food. im sad i wasnt able to try their hibachi. They did a good job of keeping trays refilled. Only concern was that a few hours later I had some stomach issues....i dont know if that was from eating too much of what.

Im still undecided on this place.

I love this place. The interior isn't that fancy or over the top. But it's clean and best suited for this kind of buffet.

For the price you get a very good selection. And to top it off, ever since they opened, they have added new options in their buffet every week. (We go every Sunday)  I'm always excited to see what new dish they have for surprise, but I won't mind if they didn't. Food quality is more than average. I love the hibachi rice and dragon fish. Many 'good' selections. And you can even have your own stir fried noodles by picking the ingredients you want and have the guys cook it. Dessert is also wonderful. Good selection. The ice-cream for one is not that boring soft serve. You get decent ice cream that you scoop. A lot of flavors to choose from to. And cheese cake....yum. It's simple but just think of what you paid!

When we get here, it's always packed. Service from many of the waiters/waitresses them selves is very good. Good job 'Sky'. The ones in pink, (hostesses?) aren't very pleasant and could work more on their interaction skills...

I would definitely recommend this place to a friend. Good price for food that's more than worth it. See you on Sunday.

For the price good. Wide selection.  Great people watching.
