It was very fresh, crisp romaine. The chicken breast was juicy and had great flavor. The salad wasn't too big but it was very filling. 

I tasted both regular and the multigrain pancakes and they were the stars of the meal for sure. I especially loved the multigrain pancakes.. Both have such different tastes, but I love the hint of cinnamon in the multigrain ones. The regular pancakes taste really cakey.. They almost reminded me of funfetti cake.

Overall, great meal and really great service. The coffee was very enjoyable too!

Even though this diner is completely out of the way, I will be back!!

Normally....love this place

Today....service and people awesome
Food... HORRIBLE

Terrible flavor

Biscuits and gravy. Almost made us sick.  No flavor. Bland. No Sausage in it.  Even the sausage on the side not good

Again. People and service impeccable.  Waitress Susie and Owner wonderful

But make this dish better or take it off the menu

I have lived in the area for over 35 years this place has always been my favorite restraunt but the prices are getting to high and your getting less portions, i found a place that is 10x better cheaper with big portions, go to GRANNY'S Armytrail & Swift Rd, trust me you will not be disappointed

So we did a 5K this morning.. burning about 400-500 Calories.. it seemed appropriate to go eat a couple thousand calories for breakfast to make up for it.

We went based on the Yelp reviews not having spent much time in the vicinity.

Well deserved because the food and service rock!

The atmosphere is fun, kind of old timey.. clean, lively... popular.

As far as the service goes, our waitress was on top of things. Anytime we asked for something not quite as advertised she always responded with "sure, we can do that" or something like it. Other people kept checking on us throughout the meal.. we were wanting for nothing.

We were there with our foodie friends; Adam and Janet and our son Ian. The menu had so many good choices that we couldn't make up our minds. 

Janet was all about french toast, which she really enjoyed. Adam was talking about a couple of different things, so I mentioned that I was thinking about the corned beef hash omelette.. he said "that's what I'm having"... I gave him the evil eye.. but to no avail. I wasn't going to order the same thing.. we like to "experience" a place.

With pressure mounting (we were really hungry!) I made the decision to go with the country omelette, (that's ham, bacon and onions topped with sausage gravy) I asked if we could go light on the onions.... "sure, we can do that" and with well done hash browns (crispy!) and pancakes. One word "Delicious".. oh, ok.. next word "Filling"

Ian ordered the Chorizo Breakfast Burrito, loved it! And my lovely bride had a broccoli omelette with the seasonal pumpkin pancakes.

So, that idea thief Adam really enjoyed his Corned Beef Hash Omelette.. fortunately for him I was a happy camper .. actually, all five of us were.

Probably should go do some more "k's" except a nap sounds better. Wonder what we should have for dinner...

We had a terrific first time dining experience here this afternoon.  The service was great.  Our waitress was perfect.  Before my husband ordered, he asked her if the chili was hot.  She said no it was not.  He ordered it.  A few minutes later, after delivering our table a warm bread basket, she brought him out a small sampling of the chili so that he could be sure it was to his liking.  That was so nice.  The chili had the perfect amount of heat for him.  I had the salad that had the chicken fingers on it with tomatoes, corn, cucumber, red onion and walnuts.  I opted for creamy garlic dressing rather than the recommended ranch dressing. I loved the salad.  It was huge. The chicken fingers were very good.  I can't think of one thing that I was not completely satisfied with.  I'm glad we tried this restaurant.

Despite being right off the Metra line, I cannot fully get on board the Christy's Pancake House train. Anything other than breakfast has mostly been a letdown for me. The breakfast items have been good, but I think Bentley's down the street is much better. I like to branch out and try different things, but there's been so much hit or miss here that I'll likely stick to a few staples.

We're fans of the Chicken Noodle Soup, but the Clam Chowder is goopy without much flavor. Their Fish Fry was decent diner quality, but the Steak Quesadilla was incredibly bland. I will go to town on a Quesadilla any day of the week, but I found myself with 75% of it uneaten on Mexican Night and didn't fight my Husband for the leftovers (and if you know us, you'd know that my Husband eating my leftovers is the strongest point of contention in our relationship).

My Husband and his Cousin spoke highly of Christy's after coming for breakfast the first time, and I remember liking them when I came for breakfast years ago, but they both agreed that the other entrees aren't that great. They encouraged me to stop ordering lunch and dinner items and to go with the breakfast foods. I finally listened and those dishes have been the most enjoyable meals so far. I really like the Hungryman's Skillet (nix 'shrooms, add tomatoes). I'm also fond of their multigrain toast and what appears to be housemade blackberry jam.

I have to say that I was both disappointed and impressed with our most recent visit because I ordered a slice of pie that I found to be inedible, but our server noticed I was displeased with it and offered to swap it without hesitation.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE Key Lime Pie. Much like Quesadillas, I will find any excuse to eat a slice of Key Lime Pie even if it's not the best or most authentic. However, I could not eat what they call Key Lime Pie here. First of all, it's bright green, so you know the pie maker is either using lime flavoring and/or is adding coloring to it (it should be a muted yellow). Secondly, almost every Key Lime Pie I've come across has a consistency somewhere between thick custard and cheesecake. That was not at all the case with this dessert. It seemed like it was trying to be Lime Meringue and failing miserably. It had a bottom layer somewhat like a creamy packaged pudding and a top layer that was much like thick Cool Whip. Perhaps you can recall your Grandmother's Jell-O fruit salads with the multicolored marshmallows on top. It was a lot like that. If this pie were a song, it would be this one: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7tWuG2oPL3o. Truly, I'm not saying there's anything inherently bad with "salads" from the 50's or even that pie as its own entity, but to call it a Key Lime Pie is misleading and I couldn't do it. I swapped it for a slice of Chocolate Fudge Cake and that, though incredibly sweeter than it needed to be, was much more my speed.

Overall, aside from the breakfast, I give the food 2 stars. It's not horrible, but it doesn't always hit the mark or the spot. The extra star is to make up for what they do well and I'd give the service 5 stars any day of the week! All the employees have been incredibly nice and on top of things. They seem to genuinely enjoy their jobs and interacting with customers.

TL;DR - Stick to breakfast and tip their hardworking servers well!
My family and I love coming here.  Their menu selections are vast and excellent for a family with different tastes.

A good place to order out at last minute. My husband and I usually get a bacon grilled cheese with fries and it also comes with a soup which is such a great deal for the price. I wouldn't go here for breakfast though, Bentleys down the street is where it's at for breakfast.

A SUBURB RESTAURANT! And I hardly visit any because I mostly dine in Downtown Chicago BUT I love supporting family owned restaurants and it was the highest rated review near Itasca, IL so my husband and I (who don't celebrate Easter) came in around 8:15 on Easter morning and were greeted immediately. It is a very bright and colorful restaurant and our waitress was great. She was very friendly, got us coffees immediately, gave us a little time on our menus and when my order didn't come with a certain topping she took it back immediately. 

She brought the plate back saying they just added the topping to to my omelette and asked me if that was okay? It was because I just didn't care too much. We got refills on our coffees and our check quickly too. It's a typical breakfast restaurant with nothing too much and the ingredients are okay but if I am hungry for breakfast again- I could see myself coming back!
Love this place been, going for years! Breakfast lunch and dinners all good!! Too bad it's only open from 6 - 3 because of all the construction:(
food tasted like they took it out of the can and heated it up in the microwave.  Very bland and very so so quality.  Would not recommend this place.  Very cheesy decor - old looking.

I went here for dinner while in town on business based on the great Yelp reviews.  I got here shortly before they were closing, so that may have an effect on my review, but they were by no means busy.

The place has a very traditional diner look and vibe.  I'll definitely agree with a previous reviewer that seating is very tight.

The server came up with a water and asked if I knew what I wanted to eat before I'd even opened a menu.  I quickly decided and had my food pretty quickly.

I ordered the sausage biscuit skillet.  The portion was huge!  The food was just average though, no where near what I'd expected after browsing the previous reviews.  

While I was eating, they came buy and were sweeping and mopping right around me.  This is a pet peeve of mine, I understand I got there close to closing time, but don't stir up the days funk while I'm trying to eat.  I cashed out about 10 minutes after they'd technically closed.  I feel like the guy could've waited a few.

I'd give this place another shot though.  It's a quick, cheap food option that easily beats out any of the fast food joints.

I'm definitely a fan. Classic diner food.
Service is mostly friendly.  The older waitresses seem to be much friendlier.  A few of the younger ladies are bit too aloof for my taste.
Food is good and fresh and their soups are really great.
Love this place!  Best soups around & service is always on point!  Consistent,  great diner food!

We've only been for breakfast but it is delicious!!! We go every other Saturday! Very friendly staff! Usually pretty busy which is what caught our eye driving by. If there are lots of people waiting outside then it must be good!! We love that it's not a chain restaurant! We keep talking about going for lunch or dinner but haven't yet. Breakfast is so good that we've only gone for that so far!
I go here every Saturday now. Amazing prices. Amazing food. Amazing staff. They let you customize any dish any way you want. The greek omlete is amazing!

Found this place on my way to work with good hours for someone who works early in the morning or even 2nd shift. Looks older but hey never judge a book by its cover. The prices very reasonable and the portions are good. The staff friendly can tell they all been there a few years. Next to Wood Dale train station so that is kind of nice grab a bite waiting for the train. Will be coming back :)

As a tourist, this was a jackpot! Our free breakfast from the hotel was the saddest, so, we decided to ditch it and go out for a REAL breakfast, and boy, Christy's didnt disappoint! I yelped for diners and found it. 

The atmosphere of the restaurant was great! The servers were really nice and friendly and checked on you from time to time. The food was THE BOMB. I has the #24 on the breakfast special and it was really good! The steak was cook the way i wanted it. The hashbrowns were great. The coffee was good too. Pancakes are perfect. 

I am so glad the hotel breakfast didnt work out or else I wouldn't have found this place. 

Great job, guys! Will def come back when i get on this side of the world!

This place was great!  When we pulled into the parking lot it was pretty full but we were seated right away. Our server Karen was so nice and friendly she made you feel right at home. My four year old was so excited that they had Pac Man pancakes he didn't need to know about anything else on the menu. My husband got a skillet and said it was delicious and his sunny side up eggs were cooked perfectly. I had the corned beef hash with over easy eggs and French toast. It was some of the best hash I've had in a long time. If I lived closer to Christy's I would be a regular. The prices are reasonable and the portions are huge. As Karen said, if you leave hungry it's your own fault. The menu has a huge selection but I would be happy to try all of it.

My friend and I came here after checking out of our hotel.  We decided to grab some breakfast before heading to the airport and this place was the closest with the highest rating.  There were a lot of people here even at 10am on a Monday; however, it was Labor Day so that could be it too.  It wasn't a large restaurant but that was fine.

I had looked at the menu beforehand on their website so I knew what to expect.  I decided on the pancakes which came with sausage links for $5.50.  We also ordered orange juice, but I forgot how much that was.  The food took awhile to come out but they were pretty busy.  The pancakes were delicious and very fluffy which I liked in pancakes.  There were four pancakes and I was full when I finished it all.  The sausage links were good as well.  Our waiter checked on us a few times but was busy running around helping other tables.

Perfect place for breakfast and the food was great in my opinion!

Amazing!

Food: 10
Atmosphere: 10
Service: 10

My husband and I come here every weekend and are impressed every time without fail.

My favorite local Pancake Place.   If you're in the area and looking for a place to eat you can't go wrong with Christy's 

Been going here for years, and never really had a bad experience.  The Servers are always great and friendly. I've never once had a table that was sticky, or spots on my glasses or silverware like you'll find at lots of other places.  Little things like that go a long way with me. 

Their breakfast, their wraps, patty melts and Friday all you can eat Fish fry are some of my favorites. 

Christy's is a little on the small side and gets busy at times. Times like Friday nights and Sunday mornings you will sometimes have a little wait.

Never again!!! I went here for breakfast about a year ago and wasn't very happy. The reviews on Yelp are so good though I decided to give them a second chance. My husband and baby and I went in for late breakfast on a Monday. It wasn't busy. We ordered and our waitress was not very friendly or nice but she looked pregnant so I thought maybe she just didn't feel well. About 10-15 later she returned and told me they didn't have feta for my omelet so did I want a different cheese. I thought a different cheese would be gross and had my heart set on feta. So I selected another omelet instead. The food was not good. Our hash brown were cold, the veggies in my omelet were either raw or water logged... I had to ask for the side of bacon we ordered when someone walked by because the waitress didn't come back. The service was rude, the food was not good and no one seemed to care about us at all.

This is my favorite spot for breakfast, and it's my wife's second favorite. I haven't been here for dinner, but I do come for lunch every once in a while. 

Breakfast: you cannot go wrong with their pancakes, skillets, or breakfast wraps. I absolutely love their Greek wraps and skillets. You can play it safe with a Denver omelette or pancake platter. I can't help but to ask for whatever the special is and then be surprised. I prefer stronger coffee, so I do have to ask them to make the coffee stronger for me, which they always do.

Lunch: very good burgers but by far my favorite are their home made soups. They have this great chicken dumpling soup that is just out of this world good. 

Please try Christie's at least once. For breakfast my wife and I usually spend $23-$30 including tip.

Our regular go to breakfast joint was closed (it was 3pm) and we found Christy's by a recommendation of a family member and my need for steak and eggs, yes it was not a want, but a need. My craving steak and eggs were undeniable.

Christy's is a spacious, clean, well lit diner with a retro early 50s counter that almost had me thinking twice before sitting at the booth. We were greeted and seated immediately. The menu is vast with many options for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

Our server was what we believe a newbie. He didn't know if the steak and eggs came with potatoes (had to go ask), brought out butter to our table before we even ordered (in the end we didn't need the butter, our toast came buttered), and awkwardly checks up on us, which is not big deal, I've worked in restaurants before it's hard being the new person/training.

Scott opted for the chorizo omelette while I went with the skirt steak (medium rare, always!) and double yolk eggs and hasbrowns (www.yelp.com/biz_photos/christys-pancake-house-wood-dale?select=MAfpZVDpcm3SSy58iQoHFg#YQtNfeOumemXzPEtcR6XKw). The chorizo omelette was overwhelmed chorizo that didn't allow us to taste anything else, not even the eggs, most likely won't be ordering that again, but the steak and eggs? Egg-tastic! Steak-rific! The steak was cooked to perfection and tender. First time having double yolk eggs and I enjoyed them, how can I not? I love yolk. I even shared some of my steak with Scott and he enjoyed it too, actually I'm sure he was a bit jealous because his chorizo omelette wasn't satisfying.  

We were asked by other servers, possibly the owner/host how everything was and our server did his best. Because of those awesome steak and eggs I'll definitely be back to try the rest of their menu.

Great place and great food

Always busy which is a good sign

Had the steak and eggs, toast is solid
Great staff, mediocre food, crowded layout, ugly decor.

I've always pass by this place and because it's located on a busy road.  Every time when I'm sitting in traffic waiting for the train gates to come up, I kept telling myself one of these days I'll have to check that place out I always see it busy.
So I finally came to Christy's Pancake House which is near the train station off of Irving park rd.  It was a Saturday mid morning and we were hungry for some local grub.  
When we walked in, the place was packed and the space looked a bit snug.  The decor had an old fashion homey feel, like you were at grandma's house.
We had to wait which we expected on a Saturday morning, but not too long as we were able to get seated in a semi booth.
As soon as we were seated, they took our drink order, coffee, juice, and water.  The menu is huge and we were greeted with a friendly waitress, Karen.  We enjoyed having her serve us as this was our first time here.  She was funny and a delight to be around even with the hectic crowd.  I like that they fill our drinks even without us asking.
Hubby and I ordered breakfast.  I got the Spinach and feta omelet with pancakes.  The omelet was huge, nice a fluffy eggs and the Spinach and feta tasted fresh.  It came with hash browns, which was ok I asked for a crispier crust.  The pancakes were nice and fluffy.  
Hubby got their chorizo skillet with multigrain toast.  It was also pretty good and a lot of it.  The chorizo was spicy with green peppers, onions, tomatoes, jalapenos and cheddar cheese.  All topped off with fluffy scrambled eggs.
We also order a side of corned beef hash crispy please.  Man when you see our table it looks like we ordered for 4 people even though it was just us the two of us, lol! 
All our food came out in a timely manner and piping hot.  There was plenty to take home, next time we'll need to share a meal...naw LOL!
Overall, great experience I'd come back for Karen and the affordable food

I have eaten some very good breakfasts at this restaurant so decided to have lunch. It was just awful...wow, awful! My husband had eggs, potatoes and a chicken breast...the eggs were done well, the potatoes mediocre and the breast was dry as if warmed in a microwave...terrible. I ordered the special of the day--stuffed cabbage. It came with mashed potatoes, a white and a red sauce and gravy for the potatoes. Also a chicken noodle soup. It was all terrible. The soup was a canned broth with a flavor enhancement likened to ramen noodle with cheap store bought noodles and no chicken whatsoever. The cabbage was tasteless, old, like last week's shoe leather warmed up. The white sauce tasted nothing more than flour and water, the red sauce was okay. The mashed potatoes were a cheap boxed mix with canned brown gravy enhanced with flour. The coffee was old and bitter and even the crackers individually wrapped were stale and hard. The waitress was lacking grace. She shoved the plate of chicken into my husbands face while she paid attention to the men behind him. He caught the plate before it hit his face or dropped into his lap. The manager came to the table and although his words said sorry, his voice and demeanor were uninterested and rude. He took the meal off my bill but made me pay for the horrible soup.  I went out to eat because I did not want to cook and frankly I would have been better off cooking at home because I know my meal wouldn't have been old, stale and out of a cheap box. I do NOT ever recommend this place. It used to be really a good breakfast but now its just junkie and WAY overpriced for boxed, old, stale food.

We stopped here on Sunday after walking a 5k at O'hare.  This place was packed, and for good reason.

We were all starving (not from walking, but from having been awake for so long to get to the stupid 5k).

As soon as we sat down coffee was poured, and it was refilled constantly during out meal.

The food was delicious and plentiful.  The menu was way too large for me, so I had a hard time choosing.  Eventually I just decided to pick on of the healthy options, since it was at the top of the front page.

I had egg whites, turkey sausage, canned peaches and toast.  Everything was great, except the peaches.  I asked if they were fresh and was told they were, so I was very disappointed to receive canned/jarred peaches. I wish I had asked for fruit in place of the peaches but that is a minor complaint.

I tried the Mexican omelet, hash browns, and crepes off of friends.  Everything was great.

I would happily return.

This place has been here a long time! It does good business and has pretty good food. It isn't the best breakfast place I have been to but it is pretty good. Service is usually pretty good as well. Greek owners I believe, like most ma and pa restaurants.

If you are hungry and really dont know what to eat. Christys is a great place to go. They have a full menu with good prices. Its a diner type of atmosphere. I was able to get waffles while my bf was able to get a blt at 5 pm. Being that they have a full menu I feel like they specialize  in nothing partiular therefore the food is not spectacular but the do serve large portions.

This place has been a family favorite for years. Weekends are very busy, and there's limited seating, but that won't stop the locals from coming here. Its a family-owned regular Greek restaurant. The management and staff are so friendly and welcoming each visits.

Favorites: baked oatmeal in a crock with fruits & nuts (very yummy). And of course, the creamy soups.

Secret tip: They have a frequent visitor punch card system! -Not good for groups bigger than 5-6.
Best breakfast place in this world!!! Everything on their menu is so good. I love the way the staff treats the customers. . Like family!! I'm just happy when I come here.

I think... this is a good place for its location. This is definitely NOT the greatest omelette I've ever had.

In fact, my Santa Fe omelette was onions, cheddar cheese, and jalapeno peppers. NOT green peppers. NOT red peppers. Spicy jalapeno peppers that the young server forgot to double check that I wouldn't like the spicy.

Sigh. 

The stuffed French toast was mascarpone cheese sandwiched between two slices of French toast. Sooo ghetto. It's a French toast sandwich. Haha

Went for lunch today and we were seated right away during the craziness of the lunch crowd. Karen was our waitress and she was an absolute delight! Service was superb, food was hot and fantastic when it reached our table and we had a wonderful time! 
More waitresses need to adopt Karens attitude because she was so much fun and full of life that we will definitely return and ask for her.

WE QUICKLY BECAME REGULARS WHEN WE MOVED TO THE AREA.
Christy's has great food, great service & they always put up with our crazy requests of substitutions and "over ordering". 
Everything always comes out hot and made to perfection. Yes, there tends to be a small wait for a table on the weekends, but that just proves how good they are, everyone is always willing to wait. (It's never a long wait though, usually 10-15 minutes, just gives me time to think about what I want to order anyway)
I love the Ruben soup. Prices are reasonable. My girlfriend likes the salads they have. Service has always been really friendly. Would recommend this restaurant to others.
Love the many menu options! Service and food is always fresh and delicious. Parking is always available and portions are generous.
Our food was very good. Omelets were  large and fluffy, everyone very friendly. Food came out promptly and hot. Did not leave hungry

Absolutely one of my favorite places to eat! I worked in that area for many years and this eatery became my home away from home. I have been there for lunch and dinner in the same day. 

The staff are very friendly.  The owner Gus, well that's a different story.  The way he barks at the waitstaff at times is totally uncalled for.  Thankfully he is there less and his sons are running things, so that is encouraging! Great food, great people and the Friday all you can eat fish fry during lent is EVERYTHING! !!!!

Great place to go for breakfast of any kind...fairly good burgers and excellent soups...recently tried the gyro but it was way too dry...seemed like the meat was sitting for a while...all together a great variety on the menu though...a good place to try...

My in-laws would always come here from Chicago for breakfast and raves about how good it was. Well my husband and I moved out here to Wood Dale and all I can say is this is my new favorite breakfast spot!!  Proportions are generous, the staff is friendly and so polite. Had lunch here a few times too, very tasty. Everything I have tried has been exceptional!! A must try!!

What can I say that hasn't already been said??? I stop in for a gyro about once every other week. The waffle fries are delicious. Their cream-based soups are fab. Service is good. Ambience is good. Coffee is good. Location, next to the Metra, is convenient. There's plenty of parking.

The only down side is Irving Park Rd. traffic where the train tracks cross... I don't think the city planned that intersection too well. That's got nothing to do with Christy's though. When you get sick of waiting for the train (or waiting for it to pass!!!), stop in for some soup!

Went here the other day for breakfast and was very pleased, was very surprised on how busy it was. We didn't have to wait long to sit and the food was served quickly. Food was very good, have to try the lunch and dinner menu. Staff was very nice.
Food is pretty good.  Seating is bad.  No matter where you sit its tight.  So unless it's just 2 of you, cramped is how you will feel.  It's ok just not for me.

We decided to give Christy's a try for dinner.  I ordered the chicken gyros platter.  It came with soup and salad.  The chili lentil "soup" was very good and the Greek salad was quite large for a "side" salad although they went a little overboard with the oil & vinegar dressing.  Unfortunately, the chicken gyros seemed like prefabricated meat from a package and not carved from a spit.  All slices were of uniform size and thickness.  The gyros didn't have much flavor.
My wife ordered the veggie stir fry and added shrimp.  She enjoyed it and there were a good number of shrimp that looked quite succulent.
Service was topnotch as usual.  The server quickly topped off our sodas even before we asked.  The price was reasonable for the two of us for dinner; $33.
You get a lot of food for the money.

Christy's still one of our favorite breakfast places.
Awesome breakfast diner.  They do lunch and diner too, but I've only been here for breakfast.  Usually a short wait on weekends but totally worth it.  I haven't had anything I didn't like

We visited Christy's Pancake House for lunch. Good selection of soups, wraps, sandwiches and salads. Reasonable prices. Everything was fresh and tasty. Keep in mind that portions are very generous - Cobb's salad which I had was enough for two. Good service.

Absolutely fantastic. Had the venitian Benedict and the wife had the sunrise skillet. Both on par. Very friendly staff. Be smart and avoid the waiting time by eating at the bar. Much faster than a table/booth and better one on one service.

Service is always friendly and responsive, we've always eaten their breakfast and it's delicious.  I usually go with the bacon, eggs (their eggs are double yolk), and toast.  I've tried their Pancakes, Waffles, and french toast...they're all really good.  My girlfriend orders this strange "between easy / medium" for her eggs (she calls it Medium Plus) and Christy's is the only place out here that gets her the consistency she likes.  This is the best breakfast joint we've found in the burbs.

Test them out, I think you'll be pleased.
Food is decent and prices are reasonable but can get pricy when you have four kids wanting dessert. I wish they would add a simple polish sausage and kraut dinner to the menu.

My first visit. Typical diner atmosphere which isn't a bad thing. Has a local feel but everyone is friendly. 

Had lunch and the place was very busy. I was alone but seated at a booth instead of being offered to sit at the counter. Again nice touch and friendly. 

My waitress (Karen) was very busy but made me feel I was her only table. She took time to answer my questions and always kept my water glass full.  I watched her with the other tables and she treated every one the same. 

I had a Reuben sandwich that was much better than average. Not greasy, home made corned beef, with the 1000 Island dressing served on the side. 

Bottom line - good food with great, friendly service and reasonable prices. I'll be back.

The hungry man skillet was delicious.  The sausage was homemade and the ham was off the bone.  The buter and blackberry preserve for my English muffins was also homemade.  to top it off they carry flavored coffee creamer. I love some french vanilla in my coffee.  The service provided by Jo and Karen was exceptional.  They made me feel like I was having breakfast with my family.  I will return.

French Toast Ala Christy--- very memorable!!!

Excellent service, excellent food.  Will go back!

On our way to Roselle to look at a car and stopped in.  Service was great for a little pancake house, soups were good, potato salad was great, and sandwiches and price was good too.
For a pancake house, I liked this place...very much.

Scene: Warm May evening, sitting in a corner booth @ Christy's with my husband.

I'm looking around and see, in the small refrigerated case behind the counter, an unidentifiable fruit. There are oranges, apples, half a cantaloupe, some watermelon, and a shiny reddish ... something that looks rather like a small pumpkin.

"What IS that?" I stared at it for awhile, puzzling over what this peculiar-looking vegetation might be, and finally my husband gets out of his seat to look too, not believing that I can't identify it. But he, too, is mystified.

When our waiter returned to check in on us and offer the 13th refill on water for my always-thirsty husband, we just had to ask. 

"Oh, that's just for decoration. I wondered that myself but it turns out it's papier-mache."

Aww, man, and here I thought I was discovering some new and exotic fruit!

Fake imaginary vegetation, table tents advertising "spicey" cheese on your hashbrowns, wonderful Greek salads, gyros, burgers, chicken, sandwiches, all the tasty breakfast you can imagine all day long, plus friendly and  ... Christy's is a gem and I'm thrilled to have it down the street from us.

Christy's Pancake House is a must visit breakfast spot. With a huge selection of delicious plates for breakfast and lunch, you'll never leave with anything but a full stomach and a small bill.

Breakfast is a touchy, fine detailed ordeal. Everything has to be spot on. And at Christy's, it is right there at getting the full 5 stars from me.

The food is spectacular, with a huge array of skillets, pancakes, even 1 lb. burgers that are amazing. The prices are also very cheap. I get a Hungry Man's Skillet for $9 which includes: eggs, hash browns, mushrooms, diced ham, sausage, bacon, and even a side of two pancakes. 

The decor is a traditional breakfast restaurant look. Unique little adornments make it stand out from some of the cheaper breakfast spots around the area, but it is also a step down from some of the classier locations.

The only reason this place lost a star was my cousin's sausage was a bit dry, and the silverware we got was pretty dirty. Seems like a small thing, but nothing throws off your appetite like crusted on food on your silverware.

Bottom Line: If you're looking for an awesome breakfast, go check out Christy's.
Ate here while waiting for a train. Great food,  amazing service, and the entire staff was very friendly. Would definitely come back!

Usually come here for lunch since I work in the Wood Dale area.

I tend to get sandwiches cause its a safe bet, but they are always delicious and you cannot beat the price.  For $8 I get soup, bread, full sandwich, and a side.  Sooo worth it.  Their soups are always great too, full of flavor and always HOT! :)  

Service is always great and really nice owners.  Love the whole diner feel and love eating here.
Great breakfast place. They have the best biscuits and gravy I've ever had in the north.  I love love love their biscuits and gravy.

I'm still searching for the best spot to have breakfast in the burbs, but I liked the feel of this place a lot. It's a neighborhood joint full of people who have probably been bringing their families there for years. I was overwhelmed at first glance with the advertisements all over the windows, tables, and by their menu which is the size of a novel. You want pancakes? How many, with bacon? Sausage? How about hash browns or grits? But wait! Just plain pancakes, why not try blueberry, or bacon? I'm all for variety but when it's that much it becomes overkill. I tried the pancakes which were giant and nice and fluffy. I also got scrambled egg whites and grits. They serve their grits instant from the box and plain with no butter or anything, so fair warning. It was plenty of food, neither my husband or I could finish out plates. It's nice that it is right off the Wood Dale metra station. Not bad at all, not wonderful but good.
The best Breakfast in Wood dale, IL. Good people great food. It's a tight squeeze but all apart of the Christy's charm.

This is a good down home diner style place with fantastic food. They have a huge variety on the menu and it comes out quick and hot. The staff is nice and I'm always comfortable when I go here. They serve breakfast all day and I always get the veggie omelette. The chicken noodle soup is good when someone in the family is feeling a bit under the weather too.

Service/Staff is top notch, very friendly, tables are well managed.

Food is very good; good portions; reasonable prices.
Great food here!  Awesome breakfast. Usually doesn't take long to get the food out. Many options on the menu. Just a nice local dinner with decent prices.

Pretty good restaurant... Yelped in before going!! Just as other reviews an old town family restaurant inspired by their favorite Aunt Christy. Enough food for a goood start of the day. Friendly place.

We were in town for a hockey tournament.  One quick phone call and they accommodated our entire team on a Saturday morning. The staff is awesome, especially Karen.  The food was great.  Highly recommend Christy's!

Must trys

Country Fried steak and cream of Reuben soup on Thursday. Good food good service.  This place can get packed between 11:30-1 for lunch.

Eggcellent.  We stopped here for breakfast based on reviews.   Glad we did.   Coffee always topped off from the moment you sit down.   I had hungry man omelette.   Eggs, bacon, sausage, ham, onions, mushrooms, and cheese.  Came with hash browns and I took Greek toast.   Fresh preserves.  My wife had 2-2-2-2.  That is 2 eggs, 2 crepes, she added strawberries), 2 pieces of bacon, and 2 pieces of sausage.   All were excellent.  Portions large.  Our breakfast bill for two people was $21 which is typical.   We went on Sunday morning.  Recommend you go before 9am.  Gets crowded.

Living in Bensenville, Christy's is an easy choice for eating out, the service has always been great, We have eaten breakfast, lunch and supper there on occasion and are always satisfied with the food.  Their portion size is good and the prices are reasonable.

Been coming here for as long as I can remember and have always loved the food.
Lots of  quick order specials for breakfast and lunch. Favorites include the strawberry crepes ( fresh in season) and the 4 deuces ( 2 double yolk eggs, pancakes, bacon, sausage) , and my wife loves the chicken fried steak. Great pricing and always a helpful staff to keep the coffee cups full. Have a nice variety of fresh desserts on display though I seem to always be too full to order any of them, perhaps that's a good thing. Keep up the good work.

Good food not that expensive. Try the veggie omelet its good. Turkey burger comes with a soup and fries and a pickle. The service was very good. They are always packed and I can see why. The regulars they knew by name.

Been coming here for years with my family. NO OTHER PLACE COMPARES. Moved away about a 20 minute drive from christys and we STILL drove all the way out here on weekends for breakfast. The owner gus, his family, and his staff are the best. They are what make the place go over the top. They are all super friendly and they talk to you like your best friends with them. They are all way to nice to my daughter and she loves going there too! I have NEVER once gotten a bad attitude or an "im too busy" attitude from anyone there. The food is great. They have by far the BEST tasting soup...even if its just simple chicken noodle soup. Im glad I moved back in the area and can come here on a regular basis. I will never stop coming to Christys pancake house

I have been dining at Christy's since I was a child.  The place is nostalgic, indeed. Maybe I'm biased, but I feel they are by far one of the best family/greasy spoon restaurants I've ever been to.  Now that I live in the Aurora/Naperville area, I have yet to find an establishment to replace this one. Their space is kind of tight, but I believe that to be part of the whole dining expereince. The ambiance is very warm and cozy. The wait staff is always very freindly, the food is fresh, and the menu is enormous. I've never been unhappy with any of the meals that I've ordered (and believe me, I've been there for all three) in all the years that I have been a patron. If you like desserts, you must try their chocolate mousse. It is by far the creamiest (though rich) mousse you will ever consume!  In fact, my mouth is watering just thinking about it! :)
Server is slowwww.   Service is lousey.   Then they bring a half a plate to the table without my fries.
Yummy food in my tummy... Great food excellent staff & very good price. I envisioned myself coming here once a week for the rest of my life.

We call in an order to Christy's every now and then when we are feeling lazy (They deliver!  Even if you can't give directions and instead bark out questions like, "Turn left? I think? By the Dunkin Donuts?" like some kind of cavewoman.  True story.)  and I'm always a fan of what I receive.  The soups are good, the salmon salad is awesome (but pricey!), and they have crumbled blue cheese for the burgers (A MUST).  I've tried some other sandwiches and stuff too, but it's all pretty typical.  The service is decent (a little slow sometimes, but decent) and I have never had to wait to be sat.  Christy's is simply a nice little pancake house close to work.  It'll do, pig, it'll do.
Really good food and awesome service! The staff is great and food is great whether you have breakfast or Lunch/dinner. Karen was our waitress and she is amazing!

This place is right by my girl's house and let me tell you it is yummy. This is my new favorite breakfast place. The skillets are AWESOME!!  The Pancakes are to die for! Reasonable prices, friendly staff, fast service, what more could you ask for? 

If you're ever in te Wood Dale area, you should give Christy's a try!
Visited on 09/18/2013.   Same review as before.   This Diner is consistently very good.

This place has been a go to place for breakfast since I was kid.  It has lost a little luster.  I love starting my breakfast with toasted pecan roll.  It was just below average.  It lacked caramel and pecans.  This led to the pecan roll being pretty bland.  Of course, the biscuits and gravy skillet was very good.  I do forget how big the servings are in the midwest.  It was ginormous.  Pecan roll was the only downer on this visit, but a big one.
Good food ggooddd service.
The food and service makes up for not having wifi, I loved this place. I recommend the belgian waffles with whip cream!
l absolutely loved the place. Staff was super friendly and the food was great. My new place for breakfast.

Your typical diner with lots of food choices. Breakfast served all day, and always has at least 3 or 4 daily soups (usually very good).
Cream of potato with bacon soup is awesome!

Bad news first: their pancakes are awful. Downright gross.

Good news: The rest of the food is awesome. Great, classic diner. Huge menu. Super friendly staff. 

Favorites: Skillets, sandwiches, free rolls (grab the pretzel roll fast before someone else at your table does), dessert...etc.

My favorite server is Martin and I request him every time I go in. Awesome dude.

I've been going to Christy's for years. My family and I are loyal customers, and have been there easily over 40 times without one complaint. I usually go there for breakfast, but have been there for lunch and dinner as well. Christy's has a very family-owned diner feel. I've only had to wait a couple minutes to be seated maybe twice, every other time we got a table immediately. The wait staff is great, they're very personable and go above and beyond what is expected of them. They're always super sweet to my kids and have brought out extras for them a few times. :) They have a big menu, so you'll definitely find at least a handful of things that you like. I always have trouble deciding what to get because everything looks and sounds so delicious!! Wait time is minimal, we usually get our food within 15 minutes. The food is always fresh tasting and delicious, no matter what we order. Their omelettes are absolutely amazing, the eggs are always so fluffy and they are packed with ham and cheese. Their crepes are to die for, and their milkshakes are thick and delicious. You really can't go wrong. Price-wise it's very affordable, and I always end up bringing food home because the portions are huge and I can never finish it all. I love Christy's and will continue to bring my family to eat there often!!

I had been a child fan of this place, coming here with my parents until more family restaurants opened in Addison when I was in high school.  We still came back, but far less often.  So, we decided to stop in this weekend for a light meal.  Being on a diet, I went to the diet secion of the HUGE menu and figured I would be safe.  Not so much.  First, they don't tell you this, but they are using milk or cream (and not skim milk) in the egg whites.  I know because I got sick afterwards and only get sick with full fat milk.  They also pre-butter the toast, which is normally fine, but on a low-fat meal that is advertised that way, they should be more attentive.  The peach halves that they serve on the plate are canned - and in heavy syrup.  I am thinking that there was nothing low cal or low fat about this meal other than the water I drank.

We also waited quite a long time to be seated, despite two open tables right in plain view.  Once seated, we had to scavenge our own menus because the host got distracted with talking to some regulars about what channel they wanted on the television. 

That being said, my mom enjoyed the waffle fries (Same as ever) and her soup and half sandwich.  Only $14 for the two of us, which is really cheap for lunch.

Sad that this place is not what it used to be - I guess if you are not concerned about calories, etc, you would be fine with the 95% fried or breaded menu and would be giving the place more stars.  I'm just a little more critical of truth in advertising.

I consider myself a pancake critic.  I've tried over 15 pancake restaurants in the Chicago area.  Christy's Pancake House gets the first five-star rating ever without having five-star pancakes.   The pancakes were great, but a bit too heavy otherwise perfect.  Christy's has a small-town diner atmosphere where the locals gather and the staff is friendly.  They have a tremendous value and breakfast selection.  The great food, service and to top it off, the customer punch card, which will definately keep me coming back for more!

Pancake (original) **** great taste, a bit heavy otherwise perfect
Sausage (links) ***** big and tasty
Eggs (over easy) ***** perfect
Coffee  *****  great coffee!
Toast (white) ***** perfect taste

there is no bad food at this restaurant.  there is however, bad seating!

i'm hungover & want greasy diner food, i head down the street to christy's.  the menu is extensive and amazing and all the soups are TO DIE FOR!

the only reason i give it a 4 is because it's cramped and the booths and some of the tables are just plain uncomfortable.

the staff is super friendly, they have a punch card (buy so many meals, get one free) and their waffle fries are TO DIE FOR!

go there - just be hungry and not care about your spacial comfort level!
Great little down-home dinner. Good service by an attractive wait staff, good food with big portion sizes, and inexpensive. I would recommend this place.

We can always count on Christy's ! It's the place we go to get a great meal. 

We love the bacon waffle, Gyro, Ruben, greek salad w/gyro meat, skirt steak sandwich, ham croissant, tapioca pudding the soups are great. 

You will not be disappointed!

Great place to get a meal any time of the day!  Advertised as a pancake house, but they have some of the best soup I have ever tasted!  They have some of the best gyro meat anywhere.  I've tried several things on the menu and have never found anything I didn't like,

This is such a family restaurant that sometimes the owner or his son is taking your order or bringing you your food.  The service is always great!  They are speedy, but don't rush you!
I like the burgers, and they have the Coke Freestyle machines for drinks, so that's nice as well.

Good value for what you get and I was surprised by the variety of the menu of Fuddruckers. I don't eat a lot of beef so I like having the option of turkey, veggie, elk and other burger alternatives. Especially during Lent, I like the fish and chips and grilled tilapia sandwich. However the tables here are sometimes sticky and on our last trip, both of the electronic pop machines were completely out of ice. We had to let someone know so we could fill our cups the first time. Ketchup needed to be refilled too. Other than that, just an average experience but expected for what we paid. The sandwiches here, in a meal (with fries) are huge and enough for two people without big appetites to share. Pecan coconut cookies were unique and delicious. The people working at this location seem very friendly and helpful. Nice job on the customer service!
Never had better burger ,flavourful perfectly  sessoned wow just great and the fact of creating  your own !wow wow

Sadly I'm only giving them three stars. A few years ago and beyond I would have given them five stars. The burger quality has gone down hill. Saturday, August 27 I went there with my family for dinner. I can't believe how chewy and crunchy the burger was. I don't know if it's a matter of them buying frozen burgers or what. The only thing I love there is all the toppings but that's pretty much all I can say about this place at this point. Not to mention how many tables stay filthy for a long time!!  And people please stop bringing screaming kids to this restaurant. Please!!!!

I went to Fuddrucker's a couple weeks ago before my second wedding dress fitting with my mother. We had a coupon for a discounted meal, and it was right across the street from House of Brides. The restaurant was virtually empty so we were able to place our order right away. While we were placing our order, the cashier was complaining about wanting to go home. 

We placed our order, and I saw a proverbial halo of light over....free liquid cheese! Yes, folks. If you do not mind cheese fry cheese, you can have a free add on to your plain burger. Our food came out in a reasonable amount of time. The burger was a little greasy and nothing special. I topped it with fresh items from the toppings bar. The wedges that came with the burger were great. I am a sucker for potato wedges, and this had a nice seasoning on it.

This is not my typical stop, but it is one I will consider.

I'm not a huge fan of buffet anything so having that setup for many of the traditional burger toppings turned me off a little.  I guess I'm a little bit of a germaphobe with all the hands touching the forks, etc.

I opted for the mushroom swiss burger on a regular bun.  I wish I had substituted the pretzel bun because once I had it in my hand, I realized that the bun was just sooo soft, it was starting to disintegrate and I couldn't put it down.  

Fries and onion rings were nothing special.

Been a fan of Fudd's for decades so it hurts to write this. Mediocre experience with mediocre service with mediocre burger. The bun was good and the toppings bar was well stocked and fresh. That's the best I can say about this visit. Ordered a burger medium rare, no fries, no drink. It's nice they have the coke freestyle machine but I didn't feel like ponying up an additional $3.79 for fries and a drink today. The food pager vibrates and I'm excited to get my burger. It's got cheese on it and fries. I ask if it's my order and am told yes. I ask again if it's mine and medium rare; that I didn't order cheese or fries. The gentleman says that they assigned the same pager # to two orders and hands me a different burger with a pink stick in it. I cut into the burger and it's well done, no pink whatsoever. I bring the burger back up to the counter, the employee sees it and apologizes and asks for another burger medium rare. I'm given the second burger and asked to cut into it to make sure it's to my liking. It's raw. I show him and he agrees and asks the grillman again for medium rare. They take the cut burger, throw that burger back on the grill and give it back to me. It's now medium well where I cut it and medium where it wasn't cut. I had enough. I ate my burger with what was remaining of my lunch time and left. Definitely not a typical Fudds experience but I won't rush back to this location.

 For some reason, pricing is a different pre-tax on the combos between this location and the Northbrook location. A 1/2lb burger combo here is over $10 while the Northbrook location's combo is less than $9.

I have been to numerous locations of this restaruant since I was a little kid. When I was a teenager, the local Fudds was right smack dab in the middle of a stretch of road that was a popular hangout on the weekends with us teens, as well as car enthusiasts who would bring out their freshly waxed machines to display. I have so many awesome memories from that time in my life, so I am admittedly a little bias in my review here because of the nostalgia factor. Sue me. 

Fudds has not changed much at all in the 10+ years since I have been a customer. There has been some minor variations, but the focus is and has always been on great hamburgers. Red Robin, 5 Guys. and numerous others places have desperately tried to imitate this formula but their burgers simply don't stand up to the challenge. This location, like every other Fudds I have been to, grinds their own meat in house, and they are some of the most delicious hamburgers you will come across. They also make their own buns in the attached bakery.  How Fudds seasons their burgers is the subject of some dispute, with websites like "Top Secret Recipes" claiming to know how to replicate the seasoning mix. This is all BS, as I have tried this out and it is not the same. I have also had numerous employees tell me that it arrives at the various branches without ingredients listed, so even the employees and managers do not know for sure. The only one who does know for sure is the Phil Romano, who founded the chain.  

What I really love most about this place is the extremely fresh topping bar, as this is what sets this place apart from the competition. Fresh tomatoes, lettuce, peppers, onions, etc, are all on tap here, allowing you to pile it high with what you love. Also on the opposite side are the various sauces and the notable hot cheese sauces which are awesome to dip onion rings or fries in (though Fudds fries are more like potato wedges really). 

I was sad to see that this location no longer has the "one pounder" burger on the menu, just the 1/3, 1/2 and 2/3 pound varieties. They do still offer it,  and they did have one made up in the meat case to be viewed. The patty has a circumference about the size of a volleyball. It has been since I was about 16 since I attempted to eat one, but that is one piece of nostalgia I am not planning to recreate. 

The interior of this location was extremely clean and the decor is a thematic throwback to a 1950's malt shop. Staff here was great, and they kicked out my food in under 15 min, which is not bad for a busy place on Golf. 

If you are looking to splurge on some unhealthy food, Fudds is a great spot to indulge.

Unbelievable

There is a managers special posted
Burger fries drink. 6.99

We order 2

By the way this is only good during the week he tells me - but the sign DOES NOT STATE THAT

We left - illegal advertising

We walked in about 30 minutes before closing. Everyone was super nice about it.  The cook asked us what we wanted before we ordered so he could get started on it. Food came out quickly and the chicken sandwiches were good. My burger was a little dry. This is a good option for a late dinner.

As always food was on point. The only thing that killed the 5th star was service yesterday. I want to say her name is Cheryl, and I don't usually like to call people out, but at 5-6pm in the middle of the lunch rush it may not be the best idea to put the slowest person on register alone during the rush.

I cannot understand how this place has a four star rating. First of all, the bathrooms were disgusting. If I didn't already have my food, I probably would have left based in the conditions of the bathrooms alone. 

The food left quite a bit to be desired. All the burgers at my table were over cooked. My dad ordered medium rare and I ordered medium. Both our burgers came out brown all the way through. The chili fries were not good at all, we didn't even eat them. Rather onion ring basket came with very few onion rings and they were not even crispy... Just soggy and greasy. Gross. 

You get much better food at a much better price with a much cleaner environment at a smash burger or Tom and Eddie's. I won't be returning to Fuddrucker's any time soon!

Fantastic burger place for my girlfriend and I! She is a vegetarian and there are not many places who have a veggie burger that is not a black bean one. I salute their menu for having that there! It's a fine place inside. They give you exactly what you want and their food is always tasting fresh! I love going here!

I usually enjoy Fudd's burgers but not the one I had today.  It was the Kobe burger and not only was the burger nothing special (a little dry)  but the roll it was served on (which was not the usually excellent roll they have but a whole wheat roll) was dry or even stale!  It tasted like something you would pick up in a buffet line.
When the manager stopped by and asked about our meal I told he what I thought and she replied that all their rolls were freshly made.  WRONG!  Not this one.
She told me that if this happened again to ask for a replacement.  I should have but I was hungry and I ate it.
It is highly unlikely I will ever order a Kobe burger again.  BTW, they never asked if I wanted a whole wheat roll and I don't think it is mentioned on the menu.
And what kind of customer service response says you should complain if your food is bad?  DUH!

This is the best Fuddruckers in Illinois, and second only nationwide to the Tucson location (because of nostalgia) in my opinion. The reason I am sure is that the best cook of all the locations is at this location. Our food has been perfect every time. We drive almost an hour to come here. I do wish they would stock more cookie varieties but maybe they just run low at night, which is when we usually visit. I am impressed with the friendly staff and also how the managers will sometimes pitch in to help with bussing.

Went to Fuddruckers two (2) weeks ago on a Saturday and I was not impressed. I ordered a cheeseburger which was good but instead of fries, I ordered Onion Rings. The rings portion size was very small and they were cold. Not even a manager came around to ask how everything tasted. If you pay extra for Onion Rings, you should get what you paid for. Plus I wasnt aware they changed the Rings from thick cut to stringy, thin cuts. Was very dissappointed. Ordered an Oreo Shake as well, just tasted like vanilla, hardly any oreos in the shake which then totally lacked an oreo flavor

First went here as a kid back in 2000 or so. Fell in love with their food, decor, rice Krispy dessert and that pump cheese YUM

Sadly have only been a handful of times since then but still very, very good!

Worst service ever.  It took 50 minutes to get my food only to have it cold.  Took back the cold food only to get slightly warm food that wasn't even part of our order.  Paid for 1/3 pound burger and they tried to serve me a kid meal burger.  $20 for two cold burgers with a half order of fries on each plate because no fries were ready when they "replaced" the original cold food was way too much to pay.  I just hope I don't get sick from eating food that sat out too long.

Bathrooms were filthy, crap in the toilets, paper towel all over the floor inside and outside of the bathroom.

The health department needs to pay this place a visit!

This Fuddruckers doesn't even deserve 1 star, but there is no option for no stars.

so far have been here and another one twice this year. love the burgers and 
you can make your own toppings. add onion. lettuce etc. on side. awesome. keep up good work.
Walked directly into the bathroom and directly out of the restaurant ..The place is disgusting ...should be negative stars but there is no choice for it
It was good for a fast food kind of place.. A lot of kids tho.. A lot and all running around..

No way around it. I have loved this place since I was a kid and continue to do so. The fixins bar is great. The menu has a ton of variety. The service is friendly as the manager came to check on me while I was eating after taking my order. But my two favorite features are they have Coke freestyle machine and they have game meats. I'm totally into buffalo, but this time I switched it up. 

Off the manager's recommendation, I had an elk burger (medium rare) with grilled onions, cheddar cheese and a side of and sweet potato fries. The elk was a little gamey and lean, but really full of meaty flavor. Very very good. The fries were tender and crisp. The only reason it isn't 5 stars is the prices. 18 bucks for the burger, fries, and drink. It's just a little much, I'm sorry.
I went here last night and really enjoyed my experience.  I had an Inferno turkey burger combo and it was really great.

I feel deprived that I didn't try a Fuddruckers ever until now. I just assumed it was one of those SUPER tasty, quadruple beef patty, triple-heart bypass surgery places, but its not. They have plenty of relatively healthy choices, depending on what you order. I was pleasantly surprised this place offers Buffalo burgers. Lean on fat, and HIGH on protein, this is the way to go, if you're looking for a healthier option. They also have relatively healthy choices like the turkey burger as well.

Like I said, I've been deprived, so all of this might be old news to yall, but I figured I'll be thorough anyways. You order up front, pay, and then they give you one of those flashy pager things that look like a coaster. Pick your seat, enjoy the scenary, and wait for your pager to flash. Once they summon ya, go back to the front counter and grab yo' food! 

The wifey ordered the turkey mushroom burger and I ordered the buffalo burger. When I was called to pick up our food from the front-counter, the employee behind the counter pointed at one of the burgers and said that it was the turkey burger (this is important, I'll explain later). They got malt vinegar, hot sauce, tabasco, and then a full-on salad bar like setup for your toppings. They include lettuce, tomato, jalapenos, banana peppers, onions, relish, etc. and then the condiments include mustard, honey mustard, and ketchup.

The burgers are HUGE! Its not one of those thinly sliced meat  burgers... these burgers were at least a couple of inches thick (thats what she said). When I first bit into my Buffalo Burger, I thought it was somewhat bland. Well, it turned out the person behind the counter told me incorrectly which burger was the turkey and which one was the buffalo. Let me tell you, in terms of flavor, HUGE difference. It's kind of discouraging though, to know that their turkey burger was so bland. Anyways, the Buffalo Burger was awesome. It was flavorful, cooked to a "medium" perfection, how I asked for, and was extremely delicious. I was pretty impressed. I also ordered a regular order of sweet potato fries and they were delicious as well.

BATHROOM REVIEW: Pretty clean bathrooms. It contained one stall and a urinal and the overall situation was clean. Sit or squat? Sit!

I love Fuddruckers.  I love the fact that you can build your own burger (I usually create a giant salad on top of mine), and that toppings/condiments/drinks are bottomless.  Only issue I have with this location is that their customer service is somewhat lacking, specifically the cashiers.  Some are just rude, others don't seem to know their own menu.  This is really the only thing I feel they need to improve on.

Food: The food suits my tastes really well.  I'm picky about what and how much goes on my burger, so the toppings bar is perfect... I don't have to give a presentation on how I want my burger, I do it myself.  The meat is high quality and true to weight (unofficially measured with my stomach).  I like thick 'steak' fries and this place does them great.  Chili is good and premium toppings are great.  My family of four all love this place and it's nearly impossible to get us all to agree on a place.

Bathrooms: Well, when things get busy, employees don't and can't check the bathroom every 10 minutes.  To those that are complaining, it is a very legitimate complaint, but I would suggest taking it up with the manager before unfairly dinging them for some slob who forgot to flush the toilet when it was busy.

Fuddruckers: Maybe a bathroom log or something in a clearly visible place to address the other reviewers' concerns about cleanliness.  You need a similar thing for the toppings bar, as I'm sure that gets sloppy (and dirty) when you are really busy.  Your product is too good to let solvable problems that are within your control, ruin what is already a low-margin business.

I have been coming to this Fudd's over a number of years. Last evening was my last time.
The line for orders was very long @ 7pm, this isn't unusual. but usually it moves quickly. Not this time. So, I sat with the group I was meeting there.  I checked back several times and the line didn't get shorter until after 8p. In fact checking back the line was out the front door. I have never seen that in a Fudd's.
There were people in my party who had ordered before 7p, had not received their food as late as 8:15p. 
The floors in the dining area were slick enough to ice skate on, the tables and chairs were sticky, and tables were not being bussed in a timely manner

Hey, Chef Ramsey, I have a project for you!

I like the the different size choices of beef pattie's you get here, the fact they cook it to your specifications and the large toppings bar allow you to have a burger they way you want it. Their bakery puts out some delicious cookies also. Nice arcade area for the kids to go play in while the adults take their time eating and relaxing!
Legit burgers...topping bar with liquid nacho cheese and pico ...jalapenos tomatos this place is amazing

Great burgers, even for a chain surrounded by several others burger places cropping up in the area.

Kobe burger was nice and juicy.  Buffalo burger is really good too.  They used to have an ostrich burger, which tasted very much like beef but 1/3 the fat. Sadly, they no longer offer this one.

I also love their potato-wedge seasoned fries, really yummy

They have a Coca-Cola Freestyle, if you like hi-tech soda fountains.

Nice staff, they took our trays for us and thanked us for coming.

Haven't had their deserts (cookies, brownies, and Rice Krispies), but they look really good.

Truly the worst restaurant experience I've had in a long time.  I ate here out of sheer curiosity, and visited the restaurant about an hour before closing time.  The dirty mop bucket and cleaning supplies in the front window by the entrance should have been a turn off, but I entered against my better judgement.  The fella at the register barely spoke audibly, and clearly hated working there.  Our food was fully cooked, but mysteriously completely cold; picture a cold cut sandwich shaped like a burger.  We left less than halfway through eating our meal, and left it on the counters, with no concern about how quickly we finished, or as to why more than half of the food was still on the plate.

I contacted customer service online to rectify the issue, but never received a response.  Just pitiful.  The price was quite high as well, on top of the lousy experience.

Just ok, I had the bourbon burger and it was very greasy, dripping.  I like the potato wedges, thick, piping hot and cut from real potatoes. But for the price I paid, I have to say 5 Guys is much tastier and cheaper

Among the best burgers you can find. I always get the Fudd Original  but now they call it something else. I just get the barebones kind with no toppings because I can put onions and tomatoes at the salad bar for free. 

Get the wedge fries and have it with cheese, ketchup and mayo.
More recently, I feel that the size of the burgers have reduced, are they cutting corners?

The interiors are okay, not great.

Tried to order a Bacon and cheese burger, no bacon. Ordered and paid for chili cheese fries, went up to the counter to pick food up only to find out they were out of chili cheese also. Surprised they weren't out of any burgers. Only good thing about this place is free refills, even though half of the drink machines are broken. Haha

Ok, Sunday lunch and we just decided to go here. I did not expect very large quantities of food, oh my god, was I surprised. I ended up demolishing a BBQ Chicken sandwich with a side of onion rings (Large) and regular PB shake (Reese). Though I kinda felt the shake was so-so, the other two were really really good. I found the place to be jam-packed, so I suggest to go a little early and find a spot. It's all self service, they give you a fancy buzzer, which vibrates when the food is ready, the shake is just served to you, don't need to wait for the buzzer. You gotta make the rest of the sandwich - they just give you the buns and the meat. But, it was delicious. I highly recommend this place and I think it's really nice place to go in case of pretty big group looking for a place. :)

I like the burgers here.  You can actually bite into them.  Not just a thin patty.

You go up to the counter, place your order, they give you a pager and then they page you.  You get your burger, then add your own tomatoes, onions and lettuce.  They also have pots of melted cheese.  One has jalapeno cheese.  Great for your burger or fries.
Soda?  They have those new fangled machines where you choose your soda, then you can add a flavor to it.  Hot dang!

Best part is no one rushes you out.
If you still have room, they have cookies and rice krispie treats.

A haiku for The Fudd...yes, I called it The Fudd.

Big juicy burger.
Coke Freestyle machine is fun.
Satisfied am I.
Good clean place with good food also.  I tried the Elk burger with sweet potatoe fries. It had a great taste and very tender. It was pretty empty but the atmosphere usually is on the quiet side.

Usually good but lately a lot if issues
A child ordered a cheeseburger and onion rings.     Cheeseburger was served and was waiting for rings.  Had to ask the manager about them.  Then he brought out a plate if undercooked ones and tried to serve them to a child. Never going back!

There consistency is like a roller coaster some Saturdays 50 min wait . Use to go 2 times a month and burgers were great. Last 2 times service and waiting on food were a D- ..their excuse to customers we new staff. Which may have been true at register but managers were running the lines and slow. ...I will go back hopefully the service changes.

The burger was tasty and was most definitely real beef! I ordered mushrooms and cheddar burger.  My complaint comes with the prep.; ordered mine medium and it was a bit pinker inside than should have been for "medium".

Didn't care for the fries- too salty and too soft.  Their onion rings looked really good, should have tried those. 

Since it is a chain I didn't expect much and got what I expected-was a better taste experience than Cheeseburger in Paradise.  I was in the area with others that wanted so I decided to give it a try.  I dont think I'd go back as it is high for what you get.

Cannot get enough of this place! I started coming here as a child with my family, and it has remained a regular stop for food ever since. 
My favorite things about Fuddruckers:
1) Amazing sweet potato fries (the large order, of which, is ENORMOUS)
2) Amazing foot-long Dogzilla (which for some reason doesn't seem to appear on the main menu, but you can order it)
3) Variety of burger options (beef, elk, buffalo, boar, turkey) and when you order your burger cooked a certain way, it actually comes out the way you requested. You can choose a certain burger or build your own. You can order different sized burgers too, like 1/3lb, 1/2lb, and beyond. 
*Did I mention how amazingly delicious the buns are?? Down to the buns! They are amazing. [especially the Dogzilla's] They grill them so they are rich and buttery with so much flavor, I can eat the bread by itself. 
4) The massive collection of condiments available at the condiment bar up front. You can help yourself to as many pickles, jalepenos, banana peppers, and  fresh salsa as your heart desires. 
5) The large selection of sauces available for dipping. They have the basics like yellow mustard, mayo, bbq sauce, and ketchup, but they also have nacho cheese, jalapeno nacho cheese (so good), and spicy mustard (amazing). There are stacks upon stacks of little dipping cups so you can take as much as you possibly want.
If you are a person who likes potato wedges, those are great too, and the onion rings are really amazing. Nothing all that special about the desserts (shakes, rice crispy treats, cookies), but after consuming the amount of food they provide, you may not be all that interested, haha. They also have great root beer floats. 
When you walk in and place your order, they provide you with a pager so you can go up and grab your food when it is ready, but the shakes/floats are brought to your table (they give you a sign with a number to place on your table when you order). I have occasionally had mistakes with my order, but they always fix it fairly quickly. Also, they have fancy touchscreen soda fountains that offer dozens of soda options, and also have lemon wedges)
The atmosphere is really fun and divey, with lots of vintage pictures and signs to check out, and if you are lucky, you can claim one of the massive corner booths. A great place to eat if you have kids with you (lots of space, moderate noise level). The food is not the cheapest, but for the amount that you get, I would definitely consider it a bargain. (1/2 burger with large side of sweet potato fries and regular-sized side of onion ring was $13). Long story short, check this place out! It is definitely worth it. I have been here many of times and it is always a nice experience!
Decent food the burgers were juicy and filling, the fries were not that great I had a 1/2 pound inferno pretty good, service is good too.

column2: R I C K Y B O B B Y.

column13: Good burgers and a nice set up to do your own condiments but a bit pricey.  The soda machine is really cool with lots and lots of flavors to choose from.  The problem is that there are only two machines and the are cool and have so many selections that you wait longer to get your drink than you do to get your food.

This is the classiest of the Fuddrucker's in the Chicagoland area. Now, keep in mind I throw around the word class a little too much - but also keep in mind that this place is actually put together quite well. 

You know what Fuddruckers is - decent burgers, build it yourself, take care of business. 

This place seems to step up the freshness a little better than its contemporaries, and it keeps the pace going just right as well. Made to order burgers (I recommend BUFFALO!) hit the spot and don't break the bank. I like the layout of this one and the view of tropical Golf Road!
Turkey burger loaded with whatever I want. Free cheese for your fries! My brain exploded when I found that out. Great place for lunch, careful don't over do it. Food coma will set in.
First time ever at this restaurant great service and great food will be back. Burger was great

In the 2 years since I reviewed this place, 2 major changes caused me to rethink my opinion.  First, the arrival of "Fast Casual" burger places like Smashburger, Five Guys, etc.  These places charge almost the exact same price (about $10) for a Burger, fries and drink as Fudds, but those places are closer to a Burger King  in results than to this place.  Secondly, Fudds has improved greatly.  Burgers are freshly cooked, the "fixings" are kept fresh, and the selection of alternate items has improved a lot.  The basic 1/2lb burger is still the standout - just good meat, cooked as you request, with lots of free toppings.  Sadly, they seem to be shrinking in Chicagoland, not expanding as they deserve to be.

I wouldn't say the food was good. It is just a fast food joint with a sit- down atmosphere. I do like the make-your-own-soda machine and the variety of sauces bar, but otherwise, it is not for me. All the tables and high chairs for children were dirty or sticky. The food was ok, but I have experienced better. Actually, Culver's as a drive-thru is better. Especially, for the amount of money you spend in this place.

Not bad for what they offer. I love the fresh fixins bar, and the milkshakes are incredible. The prices are a little steep, but no more than any other gourmet burger place. And the staff is friendly and helpful. I'd come back and treat myself to a Bison burger. :-)

When it comes to fast food, burger joints, this is the ace of aces.   The meat for the burgers is simply outstanding and with it being nestled between a great, freshly baked role, the combination is great.  You can only make it better by your own choosing as you go the to condiments bar and load up on your favorite toppings. 

My personal favorite is the 1/2 pound, works burger which comes with cheese, beacon and mushrooms.   

The wedge fries are also really good and I like the seasoning they put on them.   Especially when they are dipped into the hot, jalapeno cheese sauce.  

I only wish there was a Fuddruckers closer to me for we need to take around a 45 minute drive to get there... but it is well worth the trip. 

I would have liked to given Fuddruckers a five star rating, however the burgers are a bit pricy, so I took off the 5th star.

We have been here several times before and enjoyed it. However, we have noticed every time we visited it has been going downhill. The employees are no longer friendly...bordering rude. The tables were sticky dirty and the floor was extremely slippery, almost greasy. The food was ok but not as good as previously. Salty & under cooked. We have decided that it is no longer worth the money to go there. Sad because it was a great place at one point and time.

I don't know why I ever tell them how I want my Buffalo Burger done because without fail it always comes out well done, but that being said -- this was probably the best trip we've had there in years. 

There is a guy that has been there since my son was born (7 years) that goes around and makes sure that you have everything you need. He's super nice. 

Their fries were perfect. Crispy on the edges and perfect potato fluff on the insides with a light seasoning, not overdone at all. 

The only thing I hate about this place is how expensive it is. If I pay $15 for a burger at Sixteen, I should not be paying $10.50 for a burger here. That's just weird.

I've never been to Fuddrucker's before but I have heard of it. We were in a hurry to grab food before hitting up BBB and to be honest, didn't notice Portillo's down the street when we were on Golf. So, my 3 stars is based on the following:

5 stars on customer service. Really nice people were working when we went in, plus they clean up often and check in on you. They also offer an open topping bar and free cheese for your fries.

3 stars for flavor. The bun was perfect, the burger was good--- I loved the wedge fries and they had great flavoring. I will say that the cheese for the fries was lacking any flavor whatsoever. If I ever end up here again, I'll probably try the guacamole burger to give it some life...

2 stars for a slightly pricey, for what it is, menu. I think my meal was slightly under 10 bucks-- which is high because the burger wasn't that special.
