This place didn't get any more stars because they have a pretty generic and limited menu (for a diner).  Or am I just asking for too much when I require to see a 10,000 item menu?  Well, to each his own.  This place is just ok, really nothing special.  Price is pretty good and reasonable so that's a plus! 

I ordered the bacon omelette and the egg was overcooked for my taste.  It came with hashbrowns and a choice of pancake, toast, or french toast.  I had french toast- that was just ok too. 

The location? Well, there's not much around this place so no extra star for location either.  It's across a car place and the plaza it is in has 2 other businesses in it.  

Blah blah blah-- so does my review and the taste of this place!

Cute little place to grab a bite to eat. Friendly service, hot food that is served fast. Coffee isn't bad, I recommend the vegetarian omelette with Swiss cheese. Don't be discouraged by the look of the place, it's clean but could use a update. I love the retro feel to the place it's a blast from the past.

Uncle bills dinner looks like a classic diner.  Not sure how long it has been here but the faded pink table tope make it seem like a while.  There is wrap around counter which seats a dozen.  They also had 8 booths and a few tables.  

The staff was nice, but taking a relaxed pace.  This is fine, I am in no rush, but it is worth noting for others.  It seems like most of the customers are regulars. 

The coffee setup was the standard packets and creamer, which I always find disappointing.  The coffee itself was pretty good.  The cups were on the small side, but the waitress did offer to fill up my thermos.  Too bad that was the last fill up I had offered.  

Apparently they have biscuits and gravy but it is not on the menu!  So I may have missed out.
I ordered two eggs over easy with bacon and pancakes.  This also comes with a side of American fries.  It appears to be cooked to order, which I really appreciate.  The eggs were cooked to perfection, the three peice sod bacon were nice and crispy.  

Sadly the pancakes were super dry and not very fluffy.  It took 4 pats of butter and a syurup packet to get them down.  Also, I hate prepackaged syrup.

I'd been eager to try Uncle Bill's because of the great reviews and, well, I heart diners.

Uncle Bill's has a '50s retro feel with lots of Marilyn and some Elvis posters in the wall. Seating is limited, so I can absolutely see how there's a weekend wait. At 7pm on a Monday, though, it was just us and two other patrons.

Dee took our orders - she was friendly and intuitive. I had the Tuna Melt + pea soup. It came on toasted seeded rye (total YUM) and had 2 slices of cheese. They had just cleaned the fryer so no fries for us, so we got hash browns instead. Fine by me!

He also got the pea soup + a grilled Chicken sammy on Pumpernickel, no cheese. Sadly his bread wasn't the toasty goodness mine was. Still, both portions were hearty. We each had coffees and waters which were regularly refilled. So, yep, good service!

Our pre-tip total was $17.60.

I devoured half of my sammy - it was tasty and the tuna was plentiful - and took the rest for lunch today. All was great and was at least worthy of 4 stars ...UNTIL ("TMI" Alert!) we got home and I had to go straight to the restroom.  Ugh. Thinking it was a fluke, I ate the rest today for lunch aaand had the exact. same. results. I don't have a delicate stomach, so something was definitely awry.

Really disappointing, because it was so delish. :/ Sorry Uncle Bill's: not convinced I'll be returning.
Just went there because we were in the neighborhood and what a great place...the service is outstanding and everyone is so friendly and the food is awesome!! Highly recommend and will be going back!
It's been a long time since I've been a diner like thisGod how I missed it. The food was delicious the people were nice and it's very clean too. I know I'll be back hopefully you will be too

I love this place! I eat breakfast at Uncle's Bill every now and then... it's delicious and plates are perfect amount of food. Not huge and not small. Just perfect! Food fresh and very friendly environment!

Super friendly staff who server a quick traditional breakfast. This place has been a Schaumburg/Roselle go to restaurant for decades. It's the kind of place where they know their customer's names, and always have a smile on their face. Don't expect fancy breakfast and lunch fair... it's simple but we'll executed food. They have great dinner specials as well.

Much better the second time around.  Got the food fast, but still just typical diner fare.  I would not go out of my way to eat here, but wouldn't mind stopping back if I'm passing by.  I do wish there was a sign saying if you are supposed to just sit or wait to be seated.  That annoys me.

Came here from a suggestion by Jennifer P. The outside of this place looks well-kept. The neon signs are in good working order. Inside, the look and feel is definitely of an old diner -- not old as in Golden Nugget, disgusting old, but more like a Johnny Rockets charming, authentic good old vibe.

I ordered the split pea soup, and the Uncle Bill's Bionic chicken sandwich, which was a grilled chicken sandwich, lettuce, tomato, grilled onions, and bacon. Even though I requested no cheese, they put cheese in my sandwich. But no worries -- the cook and waitress were extremely nice and offered to recook it, in which I declined as the cheese was easily able to be scrapped off.

The sandwich was delicious! The only thing lacking was the toasting of the dark rye. Because it was left untoasted, the bread quickly crumbled and I was left with a messy sandwich. But the chicken and bacon was cooked perfectly, and seasoned just right. It was one of the best grilled chicken sandwiches I have had in a very long time.

The split pea soup was great as well, although I have to say it was saltier than I would have liked it.

Overall, the food was still good, and the people were nice and friendly. If you're looking for diner food, without the Golden Nugget yuck, definitely check out this place.

BATHROOM REVIEW: Comprising of a one-person bathroom, inside was pretty roomy. The inside had a lot of rusty looking pipes, and had the look and feel of a really old bathroom. Sit or squat? Squat!

Uncle Bill's Diner is just about as diner as you can get. The clientele is filled with some older singles at the bar, some families and in the back corner the morning we went was a motorcycle gang complete with their leather jackets. Bad@$$! Uncle Bill's has pictures and posters of Elvis & Marilyn all over the walls here.

Uncle Bill's can get very full as it isn't very big. Prices are great though, portions are large and food is good though nothing to write home about. I love cliches. They have some specials written on a board in the back and I had one of said specials - biscuits & gravy + two eggs. It was way too much food, even though I ate it all like a beast and just $7! 

Although I'm not running to go back to Uncle Bill's if I was in the area and someone suggested it, I wouldn't hesitate to dine there again.

This place is as good as a diner on the side of the road can be.  I ordered a fairly standard breakfast: eggs over medium, bacon, potatoes, and toast.  The food was perfectly prepared and tasted delicious.  The other customers were friendly and appropriately chatty (to a stranger) and the staff (including the owner) was welcoming and courteous.  I'll definitely be going back next time I'm in town.
Absolutely love this place. My co worker Referred me here for breakfast and the food was great! Good portions, great prices. Helen is the best! Great customer service!

Came in today. Not welcoming what so ever. It is my first time so I was wondering if I should sit down or they will tell me where to go. Working in a restaurant industry I know a welcome smile at least is a must. Not here.

I sat (the awesome busboy told me I could seat where ever I wanted). He then wanted to take my drink order... I waited for the waitress though.

She came smiley and took the drink order.

She then came to take my food order. I got ribeye steak med well and hash browns . It came with soup or salad which I got cream of chix rice. My daughter ordered the choc. Chip pancakes... Ehhhhk the soup not so good. 

The Busboy kept my coffee full all the time.

Then came our order... pretty big pancakes... Choc.Chip are inside pancakes which is awesome. My ribeye came with the hash and a side of corn.. ehhhk didn't know it came with corn. Not my piece of pie. Not the best ribeye... and was medium.. =( I don't like pink! But okay !!!

Food was ewwwwk 

I think since I got something from the special board(ribeye) it came with dessert. (The waitress told me the customer next to us gave us his dessert so we would be getting two desserts) AWESOME!! Considering I have two daughters and they fight for everything. They had the chocolate ice cream. ... or should I say they TRIED... Because they didn't eat it ... don't know why....

Service was good....  food not so much...
Awesome independently owned restaurant. So many choices, food was delicious, staff was wonderful. Lived here for 20 years and never have made it in-- will be back again!

Picture yourself sitting down to breakfast or lunch at a diner in the early 1960's.

Yep. That's what happens here. You go back in time.

OK, so maybe you don't really go back in time, but it's a sweet vibe.

After driving past this place dozens of times and seeing that an awesome, fellow Yelper liked to come here pretty often, I wanted to give them a try one early spring afternoon.

Uncle Bill's Diner is exactly what it is. It's a diner. And there is an Uncle Bill.

A long counter, barstools, booths, diner-style memorabilia (think classic cars and Hollywood icons), friendly staff, simple menu, reasonable prices, quick service, good portions, and greasy food! Just right.

located in a ghost area of strip malls, this is the only place that seems to draw business.  i've lived in the area for years and have never had the guts to go in here because it looks like a total dive, but there are always so many cars on the parking lot every time i pass by, so i finally had to try last month and been back several times since then.  1960s theme diner (which was also probably the era the interior was last updated).  everyone  in here seems to know everyone.  i was definitely the only non-white person on the times i came here but i did not feel out of place.  the staff were friendly (even the cook with a mullet).  the food was good, the portion was great, and the price even greater.  free coffee.

Only thing missing from this restaurant is Barney Fyfe sitting at the lunch counter.  GOOD food, great customer service, sandwiches come with soup (YUM! home-made touches) and fries.  They have umpteen specials for the day and a separate "pie board" announcing available flavors.  If you want a clean, friendly, not too full of hype, meal...Go to Uncle Bill's!

I have only eaten here for breakfast, but hands down the best breakfast you can get. It is a very cozy diner, very sweet staff and always leave happy and full.  Biscuits and gravy with over easy eggs is amazing!

This place is everything that it looks like. A first class crap hole. Don't waste your time or money going here. I ordered skirt steak and eggs. The worst breakfast I ate in years. And the bill was 16 bucks. I have lived in Roselle for 18 years and this is the first and last time I will go there.

Think 90210's Peach Pit and Mel's Diner. You'll be smacked over the head with nostalgia from the moment you walk in the door. It's like a blast from the past that I've only dreamed of, but never experienced. 

Until now. 

We have driven past Uncle Bill's Diner a bazillion times. And a couple weeks ago, we decided that we couldn't just keep driving past. So we pulled in the crowded parking lot and made our way inside. We went back again today, so I'll give you an overview rather than a total replay of one visit or the other. 

It's totally a diner. A long counter with stools loaded with locals eating breakfast. More tables and booths than I could have imagined squeezed in there. During our first visit, there was one booth available and we snagged it. This time, it wasn't quite as packed so we chose a booth. (The same spot as last time. We're creatures of habit.)

Anyhow, the servers work together as a team. There is no rhyme or reason. No actual pattern of who does what because everyone does everything. They are a well oiled machine. Operating in sync at all times. Pouring coffee, refilling sodas, taking orders, clearing dishes. 

Here you're a Honey or a Sweetie. It works. Don't question these things. Until you're a regular and they're calling your name when you walk in the door, Honey or Sweetie it is. No joke...it's like Cheers - where everybody knows your name and they're they're always glad you came...  Both times, people walked in and someone said 'Hi Joe/Bob/Jim!' And this was echoed about four times throughout the joint. Awesome!  

There IS an Uncle Bill. He's a very hard working guy. You'll know exactly who he is.  

The booths aren't overly comfortable, but you won't linger. Get in. Order. Eat. And get out. They are busy. It's reasonably priced and nothing fancy. So far, we tried eggs over medium, hash browns, bacon, biscuits and gravy, skirt steak sandwich with fries, ham and cheese omelet and chocolate chip pancakes. 

Eggs were cooked perfectly. Hash browns and bacon standard but good. Biscuits and gravy were top notch!  Skirt steak sandwich was a mistake. There was nothing wrong with it, but this is really a breakfast joint so I wouldn't order it again. The omelet disappeared rapidly from my son's plate. I loved the chocolate chip pancakes!!!  Light and fluffy with a ton of flavor packed in. Yes please. 

They cook right in front of you so that's cool. 

I will be a regular here and some day, I won't be Sweetie anymore. I'll be good 'ol Jen!  I can hardly wait!
Food was mediocre and service wasn't great at all. I will not be going back to uncle bills

After driving by this place many times, I decided to stop in to try it out.  I love this place.  The staff is friendly and fun, and the food is always good.  As far as diners go, this is the top of the list.  The only negative thing that I can say about it is that during busy times it is tough to get a seat.  But for me, it is worth the wait.  I especially love that they offer french toast as a side item with your breakfast.

Had breakfast here on recent trip to Schaumburg with my wife. If we hadn't had breakfast at Gus' Diner the dy before, we might have given this one a 4 star rating but Gus' diner was comparable in price but an upgrade in food quality.

Uncle Bil's captures the classic diner motif and experience very well and the food is typical in what that entails - good food, large portions, fair prices.

The staff was friendly and we enjoyed our breakfast and would return.
Good breakfast spot on a Sunday morning, only wish they served breakfast skillets.

Like many others, I drive past this place everyday to and from work and ive always been so curious! My brother and sister were both in town visiting for the new year and I thought what a perfect time to check this place out.  
Come in and sit anywhere! They are super friendly,  quick and courteous and the ambiance was EXACTLY how I was hoping it to be! really made me feel like I went back in time instead of thinking about another year at midnight. 
The food was great and the price even better, just what you would expect from a good diner! I will definitely be coming back again and again in just sad it took me all this time to finally go!

We are regulars at Uncle Bill's.  This is not a fine dining experience.  It's an old restaurant with surly but funny and friendly waitresses.  The food is probably something you could make for yourself at home and it's nothing fancy, which is why we love it!   Waitresses are known for having conversations with the regulars from across the room and while waiting on other tables.  There's always an opinion and 50's music playing in the background.  We love the atmosphere here, very down home.  We've taken visiting family here and they all loved it. 
One of the few places I can get homemade liver and onions.  Restaurant snobs will not enjoy this place, regular people will.

Nice and simple.
Passed by many many times, but finally made a stop to eat here for the first time.
Breakfast for dinner :)
Ordered 2eggs with bacon served with hash brown shredded on the side, with 2pcs of pancakes. Friend ordered french toast 3pcs. All fresh, delicious, no unneccesary ingredients. The best part, no cheese!!
Hot chocolate was great. Coffee was ok.
Not much service, which is fine, i did not expect/need much service at a breakfast place. Don't get me wrong, they are very nice and ask a few times if we need anything. The chef who made our food also came out and asked if i need more coffee, very nice!
Open kitchen so that you see how your food was cooked. And so that you know they are not serving you anything pre-cooked.
We went in 7:30pm knowing they close at 8pm, so it was a rush meal, we didn't want to bother them so long although they never said they were closing soon. 
Given a four stars for this first visit. Will come back again soon and figure out if they deserve a five stars or not.

Always good, always nice and friendly!! They used to only take cash so I stopped going there for years and recently went there and li and behold they take cc now!! Same waiters and waitresses for the last 15 years!! Great food and specials!!

This place sticks out (in a good way) amongst all the chain restaurants in the Schaumburg area.  We've been living in the area for over 5 years and finally decided to give Uncle Bill's a first try the other day.  The soups, sandwiches, and breakfast fare were all delicious and to my family's liking.  The service was very friendly and accommodating, and the prices are a good value.   I got the sense there were quite a few loyal regular patrons in there.  I'm glad we discovered Uncle Bill's and recommend it to anyone looking to change up the routine.  We will definitely be back.

I love Uncle Bill's. They are extremely friendly every time I go. The servers are attentive and I love the family atmosphere. They have killer prices and the quality of food is always good and consistent. It's the perfect neighborhood diner. And can't forget to mention the retro decor and old timey music.

Definitely not a good place to bring the family.  Very cramped seating arrangements. They should probably think about hiring a cleaning service.  There was food and cobweb on the walls, blinds and picture frames. My bacon was burnt black and the hash browns tasted funny. Will not ever be back here again.

You can't miss Uncle Bill's Diner ... it's painted sky blue! And though the exterior may be revved up; the inside is pure return to the 60's, with wonderful, down home kinda cookin' where you get a full plate and then some!

How fun is this? Well, the fun can be had in deciding which retro dish you plan to revisit. My consulting friend has been on a diet for weeks; he was about to keel. So, his reward to himself was breakfast here. I, supposedly, came with as the caloric police. Not!

Indulge! Get into the culture! Tomorrow is another day! Well, he outdid himself (and so did Uncle Bill) with a plate of corned beef hash, 2 eggs over easy, wheat toast, juice, and coffee. He groaned with ecstasy through his entire meal. 

And I picked something I haven't had in eons: the buckwheat pancakes and a side veggie scramble (but that really isn't what it's called). Though not formally introduced, I think I saw Uncle Bill shake his head when I was trying to explain what I wanted. Not to worry, our waitress was awesome! As was the coffee! 

Sure, we looked like outsiders. But we went with the flow. It's a campy little spot with it's own subculture and pretty great food. Clean, too! And you will likely take half your food home; they are very generous.

Having driven by here countless times it's nice to be finally in the know with Uncle Bill's!

It's more diner like than you would expect on the inside. More retro than you would expect. Pictures of Elvis for sure. 

Came here to grab a little snack after yoga, of course we ate healthy....except not at all.

My friend had the cherry pie which she said was really good. It kind of a small piece, but hey I guess that happens. 

I ordered the biscuits and gravy with two eggs. The biscuits and gravy were prettttty good if I do say so myself. Not the very best I've ever had, but by far not the worst, I would order them again.

I'm sure we'll be back again, perhaps I'll try lunch next time.

My favorite diner.  Ive only had breakfast here no matter what time of day i go because its so tasty i don't want to try anything else.  Awesome omelets and biscuits and gravy.  The bacon and sausage is always cooked perfect as well.  Ive been going here for three years and everyone is super friendly.

We stopped for dinner and found this place on Yelp. The place is decorated in 50's items and is a smaller but cozy place. The food tastes good and the French toast was very good. The reason for my 3 star rating was the staff. We asked for several recommendations as we had not been here before and they gave us there thoughts which was appreciative but the one waitress had a mouth and used several words that were not appropriate and we did not find funny. Several other comments were made when coming over to check on us that just left us shaking our head at this place. Not sure if it was just an off night but not sure I would want to bring kids there to listen to that. My wife was also uncomfortable and just made the whole experience awkward.

Food: I had the worst craving for hash browns. Sure, I cook all the time, but that's one of a handful of things I don't really cook for myself. If I'm grating potatoes like that, I'd rather make latkes. Generally, I'll do other things with potatoes that don't involve grating at home. I'd never been here before, but I'd read good things on Yelp, and it seemed like just the place to go to sate this craving -- reasonably priced, solid diner experience. 

Some days, you want experimental breakfast mashups, like tiramisu french toast. Other days, you just want fluffy buttermilk pancakes with no frills. This place is the latter (and yes, those pancakes are good). Food is well cooked, but not really seasoned much at all. I'm guessing this is because it mostly serves an older clientele, who are probably very salt-conscious. There are salt and pepper shakers on the tables, so you can adjust as necessary. Hash browns were nice and crispy on the outside and soft and fluffy on the inside; just what I wanted. Yay. Also, the coffee was good.

Service: It's a small place, with super '50s decor and very friendly staff. As soon as I walked in, I was cheerily greeted and invited to sit anywhere I wanted -- even though they were clearly busy with people both sitting at the breakfast bar and at the booths/tables. It's a great place to people-watch, as well. Regulars were greeted by name, and the staff took the time to chat with them. I love that about places like this. It's very much not a modern place; the most modern thing about it is probably the fact that the '50s rock n' roll music that played came from the Sirius/XM 50's station, and so was much clearer than it would have been coming from a transistor radio. But otherwise? Old-school all the way. The short order cook was cooking at a flat-top grill that stood in plain view of all the customers, so if you sat at the breakfast bar, you got food and a show. 

Prices are more than fair, considering. If you're looking for anything fancy, keep driving. If you're looking for a very basic step backward in time, with really great service, stop in. They also serve lunch. 

(Oh, be advised that the breakfast items all come with "American Fries." That's their term for hash browns -- not "Freedom Fries" or something that might show up on the Colbert Report.)

I've driven past here 1000 times in my life and I'm regretting not stopping in sooner.  Uncle Bill's is a thing of rarity.  Now that corporate restaurants are ubiquitous, it's hard to find places like UB's.  
They have a really small menu but it's good, cheap food.  They're not trying to blow you away or anything like that, but the food serves it's purpose.

With that being said, my sis had the navy bean soup (Greek fasolada) and she said it was really good.  My boyfriend and I both got the corned beef has with scrambled eggs and a side of pancakes.  It was good, just like home cooking.  Apparently they have the best biscuits and gravy (homemade). 

The waitresses are your typical "hi, how you doin', honey?" kind of waitresses.  I believe THE Uncle Bill's wife is one of the waitresses.  The owner is very nice and stopped by to talk to us, he was so nice!  The cook cooks your food in an open area, the kitchen is surrounded by a counter seating area.  You never really come across "open kitchens" like this anymore but it shows that they have nothing to hide (in terms of quality).  

Anyway, it's a good place to stop if you are in the area and are looking for a cheap, good meal or some coffee.  Is it gourmet? By no means.  Does it serve it's purpose? Heck yes!

fast, friendly staff (especially Uncle Bill himself!). The food was fantastic, my best friend had the biscuits and gravy and I had the French toast. We left full and in a near food coma! Would go back in a heartbeat!

We enjoyed breakfast at this diner before heading back home after visiting family. Food was good the server mixed up our order slightly, but the food was good and reasonably priced. The hash browns could have been cooked a little crispier for my liking. Loved the atmosphere of an typical 50's diner and Uncle Bill himself even came to our table and refilled coffee.
Uncle Bills is the best place for miles to have breakfast. Staff , including uncle Bill will go out of there way to make your meal the best of the day. I start my Saturday off there every week.
Cheap, delicious, friendly, totally old school. Perfect. I'm 45 years old and when we went in we lowered the average age by a third. Love!

My friend and I came here to fuel up after a run. The prices weren't bad and the food was OK. It's typical diner food, mostly breakfast and lunch type items. I went with the steak and eggs. Eggs are pretty much always eggs and the steak wasn't bad. The portions were large enough to fill me up but didn't leave me feeling grossly overstuffed. It seemed a little expensive for what it was. Although it wasn't overpriced enough to keep me from coming back. It's a good option for a casual dining experience.

From the outside this place doesn't look like anything special. My father loved this place and swore by their biscuits and gravy. Maybe it's a guy thing, because my fiance is a fan of their breakfast foods as well. He loves the meat lovers omelet, which comes with all sorts of breakfast meats ham sausage etc.. a lot of their omelet's come with peppers and onions in the egg mix, which not everyone likes and I feel like it should be more clearly stated on their menus. I've always gotten the waffles, they've always been good. Being such a small place, they run out of a lot of their fresh fruit that's supposed to come on top of their waffles & pancakes.. 

The only reason I am giving this place three stars instead of five is because of their staff. There have always been little issues every time we've been here, but the last time we were there, our waiter left without giving us a check or refilling our drinks. We sat there for about 15min without any of the other staff saying anything to us. Finally we went to the little check out counter & asked the little old man where our check was, instead of giving us a nice polite answer he started yelling about his employees leaving to go home without finishing their work. The whole situation was handled poorly, we'll probably be back, but no thanks to the staff.

Never judge a book by it's cover! I have past this place a trillion times down Roselle Road and never thought twice about stepping into the lackluster building. After going in there a couple weeks back, I am thoroughly ashamed to say I judged it by the appearance and regret not going there sooner! 

I got a basic breakfast staple: eggs over hard, hash browns, bacon and pancakes. You know they aren't counting calories which made the food so delicious! The best part is that you see exactly what they are doing to your food if you sit at the bar. 

I was craving a chocolate milk which was the only thing that disappoints because I could tell it was Nesquik powder. Why would I care about that? Because there were still chunks of powder in my milk (sigh). 

This isn't the place to for healthy conscious people. I left feeling overwhelmed with the amount of fat and butter I ate...

You could tell there were a lot of regulars and the staff has got to be the FRIENDLIEST people in town. That's what I appreciate the most!

Cozy, nostalgic , efficient diner. They wait staff work together to make sure everyone is well taken care of. Food is plentiful, fresh and delicious. I had the Hot Pork Sandwich, hubby had the Ranch Chicken Wrap. We have enough left over for a whole other meal.

great old school diner where you can eat at the counter or in a booth. Typical diner menu but made well. Friendly service. I was even offered a coffee to go afterI paid my breakfast bill and was ready to leave

A great diner! We had a meat lovers skillet special that comes with French toast. The skillet was fabulous + French toast delightful. Expect diner embellishments (no real maple syrup here), but it was perfect for our morning. Staff was friendly and speedy!

I absolutely love this place! The staff is so nice and friendly, the service exceptional, and the omelets terrific. They put so much cheese in them! Yummmm. And you can get french toast on the side for desert, all for the low price of $7.50! I didn't know which soup I wanted so they let me sample small bowls of both. The vibe is retro 1950s and it works :) my fiancé and I love this place.

We've driven past Uncle Bill's for a long time and have never stopped to eat there. From the outside it doesn't look like much. For some reason we decided to go there for breakfast this morning.  We're both glad we did!

I had the meat lover's skillet - 2 eggs, hash browns, green pepper, onion, bacon, sausage, ham and I'm sure there was some other stuff in it too.  It also came with your choice of toast, pancakes and a few other options.  I took pancakes.  My wife had 2 eggs, hash browns, toast.  We both thought our meals were great!  Good flavor and not greasy.  Even the orange juice tasted better than at most restaurants!  A bonus is that kitchen is right behind the counter so you can watch everything being made.  We both left full and it was all for just under $20.

The down side is that this is a 50's diner theme.  While the 50's music was amusing for a little while, it did get a bit irritating after a while.  But hey, that's just me.

We'll definitely be back!

Uncle Bills is your standard diner fare (burgers, breakfast, sandwiches) with  good prices and relatively good food, however, this place is  in exceptional need of a deep clean and some of their food safety practices need to be addressed. I do not like eating at this diner when the owner is helping in the kitchen. Let's jut say...I've seen him completely disregard several standards for food safety and commit some egregious acts that cause me to question if dining there is wise. The wait staff is friendly and efficient, the busser and regular cook do a fantastic job, though uniforms for the wait staff and coats for the cooks and busser would really help to convey a more professional and cleaner atmosphere.....I get it...it's a cheap diner...but there are several other local dinners like Teddy's and Checkers who serve the same food but when I leave there I'm not contemplating whether or not I may have contracted food poisoning. Basically it comes down to this....when this place is good, it's really good,but when it's bad it's horrid. Avoid Sundays. Go during the week . I like eating dinner here mid week when they are slow. My advice to the management is paint this place, ditch the old faded plastic framed posters caked with grease and replace them with some new ones, make your staff ware uniforms, clean the filthy ceiling vents, add a fridge in the kitchen area for eggs and prepped vegetables, repair some of the damaged seats in the booths, serve some better coffee and keep Bill out of the kitchen..

The best turkey club I have had! It was such a deal too. For around $8 or so I got my choice of soup, with fresh bread and butter, a nice sized turkey club (I added American cheese) and fries. It was definitely worth the money and the service was good to. They refilled our water numerous times and made sure everything was okay. I will definitely be returning here.

This place is great. 

The food is standard, not the best, not the worst and more than fairly priced~ but what I think really makes this place awesome is the live entertainment, IE, the wait staff. They are hilarious. You can see they are having a great time but they don't alienate their customers in doing so; they include everyone in the fun. You just don't run into this atmosphere anymore. Totally entertaining. Loved it. I will be back, hands down. And there really is an Uncle Bill!
small......decent food nothing special

I travel a lot and enjoy eating in diners on my journeys. I consulted Yelp today while in Roselle. The positive reviews got my attention, so decided to give Uncle Bill's a try for a late lunch. It was very disappointing, and it is a safe bet that this joint won't ever be featured on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives on The Food Network!!  The place was virtually empty and the cook was lying down (napping?) on the bench of a booth by the window. I did not know he was the cook or I probably would have left right then. There was one middle-aged waitress and a younger waitress she appeared to be training. The older one was loudly complaining about another waitress who was not there at the time. The entire time I was there she complained. I ordered a Coke, a bowl of chicken soup and a cheeseburger. The Coke tasted flat, so she replaced it, but blamed it on their soda machine and said it is not like what I would get at McDonald's!  What does that mean?!  Isn't a Coke the same everywhere?!  While eating my soup - straight out of a Campbell's can I am sure - I saw the cook popping food into his mouth while he cooked my burger!!  As soon as he plated my food, he sat down at the counter, put on headphones and a backwards ball cap and commenced checking his phone!!  REALLY?   Although the burger looked okay, my appetite was lost when I saw this joker eating while preparing my food. Not a good impression at all. Maybe the place is better supervised when Uncle Bill is present, but it was a disaster without him there to keep an eye on his employees. I will not go
back!

was out in the burbs today for work.  my coworker and i, not knowing where anything was, decided to follow the biggest crowd of parked cars to a meal, and it led us to uncle bill's diner!

as we're mere days into the new year, i was of course nursing ideas of healthy eating and exercising, ad nauseum.  then i saw on the menu that they serve a patty melt with wedge fries,  and that was the end of that!  and believe me, it was definitely worth it to move my resolution start date back a day.

5 stars for great customer service, great food, and great price.  outer decor leaves something to be desired, but isn't something that i think is really necessary for a diner to have 5 stars when the service was so good, and i only paid $9 for soup, sandwich, fries, and a drink all made to order.  loved it!

I want to give this place a 4th star, but they are "too-friendly". Food is quite good as are the portions, but compare to "Checkers" (formerly Spring Grove) they Uncle Bills is a bit pricier and slightly smaller portions. But it's character is unique, reminiscent of the diners of yore, which adds to the experience.

Awesome 50's style diner with an extremely friendly staff and amazing breakfast with great prices. They have FREE Wi-Fi and have added a nice LCD to watch TV.  Best breakfast for miles. You get to watch them make your food in classic short order fashion.  Uncle Bill and Tim are a riot and it's just a great place to visit.  Might not have a very appealing look from the outside but totally worth the visit.
The buffalo chicken salad was amazing. Service was super friendly, and the ambiance was very nice. Will definitely come back here.

I should've listened to the reviews but I was hungry and just thought "can't be that bad"

I came here with my co workers for lunch on a Friday and we all agreed that we wouldn't come back. 

The service was very very slow, it took us 35 minutes to get Mac and cheese bites, and they were mediocre at best. 

I ordered the California burger which is nothing but a burger with (not fresh made but more like store bought) guacamole on top, that's all. Pretty disappointed since the burger is over $10. The overall taste of the burger was a 6/10 at best, it's a $5 burger in my opinion, no cheese either! The tater tots were not bad, but the cheese sauce was way over microwaved and tasted bad. 

Getting our checks and paying took really long as well, nobody in our table was happy. I wouldn't come back, if i was you I'd head over to Morettis, they have way better food and service and burgers are leaps and bounds ahead

The good parts: Good selection of beer, Friday fish fry $9.99, nice patio.
The bad parts: VERY slow service, there were 13 customers (yes, I counted), two bartenders, one server, one barback, and one bouncer, yet ordering a drink and having it delivered took 10 minutes. Just go to the bar. 
They dont actually have all the beer on tap they advertise. Again, just go to the bar to save your server coming back and telling you theyre out. 
DO NOT GET THE PIZZA, actually dont eat here. It's good for drinks, but the food has been a disappointment every time with the exception of the fish fry. Be willing to wait a while for your food though.
Be aware even though there are only 13 people there, they will turn the restaurant into a club at midnight. Remember that conversation you were having with your friends? Neither do I. They start blasting the music so loud it bisrupts your brainwaves, so dont plan on talking to anyone after midnight. 

Update: downgraded to one star because I got food poisoning from the fish.

Overall, good for a drink or two if you sit at the bar and dont have a server get your drinks, just eat before you get here and leave before mighnight if you dont want a ringing sound in your head the next day.

Absolutely awful. Came here last night (11/20/16) for a drink and quick bite to eat and will never return. Took ten minutes to get a drink order, another ten minutes for a drink. The bartender (who was also our waitress) was the only one working on the floor. She was polite and apologetic but it's so disappointing to see a business run an employee ragged like that. Tipped her well and wished her to have a better night but will never return. Third time here and service has always been awful. How do you have only one person doing everything, with someone that looked like manager continually seating her? Zero help for her at all, I hope she finds a new job.

Went here around 2pm on a Saturday for some food and drinks. We noticed that they had an outdoor patio and wanted to sit there since it was great weather. 

We weren't greeted right away when we came inside and the place had like 3 groups at the patio and a couple inside. When we got seated outside, we were informed that the Bartender was helping out the only waitress that was working. The bartender had to go back and forth from the bar to check up on us. This caused multiple times that we waited over 15 minutes to order drinks/food/etc. The bartender did seem aggravated every time she came outside the help out the other tables. 

The food was okay and isnt much different from other bars in the area. They didn't have a drink menu available and the bartender told us that they're currently working on it. 

I wouldn't come back here just because of the service and that they should've had more people scheduled instead of 2 people.
Food was great, a few people in my group hd complaints about the service but i didn't see a problem i came during the blackhawks-Canucks game and the DJ dude was kind of a dork

While in town, my husband and I joined his parents and some of their friends for a quick dinner at Fireside before heading off to our next destination for the evening.

I ordered a veggie wrap with steak fries. The wrap seemed to be stuffed with greens and onions, topped with some kind of balsamic dressing. It was good, but kind of odd that nothing else was in it. The steak fries were amazing. Mmm. Perfect portion for a dinner place -- $9 and I ate it all. My husband didn't like his chicken caesar wrap, though. Apparently it had a lot of onions in it? Odd.

Service was alright. Food was good, but not amazing. Prices were fine.

Fireside has a clean, upscale but not fancy pub feel. Lights dim at night.

Just another typical suburban ale house addition to the suburbs.

Cool to have it here, but not a place I'd frequent often.

Went here for a quick lunch New Years week. We Live nearby and have never been here. We decided to give it a chance. 
The Decour is nice lots of TVs. There is a long nice fireplace right in the middle. I ordered the wings and just like another review said they did not have the bourbon sauce ha ha. My wife got the mini burgers. We thought the food was pretty good the service was slow and the ambience was good. I would say the current rating of three out of five stars is pretty accurate. It is what you would expect.

Returned to Fireside Ale house in 10/15/2016 and discovered they were closed and changing management. No date listed as to when they will reopen, it just says soon. I'll upload a picture on their front door informing customers of the changes

Normally we arrive for dinner. The waitress seats us by the dart games so we can play darts before and after dinner. They have one of the largest on tap beer selections that I have seen. Service has always been fast. Normally 20 minute wait for dinner. Have had the chicken wings, potato skins and nachos. The loaded nachos are too much for one person to eat, but they do supply take hone containers for left overs

I've gone there a few times and there's always the same bartender named Kimberly working. I'm not sure if it's your practice to have your employees DRUNK while on the job, but she has been every time. I guess I wouldn't care so much but my order has been wrong every time as well. I would like to possibly come in, have a different bartender and get my order right!  

I have friends who are regulars and they personally know she's always drunk. Maybe you should keep a closer eye on your staff so not to lose customers. 

UPDATE: So apparently she has her daughter respond to the Yelp reviews. Is your daughter in charge?  Is she the owner?  Clearly she can't even use correct grammar. 


Little girl, I'm sorry to break it to you but it's all true. Your mother drinks on the job and EVERYONE knows it.

Very lackluster experience tonight. Our server was running around frantic the entire evening while there was only about 15 guests in the entire restaurant on this lovely Friday night. We had to remind her several times to bring items that we had asked for, including Waters. The fish fry refills we ordered were never put into the computer and therefore it took over 20 minutes to receive. My martini glass sat empty the entire night. I will not be returning, don't waste your money.

So my plans this past Saturday night turned to Option B when the bar my friend and I went to was at capacity... we didn't get tickets to the band we wanted to see in advance so we weren't let in.  Such a bummer!  Plan B was to see my friend's country band, though I'm not a fan of country music...I don't mind making a trip to see them from time to time.  I don't live in this area so it was a small trip out.
Saturday pm - cover was $7 to see the band.  There was plenty of room to sit in that area of the bar, the other bar was a little crowded, but not packed or anything.  The atmosphere here was actually pretty chill, totally my kind of place with that whole sports bar feel to it!  
It's always a bummer when bars don't have "specials" on Friday or Saturday...I get it, it's their money making nights over the weekend, but throw your patrons a bone, already.  This place DID have Saturday PM specials and we got ourselves these HUGE drafts of beer for $5 - made us very happy! There were other specials but I can't recall just because that beer special was pretty awesome.
There is outdoor seating here too, and they have a full menu which I have no idea about.  I would definitely come back here again, all was good in this place!

Been here three times. Twice on Saturdays and one time during the week. You do wait a long time for your food. But after the second time I knew it's because they want it perfect. Each time the wings are awesome and the pizza was good. If you like brown cheese tell them keep it in a bit longer. But I have had pizza, the southwestern burger and chicken and shrimp pasta. All three have been perfect. I don't mind the long wait as I did the first time. This is a perfect place for any sporting event and living across the street I hope this place stays open.

The gf and I met up with a long time companion here and it was five stars.

Came here a second time with coworkers and it was a different experience. 
Which has made me go down to 3 stars.

Pros:
great beer selection
food is good pub food.

Cons:
jukebox offline (both times) 
crappy music videos / DJ that kept playing stuff from 2000-2002.
service that was hit or miss all night.

I feel that this place is unsure of what kind of bar it wants to be.

I came here with some coworkers for some after work drinks on a Friday. It was pretty early, around 5 pm, and e place was still pretty empty. They had a $5 martini special. I ordered the 50 Shades martini which was super sweet and weak but delicious nonetheless. They had a pretty big beer selection and it was reasonably priced. We ordered a couple apps that were sup par. The nachos had a lot of toppings but they all fell to the bottom in a mushy mess. The appetizer platter seemed like freezer snacks thrown in the oven and on the plate. This seems like the kind of place to go to for the drinks not the food. Service was not very attentive.

Well, all I can say is we probably will not come back again. Poor wait staff, out of every beer we were interested in having and the food was not prepared correctly and cold. We should if realized when we walked in and a sign was posted help wanted  !! This could be a great neighbor restaurant but they need to get their stuff together. Smoking should not be allowed on the outside patio or within 15 feet of the entrance. Gross !! While we were there two other couples at tables near us got up and left....hello are you listening to what is happening to your restaurant.

First of all... Thanks to Gina for the tip on this place running out of things.  My wife and I were in the mood for wings.  The server mentioned that they were out of the bourbon sauce.  Bummer.  Gina - you called it.

Overall, if you're looking for a place to have beers or cocktails with friends, and don't care much about the food, then this place is just fine.  Go drink, enjoy your friends... no problem at all.  For that, I'd give the place 4 stars.

BUT... this is a restaurant and a bar... we went on a nice summer evening, but wouldn't sit outside because there were smokers out there.  Sorry... that's just a fact.  The food is just OK.  Not horrible, but not tremendous.  As others have stated, after  couple of years of being open, this place should be packed on a Friday evening on a beautiful summer evening.  Why not?  I'm guessing that the food is not scaring people off, but it's not brining them back over and over.

By the way, the wings were OK... good, but not a destination place for wings.

I think if they step up the food quality and overall service just a bit, they will be packed.

One more thing... making gambling available seems to be in vogue around here lately.  I'm not opposed to gambling, but it's not going to draw me into your place just for that.  If I want to gamble, I'll go to a boat.  Otherwise, just give me good food and service at a reasonable price, and I'll be back over and over.

Just received delivery from Fireside. The food is horrible! Not even edible. The only reason I gave them 1 star is because the mozzarella sticks were ok. Turkey Club is horrible. They don't use real turkey...it's slimy deli "meat." The bread was buttered and grilled like a grilled cheese sandwich. Who does that with a turkey club? We ordered chips and salsa. How can you mess that up? They were just awful. The chips tasted stale and the salsa wasn't edible. My girlfriend ordered the fish tacos. She had to eat it with a fork because the shell fell apart. The fish itself had good flavor...she just pushed everything else to the side and ate the fish by itself. The rice was flavorless and a waste. We spent over $50 for this food and I'm still hungry. UGH! Never will I eat from here again.

Overall, I would give this place 3.5 stars.  The service was great (Kimberly is super friendly!)  But the food is a downer.  I started with a half dozen oysters that were on special for $1.50.  To be honest, they didn't taste too fresh, and weren't shucked properly, having tiny fragments of shell on the meat. For the meal, I opted for the beer battered cod platter.  Maybe it's just me, but when I hear platter, I imagine huge portions. Not here though. There were 3 wimpy strips of cod, heavily battered, with a mediocre side of fries.  They came with cole slaw, which had a weird chemically-taste to it.  

If I had to give stars for the food alone, I would say 2.  But Kimberly saved the day with her service and attitude.

Absolutely awful. This is the second time I've been here and the first time was mediocre but not downright horrible like this time was. I will say that our waitress was a sweetie with great manners and a cheerful attitude, and she was attentive enough, so this has nothing to do with service for me. They have a really nice outdoor patio so on Sunday evening I chose this place thinking, even if the food isn't the best, it'll be decent and we can enjoy the patio. Well, I don't know if this place has recently just given up on life or what but literally everything was awful. It almost seemed like it had to be a joke or something, it was so bad. We were waiting for another person to join our trio so I ordered the spinach & artichoke dip in the meantime to have something to munch on right away. The chips were so stale they were chewy and the dip was clearly some packaged junk they microwaved and served lukewarm. Chips have to be laying around for QUITE a while to be that stale. How do you not know they're super old or serve them anyway? I couldn't believe it but hoped it was just that one thing. My husband and I split a BLT with tots and each ordered an additional soup. The chicken noodle soup had no noodles in it. Weird. My soup was tasty but definitely just something out of a can with a piece of mozzarella melted over the bowl. The BLT wasn't horrible but the bacon looked microwaved. It was flat as paper and looked like that pre-cooked stuff you throw in the microwave, or maybe it was just super cheap bacon, but the BLT was edible at least. The tater tots were under-cooked and barely even warm. They had that slight under-cooked potato crunch to them on the inside instead of being crunchy on the outside from being cooked properly. I forgot to mention that there were 4-5 people sitting at the bar and NO ONE else in the dining room when we got there, and this place is big. One other small family came and went in the dining room the whole time. Not only was this not a busy time but the place was completely dead and our food is microwaved and under-cooked? Why?!  You're tight on time in the kitchen? Have something better to do? Even during rush time the condition of this food would have been considered brutally terrible. Two of our people ordered burgers and fries, medium, and the burgers were a bit small and completely grey and dry. The one thing that was supposed to be cooked a little bit less was scorched to death. The fries were a bit soggy and barely warm. I don't know what's going on with the chef in this place, and I know you don't have much to work with since they're clearly buying pre-made, generic foods, but please actually COOK the food! Spinach dip is so easy to make. Why, on a dead Sunday evening, am I served microwaved, barely even warm, dip? Just make some! All the food was so bad it was actually bizarre. The patio looks really nice and it's such a shame that this place is not putting out any quality at all because I would eat here often during nice weather if the food was good. They also have huge screens on the walls with games on so it could be a really great spot to hang out for games in the winter as well, but they're serving trash. At least if I microwaved a dinner for myself at home, I'd be able to eat it hot. The majority of our food wasn't even edible. We paid $60 for two burgers & fries, one BLT & fries, 2 soups, spinach dip, 3 pops & a cocktail. If business is hurting so you're pinching on quality as a way to save money and hoping no one notices, it's having the exact opposite effect you want to achieve. When people experience something that bad they're NEVER going to come back. Great food will make people overlook a lot of other flaws but no matter how great the place is otherwise, bad food will kill it completely. This place has potential to be a cool spot because of everything else it has going for it but without at least decent food it's going to tank very quickly. This area has tons of restaurants and there's no reason to go here with quality like this. I hope for their own sake they invest in better quality food and a decent cook or they're going to be goners very soon.

Two stars is only based on getting a watered down Bulleit rye for $8.50 R u kidding me. I understand this is not a whiskey or bourbon. Cmon when I say on the rocks i didn't mean water ton of ice and a splash of Bulleit. How can you get such a simple drink wrong and charge me so much for it. I would pay the 8.50 if it was served properly see my pic of the drink and you tell me if it was worth it. 

Don't get me wrong my previous post is based on food and service and did give it 5 stars that has not changed. The waitress was very attentive and helpful. I would go back, just won't order drinks on the rocks..

So we had started out at another restaurant that was so disappointing we left before we even finished our drinks. This place turned our night around. I will say they were out of a few draft beers and some tables really needed clearing, but the food was great and the wait staff was really attentive. Overall, a good experience.
Chili was good.  Chef salad awesome.  Chicken tenders different but delicious.  Burgers good there too

Just a few tips for newbie servers...

Always greet your tables within 30 seconds of them being seated, check on them after their first two bites and make sure to write things down to avoid asking the same question 3+ times. 

I'm not posting this with the intentions of being negative or obnoxious, but genuinely trying to be helpful from years of experience in the restaurant industry. My food was cooked improperly and the wrong side accompanied my dish, but our server never checked on us so I ate it anyway. I enjoy coming here so I'm still giving three stars, but our service tonight was pretty weak. I'm sure some more mentorship or training would be beneficial. :)

Great place to watch The Stanley Cup Finals. Half price bottles of wine and half price pizza on Wednesday night.

I had the Italian Beef and Giardiniera pizza was amazing! 

The absolute best customer service here! Our wonderful server Courtney was way above the curve. Seriously I have been eating out for a long time and she is excellent!

It's a crap shoot here, good service, bad service, good food, bad food. I have been here a lot since they opened and it's never the same. The atmosphere is good but if you are hungry for dinner be prepared to wait. I have mostly come here in Friday's but I'm sure it's better when they aren't so busy. Ok came here tonight and things were worse. Been here an hour no food, slow service. I have given this place every opportunity over my visits, this is it- I will NOT be back!

Ok ok, it's time to update my review. I initially gave it three stars because I liked it, I now give it four because I have more visits under my belt and enjoy it. I stand by much of what I previously said: nice atmosphere, clean, Nate is great server, not much of a kids place, etc., read my previous review.
    I have tried something different each time I've gone-- I've gotten the brownie dessert: yummy! the chopped salad: red peppers are a great touch, the Caesar and buffalo chicken wraps as mentioned in my previous review: very good, the all-you-can-eat fish fry: good plus homemade chips, and most recently the traditional chicken wings with the dry Cajun rub on them: quite tasty and comes with either bleu cheese or ranch plus celery. I've also tried things the BF and his bro have ordered such as the tacos ($1 tacos on Tuesdays) and chili, which they enjoyed immensely. (I've posted pictures of most of this)
    I've also chatted with a bunch of the wait staff, hostesses, bartenders, bar backs, and even the chef-- they really are a nice bunch and seem to do their jobs well. Sometimes things get hectic and mistakes can happen or people can have an off day, but they seem to be a good bunch. 
    As I previously reviewed, it can be really loud sometimes, particularly on a game night or when they have a live DJ playing tunes, but that is to be expected. On a regular night the volume is average, so it's not always like that, hakuna matata. 
    New addition to my review: the bathrooms! I went in them for the first time a couple of visits ago and they are so nice, new, and clean! I was quite surprised because usually bar-ish sort of places have kinda meh bathrooms. 
    I stop here, go try it for yourself. I really did like that dry rub on the wings.... mmm... well done, chef.

Happened upon this place on a game night and WOW...it's loud!  When the Hawks scored a siren went off...everyone went nuts...  Fun.  I'm not a sports fan but it was fun and I can see that this would be a great place to watch a game with friends...friends you don't necessarily want to have a catch-every-word conversation with that night.

We had the fish fry and it was good.  More importantly...they have Three Floyd's Gumballhead.  HELLO!  LOVE that beer!  And if you don't...knock yourself out discovering your favorite amongst their endless taps.

Atmosphere was very nice and our server, Nate, was exceptional.  He obviously had tons of tables but he was on it!
This place is great! The service is excellent and the food is on point. I will be sure to revisit. If your looking for a quick bite or even a go to bar at night, this is the place!

Incredibly loud speakers. The Hawks playoff game is on, but the tv volume is so loud you can't even hear yourself think. 

The "DJ" has no idea how to use a mic. He just bellows into it, making everything simply painful to listen to. 

An order of jalapeño poppers took over 15 minutes to show up. How hard are jalapeño poppers?

We asked for our food to go. It's just too obnoxious to eat here. The atmosphere is oppressive.

$40 for a pizza that is reminiscent of the high school cafeteria, jalapeño poppers that may have simply been microwaved, and two beers. 

Do yourself a favor and give this place a miss.
Going back down... Stopped in here one night for drinks.  Sat down and we we waited about 20 minutes-- no service! We walked out.

I like the atmosphere and the food is pretty good. Great variety of appetizers and the ones I have had were excellent. Many, many choices on beer. The service is what kills this place. I have been here several times and each time the service has been awful. Once seated, it takes around 5-10 minutes to be greeted just to place a drink order. Once that order is placed it's another 5-10 minutes to get the drink. Then another long wait to place the food order. I have waited 40 minutes for my food on one occasion with the excuse that the kitchen was backed up. The place wasn't even busy. We did get comped an appetizer though. I want to like this place because it's close to home and the atmosphere is comfortable but the service is consistently bad and that's reason enough to keep me away.

Cool place for the neighborhood. Been here a couple times. The place has quite the space. Plus, the patio is a bonus for the summer time. Staff is friendly. I like the part that they have a DJ for the weekends. Big selection of draft beers. 40 of them :) they got dart games. That's my personal bonus. ;) the food is good enough as well.

I want to love this restaurant, I really do.  I go once every couple months hoping that things will have changed. Unfortunately, every time I leave I say, "I won't ever be back."  This time (after several years) I think I mean it. The roof was leaking next to our table. It was also leaking last time I was there several months ago. I would think that would have been fixed. The restaurant was far from busy on a week night but it took several minutes for someone to greet and seat us. The BBQ ribs are to die for (probably why I continue to give them chance after chance). The staff is slower than slow. They have plenty of time to sit around and chat with each other; but they are very inattentive to their guests. What should have been a quick dinner as they were not busy, took 1:45. No one checked back to fill drinks or see if we needed anything. We had to flag down someone to get our check. I won't be back and I mean it this time. This makes me sad as I enjoy frequenting a local restaurant.

We come almost every week. Usually good, but tonight was poor. The manager was obviously not in. Sat, but then had to be asked to be served. The 50 shades is usually awesome but the bar tender tonight was clueless. Wish this place could be more consistent.

Definitely a townie bar. Not for singles. Music is pretty lame; it's just a DJ playing a random mix of country, classic rock, and pop hits. Darts boards in the corner and multiple TV screens visible from every angle.

This place was recommended by some friends. First time was a great experience and the food was on point. The second time we ordered our usual "loaded nachos" and they weren't loaded at all. I was very disappointed! 

I hope they keep up with the consistency so when I return I can enjoy my usual! 

Other then that the atmosphere is great and they provide great service.

I've been here a handful of times already and my service is always great. I feel like their Burgers are their specialty. The apps were tasty, especially the mac n cheese bites, they're the best. It's a little loud, but a fun place. Prices were very reasonable. We'll be back.

I went there on a Saturday evening as a party of 6 after going to a rain-soaked fest in the area.   It's clean and open in the dining room and bar areas.  We arrived a little after 9 pm, so not a lot of others in the dining room areas.

The negatives were the fairly loud house music playing and it took a long time for the food to come.   We ordered apps and various types of wings and it took 45 minutes, with not much "competition" in terms of others ordering food-should have brought the apps out earlier.   

Other than that, it's pretty good bar food-wings are meaty and sauces are good-hot buffalo and parmesan garlic.   The nacho plate was decent-large, but not a lot of cheese, sour cream or guacamole (mostly wilted warm lettuce).  

They do have a large tap list of macro and craft brews and many daily drink and food specials.  I'd go back if in the area as the place has potential, for sure.

Their club sandwhich is amazing! Highly recommend. Pizza, not so much. Never thought I'd say this but too much cheese and way to greasy. Appetizers are all yummy. Love the decor and fireplace on the inside.

Like most everyone else super excited to see this place open and try it out. Very disappointed tonight to find out I couldn't try one of their beers before deciding to order. Then the waitress tells me I can order a flight and explains to me what a flight is. I've married a beer connoisseur. I know craft beer, I know flights, I'm a professional. 
Next, they say before it's even 7pm, they are out of the fish special for my husband.

Whenever a new restaurant opens, I REALLY want to like it. There are always some kinks to work out, so it will be interesting to see how it all pans out.

When I first walked in I was greeted, and we were seated right away. It wasn't busy at all (it was a Sunday evening). There are plenty of TV's scattered around so you can watch sports/whatever else is on. There is also a large bar that you can sit at. They have a decent selection of beers on draft and a few bottle at a fair price. My friend had been here once before and said that she had ordered a few things that she wasn't too impressed with (french onion soup, nachos, burger, pasta), but they had made a few changes since then so we gave it another try.

Their menu is kind of crumpled (maybe they don't have nicer ones yet since they are just starting out). They also don't have prices on their mixed drinks menu - I don't like that. You shouldn't have to hide your prices. They have normal bar food to choose- burgers, sandwiches, soups, salads, wraps, pizza, a few pastas, and wings. I wouldn't say there is a ton to choose from, but enough to find something you will like.

I ordered the Western Burger. To be honest, it wasn't the best. The meat was overcooked and seemed like it was a frozen patty at one point. The fries were thin and greasy, and pretty limp. We also ordered the mac & cheese bites, which needed some sort of sauce on it. Everything was pretty cheap, but the taste just wasn't there. Our waitress was good at first, but then it felt like we waited forever for our check (and like I said...it wasn't busy). 

I hope they can make some improvements so that they will stick around, but so far I wouldn't go back.
Place is slow at bringing out food.... food was average.... think i could have made better at home.  pays more attention to clients at the bar which obviously where the money is made.

With so many options in the area I would have thought this place would be better. The pros, nice interior, the con's, food was horrible and the service was worse, even got attitude from the owner when I asked if he was turning the Hawks game on. Sorry for asking but the game is starting now, I see you are having fun playing DJ and all....

Back to the service, we sat at a table for 15 minutes before a server even approached us, manager even walked past us and didn't even acknowledge are lack of drinks. Its their job to monitor the dining room, they couldn't even get that right. 

I know when you walk into a bar the food can be iffy, but this place doesn't even come close to decent food. 

I won't be back, far too many other great places in the area.

This was really good place to go for a late Friday dinner. We ordered a plate of baked potato skins which was OK, along with all-you-can-eat Fish and chips (Only fish is all you can eat), since we came only before 20 mins before the kitchen closed we just got a refill once (so that was 3 + 2 pieces). They have specials here everyday of the week, so be aware of what they are. The staff was really friendly and helpful. We did order a couple of drinks to go with our food.  There were a few veggie options too, so couple of other friends were also very happy to order a sandwich and a wrap. We ordered the chocolate cake for dessert, which was nothing fancy.

Most noticeable here was: They had huge projection screens and projectors all around showing some game or other, which was really really cool. I can definitely see myself going here sometime in the future.

Man has this place gone to shit!!! Never actually was a good place to begin with. Only reason i gave it two stars was because the food is alright. Dont waste your time here just go farther down the road to thortons gas station and get a slim jim.

Decent food and service on a random Wednesday night. Really disappointed with the smoking being allowed in the outdoor seating area.  Even a cigar smoker. Everytime the door open we got an unhealthy waft of cigar smoke in the bar area.  Must be desperate for business to not follow the law. Maybe a health department fine or worker complaint will wake them up.
Good place to grab food or have  drink, they have specials for the drinks couple of times a week . the food its decent too.

After now being open for a few years you would think they had time to work the kinks out but this does not seem to be the case. The pizza and appetizers are pretty good and are always hot. However they always seem to be running out of things. The last time I went they were out of wings, today they ran out of champagne as well as Bud Light. Bud Light is a prettttty common beer that you should always keep stocked. They do not seem to be prepared very well. The service is also very mediocre, especially when the place is not busy they should be more attentive.

I really wanted to like this place because it is so close to home. It is clean and nice decor as other reviews stated, but service was painfully slow, music was too loud not to mention the music selection was ridiculous. My husband loved his burger so I gave an extra star.
Great to have a neighborhood bar with decent food and decent prices. Fireside hot wing sauce is very good. I enjoyed it on the wings the Buffalo chicken pizza and the buffalo chicken wrap.

Unreal!!!!   Walked in at 5:30 for dinner. They asked if we were staying for the Hawks game.  We said we were, the hostess walked away, came back and said they didn't have any seats available, they were 95% full, HELLO....WE ARE THE OTHER 5%!!!  Would not seat us.  Will not be back ever and will spread the word about this horrible experience and lack of professionalism.

I wonder if we picked the wrong time to check out this place.   

1. We were seated, but after 20 min. our friend had to ask if we could get some service.  The manager brought us a waiter, and we thought everything would be good now.  Not so much.

2. Food was terrible.   I ordered a chicken Caesar wrap, and the fries were stone cold and limp.  The chicken in the wrap was burnt to a chicken jerky consistency,  but some how they thought to serve it.  I never usually send food back, but it was inedible.  

3. My friends ordered the 2 for 25, and it comes with an appetizer, soup or salad,  and your choice of a shared or individual entree.  They brought the entrees first, appetizers second,  and we had to ask where the soups were.  What sort of orded is that.  At least the ribs they ordered were tasty.  

This was my first, and last time coming here.  If I want a place to watch the game and grab a bite... I would recommend anywhere else.   

I can comment that they put out a buffet at half time.  Our waiter never let us know that either.   

I hope they figure out their service and food soon.  Nice overall ambiance, and this place was closed for at least a year before this place took over the location.
This is a great place to hang out with friends. They have a huge selection of beers and liquor.
Dig this place, great beers, great grub, and great service. Just kind of shocked at some of the crybabies out there complaining it's too loud. If you want quiet time, stay home!!

The stars are for the beer selection and the atmosphere. Great beer list (draft and bottles) and the people are very friendly. It never seems to be too busy which is right up my alley. Really just a good place to catch a game. The food is two stars at best and seems to have gotten worse. I've had everything from fish tacos to steal sandwiches and I wouldn't really recommend any of them. The wings are good if you are only paying 50 cents on Saturdays but I would stick to drinking here. I will continue to go for the beer and proximity to family and friends.

Well - the fried pickles were good.  The cook must be off their game tonight, because the food was pretty terrible. The waitress was nice and friendly.  The chicken tenders (a signature dish?) were so burnt that we couldn't eat them.  The burger lacked any seasoning, but was cooked just how I asked for it.  Atmosphere seems nice, but the food was just a huge disappointment.

The food is really good, but the service/kitchen is SLOOOOOW. A great place to have some drinks and food if you're not in a time crunch, but not recommended if you're on a schedule. We've been here a few times. The most recent time was a Monday night. The dining room wasn't busy. We ordered our food and more and it took 30+ minutes to get chicken wings, shrimp, burger and a sandwich (all of which was great!). Nothing that should have taken that long to get our food. It would have been ok if we had been kept updated on the progress, but that didn't happen and the wait staff should be more knowledgeable about the menu. I'm hoping they improve because this is a place my husband and I would frequent for their food and their beer selection.

Fireside is really good I usually go every other Friday .i get the fish and it is awesome . My daughter gets the New York strip and the tator tots and she loves the Sause that comes with it . There is this guy named Brian that is so nice and funny .   It is reasonable. I know every time I go there I will have a awesome time. I like how when there is a commercial that there is music and u don't have to sit through all the boring commercials . Brian the DJ always goes out of his way to make us fell welcome.

Its not a bad place to go to if you just want to grab a beer and watch a game. I would never order food there again. It took over an hour for an appetizer when it was completely dead in there. Also, after they brought out the appetizer an hour later, it was cold. I like the layout and everything but I would only go there to grab a drink

So I am not really sure how to word this.  I WANT to give them a higher rating, but their service really, REALLY needs to get better.  There are only one or two servers worth their time at this place.

Long story short, after a looooooong wait (45 minutes after being seated) without even being given WATER, my friends and I walked out.  The manager, Melissa, was made aware of the situation, asked me for my address so she could send my friends and I something and this hasn't happened.  It's been a couple months.  So I don't think that's ever going to happen.  

So I haven't been there as often as I would have liked since they really need to step up their game...

We came here Friday night. Food and service was great, even though they were busy. 

Came here this afternoon again. They're not too busy. Service. Was. Terrible. I'll think twice about coming here again.
Bad service. Couldn't get drinks. Asked over four times before water was even delivered. Bad service :(
The good is great here, the staff how's out it's way to make sure you're comfortable, drinks are cheap, plus they melt added a dance floor.  Late night spot, pottery low key.
the food is pretty good....the service is great too......BUT THE KITCHEN.........is OH SO SLOW....like WOW slow....to bad they cant get a grip on that

We went there for the Hawks game today,  let's just say we won't be back. 
The place is very clean and have a lot of screens to watch your favorite Chicago sport.
But I will say they have a GREAT beer selection !
We had maybe 20 people,  got there early and our table was reserved. 
So here are my complaints. 
3 of us got the wrong food
A friend got chicken alfredo and had a puddle of oil on the bottom. 
My wife ordered a beer, 30 mins later,  still never got it
They added gratuity to each of our bills
Never got any ice in our water cups
Staff was not friendly. 
So if you want to go there for a beer and some basic bar food,  it is not bad.
Overall i say stay away from this place !

The bruschetta and corn chowder were awesome. We also got a burger: also good. Pretty classic flavor. The ribs were ok, not all that special. 
Came back and had the chili and sweet potato fries. The chili was great and the sweet potato fries were just the right kind of crispy. Would totally come here again. :)

I was invited to check this place out , very impressed with the new set up ! Patio looks amazing and the inside looks trendy ! Makes you wanna dress casual and bring a date ! Gotta check out the specials ! Food is good !

A nice looking place, good service, and great appetizers with ok entree.s

It's a sports bar, let's be honest, don't go here for non-bar food.

I was there on a Monday, the outside sign said 15% off entire bill, maybe it meant just drinks? Not sure but they didn't give me 15% off, no big I had a $10 off 50 coupon.  What was odd was they offered us 6.99 build a burgers.  It wasn't on the specials either.  Very confused but I asked what are they known for and the waitress said burgers and fish.  I decided to go with the burger since it was on sale. I got one medium w/ bacon, grilled onions, egg, and pepper jack cheese. I asked to sub grilled onions in for my tomato, but got charged 99 cents for it any how. I also got the pretzel roll and subbed waffle fries another 99 cents.  They really know how to add on little charges.  The bun was a lot harder and tougher to eat through than I expected, more like a french roll density and toughness.   The burger was cooked perfectly to medium. Though the fried egg was cooked through, I wish it was runny, they did not ask how I wanted it but I've never been served a fully cooked egg before on a burger.

The appetizer tray was where it was at!  We got the 20 dollar sampler, at first I was like really 20 bucks?!  But it was well worth it.  They had some wings, corn fritters, fried mac and cheese, cheese sticks, fried green beans, and onion rings.  Everything was excellent, crispy and tasty!  The only thing was the onion rings, on their menu they say they are so good they can't say more about it (not sure exact wording) but basically they were just typical beer battered onion rings.  So not really special. But everything else was great.

The waffle fries I upgraded to were limp and not crispy nor seasoned.

Service was good.  Wish they would have dropped by a lot sooner after serving our food, I would have actually said something about my food not being that great.

Place is big and spacious, almost like there is not enough tables to fill the place.  TV's everywhere. wish they had closed captioning on it.
