We have been here twice and the food is very good. I was very pleased with the chicken wings and the sauce had good flavor. Today I had a burger and it was cooked just the way I ordered, it had good flavor and the bun was unique and delicious.

Here is what I would change:
The service was great on Friday night but today it sucked! Had to go in to get drink refills and the waitress was not very responsive. If not for the taste of the food I would have given them a 1-2 star review. The ranch dressing is home made but very runny. It tastes good but makes eating wings / salad a bigger mess than it needs to be. The last change I would make would be to put the nachos on a plate rather than in a bowl. You get the toppings all over the table and it just does not make you feel good about ordering them even though they are great. I am just worried this place won't last with bad service from some and I want to stress some of the wait staff.

Let me say one thing... The music is so LOUD but it is very good!!! The waitress and the service was pretty good. She seemed friendly and very helpful. The food is pretty good but it also has a bar that has a lot of selections of drinks. If you are looking for live entertainment and without breaking the bank this is the place for you. But if you are looking to have a decent conversation at a restaurant I wouldn't recommend this place. But overall everything was fabulous.

The Fireside Alehouse is close to my house so I had high hopes.  My wife and I just got back from lunch there and, unfortunately, were quite disappointed.

We each had a burger and fries.  I had the bacon cheeseburger medium.  My wife had a burger medium well.  There was no difference in they way they were cooked.  Both were fairly dry.  Item number 1 that I have to call BS on is that they claim their burgers are fresh and never frozen.  We took a look at my wife's burger patty since she had nothing on it.  It looked and tasted exactly like frozen burgers at many different places.  Biting in to it you can see that it has a lot of filler in it too.  My second BS call is that their fries are 'fresh cut'.  I'm pretty sure I've gotten these same fries from the freezer section at Jewel!  Burger and fries were $9.99.

On the positive side, they do have a good beer selection, although it seems a bit pricey.  They server their draft beer in a narrow tall glass that makes it appear you are getting more than it looks like.  I'm sure they aren't a full pint.  They may be 12 ounces.  For that it costs from $5 and up.

Finally, the wait staff.  They spent more time hiding in the back than they spent waiting on customers.  I met my wife there for lunch since she had to work.  It took 25 minutes to get the mac and cheese appetizers to the table.  They seemed to be frozen and just had to be dropped into the fryer.  Once my wife got there, I had to go hunt down our waitress so we could get our order in since she had to go back to work.  I mean my wife had to go back to work.  I'm not sure what our waitress did, but it wasn't work!

All in all, it wasn't completely horrible, just bad.  If we go back, we'll sit at the bar and we won't eat there.

I'm only giving this a five star because of the exceptional service from my server Brittany. I must say her attentiveness was not only well noted but very on point, so knowledgeable with all the whole food menu! if you go literally ask for her she knows her stuff and is amazingly pleasant to have as a server. Will be back
Unacceptably long to get our food. Should have walked out but took the food to go. 40 minutes and no food. Not happy.
Terrible service.  Food quality poor.  Pass this place up.  This place is always understaffed.  Don't go here if you are in a hurry.

They have a large variety of beer and the service was friendly, if somewhat slow. The main reason for this low score is that the food is pretty bad. I had a grilled cheese sandwich that consisted mostly of bread. My wife had the breaded chicken sandwich, which was overdone and dry. 

This place was worth a try as something different than our usual hangouts, but we won't be returning.
Fun friendly bartenders especially Jamie. I would say don't believe the haters this place is still in the opening process. If you live close come by. The tvs are nice and the drinks are stiff.

Nice neighborhood place. We had the loaded nachos. They where pretty good; homemade  chips made it. Drink specials on a Friday night was a nice add on. $5 Martinis where good. I had a lemon drop and Cosmo. Lemon drop was better. The Fireside Italian beef was very tender and tasty. Order it with cheese, its a  generous topping. I had the chopped salad. It was a great size and had to bring half home. The blue  cheese dressing could have had a chuck or two & sorta tasted like ranch. I'd order a different dressing next time. Service was good and friendly. Over all we'll be back and we'll recommend it to the neighbors

This is a great spot to watch any sporting event. Lots of TVs. Can view the game from any area of the bar. Food is good too. Only drawback is..... I'm trying to enjoy the Blackhawks game and the guy behind the DJ booth (not the DJ) thinks it's fun for the crowd to hear him commentate on top of the REAL commentators at the game. It's really annoying. And no one in the bar wants to hear him. We're here to watch and listen to the game and not him. Please stop Mister with the microphone with the mustache. He also told us he wants a martini. DILLIGAF? ... But all in all. It's a great sports bar. :)

Also... They are extremely premature on the hawks goal buzzer. Any time they get close to the net. They sound the alarm. Awful. Just awful. Let the tv network do the work. They get paid more and there is a reason.

1/2 *  The only place I know that serves 12 oz pints of beer.  this place pours their beers with 3/4 inch head into a 14.5 oz glass and insist they are pouring 16 oz beers.  Their obvious intent is to rip off its clientele.  When we brought this up to the co-owner he denied it and made it clear we were not welcome.   I wouldn't  recommend this place to my worst of enemies.

Review 1. Beer selection is very good but our server knew nothing about the beers.  Was here to watch a Hawks game and the sub-woofer is set so loud that you can not talk to your friends. TURN THE BASS DOWN!

DJ and a Hockey game?

Review 2.  Was there on a Friday after work and they only had 1/3 of the tap beers and less than 1/2 the beers in cans/bottles. The name of this place is an "ALE HOUSE"; I guess Miller is an ale.  :(

Came here with a friend on a kid-free friday night after work and this place is ok. She is a regular here but this was my first time here. If you are a drinker the selection is pretty good but since I am not it is just another loud sports bar kind of place. Nothing in the place really sets it apart from any of the other places I have been to but there was nothing really wrong with it either.  The place is a little drafty and loud. Not much different than when it was 50 North a few years back.

This place needs to decide if they want to be a sports bar or a Euro disco dance.  Complete disconnect between the loud club music, laser light show, and fog machine.  The management needs to recognize their bar is set setup as a great place to watch a game, or have a beer and burger with your team after a late night hockey or softball game.   Their attempt to bring in a larger Bro crowd makes it unappealing despite the good food, good services and good beer.  Won't be back late night.  During the day perhaps.
Great location - great (friendly) service - great food - and most importantly, great drinks!!! Definitely, a place to check out - I will definitely be back!

Absolutely wonderful staff, and great beer selection. Food was fantastic and the chicken tenders are a must along with the pizza here. We came in on a Wednesday and were pleasantly surprised to see karaoke here. The host was beyond funny and by far the best kj we've seen. I seriously recommend this place highly.

Service service service. Service is everything. And when it's nothing, then there's not a reason for me to come back and spend money. 

I've said it before and I'll say it again, if a place wants to make money then it needs to earn it. My experience tonight was less than worthy. From me waiting a half hour for a burger. Then to wait another 10 minutes for silverware is ridiculous. And to the table that left a half hour ago that is still not clear. To the lack of a hostess on a Saturday night and the craziness that I have to ask for a menu.... to say that I'm not impressed is an understatement. My server, a guy who I don't think said his name seems clearly not trained properly. 

Now
 to the food. I had the fireside ale house special burger or something like that. It's a decent sized burger I must say. But I asked for medium. It was borderline well. No juices left. But at least a decent portion. The ham on it was pointless because it gave no flavor. Could've been the choice of ham.  And to the cooks, I'm sorry but you just don't put the burger ON the lettuce and tomato.  The burger always goes on top of the bottom bun. Onto the bbq sauce. First bite I didn't taste it. Which was weird since there was about 3 times the amount I needed for this burger. But once I did, it was different and not something I've had before. Very thin and vinegar-ish. Which was good. But it needs to be multiplied with the sauce. It wasn't powerful enough to compliment the burger but was good on its own. 

All in all I think this place has potential. Which I've read on other reviews as well. So I'll come back. Not sure how soon. 


PS the food is missing the beer aspect. This place has "ale" in its name. Just a thought

We go to watch the hockey game and the waitress was horrible she forgot to put our order in to their system.  We planned on only going for the  1st period for food and drinks and be home before the 2nd period but our waitress never even put our food order in. I do love the corn nuggets so we keep going here but food is sub par and service is hit or miss. The decor is nice and a cute outdoor area and drinks are decent.

Stopped for a late dinner one Saturday night. Nice atmosphere, especially if you enjoy sports. Wasn't busy but service was pretty slow. I saw our drinks sitting at the bar station for a good ten minutes. Not sure where our waitress drifted off to. But food was actually quite good and the guy who brought our food out was super nice as was the guy who cleared our plates. Maybe our waitress was having a rough night. Would definitely go again and give it another chance.

When I first moved to the area about a year ago I would frequent Fireside almost weekly. It had great service, some decent food, and always had the Hawks games. My last 3visits were less than satisfactory to say the least. Of the last 5 food items ordered 4 out of the 5 of the items ordered were wrong. The wait time for drinks was about 15 minutes with the floor at about 25% capacity. The waiter then went on how they were short staffed and he was the only one serving. He then spilled my drink on the table which spilled onto my lap. He also spilled my food order while serving it. The bartender did not know how to make a simple whiskey mixed drink. The service was bad and I didn't intend to write a review but I saw a group of ladies so upset about getting the wrong food order, waiting longer for their food than us and we were seated after them, and messed up their drink order and enraged the group so much that they asked for a manager due to the poor overall service. 

Oh, and the last time I visited after 11 there was a fight that broke out in the bar area. This place has declined significantly in a short amount of time.

We've been waiting for Fireside to open since September, 2013. Overall experience was good. We've been twice, once on a Friday night, late January, once for lunch on a Saturday, February. Foods ordered: pulled pork sandwich, hamburger, pizza, fish and chips, buffalo chicken tenders, pretzel nuggets. All pretty good. Beer menu is fantastic. If you like micro brews, this place is for you. Nice to have a place close by where you can get something other than Miller, Bud, and Sam Adams on tap. Just remember craft beer costs more! 

Service was good both times. Kind of slow for dinner, but they had only been open for a month at that time. Staff was friendly, tables, benches, and bathrooms were clean. Lots of televisions above the bar. Two projection screens in the dinning area. Good place to watch sports. Loud on Friday night, quiet Saturday afternoon.

They need to get a menu on line and laminate the menus they have in the restaurant. We'll give them a chance, we like to support local business!

Went here with my husband for a quick dinner while our son was at a party. Our quick dinner was not so quick. After getting seated, we waited 5-10 minutes before a server approached us. Upon coming to our table, he asked if anyone had been to our table yet, I replied no and he said he would be our server then. He took our drink order, we asked if there were specials, he said just the fish fry. On the drink menu one of the specialty drinks was an American Mule, but they were out of the Ginger Beer, essential in making any mule drink. We noticed a special sign at the hostess stand that said oysters were $1.50 each, when looking at the menu, we discovered that was regular price ($9 for 1/2 dozen), no "special" there. We waited another 15 minutes to get our drinks and order. I got the fish fry with the homemade potato chips and my husband ordered the Fireside Signature Burger, medium rare with the homemade potato chips. While we waited for our food, my husband reordered his drink, it never arrived. After 20 minutes waiting, he finally just went to the bar and got a beer. We waited a total of 45 minutes to get our food. My fish was good, but I received the steak fries instead of the chips and the tartar sauce was warm. My husbands burger was grey throughout (a far cry from medium rare) an the bun was rock hard, as if it sat under the heat lamp for quite some time. He also received steak fries, that were sitting a while too. The food had potential, but there was clearly a staffing and management problem. We were not told there were slow wait times for food until the server brought our food.

Friday night dinner with my girlfriend and my parents.  Overall good experience.   Good beer selection, even had Stella cider! Huge TVs and changed the channel to watch the opening ceremonies of the Olympics, until the Hawks game.

Kitchen was backed up a bit and our waitress was new and still learning the ropes but was nice and willing to find out the answers to our questions. Food was good, homemade chips and fries.  Would go there again.

$6.99 build a burger Monday night special is a super value. Meat was fresh and cooked to order and topping selection was really good. Had bacon and blue cheese which were both better than expected for burger toppings. Sweet potato fries were the bomb!

this place is great, the beer selection is always on point offering a great variety of crafts that consistently change. the atmosphere is remarkably comfortable adding an amazing touch with the stone glass fireplace. the staff and owner are very hospitable making the experience here even that much better. i personally have only been able to order off the late night menu that offers some good finger food for the bar crowd and it never disappoints. all in all this is a great place to catch a game with some friends or just hang out.

Very disappointed with the price switch during a Blackhawks game.  $3.00 23oz Coors Light draft before the game.  $6.00 during the game.  WTF?  I thought Illinois required an establishment to charge the same price for the whole day.  Very unethical.  You have lost my business.

My girlfriend and I went at the grand re-opening of the newly relocated Coach House and had a blast! They did a great job with the renovations  which includes a nice big bar, huge dance floor w/ DJ, separate room with pool table/darts, and a private area for bottle service. The new place is beautiful!! We tried a couple of food items from their menu and everything was delish...loved the broccoli bites! Drinks were well made and delivered quickly by friendly and attentive bartenders. 

The best thing about Coach House is the friendliness of the entire staff...from the doormen to the bartenders. This is what sets them apart from other bars/clubs. Everyone is so welcoming and makes you feel at home! The owner, Jimmy, is always there to say hello. A special shout out to Tom, Nick, Tommy F., Meghan, and Monika. It's apparent that the staff is like family, and they extend that feeling on to their guests. :) 
Wishing you much success in your new location!

The bartenders refused to give us water, unless we paid. We were drinking there for several hours and they couldn't even pour us some water so we could be responsible adults? 
That's a recipe for disaster.
Place is extremely nice, layout is awesome. Music from the juke box is awesome. Bouncers are cool and they do a great job keeping people in check male and female.
Worst server from a male bartender.... extremely rude... almost disgusted with this place. Very dead on the Friday night I attended, hope bartender gets fired from horrible service.

Gross.

It's great if you're a raging alcoholic that still likes house music, or if you're just an overall douchebag. Otherwise avoid at all costs.

Terrible. The first thing is the way the bouncer looked so long at me and my friend ID. Second the drink was way watered down. $6 for a cranberry juice pretty much. Third the music played was 10 to 20 years old. Was there 10 minutes and left. There has to be a better nightlife than this in Schaumburg.

Place is a dump when it comes to being a dive bar. All the bouncers are douche bags. Drinks are weak prices blow avoid this place unless you are that desperate for a drink. Service sucks prices suck overall this place blows

I'm not sad this place closed. They tried to charge cover at 1 in the morning when there were maybe 15 people there. 

My entire group left instead of paying. So you tried to shake me down instead of being smart enough to understand that we would have easily spent 5x more than cover in alcohol. 

Management here must have been garbage. 

Another time they wouldn't let me in for wearing sandals...mind you this was in the Summer. The owners clearly let the staff run this place into the ground. 

I'm glad it went out of business.  Sandal karma is a b

Place is ok. We went to drink night club and decided to come here after since it's open till 4. To begin with the bouncer at the door was rude to one of our male friends right when we walked in. Bartenders were good and got is our drinks pretty fast. Drinks seemed pretty watered down. Dj was horrible. & you have to pay to get in. Next time I'll probably just stay down the street at Drink till they close and go home. This place isint worth it. & there's not a big parking lot so if you don't get there before 2 you probably have to park across the street in a different lot.

Only been here once and don't think I am going back anytime soon, so I might as well do the review now...
Was here between 1am and 3am one night last week.  I was in a group of about 35 coworkers who were looking for a late-night bar to hang out in.  This one qualified, only because they were open until 4.

It seemed pretty crowded for a Thursday night.  Quite a few people were dancing, and probably the majority of them from our group.  Because we arrived around the same time (all in cabs) I am sure the regular patrons wondered where we were all coming from.  That's probably good, because I am sure we were all wondering where the locals were all coming from.  I guess this is a typical scene for this clientele, heavily tattooed, young, drunk and looking for either a one night stand or a fight.  Regardless, besides the few who were getting a rough handle from one of the bouncers, everyone seemed to be having a good time.

It was dark, and there was a bad smell that seemed to emanate from around where the front door was.  Also, everything just felt dirty.  I tried not to touch too much.  The $5 cover kind of surprised me, as the place was virtually a hole in the wall next to the highway.  Whatever.  I wasn't there to pickup chicks, but still had to pay. Ladies got in free.

We all made it back to our hotel alive that night, and even though I was not there to witness it, some of our group actually stayed until 4.  Of course, they had a tough time the next morning!
All in all, it is an OK place if you are looking to go somewhere after you have exhausted ALL of your other possibilities.

I went in to coach house on an off night and the bouncers tried to steal my credit card so I had to call the police, do not go here unless you have a gift card that they can't steal. All the workers here are criminals. 0 out of 5 stars

The Coach House is a place I can say I have gone to and will not go to again. $5.00 cover, not sure for what. To cover the cost of all the bouncers? Seriously, this place  had lots of bouncers, all rather large, kinda perched in points surrounding the dance floor. Trouble here often? Hmm. Bounce staff not concerned with the creeper in the corner with his hands in his pants ogling couples dancing. 

Bar and wait staff were friendly eager to please. 

Crowd was odd. Like, wear a flannel shirt, Ed Hardy or suit. Lots of very young looking people here. 

The dance floor was never hopping. The attached open smoking room made the rest of the place ice cold, even when it was slightly more crowded.

There are much better places to be between 2 - 4AM.

Another bar that only gives bottled water. If a patron is really hammered why wouldn't you help them out and give them a tiny cup of water? The 53 year old men behind the counter are too busy lookin for tips rather than helping out their customers. As everyone knows, you come to Roach House after a night and when you are hammered. They should be more considerate for their customers. I am very disappointed. Get cups of water and younger bartenders!!!! Be nice!!!! Everyone comes here late at night, invite us in!!!!!

It looks a little rinky dink. But I guess the dance floor makes up. It's a pretty big dance area with very huge flat or projection screen. I like that they serve pizzas for patrons who would like a slice, I dislike that the pizza is left on a warmer thing. Looks very institutional cafeteria-ish.

I can say this is a good place for dancing, and probably a great place to show movies and eat. I just never had the food there, because I came here for the after party. Drinks and dancing.

I'm not sure what all the negative reviews are for. The booze is CHEAP. The cover isn't outrageous all things considered. the DJ's are decent. 
Right now you are wondering why this is 5 stars...it's open until 4am! C'mon. I hear tons of shit about Coach House and yet everyone ends up going there. It is open until 4am when every other place is open until 1 or 2. 
The place is clean and the bouncers boot the riff raff. Tommy has been there forever and is a riot and Cammy is a truly delightful woman as well. (there are 4 or 5 other bartenders who also treat you right every...single time.) 
If you are out and hate the idea of going home before 2am....Coach House is king. 
P.S. there are TONS of cabs there all the time so don't drink and drive.

There's a reason this place is nicknamed "roachhouse." It's a notoriously scummy bar for the wasted who just don't want to end their night yet- it's one of the only places nearby open until 4 am EVERY night.

They deserve props for the food and acceptable service tho. The bartenders are excellent performers when the mood strikes and their half pound burgers are great!

The late night crowd doesn't show till midnight or later, when decent bars kick the sloppy ones out. There's dancing, a DJ and a decent sized floor inside lined with large booths. Outside is nice too, with a covered bar and some tables to escape the blaring music.

The downfall of this place is the crowd. If you were wasted but energized enough to close down Coachhouse, you defiantly had an epic night and probably wouldn't mind the crowd anyway.

WARNING: Sex on the sink, bartenders who don't give a fuck- especially if you're a shitty tipper- and big bouncers who are unfazed by sex in the bathroom or pukers out front is the norm.

The only thing good about this place is the one bartender Jason. The bouncers suck. I've seen them kick out people who weren't causing any trouble and not do anything about the assholes and creeps lurking around.

So a friend and I mosied on over to Coach House, after not seeing other for almost seven months. We grabbed a couple drinks here, as it was early, and there was no dance floor or DJ action at 11pm. Apparently they have a DJ quite frequently, and the place stays open till 3/4am according to the bartender.

Pros:

+ Very friendly bartender, she was quite willing to shoot the breeze with us
+ Stiff drinks, the Tequila Sunrise had some kick in it

Cons:

- The decor is fairly bland, an odd mix of dance floor club with more traditional bar area that is split in two sections, then a third which is further segregated from the first two, funky layout

Can't really comment on the dancing/music action, as we arrived too early. Overall, what we did experience, was okay, if nothing spectacular.

It's T-Shirt Time!  Ronnie's at the club hooking up with grenades and land mines!

This place is Jersey Shore meets Addison meets rough. It's a contest to see whose Affliction shirt was tighter than the next guys'.  I felt out of place in a polo shirt, so if you go here, get some Ed Hardy or Affliction.  

Spray tans required.

Drinks are kind of pricey and there is actually a cover at a suburban bar.

The only reason this place has 3 stars is b/c the staff there is good.  The bartender was doing tricks to keep people entertained.  Also, some of the girls were kind of cute I guess.?.  But, not my type, b/c they like being at this place.

This place sucks.  Be back soon.

Ahh...Roach House..I mean Coach House..

I've had some pretty wild nights here myself..but I tend to steer clear of this place with all the riff raff that dwell here.

I mean, the music is good, the bartenders are all super nice and really take care of you, but they need to clean it ever 3 years or something..because I swear I saw a cockroach stand up on the bar and do the Walter Brennan dance..

ANYWAY! 

This place is actually pretty nice to come here in the summer they have this huge double door that they open up that leads to the deck on the side of the bar. Nice fresh air (depending on the amount of people smoking outside) blows throughout the place. They have a huge full bar outside and they usually set up Bags for people to play. The dance floor is inside the place but that never stopped us from making our own outside! 

The drinks are relatively cheap for being a nightclub, so that's always a plus. And I have to agree with Katrina, I wouldn't eat here if I were you..eat before you come if your that hungry! ENJOY! :)~

This place sucks. One star is too much for this dirty place! They told my boyfriend to take off this hat cuz there was no hats tonight. Ok what? What's that supposed to mean? We asked why and the security guy got pissed we questioned it and told us to take the hat to the car or we all can't come in. Did he think my boyfriend was in a gang ? Once we got in we went to the bar got a drink and headed to the dance floor. The waitress finally came over and asked us what drinks we wantedak got all our orders but walked away before my other friends could order? Jersey shore scum and a mix or creepers and old guys and horrible waitresses... Never again

I don't know whats with the other reviews, but the place tries to be upscale but from what i've heard it's an after-hours dive bar. They have valet parking like they're trying to be upscale and also have a "dress code" that they randomly support. Despite the fact that my friends and I are clean cut well dressed citizens, we were denied because one of us was wearing a white shirt, yet they let other men go in with nearly the same clothes we were in.

Perhaps they just don't like guys that aren't yuppies or douches. or they didn't like the fact that I'm a white guy with dreadlocks. If you want to go to a place that obviously picks it's patrons then go right ahead. The way i look at it is that i saved myself a hundred or two that i can spend at an establishment that values their customers, not shun them away because they prefer a relaxed look.

Maybe i'll go there in my  suit, see if they deny me then.
Throwing out pregnant woman? Boo.

They kicked a pregnant woman out, when she was only drinking water and eating pizza.  Wouldn't listen to her or her friends, just kicked her out.  STOOPID.

http://abcnews.go.com/US/pregnant-lady-turned-illinois-bar/story?id=12600511
Late nite afterhours place. Nice deck. Dark interior like a pick up bar should be...great staff.....show up feeling good you'll be fine...show up sober, you'll hate it....

Hey Malakes this is the top of top for what they do!

Since Jimmy took this place over several years back, every year has been a HUGE improvement and the place looks and tastes delicious! 

Trust me back when I wouldn't have stepped foot in here. But now its a whole new world in there and outside. 

Just look at the place, they care, they are there and they give you a huge value. 

The ladies are hot, the drinks are generous and the food is SHOCKINGLY good. 

It's a bar people - just a nice little bar where you can dance and have fun with your friends. Take it for what it's worth and go out and have a drink. Life if good
1 star is to generous for this place. Its garbage. Don't go there.
Serving food and booze til 4am in the suburbs.  Does it really matter beyond that?  You know it doesn't if you have been to the burbs.
Like I said,the best nights are Mondays to pick up some chronic from JS,stay for the ladies he brings in.Hell set you up with a cold beer 2

I think this is the last surviving dancing place in the area.
Parking is too small for the large crowds after midnight.
Drink prices are average and service is great.
Nice remodeled patio with patio bar.
Location is next to Roselle ,but  not IN Roselle, I think property is in unincorporated Cook County.

Wow, people eat here??   Sorry Tommy, but I wouldnt.   This place has been a late night bar for a long time.  I will save all the stories for some other time, but let me repeat, I definitely would not eat here.  

So my review is strictly based on countless drunken visits when all other bars are closed and Dakota's is too far.   I like the patio during the warm months.  The valet is nice, because the parking lot can be jammed.  Drinks are good, selection is decent.  The bathrooms are better now, don't make me elaborate on that, they're better now.  

I like getting there a smidge early to dominate the dance floor to some 80's hits before the DJ gets crazy.   It's nice to get out a little early too, because like Gramma always said: "nothing good happens after 3"  ha!

Nothing too special about this bar except it is open when other bars are closed. it is a way alot like why people go to White Castle, only because other places are closed. I ate there once and it was typical bar food. I guess if you live in Schaumburg and want to go to a neighborhood bar and dress up in the this is the place.

I've been to the Coach House 3 times and havent had a bad experience yet... I just wouldnt get there before 12:30am.

This is one of those bars that stays open until 4am so its primarily an "after the other bars that close at 2am close".  There is a good looking crowd with a mix of middle 20's up until the lower 40's.  There usually is a cover to enter (from what I can remember) that is roughly $5.

As soon as you walk in the front door there is a decent sized circular bar with a pretty big dance floor area in the back.  There is seating around the dance floor as well with booths and tables.  In the summer, the outdoor patio and bar are open often times with a guy grilling late night cheeseburgers (everyone loves a good cheeseburger at 3:30am).

Bartenders are pretty cool guys from what I can tell and the waitresses are walking around looking to assist in your boozing.  This is a pretty well run establishment and is a great place to head on a thursday through saturday night (or I should say early mornings).

All together,  it would be better to go to Binnies and buy your own booze and have fun with your friends.  I went there with a guy for his 21st, and they were a scamming, cashing eating cow machine.  Ordered an irish car bomb, and they didn't even fill the PLASTIC cup half way with beer (shot glass was higher than the beer lever), they would not give you a glass of water (everyone forced to BUY A BOTTLE of water), and they kicked my friend out after HE stopped drinking because he drank too much (meaning, they were already liable, but tried to get out of it by kicking him out with is, well you know, BS).  That, or they kicked him out because he wasn't buying anything.  Either way, they are cutting corners, trying to take your money without giving service, and do not respect the customer what-so-ever.  If you are looking for a quality place, go to POP's down the road, at least there, you can get good service and watch the hawks.
To all my fellow vets out there I would steer clear from this place they are not military veteran friendly.

I'm not really sure how I want to review this place.  I was there for lunch a few weeks ago, and I had an awesome buffalo chicken sandwich, it had a good kick to it.  The bread was probably the best part of it.

The fries that came with it were good, until I got to one particular fry - something was insanely wrong with it when I bit into it.  When it comes to food, I'm easy to please, I'll eat just about anything.  I have had bad fries, I just eat it and go to the next one.

I can't even put a finger on what it tasted like, but it was aweful, and I was about to run to the bathroom to allow for it's exit.

Like I said, I'm feeling bittersweet about this joint, the sandwich kicked ass, but that one fry kinda killed it.  I'll probably go back, and will cross my fingers that this was a one-time bad experience.
Hands down best spot in the area to party late night.  I invariably end up making out with some suburban slore every time I find myself here.

Perfect breakfast at a diner starts with a warm greeting and a great cup of coffee. Off to a perfect start.Sat by the kitchen window and watched plate after plate of perfection go from kitchen to tables. Sausage, eggs & potatoes were pretty basic and very 3 star, everything else was amazing. Seasonal specials were pumpkin fench toast and bread pudding breakfasts were well portioned and perfect in every way.

What a cute little spot! Ive never been to a diner so i wasnt really sure what to expect.  The service was friendly and fast. The food we ordered was delicious. I had the best apple pancakes  ever here. The hasbrowns were different kind of potato-y but crisp at the same time. I will definitely return when im in itasca again.

You get so much food!!! My pancakes were fluffy and perfect and pretty much to die for. Skillet was on point with the ratio of all the potatoes, meats, cheese, and veggies. The board with all the shake flavors sounded so appealing. The prices can't be beat for a quick work lunch. I'll have to try the coffee and a gyro next time! It's located next to an amazing bakery, and absolutely worth the visit.

Little diner located in "downtown" Itasca.

This is a small diner with tile flooring and walls. Booths line the right side of the restaurant, tables for four down the middle, and bar style seating on the left. They have a TV that plays daytime television which fits with the atmosphere appropriately. Feels like something out of Happy Days.

Come in and seat yourself.

They have a pretty extensive menu that highlights breakfast items as well as some sandwich, soup, and salad options that could be ordered for a good lunch. I had the Cajun chicken sandwich which came with soup and fries. These were all good and I ordered a chocolate shake to go. The service was warm and it felt like you were being served at home.

A little biased because we know the owners but the owner themselves work in the kitchen as their passion is for food so it's delightful that they enjoy pleasing their customers and work hard on their business. 

A retro style inviting diner that's clean and has a hard working waitress on an a crispy cold Saturday morning made the place feel warm and comfortable. Prices before 10 am have specials and you will make your wallet happy by spending a few bucks on fresh eggs. We came in past 10 but the prices were still amazing- ordered some gyros in my omelette and feel free to happily make changes or any substitutes. 

Forget the iHops, and other diners that have poor Yelp ratings, or too many visitors- this diner right by the train station is a perfect stop to fill up on any given day. Perfect for a larger group or small, dishes come quick (depending on how many people) and coffee isn't bad either.
Great food and service at a great price, a new favorite! Everyone should go here otherwise they have not lived the good life.

I decided to give Daddy O's another try and wish I hadn't.  

I ordered the Pete's "special" burger that comes with lettuce, tomato and onion and "special sauce".  Server asked how I would like it cooked and I said "medium".  It came out more rare than I like.  I should have sent it back but I ate half and left the rest.

The fresh cut fries were swimming in oil.  I also only ate half.  When the serverr asked how everything was, I told her.  I hate complaining in a restaurant.  When she came back she said that fresh cut fries tend to soak up oil more than other fries.  Yes, that's true when you don't let them drain from the fryer basket and instead drop them on the plate immediately after pulling them from the fryer. 

The server was nice and deleted the amount of the burger from the bill.  I said that I wasn't looking for that and that I should have said something immediately after taking the first bite.
I don't think I'll be back.

Great food and love the 50's / 60's look  the home made soups are amazing especially the vegetable!! Only here for this week and have been there for 2 lunches and a breakfast and going back again!! Could only wish there was a place like this everywhere I travel too.
Excellent little diner! I had a chicken wrap which came with a bowl of split pea and a side of potato salad and it was delicious. Great value for $10!

We headed into downtown Itasca today to check it out and found this little gem!  An adorable 50's diner with great food, great music, and great people!  Our server was this super sweet Greek lady.  We had their Cream of Chicken Soup, Gyros off the spit and a gyros grilled cheese plate. We had no complaints at all.  Food was served very quickly and was delicious!

On the way out, we asked if she could make us a Frappe to go. They were frothy perfection!  

Needless to say, we will be back!
Excellent soup.  Had the grilled chicken with avocado, dish. Don't miss the homemade potato salad.  Next to an awesome bakery.
Great friendly service,60s atmosphere and delicious homemade food.  Service very efficient and friendly
Great place to watch the Memorial Day parade. They were really busy but cordial and got our order fast. Cool spot to have coffee and breakfast with their outside seating.
I love the food and Atmosphere. Friendly local staff. Quality food!

Cute little 50's diner in downtown Itasca.
Burgers were good, Monte Cristo was awesome!
I did have to ask for syrup though, as I am a strong believer in never picking up french toast with your hands; and slathering it with syrup and powdered sugar.
Fries were large and in-charge, and hot.
The cold coffee drink I had was not as sweet as I expected.  It was very frothy.
Even though it wasn't sweet, it worked super well with my MC, seeing as I load that thing with 2 sources of sugar.  But, if you are expecting a sweet cold coffee, it aint it.
Small number of seats, and it got crowded at lunch, so expect a bit of a crowd if you go a peak times. 
Well worth it.  Definitely want to check out the shakes next time!

This is a smaller locally owned diner located right next to Keans bakery.
The inside is aiming for a 1950's retro theme and succeeds. Chairs booths and a counter are your seating options. All are new and clean. In the summer a few tables are outside for seating in the fresh air.
The breakfast here is a strong suite, especially the omelets. The cook is originally from greece so anything greek on the item is prepared especially well. The corned beef hash dang tasty .
The lunch items are okay, and every entree comes with soup. Well, every diner has it's little quirks.
They have their own shake machine and all the shakes and malts are hand made to order. And delicious.
The waitstaff are all pretty good-mine knew exactly what an arnold palmer was and how it should be made, which not everyone does.
Parking is shared with Keans. During the rush times can get a little busy, but I've never not been able to find a spot.
Five stars for the malts and tasty tasty breakfasts.

Popped in here for a quick breakfast today, and we were pretty pleased. My husband ordered eggs Benedict, which was cooked perfectly, with a mild hollandaise sauce. Neither of us were crazy for the hash brown potatoes, but the sausage was very good. I ordered the French toast, and was very happy with it. They used a very fresh egg bread, and knew how to make it warm (instead of overdone) with slightly crispy edges -- just how I like it. The coffee hit the spot, as well, mild but flavorful. I can't recommend lunch as we haven't tried it yet, but we would return for breakfast again.

We've been coming here for years and have never left a review. It's amazing! The waitresses are all kind and responsive. The waitress named Kiki is our favorite. She's a little peach. The owner, Bessie, is very friendly as well. Great food too! I always get the meat lovers skillet with scramby eggs. Yummy! I highly recommend this place!
Really great food, fast, friendly and efficient service! Would go back if ever in area.

Great retro decor. Service decent. Food, nothing of note, except it's faults. Had eggs Benedict. Super runny. Did have real Canadian bacon. Says hashbrowns,but we're "country fried" ( sliced and browned in a roasting pan". What the hell happened to SHREDDED hash browns? Ordered orange juice. Absolutely  the worst. Not fresh, not made from fresh oranges. Had to have been frozen concentrate. They charge $2.95 for this terrible liquid. Why can't they buy fresh orange juice at the grocery store and serve that. Coffee disappointed in coffee. For a Greek eatery it should have been much better. Would I go back, nope.
Never knew this place existed. Will have to bring the family by. Had the gyro and it was great. Great 50's diner decor.
Would like to rate the food but after waiting too long for my breakfast (2 eggs, bacon & toast) got up and walked out. Never again.
Got up and walked out after waiting too long for two eggs, hash browns, sausage links and toast. Never again.

This quaint 50's style diner is a little gem. For someone who loves old school diners, it is always a treat to find one. I am a big fan of sitting at the diner counter and chatting with the waitresses/waiters. Everyone here is extremely pleasant and friendly. A definite destination if you enjoy diners.

And my omelette was delicious.

Ordered take out and I was surprised at how friendly everyone was. The place it is very cute and clean. I got the Greek Omelet which was delicious! The potatoes that came on the side were perfect too. My husband got eggs and bacon and he was very happy too. Perfect diner with great food, will be back.

Second time here, friendly service, good food.
Reasonably priced. I'll be back. Great atmosphere

Went here for lunch on Monday.  Daddy O's is a small diner on the main drag in fabulous downtown Itasca, IL.  The menu is typical diner fare.  I ordered a burger which came with soup and a side.  I ordered their beef barley soup.  For sides, one of the options was potato salad.  

The soup was actually pretty good.  While kind of skimpy on the ingredients (or generous on the broth?). it did taste good.  The burger was only fair.  I would categorize the beef as kind of bland.  But, the potato salad was very disappointing.  Rather than what I think I'm used to, the potatoes were diced to about 1/4 inch or smaller squares.  The egg in the salad was very overcooked and it was way too much onion for my taste.

It is a nice family place - a real old hometown diner.  I'll be back and give it another chance at some time.  Perhaps it was a bad day for me, or for them.  I like supporting small family owned restaurants so I won't write this one off yet.

Local diner perfect for us to walk to on the weekends.  The staff is always so friendly and it's great to support local businesses.  Almost every time I've gotten the Meat Lovers Skillet.  That comes with potatoes, 2(?) eggs your choice, and sausage ham and bacon, and your choice of cheese, as well as toast or pancakes.  I've had something similar to this at other places and daddy o's does it best.  The meat is finely chopped enough so you don't have huge hunks in there like i've experienced elsewhere.  Plus the food always leaves me full with plenty of leftovers to take home (and they taste good reheated!)  One day we decided to stop here for shakes and their ice cream was SO good.  I would come back here just for a shake sometime.  And can't forget the "snow white" - it's a sprite float.  yum.

First time visiting this diner. It is off the beaten path but that is great because it was not crowded. Came here for lunch. Parking is in front.  It was smaller than I expected but that made it cozy.

Came with a friend. Had the gyros special. It was very good. Came with Tzatsiki sauce on side. Had fruit instead of fries. 

Our server, Emily was very friendly and accommodating. Very professional.  The hostess was also very nice as well

Overall the whole experience was enjoyable. I liked that it wasn't crowded. Most other places in area get very crowded on Sundays during breakfast and lunch and you feel like you are rushed to get in, eat and get out.. This was not the experience here.

Highly recommend.
Excellent service, great oldies diner atmosphere, food was really good....I love fresh cut fries! We will be going back! Small little diamond in the rough. Highly recommended.
I loved this place so much, it really made my family and I happy. We were full and celebrating after my daughters soccer game. Highly recommended!

This a cozy, clean diner with friendly small town charm.  I enjoy the 50's vibe and the comfortable bench seating.  Menu is typical diner fare with one or two positive surprises.  They pay special attention to young one so it has become a special spot for me and my four year old.

Great  Itasca spot for breakfast or lunch.

I happened upon this wonderful diner by accident one day on a trip back to Oak Park from the western suburbs. Daddy O's has a very intriguing retro 50s exterior which attracted me to stop in for lunch. The menu has a wide variety of items to suit all taste buds. I ordered the cajun chicken sandwich which was delicious. The iced tea was fresh brewed! Above all else, the service was friendly, attentive and genuine. The people who run this place really love what they do and it shows. I don't get to Itasca often however I guarantee that I will return very soon. I have been telling my friends and family about this gem. This place is great! Please try it.

Stopped in this past Sunday for a quick breakfast.  Bright & Clean little diner with super-friendly service.  Got a table right away and our order in a flash.  First time at a breakfast joint, so S.O.P - random omelet (south of the border), pancakes, greek toast.  The toast was buttered perfectly, the omelet was sizable and *filled*.  However, the pancakes are about as plain jane and uneventful as you can get- I think the issue is the batter is probably added to (ie blueberries, etc) for special order pancakes, but cooked as is when ordered as a side short stack.  Not bad, just OK.  Pleasant enviroment, and probably have to come back and try the diner fare in the future.

Great Midwest diner. Breakfast menu had all the bases covered. Ordered an egg white veggie omelet done perfectly. Well kept, clean, and a relaxing patio out front. I also like the small town feel where this place is located. Does not feel like Chicago at all.
Food and staff are great. Just moved to Itasca and have to give it to this little diner. This will be my regular go to spot from now on.
Love this cute joint. Homemade soups are so good. Everything has the wonderful homemade taste. Milk shakes so yummy. Staff are always friendly. Feels homey.

Nice people great food

I am really getting sick of the chain restaurants. This is a nice classic local diner. The décor is retro fifties. I took my friend there who loves all things fifties, and he loved it!

This is a lovely little diner that is a hidden gem in Itasca, walking in we were greeted by warm smiles and friendly conversation. The food was great and the cream of chicken soup was my favorite! 

Great family setting and the perfect spot for a nice quiet breakfast or lunch!
Cute diner opened for breakfast and lunch. A lovely couple owns and operates it. Great food and warm, friendly service. They treat you like family.

It's nice. It's a diner that did its job and had GOOD diner food at GOOD prices and service somewhere between good & great. The 50's style with the hole music, drive inn, black & white checker theme has become way overplayed and really takes away from the quality of food for a diner. I had a chop steak that was outstanding the 2nd time I was there and would definitely do lunch there if I was in the neighborhood. Good job daddy o's but if you come to a decision in the future of change, you can stand without the 50's style!

Since all other local restaurants had huge waiting times and were not taking reservations I called this place and was pleased to get a table for 6 at 11am

The service here was outstanding,They made me feel  like I had been coming here for years, We had all had basic breakfast's egg bacon etc etc and every plate was cleaned so I know everyone enjoyed the food, I have lost count on how many times I have ordered hash Browns well down to get the complete opposite, not here they were well done and crispy just they way i love them.

I will definitely come back again.
What a great place to eat. We had wonderful breakfasts during a weekend in Itasca. Daddy O's has wonderful service and smiling faces. I would highly recommend it if you are in the area.
A hidden gem! Best skillets, such a cool, retro atmosphere. And the chocolate milk was delicious!! Definitely going back here again for breakfast :)
Hidden gem, good lunch fare, fun decor, pleasant staff and reasonable prices.  We love coming for lunch to escape the office!

I love the 50's look - red & white formica tables and vinyl chairs.  50's celeb photos and 45 records on the wall.  Service was very friendly and quick.  Portions large - sandwiches come with bowl of soup and potato choice.  My Reuben was yummy - the rye toast was buttery and plenty of the Russian dressing on the side for me to slather on.  The fries are large homemade steak-style fries.  I found the soup to be more broth than ingredients (only negative).  I also tried a banana-chocolate shake - very good.  Decent prices also.  They serve breakfast all day, too!

We bring our grandson here by Metra since it is so close to the train station.  It is a great family spot.  The chicken noodle soup was tasty but sorely lacking chicken - I counted 2 pieces.   Two of us had grilled cheese, one had a burger which were all good.  Their fries are the best if you like thick cut.  The service is outstanding - everyone is very friendly.

I love restaurants with a retro theme....happened upon this place. 

Decor is cute, service fantastc, minus she forgot our soup, (hence the one missing star, or they'd have gotten a 5-star rating), and I loved the food. Prices are reasonable too. I will return.

I cant justify one star because it wasn't the worst ever, but we were seriously unimpressed with this restaurant now that it's under new management. Seating has always been pretty quick and that has stayed the same at least. That was about the only thing that was quick. Maybe two servers is too few for the place, but our waitress seemed overworked and forgetful at best. We asked if the blueberries would be fresh on the crepes and pancakes and they came covered in blueberry syrup. Soup with the sandwich was forgotten about but at least given to us to take home. Getting the bill was slow too despite the place being half empty then. I don't think we'll be revisiting for a second chance.

I don't understand the bad reviews here!  Daddy-O's gave superlative service.  We were in town for a Saturday wedding but found Daddy-O's while looking for the train station, so had breakfast there Friday, Saturday and Sunday mornings.  Each day we went with different people and everyone had different things.  The homemade Greek yogurt is FANTASTIC.  This is certainly not an overly healthy place to eat, but they seem like they'd accommodate any request you had (like putting things on the side, etc).  The service was great - Bessie remembered us every day and asked us about our previous day's adventures.  I can't speak highly enough about this place and wish I had a reason to visit Itasca again!

Good food, large portions, fast and attentive service. The servers there were quite helpful and friendly, i would have definitely come back on that alone.

I ordered the Grilled cheese, perfect texture, crisp on the outside, chewy on the inside, cheese perfectly melted. The strawberry malt was great, the right amount of everything. 

I am glad that i can support a local business with good food and great service!
Good food at reasonable prices and cute atmosphere. Family owned feel and service. Very friendly and efficient wait staff.

We stopped in and were very happy we did I had the short rib taco, the coconut crust tilapia taco both were excellent. My husband had the 1/2 chicken dinner and he loved his as well. Then banana Carmelize spilt was how we topped it off

The Star was an ERROR!!! 
06/02/16 HORRIBLE HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!! Per their menu, Thursday is $1.50 Taco Day for grilled steak and ground beef tacos. We called and placed our order for the $1.50 taco deal for pick up. We were not advised of the additional  .75¢ for lettuce and  .75¢ for tomatoes per taco, as the tacos only come with cilantro and cheese.  We were not advised that we had to say specially we wanted the $1.50 taco deal (which we did)...As there are 2  different taco sizes.  When we challenged the total, that is when we were advised of all of the extras, and that we did not specifically request the $1.50 tacos. BS!!!. He (the mgr) went on to say "you can't get everything for free" in a very nasty tone. No, I don't expect to get anything for free. However, I've never purchased a taco that did not have lettuce and tomato. And upon taking the order, you should have advised of the extra charge. He goes on to say, it's printed on the menu.  NO, IT IS NOT!!! Then, this unprofessional a$$hole said, "do me a favor, don't ever come back here again".  Oh, I won't, neither will my co-workers, and you can have your tacos, and void the charge on my card. Then, he (the mgr) says "the sale cannot be cancelled".  My response "Either you cancel my transaction or the bank
 will. My transaction was voided.

Tostadas were very skimpy.  Not much meat at all.  Tacos and burritos had more meat.  Dropped 2 stars.  First one, because almost $4 for delivery and $25 minimum is simply unreasonable.  Second star lost, because of too many grisly and burned bits of steak.  Bad combination.  Quality matters!  Trimming meat of fat and gristle matter!

This is the second time my husband brings me lunch from here and this is the second time that the order has been screwed up. This time, however it's also quite disgusting. I ordered the nachos and added guacamole. They charged me $2 for it but didn't add it. They did add PLENTY of fat instead of meat though (I added a picture, you can see the pile of fat on the left). The chips are extremely stale. My husband ordered the carne en su jugo which had good flavor but is lacking meat. He also got two of their specialty tacos--the octopus which smelled like fish (it shouldn't) and the pork belly with habanero salsa but can't tell you how that tastes since what he actually received was lengths with onion and cilantro. $34 wasted. They are lucky I am stuck at work if not I would go and throw this bag of food on their counter and get every penny back.
The owner was rude number 1.The tacos took forever to make.The price way to high will never go back.

First time here and I can already tell this will be my go to place for Mexican food.  Best Mexican food I've had in the suburbs.  I'm from Schaumburg and there's no good place for Mexican food there. I ordered the fish tacos and it was amazing.  Fresh and flavorful.  I highly recommend Mi Tierra.

Went here for lunch bc it's near mine and my boyfriends job. We were so happy with our choice! We both ordered a chicken tinga and a chorizo and potato taco and split an order of rice and beans. The chorizo and potato was our favorite. It was delicious and cooked perfectly. I wouldn't mind more for dinner hahah. The tinga was good, but it wasn't anything special. The place was empty minus one other patron when we were mid meal. I'm sure we'll be dining here again bc it was so good! Unfortunately, I didn't take a picture but next time I sure will.

I eat Mexican food for lunch all over the Chicago metro area. This is probably the best place I've eaten. They have amazing pre prepared specials like roast pork loin and rib eye (all in taco form). The chef is truly a talent.

The special tacos are what bring me back here. The short rib tacos are good as well as some of the others they have had in the past.  They are served on a blue corn tortilla.  The ahi tuna taco was good but could have been presented better than a misshapen square trying to fit in a tortilla.  The flavor was good but trying to wrangle the tuna in it ended up tearing the tortilla.  I also got the chipotle lobster bisque. Had a great taste and subtle spice. Only issue was instead of using lobster they used bits of shrimp. Place is very clean and wide open during lunch hours.  Eating in gets some chips and salsa that are very delicious.  Worth the visit.

We stopped by in Mother's Day after a long day to celebrate with three awesome moms and several kids. As the majority of our party of 8 was vegan the owner went out of his way not only to create dishes not on the menu but to go purchase several items on the spot to make a custom vegan meal for all of us. The Agua Fresca was delicious and worth coming back - just for that! Delicious rice with corn and okra, enchiladas with mushrooms and spinach, fresh made guacamole with perfect blend of lemon and jalapeños and much more. Thank you for a delicious end to a fun day!

Came here during the week as the reviews seemed better than anything around.

Waitress seemed like she was just going through the motions no smiles no interaction, maybe she was tired?

The main reason for leaving the review is I saw 3 tacos for five dollars. So I ordered three steak tacos. 
When they came I instantly noticed that the steak didn't even cover my tortilla top to bottom. Most, if not all places do this. To make matters worse one was significantly short as if the cook didn't gauge the portion correctly and just tossed what remained on from the first two on the last one.

Steak was good quality, however when you wrap about 2oz of steak with 2 tortillas. I expect to not struggle to taste the meat. 

Sure maybe I was jipped due to the lunch special

WRONG they charged normal price because the lunch special uses a " different meat and different tortilla"

So cheaper and bad quality ingredients, YIKES. 

Overall was not too thrilled about this place

This is the best restaurant in Bensenville, hands down.

This is one of those places that makes me believe in Yelp. I never would have found it otherwise. It's tucked away in a strip mall and an easy miss, but so worth stopping in.

The chef is fantastic and creative, always coming up with something new. The coconut shrimp tacos with blue corn tortillas are amazing. The enchiladas are also great. Definitely get the fresh guacamole.

Food is very tasty, although it doesn't feel like an authentic Mexican restaurant. Just seems to be a Mexican cuisine menu with an American twist. I usually order main dishes and my food looks and tastes like expected- But when I ordered the Guacamole from the appetizer section, it looked like nothing I've seen. I basically received two avocados cut up in cubes combined with a lot of pico de gallo. As many times as I ordered guacamole from numerous different Mexican spots, I've always received it whipped up and easy to scoop with a tortilla chip. I basically needed a a fork to eat this one.

Excellent food!  A great find in Bensenville! I found this place on Yelp and glad I did.  I started off with the guacamole ...and ordered Tonight's special tacos --the blue tacos...ALL AMAZING!  The gauc was made with huge chunks of ripe avocados- super fresh.  The tacos were not your run of mill tacos...they were very unique...a coconut shrimp taco with pineapple pico, a short rib taco with carmelized onions and a potato and 3 cheese stuffed chile relleno taco...truly some of the best I've had. The service was excellent, too.   I'll be back and recommend you get there NOW!

OUTSTANDING PLACE....I work in the area and have been to plenty Mexican restaurants nearby and they have poor quality food/look inside this place is very clean very comfortable very sanitary food is amazing and also professional ...
I was disappointed with the food. The meat was fatty and everything was unpleasantly spicy. I can handle spicy food; but this was so hot that it was not enjoyable.

Great place for lunch ($1 tacos & $5.99 for 1/2 chicken meal) and surprising choices for dinner. I had the Tilapia al Mojo de Ajo and was pleased when the chef took care of my special request. I was also happy to be able to catch a World Cup match while drinking an Indio beer!!!

I love this place.  They have tons of vegetarian options and do them well.  Rare for Mexican restaurants.  Sometimes they overdo the lime in the guacamole but other than that, I have loved everything I've ordered.  The service is always prompt which I appreciate since I'm always working.  It's in a strip mall with a shared parking lot.  The only negative is the TV.

This place sucks I just ordered 12 tacos de asada and 8 de pastor and I don't know how the girl taking the orders gave me 8 al pastor tacos and 1 steak like really last time I'm going to this POS RESTAURANT TO KILL IT OF THE TACOS SUCKED
Try the Al Pastor, really original!
Great place!  I come here all the time.  The food is amazing.  The first time I came here they were closing and they stayed open just to feed me.  This place is great for all.

So glad to find this place near the airport. Portions are generous. The large guacamole was enough for 10! We are from Austin and used to getting good Mexican food -- this was on par. Will definitely return next time we are in town.
Another delicious meal. Today's perk? The agua de Jamaica & Orange juice combo...sooo good.

This place is absolutely wonderful. Don't let the location of the restaurant fool you. The steak tacos were amazing. They also have specialty tacos daily and they are delicious. Don't pass up the crab cake tacos. (Specialty tacos come in blue tortilla) the sauce they put in those specialty tacos were something else!!! It's under new management now, and we got a chance to meet him and he was such a delight. You can tell he has passion! Do not pass this restaurant up. You honestly can't beat the prices too.

My review would be a solid 5 stars based on the creativity of what is usually a pretty standard menu, but several factors detracted from my being able to love, love, LOVE this place.

Although they were not really busy, sit-down service was slow. The lettuce in my taco salad was less-than-fresh and should have been tossed in the morning's food prep and replaced with fresh lettuce rather than try to stretch it out for one more day. And at 2pm, they were out of flan, which made me really sad.

Everything else was great... and in the last place I would think to look for a great dining experience - a strip mall. Definitely try the Mi Tierra tacos - steak, chorizo and cactus, and their Cubana torta - ham and pineapple.

I totally would give them another try and hope to up my rating then.

This taqueria was pretty dam good and I was surprised for Bensenville and the strip mall location. A nice small strip mall location this place could use more decorative features though but otherwise it was a pretty cool place for tacos. they should get some fountain drinks and not just serve pop through a can. i detest when places do that.

The Carne Asada tacos and both hot sauces are pretty good here (I get mine 86 cilantro and onion and add cheese, otherwise they are just meat)...Tacos de Lengua were a little too crispy and chewy for me (although they were definitely good for squicking my coworkers out).  Overall, Taqueria Mi Tierra has nice staff, a nice amount of impulse buys at the counter (HELLO sugar!), Jarritos galore, and delicious Horchata (super cinnamon-y!).  It's a quick and easy lunch stop if you are in the area.
Great steak tacos that are simple but tasty.  Out of 100s of Mexican restaurants I've gone to this is in the top 5 hands down!  Try the special mustard and green sauce on your tacos!

Made a to go order for 2 taco dinners. The girl working the counter was very confused and had trouble writing or saying  the order correctly. When the order finally came up it was wrong. Cheese sounds nothing like sour cream, but apparently to her it does because everything was covered in it. Got a refund and went across the street to mr. Burrito where the food is always consistently made correctly to order.

So refreshing to see a great restaurant close to my house. First time there and the food was excellent and everything was homemade. It is worth the visit for the fresh food and also for the hospitality of owner/chef Jorge. What a great guy, talked to him for a bit and really enjoyed the conversation and food. Would recommend if in the Bensenville area or to be honest it's worth the trip, give them a try. I had the fish torta and i wanted to try the vegetarian tacos so he made me one as well to  try. Jorge's service is outstanding and homemade food is going to make this a usual place for me. :)
Food was good. But over priced and small portions. Will not go back.

If you are looking for excellent Mexican food which is different than your standard Mexican fare, this is the place for you. Jorge, the owner, knows what he is doing in the kitchen. Where do you find braised beef rib tacos? I usually order off the chalk board which are specials. You will not be disappointed.

The food is very good and the place is very clean. The tacos Al Pastor actually have nice size pieces of pineapple, the way those tacos were meant to be made! Loved the green salsa and chips. Good combination of flavors in the "Mi Tierra" tacos, if your up to eating cactus. Mmm

great price for a large burrito , only 3.99 and its bigger than the burrito at sol del pueblo and at sol del pueblo they want 6.00 and the burrito is chewy and bland. I thought it was pretty good except that they use pico de gallo which is hot and my kids thought it was hot. They also use authentic mexican cheese which is good but if you dont eat it you may not like it so becareful with these 2 things. This is probably the best burrito deal in town.

Finally a taqueria with an executive chef!! (Not just your typical taqueria)The food here is great!! The guacamole is awesome and freshly made. The fish tacos are the best I have had and they make delicious fresh flavored juices daily. You can tell that the ingredients are always freshly prepared. I would highly recommend Taqueria Mi Tierra for its great food, excellent chef, and friendly staff! 

Pros: 
Food tastes like it is homemade
Chips and salsa for those who dine in
Reasonably priced
Friendly staff 
Exceptional chef

The food was what you'd expect from a typical taqueria (so that gets a 3 star rating for A-OK).  That being said, I was satisfied with my meal and the service I got so I bumped up the rating to a 4.  I'd come again!

Still after living here since 1987...
When we want pizza.. This is the first place we think of..
Love the stuffed pizza .

After order pizza & beef sandwich. I got sick off pizza and my husband wasn't satisfied on beef sandwich. We called they offer $5 for beef I said ok.  We took sandwich back.......Welllllllll when we went to order something Steve lied said he offer $2.50. 
I will take my business else where !!!!! 
I seen worker working w/ out glove

Ordered my half bbq with pepperoni sausage and onions on one side and the other half is just cheese. I got in there 10 min later than they told
Me to come in giving them time on a busy Friday. I had to wait an extra 15 minutes while they redid my food bare hands no gloves or any sanitation. A sign saying no cameras or photography so they don't get in trouble I guess. I go home to see my pizza isn't what I wanted. It's a fully bbq sausage on one half the other bbq with pepporoni and onion. I call while the owner himself is making the pizzas and ask for credit back or refund. He tells me I need to come back after 30 min if I want another pizza, while raising his voice at me telling me I'm a liar and I'm not getting credited I told him for my first time trying and coming here it's my last. 1 star for the sanitation and customer service. I know I sound like a mean older lady but I'm a laid back guy but this was out of hand.

Ordered pizza on September 7, 2016 for lunch pizza was terrible, hardly any sauce, or sausage, and super expensive, I left the delivery guy a nice tip, only to find out the pizza had been tipped over. $30:00 dollars for ex-large pizza. Won't be ordering from there.

I've experienced better and at this location.  We've been ordering here for 31 years and lately we have been disappointed for one reason or another.  Poor customer service, pizza not ready at the time given, late delivery resulting in cold pizza and other complaints.

We used to get pizza here weekly.  Now it might be two or three months before we decide to give them another chance.  But the pizza I ordered yesterday was probably the last straw.  I picked it up when I was told and the pizza was cold.  I had to reheat it at home.  The crust wasn't extra thin and there very few mushrooms which was the only topping.  Also, it was very light on sauce which I can't understand.  

Shame to see a once proud business go down the drain like this.

Too bad they can't get a consistently crispy crust. The toppings are good though recently I noticed sliced pieces of sausage rather then bulk.
Even when you request, "well done" the crust is usually doughy and white. This is why we usually order from V&V. (COUPONS LURED ME TO ROSATIS)

My fav pizza hands down. Friendly service. Hot, fresh pizza. I crave Rosati's. We order from them at least 2x per month, sometimes more depending on my laziness. I also get their Rosati's salad quite a bit. A meal in itself and so good it almost doesn't even need dressing.
got here on time, staff wasn't very friendly, they said they messed up my pizza and it wouldn't be ready for another 15 minutes. no apology or anything. quite rude.

Brutal to give a Rosatis such a low rating. Something changed over the past few years and more noticeably the crust. Making it as thin as a few sheets of paper does nothing for this. There is nothing substantial to the crust that if you order more than a few toppings it winds up  being a mess. Order an XL and compare it to any other places large and you'll see that there is really no value. Paying $24 for one pizza and getting half of what the other local competitors give just doesn't cut it, no matter how good it tastes. For the same price Ill take Malnatis deep dish.

I stop here maybe once every two weeks. I often get the lunch slices. Nothing will knock your socks off but it's very decent pizza. I find their pies a bit too saucy but I adjusted my order to easy sauce and it comes out well.

One of the best pizzas in Chicagoland. They have other food, but the pizza is the best! I would also recommend the lasagna. A very healthy portion with garlic bread. They deliver too. We have been using them for over 5 years.

This review is just based in the incompetent person answering the phones.  I called asking for a delivery and he had to have had the worst tone.  Asked for the Hawiian Luau pizza and apparently he has no idea what I was talking about responding like I was some crazy person asking for some ridiculous pizza.  No help with trying to find what I wanted but what irritated me the most was I went to look at the menu again thinkibg maybe I misread the name but nope, there it was the Hawiian Luau.  

Either fix your menu or fix your employees.  I just moved into the area and eat pizza like im in college.  This place was the closest but I assure you I won't be calling back until I am certain someone competant will answer the phone.  No need to be a dick, seriously kid.

They have always delivered a nice hot za to my door and I love the pizza here.

Since I work in the neighborhood as well I will sometimes go and pick up a slice and drink for only $3.50 plus they have a pizza punch card so the 11th slice is free!

Their customer service was awful. The lady on the phone was rude and short with us. We ordered garlic bread and they forgot it and then brought it to us but it was cold. The pizza it self was not too bad however their green peppers we're not good.

I don't know why but there thin crust that was perfect!, is now so thin it's almost transparent. Someone thought they would cut corners and save money by giving less. This is what usually makes places fold up an close the doors. To the owner: yes we all notice and are not fooled or happy!! Why mess with a good thing. Hope you don't lose to many customers. Oh ya, the slices at lunch are getting smaller and smaller.

About two years ago a friend of mine recommended this Rosati's for delivery. As there isn't a whole lot of whole choices in Hanover Park for delivery late at night, we ordered a couple of pies for delivery. Talk about a recommendation!

Pros:

+ The sausage and cheese were piled on thick
+ The thin crust was well-cooked and flaky 
+ The delivery driver arrived promptly and didn't have any issues finding our funky townhouse sub-division street
+ Rosati's sends out tons of coupons in the ValuPak and other mailers, plus there are more coupons on the menu's and even on the pizza box themselves
+ Collect enough pizza box tabs and you'll earn a free loyalty pie

Cons:

I can't think of any and I've been ordering from them regularly for two years now.

Having only ordered pizzas, I can't comment on their other menu options, but for thin-crust, Rosati's is unquestionably one of the better choices in the NW Burbs. The cheese is layered on really thick, so eat it slowly and enjoy!
Growing up in the Beverly area, I was accustomed to Fox's Pizza (best pizza in Chicago)...so finding Rosati's is a definite treat! Super thin, generous toppings and so fresh! I'm a fan!

Had to order pizza for a team that works in Hanover Park & they worked with me trying to coordinate the delivery, even went out of their way 3x to meet my out-of-town team at the front desk!!! Plus they even helped me by arranging pepperoni to say THANK YOU on it :)

last but not least, the team has me jealous as to how yummy they said it was!

Ordered an extra large sausage with extra cheese pizza, it got delivered and the cheese and all toppings were completely slid to one side. I called and spoke with the manager, and agreed upon a free pizza next time, as this time I paid with cash and was unable to wait for another pizza to be made. Called back a month later to order again and they never put my free pizza in the computer. Would not hear me out. Will not use this rosatis location again.
After Jets pizza said they don't deliver after 11pm on a Friday night we called rosati's. Good pizza, great wings. Never knew that pizzerias can have superb wings. So long Jets.
The quality here is better than many other Rosati's

My friends and I got it delivered to us, and by the time we realized it the pizza was already at the door, we actually had to let the pizza cool down for us to eat it

We got a deep dish 14in pepperoni pizza and it was to die for, the first slice that was taken off the pizza left a beautiful trail of cheese, the taste of it was also amazing as well, I would definitely order from them again!
So my uncle bought a pizza for delivery with alot of toppings and they didn't leave any toppings behind!  The wait is long but it's worth it!

I really enjoy their pizza! It does take long sometimes. ESPECIALLY if you order for delivery and have their free delivery coupon that they offer you. Last time I used it my pizza arrived barely even warm. They're lucky their pizza just tastes great.

Our absolutely favorite place for pizza. My husband is pretty particular about the sausage on his pizza and this is his favorite. I like healthy stuff like broccoli on my pizza and they have that too!

I cant believe that there's no reviews of this Rosati's. It's the best one ever. I grew up eating this pizza. I've had other Rosati's pizza at about 3 or 4 different locations, but this one is the best. For the pizza. Other stuff is just Ok. The fried shrimp is good.
I would give this location 5 stars but twice was not a happy customer, but this location is always clean,employees are friendly food is ALWAYS FRESH, and plenty of room to enjoy your meal.
Was in here the other day and had a great visit. I stopped in for lunch and to get some work done. Love love love the free WiFi. Also, the manager Tom (?) was very helpful.

I usually stop here 1-2 times a week because I'm obsessed with their soufflés. Today marked the last day. The guy working the register was dripping sweat all over the place. I ordered my soufflé, he takes his filthy sweaty hands, picks up gloves and puts them on. Sweaty, filthy gloves are now going to touch my food. He picked up the soufflé and just drops it in the bag. I asked him "um you don't put them in boxes anymore" he's like "oh you needed one" I said "not anymore". Hands me bag and I ask him, fork, napkins? Got all irritated with me. Unnecessary. If you can't handle working with the public, find another job buddy
