I wasn't going to write a review but after reading other people's reviews I feel the need to jump in. I went the other night and ordered food for myself, wife, and daughter. My salad looked lazily thrown together, my wife's sandwich was in pieces. She had to reassemble it when she took it out of the bag. But the icing on the cake was my daughter's peanut butter sandwich. Which had.....maybe a teaspoon of peanut butter on it. It was essentially 2 pieces of white bread. 

Avoid this Panera at all costs.

This Panera bread is always right on point.  Even in the midst of very busy times they find a way to get to the customer.  The staff is very attentive to the needs of everyone.  I love the fact that they encourage me to provide my number to check for points for free stuff!!! 

I have gone several times and I always have a great experience!

Ordered a soup for take out.  Brought it home and it had a long black hair in it.  Of course it went straight in the trash along with my appetite.  I contacted customer service to tell them about the unsanitary health condition.  They promised to send me a gift card for a free meal.  Never received it.  Stay away from this location.  It has happened to me more than once and they don't care.

This place is pretty bad.  I have never had a horrible experience here I have just had consistently bad food especially from this location.  

The size of the restaurant is very big & much bigger than it appears from the outside.  This Panera Bread is located right off of Biesterfield road & is in the middle of a shopping plaza located next to Jewel.  

When I came in here I ordered a grilled cheese & a soup.  The soup was absolutely terrible.  It had no flavor & tasted like some one just microwaved week old soup.  I ask myself how a restaurant could mess up a grilled cheese but sure enough this restaurant managed too.  The grilled cheese was stiff & overcooked & it almost appeared as if there was no cheese on it.  

The staff here was good at keeping the place clean & they seemed friendly but that was about the only positive of the place.  This last visit I had here will probably deter me from coming back here again.  

Overall the service was good & the staff was friendly but the food was absolutely terrible.  I definitely would not eat here again.

This place is garbage. General manager Elizabeth is a piece of shit. She argues with the clients, instead of having a solution to the problem she argues. I wanted to purchase slices of chicken for my daughter and she charged me 3.99 for an ounce. I asked for me and that's when she started getting rude with me. I been going here for 5 to 6 years and she is always a problem. I strongly believe this lady should get classes or training of being a professional in her position. I would really love for someone to fix this problem.
The manager had an extremely rude attitude and was really rude to me as well as her employees. Good was still good but she made me not want to come back here. At least not in the evening hours !

Myself and my two kids went to the Panera I chose above. Setting price aside (it's gotten ridiculous), the food was straight up not edible. I posted pictures on Facebook and received a ton of feedback (read: horror stories) and I became legitimately concerned about my children's food being dangerous for them. I threw my food directly in the garbage because my soup looked like a soup I've left on low in my crock pot on day three because I've simply forgotten it was there. I would never serve that to anyone let alone charge whatever you charged me for it. Even if I wanted to eat it, like perhaps if I was homeless and starving or some sort of prisoner of war and that's all that I was going to get, I still would have had a hard time eating it because the spoon they gave me had two different kinds of soup still on it. My son looked at his own soup and spoon with horror because he didn't visually inspect his before diving into the chicken noodle soup. Much like you guys, I love when people frighten my children when they try to make a healthy choice in a meal. Also, I'm obsessed with clean silverware. In my home, I pretty much completely wash the dishes before I load them into the dishwasher. If I had a spoon that simply refused to come clean (like Eve in the Garden of Eden or a group of teenagers smoking a joint pointing fingers at each other as to who it belonged to) I would throw it in the garbage.

I'm not even going to launch into the super brief experience I had with the staff. I should have used the Panera 2.0 crap you've installed in this store, but, and I know this is crazy... I actually like interacting with people IRL still. I made the wrong choice, though.

Your corporate office responds with the worst, most cobbled together, psych 101 inspired drivel its offensive.  You guys need to either go full robot or get back to basics and actually care about what you do.  

Maybe reinstate the employee of the month thing since either no one has won since 2013 or you guys are just horrible at keeping your plaques updated.

Finally, the green tea was delicious as always. Change everything about yourselves besides that.

Never getting food from this place again. I bought a Turkey BLT that cost me 10 dollars... I could've made a better sandwich than what I received. It seriously look disgusting. It was so sloppy made, the turkey and tomatoes and bacon were outside the bread... Like it's called a sandwich not a salad. I took one bite an threw it out. Do not go here!!!

Great food, poor service.  Our office has been going to this location for carry out for years.  Lately, service has really slipped.  Today, there were errors in our lunch order and it took an hour and a half before the order was ready!   What is the point of ordering online if it takes that long????  Order time 12:20, pick up time scheduled for 1:50!

Bagels good and deserts.  HOWEVER 3 times we have gone in the morning before 11 and they are already out of bagels !!!   Most ridiculous scenario for a BAGEL bakery to be out of plain bagels   Not like we walked in at 7 at night.   Obviously bad management and don't know how to order!!! One time and should not happen again.  Also always out of coffee In the coffee station and have to elk them and wait for new pot.

I used to really like Panera, but lately their quality has gone down, while their price just keeps going up.

The staff  here are, for the most part, friendly, though sometimes later in the afternoon I do get the feeling they are just about done with us customers (not that I blame them).  The dining area is comfortable and spacious (especially now that they've expanded).  

The two things that are really stopping me from coming back, though, are product availability and price.  

It seems like every time I come in, they are out of at least one item I want: the candy cookies, a bacon souffle, etc. (They really struggle with keeping those souffles in stock, and 75% of the time I go in to get one they don't have it available and it will be a 20-30 minute wait for more - I've just given up).  They also occasionally discontinue my favorite items, never to be seen again.  

Then there's the price.  Holy crap, this is getting bad!  They'd discontinued my favorite flatbread so I went a different route and got a shrimp salad and a cup of soup.  Along with my small iced tea, this ran me $13!!! For a tiny salad and a cup of soup (I'm not a large person and I was still hungry when I finished)!  I could've gone to an ACTUAL restaurant for that price.  
Their food really isn't worth the cost.  It's glorified fast food.  The soup is obvious made from a mix, and their breakfast sandwiches are greasy and taste a couple days old (the breakfast sandwiches cost more than Starbucks' and aren't as good).  The salads aren't bad, but I can get better at Portillos.  

The only thing that is really worth the trip is the souffles, but they only serve them in the morning and most of the time when I'm there, they've run out.

Make sure you double check your order! Was there on 7/6 after picking up my partner from a procedure at Alexian Brothers. Ordered mac n cheese and to group soups didn't see the mac n cheese in the bag the runner assured me it was there. Get home and guess what wasn't there the mac n cheese. Called talked to Lori told her i would be back in 20 min showed up Roger handed me the bag should have checked was ice cold called back talked to Lori again she said it was a miscommunication and they could send me a voucher for a free mac n cheese. I am not repeat not looking for anything free. I am looking for you to do your job and not waist my time my gas running back to a store twice to get my order right. Jim

This place has gone downhill.  I previously rated this location quite high-- not anymore.

The men's restroom is horribly filthy all of the time.  I have brought this to managers' attention 3 times and they simply do not care.  If the floors are constantly urine-soaked, you can only imagine the cleanliness of the kitchen. 

They have lost a longtime customer.

This is our home away from home. We enjoy chatting with the friendly staff who recognize regulars and new customers. Love the coffee and impressed by the expansion and the new, table-service technology. Panera Rewards card is a must-have for anyone who eats here regularly. Their biggest struggle: keeping the dining room clean; sometimes this is a problem. Also, since everyone likes their food, they sometimes run out of things. Used to be a group of obnoxious, political haters who used to spew their ignorance on weekday mornings; but haven't seen that crowd in some time - most of the customers are sweet people.

Very busy but the staff was very friendly and quick. I wasn't sure what to order because the menu is a little misleading. However, the staff was very attentive and the food was great! I even went back after I ate my lunch because I changed my mind and wanted a Danish. The girl at the counter remembered me and gave me the discount she offered the first time I went up. Great service! Thanks for the great experience, Panera!
Just like any other Panera.  Good food. Intimate modern place. Comfortable seating.   Plenty of elbow room. Plenty of parking. Don't forget I use your Rewards card to earn points.

My office ordered a special treat - hot chocolate and cookies - for our staff. It was perfect and delicious! The delivery gal was friendly, professional and prompt and the quality of the food and drinks were right on point. We are loyal supporters of Panera as a result of this great experience and with how they handle miscommunication/errors. They truly do make it right when things get mucked up. 
Today feels like a great Panera Soup day!

This review is mostly for the staff at this Panera. They never get the orders right. I didn't think ordering breakfast sandwich's would be such a difficult thing. Then they barely put any ham on the breakfast sandwich and very cheap with the cheese. I don't know what happened. The breakfast used to be great and the orders would always be accurate but lately it has been lacking.

Unfortunately this location is the closest in the area to my work. Over a span of three years, they have only gotten my order right one time. I've gone well over 20 times.. too many times to count and it never fails.  Bringing it to the manager's attention once, I was looked at like an inconvenience and that it really wasn't her problem.  Stop trying to upsell me when you can't get my order right.

Went in today to this for the first time with my family and the manager and cashier on duty made my visit a great experience! Had no trouble exchanging my picky sons order after he tried his first order! Wish I could of caught her name

I usually take my lunch a little later in the afternoon, so I find this location to be the perfect spot for my lunchtime retreat.  Quick service.  Sandwiches made to my specifications (I am picky).  Fairly clean - considering I stop in after the usual lunch rush.  Pleasant employees - and helpful!  Free wi-fi.  Comfy seats.  99 cent bakery add-ons.  And plenty of parking.  

They are very busy during the normal lunch rush and it can be a little annoying to try and find a seat at that time.  They are located with industrial parks and business offices all around, so I expect to find them to be crowded at that time.  If I head there early, I usually take my lunch to a local park and avoid the heavy crowd.  Stop in and grab a bite.

Every item in the menu tastes the same.  Saturated with salt. 
Not Only is it bland, it's expensive. $11 for soup and half panini combo with a softdrink. Really???

It's kind of hard to review a chain (almost pointless), but it's worth noting that it's a good place to eat, hang out and use their wifi.  I think the people are consistently nice and the coffee is decent.

Let's be honest, places like Panera (and McDonalds) are more about convenience and consistency.  You can say what you want about being over-priced, but this place is always packed.  They're doing something right.

I've visited this Panera many times.  I'm always greeted in a cordial and friendly manner.  The manager seems to be involved in the day to day operation and is always friendly to customers.  Of all the times I've been to this location, there have been very few mistakes on my order.

I do like coming here. I know its a chain but it really deserve some acknowledgement. I'm a big fan of their " Pick 2 " deal. I have tasted most of their sandwiches and soups and like them all. I have also had their salads and there all pretty good. I like the fact that they have lemon at the fountain drinks counter. 

This location does get pretty full at lunch time till about 1:15, after that if you go you should be able to find a seat.

I'm not too big on the pastry's but when I do get one I usually do the Cheese Pastry or the strawberry filled one. 

I will probably have a lot of Check In's here ;)
Slow service. Don't waste your time here. You would think that a place that serves coffee would have it ready at 7am.

My one stop shop for bagels, cream cheese, and coffee!

I've only visited this location to grab some bagels, spreads, and coffee on my way into the office. ((Occasionally I like the be the girl who everyone loves because she brings in breakfast. Who doesn't?!?)) With a variety of bagel and cream cheese flavors ((most reduced fat)), it seems like the natural option. Not to mention, a bakers dozen ((big old bagels)) and 2 cream cheese containers will cost you about whopping 12 bucks. Stellar deal. 

The staff has always been awesome. Given the usual morning rushes, they get you in and out in a timely fashion. There's no worries on being late to work. I also like that they don't give you any 'tude when you ask for your bakers dozen to be run through the slicer. ((We all know a plastic knife at the office won't cut a bagel for shit!!))

The rest of the menu is pretty darn good as well. However, this particular location is my favorite pit-stop to satisfy my ((and my hungry coworkers')) breakfast needs.

I love their broccoli cheddar soup! It's always extra hot which I love and the calorie count isn't bad. I had also  love their whole grain bagels with honey walnut cream cheese! Could use more workers on staff. It was 11 and only one person at the register, I had to wait 10 minutes to place my order and there was only 2 people in front of me. The person at the register was friendly and working as hard as they could but they had to slice the loaf of bread and take orders. Hopefully next time they will have more staff working during a lunch hour.

I have to say that I have always been a fan of Panera Bread.. love their food, even though I think its slightly over priced. ($8 for a sandwich on average?)

Anyway... I have to say that my experience with Service at THIS Panera has always been less than accommodating: the person who is waiting to take my order seems crabby and annoyed; and on numerous occasions, I get my food and my order is wrong: wrong soup, wrong sandwich, no chips, etc. (it has happened 4 times to be exact)

BUT my last visit really was the last straw.... they stop serving breakfast at 10:30. I arrived at Panera at 10:25 YES!!! just in time! So i thought. 
I stood in line for a few min, but when it was my turn to order I asked for a breakfast sandwich and the lady said very rudely "breakfast is over at 10:30" I check my watch to realize it is 10:32! ARE YOU SERIOUS???? they would NOT serve me breakfast... She then seemed annoyed, sighing loudly at me, while I had to look at the menu to select something else.


Between that, and the time before when the lady wouldn't take my Panera Rewards card because she said it was "pointless to scan it" You have lost a loyal customer. 

Maybe I will try another Panera, but I will not be going back to this one.
This is a typical Panera.  It has free wifi, pretty good food, and lots of seating.  The service could be a bit better, but the bakery makes up for it.

I stop here after running pretty regularly. I appreciate that the staff is happy to go over what's actually in these dishes (the salads have like 500 ingredients) and omit whatever I'm not feeling.  They have also made me some fresh coffee more than once because the carafes have been empty.

They have a great selection of bakery foods, soups and salads. I love the cinnamon cruch bagles! Super tasty! Service is decent, alothough when it's busy, it gets really crazy. 

The previous time I was here, my friend asked if they had any green apples and the girl looked at her like she was stupid and said "they're red apples," like it was preposterous to think that apples could be anything but red. 

Other than that instance, its a decent place.

This one's loosing my confidence. They seem to have a difficult time with the basics. I stop here on a frequent basis but today I went elsewhere. Things like not having coffee and not just on occasion but often they run out of two or three of four types  of coffee. counter personnel are often indifferent and unfriendly.

Panera is a great place to get a quick, "healthy" lunch that isn't soaked in grease. This location tends to get super crowded during the 12-1 lunch hour so I try to go at the tail end of noon or right before noon. If you do happen to get here during the peak time it is good to know that the lines do run fairly quick.

I always get the "pick 2" combo with broccoli cheddar soup and BBQ chopped chicken salad. My biggest complaint is that the to-go salad portion is MUCH smaller than the dine-in portion. Also, I always feel the need to ask for extra dressing as what they drizzle on the salad as well as the extra portion they give isn't enough. I tend to have a heavy hand with dressing. 

One of the last times I was here I ordered my usual and while I was waiting for my food I noticed that my receipt showed a totally different salad. I went up to the cashier who took my order and told her there was a mistake. She went to the kitchen area and loudly stated that "the customer changed her mind". Uh, no...don't make me look flaky. I didn't change my mind, you rang up my order wrong. Other than that one snafu, I haven't had any other issues with this location. A co-worker of mine goes here and she frequently mentions how they mess up her to-go order. I haven't had that happen to me, thank goodness.

Also, sign up for the Panera rewards club...as though you need one more key tag on your key chain. When I first signed up, I was getting rewards up the ying yang (free beverage, free dessert, free fruit smooth), now I barely get any. If you don't have your card on you, you can give your phone number.

Oh, and if you order a drink, you have the option of adding on a dessert for just 99cents! Who doesn't love a 99 cent dessert?

I've been to a number of Panera locations--Printer's Row, Crystal Lake, Des Plaines, Arlington Heights, you name it. This is my least favorite so far. Everything tastes the same as at any other location--it's the matter of getting your item/s and paying for them that's a problem.

In the past year, I notice that all of the Paneras I visit are making smaller batches to avoid wasting/not selling food. I'm ok with being told, "We don't have any french baguettes right now, but we're taking some out of the oven in about 5 minutes if you'd like to wait." What I truly dislike is coming in here at 3 in the afternoon and finding that not only are they out of most types of bagel, all types of baguette, sourdough bread bowls, and small loaves of country bread, but they aren't baking any more, either. What about all the people who come in on their way home from work  around 5:30 to grab some bread for dinner? I guess they can just walk over to the Jewel in the same strip mall to get it, unless they actually wanted a sourdough bread bowl, something Jewel and Dominick's don't carry.

I've popped in here a handful of times to grab stuff on my way home from Alexian Brothers, and every time they were out of something. The last time, it was dark roast coffee. There was no ETA on when they were going to brew more, and my husband was very tired from getting up early to take care of me, then not eating lunch because he wanted to stay nearby in case there was a complication during my procedure at Alexian. He settled for some lukewarm light roast coffee. Despite there being a large sign that says they always have fresh-brewed coffee, and despite every other Panera location I visit putting little tags on the coffee pots that states the time they were brewed, this location can't even promise their coffee will be hot.

Finally, the service is far below that of other Panera locations. On one occasion, I was in here just for a french baguette, which I grabbed from the kiosk near the entrance. I didn't need an employee for anything except to ring me up and take my cash. I had to wait over ten minutes when there was not even a line because the only employee on the registers was chatting about her college plans with what appeared to be one of her mother's friends. I tried waving at her a couple times, but she didn't react. Other employees walked past and one even made eye contact with me, but nobody asked if I needed help or offered to ring up my order. There's no reason why I should have to wait that long to pay for one item in a fully-staffed shop with only two other customers in it. On another occasion, employees walked past a spill on the floor again and again without cleaning it. Again, fully staffed shop; almost nobody in the place. Why can the crazy-busy Panera at Printer's Row manage to stay clean and keep up with things, but this much slower location cannot?
Great place for lunch or quick healthy meal. My favs are "you pick two" broccoli cheddar soup with either Greek salad or panini sandwich. Staff is always good and polite.
Best place to take lunch at. I usually take salad and you can't go wrong with any of them. It usually gets crowded at 12 but all managers are helping out.

I used to go there from time to time as I work near. But my last experience will be....well....my LAST!
I ordered an Asiago roast beef sandwich to go with chips.
Drove all the way back to work, opened the bag and unwrapped the sandwich.

did you know that when you order an Asiago Roast Beef sandwich...you have to STRESS you want the meat?? 

Yes folks.....opened sandwich and no beef

Wheres the beef!!

I drove back there, asked for the manager. pimpled faced 18 yr old tells me he is "one of them". I asked him to open the bag and tell me which sandwich this is that they have on the menu.

Needless to say, he was speachless and asked me "what kind of sandwich would you like it to be"

I said a free one...WITH MEAT!

Youth...wasted...
Skip the chicken napa salad, more bread than salad, not worth the price!

It's our favorite Mexican restaurant! We used to go to El Tapatio but since the chapalita is open - we love it. We recommend fajitas mix - really great! Large portions, tasty sides , affordable prices and really nice service ... we always questioned the quality of the service at El Tapatio...

I just tried the new seafood menu, the Langostinos were on point, good texture, savory and with good seasoning. The fish ceviche was given to me to test and it was good. I have to say that this is a good place to eat and have a good michelada to go with your sea food...delish delish delish

I am now a regular here! The service has gotten so much better! They're very friendly! The food is great. Not many taco places have tripas or cabeza, but they do! One thing that they should improve on is the horchata... It's too watered down and not creamy enough.

GREAT food.  
EXCELLENT service. 
REASONABLY priced. 
EXTREMELY clean. 

You can't get better than that.   

If you're looking for authentic Mexican food you need to get over to Chapalitas.  

Enjoy!

Rating is for service. You expect slower service in the beginning but sadly bad service still exists.  
Food is not bad so if you're  willing to wait, enjoy!

Last Friday we order 2 full orders chicken with rice and beans and we pick up in breaktime but ohhhh surprise I never test a terrible flavor of beans so old and then I call the manager and he told me the beans was ok??? Just the cocked guy put to much onions but I bring with me the container and manager smelled and he say was ok but he not want it test because smelled like very old? Please think about it if you want to order for expensive Fuck chicken
Still a fantastic lunch spot.  However Taco Tuesday is now Taco Wednesday.  Now I have to wait and extra day to get delicious tacos for $.99!!  just kidding.  I still go on Tuesdays.

Quite possibly my new favorite Mexican reataurant.  Had a variety of their tacos with just onions and cilantro and they were tremendous.  I usually stack on way more ingredients to add flavor but these stood on their own.  Guacamole was spicy and delicious.

Worst most dictating place I've ever been to. I hate this place. The owners are so stupid specially the old lady doesn't know how to have manners and charges everything different to different clients. They should close this please down even though it just opened totally not worth it

One of the best authentic Mexican spots around. All employees are friendly, prices are reasonable, and the food is excellent. Inside doesn't look all that special but don't let that fool you this place has some killer tacos!
Excellent food steak has no gristle or fat food is reasonable priced staff is very friendly wish they were open later for that late night snack very good overall

My wife and I love it so much it's been our Friday evening date for over 5 years.
I have order more than 70% of what is on the menu, and haven't been disappointed yet.

Our absolute favorite place for Mexican food!  Family owned, two locations, the tacos melt in your mouth.  Fresh ingredients and requests are honored. My husband asked for grilled jalapeños last night and got them...perfectly done.  Not a huge place and they usually have soccer playing on tv.  Check it out :)
Great tacos great tortas all around solid taco shop.... Horchata is really good.. Do yourself a favor and ask for cilantro and onions only on your tacos...
You can be successful in a slow pace but with quality service and food , this place has always been delicious , welcoming and quality service and food
I don't know why this place has such good reviews. Yes the service is good, but the food is terrible! I will not return.

The food quality had gone down slightly. However, it is good nonetheless. I recommend dining in because they give you chips and house made salsa. The salsa has just the right amount of heat, as does their hot sauce. The owner is very friendly and polite. I've been going there since 2006. I wish the group of el rodeo the best.

This little gem is tucked away between Hoffman and streamwood. I cannot believe this is my first time there considering how many times I have passed this place up.

The ambiance of the restaurant is exactly what I would expect from a gem on the outskirts of streamwood. The would be a decent place to bring a small family but, I wouldn't recommend it for a large gathering.

The food was beyond expectations and I could not be happier with my discovery. Everywhere I have lived I have searched long and hard for that go to Mexican spot that offered flavorful tacos with the authentic taste.

The tripa tacos were cooked to perfection with the right amount of crunch and without a trace of burnt flavor. The chicharron tacos melted in your mouth due the right ratio of skin and fat. It still offered a bit of crunch and tenderness like it was hand picked from the pig. The lengua taco was exceptionally delicious due to the fact that they not only have the right combination of fat and meat but, their process of cooking the lengua reminded me of shredded pork pulled from a pig roast. 

I would highly recommend this place especially if you're into authentic Mexican food and I will definitely frequent this establishment more often.

I am always on the hunt for a good Mexican joint. We have ordered take out from here about four times now. Never have eaten in but would totally would for a quick lunch. This is a waaay casual spot and the dining room isn't what I would call "appealing". The kitchen appears well maintained and I feel completely comfortable ordering food from here. 

My husband and I both much appreciate and quite enjoy how generous they are with their portions. Three taco dinner each taco jam packed with chicken, steak, pork, beef, you name it! They will allow you to select a different protein for each of the three tacos. We typically order double rice with no beans but I would say I do like the beans better than the rice. Sadly, I do not care for beans all that much. The rice is simply put, just fine.. It's not the best but it's fine. The tortillas are fresh and the meat is tender. 

We pay about the same for 2 three taco dinners as we do for two meals at Chipotle which is not intended to compare the food but simply the pricing. 

The quality of the rice and the interior of the restaurant is where they lose the fifth star from me. We will continue to order from here and support our local businesses!!

I love this place for their enchiladas with green sauce (red is too mild) and taquitos/flautas. I also love their chile relleno tacos. It's pretty much a dive, but their food is good and the service great. It's only got about 7 or 8 tables so I typically ordered takeout. I don't live near there anymore, but I was in the area recently so stopped in. It's still yummy!

The best place to get Mexican food! The place is a bit small for the large amount of people that come here. Hopefully they can expand someday. The waiters are very nice and attentive. Try their sopes, tacos and torta poblana.

This is the best Mexican food in Streamwood! I should know... I've tried the others. This is the only place I go back to.  Torta, burrito, or taco? Take your pick. They're all wonderful.  On nights when I'm just picking-up, I like to drink a Modelo and watch Telanovelas on their tv while I wait. Good times. Good eats.

I'm not really sure what all the rave is about. My food was cold and flavorless. I had a chicken burrito and expected to be able to taste the meat but the whole inside was just a pile of mush. Will not return.

Came back from Mexico for our honeymoon, and I'd been craving authentic Mexican since Sept 2015. I dragged my sickly husband (he exaggerates) and checked out a local joint near Hanover Park. He ordered the Mr. Burrito Special - complete with fresh fries and "can of pop," and I had the 3 Tacos meal with beans and rice. Let me tell you, the first bite into that perfectly fried tortilla packed with fresh tomatoes, cheese, and perfectly cooked steak made my heart take a leap and soar across the restaurant. I found my flavor at El Rodeo Tacos. You should too.

Saw on Yelp that they scored 4.5 out of 5 stars. So I had to try it. Ordered the steak taco.... The flavor was incredible. I also ordered the chorizo taco as well, not greasy and delicious. The salsa had just the right amount of heat. I will be going back.

This place been our Friday night dinner tradition for over 8 years now. Best Mexican food around, trust me, I eat it more than I should. Carne asada tacos have won my heart but everything on the menu is delicious. Every time I bring someone new they are always asking to come back.

Best... tacos... Ever! Normally I drive into the city to quench my thirsts for tacos. NOT anymore. The carne asada tacos are the best that I've had in the area. They pile on the meat, then add cilantro and onions. They cram all of that into a double tortilla and wrap it in foil to keep it nice and warm. I couldn't ask for a better taco. 

Great job...

The taco dinner was fantastic. Im from Chicago but I've been living in this area for 29 years and never knew about el rodeo tacos. Every time I wanted Mexican food I would drive to the city not no more. I will be coming here for now on. Eat here you won't regret it. The stuff is great.
Simply delicious! Very good portion size and not too greasy. The steak burrito had a lot of meat. Very good flavored. The fries are crispy. Highly recommend!!!

OMG!  We have found it -- one awesome Mexican Take out place.  Thank you yelp and to all of the awesome reviews...plus we were even more happy to find out that we could literally walk here.

Anywho... ordered dinner from here and I was floored by how cheap everything was and how fantastic their Al Pastor tacos are (they are my fave).  Tons of meat, tons of flavor, didn't go crazy with onions and cilantro.  Loved the salsa they put in our take out bag.

Will be back over and over...

a no-nonsense taco joint for a fair price.
the tacos cabeza was really tender. recommended.
Fast, friendly, tasty. Two tacos and they still have me chips and salsa. Asada was really good. Will go back if in the area for tacos under $2

Love this location it's actually better than the one located on Irving park the only reason they are getting 4 stars instead of 5 is because they close at 9 unlike the other taco joints in the area but if you are looking for authentic Mexican food give this place a try you won't regret it

Very friendly  staff. I had the 3 taco plate. 2 Asad and 1  al pastor. The al pastor taco was delicious! It has hard for me to find a good pastor taco since I moved here. The asada tacos were good as expected. What I appreciated was the home made salsa with the corn chips also the beans are very similar to what my dad makes. This place is awesome!

This was my first visit to El Rodeo. Food and customer service was excellent!! Both of those thing plays a big part in a restaurant experience.  Prices are reasonable as well. Definitely will return again.

$1.75 tacos - sure the price can be beat by the (tons of) other hole-in-the-wall Mexican places in Streamwood, but there's something about this place that makes it one to remember. 

Maybe it's the boxes of unpacked bottles of beer stacked in front of the counter... or the collections of bottle caps underneath a bottle opener stuck to the wall... or it could be the jukebox that just so happens to play after you make your order... or that super smiley guy behind the register that waits patiently as you try to decide between tacos al pastor or lengua (tongue), then decide to get both. 

Whatever it is - it works. Adorable little place with phenomal tacos al pastor - very flavorful and a niiice helping of meat. I think we got one of each on the menu. Carnitas was good too - had a good crunch to it. Tasted a lot like Filipino lechon. Yummm.

The paper menu has more options than the big menu behind the register, if I would have known, I would have grabbed a torta as well. Next time!
My fiancé and I come here once a week! Great food, great prices, and extremely nice people!

I ordered chicken taco, torta, and tamale.  The taco was alright. The lettuce was soggy and the chicken tasted off a little.  The torta was also the same.  The tamale was hard and crunchy and didn't have much taste to it.

Looking for Mexican and found this based on reviews, and frankly had better at Chipotle!   Would not rate this 5 stars as others have done.

Very salty steak tacos and burritos....with fat bits mixed in with meat.  Also too greasy for my wife.  Chicken tacos looked and tasted like it was processed. Lettuce, tomato and shredded cheese were the only toppings.  Was expecting cilantro and onions.  Lettuce and tomatoes were not fresh. Refried beans and rice were average.  Chips were greasy, but salsa was decent.

Our family was hungry, so we ordered takeout.  I should have order just a few tacos to sample before going all in.  Ended up eating half of what we purchased and instead had leftovers from night before to complete our dinner.

Greasy, salty and cheap.  Maybe my expectations were too high based on other reviews.

I've been back here more than a dozen times since discovering El Rodeo and I'll be back for a dozen more.  I'm usually the type of guy who orders something new, but after having their tacos and quesadillas, I can't get anything else.  I love their Al Pastor tacos, served with the usual fixins - cilantro, onions, lime, and don't forget the homemade hot sauce.  But my recent favorite is the Tripa, fried crispy unlike some other places.  Not too greasy and packed with flavor.

Cheese Quesadillas, woah are they addictive!  The tortilla is hot, crispy, and packed with delicious ooey gooey Mexican cheese.  I don't even bother adding any meat, it's just cheese perfection.

I love this type of hole in the wall, family-owned joint, cooking up some great food.  They've quickly become my go-to spot for Mexican in the burbs.  I can't get enough!

Amazing Mexican fast food! My husband and I have come here several times and never been disappointed (especially as vegetarians). Some recommended dishes: chilaquiles (red or green sauce), nachos, chimichanga, burritos etc... Big servings for descent pricing!  Don't go for the ambience, go for the food!!!

Hands down the best authentic Mexican food in all of Schaumburg period! The cost is low, but the flavor is high.
This place is a true hidden gem, and while there are always plenty of Mexican restaurants in any neighborhood, this one is the best.  
I usually get the steak tacos, and am never disappointed.
Try the horchata!

Just discovered this excellent spot for authentic Mexican food. It will take a while to try everything on the large menu, but everything I have tried so far has been outstanding.

The three taco meal is a great deal. Steak, chicken, beef tongue, and ground beef are all excellent. The tamales are also memorable and served in the corn husk.

Highly recommended!

Great family restaurant. I have been at El Rodeo numerous times and never had a bad meal.  The owner is friendly and always thanking you for your business. The pricing is reasonable and the menu has a lot of items.  My favorite is the pastor tacos.

I normally don't eat at small places like this but I was surprised at how good their burritos were. I ordered a Carne Azada (Steak) burrito and it was a decent size. Would recommend this place for a good burrito.

How the WORLD have I not written a review for this place yet?!  It's my go-to for inexpensive, quality Mexican food.  It doesn't hurt that I can practically see it from my front door!!

I have been here many times since we moved to the area a few years ago.  I have had the steak tacos, the steak burritos, some tortas, and the quesadillas as my go-to meals.  My favorite out of those are the quesadillas.  They are NOT good for you whatsoever, however, they are a really delicious comfort food.  This is the kind of authenticity that has the delicious grease at the bottom of your to-go container and I  don't even CARE because it's so delicious!!

Trust me, one bite and you won't care either.  This is not your Taco Bell, my friends!

The sides that come with many meals are good, too!  They don't skimp.  The atmosphere feels authentic (including the Mexican soaps on their little TV when you dine in).  They are fast, they are friendly, and they are quality.
I've been getting burritos from here for five or so years now. The steak burritos are excellent and I've enjoyed seeing the family that runs the place grow up.

Best authentic Mexican place around this area! My favorite is there Steak tacos and tortas yummy! I dont think theres one thing in there menu that isnt good!! Will keep on coming back. Prices are so reasonable. Try there Horchata !! The only problem is that its small place and sometimes it gets packed. It would be awesome if they would expand but if its packed I  order to go which is fine too because what matters is that I get my delicious food. Lol. Try there food you won't be disappointed!
We've eaten in and carried out. Haven't been disappointed yet. This place has become one of our favorite places. The staff is also great.

Hands down... The beat Mexican food in the Schaumburg area!  I love the steak taco's my favorite!!!!!  i know everyone has different tastes... but I've been to all the authentic Mexican restaurants in this area and none are even close to this one!

I have ridden the taco bull many times at El Rodeo. But it never lasts 8 seconds before that taco is all the way in my mouth hole. The chicken tacos will buck and kick your taste buds into a frenzy with its unique seasoning, probably the best chicken tacos I have had and I have ridden a lot of taco bulls throughout the Chicagoland area amigo. I would also recommend taking a ride on the Steak and Pablano torta. Its a real arm jerker.

Admittedly, I thought there might be pictures of some guy getting bucked off a horse or gored by a bull on the walls of El Rodeo, but I was wrong. Other than the name, El Rodeo holds no ties or themes regarding the famous Southwestern sporting event of the same name. Sorry rodeo fans.

People at work swear by El Rodeo, and now I know why. I enjoy a good taco, and this place has some of the best. In fact, my whole experience was really very nice, and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a great hole-in-the-wall taco establishment.

The service I had was upbeat and friendly, and my food came up pretty fast. While I was waiting, I gave the chips and salsa a try- absolutely fantastic. I suspect that it contained black beans because there was a little smokiness to it. I enjoy smokiness in my stuff. It's a flavor I think I'd like to experience in more salsas. Also, the salsa is spicy, another thing that I really like.

Make no mistake, this is not a pretty place to eat, and they sometimes play their jukebox kind of loud. But if you go there, at those times just take a minute to remind yourself where you are: El Rodeo. Yee-ha. Eat them tacos.

I can't bring myself to agree with all of the other reviews. El Rodeo is your basic taco joint that doesn't deliver as far as the normal menu items but there are some surprises hidden in the menu.

 All of the tacos iv'e had from there tend to be dry and on the small side. The carne asada, carnitas, al pastor, and chorizo were just average - nice seasoning but both times just overcooked. Same thing with the burritos - just a ton of overcooked gritty meat. I mean they have a chance as long as they don't kill the meat more than it already is.

So the diamonds in the rough are the tortas and the hard shell tacos. Yah I know its weird but the breaded steak (milanese) torta is a perfect combo of tender steak, creamy guac, and a nice soft roll. On the other hand the hard shell tacos (my mom wanted to try them) remind me a little of those crappy BK or Jack-In-The-Box tacos but 10x better. Fresh and crispy tacos that more than make up for the filling being a little bit dry.

Short but sweet - skip the regular tacos and go for the hard shell and skip the burrito and go for the torta. You will thank me later.

I have been going here for years, and I live in downtown Chicago. When I am in the Schaumburg/Hoffman Estates area, I always make time for a cold beer and some tacos, especially the pork. The owner is a nice man and the staff is genuine, the food is excellent, and so cheap. I always forget to write a review, but here you go, a loyal client for sure, if this was downtown it would be a huge hit.

Best steak tacos! Very authentic! I ate tacos that Taste just like this from a small vendor in Mexico!

The restaurant is small, family run and nothing fancy. But the chips and salsa make it worth staying In for...

Steak tacos with a bottle of Mango Jarritos will def hit the spot - highly recommended for lunch or a super casual dinner.

Oh, and thebp best part is- it's dirt cheap!

I freakin' love this place.  I actually debated giving it just 2 stars to scare away folks that may overwhelm this small eatery.
It's clean, it's neighborly, run by a great and friendly staff/family and best of all, the food is fantastic and on the inexpensive side.
So... Try it out at lunch.  I am a fan of the Tacos de Cecina (steak steamed with jalapeños).
But don't you all try it at once or it'll just be another joint with a line to the door and average, mass produced meals.

Kudos to El Rodeo for pulling off total dive with charm and class.
I always get the tacos and they are always delightful. I request flour tortillas instead of corn.. lovely that they have that option! Recently I tried the chile relleno and i was blown away. SO good. 

I'm also quite fond of the nice man who runs the place and the jukebox that randomly plays popular songs in Spanish.
When I say "popular," think "titanic theme song" and by "play" i mean you have to stop your conversation until the song is over. Totally fun, right?  

I've yet to find better Mexican for the price.

ENHOY!
Good burrito with fries. The food is always good and you get a lot for your money.

We were very excited to go here based on all the positive reviews.  It started out well.  The guy who took our order was very nice and very helpful.  It sort of fell apart once we started eating.

I had the enchiladas with mole.  Meh...It was ok but not very flavorful.  My wife also has enchiladas and she thought the same thing.  The chips/salsa - meh...again, not much flavor but nice heat.

We probably won't go back when Los Burritos Tapatios is a short drive down the road.  Hmmm, maybe it isn't all that bad and we are comparing it to a place we really like.  Ok, I guess I'll go back and try something else just to make sure.
Their tacos are to die for!

Pretty good food; great prices; limited sitting; pretty authetic tasting options; good refried beans; salsa a little hot but I'm a mild tasting guy so not a great judge; friendly service and the food was served in a very timely matter

For starters this had been a favorite of ours for years however the last few times have been questionable. Not only do we eat there we also do carry out. Not to long ago we dined in and I ordered the chicken flautas which are usually very yummy. The chicken inside the rolled and fried tortillas was burnt. I didn't say anything because we are "regulars" and chalked it up to just one of those things...The next time we go my husband orders beef tacos and the ground beef is burnt. Ok he should have said something and had them make him another order but he is not a complainer and like me just chalked it up to one of those things...

Last week my husband came home with chicken tacos for me and beef for him. Mine was okay but again BOTH of his tacos were filled with ground beef that was hard as a rock because it probably had been sitting on the grill for too long and BURNT. Plus, the taco shells are a lot smaller then what they used to be. LOL! the price went up, burnt food and the taco shells got smaller. I mean I seriously wondered where they could have gotten shells that small. 

I have always found the place to be mom and pop and very clean. It most likely will be awhile before we go back.

This place is just outstanding, inexpensive Mexican fare; nothing more can be or needs to be said. Everything here is great, my favorites being their tacos and tortas. Their corn tortillas are superb, as is their green salsa.

Do yourself a favor and eat at El Rodeo often.
Average food at best, not a fan of there steak they use. I find it hard to believe people think there deserving of the ratings they have, there is much better Mexican food out there.
One of the better Mexican restaurants around.  Had a pablano torta. Steak was very tender. Service was friendly and fast. Definitely will return.
This place is damn good. Nice people too. Good hot sauce, good salsa, good meat.

I am very picky about my food but this restaurant gets 5 stars from me. They have the most delicious mexican food I have ever had. I highly recommend the chicken or beef tacos and the chicken quesadillas. The workers are very friendly and the owner is fantastic. 5 stars for customer service, as well!
Could have gotten a better burrito at Taco Bell. Steak meat tasted like it was in the fridge for two days then warmed up in the microwave. Will def not be going back.
This is an absolutely amazing gem of a Mexican restaurant. The staff is friendly and attentive and the food is ridiculously good. This is the best Mexican food in the area no question!

Stopped here to try them out as a part of my ongoing quest for the best taco joint in the area.
The food was good, and the service friendly. Stuffed peppers not up to the level of the great peppers at La Flor. Al pastor tacos had better meat quality, though. I love the liberal use of cilantro.
Guacamole is made with tomatoes here which makes it soggy and bland - under salted too. 
A solid place to go in the neighborhood but not worth a special drive.
If you love a real place where real people cook real food for you, with their own unique take on style and flavor, just come here.  Try the gorditas and chiles rellenos!  What a find!

Great place for lunch if you like good Mexican food.  If you dine in, you get free chips and salsa.  The salsa is very good.  I order the 3 taco special with one chicken taco, one chorizo taco, and one chile relleno taco.  It's a great value and the food is delicious.  

There are only a few larger tables and the dining room is small, so come early for lunch if you are bringing a group.

El Rodeo Tacos is a hidden gem and is one of the better authentic mexican restaurants located in the northwest suburbs. I've been coming here for about twelve years and it has never let me down. I have had there enchilada's, burritos, and tacos which are very good. The food quality is good and flavorful. Free chips and salsa is a added bonus.The gentleman here (I believe he's the owner) is extremely polite and assiduous. If your looking for authentic Mexican food then I would definitely recommend trying El Rodeo.
Very good restaurant to eat Mexican food. Very nice restaurant
Excellent, excellent low cost authentic Mexican food.  Spicy and flavorful.  Great salsa and chips while you wait.

I've been coming here for the past 10 and to see that its still standing when all the business around El Rodeo open and close with in the first year says alot.  The food is incredible for the price.  From the tacos to the burritos, you can taste the freshness of ingredients.  Simply the BEST!

El Rodeo is my weekly lifesaver. 
It is located around the corner from my place... and on those lazy cooking days, guess where we go/pick up from! 
At first, all I ever ordered was the Al Pastor tacos... they are so delicious. Juicy, saucy, flavorful pork, tucked into a warm corn tortilla, and topped with some chopped onion and cilantro. Two of those babies, a medium orchata, and I'm good to go! 
The hubby has tried a few menu items, from tacos to their carne asada platter, to the lomo. I gotta say, the lomo dish is delicious. The sauce it comes in is almost a mole, but lighter. 
All of these orders were delicious, substantial and satisfying. Until we tried the carne asada gordita. 
We get it with avo, splash some salsa verde on it...  and it is pure flavorful deliciousness. 
(I was recently in NYC and tried Caracas arepas... I wanted to love them, I really did.... but this hole-in-the-wall taco joint near my house has gorditas that are a homerun!)
Anyhow. you owe it to yourself to stop by this place one day. It's seriously nothing fancy, but the food is fresh and delicious, and after 3 visits, they'll know your name. :)
I've tried numerous hole-in-the-wall mexican restaurants, and this place still has THE best chile rellenos entree.

What a shame. Food is great, but it's too bad that we were treated badly. Unfortunately we noticed this by the people surrounding us. We are not of hispanic origin, and they made sure we knew that. I thought my money was the same color....

This address F.W. I'm white and I've never felt out of place at El Rodeo. The owner and his family have always been nice to me and my family. I think they're the type of people that takes a bit to warm up on you.  Also the clientele has never once bother me a bit. My parents are from another country and I know at times they can come off as being cold when in fact they're just being self-conscious about their accents and pronunciations. Shockingly a lot of foreign folk think people view them as unintelligent or aggressive due to their accents. That's typically why they're cold and to the point around strangers.

We stopped by just for an early dinner and stood there for a couple minutes since the hostess wasn't prepared to see us yet and was sitting at the bar folding napkins. One of the waiters saw us first and seated us at a table.

For drinks, they had a big wine list and a bar with different alcohol choices. They don't have any draft beer but do have a good selection of bottled beer.

We had Rigatoni Rustica and my wife had a gluten-free seafood pasta. The food was excellent and my pasta was cooked perfectly - al dente.

The service was so-so but that looks like it depends on if you are a regular or not. It seemed like the staff seemed to be very attentive to a couple tables and it sounded like they were all friends. We weren't regulars and while we weren't abandoned, we weren't looked after like the regulars. Also while we were still eating, one of the staff asked us if we wanted a box and it seemed that he rushing us to finish.

Overall, pretty good place but not perfect.
Excellent service, beyond excellent food, fantastic romantic atmosphere. They really went above and beyond to make it a great evening. Definitely will be a regular for me now.

My sister's baby shower was held here, and it could NOT have been better. I was a little skeptical when I saw the outside -- okay so I'm a snob -- but it was way better than I could have imagined.

Not only was the food amazing, the room was perfect and the staff was so nice, one of the owners helped coordinate the event and he was soooo helpful! He made amazing suggestions without being intrusive that made the day even better.

And this place is so affordable! 

Seriously, have your event here.

It was a while since we ate here.  Came back and was dissapointed.  Service was terrible.  Waiter was working the bar and tables at the same time.  Messed up on our simple drink order and waited about 15 minutes between coming back to take our order.  Brought out salad instead of soup.  Found was hot and decent but proportions were very small for  price of the plate.  Had to ask bus boy for refills on our drinks.  Some one else served our food and waiter only returned to drop off our bill.  Was going to pay by debit but after waiter never returned left cash.  No suggestive sell on coffee or dessert.  It was a Thursday nite and was not that busy.  Probably will not return.

Incredible service!
Awesome spot!
Food is right on the money! Drinks are good!
Tightly run, keep it up guys!

Terrific daily special of fresh fish prepared Italian style. 10 of us seated in small room off main dining area. 6 people raved about fish, remainder had veal, pasta, chicken. Good, attentive service. Entertainment Fri/Sat is too loud for room but we were able to close door in order to visit. Extensive menu; enjoy the complimentary bread, olives, sorbet after salad course.

Villagio advitises heavily in groupon, so we bought and went there. Its on lake street in a ho hum strip mall in basement, but their attitude anything but ho hum basement cum stripmall cum lake street. We were told to take "Reservations" when we walked in since in basement, smelled overwhelmingly fishy. We were seated in the middle of room in the path of going coming waiters who often bumped into me,spilled whatever I was eating, drinking, half of dining area by windows empty until we finished eating. They insisted we order appetizers, when I refused the waiter rolled his eyes. Forced to order 4 entrees for 3, clearly says so many dollars worth of food. My entrée eggpla
nt parmigiano was definitely frozen heated in microwave. In my rating not worth even one star. Ambiance, service,taste a big Zero.

Maybe I went at an inopportune moment. But we were the only ones when we dined for lunch. The food was OK. To be honest I can get better from other restaurants I more often frequent. Service was adequate. But what bothered me most was the flies. We switched tables once...maybe twice. But the moment food is served they want over. I found it hard to enjoy when that was happening.

I love this restaurant. My husband and I have been coming here since our rehearsal dinner, 7 years ago. Every experience is great. We've been a party of 2 all the way up to the rehearsal dinner that was close to 40. The wait staff are attentive and knowledgeable. Not all the pastas are house made but all are good and the house made are extra awesome. Come here and eat, its great!

Mehh. I'm not super impressed. Their pasta in vodka sauce is very good. But their chicken vesuvio was terrible. I mean it was flavorless, dry, and made with a boneless chicken breast. I have never seen chicken vesuvio made with a boneless breast. Very disappointed about the chicken vesuvio.  They do however give tasty bread and focaccia which helps.

I visited this lovely restaurant on my second trip to  Chicago.  We met extended family on a  Friday night in March. Incredible music, delicious  food...we will come back! I  love the  lobster ravioli and the moscato.  My boyfriend  enjoyed the  veal.

I'm surprised this place is not running over with patrons. The food is very good and I love that they serve you lemon sherbet after soup, salad and appetizers.  The chicken Vesuvio with grilled vegetables and roasted potatoes was a delicious lunch. Enough in fact for 2 lunches. All the pasta and risotto was great.  Good wine list and friendly service.  Chocolate mouse pie and flourless lava cake was to die for.  Service was a little lackluster but friendly.  They also have live entertainment on Friday nights that you will enjoy if you are over 50.
Fantastic food very clean place. The only thing bad is the service is slow.if you're on lunch don't come here for dinner I'm sure it would be fine but it takes way too long to get your food.

Dinner was fantastic yet again! This place is a local gem that doesn't miss when creating a great dining experience. Have tried multiple apps and entrees none of which weren't amazing. They also have great desserts try the lemon cake it's out of this world!

OK.   Calamari was chewy. 

Got the lobster ravioli.... Not sure what everyone is racing about.  This place is below average at best.  :-(

You know when you love a restaurant and you want to tell everyone about it?  But you're afraid if you do, then everyone will go and things may change?  I want to keep this to myself but I owe it to the staff at Villagio to do this. The staff is amazing!  So friendly, helpful and humorous. The food is delicious!  I've had one dish on the menu I did not like, but their menu is large and plenty of great things to choose from. If you ask your server for recommendations, you won't be disappointed!  Try the lemon cake for dessert, OMG!

I didn't find the food to be that good...  I had the lasagna and to me it was too runny and not much flavor, very plain.  Appetizers were semi warm and not much flavor, you can tell they were not fresh but frozen.  The bread that was brought to the table was excellent.  The service was friendly overall, however server spent a lot of time talking and kissing inbound customers that didn't belong to his service area.  Confused by other servers bringing food?  I was asked only once if my cocktail needed to be refilled, over an hour being there.  Finally, atmosphere seemed to be geared to an older crowd of 60+...  I will not be returning!!!!
One of the BEST Italian restaurants in the Chicago area!  I've been a loyal customer for years and would go there if I lived 50 miles away.

We brought several friends to Villiaggio to see the Vito Zatto show and it was a great evening of good food, great music and lots of launghs! 

The food was good - our table had a variety of pasta, seafood and chicken dishes.  The lasagna was a big hit as well as the linguini frutti de mare.   The desserts were also delicious - spumoni, cannoli and a wild berry tart with ice cream (my favorite of the three).

We really came to this restaurant for the show but were very pleased with the meal and the service.  Villaggio's is not in our backyard and there are lots of great Italian places that are much closer for us but the food is good enough to make the trip, especially for a special event like this one or as a central meeting point for friends scattered in areas west or north.

WAAAAAAH!!!  Why can't 1/2 stars be an option?!  This would definitely be a 4 1/2 star review if I've ever written one!

A couple girlfriends and I met here on a Monday night for some yummy drinks and Italian food.  We got nothing less than the best--the best service, amazing food, and a really fun and funny environment.

The service was spot on.  We had people checking in on us constantly but without being intrusive.  They were making sure we had everything we needed and that everything that we ordered was good.  And trust me, it was.

We were one of two tables in there when we first walked in around dinnertime on this particular Monday.  It surprised me that they weren't more busy, but it WAS one of the Hawks playoff game.  I'm sure not many people thought to themselves "Where would be a great place to watch the game--A fancy Italian joint!!".  It wasn't bad news for us, because the service was amazing :)

We weren't quite sure what to order for drinks at first.  Well, my cohorts didn't--It was Tequila Monday for me, so I got a margarita no salt--make no mistake.  This was one of the BEST margaritas I've ever had!  My friends got the house pinot and prosecco.  Very good as well, but my drink was very strong but very smooth--definitely a hit at the table!

We ordered the calamari (fried) as an appetizer.  It was AMAZING.  They even serve it onto plates for you.  I am serious, the service here was top notch!  For our meals, my one friend ordered the lobster ravioli, I had the Rigatoni, and our other friend had a really fresh-tasting pasta dish with a lot of vegetables (not sure what it was called, but it was yummy!)

My rigatoni was AMAZING!!  It was just the right balance of sauce and noodles as well as some of the best tasting crumbled italian sausage I have ever had!  The dish was HUGE, too.  The other meals were good, but I loved the sauce on my dish as well as the freshness of the pasta.

We each had a dessert--because why wouldn't we?!  All of them come on a long plate and the presentation is beautiful.  Furthermore, the taste is amazing--which is kinda the best part.

The only downside is the price, but I guess that's what you pay for amazing food!  I will definitely be back again and again!!  My friends are in 100% agreement!

This place is garbage. They seated us in an area where the lights are basically off. Then they told us they will come out with the complimentary bread, but never do. They took 20 minutes to bring out a dessert plate (restaurant was empty). The lava cake they brought out came out to be $7.57. There was so little on the plate it was worth no more than two dollars. They never came to our table to ask us if we need anything or how the meal was. It took us a while to get there attention to get the check. Horrible place, dont waste your time hitting up this garbage hole in the wall.

Lovely place. From the moment we walked in, we loved the warm and inviting atmosphere. The waiter was very nice, attending and very knowledgeable about their dishes. We started with wine and appetizer platter suggested by our waiter and were very happy with the choice. I ordered salmon with roasted potatoes and sautéed spinach and everything was melting in my mouth. Couldn't stop eating. We are coming back for sure.

Great food! They were very crowded on a Saturday night so make sure you make a reservation. We didn't have  a reservation and waited about 20 minutes. the food was definitely worth the wait! We will be back!

What a great place...food was fabulous, service was exemplary, staff was on top of everything!  Can't say enough good things; however, our server "Melissa" was absolutely OUTSTANDING!  Have never had such a personable, sincerely nice, and very good server all in one!  Thank you Melissa for a fantastic experience!

Sheryl K
Bartlett, IL

It felt like home from the second I walked in the door.  The staff is very friendly and accomodating.  Food was excellent and enjoyed the variety of chef specials they had, it was hard to choose!  Loved the limencello shots at the end.  Highly recommend and will be back!

Villaggio is a pretty good Italian place overall, but there are some things that made me give the stink eye, thus the knock down from a 5 to a 4...sorry, Paisans.

The Good-  
1)  The pre-meal mangia.  It's good.  It's plentiful.  It's different.  Yes, you get the whole bread with oil thing, BUT you also get some parmesan without asking.  (Thank you!)  AND you get a small olive plate and some delicious red dipping sauce as well.  YUM.  
2)  The marinara is delicious.  And I am a HUGE marinara snob.  So there's that.
3)  The eggplant parmesan was awesome.  The only thing I would ask for next time is more marinara.  (See also:  reason #2)
4)  Service is pretty good and everyone in the restaurant seems to help each other out.  I like that.  
5)  They have a decent wine list including some local wine too.  Lynfred, HOLLA!!

The Bad-
1)  The place is really small and almost feels like you're interrupting a family meal if you aren't a regular there.  I guess I just need to come more often?
2)  The service is definitely different for regulars.  I get that.  Really, I do.  But if you're going to start passing out Italian Ice, or Limoncello, or Gelato...pass some over here too, man.
3)  The minestrone was meh.  Not BAD, necessarily, but just ok.  

The Ugly-
1)  There really is no UGLY, I guess.  I just feel like you can't do a good and bad without an ugly too.

Villaggio is my favorite Italian restaurant. I've been here twice and can't wait to go back.

Their entrees come with a daily soup or salad and both are great. The first time, I had the Capellini Fra'Diavola and the second, the Linguine Campagnola. Both were incredible- really fresh and so delicious. During our second visit, we also had their tiramisu and creme brulee- so good!

I can't remember much about their wine list, but we enjoyed the wine we had both times. Service is a little inconsistent, especially when they get busy, but their food is definitely worth a visit!

Villaggio recently had another Groupon this time for lunch and Dinner, being that I already ate dinner there I decided to go out for lunch with my friend. We were both shocked on how good it was. I can not for the live of me spell the things we ate but it was damn good! The staff were very warm and kind and they didn't get upset when we butchered the names of the dishes. After lunch we wanted to try some Italian desserts. I had this wonderful Italian ice cream with roasted almonds with honey drizzled on top with raspberry sauce decorating the plate. It was to die for! My friend opted for Tiramasu. All in all I was very impressed and will be coming back again.

Since the last time I came here, this place has undergone some minor changes. 

1. They got new more stylish menu's with a few small menu/price changes. 

2. They changed some some staff...I think. 

As to the menu, they now offer a free soup or salad included with the split charge which I think is a pleasant surprise. I'm usually never a fan of split charges because its like charging you extra to dump the food on 2 plates instead of one. The fact that you're getting something makes this way better. 

Now every time I've come here so far, something went wrong with the service. This time it was SPOT ON PERFECT! Thanks to an attentive young waitress named Melissa who provided quick and efficient service.  

Food was still good and the free focaccia  was still warm and fantastic. 

Definitely coming back sooner than last time. Keep up the good work!

Started going here again recently (used to work nearby, changed jobs years ago) and was pleasently surprised that the quality hasn't suffered.  Food is wonderful, service is great and staff is always friendly. They've always been willing to serve items that aren't on the menu (my youngest loves lamb, they always are willing to make chops for him), and everything we've ordered has been excellent. Definately not the cheapest, but well worth the price.

What a great meal of Italian food! Yum!!! We had a family style meal lasting several hours and I have to say they did not dissapoint. We started off with that bread basket, full of pizza bread among other options and it reminded me of the pizza from  the Italian deli that my mom served as an appetizer every christmas! Then there was bruchetta, a light and refreshing salad, to be followed by an awesome vodka sauced pasta. At this point, I should have headed to my car and changed into buffet pants but I didn't. Silly me! Next up was some chicken and melt in your mouth mashed potatos, followed by red velvet cake, icecream and coffee. How did i drive myself home? In a food coma, that's how! Our server was speedy, refilled our drinks a ton so that we could wash down course after course, he promptly removed our empty plates and and he was very polite. Nicely done Villaggio!
We stopped with a few other couples. Had a wonderful waiter, very funnyman,  Great service. The food was AWESOME.

4 1/2 stars

Momma mia!

I came to Villaggio on Valentine's Day for its romantic ambience.

For beginners, they served both focaccia and Italian bread alongside olives, red sauce, and olive oil.

The lentil soup was tasty but over cooked. The garlic salad dressing totally missed the mark.

Before our main meal, they served lemon Italian ice which I thought was a nice touch.

I ordered zuppa de pesce which I must say was absolutely perfect. My wife couldn't keep her fork off of it.

After dinner, they served, on the house, small biscotti cookies.  

The place was clean. Servers were polite and very professionally dressed.

I really enjoyed our visit here.


Good job guys!

IBB

I came for an event. They people rented out a space. 


About a solid 2.9 

Food
- bruschetta was really delicious! Very Fresh and the brad was crunchy buy not break your teeth hard.
-salad..yeah it was a salad
-pasta was good. The sauce was kind of runny and there was like 2 cups of sauce to 1/2 cup of past but it tasted ok 
-I don't eat meat so the chicken parm. smelled chemically-but the potatoes and broccoli were delicious. 


The atmosphere.

-weird plastic burgundy chairs...come on ...I have had better atmosphere in a banquet hall. 

Would I come back a huge maybe....maybe if I ate at the restaurant maybe it would have been better but as a group meal with a pre fixe menu...not really that great. 


The service was nice enough a little slow, but friendly.

My husband and I pass this restaurant regularly so thought we'd check it out. It was a disappointment. On a Friday night, there were only ten tables, yet service was terrible. The servers were scatter brained and running around. We started out with one waiter and ended with another. It took someone 7 minutes to greet us and ask us if we wanted anything to drink besides water. After that, another 20 minutes before we had our order taken, and then half hour for our food to arrive. 
The food was mediocre. Bread at the beginning of the meal was good as was the palate cleanser. My husband ordered the fettuccini alfredo which was bland and dry. I ordered the gnocchi which was chewy with a bland tomato sauce. 
We will not be returning.

Maybe I am giving this 4 stars because when you drive by the strip mall this restaurant is located in, you just assume the worst.  The restaurant is in the basement of a strip mall badly in need of remodeling.

That said, the actual inside of the restaurant is quite welcoming and cozy.  The bar area is really small, but in a good way because it makes the place feel warm and friendly.  My wife and I went on a Friday night at about 7:30 and the place was quite busy, but we were sat fairly quickly.

We both orders pasta dishes and thought they were excellent.  I got the "Mama Mia" which is just bucacelli, sausage, meatball and brociole... wonderful to the last drop!

Would definitely recomend for a casual, good italian meal.

Excellent and authentic Italian cuisine.  The atmosphere is warm and friendly, very much like family.  The menu has a beautiful selection of appetizers, homemade pastas and fish. Everything was outstanding and I am looking forward to going again!!!

This is mine and my husbands Favorite restaurant. The food is outstanding. Best authentic Italian around. This family owned restaurant makes you feel welcome every time you walk in the door. The wine is fabulous the entertainment is fun. We absolutely recommend this to everyone.

I had dinner here this weekend and I LOVED it.  First of all, the food was outstanding.  Very authentic.  But more than the food I loved the attentive service and friendliness of everyone working there. I felt like a guest in someone's home.  It was just a wonderful experience overall.

Been to Villaggo's many times...just love it....friendly people, excellent service (Christina is our fav)!!!!  Food is delicious!!!  

Just had our daughter's college graduation party a few Sunday's ago and everything was done to perfection!!!  Couldn't be happier...

Top-notch!

Thank you!!!!

service.. how many times will you ask me if everything is alright. 

Lasagna... ala dente it was not. 
It reminded me of the Lasagna in the redbox in your freezer section.
Salad with the meal was oil and vinegar. 
Sorry, but nothing good to say.  I would have been happier with a $5.00 Skippy Gyros down the street.
 How they have stayed in business all these years is a mystery. Guess I'm just a food snob and demand quality and this was not !!

The service was amazing! First time here and I never been to a restaurant with such well staff people. Really, from appetizer to dessert...incredible service. The food..so good...I'm VERY PICKY! No way I can give this Italian restaurant less then 5 stars!
Went because we had a groupon....it is now in our list of local favorites!  AmZing flavors...loved everything!  Special touch giving scoop of lemon ice before entree...impressed.

We just ate here tonight and it was one of the best dinners I have had in a while.  The service was great and service always means a lot to me.  We ordered the bow-tie pasta with salmon and the pork tenderloin.  Each meal came with salad or soup and intermezzo.  We also got fresh bread with a choice of dipping sauce and olive oil and cheese.  The food was great and the portions were large so we have leftovers.  We definitely want to come back more often.

I was doing the wandering thing again and noticed Villagio so I stopped in for lunch.

Something about the decor made it very cool and inviting. The staff though felt somewhat distant.

I ordered the Lobster Ravioli from their Lunch Specials Menu.

They brought out bread first, two types: white and something with tomatoes and basil and other seasonings. Along with the bread there was a bowl of Parmesan cheese, containers of butter, a plate of black olives, and a tomato-ish spread... not sure what it was called but it was good.
I also chose the salad with their house dressing. Also delicious.

The Lobster Ravioli was awesome. The pasta was cooked perfectly, the filling was just the right amount, and the sauce was one of the best I've had. There was also crab legs and shrimp piled in the center of the plate. It made me happy.

I'd definitely come here again, probably with some friends for a nice dinner. I definitely got more of a fine dining vibe than a casual lunch. Luckily I was dressed up.

Upping my review. Went last night with good friends for dinner. Service couldn't have been better, food was excellent. Had a great time! Again, they will be my go-to Italian restaurant. Manga-Manga!!!!!:)

This place is good, but could be better. I like the lasagna and would order it again. The sausage and meatballs could be better. The lobster ravioli is good, but not worth $22 . The prices are too high for what you get. I'm going to try this place 1 more time for chicken parm. It's $16. For that price it should be awesome. I doubt it wiil be.

Went there last night with my family and we all loved it. Never went there before and we'll be back. I agree with Debbie on 2 things - they do ask if everything is okay a little too much and the salad was drenched in balsamic vinegar. The bread was fantastic and the sun dried tomato paste that comes with the bread was really good. I had the clay pot fruti de mare and it was the best I've had. The fish was fresh and perfectly cooked - portions were big - we all loved it!

Let me start by saying that it is difficult to please my Italian husband who lived in Italy for a few years and has high expectations.  We were pleasantly surprised by Villagio.  The service was very good and we got a quiet table in the back.  We ordered the sausage in a clay pot for our appetizer and it was delicious.  My husband had a veal and pasta dish and I had the risotto with seafood (not great) but my husband's plate was amazing.  We were fighting over leftovers the next day.  Will come back here again.

First time diner at Villagio.  Whereas the reviews I read were mixed, I had a very nice time and will return.  The food was good.  Expansive menu.  I had Brick Chicken.  The prices were reasonable and the service was excellent.
Best of all they had some Friday night entertainment.  He did some pretty good lip syncing to a bunch of oldies songs.  Memorable music that me and my girlfriend had a good time dancing to.

I agree...  this place used to be top-notch.  However, I believe the new owners are trying to make Villaggio's what it used to be.  We had a terrible experience New Year's Eve dinner, but I've been telling everyone to give them a chance as I know many people love Villaggios.  I want this local restaurant to succeed. But the price point of this caliber of restaurant is too high.  Prices should come down to reclaim the validity of the food we are being served.  Simply too high.
