During and after your meal the workers here, who are the same every time, will service you with disinterest.  They can be smug which is an attitude I never understood when you are in the service business.

The atmosphere, besides the moody waitstaff, is like any typical neighborhood bar.  They have plenty of televisions with all kinds of sports programming on.  

The only reason you should come here is if you want a less than average experience.

I have been to this place over 5 times. The server's are extremely rude, the service is terrible, and the food is disgusting. Last week, we waited over 1.5 hours for our pizza. Nobody came to tell us it would take longer. Our server was so snippy, while we all tried to be nice to her. I will never return to this place again. I can't believe they are still in business with the terrible service, subpar food, and rude servers!

Jennifer, Jenn, Jenni, C***.... we LOVE HER
Totally accommodating.. she put up with our semi  buzz..and put up with our shit and gave it back.. been here before.. best time EVER tonight!!

This was my first visit, and I'm afraid my last.

Coach's Corner is your typical sports bar, located in Elk Grove Village. Convenient to my office, I went with a group of co-workers and thought this could be a regular on the lunch circuit. But, that was not meant to be.

First, I have to say the server was very nice. She was pleasant, cheerful, clearly liked her job, and attentive to our needs. Service was fast. They are "famous" for their Italian Beef, so I gave it a try. They price things separately, so I knew when I ordered I was ordering the sandwich, and the fries and cole slaw were extra. I also ordered an Iced Tea with lemon.

First things first, the Iced Tea was served in a tall glass with two fresh lemon slices. I'm not sure how they make their iced tea, but it tasted like it was powdere and not fresh. Strike one. The food was served on a tray with a large plate. The Italian Beef looked good. The fries were a little skimpy - there didn't seem to be as many as would have been served elsewhere. In fairness to Coach's Corner, they were very good. The Italian Beef had a good taste, but it was dry and there was not as much meat as there should have been. 

Where I lost is was when we got the check. As noted earlier, I knew we were paying extra for the fries, but I did not know we were charged separately for hot peppers (giardiniera), which is typically served along with Italian Beef. The Iced Tea (price not shown on the menu) and sodas others ordered were also pretty expensive relative to other local restaurants.

I wld say no for the money. One had chili with garlic and while the cook was preparing other food in the group. Bowl became cool and delivered cold. Another time my husband ordered pizza with ingredients. Cook adds onions. Waitress was fine. She wrote what my husband wanted. Next time cold chili again and an hrs wait for a mini size pizza!! All in a row!! After 15 yrs? The management needs to be in the kitchen. And this is no stars!

A great sports bar suitable for everyone, even families. This place has a ton of sports memorabilia. I also love that this place has so much wood inside, which helps to provide a comfortable, inviting atmosphere. All the food is pretty good here. I love the pizza, beef and grilled wings, but would order anything else off the menu at anytime. The service is usually good. This is my "Cheers".
Great neighborhood bar and grill.  Cold beer, good bar food.  Tons of tv's, they will put on any game you would like to watch.
Love it here - waitress was friendly and fast. THE FOOD IS DELISH! We will come here regularly so many choices. The wings taste fresh and the smell is wonderful!
Friendly sports bar. Good drink special clean fresh decor.  Lotsa TVs for sports.  Good for large and small groups.

It should be called Cutting Corners and not Coaches Corner.Not sure what has happened to this place. I have been going here for years and recommend it to those who come into town. The server was the only above average thing about the business left (jc). We ordered fried pickles and a large pizza so we could take some home for my mother and I. When our pizza came; I laughed and said this is barely a medium and not a large. So the manager comes out with pans and says it's a large on a medium tray but hanging over. It was 2 inches of bread. The pizza wasn't even good as it was skimpy. It was quite obvious that they are cutting corners. They charged us for the large and acted like we were visually impaired. Perhaps that is why the place was half empty on a Saturday night. Next time we go to Morettis' where you get what you pay for.

This is a down to earth family place that you can go to catch a game and cheer on your favorite sporting team.  You can actually bring your children here and not be afraid of foul language and such.  It is a nice family place with a laid back atmosphere.  The menu is well above average, and I am also a fan of the cheese sticks.

Another over priced disappointing meal from da Coach. Went to watch the Hawks play and have dinner with my wife.

To start with, It's a Half empty restaurant and they sit us in the highest traffic spot in the place. Busboys, waitresses and patrons bumping in the back of my chair the entire experience. This was the start of worse things to come. 

The waitress was not around to deliver our food, so some busboy did....
The food was over cooked across the board including the $10. Order of chicken wings that were completely burnt black on one side. (which were all turned down of course).  

Our Waitress ran by asking how everything was prior to flipping over the chicken wings. 

The next time I saw her I let her know about the burnt wings and she said there's nothing she could do now... I should have let her know sooner. 

I left the food, tipped the waitress and learned a lesson. 

Coaches corner is a generic sports bar, with no heart or soul.... just terrible food and overpriced drinks. 

I will drive the extra mile to Pops on Nerge or wait until Pope's Pizza Opens back up on Devon.   
Coach's Corner is "DA WORST!"
Enjoy watching the Hawks here great environment,great staff, I've had several items off the menu all excellent, pizza light crust, huge fresh ingredients, great sauce. I frequent this place a lot.

Above average, but pretty typical, spots bar. Lots of great daily specials and TV's on every wall so everyone can see. HUGE menu with options for everyone. Had the boneless chicken wings and fries, about $7 and pretty good.

Minor downfall, management and staff are not in tune with the sports programming. Came in specifically for a Bulls game at Noon on a Sunday. Game had tipped off, and they didn't have the Bulls on a single TV. Instead they had ESPNU, NHL Network, ESPN Classic, etc with nothing relevant on. However, they were very accommodating, and even turned on the audio, when asked. 

We'll definitely be back, and you should try it out if you haven't already!

I've been here at least a half dozen times and it's time to update my review.  I notice the one-star reviews and find it odd.  Simply stated, I've never had a bad meal or experience at Coach's Corner.
The pub burger is very good and the Italian Beef is almost as good as Portillo's but what really tops the chart is their thin crust pizza.  If you are a thin crust aficionado, you have to try this but be sure to eat in and get it hot out of the oven.  Even leftover slices are pretty darn good if reheated in a toaster oven.
I don't understand the haters.  As I said, I've never had a bad experience. 
Coach's Corner has daily food and drink specials that provide good value.
I really don't expect much from sports bars in the way of food, but Coach's Corner is a pleasant surprise with very good food, a nice selection of libations and friendly servers.

I've eaten here twice, and give it 3.5 stars, since it's whole numbers only for ratings.  The portions are generous and decently priced, the sports and music memorabilia are scattered all over, and the old framed magazine covers are a nice touch, they do bring back a lot of memories when I was a kid.

The food here is good no complaints about that. They are a bit more expensive than other pizza restaurants in the area and they are quite inflexible on their coupons. I ordered 2 large one topping pizzas and they wouldn't let me use the coupon for the free 12" cheese pizza, they said it had to be at least one two topping pizza. I know this is a minor complaint but it is irritating since my usual orders run about $75 - $80. I'd probably give them 4 stars if not for these two minor issues.

A great place to watch a Packers game, they always have about half of the screens with the Pack game on. As a Pack fan I always feel welcomed, which I don't get at allot of Chicagoland bars. Good wings, burgers and Italian beefs. The fried cheese curds are awesome!
Great pizza and cheese stix

Attended the Brunson Autism Speaks fundraiser and really enjoyed the evening. My first time, so I had to try the cheese sticks and their Italian beef. They have a one of a kind product here. Not your standard stuff here. The beef plain had a great kick to it and the pepperoni cheese sticks where my favorite. The thin crust pizza looked great too.

Nice bonus was the trivia night. Not often you learn so much trivia at a bar you can trust is true. Of course Ted was in his usually entertaining form and made for a great guest bartender. My only gripe is no fresh brewed tea. I'm not a drinker and the stuff that comes out of the gun isn't my favorite. 

Very nice location and can tell the employees think a lot of their boss, Joe. Great family operated business and they obviously give back to the community in numerous ways.

The commute to Lakeview from the western suburbs is horrific.  After sitting in it for the past 3 months, I've come to the conclusion that it is a a mild form of torture.  I'm not even exaggerating...you try it.  

I decided to kill time at Coach's Corner one day when it was snowing.  (Of course it has to snow during the hours of 3pm and 5pm.  Why can't Mother Nature hold off a few hours?!)  BEST decision of my life.  Where else can you get cheap mai-tai's, hurricanes AND cherries dipped in Bacardi 151?  ALL right here.  

Their food menu is just amazing.  It's all the typical bar stuff, but just tons to choose from.  (There's everything from wraps to salads, to ribs to pizza to cookies!)  Apparently, they're known for their 'cheesesticks', but they aren't the typical breaded and deep fried mozz sticks.  It's cheese wrapped in a flour tortilla and fried.  Delish!  Their Wednesday night special was 2 sliders + fries for $6  and you could choose from chicken, meatball, cheeseburger, beef or sausage.  I got the chicken (lightly breaded + buffalo sauce) and the sausage and it was seriously the best bar food I've ever had.  

If you want to watch a sports game, THIS is the place to do it at.  There are a million tv's, so you could probably catch two games at once.  The bartenders have always been extremely friendly, so I'm so thankful to have discovered this great spot!
Great place, kind of small. They desperately need to update the design of their menu because it is a disaster. A place for elk grove regulars

Been here a handful of times, always leave satisfied.  You have to start with at least a couple of cheese sticks.  Yesterday, I had the southwest chicken salad and really enjoyed it.  My friend had the bleu cheese burger and was disappointed - either the cheese melted or they put a little bleu cheese dressing on it in lieu of the cheese.  It was totally absorbed into the burger or the bun; not what she expected, but she asked for onion, and doctored it up so that it was a satisfactory burger.  On previous visits, I've had the patty melt and other friends raved about the beef sandwich.  Living just a couple of blocks away, it's my go-to spot when whoever I'm with doesn't know what they want; there is a wide selection with specials.  

It can be noisy, so don't go there if you are expecting a place to have a quiet conversation.  I was there during a Hawks game and every time the Hawks scored a goal, the foghorn blared and the entire place erupted into a chorus of Chelsea Dagger.

Solid bar food, casual atmosphere, good value.  Service can be a little iffy, depending on how crowded it is.
Had dinner last night while watching Bulls game. Great prices good food. Had chicken Parmesan with pasta very good. Was very busy but still had good service.

I DONT GET ALL THE STARS FOR THIS PLACE. 
The food is awful. I'm actually afraid to eat there. Had a buffalo chicken salad with the most snarly chicken pieces.  Soup, awful.  Ugh.

My husband and I will never go back there. Coach's Corner was hosting a Hawks Roadwatch party. We arrived almost an hour and a half early and found out most tables already had been reserved but obviously the tables were empty, alot of them had not arrived yet. Okay so we will wait for one of the few that weren't. Then we were told they had given away all the wristbands, but there were not that many people there yet and I was told go count if I didn't believe her. I believe ones were put aside for the reservation people though they were not there yet. We left and did not spend our money there. I think the way this was handled says much about the place and ownership.

The hubby and I came here for the first time for a Monday night football game with some friends. It was our first time there, and we really enjoyed it!!!!! I was in charge of reserving a table for our group the week before...but of course I forgot, so I called the day of the game to reserve a table for 8, and we were a go!!!  Got an awesome table right in the middle of the restaurant too!!! 

Lots of tv's and plenty of seating.  It was pretty crowded in there.  It seems like a neighborhood bar, and just about everyone knew eachother!  I ordered the Crispy Chicken Salad with the mild sauce on the chicken...very yummy!  The hubby ordered the Cheesy Beef...Im not a big beef eater, but even I enjoyed it!!  Everyone else in our group enjoyed their food as well!  The prices are great in my opinion! You can't beat a $7.49 salad!!!  They also have great drink and food specials through out the week.  

We definately plan on coming here again for some sports games!!!
Always a good place to go.  Very neighborhoody   if thats a word.  I like all the TVs and the sports bloopers they show.   Great place for Blackhawk games and you must try the cheese sticks!

Every single time I come here the service is horrible.  The food has also gone down the tubes.  But the service was never good from day one when they opened up.  Today was the last straw.  There were 3 tables with people at 2 pm.  I sat down waiting for over 15 minutes for a server.  I walked out and never ever going back.  Everyone in this town I know complains how terrible the service is.

I went to coach's with a college buddy. Me and my boyfriend were incredibly impressed with the bartender (Rob) as well as the thin crust pepperoni pizza and italnian beef (on garlic bread of course). We were sad we lived so far from this awesome official blackhawks bar! Little did we know we would end up moving in walking distance from our new found gem! I married my boyfriend and we had pizza and Italian beef *on garlic bread* at our reception.. inspired by coach's. Hands down best food in the area and great staff too. Trivia nights, live music, friendly local crowd. Order a pizza bigger than you originally plan. It's very addicting! Cheese sticks too!
Wanted to like this place- but bad service and terrible burger:(! Second shot but won't be a third. Very bummed as I like locally owned but they still have to earn it!

I went here recently for a road watch party for the Blackhawks and had a great time. I had very good service sitting at the bar and it's nice to actually watch a game at a sports bar that actually cares about the game. Prices were pretty good on the food and great drink specials.

One positive thing is the italian beef....one of the best I've had.  Other than that not so good.  The grilled cheeses are ehhh and the pasta is nothing special.  The atmosphere is my style but the staff isn't that friendly.  They aren't rude but they need to put a smile on their face and at least try to be happy to serve the customers that give them paychecks. The cheese sticks they're known for are just ok.  However it is a place you can drink and watch games at.

Have been here multiple times, mostly for Blackhawk games. Outside of the Madhouse on Madison, best place to see a Blackhawk games.

They offer a great menu, and their wings are out of this world, I recommend those the most. 

Great drink specials every day of the week, which you cant find that in a lot of the bars in the area on the weekend.

A great find in the suburbs.
Best Bloody Mary's around. Excellent cheesy beef on garlic bread. I prefer mine with a side of peppers.

I have been here a million times and have always had a great experience. I've had their wings, sandwiches, pizza, breadsticks, wraps, and a ton of other things and have never been disappointed. This is definitely my go to spot for Blackhawks games and for laid back night with my friends.

Nice little sports bar...but not as little as it once was, as they have increased the sitting area, & more than tripled the quantity of upgraded TVs in the place.  FYI:  4 star rating based on the fact that I know what is good/great there (see below.)

Italian Beef:  Awesome!   And it always has been (15 years ago I had my first one!)  I enjoy the cheesy beef, with sweet (and sometimes hot) peppers...it comes on a Turano roll...perfect for soaking up the delicious drippings.  Paired with their fries and slaw at lunch, it will set you up for a very comfortable afternoon nap!  Warning...you will need extra napkins.

Other things like the Burgers, Cod Platter, & BBQ sandwiches are just fine.

I'd stay away from the mozzarella sticks & the pasta dishes...not really the place for those things.

As a family of 6, everyone can find something to eat, and if you have boys (we have 3) in the family, the abundance of sporting channels is quite overwhelming...which is kind of nice if you want to keep them occupied while you are eating!

So, for what it is, it is, and it does a good job of doing it.  4 star for me, and pass me another napkin.

NOTE: I haven't been here in at least eight years.

Based on the reviews, it looks like this place has gone downhill. I used to go with friends when their parents wanted to watch some sports game. They had these amazing fried cheese rolls -- not mozzarella sticks, but some doughy, rolled up cheese things served with marinara sauce... Whatever they were, they were heavenly. Other than that, it wasn't anything spectacular, and I doubt I would ever go back today if I was in the area.

First time here, I'll say this it was busy but service was Sloooow, probably the worst service I've had in awhile. The food was average at best, I did only order a hot dog & fries, but the bun was hard and the fries were not good. I am a fry snob & they alone can make me eat somewhere, not these, not.even.close. I won't be in a rush to go back.

After waiting about 15 minutes during the lunch hour without anyone acknowledging us upon entering or even when we seated ourselves, my coworkers and I   left.  To make matters worse,   we realized when we walked  out of this garbage place, there were two "coaches corner" managers or execs having a meeting with their lap tops right next to us (we just put it together; they talking about restaurant mumbo jumbo and were going over numbers....plus, it said coaches corner on their lap top screen).  No one greeted us when we came in nor anyone else that walked in.  It says seat yourself. We looked around to see if we  could catch a waiter's attentions but couldn't  get anyone's attention.  So we sat down and waited ...and waited. ...I stood up to look around...still no one.    Another pair of customers came  in and no one waited on them either.  To top it off, the managers let us walk out and didn't even care to assist or stop us.  Worst 15 minute first impression of a restaurant I've ever had.  I couldn't recommend the food because we didn't get that far yet.  I'm sure  if service is that bad during  lunch...their food and/or service must be bad too.
Stopped in for a casual dinner with my daughter. I love this place! Very family friendly, a wide variety of food, at reasonable prices! The burgers, beef, fries and slaw are excellent!

Really good food when you actually get the food. One of my favorite places to go, but the service has gone down over the last few months. Due to the service I think I will not be going back until I hear things have changed!
always a good, family friendly place to eat. Service is great and the food comes out hot and fast. Been there often and quality and service are always great!

By far the worst food I have ever had in a sports bar.. Buffalo chicken sliders are those pressed chicken pattys that you used to eat in grade school. After sending that back I ordered the boneless jerk wings that tasted like frozen chicken nuggets with curry powder over them. Pizza dough was chewey.. Maybe we caught these guys on a bad day but we are never coming back. Real brewed iced teas would have been nice instead of the fountain iced tea. And lastly, when you have a hunded items on your menu, the quality of your food suffers.

I've been here a few dozen times..... All the food is great,, the wait staff needs to get rid of a few crabby waitresses..... But the Cheese sticks are great as noted by a TV show .... Chicago's best....  I also love the BBQ wings,, not too spicey,, just tastey.. and of coarse save room for dessert.. The Pizz-okie (pizza cookie) is great,, my son (17) saids it the best,, I have it rated 4th behind..  #1 Derby Pie ( Assembly Pub) then #2 Chocolate Thunder from down under,, then #3 Brownies from Chuck's in Burbank,,,  If u are looking for desserts,,, lets talk  I love Chocolate and I would love to sample more... thanks...

While I appreciate the laid back atmosphere, allowing children to literally play ball in the restaurant where the ball is bouncing off of patrons & tables is unacceptable. Shame because the food is good.

When it comes to sports bars, this is the best one I've ever been to for atmosphere.  An amazing place to watch sports, especially if it's a Chicago team.  The food is all really good and very reasonably priced.  Drink selection and specials are awesome!   

The only real downside I have with the bar is that the way it's set up, it's not really well set up for bigger groups of people.  They have a few spaces for bigger groups, but for the most part, it's tough for a group of 8 or more to find a spot for everyone to sit comfortably.  Otherwise, it's a great bar/restaurant!

Love this place. Great food and service. Not too pricey. I feel comfortable coming here alone and always feel welcome. My favorite is grilled buffalo chicken wrap with fries. Awesome daily drink specials too!

I've been here a bunch of times and always have a blast everytime I go.  The service here is awesome. Brian the bartender is super funny, always has great stories and can make a mean drink. He makes a great cosmopolitan, i should know, im a bartender and cosmopolitans are my fav drink! When I don't have the pleasure of sitting at the bar (it's a tad small but good size for the place it's in) i always request Megan as my server. Not only is she super fun but she never gets our picky pizza order wrong and she doesn't even write it down!!!

I've tried a lot of the food here and everything I try is always good. It's hard for me to look at bad reviews about food in a bar because the point of most bar food is for it to come out fast and hot. I'd say coaches corner goes above and beyond fast and hot. Their pizza is delicious, the sandwiches are all tasty, those mozzarella sticks are something pretty special and the prices are fabulous. If you're looking for a nice steak tartar maybe try a fine dining French restaurant at $90 a plate.

All in all this is a great bar with a neighborhood feel, a supreme staff, tasty tasty food and a lot of entertainment. It's worth a try of you havn't been! And to those who say they were disappointed the first time, ask for Brian or Megan, they'll make sure you're time spent there is well worth it!

Stopped in here to catch the Euro2012 matches.  
Great food and atmosphere!
Spicy Bloody Mary will made me cry.....
Will be back.

I was there a couple of days ago for the first time and probably won't be back based on the experience we had. First of all the service we received from Donna was not great. Not really attentive but rather pushy. When I received my Chopped salad which looked like it has been waiting to be served for a couple of days she looked really surprised when I told her I dont like it and didn't even bother removing it from our bill until I asked her too. Secondly we realized why all the pushing to get us more beer was- we had big Stellas on tap for 8$- can you believe that?! 8$ for tap beer I was like damn I should of went to a restaurant and drink and eat there so at least I know why Im paying so much money. At least the food and the experience would have been better. Anyhow Im not one to raise a stink about that kind of stuff even when Im disapointed, I just dont come back :))))

I wanna make love to the hostess.  that is pretty much the only reason i come to this place.  The food is consistently unimpressive.  My least favorite being two of the burgers.  The bacon and Merkts cheese one and the super cheesy one also with merkts.  Now a burger with merkts is one of my favorite foods of all time.  But somehow these guys completely overwhelm the sandwich with the amount they put on there.  Sure generous portions are great but not to the point where it destroys the whole point of why the sandwich is good.  They need new cooks.  The fries even suck.  The popcorn chicken is alright.  Pizza is alright.  Moz stick things they have are alright.  Drink specials are nothing real special.  My friend always gets the buffalo chicken wrap and its usually decent.  She has gotten the soup several times (french onion) and it has been both decent and inedible in different visits.
Very good business with good Chicago style food and good drink specials.  A lot of TVs so it is a good place to have a beer and go watch a game.

Service here is very friendly and very fast. Food was delicious! I had the blue cheese bacon burger. It was flavorful and cooked medium- just the way I ordered. Fries were nice and hot. Nice place for families to come. Will come back here soon!

Coach's is now our go-to place when we wants to watch a Hawks game.  They're an official Blackhawks bar, so they play the audio for all the games, plus do their own little stadium celebration when the Hawks score.  Definitely a fun atmosphere!  

We have also been really impressed with the food.  We have seen our fair share of sports bars, and we have yet to be disappointed with anything we have eaten at Coach's.  

Yes, it's a sports bar in the suburbs.  Yes, it's in a strip mall.  HOWEVER, they're doing things right at Coach's.  You can tell it's owned by people who really care about their business and their customers.

I love how everyone in Elk Grove swears by this place. Is that because it's the only sit-down restaurant that serves Chicago-style food? Maybe because it's the only "kid-friendly" bar (wow, now there's an oxymoron) where the closet alcoholics in town can get a beer and halfway-decent food in "downtown" Elk Grove while their kids are preoccupied with TV or video games (why'd you ever leave the house?). 

Where to begin? For one, smoking was allowed here before the state ban. Problem is, post-ban, it still REEKS. Could someone change the ceiling tiles out and CLEAN the place so it's not so disgusting? 

Cleaning is, apparently, not a great priority for this restaurant. After all, how could I forget the cockroach struggling to escape from my glass of root beer? They sure do love this restaurant! 

If that statement doesn't have you running for the bathroom--or the exit--wait'll you try the food! Bust out the Imodium and Tums! The Italian beef sandwich is way too spicy and messy. The pizzas take a while to cook and aren't worth the wait. Everything else is just your classic greasy, overpriced, over-seasoned bar food. 

Unless I'm watching a game with friends or enjoying the drink specials, I wouldn't waste my time or money here. The service is only so-so, it just depends on your waiter/waitress. Maybe 'da Coach' should spend some time training the wait staff. But, again, being a bar...maybe you should expect a few to be downright rude to you? 

I imagine that with their new location, Big Sammy's must be making a killing. You want a taste of some real food? Chuck your vomit bag and walk a few doors down. Big Sammy's has the real Chicago-style goods.

not many places to eat in egv. if this is your only choice, go to schaumburg! we were here on a friday nite and yeah ,they were busy. we were asked to have a seat in an uncomfortable waiting area while they seated each party that arrived after us! left and went to village tavern. foods better  there anyway! will not be back to cc and we live a few blocks away!

Food was hardly edible, everything was clearly frozen and reheated. Nothing fantastic.  If we didn't have a family member in ICU at alexian bros, there's no way we would go here in the first place.  We figured we would try it since we've gotten sick of panera and McDonald's.  
We had "home made mozzarella sticks" which supposedly were rated by Chicago's best ... These were the most edible out of everything that we ordered.  It was cheese rolled in tortilla and deep fried. Sammys in the same strip mall has a very similar thing, and they are BETTER there. 
We also had three sliders, a regular hamburger, a salad and boneless wings.  The sliders burger meat smelled and tasted spoiled.  the boneless wings were clearly taken out of a box and plastic bag and tossed in the deep fryer and then coated with hot sauce.  If you like mediocre, and your starving, they work.  The salad was 8 or 9 bucks and had nothing special or unique to it.  The hamburger was over cooked and probably frozen as well.   we finished our meal with a cookie pizza thing that was raw cookie dough in a deep dish pizza pan.  the edges weren't even cooked.  however, it was the most edible thing that was put on our table.  
If you LOVE country music (that seems to be the music genre that plays  a song ratio of 1-2) and don't mind getting bubble gut before you leave the table, followed up by explosive diarrhea (seriously- i got sick) ... eat there.  
Our server was very nice, but definitely didn't seem proud to be serving what he was serving.
Amazing service, food, and drinks! Great place to go with family, hang with friends, or watch a sports game. This is a great place and my boyfriend and I have become regulars there.

Ok the menu is huge and the amount of TVs is even bigger.  Its a decent place to eat lunch and watch some sports.  The food is good and I have been coming here for about 15 years.  I normally just get the the fish or shirmp plate but they good wings too.  The staff is pretty good at taking care of you and making sure everything is OK.  The service has improved over the years.  Its a regular place for lunch for me since its so close to work.  I will continue the tradition! LOL
I had the BBQ wings and thought they were good, a little too big but nontheless good.  I did try my wife's Italian Beef which was very tasty.  Good atmosphere and  lots of TV's to watch games.

Great little family friendly pub with very good food and cordial staff. Downside: Be prepared to eat out of a plastic tray if you order a sandwich - but food won't disappoint. Cheese sticks are the BEST.

I have been here quite a few times, food is OK, I never had any problem with the service.  I do have a problem with the volume level of the TVs in the seating area.
It actually hurts,  They need to turn it down a little, you actually would be able to hear it better.  Keep it as loud as you want in the Bar area.  I have asked a couple times nicely to turn it down just a tad so you could talk without yelling, that fell on deaf ears.  I'm a hockey fan and this high volume is a bit much on the table side when trying to talk at all.  Cannot enjoy the food.
Turn it down a tad Coach!

I love this place!! I've been eating their food since the 90's when they were Frankies 2. They have, by far, the BEST BEEF ON THE PLANET! The mozzarella sticks are amazing! I honestly like everything that I have eaten there. The place is awesome inside. Sports lovers will really enjoy this place but at the same time a nice place to take the family. I can't stress the high quality of their food!

I like you Coach's Corner. You are the ultimate Elk Grove townie bar. TVs are viewable from pretty much everywhere, the pizza's always good and the meatball sandwich makes me happy every time. Here's my main problem with the kitchen. The wings are terrible. They're overly breaded and the sauces are weak. It's like Keith Bogans to Derrick Rose. Okay, maybe they aren't the worst wings but I reeeeeeeeeally like the rest of the food. Tweak the starting line-up a little and I think we're on our way to an easy win.

My friends and I decided to try this place after one saw on television.  Was concerned, as it seemed very small. This particular night was Blackhawks playoffs and yet we got a good table.  Two men/two women in our group. Our server was very polite, friendly and just fantastic.  We started with a couple appetizers (cheese sticks and soft pretzels).  Cheese sticks o.k., but not really what we expected.  Pretzels we're soggy, but in a good way - and they were really good.  Good selection of alcoholic beverages.  We had fish, burger, and beef.  The food was excellent!  Definitely not what we expected from "bar" food.  We also tried the mini desserts and they were very good.  I wouldn't go out of my way to get there, but if someone wants to meet there again, I'd certainly be pleased.

I really like this place, they pretty much  have the best bar food around.  The service is really good, they have really good drink specials, it's really kid friendly and watching the Blackhawks there is always a good time.
Its a cool place... Lots of tvs.. Good service... I like it... Good food...

I love this place its a great neighborhood pizza place  .... They have a wide menu of you typical bar food site down dinning and let me say this place gets packed for lunch and dinners, expect to wait in the summer for a place to sit when basketball, baseball, soccer, football or any sport is going on. They usaully have super bowl partys were limited tickets are sold which is going on now .... and unlimited BEER and finger food are given throughout the game and plenty of raffels also going on for the event.
 Prices are reasonable and one signature item I always get here is the "PIZZOOKIE" Yep thats right a little 6 inch pizza pan with a 1/2 backed chocolate chip cookie doe topped with 3 scoops of vinalla ice cream melting away on the hot cookie "MMMMMM" its sooo good I promise you!!!
I love the southwest  pizza here too.  Chicken, bacon, onion, with bbq sauce instead of tomato sauce .MY FAVORITE!!!!!! 
The bar tenders are pretty cool here to Mike usaully will take care of you after a couple rounds. 
Plasma  T Vs are in every corner with games or sports bloopers running which the kids like to watch and in the front they have a few video games to hold the kids over while you can still take in a nice night out in a "bar / restraunt" atmosphere.

Sorry, but this was terrible...there were six of us and we shared everything.  The wings were fatty and clearly frozen.  The burger was charred and well done, even though I asked for medium.  The salads were expensive and just terrible.  The lettuce was still wet, everything seemed either frozen or canned, and the dressings had strange tastes to them.  We had a few sliders as an app and they were horrible.  They were overcooked and tasteless.  We also had their "famous cheesesticks."  It would have been nice to know that they were not what you would expect.  They were cheese rolled in tortillas and fried.  I read menus closely and somehow missed this.  We were terribly displeased with the food and pricing for frozen reheated bar food.  The service was quite weak.  Our server didn't know much, and kept responding, "I've never tried that."  It is just a bar, not a place to eat, in my opinion.  I am not a food snob if the price is right, but at those prices, they don't deserve to stay open.  

The worst part of the entire experience was that every other song was a country song, and there was no juke box that I could find.  I was in hell.  I won't be back.

So I went there yesterday. I had this bad craving for bar food and beer :D
The place was pretty busy, which was a good indicator (well at first it was haha). There were two people waiting to be seated before us and right after we got inside , a few others walked in. Sadly, the hostess let everyone sit before us. We had to wait 10 minutes because there were no tables open.  I told her sweetly that we got here first and she apoligized for not noticing... Apparently us being in front of everyone didn't matter.

The waitress seemed better at first. We ordered beer (which BTW they had pretty decent drink specials), and waffle fries with bacon and cheese and italian beef sandwiches. The waitress looked straight in my face and asked if I want fries with it. I started laughing and said... I think I will stick with the waffle fries... enough starch for one night. She didn't get it and proceed to ask my friend if she wanted fries with the sandwich. Whatever.
As soon as we got our food, we realized we didn't receive any silverware or napkins. I was really tempted just to eat with my hands and make a mess..but then i stopped myself and took some silverware from the table next to us. 
So when our beer glasses were half full, or half empty (whichever you prefer), she stopped by asking if we need more drinks. We said we werent ready yet. She just walked away. BUT when we were done with our drinks, she would pass by our booth without asking us for anything. My friend stopped her, asking for another beer and she walked away saying she will be back.... 40 minutes later we asked for check... I am NOT going to wait an hr for another beer!
She came by with our check, we decided to split in in the middle by using two cards (i am not sure if that was just too complicated for her...). She gave us our receipts back and I started laughing... Isnt half off of $18...$9??? Well she charged both of us $13... I am not a math wiz but I can do simple math... I take that back... I am a math wiz but THIS is simple math... anyone should know it! 
This place could be a good hang out if they hire someone who can count and is attentive (after all that's your job). I liked the homey feeling of that place, they had nice booths, lots of TVs and decorated with anything sport related.
Great burgers.  Enough said.

Great little hidden gem in Elk Groove! Although we were greeted to some rather punky kids playing football in the street right in front, it's a good hang-out-and-watch-the-game/dinner-with-the-fam kinda place. Good menu selection and wow! You MUST try the Pizzokie! A 7in half-baked chocolate chip cookie with vanilla ice cream on the top! F-in delicious! Between 4 adults, it was gone in under 5 min!

Went for lunch today.  (actually in May, I forgot to press the Post button) 

Apparently asking for a booth in an uncrowded restaurant is more than the hostess can take, she seated us and walked away say 3 times "they wanted a booth"  while shaking her head side to side. 

I believe there were less than 13 customers in a restaurant that seats 10 times that . Food remains good, it's the service that is spotty.

The restaurant is much larger now...which is one of the reasons the other reviews are a tad lower than they should now be. The menu is pretty large and the food is very good. If you like burgers this is a great place to get a very good burger. The atmosphere is great as the new large restaurant now has, I believe, 27 tvs. Don't forget to look at all the memorabilia...there is one Bull's Jersey on the wall that I can guarantee is well worth $20k...I could understand the 3 to 3.5 reviews back when the restaurant was smaller, but the larger diner has alleviated some of the stresses of eating here in the past.

I am a huge fan of this place. The chicken wings are meaty, and the sauces are delicious. I would eat here over BWW any day of the week if it was closer to my home. Also try the mozzarella sticks, they are fantastice.  It also helps that they have great beer prices.

This place was more of a 3.5 but I left it at 3 because although the place is reasonably priced, I don't see any reason to go back unless another Blackhawks Roadwatch was there. Lots of TVs there though (I think there were 12? TVs placed around the bar/restaurant) so if you're in the area & need to catch a game, you should check it out. It's located in the west end of the Elk Grove Crossing strip mall near Panera, so there's plenty of parking. 

Food: good bar food but not amazing. Liked the mozzarella stick appetizer - instead of breading it, they wrap the cheese in a tortilla & fry it. Kind of like a tamale - it was pretty good. I got the cheesy beef, which they say "is the best beef in Chicago". It was alright, but not really spectacular. It reminded me of Portillos, and I've had better. Tasty but juuust a little bland. My friend got the chicken wings (hot) which were nice & hot but too breaded. The championship fries (waffle fries with melted nacho cheese + bacon) were delicious though. I definitely recommend them. The pizzookie (pizza cookie+ice cream) hit the spot for my sweet tooth craving especially because it comes warm & delicious. Lots of different specials for every night of the week; my friend got a $3 mini-pitcher of Miller Lite which was about 2.5 glasses. 

Atmosphere: Since I was there for the Blackhawks Roadwatch the place was filled with Blackhawks fans. The Hawks beat the Predators 4-1 so there was a lot of screaming & singing "Chelsea Dagger" that night - so I can't say what it would be like otherwise. While I was there it was loud, noisy and filled with hockey talk, like a mini-UC, which is supposed to be the point (we were even clapping & yelling when they played the anthem). As a Hawks fan, I definitely had fun, although there was one table that wanted to watch the BC/USC game and kept trying to get the server to change one of the TVs. Whenever they got a server to succeed, a bunch of other tables would complain, it'd be switched back & you'd see the server get scolded by management. Sorry College Bowl-watchers, but since the bar was the "Official Chicago Blackhawks Bar" for the night, you probably should've just gone somewhere else. 

The place is a decent sized restaurant-bar. Booths along the front wall (about 4 or so), a little more than 15 free-floating tables, and then a kind of smallish bar that seats maybe 15 people. If there's an event, I'd call ahead and see if you can make a reservation although my friend & I lucked out and got half of a booth because we said we'd share with strangers. (Note: if said stranger sits down with his 2 kids and proceeds to tell you he is a professional wrestler despite looking like a shorter, portly Stanley Tucci, it's best to smile politely and then act distracted the rest of the time. Even if his kids are adorable little hockey fans.)

Service: the hostess was incredibly polite and helpful, although you could see she was a bit overwhelmed with the sheer number of people that had shown up. The place turned into a standing-room-only place because all the hawks fans, but she did a good job. The server was friendly but obviously distracted, and didn't really clear the plates or notice refills unless specifically asked. I'm going to give her a pass this time, given how busy the place was. 

Cost: Wings + Italian Beef + Fries + Mozzarella sticks + Pizzookie + Coke + mini pitcher of Miller Lite + Bud Lite = less than $40. Most entrees were just under $10, and there are plenty of drink specials and daily specials. 

Overall, if you live in the area, it's a great sports bar/restaurant to go and watch your favorite game at, while having some decent food for not too bad of a cost. Otherwise, the typical sports bar near wherever you live will probably be just as good as this place.

Love their fresh Spanish bread & pandesal! My go to spot for these items, especially with their great prices. 

It's a small filipino grocery shop and I typically just come here for the fresh bread items and/or snacks. I see that they're expanding soon as well. 

I have yet to try their food items, but will be looking to order for catering as their prices look pretty decent for that. I have also came during the lunch hours as well and they can get pretty busy. So this must be a sign their food is delicious! You can eat here or take it to go, there are a few seats located in the front of the store.
Really good Filipino food and friendly service!

Fresh Pandesal.  Right out of the oven.  My son calls it "softee bread" and he is totally right--it's warm, soft and pillowy...so easy to eat more than one. 

Lina's is a small shop that focuses on typical Filipino cooking staples--sauces, vinegars, canned goods, frozen and fresh items.  So if you want to make casava cake--you can pretty much all the ingredients here.  Lumpia?  they have your wrappers. Filipino spaghetti?  They have ready made sauce.

 There is also a small kitchen and hot food warmer which usually offers about 5-6 hot items you can purchase--like longanisa (spicy sweet sausage), dinuguan (blood stew), pinakbet (veggie stew), and another favorite-the BBQ pork sticks. They also have some other baked items brought in from another bakery--like sapin sapin, puto, kuchinta. 

One Friday night I was hoping to grab dinner here for me and my son and they were out of almost all the hot food. And it was only 5pm!  Out of rice too!  Wha???? So we settled on the BBQ sticks (grilled to perfection with a sweet sticky glaze) some pandesal and fried tilapia. 
So If you're in the mood for something specific, best to call ahead.  

Friendly service.  I like standing in line with all the Lolo's/Lola's--they always tell my son he is pogi (handsome).
Really great place to get some good Filipino food. Everyone is so friendly and sweet.

Highly recommended...the rumor about the good pandesal, it's true . Tried kare-kare, sinigang, fried tilapia, pansit and bought different kakanin like sapin sapin, pitchi pitchi, kutsinta. The pandesal, freshly baked and it's really good!
I will definitely go back here again.

Came to grab some quick Filipino food for breakfast/brunch. But when we got there they only had four entree choices and bbq. 

The lady in the back kitchen saw us waiting to be helped but didn't help us or say hold on. She waited for a younger lady to serve us. 

They had like 8 bbq sticks and so we bought them all and the older lady looked angry that we bought them all. I mean shouldn't she be happy that we are buying her food. 

But the food was not even okay. It was nothing special at all. And I would not come back ever. I have never felt less appreciated at a restaurant to buy there not even good food as I did today! But maybe she was just haven a bad days everyone has those rights!
Best spanish bread and pandesal in town! I keep on coming back!. Feels like I'm in the Phil. lol

Their cooked food is sooooo good.  We ordered their BBQ chicken and BBQ Pork.  Oh, and I also ordered their freshly baked pandesal.  I hear they also sell freshly baked Spanish Bread.  I still have yet to try that.  I was very imporessed with how they cook their food and will come back.  The only downfall I found was that when I got there, they did not have any Pancit left and they did not have any Lumpia.  They make those really well there too.  

Word of advise, call ahead of time to see what they have available so that you do not waste your gas in case they do not have the food you want, if you already know what you want.

The Pan de sal and Spanish bread is so yummmmy!
It just brings you back home, its filipino comfort food.
Theres  always alot to choose from and its easy and quick  to order if you want some home made style freshly fried lumpia. 
Check this place out and you'll surely enjoy the food and the breads.

Lina's Filipino Marketplace is a Filipino mini-mini market in a stripmall that sells Asian types of items.  
I believe this place use to be another name, but the store layout still looks the same.
When you walk into the place, it's pretty small.  They try to put as much shelving items in their space.  No really, you can't have two shopping carts through the aisles.  
They have a lot of canned goods and in the back they have premade Filipino dishes in food warmers to bring home for lunch or dinner.  I haven't had a chance to try them, maybe next time when I'm not in the mood to cook Filipino food.  You can also order pans of Filipino dishes as well for your parties.  There is also a section to buy freshly baked pandesal (sweet bread rolls).  
They have a small freezer section full of Filipino type of items from whole fishes, shredded coconut, to desserts like ube ice cream.  If you ask for help, they will help you.  They won't come up to you.  
I get their premade frozen lumpia (finger egg rolls), deep fry them individually frozen until golden brown and crispy SOOOOO good!  Don't forget the sweet and sour sauce.
I also buy Knorr Sinigang Tamarind Powder and Kare Kare powder.  From time to time, I purchase a bag of sweet rice to make Arroz Caldo (a filipino Congee rice soup), yum.
And don't forget their halo-halo mix for those summer days of this icy dessert treat!
It's an OK place and it's close by to me so I would only come here if I needed something for my Filipino dishes that I can't get at the near by Caputo's.
I discovered their pandisal (bread). I called first to put aside 2 dozens for pick up later in the afternoon Perfect arrangement, the excellent bread and polite service. Very pleased.

I can only comment on their baked goods and it is unequivocally rated 5 stars.
Their spanish bread and pandesal are great!
They do not have their baked items displayed, presumably because they can't keep them on the shelves long enough.
A six pack of the spanish bread will not go unconsumed on the way back home.
It is THAT good.

I've gotten take-out here several times for my Filipina wife. She is often critical of take-out / restaurant food but is always happy with the food from Lina's..."they are really good cooks".

The store is small...they sell a basic variety of Filipino/Asian grocery items. They have a steam table in the back with 6 entrees and a hot plate with cooked fish (Daing) and BBQ pork on a stick. They also sell some fresh baked breads (my kids love the pan de sal), and some items from other places (I saw cassava from Sariling Atin) there.

Entrees vary, but may consist of Sinigang, Nilaga, Caldereta, Bopis, Diniguan, Afritada, etc. A 16 oz. container runs $6/$7/$8 for veggie/chicken&fish/beef, and 32 oz. containers are a little less than double ($12 for a chicken entree). 6 pieces of pan de sal will set you back $2.50.

They have a couple tables to eat at, but I seldom see customers dining in.

Service is friendly. I pick up food there any time I'm in the vicinity.

I went there to buy som ulam but it look so dry and getting black.  But anyways I tried their beef caldereta and oh my I cannot explain the taste so I did throw it and went back to the usual place where we use to buy ulam The Bakehouse on Bloomingdale Rd. I was so dis-appointed.  I also question the safety of their cook food because it is mix with grocery but oh well at least I tried their food and I will not recommend it at all.

I was craving authentic Mexican food and saw Taco Tuesday on Yelp. My husband and I decided to check it out and were really happy we did! The construction on Irving Park Rd. makes it a little difficult to get in but it's worth it. I had the cecina (marinated thin steak) and chicken tacos. My husband got the same meats but in a gringas (kinda like an open quesadilla). We added sour cream and avocado. We were not a big fan of the horchata, but overall our food with the salsa verde was delicious and affordable!! The owner Edgar and his cook were super nice. Definitely will be coming again! 

***UPDATE***
We went again to Taco Tuesday a week later, and was told they switched the horchata to a homemade recipe. It had a wonderful balance of sweet cinnamon and milky texture. The horchata is worth a try! Oh and their fresh, homemade guacamole which is not yet on the published menu is so yummy. You can even request the level of spicy because they make it for you right after you order. Thanks again Taco Tuesday for another wonderful meal!

Ok, so as of today I have been there a lot.  I have tried the Steak Burrito, Torta, Gringas, Chicken Enchiladas, Guacamole , and new today, the Fish Taco.... nothing short of amazing!!!  I have been addicted to the Gringas since day one, but the Fish Taco was a nice sized piece of fresh fish, grilled to perfection, and seasoned perfectly.  Boy, am I in trouble....I crave this place almost daily.   Highly recommended!!
We had the chicken, steak and pork taco dinners.  Great tacos, fresh guacamole and delicious rice and beans!  Best Mexican food we have found in the area!!

My friends and I were hungry in Wood Dale and found this place. Tacos never disappoint; right? This was an amazing decision! The staff, including the owner, is super friendly and it is clear they are having fun. They are so passionate about their restaurant and take pride in their food and service, as they should! I ordered a steak torta. It was affordable and a huge portion! I barely ate half. My friends ordered a chile relleno taco and a steak burrito. They really enjoyed the food as well. It is perfectly seasoned and the flavor a merge so well in your mouth I am getting hungry just thinking about it! The owner said they are expanding their menu. They are still pretty new. I intend to visit again and try as much as possible! Also, the horchata was delicious and satisfies your sweet tooth. If you want good, affordable food and service, this place is totally worth a visit!

Great food .  . 
quick service , not pricey , nice people .

Wow! Great tacos! I work in the area and I decided to stop by for lunch with a a co-worker, to give Taco Tuesday a try (on a Tuesday) lol we left very impressed with the quality of food and service. Price is high for tacos but well worth it.

First time here.  Great and friendly service. I ordered the steak burrito which is a good size and delicious. All fresh ingredients and made to order. I hope they expand their menu to include rice and beans as well as maybe a nacho dish. Also chips and salsa and guacamole would be great too! Definitely will come back!
Very good Steak taco's. Best taco's in the Addison/Itasca/Wood Dale area. The gentlemen that were working were very pleasant. Definitely coming back.

I have worked in the area of Bensenville and Wood Dale for a little over a year I have been looking for a good taco place I have not been so lucky to find one thank you Taco Tuesday for opening your doors great food great service
The food was good, people were friendly, and everything was fresh. I was pleasantly surprised. Well definitely be back....
My family and I have been there 6 times since they opened and every time the food is good and consistent. We've had all the tacos and everyone is well proportioned and GOOD.

Delicious food reasonably priced. Highly recommend the Gringas! The fresh fruit waters offered are also a nice option. Will definitely be back.  Finally well-portioned tacos in the suburbs. Thank you Taco Tuesday!!!

Wednesday and Saturday half price pizza, cheap deals, great place to be with family and friends...

Ordered fried mushrooms, delicious

Friendly service, good food, nothing fancy but lots of tv to watch sports

I order the half price pizza from here on Wednesdays. Nothing special but a good pizza for the price. You can get a large pizza with a couple toppings for $8. They do have slot machines and darts in the bar area. The place is a little divey and probably needs to be updated a little bit.

Looking for the best pizza in Chicago? You won't find it here but you will find the best value for your dollar. Stopped in on a Tuesday night to grab a bite and a beer. The whole staff is family and they treat you wonderfully. Friendly and outgoing and they always check to make sure your doing  OK. The food is nothing to rave about but an 'all you can eat' buffet for $4.95, where in the world except here can you find that? Several big screens TV's to catch the game and a down home pub like atmosphere. I left with a full stomach and a full wallet. Great watering hole that has the best food value around.

My favorite pizza in the area, hands down! I love their crust because they use corn meal on the bottom of the pan that it's cooked on and it's always thin and crispy. Their sauce is tasty & they always put plenty of cheese. I prefer my pizza a little brown on top, so I alsk for it well done and they make it fresh to order every time! Best part is... they have half-off specials on pizza every Wednesday! We order almost every Wednesday. The wings are ok, but they do offer a good dinner salad. Def recommend!
Great family, neighborhood restaurant with fabulous deals throughout week.  Pizza is delicious along with other items on menu. A must try!  Owner and staff are very personable.

OMG cousins pizza! What else can I say, not to many words are needed to described the golden crust, over cheesy and delicious pie that you guys offer. I'm glad cousins has 1/2 off any pizza on Wednesday's... This place is to die for! If you haven't tried the best thin crust pizza in the area, you are missing out... Try it you won't be disappointed. I guarantee it

The Pizza was OK, my fried combo platter was ok...The wasn't anything special and I felt like it could have used more flavor. I went in to pick up my food and I feel like this place is more for machine poker rather then for food. 
I'm kinda sad I wasted my 30 bucks.

Cousins has the best pizza around here! They have half-price days and they also have a really good Buffet for $5 on Tuesdays. Half price appetizers during the Blackhawks games and a raffle at the end. I won a Jersey a couple months ago!
They have an "all you can eat " buffet Tuesday evenings-  pizza, salad, pasta, garlic bread, meatballs.  Great price, food is delicious.

Apparently when I updated this review it didn't update but totally wiped out the previous post . Here goes . This place is definitely worth trying , if you try them you'll be Back . On Sunday they have Free breakfast you only need to purchase a beverage .
Sometimes it's buffet style others it's scrambled eggs , toast, hash browns and either ham or sausage . Then they have customer appreciation Buffets I think it's once a month again Free  with the purchase of a beverage . Wednesdays all Pizza is half off no matter ingredients or size order it ANY WAY you want and then it's half price . Saturday half off pizza Dine in only. 
And now they have gaming machines with cash payouts .
They have on Tuesday nights a 5 dollar Buffet that has a pretty good selection  of pasta with 4 or 5 different sauces , fresh Pizza from cheese to different toppings , salad , hamburgers good sized ones and hot dogs . They have a nice family dining room separate from the bar and games and also Dart leagues .
For all the different things they do is a nice little pub . Definitely worth trying . Service is really good with the employees treating you good . I am not an employee either just a repeat customer .

This place is really easy to miss or overlook because it's set so far off Lake Street (set back from the road).  I'm not one that likes a bar atmosphere, but will tolerate it for their great cooking!  They have a separate restaurant area away from the bar area.

They have the incredible 1/2 price pizza (eat in or take out) on Wednesday and Saturday (eat in).  Pizza even on the 1/2 price days - they don't skimp on the ingredients cheese, sausage etc.  I don't know how they make any $$ off the 1/2 price days.  

Have inexpensive lunch specials Monday through Friday $2.99, a monthly "customer appreciation" meal that is FREE with the purchase of a $3.00 drink!  

What's not to love?  Friendly, efficient staff, family owned.  Love at first bite!  Hope they never change.  My only complaint is that the blinds are always closed - but I supposed that's because it's basically a bar.

As long as you're ok with your standard American pizza (crust is a little crackery, could use some work)  this place isn't bad. 

I got my pizza on a Wed. They have 50% off all pizza on Wednesdays and it's a great deal. No coupon, didn't even have to mention it. 

The place is like a pub and seems to be a popular hangout. I've always seen it hiding in a shopping center and never expected it when I walked in. 

My wait for my pizza was about an hour, which surprised me. Not sure if this is because of the Wed half price deal or if it's just a popular place. Maybe a little of both.
I really like the pizza here.  Nice friendly staff.  Nice place to relax and watch a game.  My new Friday night hangout.  Glad I discovered it.

Excellent pizza!  Generous servings and friendly staff.
WILL BE BACK!

I have been going here for a couple of years now. The staff is friendly and always accommodating. I like watching games there and the pizza is great. The pizza is different from other places. They have their secret recipe. The best way to describe it is a thin cracker cornmeal crust. They are generous with the cheese. They have introduced gaming machines.

went a few Saturday's ago (had another Amazon Local deal) - had the chicken parm  - was pretty good!  The chicken breast was large and juicy and the sauce was just right - we ordered a pizza to go  - that definitely needed a bit more - crust was not buttery and was lacking that "something special"   We were waited on by a very nice gentleman (I believe one of the brother's).  The atmosphere is nothing to write about (no really nothing to write about!) it's a Pub type environment with a separate dining area ...almost an afterthought.  But the food is good enough.  At least give this place a try!
Excellent riff raff of the burbs! The pizza is totally worth it! The staff are always working hard around this place. The alfredo pizza is perfect. 1/2 priced pizzas on Wednesdays is a steal!
Kind of a hole in the wall. Food is ok but not great. Service was slow like they aren't used to serving food. It's like a pub that decided to serve food

This place is so....odd.  I looked this up a while ago wondering what it was. I had driven by it many times and it always seemed empty. Well, my husband and I were driving home from the hawks game and feeling adventurous, so we decided to give it a whirl. 

There was one other family inside, when we went to the counter. We looked at the menu for a while when one of the younger workers said, if you're eating here you can take the menu and sit down. So, we did just that. 

Anyway, we both ordered the chicken shawarma, I got fries and the hubs got rice.  The wait wasn't too long, and he brought us our waters after the food came out. Now, the food was delicious.  Such great flavor. 

I just felt so uncomfortable while I was there. Service was okay, and prices were okay too. It was more of a I wanted to inhale my food and leave type of place. Maybe it would be better for takeout?

The worst chicken charga i ever had.
Chicken was very dry with no spices
Will never go back

So I stopped in here a few days ago. I have so much to write about this place.

1. I was expecting something like Fazzolis. I live Fazzolis. Fast food Italian that use to be in the Chicago area but they all were shut down in this area. Well this place is far from it. And it was sort of expensive.

2. Not really Italian. It's more middle eastern with many items on their menu very middle eastern. Actually, everyone there from customers to employees were middle eastern. Lol. Nothing wrong with that, but I felt that was the only demographic they were targeting. There was even middle eastern plaques above the cashier.

3. The interior was very 80's like and looked very drub. Cheap napkins, plates, and silverware. 

I felt very awkward being there. I really felt like they were losing money. However, the customer service was good and the food was good. I might come here again for pasta dishes, but they need some work to do. It ain't so Fazzolies though.
Good food! Their meat lovers pizza is good. They don't put enough meat on the pepperoni or sausage pizza...

I have never written a yelp review but seriously disappointed visiting it today, the steak sucked big time even for a Desi, the gyros were too much fried, chicken wings were ok, the service was slow, people were kind but slow, should have taken my wife a better place, 

They were kind enough to give a complementary sandwich, but even that sucks while I am having it now, kind, slow people but shitty food..

Out of the 3 Italian Expresses (not sure if they're a chain or not), this is the one I feel most comfortable at. It's clean, has polite staff, and tastes awesome. Not much more I can ask for in a restaurant. 

Their gyros are amazing, especially when they're on their pizza. The fries are, honestly, the best fries I've ever had--just crunchy enough to know it's cooked well but soggy enough to make it enjoyable while engulfing them. I love how they give cans of pop as opposed to every other place that gives you a watered down drink that doesn't resemble, in taste, what you asked for. There's a lot more to their menu, that I've heard is great as well, but I just get the same thing every time so I wouldn't know.

Overall, it's a cool place that has the potential to become a Buffalo Wild Wings (they have a projector screen) for people that eat Zabiha Halal. Also, try out their buffet during the month of Ramadan!
Why don't they just name it Pakistani express, why Italian?  Because it was owned by an Italian family in Rogers park back in 80's so they just kept the name Just an fyi.
Loved the food, especially the Giro Sandwich. Conveniently located but best of all was the service and staff. Hats off ! One of the best places to eat Halal in Schaumburg.

Lets get this straight, this is NOT AN ITALIAN RESTAURANT. For those who are familiar with the famous Pakistani Italian Express restaurant on Devon Ave in Chicago know that your not going to get your typical Italian food in this joint. Rather its a fusion of fast food, Pizza and Pakistani cuisine.

Over all the food is good but I would give this place 5 star if the service was slightly better. I usually go for the spicy Chicken TIkka Pizza or Spicy Gyro pizza. The other must have item on the menu is Ham Burger with Gyro meat.

What I have failed to understand if why they have decided to not use the drive thru. Most restaurant would love to have a drive through option.

Restaurant review
Super slow service and okay gyro "meh. I've experienced better" sums up the experience here. This is a great restaurant if you have friends that need to eat halal. The prices are okay and there are few places where you can get halal t-bone steak for 20 dollar ish. I ended up stopping by during AMEX small business day and got two orders of gyro to go. I was surprised as it was lunch and there was no one there. After taking my order I sat and waited for 20 minutes for the food to come out. Albiet the gyros were hot and the fries were fresh although small. I still can't imagine what happens if this places ever gets busy. The gyro were above average and the yogurt sauce help balance the grease. I wish this place good luck, but with the marketing going on so far and the business volume I would not expect this place to stay running for long. Just as in the past this was wendy's, el pollo loco, and some kabob place.....

Pro: fresh food

Cons: very slow service, average prices, small parking lot

Hidden gem: 
There is a lunch special, but I forgot what the deal entails....

Having visited another place called Italian Express in Glendale Heights, I've had this second Italian Express located off of Barrington Road and Irving Park in Hanover Park on my "to visit list" for quite some time. I finally had the opportunity to stop by here and give it a try. The first thing that's worth noting is that this place is set up more like a typical fast food joint. However, it is a place where you sit, are given a menu and are waited on. 

What's interesting about both this and the Glendale Heights Italian Express is that it's more of a Pakistani restaurant than an Italian eatery. While they do have things like Pizza, the focus here is more on Halal meats and Middle Eastern cuisine. The inside here is fairly modern looking and very clean. It has quite a different decor than the Glendale Heights Italian Express. I'm uncertain of how they are related, but the menu did not appear to be identical here either. After looking over their menu and considering my options I went for the jumbo hot dog with fries. 

Less than ten minutes after I ordered my food was brought to me. The hot dog I received came on a large thick roll similar to the Italian bread used throughout Chicagoland to serve Italian beef sandwiches. On the hot dog were pickle slices like those found on a hamburger, mustard, relish, onion slices and a few pieces of sliced tomato. The sausage itself was skinless and fairly thick (after all, it was listed as being a Jumbo all beef dog), it had a familiar taste though I can't immediately pinpoint the vendor. I'd say the combination of condiments, somewhat hard bread and frank went together decently but the bread really wasn't the right fit for this kind of hot dog.

There were also fries with my hot dog, I had a few of these and they were pretty good. They had a very crisp outside with a nice potato paste on the inside. They were a little salty, but not particularly greasy, these were better than the hot dog was.

Overall, I liked this Italian Express considerably more than the one in Glendale Heights. I think it's an interesting place to visit with the fusion of Middle Eastern and Italian cuisine. While my hot dog wasn't fantastic and was a little pricey at around 6.00 with fries, I'm going to give this place three stars. Decent food at a decent price but nothing that will blow your mind.

I'm sure non desis don't have a clue that this is a desi ish place. So the reviews are mixed or negative. I give it 5 stars just for the chicken Tikka pizza. I won't even write about it...you just have to try it and don't be a sissy...do it with onion and jalapeño. ..sissy.

I've been eating from Italian Express for years, whether it be in Devon, Glendale Heights, or here in Hanover Park. I have got to say, I am extremely satisfied each time. I order different things every time I come - chili chicken pizza, spicy gyros, double gyro cheeseburger, etc. The food never fails me. The owner is very nice, and the workers are genuine and always ready to assist you. I have not had one bad experience at this restaurant. Overall, the food is great, the customer service is great, and I recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a yummy, filling meal. 

Also, this is NOT an Italian restaurant. The food is primarily a fusion between American fast food and Pakistani flavors.
Gyros are good. Burgers are obviously frozen. No music, so you're just sitting in a quiet room. Prices are descent.

Good food , priced right.
Place is so clean , yes they are under staffed but it looks OK during the weekends.
This place is cleaner and nicer than the Glendale Heights location. The only thing I can recommend is the meat lovers pizza. Haven't tried anything else here.

Food was alright and the service was friendly, but they were severely understaffed.  We ordered 3 dinners to go and it took almost 30 minutes to make.  They had one lady working at the register and I believe one cook in back.  Again, food was okay, but the promptness was not the best in regards to how long it took to get our food.
it's amazing! it's gyro pizza is super good.

Very good place, was excited when they opened the location in Hanover Park. I always get the extra large meat lovers pizza and even though it is a little pricey (25-30 bucks), it includes a 2 liter Coke and will definitely feed and fill up 4 grown adults. It is all ZABIHA HALAL too which is great and the pizza has more than enough meat on it! Besides the pizza I get the gyro's which are also very good. Definitely would recommend to people who are looking for a nice halal place to eat

I wanted some pasta, and decided to try Italian express.
Umm... this restaurant was very weird.....
This place was not an italian restaurant, it was more like middle eastern place.
So I ended up getting gyros, not pasta, it was good. but i don't think i'll be coming back here, because the restaurant is just too weird....

I don't get the "Italian Express" name. It isn't Italian or remotely close to Italian. Is it a ploy to get people in the door?

We visited shortly after Christmas. We both wanted pasta and remembered this place was down the street. We enter and not a soul was in the place...well, one guy was, he was watching rugby (? I still don't even know if this was what was on) on a huge screen that came down from the ceiling. It appeared he worked there or knew the owner? 

Anyways, we walk in and awkwardly stand at the counter. There isn't a true menu display so we looked at a takeout menu. I started seeing food of middle eastern decent which should have been a red flag. We still ordered 2 pasta dishes, one with meatballs, the other with sausage and 2 drinks. We sit down and drinks were brought out to us. It wasn't a long wait for the food but when it finally came out I was pretty surprised. There was probably 20 cents worth of pasta and each dish and the meal cost $30. The meat was pretty questionable too. I took a small bite of my sausage and it tasted like breakfast sausage. They also gave us 2 rolls which were decent as they were soft and warm. 

Sorry but we won't be back.

I really don't understand the negative reviews - this place has really yummy fast food.

First of all - don't be fooled by the name, it's not "Italian" only. It started as an Italian place with pizza and yes - they still have really GOOD pizza! But, it became famous for their spicy gyros! The spicy gyros and regular gyros are amazing as are almost all of their burgers and sandwiches. The fries are crispy on the outside and soft on the inside....delicious!

Get the following and you will not be disappointed:
Spicy or Regular Gyro
Gyro Pizza or any pizza
Buffalo Wings
Rib Eye Steak Sandwich (ask for it without ketchup)!
Cheeseburger with Gyros

The place itself is nice and clean and the wait staff is friendly.

Overall, it's honestly one of the best places for really flavorful and freshly made fast food.
The food tasted fine, though it took a while to serve.  I think we were there for a good 45 minutes, which is extensive for a restaurant self-titled "express."

excellent customer service and excellent food
the fact that arrived with 4 families at closing time we got excellent service and the food was simply to die for 
the staff was very courteous and well
mannered

New location right around the corner from where we are, so highly convenient. Serves same menu as the location at Glendale Heights and Devon. I normally do carry out or delivery but decided to dine-in with the family today.

PROS - Great food, especially their steaks. Nice ambience and interior decor.

CONS - Service could be improved. A kid was serving us who was good at following up if we needed something e.t.c., but just lacked the basic waiting skill. Could not take directions well (brought out appetizer and dinner rolls with main course even though we said otherwise). Cutlery was missing and not enough plates brought out. When we asked for a to go box, empty dishes,plates were not taken away to make room for to go boxes.

Another caveat was the steak entrees. Usually at the other locations, the steaks are served up with 2 sides. This location does not honor that. As a franchise, I would think one should be consistent on how they serve their meals.

Other than that, great place to try out .

Horrible food in short.
The shawarma we ordered had lethal amount of salt.
The nachos plate had a lot of nachos but maybe a few pieces of chicken along with 2 spoons of their salsa.

The chicken wings we ordered were fresh but raw and the chicken pieces were the size of half of my index fingers. You have to see if to believe it
I have never had this bad food I a very long time

I have been to this place countless time and each time I have been disappointed.  Their food was and is unacceptable compared to the other Italian express.  I do not go here because  lack of taste, quality, and quantity of food.  The owner does not know what he is doing.  Please don't waste your time or money because  this Italian express is now just a franchise with horrible chefs .

Very strange place. When I saw italian, I was expecting lasagna, pizza, or pasta. Instead the menu varied from gyros, wing, steaks, platters etc.... Thats a big throw off. To top it all off, there was an entire family from kids to grand parents behind the counter attempting to catch on to what people are ordering. Im no racist but middle eastern folks owing a restaurant such as this is a no no. I was immediately turned off by the kid servers and long beards not to mention the menu selection. I walked out and so did the other 3 people behind me.
False advertising!!  There is nothing Italian about this place.

New location, proven name. This restaurant opened after much anticipation. The new owner has really stepped up and is providing just the right venue for a night out with family or friends. 

The spicy gyros pizza, buffalo wings and gyros cheese burger are all great. It's a new place and recipes are being tweaked to get it just right. 

The ambiance is great too. It is very modern and clean. Definitely recommend this to anyone who is looking for a good Italian fix.

I usually don't write reviews, but this place inspired me...  I'm not going to sugar coat it --- this place sucks with a capital S. 

This place was not italian nor express. The only thing we wanted express was to get out of there!

Hard to explain weird mish-mosh food selection -- I ordered a rib-eye steak sandwich, it showed up with ketchup and pickles and it tasted nothing like steak. My spouse ordered a gyro, and even though he asked for extra sauce, they were stingy with it, none on pita bread and one little round dish of it on the side. I ended up eating the meal i ordered for my kid since it was just bread w sauce and cheese. Can't screw that up right?  After meal (not sure I'd call it that) made sure to have a shot of alcohol to hopefully stave off any poss food poisoning....
