Finally, a zabiha halal fast food joint that has a good ambience. You can't go wrong with ordering the Gyros: spicy or regular. They have good fries. My wife ordered the t-bone steak which wasn't bad. The chicken noodle soup was ok  Salad was good. The chicken strips for my daughter were not good. We had to dunk it in ketchup. Service was good but food did take some time to come out. Will try more items to give a better review.

Visited this place on a Thursday night with a group of 14 buddies. Overall this place was great - the ambiance was nice, there was a lot of good food consumed and the entertainment (projection system for Thursday night football and the NBA on TNT) really put a complete dining experience on this place.

Pros:
1. For all the Muslims that want to visit the place, I found out that the place serves Zabiha-Halal meat. 
2. The decor and ambiance was very inviting, clean and comfortable. The place really looks nice. Its a casual dining spot. 
3. There was a projection system setup so we could enjoy some NFL and NBA on a Thursday night. Definitely a good touch.
4. Food was good - it was served fresh and hot and in generous portions. We ended up ordering three XL pizzas - one with Spicy Gyros, a Meat Lovers and a Chicken Tikka Pizza. The Meat Lovers by far was the best of all of the three. 
5. Pricing was Reasonable - for 15 people, pizza and appetizers we spent about 100. 

Cons:
1. Service was a little slow - not a deal breaker considering the place is pretty new. So I would expect this to improve.
2. The sampler basket was disappointing. I love appetizers and I felt that the onion rings were over cooked, the mushrooms didn't have much flavor and the buffalo wings left a lot to be desired. 

Overall a very promising place - I would definitely recommend.

This is a nice clean and welcoming Restaurant with good ambiance. The food is yummy. I had the Gyros, Cheeseburger, and Chicken wings.  It may not be authentic Italian place but it still is a great place to eat.

Um well!!! If I could give 0 stars I would to be quite frank.  So I saw this new restaurant and I am all for Italian food so I thought I'd try it out one afternoon.  I should have known just by pulling in the parking lot at 1:30pm and there were no cars in the parking lot then again when I walked in and there wasn't anyone in the dining room.  I thought I'd give them the benefit of the doubt so I ordered but to my dismay there was little in the way of Italian choices.  I did end up ordering a pasta dish.  With my dish I got a side which I had the choice of potato, rice, coleslaw or pasta. Wait that doesn't make sense. First, why would I have another carb as a side or why would I have pasta as a side for a pasta dish?????? Weird. I had my order to go and when I got home the paper bag was soaked with oil and fell apart on my counter. Ugh!!! I hate that!!! I took a couple bites and couldn't eat anymore.  This dish was completely inedible.  I wasted $10 of my money!!  The pasta was way way over cooked it just turned to mush when the fork hit it.  The vegetables were slimey and gross.  Please don't eat here.  It is not an Italian restaurant.
The worst delivery service ever. We have called twice and she said they don't know if we can deliver because her boss is not there. Why would you say you do delivery if you don't know if you can?

Note: this is not an Italian place!! It's an Indian/Pakistani restaurant with various pasta and pizza options. I stand by the gyros pizza only... It's absolutely amazing!!! I will be coming back again and again for the pizza. With that said, I would never order a pasta dish here... Indians do not cook pasta! The wings were sad too... just go for the pizza!!
Very wierd restaurant

Came here on a Thursday night after a last minute detour from our original destination: Lou's.  The fam and I had been wanting to try this place for a while, tonight we got the chance. 

Entering into a completely empty restaurant is always a little daunting, but I still had a good feeling about this place.  We ordered at the counter and grabbed a table.   Food was served hot and quick. 

Had the hummus and the spicy Moggo fries as appetizers.  The hummus was just eh...but the fries were tasty. 

I ordered the chicken tikka platter and subbed the rice with an extra serving of salad.  The salad was straight up bagged salad, but it was fresh and crisp so no stars lost for that.  The chicken was tasty and juicy, and the portions were VERY generous, which is always a plus in my book! 

We also had the chicken tikka pizza, an onion & green pepper pizza, and a mushroom pizza.  The pizzas were slightly larger in size considering it's listed as "individual- size" but again, absolutely no issues with that.  The crust was light yet sturdy, sauces were tasty, and cooked just right. 

After ordering and paying, I had the urge to try one of their fresh juices.   I settled on "Popeye's Arms," and it was good...would've been better if served on ice.

Not only was the food great, but the speed and service was very gratifying.  I went to pay for my juice and the extra pitas we ordered, and the gentleman behind the counter comped it after learning it was our first visit.  Because of that, and everything else previously mentioned, it definitely won't be the last.

Check in reward is very misleading. You need to get 2 pizzas with toppings for 1 free cheese pizza.

I was planning on getting chicken tikka pizza and falafel (based on the reviews). I didn't want 3 pizzas, so I ended up not getting the check in, even tho I marked it on yelp. Also, you don't need it, that's their special in the restaurant.

The guy working wasn't very friendly and I felt a little uncomfortable, but I still ordered chicken tikka pizza and falafel pita. Came out to $16. Kinda pricey for a 10 inch pizza and a pita with barely anything in it. 

I got excited when I got my food because it smelled so good! Like garlic bread or something buttery and garlicy.

Well... the falafel was salty as f and it seemed like it was mostly made of flour. It was very bready. 4 falafel with one slice of tomato a little lettuce and a few cubes of cucumber.... not worth it.

You'd think 10 inches is a lot, but when I opened the box, it was pretty small. For $9, I expect way more. The pizza was also salty as f and bitter. I just saw another review mentioning the bitterness and I think it's because of the garlic. 

I thought this place would be really good from the reviews, but it was just eh. The only flavor in my mouth is salt right now. If they toned down the salt, it might be a little more edible. But I doubt I'll be back.

The best falafel i've had, BUT you have to eat it fresh!!! It doesn't taste as good when you take it home. The sandwiches and platters are delicious, though i think it can use more rice. The chicken is yummy and has a good amount of spice (i forgot the name of the exact platter we ordered). The club sandwich is okay, not the best i've had. Although the falafel was delicious, I wasn't a fan of the falafel sandwich. It was only $4.99 during lunch time, but it was just four pieces of falafel in a pita with lettuce. I would have rather ordered two orders or falafel (8 total) for $4 and share it with family. 

I love their special red sauce they give. Super delicious and i like it more than Pita Inn's spicy sauce. The pizza looks delicious but wasn't able to try it. I'm definitely going to try that next time. Overall, very satisfying.

I was in the mood for pizza and wanted to try something new, found this place on Yelp and it says that is Halal. so I decided to give this place a try. the place is nice and clean, I liked the set up, you can tell it was recently remodeled. The service was a little slow. there was one guy taking orders for walk in customers and phone orders, plus serving the food to the tables. So anyways I find out that the Chicken is the only thing that is Zabiha Halal. and they had a promotion going on where you buy 2 pizzas and you get one cheese pizza for free. each is a 10 inch pie. so we ordered the Chicken Tikka, Grilled Chicken and got a cheese for free. The Chicken Tikka Pizza was good, I really liked that, but the grilled chicken pizza was bland, no taste to the chicken at all.
Overall this place was decent.

The peli peli chicken platter was spicy bitter, the rice was tasseled and salad was pretty much just shredded ice berg with a couple of sad sliced tomatoes.   The side salad same.  The falafel was dry, overcomes and burnt on outside.  The pizza was okay and nothing special in flavor.   The tikka chicken was bitter tasting.   Overall not a good delivery email and would not recommend this place.

The BEST falafel sandwich in the NW suburbs!  I believe the sandwich cost $5.95 (dinnertime), and was worth every penny.  You will find slightly less expensive ones out there, but they suck in comparison.  

My pita was overstuffed with four huge falafels along with tomatoes, lettuce, cucumbers, and tahini sauce.  Hot sauce and Tszaziki sauce (I think) came on the side.  I also ordered a side of hummus.  Not sure if you can just ask for some hummus on your falafel sandwich, but I like ordering a full side because it comes with that delicious oil on top!  The side of hummus also included a couple of olives and, of course, pita bread!  

Restaurant was clean, including the bathroom, I mean SPOTLESS clean.  That means a lot to me.

I expected the employees to be like street vendor employees of New York, due to their restaurant name.  So I expected the worst.   Last year I went to NYC and stayed right in Manhattan.  I ate A LOT of street food because it's damn good.  But the vendors are jerks.  One jerk charged me 7 dollars for a lousy hot dog!  The hotel concierge told me that basically I acted too much like a tourist and that they could smell me a mile away.  Then the hotel concierge held his hand out for a tip.  Geesh!

Back to the employees here at NYFPFaG:  They were super nice and answered all of my questions without being mean or rude.   They made sure I left with my takeout order with everything I needed (including utensils, seasonings, etc.)

So if you're craving some NY food and don't want to travel to NY, give this place a try!  And if you're not craving NY food, take a break from your Italian beef sandwich and try this place instead.  You'll be pleasantly satisfied.

Came here with family after a day of shopping and found this place near Patel Brothers. We ordered the Ferrero Richer milkshake, spicy mogo fries, falafel wrap, and paneer tikka pizza. I liked how you can see the food being made, it's almost an open kitchen but they don't have a door between the register area so it's reassuring everything is clean back there and you can tell the food is fresh! Falafel came out PERFECT and crispy and warm on the outside. I'm not sure what it is but the spicy red sauce is AMAZING. The portions are super generous. Would be nice to know how much food you're getting before you order but it's a good problem to have. Will definitely be back!

The best pizza I've had in a looong time. Seriously amazing. I'm in town for work and I try not to go to chain restaurants when I travel. Picked up the menu at the hotel and saw chicken tikka pizza. BOOM sign me up. I love chicken tikka at Indian restaurants and I love pizza. NY Famous Pizza DEFINITELY didn't disappoint. Some of the reviews mentioned spicy mogo fries so I got those with my pizza. Legit, the best fries I've had in my life. Seriously, it has this spicy red sauce on it and the texture is a little thicker. It's made of cassava and deep fried from what I understand. The portion was super generous for the price ($9) and the chicken was cooked perfectly. This makes B Dubs Mumbai masala My roommate/coworker went with the spicy chicken wrap which was HUGEEE for the price. He got the regular mogo fries because he can't handle the heat. Whatever, his loss. Delivery was quick and the flavors are unique. Pretty glad I skipped the Sarpinos offer and took a shot here. I'll order here again to try some of their other items next time I'm in town. Boston and these chain places needs to step their game up!
Great place to eat. Clean and food is fresh. I had the chicken panini and wife had chicken club. Both very good.
Awesome new place in the area. They have the best fresh falafel and good lunch specials.  Chicken tikka is also great!

Wow really good pizza faster delivery the food was hot. So I can say I love the pizza  I will also order from here.    I have been on the hunt for the best delivery and I have it now lol      Who don't love hot plus good pizza right!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This place was such a surprise ! Our Indian pallet demands Indian flavours and that's exactly what I we were craving yesterday ! The chicken tikka pizza was bang on ! I loved it till the last bite.the garlic knots were too dry but what do you expect for 2 bucks ! The peri peri chicken platter was decent but oh my god too spicy ! It did say spicy but oh my it was over spicy for me also ! But I will go back for the chicken tikka ! The delivery time was decent ! I did a little happy dance after the chicken tikka pizza !

A wide range of choices (way more than just pizza here). Everything I've tried has been flavorful and well prepared. Staff is very friendly and the restaurant, including the bathroom, is very clean. The pili pili fries are definitely worth trying. Great new place to check out!
I got pizza from here. It was delicious. I am definitely going back! Great customer service. Owner is very courteous.

I came here a few weeks ago, great experience. Being that it is in the same plaza as Patel bros, this restaurant provides delicious food in a convenient location. I had the paneer tikka pizza which was excellent. Very nice to see a new restaurant with quality food in the Schaumburg area. 5/5 will return

This place just opened up down the street from my car wash so I gave it a shot for lunch today. Amazing pizza and appetizers, all their dishes are really on point. The mogo fries and spicy pilli pills chicken wrap was great. I really like the pilli pilli sauce these guys do, very spicy and gives a good kick. The staff was also very friendly and the place was new and clean. Great addition to the neighborhood, I will definitely come back with the whole office.

Very clean place, good food and very courteous staff. We had falafel and cassava fries and it was delicious!  Falafel was very well filled with lettuce, cucumber,carrots and 3-4 falafels. Sauces were good too. It was very filling compared to Pita house. Will definitely visit  again.

A business trip landed me in Schaumburg, IL. There were only chain restaurants in the area and saw their menu near the desk. AMAZING find. Got the Kenya Crispies, Mogo Pilli Pilli Fries and a chicken tikka pizza. Chicken was properly marinated but the mogo fries were excellent! Never had something like that before. The 5 stars is because of all that and great service, patiently explaining items I hadn't seen before. If I'm ever back in Schaumburg with a craving, I'll definitely check them out again.

This place probably has the best pizza in the area, solely due to the fact they have awesome unique toppings like paneer and chicken tikka, falafel (WOW!) and everything is made in front of you because they have an open kitchen. Service is great and bathrooms, eating areas, and kitchen all look very clean. Owner suggested we try mogo pilli pilli fries if we like spicy food and it was AMAZING. Wife tried the falafel wrap which was in the lunch special and it was a major hit. Crispy on the outside and creamy but consistent inside. Great food and the price makes it even better. They have a Ferrero Rocher milkshake on the menu that looks great and smoothies too. This has become a mandatory stop every time we go to Patel Brothers!

Saw this place open up next to Patel Brothers. My family and I have always enjoyed these New York style pizzas with different toppings so thought we'd give it a shot when we were in town. They have a lot of unique options like falafel and chicken tikka as pizza toppings, and some items were East African or Caribbean which was nice to see in a strip mall in Schaumburg. Decent prices, great food, and clean dining area and bathrooms. We will definitely return if we're in the area!

This place surprised me. Went there for lunch on a Sunday. Place is very clean. We ordered a falafel wrap and a Paneer tikka pizza. Both the items looked fresh and tasted great. Will definitely go there again.

The best New York style pizza in Schaumburg. Love the price/size ratio so I can get different pizzas with different toppings. Nice and clean place, and great friendly staff. Hope they get online ordering up soon so I can order delivery.
I tried the Kenya Fries and they were AMAZING!!!!  I don't know what that red sauce was that they gave on the side, but I want a bucket of it!!
Went back and had a half falafel half paneer pizza. Amazing! Get pilli pilli sauce on the side!
Traveled here with family and had to stop in when I saw Famous Pizza. Wow. Mogo fries tasted just like London. If I'm ever back in the area I wanna try the wraps too. Gotta get the pilli pilli!

The flavors are good, but my initial shock was how small the pizza was. For 9 dollars a pizza, I expected it to be at least a full size pizza. This looks like a kid size pizza. They don't really mention the size so you would never know. You can get a better deal at Mama Maria's or Blaze pizza, the flavors are just as good and you get more for your money.
I ordered the Chicken Tikka pizza and it was very good.  The staff were welcoming and the building was clean and freshly remodeled. Great addition to the neighborhood.

Great chicken tikka pizza and amazing falafel! Nice crispy crust and sauce was very tasty. They also make specialty items like Mogo fries and Kenya crispies which we saw on a lot of tables.  The place was clean and  the food was fresh with flavor. Can't wait to go back!

Date of delivery: 29-September-2016
Time of the delivery: Late dinner

I have used this place in the past and by far, this is one of the best pizza in the Western burbs.

I ordered medium size pizza (feeds about 2-3 people).  I got pineapple, green pepper and half pepperoni/half sausage.  I am a weird one, so I made sure I asked for a pie cut.  Sorry, but pizza is not meant to be cut in squares, at that point it's just cracker with toppings....

Their traditional crust is something in between thin & deep dish.  I LOVE that crust!  I don't know what it is about that crust, it's just good!  They delivered very quickly and efficiently!  Overall great experience!

A+!

I have ordered their thin crust pizza twice using delivery. I enjoyed it better the first time, but both times the pizza has been reasonably good. It's not going to be one of my go-to places at this point, but I may try Joseph's again.

The pizza comes in a bag instead of a box. That is kind of unusual and somewhat inconvenient, but it also feels authentic at the same time!

I love this pizza. 

This is not a fancy place. People show up and get their pizza and go. There's a couple tables you could eat at if you wanted to, though really no one does. They do tons of business to the bar next door. This place is so outta my way now, but I do love to grab pizza here when I can. If you spend over a certain amount, they toss you a free litre of RC cola.

Their crust is soft, not crispy. The thin crust is soft and thin and the regular is soft and doughy, and I weirdly like both, so I like to mix it up. I don't know about their foods beyond pizza so this review is entirely based off the pizza. And the pizza isn't super fancy either, it just has that "comfort food" palate pleasing aspect that you keep coming back to.

OMG! This is the best thin crust ever. I just moved here from the South Loop so there's plenty there to choose from. I'm so happy I found these guys. I loved it so much, I ordered it today. Get the thin crust, you won't be sorry. Delicious.

They are open on Wednesday, despite what they have on their hours listed here on yelp. They have funky hours so call first before coming. Ordering ahead is a great idea too because it takes almost half hour to bake an 18" pizza. 

I've been coming here for years... They're very famous and busy during the football season. Their thin crust is the best.  Get the Italian beef and giardinera on thin crust. An 18" with 2 toppings is only $21.60 

They sell pizza by the slice for $3. I wouldn't recommend because their classic dough is too doughy for me.

Agree with what has been said about employees, not welcoming. 

Ordered the half slab ribs and chicken dinner. Both horrible, both had zero taste, both were uneatable. The fries were gross and soggy. Also had zero taste. All the salt and katsup couldn't save them. 

They forgot our salads for both dinners. 

I have never been here before and I can say I will never return. 

This was without a doubt one of the worst experiences I have ever had with take out.

My suggestion would be to take a pass, unless you like food with zero taste.

I am a pizza whore...I love any kind of pizza, thin crust, pan, deep, stuffed (my favorite is wood burning oven) and Joseph's pizza definitely has a unique regular crust pizza which is not the same as their pan (which I've tried from here, and was delicious as well) but just that pillowy, soft, sink into your teeth kindof crust. More like a combo of a thin & pan, but not as doughy as pan. The sauce is tasty and not overwhelming...and the right amount of cheese and ingredients.  

I've only ordered delivery from here and just recently ordered a med reg pizza, combo beef sandwich, sub sandwich and baked clams.  I'm giving 3 stars based on my recent order and on the rest of the food and service.  Pizza was delicious, no complaints.  baked clams also great, with large pieces of clam you could actually bite into and not all filling.

Not so great:  friend said beef sandwich was dry and tasted like it had been sitting for awhile..odd taste.  His sub sandwich consisted of a couple pieces of meat, with the remaining ingredients being all lettuce and tomato.  Delivery time?  was told 45 minutes and order did not arrive until over an hour and we were STARVING.  I gave them 4 stars for unique, reg crust pizza (it is a pizza joint after all) but they need to work on delivery times and not tell everyone 45 min. Pizza & baked clams are keepers here!

This is my second review on this place because if you've read the 1st review I wasn't suppose to order from here again. my husband ordered from here. he hated it. Me I like the flavors but the bread was soooo tuff. I was eating it like a Loin tearing lems off a animal.
Never again.
Joseph's is pretty good, customer service is great,   at least over the phone. The Hawaiian pizza is also good.

We NEVER complain but tonight We ordered dinner that totaled  $45.10 before tip. Two orders of baked mostaccolli (that came with no ricotta cheese plus cold mozzarella cheese on top) three side orders of meatballs (delicious actually!) an order of mozzarella sticks ( so overcooked there was no cheese inside) and garlic bread (that was a hockey puck). We called and complained ( we have ordered here for years and NEVER complained) and spoke with a manager named Ron who was beyond ignorant and had no cares about our complaints. We explained we were told 45-60 minutes for delivery even though it arrived at 92 minutes. (We still tipped the delivery driver and she apologized and gave us an extra one liter of RC for free that we told her we did not want). We explained to Ron how someone called back 25 minutes after we initially placed our order to clarify if we wanted mozzarella sticks and not cheese filled bread sticks and was still told the food would arrive within 30 minutes. Yet Ron was ignorant and fought with us on the phone for ten minutes when all we wanted for him to do is apologize.  But instead blamed it on the new guy. Seriously customer service along with great food is what people come back for, and every restaurant will not be perfect 100% of the time and thats okay and forgivable if your managers or staff is sympathetic to your customers concerns. You Ron failed. We have been customers since I lived in Glendale Heights over 10 years ago. I do not care about your $10 credit after ten minutes of you arguing with me, even when i offered to send you a text or email of the pictures of the food that was delivered.  Seriously disappointed in how we were treated. We did not want free food or a credit we wanted you to LISTEN and ACKNOWLEDGE our complaint.
Better places out there, rude owner and food taste bad.

Pizza was decent, cheese filled breadsticks were awesome. However, the counter employee was sullen. 

All of this would have been fine, and i wouldn't have been compelled to post a yelp review.

However, the marinara had beef in it and we were not told this. I do not care about meat being in a sauce. I love meat. However, one of my good friends is a vegetarian and hasn't had meat in over 10 years, and the beef is so finely milled that we didn't notice until we were finished.
$16.75 for 1 medium 1 topping pizza??!! Are you serious? I don't care how good it is. It's way too expensive for a medium pizza.

So far, the best pizza place around town.  I don't order pizza that often but now that I know that Joseph's can dish a good pie, I'm all for it.  Order time is only 20 minutes and best part of course; is that they pile on the toppings!

We built our own pizza with roast beef, onions and jalapenos. Heartburn with crust, right? But it was oh so delicious!  Great prices to boot for the customized pie too!

Placed an order to be delivered and was told it would take about 45min. After an hour I called and was told the driver left about 5 minutes ago. After another 10 minutes the pizza finally showed up. I opened it up and it was ice cold and disgusting. It may have left 5 minutes ago, but it must have been sitting there for quite some time before it left their location. When I called and asked to speak to a manager he told me he could make another one and send it but we didn't want to wait another hour to eat. (it would have been over 2hrs from the original order). I asked him if I could just call on another time and get a free pizza and he basically said no. He also stated if I didn't want the cold pizza that was delivered, he'd send someone back to pick it up and give me a credit..... seriously?!?!? They wouldn't just refund my money, they'd rather waste more time by sending the driver back. I have friends who have raved about this place and have order on 1 or 2 occasions prior. I definitely won't be ordering from them again any time soon, unless I pick it up. Their pizza is ok but their delivery and customer service really SUCKS!!!

I love this place not only for the awesome pizza (best thin crust ever) as well as their sides/appetizers! my family loves ordering from there and the chicken strip are inhaled on site! I would also like to give major kudos to the amazing service they provide over the phone. The gentleman asked me my name was very professional and used my name throughout the order and showed that he cared about providing quality service. Most of the time when I order pizza, I feel extremely rushed and feel like l am an inconvenience if I ask any questions. not the case here. 

Superior food and superior service!

Finally a great pizza place near us! Sauce was on point, reasonably priced- It is also a busy restaurant, which is always a good sign. Will definitely be ordering here again.. The only critique is the crust could be crispier. Otherwise best in the area!

This place is a very typical "hole in the wall."  It is located in a strip mall, next to a bar and the place is a counter with a couple of tables.  

Now, let's get past cosmetics because this place is great.  They have fresh, homemade breadsticks stuffed with cheese.  Their prices are more than reasonable.  A one-topping party size pizza (18 inches) will only set you back $16.  Phenomenal.  

I had the thin crust pizza.  It was the perfect dough.  Thin, but not crunchy, good bite without being too doughy.  The sausage was delicious.  Clearly fresh and generously topped.

My only complaint?  Soda in cans?  There was no option to buy larger containers.  For a group of people coming in, it was a bit annoying to have cans.  

I wish I lived closer to Joseph's so it could be my usual Friday night place.  This is definitely a great place and I would recommend it to everyone.

The pizza here is fantastic, but the rest of the food not so much.  Got what they call chicken tenders and they were awful.....  Taste like burger king's nuggets.  The fries were cold and stale tasting and some were still frozen.  The eggplant parmesan was good and a good portion.  if you get food from here just get pizza...

I have ordered the thin crust pizza from Joseph's a couple of times and have been satisfied with my order each time. The pizza is consistent; the crust super thin (the way I like it) with a good "dough" flavor, the sauce is savory and the cheese is good. My only complaint is the cheese is very greasy. However, this is my go to spot for a thin crust cheese or thin crust cheese and sausage pizza.

I'm a fan!! This is great thin crust pizza. Generous toppings, lots of cheese and crispy crust. Loved the flavor too. Ordered a pepperoni, sausage, black olive and mushroom pizza. My only wish is for more!! 

I can't believe I was sleeping on this place all this time. It's so good!

ENVIRONMENT: 2/5
This is a pick up type location with two tables if you want to eat here.

SERVICE: 4/5

Pick Up- The ladies picking up the phone can be very rude. I am simple and know what I want so I have no issues. Ask questions and you will have problems. 

The guys at the counter are always nice and take care of you right away.

Delivery- Get to know your delivery drivers. Tip them very well. Most drivers know us and prioritize our orders so its hot and fresh. Oh and if you treat them well they bring you your free RC without having to ask them. 9/10 times the pizza arrives on time and hot.

Pizza: 5/5
Ingredients: Fresh. Delicious. 
Italian Beef Pizza- 5/5. Outstanding!
BBQ Chicken- 0/5. Sauce is horrible. 

OVERALL:
Tradition for townies and have been eating here since I was 5 yrs old.

I've been looking for a good, southside pizza in the northwest burbs for more than four years, and this is it! This pizza has lots of cheese; a mild, slightly sweet sauce; and a pillowey crust with crispy edges. The sausage is Chicago style - heavy with a little bit of spice at the end. (Exactly what I was looking for). The pepperoni comes under the cheese and is thinly sliced. Be excitedly aware: This is not a healthy pizza! This is a man's pizza. It's heavy and filling and delicious.

I recently moved to Addison. My co-workers and I always order from here on lunch break at my job in Carol Stream, so I decided to call and see if they deliver to me as well. Why did the girl who answered the phone ask me where in Addison, tell me no, and when asked why tells me because she was held at gunpoint???? SERIOUSLY JOSEPH'S???? Like this is some type of Chicago project building and you're the Channel 7 News?!?!?! You would love to report they wouldn't you! Horrible customer service from start equals you've lost my business forever,  and I'm sure my co workers will feel the same!

Literally the best pizza. So happy I am closer to this place now! 
(regular crust is the way to go, IMO)

Nomz: thin crust with sausage and mushrooms.  Other reviewers mention that Joseph (and staff) are heavy handed with the toppings, but I personally enjoy that.  The thin crust is a little thin to hold up the weight of all that deliciousness, but you just gotta eat it fast (and then toaster oven it back to desired crispiness if you have leftovers) and expect it to be a bit messy.  

I also love the bread sticks (5 per order) which come with an amazing tomato sauce.  those two items--the thin crust pizza & the cheese filled breadsticks--are basically the only things we order.  I think we always consider ordering something different, but just like our old standbys too much to deviate from the usual. 

Joseph's pizza has some coupons on their website for free liters of soda (like RC and all that... come on now, when's the last time you had RC?) and a few bucks off your order, but prices are reasonable.  Joseph's has become our go to pizza delivery spot.

I have now had Joseph pizza multiple times, and every time has been great!!!  I have went back and forth between the thin and the regular crust and honestly cannot say which one is the better of the two, I will actually have to declare a tie here.  I think their Sausage is very tasty, and would recommend that as the topping of choice.  I recently just dropped by for a lunch visit and tried getting random slices, and I was very happy.   Fresh, generous size, and hot, the perfect lunch slice!  I really want to try their baked mostacholli, or other offerings, but I cannot get myself to not order the pizza, lol.  I wish they were a little closer to me, so I did not have to drive and pick it up.  They do have a couple of tables where you can eat in there at, but the offerings inside are very basic, but it is better than not having that option at all.  Highly recommended and is definitely my choice of thin style pizza in the area.
Best pizza on earth hands down. I totally recommend the deep dish from here. The cheese is fresh and the crust is thick and soft.

This pizza is terrible. How is this place hanging on to 4 stars? Just look at the pizza pictures, the sauce is runny and the cheese is cheap. Seems like you have to be inside of NYC and inside of Chicago to get a really good pizza. Glendale heights has Lou Malnatti and Giordanos not that far away, GO THERE.

FOOD 5 stars...Phone service zero! I have called multiple times and it's like I owe them a favor. Very snotty and rude. They are lucky they have such amazing food. If it wasn't for their amazing food I'd like to reach through the phone and grab the girl on the other end. Please Joseph's change this, you have great food but horrible brats on the phone. And I know we all have bad days at work...but Every time I call there!? Ouch.

I really love this pizza place. So yummy ! I usually get the party pizza half chicken and half cheese! It's very big and its only $19! Pizzas are really fresh and the dough is delicious. People on the phone are usually friendly except for this one girl , she's not all that excited about taking your order! Lol. 
The deliveries usually take 45mins to an hour and nothing before that. Which is fine because they make you aware of that when you order. 
Collect 20 of their yellow menus and you get a free pizza! ANY SIZE.
Also, it says on the menu that for every purchase $15 or more you receive a 1 liter bottle of soda but they don't give it to you unless you mention it. So if you don't know about it you probably won't get it.
Closed on Mondays, but they are open late any other day.
This place is decent if you're looking for pizza that's different (in a good way) than your usual pizza place.
Love this place! I have to say I haven't tried anything on their menu besides their pizza. I've never been disappointed with the service and the pizza is always great. I go a least once a month

Absolutely amazed with terrible customer service, I am going to state that the girl on the phone sounds like she hates her life and job, I will accept that. We arrive to pick up the food to be faced with some schmuck behind the counter coughing up attitude for no reason, obviously he's angry and he's taking it out on people. Gives up pizza with no thank you, have a good evening, enjoy the pizza, nothing. Will not consider the place again and will share this info with all relatives and friends. 
Experienced level of customer service IMO is a sign of poor management and leads me to think if service is bad how terrible the food production must be....

Bangin' pizza made by cool people.

Italian beef and pepperoni or tomato are off the chains.  Get 'em while their hot!

....and don't forget to save your menus!

Best pizza ever. Anything over $17 gets you a free liter of RC. I LOVE that they'll deliver anywhere. "The pizza maker" scratch off idea is brilliant. My go to is always onion and pepperoni, regular crust.

Wow! The crust, sauce, toppings...AMAZING! The veggies tasted fresh. Tried this place because of Yelp reviews and so happy I did. I gave 4 stars instead of 5, because this is not really a sit down and eat kind of place. Better for take out. I will absolutely go again.
Been ordering josephs since I can remember. ALWAYS the best pizza! Highly recommend them to everyone who asks me where to get a pie around the area. Can't beat it! Yummm

Let me start this off by saying I'm not really a pizza fan. Sure, I'll eat pizza, but I don't get super excited about it and I almost never crave it. It's a long story....but I'll tell you anyways. Many years ago I got food poisoning from pizza and stopped eating it for YEARS until like 2 years ago. Ok, it wasn't that long of a story. 

Joseph's is actually REALLY good. I sometimes crave it, I'll even eat it cold...which in my book means it's pretty freaking good pizza. I think it's something about their crust that I really like. It's not too doughy or too thin (although I do like some very thin crust pizzas). 

I typically get mushroom pizza here, and I love it.

Usually my go to place for lunch slice of pizza has disapponted lately. Last two vists provided me with a limp sloppy slice of pizza. Prior to this,  the  pizza was a firm crispy hot skice of pizza perfection. I hope this a temporary glitch. For now I have  to lower my rating.

Yum!  I have been looking for a good pizza place for about 3 years.  I found it!  Perfect amount of toppings, great prices, and wonderful flavor.  The thin was a little to thin, just not enough dough to hold all the goodness.  Trying the stuffed tonight!
Great pizza in the area, service is okay. Delivery is best. Price is averege. You won't go wrong with this choice.
Good pizza. Good price. Ordered here twice since moving to Bloomingdale. Have tried 5 or 6 other pizza places and this is in the top two so far. Order without hesitation.
Very good pizza. Ordered thin it was awesome. Very nice order taker, fast delivery. Will be back.

Joseph's Pizza is a small pizzeria located off of Bloomingdale Road in Glendale Heights. This is a delivery and take out only joint that offers surprisingly generous amounts of toppings on everything at very reasonable prices. 

The first thing to notice about Joseph's is the value. While it might not be the cheapest pizza around, they certainly give you your moneys worth. Whether stuffed pizza or thin crust they absolutely do not skimp on toppings or any other ingredients. 

Their stuffed pizza is a thick stuffed (sauce on top, re-enforced crust) pizza with a very thick and flavorful sauce, the quality of the sauce, cheese and any toppings you get are fantastic. With that said I'm not the biggest fan of the taste of their crust as it is a distinctive yet, to me somewhat bitter flavor. The thin crust pizza here is actually a bit better, their thin crust pizza is thin, crispy, the cheese and sauce used are spot on, and they pile on the toppings.

One other thing to note about Joseph's is that with any order greater than 9.00 you get a yellow menu. If you collect twenty yellow menu's you get a free sausage pizza. They also have "Play the Pizza Maker" scratch off cards. If you collect a cheese, sauce and dough card you get a free pizza. Unfortunately, the dough card appears to be the Joseph's pizza equivalent of the Boardwalk game piece for McDonald's Monopoly. In my workplace Josephs has been ordered a great many times and I've not seen one dough card out of over 30.

Overall Joseph's is an excellent quality take out/ delivery pizza joint and I'd recommend it if you happen to be in the area.
Decent food for a fair value.. $2.75 large pizza slices for lunch...always fast and friendly ..

This place was recommended to me and I also was intrigued by the great reviews on Yelp. We ordered our usual -- the large sausage and pepperoni thin crust, well done.

Crust: Had it been a little more crispy, it would have been the best crust I'd ever had. It has potential/

Toppings: Wow, this sounds crazy but there were way too many for my liking. So much so that it was not possible to eat a slice without your hand becoming full of grease. However, that said -- the sausage had a great, fresh flavor. The cheese was really good. But I felt like the pizza sauce was missing some spice.

Atmosphere: It really is a carry out/delivery place so it's not great. 

Price: A baby cheese pizza, large sausage and pepperoni pizza, two cans of pop = $32.04. Way overpriced.

So yeah, it was "ok". Nothing I'd rave over. I won't likely try it again at that price either. Maybe the Pan or Deep Dish is better...at least the reviews make it seem that way.
Best pizza around the NW burbs.  Quiet little danky place, next to the "town pub".  The pizza joint has been there since I was a kid (in my 30's now).  I would definitely recommend it.

Ordered a slice of cheese to-go. They only had sausage or pepperoni and didn't up-charge me the quarter or two. Good pizza, medium thickness crust. Not sure, maybe the sausage is homemade but the smell of that one piece in my car was fantastic!

Place an order and it arrived in 20 min.  My order was missing a sandwich.  I called them right away.  I could here the girl who answered the phone and the cook arguing about whether or not he put the sandwich in the bag.  First is was did you check all the bags - I only got one bag.  Next was are you sure it's not in the bag - No, it's not there.  Can you check again - No it's not there.  After 10 minutes of this I got "fine we'll bring you another one".  You can't say your bringing me another one when you never delivered the first one.  Needless to say, it took them 30 mins to bring the missing sandwich.  Won't be ordering from there again.
The pizza is delicious considering its in the suburbs. But the calamari was horrible. No taste, very oily. The guy literally through the calamari right into the box after being in the oil.
Their Thin crust Pizza is very tasty.   They have Quick deliveries and friendly staff.
Love the pizza! They are quick and always get it right. The sauce is really what makes it. Delicious!

My order was just canceled because there is no bread for sandwich .
What pizza place are you if you don't have MAIN ingredients.
Last order did not get sauce and before that I was on hold for 30 min.
I'm really done with dominos pizza

authentic pizza. sauce is very good, has some spice to it. regular crust is always good and sometimes there's sauce in the crust end which tastes awesome. this is number 1 in Glendale heights area, lavatos (amatos) is the next best. the rest of the pizza joints  around here are bad.

Joseph's is my favorite pizza in Chicagoland!  I'm not a big fan of deep dish, so I've only had their regular crust and it is the best!  Tastes home-made instead of the typical greasy pizza everywhere else.  Quality pizza.

For all the complaints about food and service, I have never had any issues here. I've ordered from Joseph's Pizza 4 times (delivery twice and pickup twice) and the pizza is consistently good. They don't skimp on toppings and I always feel like I get my money's worth. Delivery service has been fine and while the people answering phones/working the counter aren't necessarily the most cheerful people I've ever come across, you just need someone to take your order and take your money. What else could you need?
Excellent pizza ive had it twice and its definitely one of the best pizza joints in the area!!

We ordered takeout from here, thin crust party pizza with sausage and mushrooms. Like other reviewers have said they give you tons of toppings. I think the thin crust was a little too thin to support the weight of the toppings. Next time I may try a thicker crust. The food was ready when they said it would be and overall it was a very good pizza. Also, the price is probably one of the cheapest around. We will be back.

Joseph's pizza tastes so good! 

I had the gardinera and Italian beef pizza, as well as their veggies and original cheese. They don't skimp on toppings, and it has a nice thin crust, not too greasy.

A large 2 topping pizza was about $17 or $18, and if you spend over $15, you get a 1 liter RC cola, which I have to LOL for this one. But hey, that's nice --they throw in a little something something for you since you picked them out of the chain restaurant down the street. 

The actual place isn't very athestically pleasing, but it's not like you'll be eating there, anyway. It's in the strip mall next to Avalanche Pub, El Tesero Restaurant, and White Hen Pantry. 

I definitely say give this a try instead of going for the usual Dominoes or Pizza hut... you'll be amazed!

Great tasting pizza, I've enjoyed both the thin and double dough crusts. 

Sauce wasn't overpowering, which is very important, and they give you a liter of RC with every pie.  Simply amazing.
Pizza is good from here. The wings and jalapeño poppers are another story. I would say to stick to their pizza and don't get anything else.

Had a couple of sausage slices. Big slice, lots of sausage and at $3 ea incl. tax, not a bad deal. But...sausage was bland, the crust was under cooked inside and the cheese was almost pasty. I was hoping for some good fennel laden chi-town sausage and cheese with some pull to it.  Not impressed but worth the $3.

20-30 minutes turned into 45, which turned into 50, which turned into 60.  And after all that waiting we got average pizza and not even an apology.  Definitely not worth the wait or a return trip.  Don't waste your time.
Got a pepperoni and sausage pizza with an order of calamari.  Both were great! Quality calamari! Fast delivery too

Probably the best pizza place in DuPage County, if not the entire Chicagoland area.  For me, this is the pizza that all others are judged against.  The sauce is some of the best around, the crust is delicious, and the ingredients they use are top notch.  The other dishes they offer are equally tasty.  If friends of mine come in from out of town and want Chicago style pizza, this is where I take them.  I have been a customer of this establishment for years and will continue to be.

AVOID THE CALAMARI!!! The pizza was great! I've had the thin crust and the regular.  The baked clams were ok.  The calamari was HORRIBLE! No flavor, well actually, it did have an old fish flavor.  I think the calamari I was served was old.  It was so bad that I ate two pieces, a second to ensure the first wasn't a fluke, and threw out the entire ten dollar order!  Those two pieces of calamari tasted like cardboard with a rotten fish flavoring!  I'm writing this review about an hour after eating the calamari so hopefully I don't get sick tonight.  It is a shame the calamari was so bad because it will probably keep me from ordering their pizza in the future.  In general the pizza would be 4 stars, baked clams 2-3 stars, and the calamari would be negative stars if that was an option.

I, too, read the reviews and thought we'd give it a try. We ordered a large thin crust and even with a $2 off coupon, it was ~$20 with delivery and tip. It's pizza for god's sake.

The pizza was average at best. The crust was average as was the sauce.

It is experiences like this that make us cautious to try new pizza places.

With their menu, just stick with the pizza.  
Pizza was very good, the clams were okay, calamari wasn't great, and we ordered something else, but i guess it wasn't good or bad cuz I don't remember.

I'm an avid lover of pizza, and this had to be one of the best I've ever had! I'm not sure if it's made in a brick oven or what, but the thick crust pizza is to die for. And make sure to order their cheese-filled breadsticks. Definitely worth the price!

Joseph's Pizza is by far one of my favorite things about Glendale Hts. The pizza, especially when it's right out of the oven, is irresistible. The ingredients are always fresh, and the service is great. They also have an extensive menu full of delicious Italian dishes! I highly recommend eating here if you are in the area. You won't regret it :)
Pizza is fabulous but the calamari is the best around!!!

Just discovered this gem of a place in the GH area. If you like pizza, try this for sure. Only reason it gets 4 stars is due to the prices, but then again if you want cheap you wont get this kind of quality toppings.

We've lived in GH for a long time now, and just recently tried Joseph's. Loved it! They did a great job with the toppings, and the sauce was just perfect. Delivery was much earlier than anticipated, which made my tummy happy. I thought the prices were fair as well. We are definitely fans of Joseph's from now on. Hip hip hooray!

Love Joseph's Pizza.  Joseph's is great for late night food deliveries.  Being a picky eater I only eat cheese but their pizza is great.  I have never tried their other dishes, but after all the recommendations from my friends at work to try it, I did and still continue to order from them.  Their sauce tastes very good and their crust is perfect.  Sometimes I ask for them to cook it a little longer so the cheese is more brown than white, but overall a great pizza place!

I tried this place last night on the advice of Yelpers, even though there's a dozen pizza places much closer to me. The thin crust pizza is the best I've had in 20 years. The tomato sauce is perfect. The sausage is perfect. This place is easily worth my 3.5 mile ( each way) drive!

I have never actually been there, so I'm not even sure if it is dine-in or take out and delivery only, but I have ordered from Joseph's many times.  I am a huge fan of their thin crust pizza.  Easily one of the best pizza places in the area.

Really love this place.  The green peppers and onions are sliced thin and the ingredients taste fresh and delicious.  The crust is tasty with a wonderful crunch.  Not too salty you won't be up all night drinking water.  Great flavor, great pizza, nice people.  Give it a try it's one of our favorites.
Best pizza around hands down!!! Wish they were open on Mondays for football thought lol!

The food is really good actually, but their delivery sucks. I don't think I'm going to order from Joseph's anymore, since the last 3 times I've ordered for delivery, they have told me my food will be here within 40 minutes and it's taken up to an hour and a half. I'm not exaggerating. Good food if you've got  the patience to wait an eternity for it.

Got the thin crust, pretty good. Usually, I see a lot of people screw up sauce when making a pizza, and I liked this one.  Moves near the top of my list for local thin crust

Only slight negative was the price. I paid like $14 for a medium 14 in with a topping. Just seemed like a few dollars too much. It looked smaller than it really was, as it ended up being plenty, but yeah

I have been a customer for over 30 years, it is what pizza should be. They have been consistently great for as long as I can remember. It is not cheap but some of the best pizza on the planet. I used to live down the street and eat it all the time, over the years I have moved out of the neighborhood but still make the trip when the crave hits. You cannot go wrong !!!!!

Still the best pizza in this area, and I've been trying a lot of other places over the years seeing if anyone can top them. I did have a little issue yesterday with the chicken salad, however. My husband picked it up with a pizza but when we got home we noticed that some of the lettuce was brown. I immediately called and the manager was very apologetic, made a fresh salad, and had it delivered at no cost. Now that's customer service! We will continue to patronize this place.
When we are in the mood for pizza, we order from here. We LOVE their thin crust. I don't know what it is about the sauce but it's amazing.

really good thin crust pizza 
had them for a party too one time and it was great
ordered sausage and it came loaded 
we feel it was well worth the price

We tried Josephs based upon reviews from here on Yelp. My husband and I have been trying various local pizza places to find our new go-to place since moving in nearly 1 yr ago.  Today my husband said it best when he said "I think we found our new place!" The sauce has just a little zip to it that makes it work and the toppings were super generous. The extra kicker was the 1 liter of soda that came with our pizza. Timely delivery, hot pizza...we will return to Josephs for sure.
Best pizza we ever had.  Joseph's has ruined us for other pizza places.  Our out of town guests have us ordering here the entire time they are visiting!

The best thin-crust in the area. I can honestly say that I'm not even really a pizza lover, but I crave Joseph's. The only problem is ordering it too often, because I've programmed their number into my cell phone. I guess you could consider that a recommendation.

Best Pizza around I have not found a place that beats Josephs. I have never tried anything else on the menu because the pizza is sooooo good but ive heard some of the other items are good as well. Awesome crust and everything tastes fresh and home made love it!!! the people that owe it/work there are really nice to! never had a problem with the orders and the employees are always polite. I suggest everyone try them they are awesome!

I just moved into the area and was looking for a good local pizza place and I found one. I will definitely be getting pizza from them in the future. I ordered four different large pizzas and all were very delicious. Plus, four large pizzas were more than enough to feed 10 people; we probably should have just gotten three pizzas.

Since I was staying at the Marriott and there aren't too many food options in the area, I ended up getting breakfast at this hotel every day for a week. I generally like to read the paper at breakfast so I opted for going to the River City Grille instead of ordering room service. Maybe because I wake up late or because everyone gets room service or because you would only stay at Hoffman Estates for business, the restaurant is never crowded. Luckily for me, that means the service is incredibly attentive and the food comes out fast!

True to Midwestern style, they serve hearty, generous portions that will definitely fill you up. The hash browns are very fried, there is meat in most of the menu items, and when the omelette has melted cheese inside, it's far from a delicate amount sprinkled on top. You're going to get as much cheese as you want and then some. But as long as you aren't vegan, the food is pretty good. The Broken Yolk Sandwich, in particular, is delicious. And the Frittata, which is supposed to be a healthier option, is also good and comes without the tempting fried potatoes. Service is quick and friendly and all in all, River City Grille is a solid hotel breakfast spot (I can't speak to lunch or dinner).

Good breakfast for a hotel. I don't like buffet food, so ordered standard egg breakfast. Food was fresh and hot. Most guests do the buffet, so service was a little slow. $13 for breakfast seems to be the going rate for hotels--decent value for the convenience.

Hotel restaurants are the best! Or they make you wanna smack yo granny. I arrived at River City Grille knowing two things. One was that it was inside the hotel I was staying at. The other thing was that it was still open and serving food. Convenience and food availability were the order of the evening.
I ordered pretzel bread with cheese sauce but let my coworker/travel buddy nosh on that. I did try a piece and it was pretty tasty.
For dinner I had the filet with fries and 4 cheese mac n' cheese. The filet was a decent cut of meat but overpriced by about $8 for what it was. The fries were so forgettable I ate all of three of them and gave up. The mac n' cheese was mediocre at best. I love mac n' cheese. I love all types and even enjoy Kraft. I would eat Kraft over this mac n' cheese any day. The pasta was overcooked, it was barely warm and the cheese sauce was bland and uneventful. I blackened the bowl with enough pepper to kill a mongoose and still thought it lacked any flavor... it was the yellow blackhole of flavor destruction. I finished most of it because for what this meal was going to cost I needed to eat more than just the filet.
I also tried a bit of an apple crumble pie with vanilla ice cream and that was pretty tasty. I could have demolished the whole thing... but I also haven't had any sweets in nearly two months so it may have seemed way more awesome than it actually was.
This place boils down to being too expensive for what it is... bland food that is poorly prepared. But really... isn't the point of a hotel restaurant to provide food when nothing else is open? So in that vein it does it's job. 
Meh.

It might be one of the best Korean fried chicken. 

Half/half fried chicken
The breading was good. It kinda reminds you chicken tender crispy and seasoning on the breading and juicy inside.

The marinating one was amazing. The fact that breading was crispy it was able to keep chicken to have crispy texture without getting soggy. The sauce was well balanced sweet and tangy.  Tip: ask for their hotter version sauce on the side

Spicy omurice
It was really good solid omurice with good gravy and spicy sauce. I would recommend regular one if you do not like spicy food. 

Overall 
The food was awesome, service needs little work, I think they can improve on the pricing of the foods. 

I'll defin come again

Interesting restaurant -- not quite what you'd really expect when you're eating Korean in the suburbs. Instead of a quiet setting with lots of banchan and traditional dishes, you instead get lots of K-Pop on TCL screens with a menu really focused on the Beer and Fried Chicken combo. Prices are alright, not cheap but for Korean it's pretty cheap in comparison to the amount of meat you're getting (generous portions). The cooking overall is a bit light on flavor, prepared quickly, and with fast friendly service. Here are some thoughts on different items I tried.

Fried chicken: Good texture, kind of like broasted chicken -- without seeming too oily. But a bit light on marination and flavor. Decent price for the amount of chicken you get for an order.

Three flavor popcorn chicken: Could've been a bit more crispy -- but it does come with a pretty generous helping of meat (although it's also pretty expensive). The sweet and spicy chicken isn't too sweet or spicy (not much more than the sauce packets you typically get at Asian restaurants) and the honey gold (which was my favorite) was also a bit mild. The plain one was a bit too light on flavor for me.

Jjamppong - huge bowl with a generous amount of seafood and noodles. I did enjoy the broth quite a bit (even after coming back from Korea the previous week) although it has a pretty strong spicy kick to it.

Pork cutlet - Huge portion of pork that was breaded and fried pretty well. The sauce was not as sweet or acidic as I'm used to -- which can both be a positive (since it seemed healthier) or a negative if you're used to a very tasty tonkatsu sauce.

Omelet rice - Not sure why we don't see this item on local menus more often. This is really an improvement over normal fried rice with lots of egg flavor, a bit more chewy rice (since it keeps a higher level of moisture), with a nice and creamy / sweet sauce. The amount of sesame oil in the rice was a little more than I would've liked, but still an enjoyable comfort food.

Overall, if you want to try more modern Korean food at reasonable prices -- definitely visit MOWA (or TTOWA which is also in Arlington Heights).

I has visited this place two times already: opening day and today.
It's the place having all we wanted. Spicy Pork Cutlet, Nagasaki Jjampong noodle, and half and half chicken are our best.
I highly recommended this place for dinner, lunch, or late night. Family friendly.
I would repeat this place as long as I can.

We had their tonkatsu, delicious! Our favorite of the night. Also tried their popcorn chicken in original, honey, spicy & sweet flavors, yum. Liked how it stayed crispy even with the marinade. Friendly service, enjoyed our dinner there x)

My first visit.. we had fried chicken and stir fried spicy squid. Chicken was above average with relatively fresh ingredients. Chicken and batter lacked seasoning a bit however it worked well with the side sauce($0.50) we ordered. Squid was bit too oily. Overall food were ok

Pls note that it is a bar not a full Korean restaurant. It is a bar.. However, the draft beer was tasteless. Disappointing.. Hence the average score.

Hands down, the best Korean style fried chicken in Chicago ! We ordered both regular and sweet&spicy fried chicken. They're so Crispy outside and tender inside. Perfectly cooked & seasoned. We also loved the jjam-bong (spicy seafood noodles) if you ask for extra spicy they'll make it even hotter. I would definitely go back to this place and try other food next time!

I came here on opening night with my husband. We were both very impressed with the selection of food and the great customer service. We ordered soju, bulgogi, and the Korean fried chicken. Everything was delicious. We are mostly happy to have a great new Korean restaurant/bar near our home. I hope Mowa is around for a long time to come and look forward to bringing many friends here!

Tried this place with the Mrs. She said it was really good Korean style chicken. We got the chicken wings and popcorn chicken. Ordered the sweet and spicy, it was more sweet than spicy. Owner came out and told us the sauce today was not as spicy and wanted to know if we wanted the super spicy. We said no and it was till very good.

Next time we will try a while fried chicken.
Loved this Korean fried chicken restaurant. No ambiance but the food was amazing. Some of the best Korean friend chicken in all of Chicagoland.

Sorry to disagree with previous reviewers, but I found my visit to Mowa a disappointment.  My ist visit was motivated  by several positive reviews.  We encountered major problems with the service & food.  20-30 minute waits to place our order, to receive our food and obtain our bill. We ordered crazy-hot fried chicken, spicy pork cutlets & kimchi fried rice.  1st two dishes had a crispy but bland batter on the meat.  The hot sauce was unbalanced, being not very hot and too sweet. The kimchi fried rice was saturated with the above hot sauce while tasting braised rather then fried, drowning out any kimchi flavor.  This visit will be our 1st & last one.
Probably best Korean style chicken around the area.  Highly recommend it if you are looking for Korean style chicken. Food is fantastic.

We live in the neighborhood so gave it a month to iron process out . First impression .....mot sure what to call it post Neo neon diner? Menu little hard to understand meal were less than snacks and waiter had hard time explaining the difference. Funniest thing on menu French fries at 8.99 ??? Couldn't find out what made them worth that much and didn't order to find out but later when talking to owner I asked about it and she said "too much? We make it 2.99" we got 2 types of popcorn chicken. And stir fry chicken all was very tasty but no side dishes but that was ok as they were big portions. I made have given it 4 stars except the 4 tv's playing kpop was a little much. It almost seems like they only want to cater to Koreans but not really a Korean neighborhood so making it a little more comfy for the neighbors would help. Can't see the wife and me walking over to the bar like we used to when it was Danny's and watching Kpop videos.

We were craving burgers... and really happy we came here. Reading previous reviews made us skeptical. We were in fear of a dry burger.... well it wasn't there tonight. My burger was perfect! I ordered the Kuma burger, yum! I'm craving one now, so moist, juicy and perfectly tasty. The bread is really good but a bit too hearty.

My friend ordered the neurosis burger. She was also happy with her order. Medium rare actually came as ordered. She still had the same issues with a "hearty" bun. 

The portions are large. Even their side salad is a meal. This place is an ideal place to share.

Jalapeño poppers are delicious! I would definitely order that again. It was kinda odd though that the "hotness" was inconsistent. But it was still tasty. The raspberry sauce only makes it better!

Chips, nice a crispy. Portions are generous so come hungry.

As for atmosphere, reviews said this place is loud. We were a little concerned before coming if it would be a good place to talk and catch up. It was fine.

As for service, we were seated right away. Our server was helpful and answered all our questions. Food arrived hot and our water glasses were filled. I look forward to my next visit here. Mmmm my new favorite burger place.

Limited menu but good food and hand cut fries are always yum. It's a burger place but you can get any of their fun/unique burgers with a black bean veggie burger or chicken instead so easy to make it work for those who don't like beef. 

The atmosphere is ok, fun if you appreciate the fake hard rock bar attitude. We love getting take out (or grub hub!) And the food is always good.

I love metal and burgers. However this Kumas is in a really preppy area of the suburbs and it just seems like a weird fit IMO. The metal is kind of loud, but its not like being on the dance floor at the CLUB...

I went here on a date and forgot that they played metal so I just doubled down on loving metal and she ended up being okay with it, but I would definitely think about that before you bring your typical Adele-listening lady here. 

Our sever was cool, she was helpful  with offering an opinion and kept the water and drinks full. Drinks were fine, maybe a little expensive, but in this neighborhood of the burbs its expected. 

The Kuma burger was okay, but i thought it was actually pretty bland and it ended up making me sick to my stomach. I think I needed to make like 4 trips to the bathroom during the rest of this date. 

So all in all I went to Kumas and I ended up with an upset stomach, a 14 dollar bland burger, and a happy date. Mixed bag night for sure!

I've been wanting to try this place for a while and finally got to try it...

1 upon arrival place was inviting, atmosphere was unique.

2 place was super busy, music was not so loud which is fine- Rob Zombie type of music.

3 TV around the place to watch sports, place super clean and staff very friendly.

4 when we got there my fiance and I wanted to sit at the bar but it was so packed no room for us so bar staff was so nice and attentive and they started us with drinks and as soon as the 1st couple left they looked out for us so we could sit down. 

5 drinks are good, we also had their signature burger with the fried egg inside which was delicious MUST TRY EVERYONE.  It is so big that you can split it with a friend or loved one.

6 fries are amazing.

7 never made it to the ladies room.

8 rest of the experience was really cool, this place is very unique and has its own touch and nice counter tops I would come back here.

REALLY hard decision between 3 and 4 stars but the service really pushed this over the edge. The waiter was very helpful in making some really hard decisions and here's how it played out:

1) Mac & Cheese w/bacon and broccoli: some of the best mac I've ever had. Honestly, could eat this all day if health was not an issue
2) Absu Burger: I love spicy and this did not really do the trick. I think High on Fire or Pantera would have been a better choice. At the end of the day, the meat was cooked right but it does not have a lot of flavor. The toppings help but otherwise it was bland.

I did not have any drinks but their beer selection is awesome! Luckily we came fairly early on a Sunday night so there was no wait. I'd be willing to give this place another chance with another spicy burger!

I have had this place bookmarked for both the city and Schaumburg for a while now and I was finally about to try it. 
I can't decide if I like the mac and cheese better or the burger better. I have a new obsession with brie cheese and pears and thats what I got on my burger, so I can't say I didn't love it BUT the mac and cheese was absolutely amazing. The taste of sun dried tomatoes on the warm mac and cheese was amazing!
I think the thing I appreciated the most about this place was the fact that any beef burger could be replaced with a chicken burger or a veggie burger. This should be something that is offered more often at restaurants. I am not a vegetarian, but this puts a whole new spin to someone who is vegetarian, they can now eat any burger they want! 

The inside of this place was cool and there were a lot of beers here! This seems like a good place to hang out and have a few beers (and mac and cheese :))

Burgers are good but the place is A LOT smaller than I thought. Also I don't like how they play loud ROCK MUSIC and have zombie drawings all over the place? What is this? It's like a Hipster / zombie / IPA beer Burger joint?
We're not in the city dude, we're in Schaumburg. 
The burger is really good but the atmosphere is a bit weird..

Came here with some friends in the afternoon for some lunch. Pretty crowded, but we got a table right away. As other reviewers have stated, the heavy metal background music was incredibly loud and our conversations consisted of us saying "WHAT?" repeatedly. Fortunately, the food made up for this :) 
Burgers were on point  I probably won't come back to dine-in, but definitely somewhere I'd order for take-out.

Oh wow! This place is something else!

The pros:

* the food is delicious
* the menu isn't overbearing
* the drinks are good
* the food comes out quickly
* the menu is unique, and has a wide variety
* the waitstaff was super kind

The cons:
* their goal is to have every plate come out the same so they don't like to do modifications (so that others don't ask for it)
* they have burgers...lots of burgers...and few other options
* the shirts are ridiculously expensive

The Meh:
* the prices
* the calories

This place is just phenomenal. It's a great suburb joint to visit -- and eat a cheat meal at.

I feel like this gem is a treasure for the suburbs. And music isn't insanely loud, but fits the mood.

I would rate this a 2.5/neutral experience. Definitely the burger was not as good as the Chicago, however I do like the fact that this location has more space to breath..and it's easier to find parking. 
Food Technicalities- I think I've tried all of their burgers at the Chicago location by now, however at this location I ordered the Pantera burger-medium well w chips..only thing I liked was their house made ranchero salsa and roasted poblano.  Patty felt really dry, bacon- well it's hard to go wrong w bacon, and the chips were just ok..lays could have been the same..
Mac and cheese was good, but not the best as it's hyped..


In nut shell, I think m done w Kumas for a while..
Pros:
Good selection of draft beers..
Relatively quicker service..
More room to sit and breath
Ease of parking 
Close to wood field mall

Cons:
Food

Kuma's is my favorite place to go for burgers and on special occasions! My husband and I just went there this month for our 4th wedding anniversary, I went there for my birthday last December, and I plan to go there again for my birthday next month. The service has been excellent for every visit I've made to this location and the food is even better! Favorite burger? Lair of the Minotaur! I'm normally not a fan of pears or brie cheese, but whoever decided to put them on a burger is a genius. It is so good!

Been wanting to try Kuma's for the longest time and finally had the chance to go with my co-worker during our lunch break. It was great because it was in walking proximity to us from the office. Came in on a Sunday afternoon and this place was pretty dense with people already. I heard very good things about it and wanted to see if it lived up to the hype. What I thought was really odd is the Metallica playing in the background because as I was trying to eat my food, there is this loud thump from the music making me feel uncomfortable as I was eating. 

Didn't get the chance to try the Mac & cheese but will be back for it. What's awesome about the menu is how customizable it is. You can basically choose any protein to put into your burger and all the different options they do offer for you to add onto your burger. I just went with the classic Kuma's and add an egg and it was amazing. The tastiest burger ever!!

My honey Chris and I came here on out way to Madison, WI for Days of Madison and OMG, they blew it out of the swamp water. We got the mac 'n cheese appetizer with bread crumbs,  garlic, bacon and bbq pulled pork. We also got a pulled pork sandwich and a bowl of chili that had just the right amount of heat and was scrumptious.

3 1/2 stars. Heard about this place for many years when it opened in Chicago. Sat outside because of the music (not a big fan of metal). Ordered the Iron maiden burger which was delicious but not earth shattering.
The fries were too salty and a little soggy. The service was nonexistent with the server not coming to check on us after the order (I had to find him to get the check).

I recommend the Assembly for good burgers.

When I first visited the original location on Belmont, I was single with no kids. Now, I'm married and have a child living in the suburbs driving a Camry. Needless to say, I'm in a different life stage than I was several years ago. As excited as I was that Kuma's was opening up in Schaumburg, I quickly learned that it just didn't feel the same. 

Parents, this place is not kid friendly unless your child loves Megadeth and Metallica. The music is loud but that might be a good thing if you have a new born that does well with loud background noise. If you child doesn't fall into one of these categories, then make sure that you know what to expect ahead of time. 

Otherwise, the food is still kick-ass delicious. To me, the food tasted just as good as the other locations in the city. Don't forget to order the mac and cheese and fried pickles. This month's burger special had a crab cake topped with an arugula salad. With the new location, Kuma's easily has the best burger in Schaumburg. I won't be bringing my three year old anytime soon but eventually.
Awesome burgers! Killer MacnCheese! Cool place.

I am the furthest thing from a metal head as you can get but I'll do and go just about anywhere for good food!

When you first walk in you're hit with the music. And it's loud. On top of that there are metal music videos playing on the TVs, eah whatever right? No. I saw one video that was all recordings of eyes...some that would make even the not squeamish, stomach churn...cause mine did.

The crowd in there was not what I was expecting at all either. But I guess that's what happens when you set up in the burbs!

On to the positive!! Our waitress was super nice and knowledge of the whole menu and made great recommendations based off our tastes. We split bacon broccoli Mac and cheese as an appetizer between four of us and it was just enough and very yummy to satisfy until dinner. All the burgers are named after different bands, kinda fun. Mine was the Sourvein! It was basically chicken and waffles on a cheeseburger with bacon. There was some other stuff on it, I can't remember what but holy crap they know what they're doing with the food!

METAL! BURGERS!!!!

OK, I am going to quote an Elite Yelpers 3-star review and make fun of him for it.

"Burgers are good but the place is A LOT smaller than I thought. Also I don't like how they play loud ROCK MUSIC and have zombie drawings all over the place? What is this? It's like a Hipster / zombie / IPA beer Burger joint? We're not in the city dude, we're in Schaumburg. "

This Elitie is right about one thing, at least. Kuma's Corner has killer burgers. It is also heavy metal themed, so there are old metal album covers on the walls. And the music isn't uncommonly loud, but it's definitely guitar-driven rock. 

Seems like a jerk move to acknowledge a place has great food, and then give them 3 stars for being small, but whatever. I guess our man in Schaumburg would rather eat at TGI Fridays with a parking lot big enough for him to roam in and Top 10 greatest hits playing on infinite repeat. *Shudders*

So, OK, time to stop pillorying my fellow suburbanites and get to the meat of the review. Kumas is a ton of fun. I love the spot. Long beer lists. The burgers are better than good, and honestly the pricing is reasonable. Get blitzed, have a burger, take in the rock ambiance. Have a good time!

This location is pretty new, but I'm so happy you can get Kuma's in the suburbs. I've been here w few times and the food is just as great as what you get in the city. If you've been to the original Kuma's, you know what to expect. Let me talk about what's different in Schaumburg. 

There is a nice little patio area where you can eat outside. We haven't been out there yet, usually due to the crowds or weather, but I'll definitely wait for outdoor seating once it gets warmer. The waiting line is also a bit more sophisticated-you give them your phone number, and there is a website app that keeps track of your spot. Yes, he waits are still long and can take up to 2 hours (or longer if the weekend). So get there early, put your name down, and chillax at Nordstrom Rack or something (because there will not be a seat at the bar!). 

Service is friendly, and the food is great. Be warned that every location has their own BOTM (Burger of the Month) and Mac and Cheese of he month. Also, my only gripe about this location is that it's a little too hardcore on the music-it's way too loud for any sort of conversation or human sound. At least I can talk to and enjoy my friends if I had to the city location. Turn that down a bit, and we just may have a suburban Kuma's complete equivalent!

Boss told me this was the best burgers in Illinois. No. Just no. Music was death metal (anthrax and some other singing/screaming/demon summoning). Burgers were ok. Fries were good. Not coming back. If the food was amazing, I'd recommend the outside seating area.

Talk about a let down!

I was totally psyched to check out this location since I obviously never made it to the Belmont joint, which had been on my burger list for yrs....I knew it was gonna knock my socks off..
(or so I thought)..
Awesome reviews, friend recommendations..and yes, beastly burgers...

I needed to get this full-on burger feast and went in with high expectations...
At noon on a weekday, to my delight...place was chill..no wait...plenty of open seating..I dug the industrial/rock vibe..yep, music hits you as soon as you enter...but I was cool with it. Not really a Metal fan, but that wasn't why I was here...I got the feeling the ambiance here changes drastically at night...

I can't tell you how many times my eyes circled the burger options....I love variety, but it always gets the best of me and the more choices, the harder it is for me to make a decision...
I finally pinned down 2...Lair of the Minotaur OR Botm...Sourvein...
