We enjoyed watching the old metal music videos we hadn't seen in ages.  It is loud in there with the metal music playing but it wasn't like rock-concert loud or anything and we really enjoyed it.

We stopped in here for a business luncheon and it's decent for the type of food served, but it's nothing to get too excited about or make a special visit for. It's basically just slightly glamorized bar food, which is fine by me, but when they try too hard to make it more than what it really is (and attempt to charge accordingly), that is when concepts tend to lose me. "Gastropub" is probably one of the most overused descriptors in the restaurant game these days, and Kuma's is the case in point of why it has become so cliche and boring. Throwing artichoke hearts or other random toppings on a burger and calling it a day is not "gourmet". 

We stopped in on a Thursday afternoon for lunch and the place was pretty busy for 1:30. We got seated right away and our extremely hot waitress (I will give her that much) got our drink order out to us rapidly. Beer selection here is quite good, with several great offerings on tap to choose from to marinate your palate. I am just now beginning to experiment with the various microbrews in this state, which is an exciting process if you are an ardent beer drinker. That said, Illinois has a very long way to go to compete with the Wisconsin brewers for craft beers. 

Like most high end burger chains, you have a wide assortment of topping selections to choose from here. The signature Kuma Burger with fried egg on top was what I decided to go with. They have several other topping concoctions as well as a "Burger of the Month" offering. It was pretty tasty and totally adequate, but once again, nothing that I have not had elsewhere that was far better. What many of the Red Robin type places of the world seem to forget is that the meat is what makes all the difference in the world on burgers, and It just did not have a robust flavor to it at all. Investing in some house ground Angus is far more likely to impress me than trying to get cute with toppings. The fries here were crispy enough, but too over seasoned for my taste. 

Overall, while the food here was decent, I would take Fuddruckers or Five Guys over this place any day of the week, and it's cheaper.

Service was good. For some reason, my burger was not good. 

The burger was simple and came with fried egg. I don't know how this could go wrong. I think it was due to too much juice from the meat made my burger suggy. Or I was not in a mood for eating too much fat?

 But I remember the burger at their original location was much better. And I know my burger was not suggy that night. 

I need to find a good burger joint.

Every week we order curry chicken an naan bread.

Love the food here!!
So flavorful an yummy!
Good food i have to say they have a lot of options, but the place could be more clean.

Most people would disregard my review which is fine.  The number of stars I'd rate them teeters between 2 and 3 stars.  Over the years, increasingly, I am not a fan.  However, I can tell you that some of my extended family and friends (which live in these parts) think it's pretty awesome.  I'd say many of them would rate it a solid 4 or 5 stars.  On occasion I've bumped into them here (and if I walk in here, it's very uncommon and random) and  some would occasionally place catering orders.  If I'm here, it's because I was dragged kicking and complaining.  

A lot of Indians dig the food as do Americans looking for that "butta chicken" or "Indian fix."  

Me... It's not impressive.  Driving a little farther in any direction would yield better results.  I'm not saying every experience has to be impressive, but it should be consistent.  From the taste of the biriyani, or the butter chicken or the style of their breads, something should remind you of why you dined there.  

Most would dig their flavors, which are plentiful although pretty bland.  With the often mix of clientele, they always keep it bland.  I've tried getting carry out orders that lacked the spice level I requested.  

Lastly, with the number of "bar / restaurant rescue" type shows out there.  They could do a bit of housekeeping.  If there's a reason to keep the kitchen door open, sweep up the floor.  How many food bits need to be down there? Wipe down a table or table accessory, so that it isn't icky to the touch.

Got to read some great reviews about the place and the food is really bad and stale would be an understatement.Most people who come here either hallucinate this as Indian food or have no idea on how to cook.Try to avoid the place as the food is bland and flavorless.

Food is nice. I got three meals worth food the first time I went. But on my second time order, I got mostly curry without any paneer peices. That's the only reason I'm not giving five stars. Maybe I'll try shorter Indian place nearby
MUST MUST have Lamb biryani!  The best biryani I have had in a long time.   Best in Chicago!  Also the samosas are amazing.

The food is delicious and has great flavor. Not many places have dinner buffets (we know cuz we called all over). They have a good variety for the dinner buffet too. 

I only took a star off because the ambience was a little weird? There was no music so it was awkwardly silent and until more people arrived I felt I had to whisper. 

Other than that the staff is friendly enough- idk about everyone else but service at Indian restaurants seems the same to me?

This is the second time I've been there with my son. We both really enjoy the buffet.  It gives a chance to try a little bit of everything.  The cabbage today was especially very good.  Also the types of food served are different than last time.  Makes me want to go back again and see what's being served.
Well the biggest thing was that there was a rubber band in my food.    And that was besides the fact that the food was bland and uninspired.

I like different kitchens. Indian food one of the most tasty, spicy and sweet at the same time. My favourite butter chicken with rice I can eat elevery day. This place reminds me of one small Indian restaurant in my home country.
Love this place!!! Been going here for awhile. they have home cooking like mom, if that was how your mom cooks.

I have been coming here for the lunch buffet for several years.  I do enjoy it.  The samosas are excellent.  The main dishes are well done.  The menu changes so there is a good variety.  The buffet is right when you walk in so you can see what is available.  As a long time fan of Indian food, I know what I like and what I do not.  
My only complaint is that the music has changed lately.  They used to play somewhat traditional Indian music.  It just isn't the same when you are listening to the classic rock station.  Otherwise, foodwise, the place is excellent.  Give it a try!

Delicious lunch and dinner buffets! Cuisine of India is my go-to for Indian "comfort food". This place is not fancy, but it is inexpensive and full of flavor. I've been going for many years and will keep coming back again and again!
Food was amazing. I am new to Chicago was this place was great. Food was flavorful. There was a variety and service was great!

Better taste with lesser spices!! The dal was specially awesome.
The dishes felt like homemade. Was a wonderful experience.

Great food,  great service.  They had all my favorite dishes.  They made sure to keep our waters filled and cleared our plates promptly.  

The best part is that paying for separate checks is not a hassle at all.  You just go up to the register and tell them how many people you're paying for.  Excellent.
The lunchtime buffet is a deal that can't be beaten AND they are not stingy with the Naan bread. I like to go here once every month or so.

Ignore the uptight bad reviewers for this place because they are trying to review this place as if it's a high end Indian sit down restaurant, which it's not.  

If you want all you can eat good indian food flavors for cheap, then come here because there aren't any better options.  Come for lunch during the week and pay about $12 and some change for the buffet which has both a meat and vegetarian section.  The desserts are great, especially the mango ice cream.  There's a reason you see so many people, both Indian and not eating here often.  Because you can stuff yourself senselessly on a variety of good Indian food for what you'd pay for a meal at Chipotle.

First time in the restaurant in the Naperville location and service suck.  Good thing I was patient enough to wait on my naan & tandoori chicken for 28 minutes.  I asked once but, instead of giving us the starters a server who pretended not to speak English gave our food to a couple who just got there.  There was only a handful patrons at the time, so the servers should have enough  common  sense to make sure their customers are taken care of.  Yeah right?  We asked the server a second time for our naan & tandoori chicken and it took 10 more minutes before we finally got it.  We didnt get our soda refill either.  Welk, there's always another indian restaurant around the corner.  I never have this problem in Masala in Oak Brook nor Saffron in Westmont. They're both on top of their game.  Yes thank goodness for my patience I didn't walk out and made a scene.  Lucky I even paid the bill.

This meal was great, went for the weekend dinner buffet.  We were astounded by how many options were on the dinner buffet!  We dined on excellent Samosas, but really my party liked all of the food.  The fresh naan is delivered hot to your table.  On the suggestion of other reviewers, I went for the rice pudding and mango ice cream, it's great!

Also this place was cuter inside than the curb appeal would suggest.  It's tucked inside a lackluster shopping center but don't let that stop you.

Loved it! I just moved back to the suburbs and have been craving Indian food since I no longer was by my fav go to place in the city.... 

It definitely was super good!!! I went to the lunch buffet for $10.99. Great deal. Naan bread was perfect, butter chicken was great. The tandoori chicken always a must have. We went right when they opened and food was all out and ready and hot. 

They were quick to take your plates and give refills. 

The staff was super friendly and we had a nice conversation with them on our way out.  You will definitely have a return customer!!!
Awesome food. And buffet till 10pm. No wAy! Yes way!!! The goat curry was surprisingly Delish. Pretty great for 30 mins till close!! I'll be back yes please

We used to visit often there. It used to good until we went last month. We went for dinner buffet and the food was horrible. Chicken items looked like 2-3 days old, vegetable items were too oily to eat. We took some rice and it was like its dipped in oil. We hardly ate anything and left. I am not sure but I think the management or the head guy changed. I did not see the guy we used to see previously on the counter. Moreover, Its time to forget Cuisine of India.

Staff was friendly and desserts were really tasty.  Dinner buffet food was a bit spicier than what I'm used to, but seemed fresh.  Lots of options, but none were really impressive.  Bathroom was disgusting and right next to kitchen.  

Nothing to write home about, but definitely a good value.

Underrated Indian buffet, everything was great the briyani by itself could have been sold at 10 buck which is the price for lunch buffet. Usually when you go to Indian buffet that briyani taste like the typical Indian buffet briyani but not here. It is different and stands on its own. All the items have their own distinct flavor.  They have vegi stuff and stuff for the meat lovers. But they have a limited amount of items but they are high quality and tasty items so it makes up for it. Get the mango ice cream Yum...
A-OK
It was good for a buffet which I'm usually opposed too. We got there right when they opened so all the main dishes were fresh and warm. Mango icecream was phenomenal .

This is my favorite place! I come here for the dinner buffet, and often bring friends and family who have never had Indian food (and then love it). The food is incredible. I agree with another reviewer - the food has gotten spicier. I do wish they would kick it back a bit. And I do agree with another reviewer (or maybe it was the same one?) who said that the bathroom is gross. It is. They really should fix that.

We love this place.  The food is fresh and atmosphere is quiet and peaceful. The buffet is awesome and we love to try the various foods.  A real bargain too.  I come with my wife and 2 year old.  They love it too.

Cheap lunch buffet and you get so much food! The butter chicken, garlic chicken, curry, naan, rice, desserts... All so yummy. When you think of buffets like this you don't expect this kind of variety with these popular items. Quick lunch place with friendly staff.

Oh my god! I had a craving for samosas and wanted to check this place out. These are the best sonatas I have had in al long time hands down. Highly recommended.  I stopped in for a six pack and they were fresh and hot with some of the amazing green mint chutney sauce. I recommend a six pack of somosas since they are always great the next day warmed up in the toaster over. I cannot wait to try out the rest of their menu and brunch.
Basic, simple, clean, with a good selection on the buffet!!!!

We have been here quite a few times, and have had mixed experience.

Their selection in buffet is not that much. But for the price, it is expected. We usually enjoy their samosa, tandoori chicken and gulab jamun. One of the few places that I know of has mango ice cream served as well.

Service is actually not too bad, they keep the tables clean, and get the dirty plates picked up fairly quick.

They also have take out for a few items, we had tandoori chicken once, and it was great. 10 bucks chicken feed 3 guys...

For a very quick last minute decision, this place was perfect! Loved the samosas, and the two vegan dishes they had. I wouldn't say this is my favorite Indian restaurant but in the moment this was the best decision! I would return for the lunch buffet if I'm ever in the area again.
The best buffet in mount prospect. Tast of tradition and culture. Please don't talk anything to go. I ordered chicken biryani and it wasn't good the next day... Sorry.

Public Service Announcement:  This restaurant does NOT serve alcohol.  Not a worry if this doesn't bother you but for those of us who enjoy a cold Kingfisher or the like with our curry, good to know before you go!  Not sure if they lost their liquor license or what (at least one review mentions a good selection of beers), but as of yesterday, NO BEER! 

Thankfully, I'm not completely in the dog house, as my husband, travelling on business, DID enjoy the food at Cuisine of India.  Another slight annoyance:  though they had a full menu available, they didn't seem excited to cook from it and pushed the dinner buffet hard.  

So, though he didn't have the relaxed curry dinner he had planned for (buffets are NEVER about relaxed eating now, are they and this is not a posh restaurant), he thought  the food was good (Butter Chicken, Lamb Rogan Josh + many others) and liked that they they brought hot naan straight to your table along with a sizzling hot plate of chicken tikka pieces.  

His final assessment?  7/10 for the food, 3/10 for the ambiance/service (it was buffet after all) and 0/10 for the availability of Kingfisher or any other alcoholic beverage.

Me and my staff had Indian Briyani many times. We were craving some today so we found this place thru yelp. We placed an order via phone and we were asked to pick up the order in 20 mins. When I arrived, I informed them that I am here for a pick up.  I was not welcomed, thanked and I was just asked to pay $28.50. So I paid, understanding that I will get my food in few mins. But the cashier didn't notify me what's happing until I asked where is the food. I was then told its in the counter, so I picked it up and left thinking that the cashier is having a bad day. Then when I reached the branch and started to eat the Biryani and it was horrible. I meant it was tasteless. Biryani isn't made this way at all. The so called Biryani was boiled rice with ( fried vegi and goat with no indian spices) it was like someone tossed rice and the fried vegi with goat. I have never had such bad food. I don't know about the rest of the entrees on the menu but Biryani is a waste of money. I am still shocked how they can call this Biryani. And all the excitement on yelp about this place is because most of the customers are non-indian. And they do not know how the food should actually taste.
The food tasted amazing but there were bones in the chicken, they forgot the sauces for the samosas, and I've never had an entrée at an Indian restaurant where rice wasn't included.
What a place , exquisite , food made fresh and very tasty , always come by at least once when in town

Great buffet with plenty of vegetarian options! You can't beat the price and the taste. I personally enjoy them because of their options for lunch, the food is also fresh. People working there are friendly and the service is good. Would recommend to friends.

For sure, they are back in business (for the last 3 months).  (If recall correctly).. There was damage to their roof that had to be repaired.

The food is as good as ever.  The night I went they had a chili chicken which was really good.

Food not that much good. Food Variety is ok, Food was not fresh. They charge $15.00 Dinner Buffet and good quality not that much good. I can say this Buffet cost $10.00 not more than that. If you find any coupon that it's a good other wise waste of money.

Superb food. One of the very few good Indian restaurants around Chicago. Wonderful North Indian food Punjabi style. The dinner buffet is certainly value for money. I would say the food here is as good as Jaipur restaurant or India House. Authentic Rajasthani/punjabi/north indian flavors. Mild flavors though. Buffet is not extremely spicy.

Went here for lunch a couple weeks ago after seeing all the great yelp reviews. It was good, but I didn't find it super excellent, more in the 3.5 star category for me.

Yes, they have a nice large buffet, with somewhat more dishes than average probably, and it was good though nothing hit me as a reason to make the trip.

At lunch (that day at least) the naan was just another item on the steam table and it was lukewarm and somewhat soggy. This was disappointing having read the other review mentioning "hot naan brought straight to the table" which probably would have pushed them up to 4 stars in my book.

Will think about giving them another try for dinner and update this review as appropriate.

G.

One of my favorite buffets. I go every time my stomach allows. $10 gets you 2 tables of options with plenty of sauce to drench your rice and naan in. Nice and spicy and strong for those who like lots of flavor.

Servers are nice, and place is always packed around lunch. Samosas and pakoras could be better, but I enjoy almost everything else on the menu. Nice beer menu including imports.

Checked in for the dinner buffet and unlike Nektaria above, I did not have to do the poo dance at the restaurant. The food completely agreed with me. 

It is an Indian buffet in a strip mall so lets get that outta the way (But then again, Illinois has everything in a strip mall so this might not be so alarming to you). 

Not a soul in here on a Wednesday night at around 8pm. I was the Buffet King for about an hour. Wide variety of dishes (at least 10) all of which worked for me. Pretty decent samosas. They bring the free bown soup (direct Indian tranlsation) and tandoori chicken to your table, sizzling like it was from Sizzler. Your standard tasty fried sugar dough balls (again, a direct Indian translation) and mango ice cream. 

If I am ever back in the neighborhood and have a hankering for Indian food, this is the first place I am going to.

Went for buffet on Sat,  wasn't so bad. I cook indian food at home so not a big fan of Indian buffets but this one was okay, it was kinda empty for sat afternoon but I guess they have more customers during weekdays. .

I have been to Cuisine of India many times.  I used to do lunch here every Wednesday, but I now have too many places that I like, so it does not come up in the rotation as often.  At work we refer to it as "the Indian place", because it is the only one we go to.

Cuisine of India is in a strip mall.  The decor leaves something to be desired as do the environmental controls.  It is often too cool in the winter and too hot in the summer.

So why do I keep coming back?  The food is the answer.  The lunch buffet is the best way to eat Indian food.  I always start my meal with a samosa.  Then I take a little of this and a little of that.  I love the mattar paneer and the lamb dish.  The naan is precooked and left in a big pile for the buffet.  The quality varies greatly from day to day.  Most of the time it is good, but there are days when the naan is cool and soggy and the lamb is all bones, but luckily that is not the norm.

As with most restaurants, the price has been going up.  As of today it is $9.95 per person.  If it wasn't for the tasty food, I would think twice about paying this much.  Even though it is a buffet, there is a limit to how much I can eat!

Cuisine of India is a good solid choice for lunch and you will not go away hungry.  There is room for improvement, but I will be back.

If you want a pleasant dining experience with decent customer service, then please take my advice and go somewhere else.  I would say that I had the worst experience at this restaurant in the 20 years that I have lived in the area.  My family decided to give this restaurant a chance and went there for the dinner buffet on a weekday.  The restaurant was not very busy, but we waited about 10 minutes to get seated since there was only 1 person multi-tasking as the host, waiter, cashier, etc. for everyone.  This person eventually pointed to a certain area of the restaurant and mumbled for us to sit over there.  

As others indicated, the food in the buffet was cold and did not look fresh but was edible.  Some dishes in the buffet were spicy. Our 3-year old son tried a curry dish and must have had a bite of a really hot pepper, since he would not eat anything else after that.  After a while, the owner stopped by to pick up our plates and saw that my son's plate still had food in it.  He then asked my son why he had not finished the food in his plate.  I thought the owner was trying to be playful, but my wife explained to the owner that my son had eaten something really spicy and would not eat anything else.  Instead of showing any concern or acknowledgement, the owner just mumbled something and took the plate and walked away.  We thought the owner's behavior was rude, but didn't really think much more about it.  

When we eventually went to the cash register to pay, the owner started telling us that they normally do not charge for kids, but he was going to charge us because our son had "wasted" food and that we should have given him less food.  At this point, we honestly could not believe what we were hearing.  So, instead of showing any concern that the food was too spicy for our child, this person was doing the exact opposite and complaining about wasting a small quantity of food in a child's plate and about how he is going to charge us for it.  We really did not care about him charging for the child's buffet even though they usually do not, but I never imagined a restaurant owner telling me how I should feed my child.  We obviously told the owner about his complete lack of customer service and rude behavior during our visit there, but he did not really seem to agree.  So, we tried to end the conversation and leave as quickly as possible, but told him that we would be sharing our experience with everyone so they do not make the same mistake that we did by dining there.  I usually do not write lengthy reviews such as this, but wanted to make sure everyone was informed about our horrible experience at this restaurant.

I don't know what it is about this place. We've been coming here for years (a bunch of cranky office workers) to bitch about this or that. Every single time, I do the poo dance. I don't know if it's this place or just the spices that seriously do not agree with me. Well, this last time, was it. I've sworn off Indian food for good. I refuse to eat here or any other Indian restaurant ever again. 

The problem is that I've had Indian food before (coworkers make it) and one other place in Oak Park. Well, it's tasty enough, but I can't deal with the cramping afterwards. So that's it. I'm done. No more. Thai please.

I love Indian food. Even more, I love a good indian food buffet. We're no strangers to the places on Devon and this place definitely holds its own. It's also close to where I used to work, so even better. 

They have a rotating selection, but they always have samosas, tandori chicken, etc. All quite good. 

If you're in the area, it'll easily satisfy your cravings. Perfect comfort food on a cold winter day. My only complaint is that I'm pretty much useless after eating lunch here.

Their dinner buffet is such a great price at $13.99! Great selection and comes with fresh naan and tandoori chicken served fresh from the kitchen. I love how the buffet includes the popular dishes and has a good mix of vegetarian and non vegetarian dishes. The best part is how there's more than 1 dessert to pick from as well! I'm in Indian food heaven when I eat here. :-)

i really enjoyed this place! my fiance and i went for the lunch buffet on a weekday the chicken curry and lamb were tender and excellent. they had a whole buffet tray full of tandori chicken that was sooooo delicious. the red chutney was almost desertlike but oh so good, and when you have stuffed yourself silly with all the indian food they have mango ice cream and rice pudding waiting for you on a different table.

the only thing was i overheard another table say that this place was a give or take resturant, meaning somtimes is was good sometimes not. i also took that as they change the buffet items reguarally so call ahead if you want to know whats on the buffet. price 9.95 pp

We had the buffet, we came a bit late so the rice was a bit crunchy.  However, when we told the waiter they fixed a new batch of rice in 5 minutes. Considering it was a buffet it was pretty good, even the mango ice cream was tasty (although slightly flaky). The butter chicken and paneer was particularly good, we even got a hot plate of tandoori chicken chunks. Vegetarian Vidar was also very happy with the selection. Erlend was a bit meh and voted 3/5, mainly because of said shitty rice.

Ok to be fair the only thing I've tried here is the matar paneer, the naan,  tandoori chicken and the samosas...by far my favorite restaurant to order from for lunch or dinner.

The food has always been very tasty and fresh and absolutely delicious with very good flavors and just enough spice. 

The employees are not too friendly but I could honestly care less because the food is soooo worth !

Try it, then thank me...you will e hooked!

website down, number not accepting calls. Did some Google research, found this website: http://www.mycuisineofindia.com/buffet.aspx.  Called the spicemart number and reached an answering machine - there are two restaurants and a spicemart listed on the website, btw.  SO - don't know if COI is permanently or temporarily closed.  Just dunno....  Hopefully they'll be up and running again, last time I was there before I was a yelpin', the food was PDG!

Used to go here all the time and it was one of my favorite Indian places.  Not anymore. Went today and the dude seemed puzzled as to why we came in.  Then he saw my Restaurant.com in my hand and told me they don't accept it for lunch.  Not cool, doesn't say that on the site.   What set them apart for me was the not only the Naan delivered fresh and hot to your table but so was the tandoori chicken.  Not anymore.  Old soggy Naan on the steam table?  Bleh.  Done.  Luckily you can exchange Rest.com any time now so I won't have to go back.

service: bad
food: not even warm, naan partially cooked
taste: average
price: charged $3 for a glass of coke

Have been here a few times. Always very good service. The naan is hot and fresh out of the oven, I could live eating just this, it's that good. Love the tandori chicken here, they cook it just right so the meat stays tender and a bit juicy. The dinner buffet is not huge, but all the items are quality and buffet changes every day, samosa's are included. I do love the mattar paneer. Looking forward to the delicious Mango ice cream.
A great buffet, excellent food.
Their prices have gone up to over $10 for a lunch buffet, but the food is tasty

I've tried both the buffet and ordering off the menu.  The buffet was a good assortment for the price, but felt a little heavy and the restaurant itself is kind of boring.  Ordering off the menu to pick up is the way to go - everything is really fresh.  Their Bhel Puri is fantastic.

Well I was never a fan of indian food until I went here. The food was some of the best food I have ever had. The staff has always been very welcoming and very attentive to every need. The portions are more than enough and the buffet is out of this world. I am a truck driver and I drive all over the country so I have had alot of diffrent food. I can honestly say this is some of the best food I have ever had. I am a true white american.who never thought about eating indian food but while I was out working My wife had went here and told me about it. Now when I come off the road on friday. Its our new saturday date spot and will b for as long as they are here. Not one bad thing to say. Love it

This is the best Indian restaurant near the northwest suburbs. I wish they would open a location in Arlington Heights!

The buffet is best at dinner time, when sizzling tandoori chicken is brought to your table along with fresh naan. I enjoy many things from the buffet, such as the Murgh Makhani and Mutter Paneer. Their chutneys and raita are great too. You'll find me bringing them in the ice cream dishes over to my table! Try dipping the naan into the red chutney---mmmmm! It's like dessert.

Wow. Just wow. 
I've had Indian food from here to London (and all over Devon Ave), and nobody beats Cuisine of India in Mt Prospect. A buffet at both lunch and dinner? Outta sight. The chef here is masterful with his spice blending- the heat never overpowers the other flavors (and there are a lot of them). His Mutter Paneer is not to be missed. He mixes up the items in the buffet so it's never the same twice. And today it had 10 or 12 different entrees... in addition to samosas, pekora, salad, and desserts. There are always vegetable options and lighter fare. For me, it's all about the sauces. When I do takeout (I'm lucky enough to live nearby), I always get the peas (Mutter Paneer) or the Navrattan (7 vegetable) Curry, plus Murgh Makhni (butter chicken). Or try their dish called Chili Chicken; the spicy, bright red sauce is phenomenal. 
I have eaten here for over a dozen years.  It is a simple business.  There is always seating.  They play cool Indian music softly most of the time. I bring all my friends and adventurous dates to Cuisine of India.  It's crazy to have bragging rights of this caliper out here in the burbs.

My coworkers came here for the lunch buffet, and I was amazed by the selection.  There was an array spread out amongst a few tables.  I wasn't too thrilled about the salad since there was quite a bit of red onions in it.  I managed not to fill up on naan and rice and made sure I got a little of everything, but still filled up my plate.  The samosas are huge here and was convinced that I had to go back for seconds for them.  The food actually isn't as spicy as the other Indian restaurant would be the only difference if you are looking for a heat index factor.  The buffet price is pretty comparable, and the service was okay.

Sorry, can't give it five stars, I have nothing to compare it to.  We started visiting for lunch with a group from work and we are now visiting it monthly.  Excellent food, great price and the mango dessert is excellent.  If you are looking to experience food from India I suggest you start here.

I've  been a long time patron of the this place and have always thought it was great food at decent prices. Now that it has reopened the buffet has almost doubled in size and has a lot of new tasty dishes! Well worth the increase in the price, still a great deal, but now with a greater variety. The only ding would be that the nam is indeed served in a buffet tray and is no longer served fresh, not as good that way, but it still didn't stop me from eating three or four pieces of it! Overall I'd give this place a solid four of of five stars!

The one star is not for the food--I never got to try it. I called at lunch time and tried to order lamb xacuti for take out. They didn't have it. I hung up, disappointed. I can think of a couple reasons why they weren't prepared to offer this dish from their regular menu, but none are legit--and it certainly doesn't point this out on their website. Cheaper Indian restaurants do this all the time, but this is not one of those places...

This is the best Indian restau for my family. The food is excellent. The price is reasonable. Right now, they are under renovation. I can't wait to eat in this place again. I am missing their mango ice cream......

Went for the Lunch buffet on Saturday right when it opened. My sister said when she went here, everything was cold, but I guess the trick's to go right when it starts. I put red chutney on everything and ate all three dessert buffet options in every spoonful. Is that some white people business?
Amazing mango lassi! Extensive buffet at $12, I was very contempt with a Indian fried chicken appetizer and should not have swallowed any more. Worth every dime!
Best Indian restaurant I have found anywhere.
Mmmmm.......tasty!!

My husband and I enjoy visiting regularly for the lunch or dinner buffets. It is reasonably priced for all the choices they have out. The owner and one waiter are always there and they make sure drinks are filled and plates removed. The restaurant itself is quiet (there's never more than three tables filled) and I enjoy dining that way. I recently brought a group of 7 here that have never tried Indian food and they all loved it! So I recommend this as a great "starter" restaurant because the buffet offers many options to try.  Everyone went home stuffed and it cost me half what it would at other restaurants.

Definitely one of the better places to eat for lunch. Pretty good tasting food but loses points for the lack of change. If you've been here more then once you'll notice that the food choices are pretty much the same everytime. Maybe one dish might be different but they ususally are pretty much the same. Great tasting food, some days are better then others but over all it's pretty good. Beat the lunch time rush and get there before 12. Now that most places are off summer hours you can bet that Friday's are going to be real busy.

Opens at 11:30, lunch buffet is $8.95

For a first time Indian food eater, this place ain't bad, then again I have nothing to compare it to. 

The decor may be out of the late 80's. Practically no table decor whatsoever. This is a buffet afterall, cut down on laundry costs by tossin' out white sheets of paper atop the tables. Smooth. 

On to the food. I know none of these names. And I can't do spicy food. That part of me sucks. But there is a plentiful amount of salad and chutney (I remembered that one!). Try the yogurt based dressing and you are set. I dabbled in all the eleven courses offered but was most impressed by the radiantly-colored-red-chicken, the lamb with gravy and the green pea infused rice. 

The aftercourse offerings were mango ice cream, rice pudding and fried dough with a spectacular taste. 

They do have a bar, so if you want some Indian beer or a beverage aside from water, ask the waiter who's busting his nuts off bussing the tables. 

The price was adequate, though not very filling. It's all right from time to time, but there are other places in this strip mall and it's not too far for my lunch, so I will come back.

I was really torn between 3 and 4 stars for this place. My criteria is usually based on my desire to return to a particular place, 4 stars meaning very likely, and 3 meaning not as likely. I have officially tried enough Indian restaurants to recognize mediocrity. I sampled the buffet and found several hits and few misses. The days selection wasn't as good as I've seen in other buffets, only seeing 3 vegetarian dishes for the day. One big problem I had was the freshness of ingredients, I could clearly see the potato component of the vegetable dish consisted of frozen french fries. 
On the flip side, the tandoori chicken was brought to the table separately along with warn nan, and both were great. I was also a fan of the stewed lamb and the curried lentils, both very good. Maybe it was the buffet choices for the day not jiving with my particular tastes, but I left here feeling a bit underwhelmed. This is even after renewing my membership to the clean plate club. Who knows, another visit here on another day might bump this place up to a 4 star joint.

We're regulars here, so that says we like the food and service.  No, it's not always the freshest, or the spiciest, or the cleanest, but 9 times out of 10 it is all of that.  I wish it had a better atmosphere, but the food is always a hit with the spice craving adults and also the spice-fearing kiddos.

I love this place and it is the only place I go to for Indian Food.  My meal of choice is the Chili chicken with Peas Pulao and an order of Nan.  The owner or manager is always there and is always friendly to me.  Once I forgot my credit card and he said I dont have to pay until next time I come in.  (I paid him later that day though, I am not out to use anyone.)  The buffet is also very good and priced reasonably at around ten dollars.  The place itself is nice although the decor is a bit.....out of the times?  Overall I highly reccomend this place.

A good place for Indian food out in Mt Prospect.  The lunch buffet is around $10 now which is not the best.  Having lived in the middle of the India on Devon and Western I can say that the food here is as good as anything there.

Tried their lunch buffet today priced at $7.95 for lunch.

Appetizers:
1) Iceberg lettuce, unripe tomato, cucumber
2) 2 chutneys, 1 raita
3) giant samosas, rubbery pakora

Entrees
1) Peas paneer
2) Deep-fried red-colored cauliflower (???)
3) Chana masala (chickpeas)
4) alu beans (that's what they called it - was potato & green beans)
5) chicken murgh (drumsticks)
6) tandoori chicken (thighs & drumsticks)
7) lamb curry (mashed boneless lamb chunks)
8) basmati & naan

Desserts
1) Mango Kulfi (granita-like dessert from powder mix)
2) Halwa (grated carrots)
3) Gulab Jamun (fried balls milt pastry soaked in syrup served hot)

Pros: Inexpensive, decent array of dishes

Cons: 
1) Poor ambiance
2) A touch salty & oily
3) Chicken dark meat only
4) Naan is not made fresh for each table and a bit rubbery
5) Food has a less fine preparation

Finale: I'd rather dine at Himalayan up in Niles.  Same price.  Better selection.  Way less oily or salty.  Finer preparation.  Buffet selections vary every time we've been, even on the same days of the week (they'll have maybe 1-2 different dishes from the prior visit) AND they even change dishes on the buffet during your meal - you get to sample more dishes.  Better ambiance.  Higher turnover of dishes means fresher items on the buffet.

Good buffet. Very consistent visit to visit.

Only complaint is that I eat too much and then feel miserable for a day or so.

I've been here several times for their dinner buffet ($12+ as of Feb '08) and I must say it's one of the better buffet places I've been to.

Nothing fancy inside. A row of approximately ten sterno warmers by the front windows includes lamb (yes!), chicken (x3 variety), something with potato and peas, rice, something with yogurt, and salad. I'm bad with names.

The buffet also comes with hot naan and sizzling tandoori chicken, brought out separately. I've had better naan elsewhere. The tandoori can be a bit dry and I felt bad for not finishing it as I preferred their buffet dishes.

Next to the hot dishes were three types of dessert. I love their mango ice cream and the creamy rice pudding.

Make sure you go hungry.

Attended a BDay party there. It's in a strip mall and is a buffet but everyone who works there was very nice. The food was OK but I've had way better buffet Indian. Samosa's and pakora were great. Wasn't a fan of the Dal Mahkni which is one of my favorites. Beware of bones in the Lamb and Chicken dishes(almost cracked a crown). I guess it all just seemed a little bland for Indian and not because it wasn't spicy enough. Something just seemed like it was missing. Great mango Lassi's.

Buffets can often be a scary experience. Hard rice, overcooked food. But the Cuisine of India has a solid-quality buffet line. I 've been coming here for years, and the food has rarely disappointed me. It's helpful to get there early, of course, but sometimes, food that's been marinating for a couple hours can be very satisfying. Your choice! The standard rice and pakora + samosas (HUGE) are always on the buffet, and they change around the entrees  on occasion: with @ least 2-3 meat dishes for the carnies. Carnivores, that is. Not circus people. As long as I'm offending people, there's also a bar for all you lushes.
My friends usually enjoy the rogan josh (lamb curry). The salad is never brown, which is nice. I've definitely been to spicier Indian restaurants, but there's still more than enough kick to make the heat-seekers happy. (Palak paneer)

The lunch buffet is cheaper ($7.95) than the dinner one (I BELIEVE they just raised it to $10.95). The sizzling tandoori chicken comes automatically with dinner and is included in the price. It arrives on a bed of onions and w/ limes to garnish. I'm a veggie, so I can't vouch for how it tastes, however! Naan is supposed to come automatically with the price for both lunch and dinner. I've seen it on the buffet table, and have had the waiter bring it out to us @ our table.

There are almost always gulab jamuns (fried doughy-cheese-balls in sugar syrup) and mango "ice cream" available. Occasionally a kheer, too. AND... If you're lucky, you'll find their fruit salad there one day. Very rich and very sweet desserts. My kind of place.

They close in between lunch and dinner, so call to double check what the hours are!

Tried the lunch buffet.   This is one of those restaurants lost in a strip mall, but then again, some of these restaurants turn out to be a surprise.  The food was excellent.  Everything was spiced to perfection--that is, no one spice overpowered another leaving and all came through in a subtle, but delicious way.   I love Indian food, and this rates in my top two for taste.  This place knows what they are doing.  I highly recommend for an excellent lunch under $10.
Ignore the tacky, outdated, somewhat nasty decor and enjoy one of the best Indian lunch buffets in the Chicagoland area!

We had a great Sunday evening buffet experience. When we called to see if they were open, they said they would reopen at 5 for dinner. We arrived at about 5:30 and found a freshly stocked and diverse buffet. Warm naan and tandoori chicken came to our table. The food was all very good, including the desserts. Can't wait to go back!

I love this place! I try to go there every month or so. Their buffett is always fabulous.Every time I go there's always something new to try.

I usually start out vegetarian & load my plate up. Tasty tasty!!!  Then I go for the Tandori Chicken,curried chicken & lamb. Well spiced & consistantly good every time.

We went on a Sunday around 2:30 and it was pretty packed. We thought that we would have to eat fast before they took away the food at 3:00. We were wrong as the wait staff and owner did not rush us AT ALL and kept the food out until we left around 3:30. There was a huge selection and everything was very delicious!! Some Indian buffets lack meat items and thus my carnivorous husband leaves unsatisfied. Cuisine of India had at least 4 meat dishes including chili chicken, rogan josh (lamb curry), tandoori chicken, and chicken korma not to mention countless veggie items including dal makhani, matar paneer makhani, ghobi aloo, baighan burta, samosas, pakoras, and more! All were very good! Oh, and the dessert is to DIE FOR! Mango ice cream (amazing), gulab jhamun (fluffy and hot - the best I've ever had!), and kheer (a little thick but still very tasty). All in all, I highly recommend this restaurant and while I can only speak for the buffet, I'm sure the regular menu is just as good. Two thumbs up!

I love this place, i've been coming there with my family for years! the staff is super friendly, and the food is awesome! I've been to other places in the area and it's never as good as this place. now, we don't bother looking elsewhere because everytime we eat Indian somewhere else, we feel like we are cheating on our favorite place! I'm a firm beleiver that you should support your local faves!!

Celebrating our 4th wedding anniversary.
Stopped in for cocktails and appetizers.  Our waiter was EXCEPTIONAL and the manager even stopped by to deliver a box of chocolates and wish us a happy anniversary.
My husband ordered a bourbon and I ordered the "Cucumber Margarita".  I don't even know where to begin with this cocktail.  It is the most amazing, most refreshing, just the right amount of sweet cocktail ever.
We shared the bang bang shrimp (can't go wrong there EVER) and the coconut shrimp.
The restaurant was pretty crowded for a Wednesday night but the hostess was able to seat us, right away, in a quaint little booth closer to the rear of the restaurant.
We'll definitely be back.

Disclaimer first: I'm a pretty picky eater. I'm a nondairy pescetarian which means except for eating fish I'm basically vegan. I'm also really health conscious and count macros. Those are the number of carbs, fats, and proteins I eat daily.

Food was amazingly good! My aunt and I both ordered shrimp and scallops. She had the lemon butter sauce and I had the Asian ginger one (can't recall exact name). My husband ordered a pork chop I think (it wasn't fish). They both really enjoyed their food, our plates were completely cleaned.

My food was also cooked almost perfect, my scallops could have been done a little less done but they made them to order with no oil which is likely why mine were more done because my aunts looked perfect. The scallops are on the smaller side with this dish since you're getting 5 of them and Shrimp plus 2 sides, the price was good too. 

It's a little small inside and kinda loud, I heard they might be expanding and I think they do need more space.

The best part of the experience was the service (not that the food is bad, it was good) the service was top notch and I think in today's world that says something. We arrived early for our reservation by about 45 minutes. They were able to check us in early and have is seated within 15 minutes. The waitress was amazing letting me know which items had dairy in them and asking the chefs to make my food with no oil. My drink was never empty either. A lot of attention to detail given in a busy place where customers often have the little things missed.

Thank you for a great meal. I will eat here agin when I'm in the area for sure! I have family in that neighborhood and have recommended they check it out as well.

Really good food here. There's a little bit of a fishy smell as you walk in, but, don't let that fool you. The fish is fresh and fabulous. We had the sea bass and the tilapia. Both dishes were the best ever! 

The staff is so sweet, too. They were so helpful. It was kinda busy, but, the staff was always ready to help.

I have been to this location of Bonefish Grill a few time, and I have not been disappointed. We were seated within a few minutes of us walking in, the atmosphere of this place is very nice, with the dim lighting giving it a romantic/ intimate feel. anyways so you can not come to this place and not order the Bang Bang Shrimp. hands down the best starter that I have ever had, the sauce is amazing, creamy with a little kick to it. And for the main course I ordered the Talapia Imperial, which is a Talapia stuffed with Shrimp, Scallops, and Crabmeat. the seafood all tasted fresh, and it was cooked to perfection. Overall it has always been a good experience here, highly recommend this place.

Amazing menu, incredible service, great ambience. You must experience this gem. You MUST have the bang bang shrimp. BANGFULLY GOOD!! They have some really awesome interesting specials all the time. Compliments to the chef for mixing it up and keeping it fresh! Ask for Renee, she is terrific!

I initially was dining alone, but later was joined by a friend. I ordered the raspberry martini to start which was pretty tasty. For dinner I had the lamb chops med rare, lobster fried rice, & mashed potatoes. I also added on a lobster tail. When my food came out my lamb was well done. So I ate my lobster tail & fried rice until they corrected the lamb chops. The fried rice was DELICIOUS!!!! Lobster tail was succulent.. The lamb chops came back out, cooked to perfection. Only thing I don't like the carmelization they do to them, I would've preferred them dry. While I waited on my friend to finish her meal I ordered 2 fall apple martini's which were killer!!!!! The service was great too.. My waitress was very accomodating, she even signed me up for their rewards program. I'd definitely go back.

Three words- Bang, Bang, Shrimp!  These shrimp are covered in the most delicious sauce/sauté/marinate I have ever tasted on seafood. On their own they are delicious but if you try the tacos, well, be prepared to have a mouthwatering experience.  

The Menu: 
The fish has always tasted very fresh and I have never had a complain about ay of the other food items.

The Martinis:
These are some of the best martinis I have ever tasted.  The winter land martini is a must during the winter months.  And the current summertime watermelon and very martinis are so delicious!  The problem with the martinis (if you call it a problem) is that they are so smooth you'll probably drink a couple before you realize how much you've had to drink.  Don't forget to get a DD!

The service: 
This place defiantly has amazing service.  From the hostess, to the bartenders, and especially the servers are great.  Great, friendly service with a smile.

Good service, good food but lacking a little flavor! Busy place so good to make reservations at weekend. Calamari was tasty. 

Trout was very bland  but the green beans were tasty and cooked aldente. The spinach in olive oil and garlic was good. The ahi tuna was ok, also bland and nothing special. Lemons to squeeze on the fish would have been a novel idea considering it's a fish restaurant! The lime tomato garlic sauce really had little to no zest. Creme Brulee dessert was pretty good!

Ok experience.
Good romantic experience. Wait staff was particularly good. It was a bit pricey but good overall.

I'm from out of town and while on vacation with my boyfriend and friends we stopped by this location on a Monday evening. Back at home in NJ we frequent Bonefish Grill and the service is always exceptional. At Bonefish Grill Schaumburg, service was no different: super friendly and knowledgeable staff, amazing food, warm armosphere. 

My party and I ordered drinks, appetizers, and entrees. I had the Bang Bang Shrimp Tacos and they were huge. Our server John checked on us frequently and our beverages were often refilled. The Managing Partner of the restaurant/region (sadly I cannot recall his name) even dropped by our table to see how we were doing. 

We would visit more often if we lived in this area!

Four of us went to dinner before a class at the Schaumburg Library.  As it was a Tuesday, the special offering was called "Hooked on Tuesday."  This must be the deal of the century!  They offer what they call a "three course dinner" in four different price categories.  Each category also has three entree options.  While the lowest and unbeatably priced first category was tempting, all 4 of us opted for the next higher priced group.  Yes, it was a three course meal, but it came with all the bells and whistles.  There was a choice between two nicely sized salads, either house or Caesar; a choice of one entree out of three plus your selection of any two sides from an adequate list, and dessert.  The choices were tempting, the service was outstanding and the price was not to be believed.  I had the House salad with assorted greens, grape tomatoes, pitted kalamata olives, hearts of palm, pine nuts and a citrus herb vinaigrette that was marvelous . 

 I ordered an 8 oz Atlantic salmon filet in a light butter sauce, and two hearty sides, sautéed spinach and delicious potatoes au gratin. The salmon was perfectly cooked and the sides were fresh and well prepared.  We lingered so long, savoring every course, that we had to leave for class before we could eat dessert.  They were kind enough to wrap our desserts  and hold them for pick up after class.

i will save the desserts as a surprise, but will say there wasn't one i would turn my back on.  The choices were top notch!  So much delicious food for such a modest price.  I could see myself having dinner there every Tuesday, forever.  The surroundings were relaxing and pleasant and the wait staff was attentive and accommodating.  I look forward to trying their specials and regular menu items on other days of the week, especially their Sunday Brunch. 

To find such a jewel in my own backyard is great stroke of luck and i intend to make a habit of dining there.  The evening we spent was a lovely surprise, an exceptional treat and possibly the best deal in town.

It was my first visit at Bonefish Grill, and I definitely felt that the atmosphere was more sophisticated. I would definitely recommend this place as a good spot to go to for special occasions. However, my first impression of Bonefish Grill was definitely disappointing. As my boyfriend and I enter, the waitress ask if we were a table of 2. We answered yes, but right after, another Asian family walks in, and the waitress automatically assumes we were all together. It is disappointing and upsetting to see any restaurant to have such immature behavior and prejudice against Asians. 

Despite such impression, I do admit that the food was great. I definitely think it was worth the money. I ordered a tilapia with lemon butter sauce, and the fish was juicy and tender while the sauce was not heavy or oily. 

Overall, I would rate this place 3/5 because I definitely feel like they can work on their service better.

Been to Bonefish a bunch of times in several states, including this location. In the Midwest where it can be hard to find good seafood that doesn't cost a fortune, it's a reasonably priced choice and is generally consistent. 

Always start with the Bang Bang Shrimp; the creamy sauce is a touch spicy, but the shrimp are sizable and there are a lot in the serving to share. 

For my meal I had the Corn Chowder & Lump Crab, a soup really emphasizing the sweetness of the seafood; tasty but it benefited from some pepper added tableside. The entree of grilled shrimp & sea scallops was also very tasty, offset by simple lemon butter. 

The one issue with the meal came when our well-meaning waitress accidentally dropped the dish of pesto oil from the appetizer bread on my mom: the oil was in a small dish on the larger bread plate and just slid right off onto her. The waitress was extremely apologetic (she wouldn't even let my dad tip her as much at the end as he planned), and accidents happen, but it did get all over Mom's sweater. The waitress went to get the manager, who went through this whole rigmarole of telling my mom to bring in the dry cleaning receipt and the restaurant will pay for it. Oh, you live out of state? Well, email it and we will mail you the price. (I mean seriously, it's not just easier to take off the cost of the appetizer or a glass of wine or something? I guess they're just hoping you won't bother and they'll save some $.) Weird...

At any rate, you can rest assured that you will find a good seafood meal at Bonefish...just watch for falling pesto.

Good service, nice atmosphere but... Can we tone it down with the salt? 

Bang bang shrimp tasted like a lot a mayonnaise...

Calamari was ok... Safer choice, harder to ruin. And seriously... Calamari is always chewy so it's funny when people complain that it's chewy... It's a texture thing.

I ordered the crab cake and sirloin. My steak was cooked well, but salty. My crab cake was ok, but all my veggies were drowned in salt. 

The tilapia and stuffed shrimp was okay. 

This place is kinda pricy for the quality you get. Your better off going to a Red Lobster which is comparable to this type of establishment. And I'm not even a fan of red lobster, but I would choose over this place.

Celebrated our wedding anniversary 2 nights ago. The food was great! you can taste the freshness of the fish, no fishy taste
 their bang bang shrimp is the winner if only they put more shrimp than too much lettuce at the bottom. Our server was ok but like some resto not as visible as you need. Another downside is the lights. It's just too dark. I know it's for ambience and all but not that dark. I had a hard time reading the menu. Just wondered how the elderly people got by at the other table.

I'm knocking one star off solely because of the prices. A piece of fish with two small sides for $25 (avg) is crazy to me. Very delicious...but that's a whole lot of food I could buy at the store. As for food/service/quality - all 5 stars!!! I've been here twice now. The complimentary bread is very yummy. You can't beat bang bang shrimp - and I don't even like seafood! My server has always been very kind and helpful. I have yet to try a dessert, but hopefully will another time. :)

Hello Foodies...Very slow kitchen...entre took 30 minutes...strange not even that crowded...ceviche was good chips stale.
RJ
Been here 3 times. All extraordinary. Best food, best service and best of anything you could imagine.

Very nice experience. Ordered Bang, Bang Shrimp for group appetizer, cedar plank dish - very fresh and yummy and lastly key lime pie. Very clean meal. My palette feels refreshed. 

Martinis are to die for. Fall Apple Martini as we are in the end of September. Delicious. I recommend. 

Waitress was very frank and funny with us. Great service. No wait time. Can't think of one negative about Bonefish Grill.

I went to a restaurant called the Bonefish Grill. They have wood grilled fish. I order the Atlantic Salmon with herb pesto sauce, garlic mashed potatoes and couscous.

The salmon was cooked perfectly, the garlic mashed potatoes were very good. The couscous was fresh but it seemed under cooked, but I am not a big couscous fan

We've been here more than a few times and it's always a pleasant experience. The food is great and the wait staff are exemplary. After the bang bang shrimp, salad (suggest dressing on the side) and bread it's difficult to finish the entree and dessert. House wines and cocktails are top notch. Would suggest one tweak however and that would be easing up on the salt in the garlic mashed potatoes.

My husband and I went out for a special night, I made reservations, and from that point on, I was very impressed!  The person on the phone was so polite, the host was sweet, the bartenders were awsome and social!  I myself work in a restaurant, so my standards are very high, but everyone here went above my expectations!  Special shout out to Steve who took care of us, thank you again!  Now, about our server!!!  Our server Brooke was so cute, sweet, knowledgeable about the food menu and wines!  We already knew what we wanted to eat, but she still made awsome recommendations, and we were glad we listened!  She could do no wrong, and can't wait until she comes to visit me at my restaurant!  We are definately going to spread the word about the excellent food and service!!!Thanks to you all for an awsome night, and awsome service!

Sincerely,
Angela

Okay I'll admit it. I'm 53 and we picked this restaurant because there are lots of Pokestops in the mall. Couldn't be happier we did.  Bang Bang Shrimp appetizer was great (we split it). I had salmon with Lime Tomato Garlic sauce. It was perfectly cooked as were the veggies I ordered with it. We will be back, Pokemons or not.
Amazingly fresh seafood, fast service and amazing desserts.

I've heard about this place for a while now but never really bothered to check it out. Well today was finally the day. 

Located next to the Schaumburg library, this place was the only place with a filled parking lot in that location. When we got there at 5:40, the parking was already getting cramped which is always a good sign. 

We ordered the:

Ahi Tuna Sashimi: (around 10 dollars for a "regular")" It was seared well on the outside. Came on a bed of lettuce with wasabi, soy, pickled ginger and a sauce on top of the fish. (See Picture)

Bang Bang Shrimp (10.50): What this place is famous for. I completely get why it is so popular. The shrimp are tender on the inside and fried crispy with a spicy and creamy sauce. Very good. 

Blackberry Smash: (3.50): For the price, I'm surprised there isn't any booze in it but either way this is one fantastically tasty and refreshing drink. Its fruity and minty and just sweet enough. Reminds me of a fruitier mojito. (See picture)

Lobster roll. (around 16 dollars): They certainly didn't skimp on the lobster unlike way too many other places around here. You can see giant chunks everywhere. It came with a coleslaw that had a sweet ginger kick which I liked and some fries. Unfortunately they burned my bun but the management was very quick to try and rectify the situation. 

Every meal here comes with fresh bread which was delicious and olive oil with pesto. 

Overall I'd say this place is a winner for food and especially service. The moment I pointed out the roll in my lobster roll was burned, management came by a minute later and offered me another order of it. I didn't take it but they ended up not charging me for the dish which was very thoughtful. Our server was quick, knowledgeable and on point. 

We will definitely be back.

Oh Wow!! Super delish!!! I loved the Salmon Bonefish house salad!! The best!! Prices very affordable!! Service is superb with Daniella! Thank you!! Environment and cleanliness is like a drop of water!! Clean!! 100+

This place is awesome!! I have always wanted to try it since I live so close but never have until yesterday. The place has classy decor and is very warm and welcoming. My girlfriend and I came yesterday and I ordered the Ahi Tuna steak while she had the tilapia. Out server was very friendly and polite. We ordered the cosmo martini and it was very good. Our waitress accidentally forgot to bring out out salads but the manager bill came up to us and offered us 2 more drinks on the house to make up for it. It more than made up for it! The food and service was top notch and we will be back!!

After getting on wait list at home, my husband and I were seated immediately.  Table was a little too close to other table as my chair kept getting hit. Took a long time to order drinks. Bang bang shrimp appetizer was outstanding.  Best martini was not.  Small glass with almost an inch empty.  Also no mention of stuffed olives in description. Bread at table was very nice. I ordered crab cake and filet. Filet was actually sirloin which was reflected on bill. Crab cake was small but delicious.  Sirloin was just ok.  Overall food was good but not anything special. Service was just ok.

Wow, I just had an awesome dining experience at Bonefish Grill. I was surprised because I have passed this place every day for the past 10 years and never tried it until recently.  
 
From the food to the service, everything was well executed but the real kicker was the Bang Bang Shrimp - it's seriously the bomb. It's fried shrimp tossed in a creamy sweet and spicy sauce with a touch of an unknown addictive substance. If fried bite size pieces of succulent shrimp tossed in mayo, Thai chili sauce, and sriracha doesn't excite you, then you won't enjoy what makes the shrimp so bang bang. It's highly addictive and might have been laced with something because I am having withdrawal symptoms. The menu is reasonably priced from small plates to large entrees. Our scallops were cooked well and I loved the ahi tuna tacos.
 
Bonefish is really the perfect inbetweener with the variety and the price point. It's a step up from Red Lobster and not as expensive as Shaw's. Just don't forget about the Bang Bang Shrimp (intentional redundancy).

Wow! Felt like I was transported to Florida!  Great food great service great prices!  A home run! All of our dishes from our Surf and Turf eggs Benedict to the Big Bang Shrimp and Clam Chowder soup were delicious! My husband said the Blue Cheese Wedge salad was the best he has had in years. The Walleye and Chilean Sea Bass ...perfection! Great Father's Day at Bonefish Brunch!

Sure, it's a chain. Had one of the best meals I've had down here (Palm Beach Gardens, Florida). Fresh warm crusty bread on the table with an herb olive oil dipping sauce. Crisp, cool house salad with hearts of palm, Kalamatas, and plum tomatoes in a good citrus herb vinaigrette. Entrée was wood grilled wild snapper and shrimp in a blackening spice in a chorizo "mojo" sauce, jasmine rice, and very fresh asparagus. Had it with an excellent Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc. Finished with the coconut custard cake (companion had the crème brûlée). Place was jammed on Tuesday. Service was very attentive and really flawless. Wonderful meal. 50% off on 4th visit. This is not chain food. Highly recommended high-end cuisine at very reasonable prices.

Bonefish is a pretty well run chain. Prices are moderate and the food is good

The wine list is so so but they did. have a good deal in the 2012 Caymus 

Overall, if you want good seafood at a good price this is worth the trip

Healthy fish and very fresh. Had the calamari and the rainbow trout which I enjoyed. The french beans were cooked well and so was the spinach in garlic. I really enjoyed my creme brulee. Service was good. Sangria was a little sweet for my taste. The place was super busy so good idea to make reservations at the weekend.

My husband i were reading this restaurant 's reviews and decided to give it a try.

Bang bang shrimp - the crunch and heat to it is ok.

Oscar Omelet - hubby ordered something light but he mentioned how he couldn't taste the crab and the asparagus was a bit overwhelming.

Creme Brule french toast - i picked this because i love creme Brule.  For some reason, the char from the bread was so strong it gave me a weird taste after one bite. I know they served it with whipped and mint plus strawberries but thats what got me excited the most. Maybe i will try this again without it being way too burnt.

Overall it was a good experience. Maybe my expectations were a little high.

My first visit to a Bonefish and I was blown away!! Upon my arrival ( this place was packed )
host honored my reservation and we quickly sat in their beautiful dining room.  Started of with their Tuna Sashimi, best I've ever had, moved on to a fish called "Cobia", which was amazing and finished with an ooey gooey Chocolate Brownie. Wine list has many fine selections.  Server was efficient, and Bill, the manager stopped by to ensure all was well.  An amazing
dining experience, can't wait to come back.

Our service here was great! This was our first time to this location and our family was very impressed. The service was phenomenal, especially our waitress, Joann. The staff were very concerned with our satisfaction and made our stay very enjoyable. We will definitely be returning thanks to the great food, enjoyable environment and pleasant workers!
Love the scallops and Hawaiian Martini. Staff is always friendly. Can get packed but it's easy to make a reservation on their website.  Must try the bang bang shrimp.

Very good food but also a little pricey.   I had the fish and chips and ordered some sushi appetizers.  Everything was fantastic.  Service was also very good and the decor is what you expect from an upscale restaurant.   

It can get real busy at times, but it's a mark of a good restaurant for sure.  Highly recommend it!

They accept reservation, but no table has been reserve for you, you still need to wait via first come first serve when you arrive, there is no point for having a reservation.  Wait time is at least 1 hour, just go to Lou Malnatis or Asian noodle house close by.

Came here for my birthday. Foods tasted great, and our server Ellen was very kind and attentive. Also, a gentleman who looks  like the owner of the restaurant stopped by our table to make sure things are okay. Ellen told her manager it was my birthday, and the owner came by to recognize it!! (Thank you.) My first time visiting this restaurant became an excellent experience. Will definitely come back.

Been here on two occasions,  one with girlfriends and the other to catch up with my mom. Both were good dinners with tasty appetizers. Bang bang shrimp went well with our sangrias. The menu offers typical fish dishes,  average flavors. Restaurant packed both times, sat in the outside patio and enjoyed some sun. We returned with my husband and kids but not a family friendly menu. Would suggest for a girls dinner out.

Leaving Bonefish restaurant. We had 4:00 reservation on Mother's Day. Upon arriving at 4:00 , we were told we would be seated in 25 minutes. It is now 5:00 and we left as we were told we had another 40 minutes to wait . Lol. Are you kidding me. They know how to take a reservation but don't know how to execute the reservation!!! Many people left also. How can you not properly manage a restaurant on Mother's Day!!! If you can't handle a Mother's Day then don't open for Mother's Day!!!! Unbelievable!!!!! We saw chefs standing at the end of the bar. At one point they were handing out complimentary champagne. What's the problem here?????

I had the salmon meal with mash potatoes wow was the salmon delicious. I got the lemon butter and poured it all over the salmon and the taste was absolutely amazing. As an appetizer we got the Bang Bang Shrimp and OMG it seriously was the best shrimp I have ever tasted in my life. It's little spicy but holy cow it tasted so good. If you go here you MUST and I mean MUST try the Bang Bang Shrimp!

If I could give a review with zero stars, I certainly would. Why? Well, that would be because I became violently ill within 30 minutes of eating the red pepper and tomato soup.
I was unable to eat my entree and my husband and I were compelled to leave. I spent the next 4 hours vomiting. I felt terrible for days, and eventually it concluded with intestinal distress.
Upon calling the restaurant, I was asked for my info to give their insurance company.
When contacted the agent indicated that no one else reported becoming ill so obviously it could not be a food borne illness. I don't understand that conclusion without adequate testing. I was told that I may have food allergies. Respectfully, I do not. 
In the past I had eaten here several times before with satisfactory experiences. 
I currently have lost all confidence in the basic food safety practices of this establishment and their protocols for responding to questionable practices. I will never dine at any Bonefish Grill again. For those of you that choose to, I encourage you to report any circumstances involving illness related to your dining experience.

Went here last night with my husband.  I absolutely loved it!!!  First, we started with the bang bang shrimp.  Holy moly, those are absolutely delicious.  Then I ordered a special Halloween prix fix that included salad, entree and dessert.  I got the shrimp and scallops with the line tomato garlic sauce and the pan Asian sauce (I couldn't decide), spaghetti squash and potatoes au gratin.  Everything was outrageously yummy except the potatoes that were slightly underdone.  Then for dessert, I had the coconut pie...which wasn't my favorite but it wasn't bad either.  My husband ordered mahi Oscar and he enjoyed that a great deal also.  I honestly liked this place for many reasons...the food, the service and the ambiance.  I will, without a doubt, return.  I had such a lovely experience!!!!!

Great food when it is ordered correctly.

Poor service by a pushy waiter. He explained two specials and when we ordered them, he put in the more expensive, incorrect counterpart. When the order needed to be corrected, the waiter took 15 minutes to bring it out, but spent most of that time chatting with coworkers and did not check in with the kitchen.

At the end of the meal they brought out complimentary ice cream to make up for the faults, but then took back our bill to add it on. 

Very disappointed in service and customer loyalty. Will not be going back.

Not happy with our last experience at bonefish. Used to be our favorite restaurant. Went on Halloween this year and had the following experience: ordered the roasted red pepper soup and it came out cold. Ordered the lobster Halloween special and it was the smallest lobster portion I've ever had. In addition probably the driest lobster I've had. Sangria not as strong as before and the bang bang shrimp seemed soggy to us. Quality is suffering here and you're Losing our vote bonefish!
I'm not a big seafood eater, and I must  say that I truly  have enjoyed  their food. Very fresh

I took my parents here for dinner one night and was completely blown away at how great of an experience it was!

Decor: It was a pretty standard restaurant as far as the inside, but I'd venture to say that it is actually a bit more upscale. While I don't think you'd be particularly out of place coming to eat and dressing completely casual, you'll fit in better if you're dressed a bit nicer.
Bathroom: Spotless and inviting!

Staff: Our waitress was one of the best I have had EVER. She was friendly, fast, and did everything absolutely perfect. She was there when we needed her and not when we didn't. She kept our water glasses full and provided excellent recommendations on the menu items.

Food/Drinks: It's a seafood place, so you have to get the seafood. And why wouldn't you, it is all cooked PERFECTLY. We had an assortment of items but my salmon was wonderful and, just like everyone else, the Bang Bang Shrimp is absolutely amazing. It's definitely a must-get item.

Value: It's a bit more expensive, for some items, than your average place but it is definitely worth it. The food quality is A+ and the preparation is fantastic.

I can't wait to come back for another meal. The only thing I'm disappointed with is myself - I've driven by many a BF location and never stopped in - I wish I had dined here years ago!

Heard such great things so we finally went and ended up with a huge metal chunk in our shrimp. After we politely told our waiter about the issue he sent over the manager 20 minutes later. She examined the metal at the table and said she was sorry and we wouldn't have to pay for that appetizer....yeah that's really great of you. The rest of the meal was pretty generic and lack luster. Overall disappointed in service and food.

Tonight our server was Anita...I have frequented this place many times. Anita was exceptional. She was patient as out party of 8 slowly arrived due to traffics then quickly dwindled down to a party of 5. The bang bang shrimp appetizer and crab cakes never disappoint. Anita recommended the Wild Orchid Hawaiian Martini, perfect! I have never had a bad meal at Bonefish. I do recommend making reservations because they do get busy.

Why would you open on a holiday like today Labor Day at 4 pm we arrive at 4:20 place is empty and they say it 20 to 25 wait due to lack of servers how do you run a business this way!! Always like this place don't think I'll be back and the young hostess was very ruined

Typical bonefish experience.  Good service, food was good.  My wife ordered the new lamb chops dish and that was amazing. I had the ahi tuna and it was well cooked or should I say seared.  Bang bang shrimp typical favorite at nine fish was good. I love their corn chowder here it was a bit thicker than usual but the taste was still there.  Overall good experience for dinner, would go again when in the mood for some seafood.

I've lived in the area for 10 years and I have no idea why it took me so long to eat here. we ordered the bang bang shrimp for an appetizer. It was pretty good and the serving was quite large for an appetizer. 

For dinner I ordered one of the fish specials. I can't remember the name of the fish but the server described it as having the density of lobster which it actually did. The sauce was some kind of lemon garlic butter and it came with a couscous kale salad which was very refreshing. For someone that is health conscious, I think this is a great place to go since the platters come with a big kick of protein and veggies.

The service was good. Nothing better than I've experienced before and nothing worse either.

We finally did it! after months of talking about going here, we finally did it sunday. We were craving good seafood and the husband suggested this.
We went for early dinner, around 5pm like old folks.  Seated right away with our 2 kids.  Started out with Bang-bang shrimp and the starter bread was good. I know, but the bread was something we enjoyed eating as a family.
I had the Baja fish tacos, hubby had the Fontina Chop, son had the kobe burger and daughter the bang-bang shrimp tacos.
We enjoyed our food and definitely will be back in the future. Just a word of advice, skip the salad or soup, I didn't know that they charged extra, $3.10, for it.  My mistake...
The waiter was awesome (sorry didn't remember your name); attentive and he even told us that the salmon is 'heart healthy'. Nice spiel!
The ambience is laid back, we didn't have to wait long for our food. Our experience was worth it.

This is a brunch review. So only read is applicable. 

So came here for brunch since we were in a seafood mood. Been here a few times for dinner and it's pretty good. Nice service and very clean restaurant. So looking at the menu, we usually get the mussel appetizer. It wasn't on the brunch menu but we just asked out server and he was able to make it for us to props to him. For 10 bucks it's pretty good size and I love the flavor. Makes really good dipping sauce for the bread.

I ordered the surf and turf eggs benedict and it was all right. Good flavor but didn't blow me away. What bugged me the most is that if you get an asparagus 'side' it's really just 3 pieces of asparagus.... and on top of that, it didn't even taste like it was seasoned, just steamed pretty much.
