My mom got the pork chop and ended up taking some of it home. I ended up eating it as a leftover and it was pretty bomb, so I can only imagine what it tasted like when it was fresh. Good flavor, good seasoning. So definitely don't feel like you have to get seafood at a seafood place.
The mussels and house salad was great. Anthony my server was a great help and friendly.

Food met the expectations however it took 8 minutes for anyone to stop by the table. Then the waiter situation was unknown as far as who was going to discover us. Finally a waiter from the other side of the room felt sorry for us and began to serve us. 
Funny the place was empty but they all tried to appear busy. Management must have change cuz this location was much better.

This was my first visit to Bonefish Grill.  I've heard good things about it, but never got around to going.  After a day of training at the office, a colleague and I decided to stop there for a drink before heading home.

We arrived at around 6PM on a Friday evening. The bar was crowded, but not overly so.  There was a wait for dinner, but I did not plan to stay that long.

What I found great about the bar was the setup.  There are the traditional bar stools, all occupied.  But, between the bar and dinner booths, there are long "community tables" where anyone can sit.  There were a few seats open, so we grabbed them.

This is anything but a corner bar, but everyone at the table talked as if we knew each other.  I'd classify this as a friendly place.  I'm eager to go back to see if this holds true again.

They have a large drink menu, but I'm normally a bourbon drinker.  Last night I decided to me more adventurous.  They had a $5 special for something called a Blackberry Elixer - it contained Malibu Rum, coconut water, fresh blackberries, lime and fresh herbs.  It was pretty tasty, but not one I'm likely to get again.  They also serve fresh Focaccia Bread with Olive Oil.

I'm eager to go back and try something on the menu. While their prices are a little high, the other patrons spoke very highly of the food.

Dined here in May 2014

Overall Rating: 5/5

//////////////////////////////Rating Breakdown//////////////////////////////

Atmosphere: 4/5
Well-maintained restaurant, really clean

Food: 4/5
Really good, but serving size is pretty small

Service: 5/5
Extremely fast service, nice waiters

This place is a joke. It was not that busy and I waited over 20 minutes for someone to take my order and another hour to get the food. I had their "bang bang shrimp" and it was not that good but if you like high calories of garbage this appetizer is for you. They undercooked the fish that I thought it was some kind of "sushi" special or something. I had it sent back and they brought another one that was a little overcooked. I wouldn't be surprised if the waitress told the back to overcook it since she had an attitude. The owner of the place who looks like A pedophile came by and gave me the bullcrap apologies and offered a free dessert. All in all I will never go back to this dump. I am surprised to hear they have been open since 2004. I guess people like overpriced mediocre food with bad service.

I had the opportunity to visit this establishment for the first time with my sister today. Everything was great-the ambiance, service, food, wine, the prices even the water. The warm bread with the olive oil mixture was excellent. We both ordered the bang bang shrimp taco which was delicious. My sister brought it to my attention that there shrimp in every bite and she was certainly correct. We tried the house wine which was only $3.50 since it was during happy hour. I was pleasantly surprised while I was sitting there, I went on my phone to see if I could find a coupon and there was a coupon online for $10 off the meal and I just had to show the phone to the server. We would would have been out of $33.00 for the two taco meals (3 tacos and a side per meal) and two glasses of wine which ended costing us $23.00. What a deal??? I will be back coupon or no coupon. It was worth every dime.

Cannot go wrong with bang bang shrimp I mean those things are just delicious. I would also recommend any of their fish they are fresh and delicious. Everyone at the table ordered a drink from the bar and they were a little upset since the drink was quite strong. Too the point where it was pretty much inedible. Overall great service and food bar was okay

First went to Bonefish a year ago in their South Carolina location - but this restaurant lived up to the prior memories and everything was delicious! The Bang Bang Shrimp is always a fave and their Wood-Grilled fish are so fresh and succulent that you could never go wrong with them. I had the Wood-Grilled Salmon with the Lime Garlic Tomato butter - John is a great server and insisted I try it along my first decision of classic lemon butter, and I'm so glad he did, it was wonderful. I'm looking forward to eating here again!

My second time at a bonefish (first was in NJ) and I can't help but want to go back.  All the food is really good.  The fish is outstanding and please treat yourself and get the bang bang shrimp!

Service and food are excellent.

My mom had been dying to check this place out for years, always telling me she heard it was great and that they had a gluten free menu. This past weekend, we decided to finally check it out. A bit of a drive and located in an area with not too many other restaurants, Bonefish Grill looked to be a pretty popular place on a Friday night.

Because we were just a party of two, we were seated immediately. They had a nice little outdoor patio that was great this time of year as fall is just setting in.  I should have guessed it by the name, but this place has mainly fish.  Actually, "mainly" doesn't really suffice to say how fish-dominant this menu is.  On their gluten free menu, only one option was fish-free, and I'm pretty sure that on the regular menu the non-fish options had a very small section as well.  Unfortunately, I'm allergic to fish and shellfish (I know, I'm a bit of a bubble child), so my entree was decided for me.  I got the Lily's Chicken and my mom got some sort of fish.

The good news?  I think my mom really liked her fish!  The bad news?  My chicken was kind of gross. It came with spinach, cheese, and artichoke hearts on top, and both of our dishes came with ratatouille on the side. In my opinion, the spinach was slimy and the ratatouille was bland. The artichoke hearts on my dish were practically half the size of the chicken breast!  I ended up just scraping it all off and eating the chicken plain, and even plain the chicken didn't taste very good.

However, Bonefish Grill does have one thing going for it --- their fresh bread. My mom wouldn't stop talking about what a bummer it was that I couldn't eat it. Apparently it was "so fresh and warm and delicious"... thanks, Mom. Oh, and their desserts were pretty good too. I'm a huge fan of crème brûlée, and I was super excited when the menu said theirs came with fresh berries on top. Apparently fresh berries means one blueberry, but the crème brûlée itself was decent. 

Basically, if you're a huge fish fanatic and you're in the area, maybe you should give this place a shot. Personally, I don't think I'll be back to Bonefish Grill. It's overpriced and nothing special.

An average experience. I made reservations for 7:30pm and specifically said it was for our wedding anniversary. We got there and the hostess confirmed our reservation for 2 and they gave us a table notifier to let us know when they were ready to seat us. We didn't get seated for 45 minutes. Why did I make a reservation when walk-ins were getting seated within the same waiting time? The couple after us who just walked in were seated at the same time as us.

Wedding anniversary was not acknoledged. Every restaurant that I make a reservation at mentions our anniversary and congratulates us or does something special on the house. Not this place, it just seemed like they wanted to move us in and out like cattle and they didn't ask what brings us to  Bonefish, if this is our first time there, or what's the occasion.

My wife ordered Chilean sea bass and I ordered the lobster tails entree. The server came back to me 10 minutes later and asked me if I wanted two lobster tails or one? The menu for the lobster tails said two lobster tails so he left me confused. I also asked if they had hot green tea and the server didn't know so he gave me all the tea bags that they had and had me pick out the green tea.

Overall, the food was okay, but the service and experience was very bad. I would recommend Red Lobster over Bonefish.

Very disappointed.

I checked in on Saturday November 28th 2015 I won't ever go back. Honestly, I expected so much more maybe that is why I was so disappointed. I had a party about 7-8 of us and the waitress kept forgetting to put different appetizer orders and also forgot about majority of our drinks throughout the night meaning someone went from having one type of beer to another and it would not be brought out until that person finally mentioned, ' hey, I never got my beer I ordered' it would have made complete sense if the place was busy but by the time we were seated it as dying down and when we were getting ready to leave there was only about 5 tables the rest of the room was empty. Moving on, another person who ordered their entree had their food taken back three times due to it being the wrong order. They messed up the salad added something that they asked to be taken off I believe it was onions-- when they came back the salad had nothing but dressing which is not what they asked for they simply only wanted the onions off, then the actual meal was wrong as well.
Always great food. Eat here couple times a month. Never a bad experience,  highly  recommend.

I can't believe I forgot to wirte a review on my experiences here. The food is excellent. Love the bang bang shrimp. It is spicy and a nice portion. I am not a huge fish eater but I like that there is continous variety. I most recently ordered the crab crusted pompano. It was really flavorful. 

If you are a fan of seafood, this is a great place. You will not be dissappointed.

I have lived down the street from this restaurant for 4 years. Drive past it almost every day and have only just tried it for the first time.

We were trying to find a place for dinner and could not decide. My sis and I debated and debated. You would think we were deciding on what kind of car to buy. We both wanted to try something new. We talked about 'that place at the corner of Roselle and Schaumburg ', both us us afraid to try it. Were we dressed properly? What is the pricing like? What do they serve? What are the Yelp reviews like?

I, driving, and my Yelp reviewer assistant riding shotgun, I heard enough when we heard bacon wrapped scallops in one review, I knew that would please my sister.  I'm sure glad we gave it a chance.

So, you walk through the entrance into a very comfortable and relaxing setting. The host stand is set back a little ways, but don't fret, the host actually came to the door to greet us like Grandma would come out from the kitchen when you arrive at her house. 

We were seated immediately which was quite surprising considering they were very busy. I guess we just have awesome timing. 


I love pesto.  I love pesto even more when mixed with oil and served with bread to dip! Bread was hot from the oven and I thought about potentially skipping dinner and just eating bread, but I'm glad I opted to eat because it just got better after the bread.

I have been hearing about the Bang Bang Shrimp forever. Of course, we had to try it. Have you ever had shrimp melt in your mouth like butter? I have. It's from Bonefish Grill. Seriously, if I could just go here and eat the Bang Bang Shrimp with a glass of wine and maybe a little bread. I'm all set.

I am not much of a seafood fan except for calamari and shrimp, so I opted for a non-seafood entree. I went with the chops. HUGE pork chops. The sauce was different and delicious. I ordered the au gratin potatoes which looked great but sadly, were not served hot. This is the one and only reason for the missing fifth star. Their veggie of the day was chickpeas and peppers. I'm surprised, but I have to say, I loved the veggies. I think I ate more chickpeas than Pork Chop, if I'm telling the truth. They were that good.

My sister and I ask a lot of questions. We discovered that you can add a crab cake for 5 bucks to any entree. And she really wanted to try one, so she got the shrimp and scallops and added a crab cake. She was nice enough to give me a shrimp and I'm telling you, their shrimp is very fresh. The lemon butter dipping sauce perfectly complimented the grilled shrimp. Yum. She held a gun to my head and forced me to try the crab cake, and I have to be honest. It was really good. I might even get one next time or at least convince my fiancé to try one so I can have one more bite.

Seriously, there must be something wrong with me to have not been here ever before but don't worry, Bonefish....I WILL be back.

The sea scallops/shrimp (5*) and Chilean sea bass (4*) were real treats. A spinach side was large and melt-in-your-mouth tender. The noise level was fairly high, then worsened when they turned on the house music, which was all vocals and added to the din. They did back it off a bit on request. Nice decor, great friendly service with plenty of helpers, and table linens. Reservations are highly recommended as they are often packed.

We like this place, especially when we used to live closer and would enjoy their outdoor dining. The bang bang shrimp calls to me, as I hear it does to many others. Yum yum. 

They have really nice, healthy kids meals that you don't find everywhere. Fresh fish and steamed veggies for the little guy. I like their fish tacos, fish and chips, as well as their more traditional dinner items. I ordered a tilapia sandwich on our most recent visit and regretted it, but that is about my choice and not their cooking. 

The servers and hosts are always friendly and welcoming, and the restroom is clean and nice (with changing table, thank you.) It's well located too, with a duck pond and fountain behind perfect for a stroll in nice weather.

We'd seen the restaurant when going to the wonderful Schaumburg farmers market and had wanted to give it a try for quite awhile.  Very glad we did.  There was something comforting about the decor and the food - so good you could pass out. They had this warm bread that was wonderful.

This place is amazing!  To say the least!  Starting with the fresh bread and finishing with the desserts.   We came with a party of four the service was fantastic!  The food was even better!  The Atlantic  Salmon was so tasty!  Loved the Ahi Tuna Sashami for the appetizer.  The Macadamia Nut Brownie was to die for!

Top notch on all levels!  The service was most impressive...friendly and extremely prompt.  Classic restaurant/bar atmosphere, the tuna steak entree was nothing short of perfect as well as the specialty mango sauce.  I highly recommend this fine establishment for anyone who appreciates a satisfying dining experience.  Oh, and the macadamia brownie dessert is freaking awesome!

Had a wait at the door for seating and they passing around their bang bang shrimp appetizer for everyone to try. It tasted like soap. I am not sure if the plate just wasn't rinsed off enough from the kitchen or what was going on. Even my husband said it tasted like soup so at least i knew I wasn't going crazy.

Restaurant Review
Amazing service, okay food. I really wanted to give this restaurant more stars, but the food that we ordered was so so, maybe it was the type of food we ordered. We ended up going with a large party for my wife's birthday with her family. For our large party they had two servers which helped expedite the process. Servers were super attentive and nice with taking orders and making sure everything is okay. The dessert they give for the birthday person is so so, 2 chocolate covered strawberry with raspberry glaze and 4 blue berries. Looks nice. No complaints because my wife's favorite dessert is the oberweiss chocolate ice cream cake which they let us serve without charging us a plate charge. Your meal comes with a plank of warm bread which you can ask for more. The calamari and coconut shrimp were cooked perfectly. The coconut shrimp were large and well flavored without too much grease. The main entree for a beef lover was limited (sirloin or filet) and the largest steak was 11 oz sirloin for ~20 dollar. The beef was so so, but I should have expected this as this is not a steak house. It comes with a side of vegetables that was zucchini with tomato (very odd taste, likely canned tomato) and a scoop of au gratin potato (or other sides) This tasted like something you made from a box. All and all I will give this place another try, maybe try a seafood dish next time and see if that taste better, but A+ on the customer service.

Pro- excellent customer service, great appetizers, warm bread

Con- the main entree (steak) was not good along with the sides

Hidden deals-
1. Wednesday 5 dollar bang bang shrimp
2. Check out the website for super saving. They had a 19.99 summer catch menu that had lobster tail, 2 scallops, 2 shrimp along with the vegetables and side.

We enjoyed the wine, the bread and our appetizer coconut shrimp. My husband loves lamb and balsamic glaze but these chops were way over done and tasted burnt. I had the rainbow trout and enjoyed every bite. The waitress was very welcoming and attentive. We will go back again and probably will order only fish.

I love their fresh watermelon martini, bang bang shrimp and their sesame encrusted seared ahi tuna. I could probably live on those 3 items for the rest of my life. My 3 year old loved the popcorn shrimp. Picky eater #1 actually ate all of her popcorn shrimp and sat still the entire hour we were there.

Good Caesar salad with homemade croutons. Their lobster roll was pretty darn good with plenty of lobster and on a nice brioche roll. We've never had a problem getting in since it's not on the main Schaumburg strip. Great service and excellent bar options.

Came in at 10pm on a Saturday night and had really high hopes. Yelp didn't leave me astray on the bang bang shrimp, best part of the meal! 

We got the salmon with spinach bacon and gorgonzola, the tilapia imperial, and a side of crab fried rice. All three things were soooo salty that I couldn't eat even half of the tilapia. The Salmon was okay, but the tilapia was overcooked and dry. 

Service was not great considering that they weren't busy at all. Ordered a beer and it came out after the entrees...

Had such high hopes for this place but I probably will not return.

We came here for my moms birthday tonight and everything was great! Our server was very nice and knowledgeable and was able to suggest different types of fish and sauces to pair them with among other things. Our food was great also. We had the bang bang shrimp appetizer which was really yummy just like other yelpers have said. The portion size for that is also pretty large! Some other things we had include the wild salmon which was strong but fresh, fish tacos (tilapia), and Arctic char which was more buttery in comparison to salmon and something our waitress recommended. Someone else in our party ordered a burger which was apparently really good (especially for a seafood place). I would also highly recommend the pineapple martini! And the truffle Mac was fresh, hot and super yummy too! Great place for a chain and they also have a decent bar area
Great place for dinner or lunch!  I've had seafood and steak on different occasions and enjoyed both.  Wine is reasonably priced too!  Highly recommend.  Great for a date or for a group of friends
Havent been here in a few years but still remember the bang bang shrimp!  To die for!

*Disclaimer- this is solely for the staff in the front. If I could rate the food and staff separately, I would rate the food at 5 stars. I've never had a bad meal here, in fact, if it wasn't for the poor service, I would come back just for the food. Food times are always great, never had to send a meal back...maybe I will try take-out to avoid the servers...

As a former server and bartender for 8+ years, I was so disappointed in my experiences here.  I have dined here on many occasions and will not be back. This very last visit was the worst. I came for early dinner (probably around 4pm- so before the dinner rush). The hostess sat our party of 4 and let us know our server would be right with us. Well- fifteen minutes later, we still had no server. There were plenty of servers around, walking right past us, but none stopped at our table. I even spotted a manager walking around aimlessly in the dining room, but still no service. I finally had to go to the host stand to ask if we had a server and they sent someone over. I'm sorry, but as a server, if you notice someone not getting served, you take care of the table. It's called teamwork. We were seated outside of the current open sections (I know this because the server made a point to place blame on the hosts- as if that would make us any less frustrated at the situation) , but still- a server should have noticed we hadnt been helped (us constantly looking around for help would have been a dead giveaway) and stepped in. I've also been here on a weekend night when it was really busy and noticed two managers standing against the wall gabbing away, when they could be helping their servers/bartenders out of the weeds- prebussing, running food, etc. Later on in the meal, the manager had left his post against the wall to go watch tv in the bar.... still during the dinner rush. Seriously? What are they being paid for? Servers take their cue's from their managers, and on a busy night, no one should be standing around doing nothing. Lazy managers=lazy servers. This bonefish could take a lesson from the Orland Park and Algonquin  locations (which I have also visited about 3-4 times and never had a complaint). They seem to run a tight ship  and don't let any of this nonsense fly. 
My advice- clean house, starting from the top.

Today was Easter. The dining room was half full and I was also eating at 2pm. It took 15 minutes for a bellini to arrive in half a wine glass. The bang bang shrimp was delicious. The fish and chips are stale and HEAVILY battered. I suppose for all their discounts, this is a nice place to visit occasionally.

My boyfriend and I came here on a Tuesday night for the first time. We love seafood and this restaurant didn't disappoint us.  The food was good, and we really loved the menus options. We had great service! 
The reasons I didn't give it 5 stars is because it was a little too expensive for small portions and the taste profile they use relies too heavily upon spicy/hot.
Tiny amounts of food at high prices and the taste was ok. Also they did not have tilpia and told us 10 min later it took half an hour fir our food to come!! Never comeing agian!!

I went to the bonefish grill today the only reason i did not give it 5 stars is the hostess stand is so far from the door confused me and guest at first. The atmosphere was nice it was a good change of pace not seeing a bunch of people on there cellphones. The waiter was very nice had excellent knowledge on the food i kinda quizzed him. I had the boom boom shrimp tacos my guest had the kobe beef burger. Mine was excellent and my guest told me it was the best burger he has ever had. We also had the creme burlee and it was excellent will def go there again great place

We came here on Mother's Day and let me just say, with the craziness that was going on that day...staff and management handled everything so well. We always come here, so when we walked in and saw how busy and chaotic it was, we knew something was up. Had a 3:00 reservation, we were told that it would be a 25 min wait, which was fine. We were seated 45 minutes later, and ordered immediately. We noticed that all around us, no one was eating and besides appetizers, food wasn't really coming out of the kitchen. Our waiter had informed us that not only were they already short staffed one person, but one of the chefs had walked out on them in the middle of his shift earlier in the day...hence where all the problems and delays were coming from. They offered us and every other table around us free appetizers (more than once) and started handing out $25 gift cards. Our waiter disappeared for a bit, and when he came back he told us it was cause he was in the kitchen the whole time helping them cook. It had been 2 and half hours by the time we got our food. Of course we were a little bit annoyed but we knew that it wasn't any of their faults for the delays. When we got our check we were honestly pleasantly surprised that they had comped us for EVERYTHING. Appetizers, drinks, and three dinners. They did the same for all the other tables too. We felt so bad cause I can't even imagine how much money they must have lost that day. Despite all of that our waiter and everyone who had come up to us was still so nice and accommodating and you could really tell that they were doing the best they could. I have been to this restaurant so many times and this has been my only "bad" experience here, and even in a time like this I still felt like the customer service was fantastic. I'm always gonna be a big fan of this place :)

I love this place. It offers a family style experience,  well informed staff and a beautiful summer patio. 
As far as the food- I am dying for their Florida Cobb salad and their mussels Josephine. They offer four different sauces to choose from for the grilled fish and change them every season. Furthermore,  they have recently completely updated the menu. If you go there on Monday, they might have a Monday Martini night for 5$. You have to try the raspberry Martini! !

I didnt realize bone fish was a chain restaurant until after the meal. This is usually a compliment because I do not like chain restaurants. 
Food is good but not great. The bang-bang shrimp is very good and I liked it. But the Spicy Tuna entree I ordered is total bland. The tuna is not spicy at all and not as fresh as I have hoped from a restaurant like this.

To be honest I've been avoiding going to this place after reading negative reviews on Yelp.  Someone gave my wife a gift card for her birthday and we said let's get it over with.  Wow, talk about being pleasantly surprised!    We went without a reservation and were seated immediately.  We ordered the calamari with bang bang sauce, and half dozen oysters Rockefeller's. The squid was perrrrfect. Light breading, flash fried, delicious. The oysters should have been called bacon Rockefeller.  It was bad. In a wink they took it off the bill.  Oak wood grilled rainbow trout for the wife. I had the wood grilled shrimp and scallops. Both were loaded with smoky goodness. Really good!  Ended it by splitting a coconut cream pie.  I've never had a c c pie like this.  The lower cream section was a little thick and mild tasting. The next layer was tasty sweet coconut. Topped by home made cream with toasted coconut. It was the best I ever had. Many layers of flavored goodness. All I can say about this visit is I'm going back there. The food was good. Everybody around us were enjoying their food, and our waiter Kirk knew the menu like the back of his hand. He was more than helpful, not over bearing, and seemed like a good fellow who was really good at his Job. We interacted with 6 different employees and the manager. All were top flight professionals. A great experience!

Had an Outback gift card (barf) saw that Bonefish Grill on it. Thought we would give it a try. It was very good! Had the grilled Mahi with a side of crab fried rice. Wife had the grilled Shrimp and Scallops with a side of the truffle mac and cheese. Food came out fast even though they had a bus of 40 in the restaurant when we arrived. Will go again.

First time ever. Visiting from a city that just opened  a Bonefish restaurant. My brother loves this place and made a reservation for 5:45 party of 5. After 30 minutes we said we would take any table available and were seated. It took 15 minutes for drinks to arrive. No water even after request. Ordered appetizers and were served but we had no silverware. Had to flag down waitress. Again. Ordered food. When it arrived, my sister in law could not eat her dinner, fish was very dry. Flagged down waitress again. Reordered meal. It arrived after everyone else had finished their meal. Asked again for bread. Water arrived eventually but was never refilled. Not impressed. Will not try again.

Daikichi Sushi is the grab & go section of Mitsuwa Market. As far as grab & gos go (gogo haha), it's as good as it gets. 

All of the fish is fresh and the portions are so huge! Not only are the portion sizes big but the pieces themselves are monstrous as well. I had a salmon & avocado roll today that was so thick, I had to take each piece in two bites. My tiny mouth didn't help matters much! 

I bet you're thinking these giant sized maki rolls run at least 10 buckaroos a pop. Eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeh (that's my buzzer noise)! Wrong! Nu uh!!! These colossal servings run $4-$6 for most rolls. 

Insane in the membrane!!! Fresh fish, tasty rolls, massive helpings, good prices...what are you waiting for?!

So delicious and fresh! This is the grab and go section of Mitsuwa Marketplace and you simply choose what you like and pay at the register. There are plenty of options ranging from different rolls, onigiri, bento boxes, and fresh nigiri. We chose 2 different boxes of the assorted nigiri combo and were satisfied. 

The fish was very fresh, good quality, and well prepared. However, we wished there was some wasabi under the salmon and tuna nigiri pieces. The rice was cooked perfectly but could use a bit more seasoning and sushi vinegar.

Nonetheless, the nigiri boxes were well worth it for the price of around $12-13. Next time we're in the Chicago area, well definitely be stopping by for more.

Daikichi Sushi is a shop located in the Mitsuwa Market. It is a few long, refrigerated cases that are filled with already-packaged pieces of sushi and other Japanese lunches. It's a grab and go/express type set up, where you pay at the cash register of the supermarket area of Mistuwa. 

The variety is pretty impressive. Whether you're a fan of fish or not, there's an offering for you. Common items like tuna rolls, California rolls, and salmon rolls are available, either on their own or in bigger combination trays. Then there are offerings with eggs, eel, and even baby octopus. Everything is insanely fresh, which is a huge plus. The rolls are also pretty massive in size. 

I was expecting to pay a lot more than I did. I get sushi fairly often from a place near my house, where I get less variety and way less quality. At this other place I get a pack of nine tiny rolls for about $10. Not here! Six of these giant crab rolls cost only $6.99 here, and they don't look as though they've been sitting out all day. 

I also got a "deluxe" tray, which has $18 various rolls for only 16$ or so. It tastes good, and is well worth the price.

Fresh sushi as far as the eye can see!  Well, at least to the end of the refrigerated case, which is still pretty darn long.

I bought a massive Cali roll for $5.  Offerings at Daikichi are simple like spicy shrimp roll, crab roll, salmon roll.  The roll itself is extra large, but some of the individual pieces are 2 bites each.

To purchase, grab what you want and then pay at the regular grocery checkout.  The security guard stared down my friend and I, like we were going to bury salmon rolls in our pants.  Even if I wanted to, I had leggings on, and those pieces of sushi are so large that there would be bulges in places there shouldn't be.  The security guard reminds me of the lame cop from "Superbad."

The cashier will ration your wasabi, ginger, and soy sauce.

Daikichi is located inside Mitsuwa Marketplace.  I would buy sushi here again, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

I dunno why everyone is so jacked about this place, the sushi was pretty mediocre I thought, can grab and go better sushi at other places IMO. I would come back to hang in the cool food court and slowly decide which restaurant to eat at, I will try again and re asses, maybe I got an off roll. Which is what I call getting out of bed.

For those who thought grocery store sushi couldn't be fresh or fantastic: Behold! 

Granted Daikichi is located within the Midwest's largest Japanese market/superstore, it should still be noted that this stuff is damn fine... and for non-fancy schmancy rolls, the best bargain/bet I've seen - ever. EVER.

This is some SERIOUS sushi. So serious, in fact, that I'm going to be doing a whole heck of a lot of caps locking over the course of this review. 

BEWARE: There's a definite choking hazard with these HUGE, heaping pieces. And not just a buncha rice and filler - I'm taking giant chunks of ultra fresh fish, expertly sliced. Obviously some ninjas are employed here. 

If you go later in the evening/day, your selection is highly limited, but if you are able to make it in mid-day, it's PRIMO as far as options. You can get sushi, sashimi, stuffed rice paper balls, bento boxes that you can re-heat in their microwave ( a little ghetto, but the price is right). 

The prices are crazy. Like, before I was buying the stuff I got kind of worried as to how quality the fish could be considering how many GIANT rolls I was getting and how much fish was packed into the package, but it was sooo good! So good, in fact, that my dude and I ended up fighting over the pieces (even though one package is more than enough food for a full meal for one person) to the point that we decided to go back in and buy another giant package. 

The only annoying thing is that you have to ask for soy sauce when you purchase the sushi, it's not just out for you to take, so your soy sauce intake is limited to however many packets the Mitsuwa cashier will give you (hint: it's never enough) and the little solo cup is too small for the size of the sushi rolls so you can't really dip your as is. Also, there's no fresh wasabi - you get the mustard packet wasabi, but it still tasted fine and if that helps keep the cost down I can be okay with it. 

I go to Mitsuwa fairly frequently but this was my first time purchasing sushi from Daikichi. I think because I usually go after 3pm and at that point there really isn't much left in the long case, but on this particular occasion I had managed to get my ass up before noon and was able to partake in the fishy fruits of Daikichi's loins... which is the grossest statement ever, but I'm going with it. 

Holy Moly Roll-y and Beam me up, Daikichi!

No joke, this is THE best store bought sushi you will get. It rivals fancy restaurants with their $20 specialty rolls. My favorite is the salmon avocado with the biggest most tenderest of juicy fish pieces. Also their rice is the best tasting rice I've had in any sushi roll. 6.49 for 8 giant pieces. Plz plz plz keep that up, faithful customer forever haha.

Would not get sushi here unless you're dying of hunger.  The sushi looked ok, but the rolls were bad.  Selection is very small and simple. The rolls are huge and mainly packed with rice.  Unimpressed to say the least.  Definitely rates somewhere on the bottom of the list of sushi places I've gone to.

I love this McDonald's! Its clean and new and the ambiance is great!
The one guy was cleaning while we were there.
My daughter got  a free kiddie cone after her happy meal and loved it. 
I do love their southwest chicken salad!
I would definitely go back if i was in the area.
I wish the one by our house was this nice!

This was our first time checking out this new McDonald's next the Chick fil a.

When we walked in, you can tell it's a new facility new modern decor. It felt like you would see this in a high end area or like a high end hotel. 
It wasn't busy in mid morning as we ordered breakfast. They told us that they will bring out food to us, wow ok. Then later on they ask how was out meal then gave us a "thank you" after mint. What...what kind of McDonald's is this where are we lol? I felt like I needed to give a tip or something lol!
Our meal came out hot and fresh. We like their breakfast sandwiches, who doesn't love their crispy hash browns too! 
Overall, very good experience will definitely come back to this location.

Very good modern McDonald's! We don't frequently eat at fast food chains but this location makes you feel like home. Great customer service, location, and they even bring the food to your table. Food has always been fresh and hot and restaurant clean. Love all the smiling faces, great job managing this location, hope it only gets better!

I'll start by saying the place is new so everything is fresh inside and out BUT the service I had there was horrible! Through the drive through the employees were very rude and rushed me through. Then I say at the first window waiting because no one said to come to the SECOND window. Then when coming to the second window they forgot my order and almost charged me for the wrong one. After I paid I waited another 10 minutes just to get my food which was cold and soggy by then and when I explained my food was cold the Mexican woman acted like it was my fault. I left very unhappy and dissatisfied!
The "gorditas" of beef, cheese and green peppers are Awesome. highly recommended. Also, try their Nachos but I was blown away by there customer service. Very nice people.

I come here almost once a week for lunch and I love it. The place is clean. The service is friendly. The food is great and very reasonably priced.  The tacos a great and so are the dishes. 

Go for the shrimp tostadas!!

Brought my family here this afternoon after my graduation. Now, I have lived in Chicago for 49 years and tried just about every type of Mexican food in the city. I must say the food here is spot on, good quality, fresh, well prepared, and the service was fast and gracious. I had the skirt steak plate with cactus and grilled jalapenos, this included rice and beans; I have always weighted my experience by the way the rice and beans taste at Mexican restaurants and these were fantastic. The best part of this restaurant was the price; huge amounts of food for a very low price. Others must feel the same way because the restaurant was full at 2:00 on a Saturday afternoon.
My favorite place to eat Mexican food.  The food is inexpensive, authentic, delicious, and comes out quick.
An amazing fast-food Mexican restaurant. It's tiny and crowded, and you'll have to wait. But it's worth it. Amazing flavors. Sadly, I live 150 miles away.

Food here is absolutely delicious and authentic! My family and I ordered the skirt steak dinner, flautas and pozole! We all enjoyed are meals and were super full with leftovers to bring home, their portion size is huge! The horchata and jicama beverages was also good. Spacious restaurant with a lovely staff. Will definitely come back to try different things.

We are very picky when it comes to authentic Mexican food. We went here last week and LOVED it. We have vowed to never go anywhere else in the area.  We went simple - steak taco dinner. Can't beat the prices.

Awesome pozole and menudo. They give you all the fixins too. Tacos are decent and most of the dinners are very good too. But to be honest, I usually just come here for spicy soup to cure hangovers or colds. There's nothing like some nice hot menudo to flush the toxins. I don't know if the pozole is available daily, I only get it when there out of menudo. but the menudo is only available on weekends and sells out well before 4:00. 

The staff is very kind and responsive enough. I think it was another kind of restaurant before they bought the location, because the layout is a little interesting. 

Heads up: Sundays after church are PACKED.

Go to mexican spot in Mount Prospect.  Los Compadres is family owned and it really shows in there food. The food is always hot and fresh and they have amazing fresh lemonade.  

I would recommend the combination platters.  They give you a taste of everything such as a gordita, tamale, and a taco for one low price.  Also, the steak and pablano gordita is out of this world.

Give them a shot if your in the area.  You will not regret it.
Excellent food!  Great place to have lunch or dinner.  I always order their steak tortas.  Ive been eating at Los Compadres for over a year and they are consistently excellent!

Very solid Mexican food and good service. Like many reviewers have stated, the atmosphere is unassuming and, in some places, a bit tired and run down. That said, you can tell they take pride in their food. I had the burrito suizo with chicken and it was excellent. The salsa served was also very good but the chips weren't my favorite - I'm willing to bet they weren't stale but, likely, a bit over cooked as they were harder than I prefer. Not sure if they are always like this as I stopped here from out of town.

First-time diner and it was a success! My fiancé and his co-workers lunch here often and have given rave reviews. 

I am not a huge fan of pork and would typically order chicken tacos at a Mexican restaurant, but my fiancé said I would love the Al Pastor tacos. I'm so glad I tried something new, the pork was so tender and flavorful- I could taste small notes of pineapple. The simple garnish of onion, cilantro, and lime complemented the pork- I had to make sure I had a little bit of everything in each bite and topped it off with a mixture of the green and red house made hot sauce to give it heat.... Perfection! Service was good, waitress was polite and food came out quickly. Price is also very reasonable!! I will definitely be returning when I am in the area!

Very good Mexican food. Guacamole was great! The chips that came with it tasted homemade and they were great as well. I had the steak tacos and those were good although I'll probably try something different next time.

I just had a Chicken Burrito at work.  As a thanksgiving treat my company decided to let us pick something and buy.  

The chicken burrito was OK, I would have liked more flavor on it and a little spice but not to much.  The size of it was huge and very filling.  I am willing to try the steak burrito as my co-workers said it had more flavor so we shall see next time!

My fiance and I came here for lunch. The environment is very casual, I almost thought we ordered at the window instead of bring given menus and being waited on. I ordered the avocado and cheese torta. It was good, random bits of pepper in bites, which was yummy, and you can't go wrong with avocado. My only complaint is that it wasn't very filling since it was just the sandwich. My fiance ordered the steak, cheese and beans gordita dinner. I had a bite and wasn't a fan, but he thought it was good. He completely cleaned off his plate (minus a tomato, but he's slowly liking those now). The beans were perfect texture and had a delightful taste. I'd like to order that as a side next time possibly. Overall, I'd say it's a good, quick place to go when you want authentic Mexican.
Everything was great. The service was fast and friendly. Best Mexican food I've had outside of California. A must if you like authentic Mexican.

My coworkers and I come and have lunch here at least once a week. Great food, service and prices. In terms of interior decoration, it greatly lacks. Regardless, the food makes up for it! Can't go wrong with steak tacos!
The food was good had a Al Pastor taco dinner. Service was great very polite, food didn't take long. Really recommend the horchata.
Solid authentic (I think) Mexican food. No fluff, just tasty food. Everything I try is good. Meats are always juicy and moist and ingredients fresh.

My husband and I ate in here awhile ago, probably 3 months ago. The restaurant is fairly small, possibly was an old pizza hut reused. The waiterstaff is small but efficient. The good is moderately priced, not expensive but not as cheap as a take out only place. The food was good and had large servings. The major fault is that it does not serve alcohol. Which is deceiving since there are images of cocktails on the sign outside. I would recommend giving this place a try for lunch on the weekends.

I absolutely love this place!  They have the best authentic Mexican food in town..and always the nicest staff...their horchata is the best I've ever had...I would recommend this place to anyone wanting really good Mexican food!

Yes I know there are tons of authentic Mexican joints nearby, but dollar for dollar, this is tops. They jam-pack the tacos with perfectly seasoned meats, barely any gristle in the steak, and fast and CHEAP!  Minus 1 star for "eh" horchata.

El mejor sabor y variedad en comida Mexicana!! I have to agree with their slogan that they are the best flavor and variety in Mexican food in town! :)

They have a huge menu at fantastic prices, it's really hard to pick just one thing! Today was my first time going for lunch but I'm sure I'll be back many more times to try more treats. The entire menu is mainly in Spanish  and the good news for my coworkers is I came along & am fluent. Bam! I translated some of the veggies & toppings for them so they'd know exactly what they're getting. 

I had a Lime Jarritos and La Gringa Torta which is appropriate since I'm a white girl and all. La Gringa comes with eggs, ham, two types of cheese, mayo, lettuce, and tomatoes. I absolutely loved this but it's huge! It's $4.99 which is a very good price for the size. After chowing down on the complimentary tortilla chips, I could only muster the strength to finish a half of the torta. I have lunch for tomorrow, woohoo!

When you're done, you pay up at the front. I suggest getting a smoothie to go on your way out for $2.50. My friend got the pina colada today and it was Mmm Mmm Delicioso!

Update 9/15: The Asada taco was the best I've ever had! Oh myyyy~so tasty! The jamon y queso quesadilla is friggin awesome, too!

I'm very picky when it comes to authentic Mexican food and after trying out a few places in the Arlington Heights/Mt. Prospect area, I don't go anywhere else but Los Compadres. It's a solid restaurant that makes a mean burrito suizo. Highly recommend!!!

I am originally from the heart of the city. I'm part Mexican, Puerto Rican, German and Italy so I know the difference between authentic and chain and this place is most definitely authentic! 
The prices are so low and the food is extremely satisfying. I've lived in Arlington heights for 2 years and I finally found my gem!

Finding a Mexican restaurant that serves breakfast wasn't easy but it was well worth the search after visiting Los Compadres Taqueria. 

The menu was written in Spanish for the most part but with a little help from the waitress and my very limited knowledge of a few basic words it was fine. The breakfast menu was small but it had just the right stuff for an authentic Mexican meal. 

The plates (who am I kidding - these were platters) came loaded with food including the traditional rice and beans and everything was freshly prepared, piping hot and loaded with flavor. I had to wave the white flag about half way in, but my husband happily dug in and made a pretty good dent in what was left. 

The atmosphere isn't quite Hole-in-the-Wall, but maybe more just broken in and casual. Either way, a return visit will be on my list of things to do to check out their dinner items.

This place is very good. The service is great and the food is delicious I would recommend there tortas and also there tacos because the are also very good  I also like there drinks I would recommend going here if you are trying to find a good Mexican place to eat at.
This is real Mexican food. Good service and good prices. I was in town to catch a flight at O'Hare and needed a place to get some dinner, the tacos were very good.

Not a fancy place but food is fresh, authentic and good. The guys love their burritos. I like their tongue tacos! The place gets busy fast and you know it's good Mexican food when the place gets packed with Mexicans like me!! 

I would recommend their pozole too!! Almost like moms
Great Mexican food! Good prices & outstanding service. Lot of people told me about this restaurant, now I can pass on my review

Anything less than 4 stars mine boggles me here.  This place is on point with real delicious mexican food at it's best... from the meat flavors to the tortilla used, to the green and red sauce.. 2nd to none.. no fu fu BS fake mexican food like that one "chef" that puts out that overpriced crap in downtown Chicago and charges $25 a plate.  Even went here on Valentine's day for dinner and was not disappointed, my date to say the least wasn't disappointed as well and neither was every filled table in the restaurant that night.

I will say this place can make real waves if it invested a little more on the ambience.  Could ultimately be a bad choice in the end, losing it's character could cause it to lose it's authentic taste in food.

PROs: Helpful staff, Great food, Authentic

CONs: Not much to look at

Didn't really mind how the place looked, only cared for how good their food was. Boy was it delicious! I've ordered the Taco Dinner w/ Asada, Pollo, and Pork w/ Red Sauce. Also with Horchata as my beverage. I told the server that it was me and my girlfriend's first time here and he was very informative with whatever questions we've had with the menu.

I was looking for a local mexican restaurant and came across Los Compadres Taqueria. Had a pleasant experience and will be coming here more often.

I'm always on the lookout for delicioso Mexican eats. And I'm not talking about the fluffy, fancy Mexican eats. I'm talking about a taqueria that serves up perfect street tacos, tamales and, especially, a nicely made mole. Well, Los Compadres Taqueria isn't perfect, but it definitely fills the void! 

It's situated in an old Pizza Hut. I didn't need to research that or anything, you just know it when you see it. Or a Sunday afternoon, this place is packed to the gills! The post church crowd can be found here stuffing a myriad of eats into their hungry bellies. And my oh my is the menu large. Beyond the traditional tacos and enchiladas, there are plenty of options that will likely satiate the masses at very reasonable prices - tostadas, combination platters, sides, burritos, etc. 

I went with the chicken enchiladas de mole- a huge platter piled high with generously stuffed enchiladas, covered in mole sauce, sprinkled with cheese and spooning the plentiful portion of rice and beans. The mole, while tasty, was a bit too rich when topped with the shredded cheese. Next time I would probably go cheeseless on those enchiladas...and I love cheese, so that's saying a lot. The chicken inside the enchilada was super tender and flavorful! I had enough left over for a substantial lunch the next day, too. 

While it's definitely not the best authentic Mexican I've had, Los Compadres Taqueria is a winner in the area.

Always my go too. The food is amazing, every thing I have had has always been cooked to perfection. It might not look like a up scale restaurant, but the food is worthy of upscale dining; and the staff is exceptionally nice!

Aside from the food, the coffee they make is also out of this world. Just the right amount of cinnamon to give it a little pep but not over bearing.

The amount of food you do get for the price you pay is very generous. Also If your up by the register, they do have some sweets to go.

Give it a try, you won't regret it!!
Been here a few times. Great food. Sopes are amazing here. Really cool hole in the wall mexican joint. Used to be a pizza hut back in the day ( not that it matters ) Their nachos are great!

How did I forget about this place?  I used to come here a lot for lunch, when my office was nearby.  Plus there's just a bunch of good food in the area, like the spicy Korean tofu soup joint next door.

So I usually get a Mexican breakfast, actually most times, but the other day I tried some Al Pastor and Tripa Taco.  Both were delicious, but the tripe was the bomb.  Still not better than my favorite taco joint, but it's right up there.  My lunch crew and I decided that we'd come back here more often.

Anyways, the food here is legit, they have friendly service, and the prices are great!  The prices have gone up a bit in the last few years, but it's still a whole lot of food for not a lot of money.  Also, get a Pina Colada smoothie.  I ended up getting one last time when I went up to pay and was really glad I did.  Dayam good!
great tacos, great prices, super nice staff. will be back!

Not bad, but was hoping for better.

Difficulty parking--small crowded lot and big semi. 
Service took order, brought drink, chips& salsa, food, and was never seen again.
As noted by others, got bill & paid at register. Strange.

At to the food, the tacos were fine, but certainly not that filling. A lot of onion and a little cilantro on each didn't help.
The chips & salsa were unremarkable.
The refried beans were a small portion and kind of runny.
The rice was very starchy, clumps stuck together.

I wish that I had the experience others wrote about.

I continue to be a regular at Los Compadres and I have learned a little...

I finally figured out that the reason I get such bizarre service regarding the payment of the bill is that they do not actually want to bring the check to your table.  They expect you to walk up to the counter and tell them your table number.  This is after they have come to your table to take your order and they deliver the food to your table.  In any normal restaurant that operates like this, they would at least bring you the bill, even if they expect you to pay at the counter.
So my colleagues and I finish our meal and then stand in line at the counter.  Since we are bothering to get up, we decided we might as well pay separately.  Each of us in turn states our table number and what food we ordered.  Then we complete several individual transactions.  I understand the process, but I don't like it.  In fact, I must admit that it discourages me from going to Los Compadres for lunch.

It is that irritation that resulted in my updated review and the loss of a star in my opinion.  To be honest, I would like to give a 3.5 rating, because the food is still very good, but service is so important to a restaurant.

I will still be back for my enchiladas de mole, but maybe a little less enthusiastically than in the past.
I love this place...my husband and I have been comin here for about five years and have never been disappointed. .the food is amazing and the people are super friendly..

A nice looking middle size taqueria . The two waitresses were working fast  and got my takeout  quick. The Quesedellas were excellent although seemed a bit small and resembled tacos.  I have been wanting To go to one of this areas taco places for a while and was not disappointed. Not bad.

Best burrito I ever had. My dad took me here for dinner once and I thought he was kidding because the place looks intimidating on the outside. Once I got my burrito though, it was heaven on a plate.  Everything was delicious and not overy greasy. Been craving a burrito lately so I will be back really soon.

I'll be back for more!  The steak tacos were the bomb! When people say the food is authentic, what I think they also mean is that the place is chock full of Spanish speaking families who appreciate the great prices and flavorful cuisine.  Tele-novelas and FIFA games are prominent on the big screens that surround the dining room.

No, it is NOT for the Uncle Julio's Hacienda crowd, who enjoy their Mexican food served with plenty of overpriced Anglo flair.  Los Compadres is a restaurant that serves the predominantly Hispanic community along this stretch of Algonquin Rd. Though I suspect the good cuisine and prices draw customers from Des Plaines, Mt. Prospect, Elk Grove and Arlington areas as well. 

This place really reminds me of Latin restaurants down in Cicero, IL, where my daughter lived. Where I was wholly dependent on her Spanish skills to place my order. Same relaxed and welcoming vibe. Same solid food and prices.  Los Compadres isn't the Maserati of Mexican food, it's more like your daily driver. 

Go when you're hungry for an authentic experience, and want a good meal and a good deal.
Great food great service always happy when we go there never a bad experience A plus in my book

I had the best torta in my entire life at this place today. Their chips and salsa are perfectly spicy and delightful. The employees are very friendly and helpful. The seating isn't the best but the food is so good that it doesn't matter. I had their horchata and it was pretty good but I wouldn't put it up there as the best I've had. I had a really great experience here while eating and watching the World Cup game on the many TVs they had around. I cannot wait to go back and tell my friends all about this hidden gem!

My coworkers and I go here every so often for lunch. The only reason we don't go more often is it's relatively far from the office. This place is so good it's ridiculous. It doesn't matter what you have.. from tacos to tortas, burritos to dinner plates. It's fresh, authentic, and reasonably $priced$.  I normally get a the same thing but today I went to an old standby, a Carne Asada torta. One word - DELICIOUS !!! the bread was so soft and the steak was so well seasoned accompanied by fresh tomatoes, lettuce, cheese, and beans. I added the house red sauce for some additional kick, but it would have been fine by itself. If you are anywhere close to this place and like authentic Mexican food,  do yourself a favor and stop in. You won't be disappointed.

Ive tried this place twice in hopes that it would get better. Both times I ordered the taco lunch to go. I've tried the steak,pastor and beef. All were just ok. If I were invited to go with friends I would go...but most likely I won't be back. It isn't anything special. Id rather just make my own tacos.

This is my favorite place on the planet for Mexican food, bar none. I strongly prefer lowbrow Mexican to highbrow Mexican, and I've tried places all over the Chicago & San Francisco areas. 

Know this... this is a converted Pizza Hut. Most of the clientèle is non-English-speaking.  It smells of bleach when they mop the floors (which is often). There are no margaritas. If any of that contradicts what's important to you in a Mexican dive, then don't go here. If, on the other hand, you like fresh and well prepared asada, challenging hot sauce, chips and salsa with your meal, and the occasional sound of "Gooooooaaaaaallllllll" from the TV in the corner, this is your place. Stop by some night; odds are 1 in 7 or better you'll find me here.
I love this place.... the guacamole is DELICIOUS... I would give it 5 ,stars if they had hard shell tacos... nevertheless everything is pretty tasty...

Stopped in after hearing Steve Dahl rave about the place.  Had the steak tacos and they were very good.  

It's an old pizza hut and the decor hasn't changed much, but worth the trip for the food.

I'm not saying that this is as good as Alinea. Duh! What I am saying, however, is that for a Taqueria this place is fabulous. The tacos - fantastic. Steak, nummy. Chicken, moist. The mole? Surprisingly complex. But the ground beef? Surprisingly tasty! 

I'm from Chicago and have been dying looking for a solid taqueria ... I finally found one. Hoorah!

Update on 3-4-2014
I just knocked off one start ... their carnitas was surprisingly dry. Huh. Either way, still a fantastic place and my go-to tacqueria in the neighborhood.

This is by far the most authentic Mexican restaurant in the area. My friends and I were on the mission to find the best Mexican food in the NW suburbs, so trust me when I say we've eaten a LOT of burritos, tacos, enchiladas...

I had the mole enchiladas, which were the best I've had. You get SO MUCH food for a great price as well. I barely touched my rice and beans, but did make sure to sample them. They don't serve alcohol, but there was a full menu of Jarritos, so that was a bonus.

My toddler got the kids burrito, which came with french fries. OMG, even the fries were delicious!

I'm not sure if this is the BEST Mexican food in the area, but it's a serious contender and hands down the most authentic. Make sure to give it a shot!
Good bang for your buck. Big portion and really friendly staff. Not a good location. It's on a busy corner so it's not that convenient. The parking lot is also small. But the food is really good.

Loved this place. The food was wonderful. The only thing I didn't like was that we didn't get chips and salsa, not that I needed it. But other than that it was a great place. I Loved how authentic it was vs. All the other places around here such as 'la Magdalena' or any other american mexican resturaunts. I'm definitely coming back.

Just tried this place for the first time. The food is amazing especially for the price. 
I dont know what the other people expect that have commented on this place. Yes, the staff isn't the most talkative, but i wouldnt be surprised if they hardly speak english. 
This is a great "hole in the wall" place! I knew it would be good when the floors were a bit sticky! =) Anyone that gives a bad review based on looks of the place - stop being so stuck up or go somewhere else you find "more classy"! 

If you want some really good food that's quick and not costly, definitely try this place out! I know I'll be back there again soon.

You must be weary of the everlasting Cat Juice odor. And you must wear a straw hat upon entry and if you don't tuck your slacks into your jeans, you're gonna have a bad time. And another note,  after eating go to the bathroom cuz it's come threw fast. Over all, great tacos, clean water, great ass. 5/5 would eat again.

I was craving a torta and decided to search Yelp for a Mexican place near my house. I hadn't had much luck with Mexican out here in the burbs, but this place is a real winner.

We started with a couple of lime Jarritos and basket of chips which were fresh and came with a cup of pleasantly hot salsa while we looked over the menu. There were a ton of appetizing choices and one of the walls was covered with photos of most of them. I got a vegetarian torta (avocado, cheese, onion, tomato, refried beans) and a side of rice (yellow rice with vegetables mixed in), and my date ordered a carne asada torta combo, which came with fries.

Everything was out on the table in about six or seven minutes. My rice and sandwich were absolutely delicious, and my date loved hers as well. She made a few modifications to hers and was relieved that everything came out correctly (I say this only because people will ALWAYS mention when something goes wrong). I have trouble finding any fault with this place whatsoever (wait, I found one, they didn't have takeout menus!).

I can't wait to go back.

Yum! All i can say. Little hole in the wall place.nothing special. THe food is what its all about. Waitress could barely understand english, thats how you know the food is gonna be delicious! lol. Authentic. Great staff that are very nice. We are regulars from now on.

Just moved in the area and if course had to find a Mexican restaurant! This is by far one of the best Mexican restaurants I have  been to. The food is extremely authentic. The tacos are amazing as well as the dinner plates. I had the tamales and my boyfriend had the super burrito plate. The prices are great. You get so much delicious food for a reasonable price. The atmosphere is relaxed and the service is excellent. We ate a great meal and were completely stuffed for under $25!! I am definitely impressed and the food is something I will crave! Less than 5 min away from my new place so ill be stopping there frequently!

A bunch of at work go here on a weekly basis.  It forces us to get out of the office at least once a week (pathetic, I know).  The food isn't the best, but is surely is one of the best in the area.  We work in Rolling Meadows were there are probably 5 other Mexican restaurants around us, and we seem to enjoy this one the best.  

I usually just order tacos (hey, I really like tacos), but have paid attention to what others have eaten and the food usually doesn't come out greasy. It isn't over seasoned with salt.  The food is good (not great) and consistent.  I had brought my son here one afternoon (he's another taco fan) and he also enjoyed the food.  

I think the prices are very reasonable.  Just eating three tacos is under six bucks.  Add rice and beans I believe its only a dollar or so more.  

The salsa served with the chips is not as consistent.  It always tastes good, but the spiciness of it varies from bland to damn, what was that.  It is usually somewhere in the middle, but we have noticed it varying.  


See you there on Thursday.  :)

Their steak quesadillas make me violently ill every time I eat them....  yet I can't stop ordering them.  They are the best I have ever had....  They are my forbidden fruit.

(Note:  I have dairy allergies, its not the establishment's fault)

I LOVE this place.  It is right across the street from where I live.  My family typically has take out from here about once a week.  I 9/10 get a steak burrito, my boyfriend gets two steak tacos and an order of rice, I get my 6 year old a steak taco and my 2 year old a small cheese quesadilla and I get an extra order of rice for the girls to share...all this comes out to about $20.  The staff is super friendly, prices are low, HUGE HUGE HUGE menu.  All the meat is very good quality (no gristle in steak)..chorizo however is a little dry in the burrito or on a taco (the Huevos con chorizo is fantastic however).  The nachos are GINORMOUS and are 2-2.5 meals in itself.  Pretty much the only complaints I have are parking low is very tiny and a part of a very busy strip mall.  Also, I've always done take out and if you don't call ahead, the wait is pretty long (like 10 minutes+ long), which is good because you know you're getting fresh food, but still...call ahead.

Still loving this place!!!  However, does anyone know if they have coupons anywhere?  Would love to see a Groupon for this place (not that the price is bad now).

So far, so good.  This is my first time here.  The steak tacos had great flavor.  Didn't have to add salsa or anything to them.  Can't wait to try other things. Big menu with a lot to choose from.  Nice and convenient to work for me, which is a plus!  Really hard to find a place to park though.

I finally quit procrastinating about trying this restaurant out and came here for lunch. They have quite an extensive menu here , more than the standard tacos, burritos , tostadas ,and tortas. I ordered a chicken taco and steak burrito to go. The place was not crowded at all and it took 15 minutes for my order to arrive So I knew the food had to be freshly prepared. The steak in the burrito was extremely fresh, soft, not the least bit dry, lean and deliciously seasoned. It was moist but not greasy, almost melt in your mouth texture. This was the best burrito I have eaten in years. At $5.99 it was a steal considering the quality and size of the burrito. The chicken taco came in a small cardboard dish. It contained large chunks of tender white meat chicken. It was not quite as good as the burrito but still it was  better than average. The red and green salsa both had nice flavor both about a 7 on a scale of 1-10`for heat. There are many Mexican restaurants closer to home but I will drive past them all from now on for this terrific food.
My husband and I order tacos from here on a regular basis.  Steak with cilantro and onions. Simple and delicious.

A friend and I had lunch at Los Compadres a few weeks ago and we both really enjoyed the food. The food seemed authentic to me. The fact that there was a large Mexican clientele seems to validate this too.  I had the Burrito suizo con pollo.  The portions were large and inexpensive. The salsa roja and verde with the chips were both pleasantly spicy and flavorful. 

The service was prompt and friendly. This is not a fancy place, it used to be a Pizza Hut. However, I'll be going back frequently for sure and you should too.
Good food.  Good $$$

Heard about it from Steve Dahl (his favorite tacos in Chicago) and gave it a try.  This is now a regular weekly lunch stop for our office.  Authentic, great prices, very casual (definitely not a Chevy's or Chi-Chi's.)  Steak tacos and steak burrito are fantastic.

Los Compadres has been my go to place for mexican food in the northwest suburbs for close to 20 years.  The food is authentic and the prices are very reasonable.  I especially like their tortas and alambres.

I met a friend for lunch here because of all the rave reviews. The menu is so authentic that we had to ask our waitress to translate the lunch special. But something got lost in translation. We did catch the word, tripe and since neither one of us were brave enough to try that, we skipped the lunch special. I found out later that tripe is a popular Mexican dish.  

We ended up ordering our lunch based on the pictures inside the menu. There was a  Spanish/English translation and photos for most entrees and drinks. The lunch special was the only item missing that combination.

I have not been to a better Mexican restaurant in the Chicago area. The food was delicious and plentiful. Service was good and friendly. 

The only drawback for me is that I prefer fountain drinks. They serve pop/soda/Coke in cans, but the waitress brought me a glass of ice when I asked, so it was like having a fountain drink. 

Many of the families and others eating there would be eating the same thing for lunch if they were back in Mexico. It is a  busy, distinctively truly, honest, ethnic restaurant. It is no Taco Bell, Pepe's or Chevy's. 

It's not fancy. It's fun -- I'd call it a Mexican diner. I will definitely go back again and tell all my friends who like Mexican food -- "Try this place."

This place is the best place for some mexican food. I started coming here when I was a little kid, I love their torta de milanesa (sp?). I get it almost everytime I go there. If your ever in the area go and check out this place it's really  good and you won't be disapointed.

I love Los Compadres.  I have been coming since I was a little kid.  I have never had problems with their horchata, which is definitely home made.  It has cinnamon in it, and if you're not used to it, then I can see where you would think it is made of powder.  Phenomenal flautas, tacos, and burritos.  They are always very sweet.

It was just okay...ordered the flautas and chicken was tasteless, rice was good and beans were okay...Also I ordered a horchata and it was chalky, so they definately use the powdered stuff.  Im so disappointed because Im looking for GOOD AUTHENTIC mexican food in the area.

I have been going to this place for over 2 years now and have yet to be disappointed.  The food is always fresh, service is great.  They have a great selection of different meats to choose from, with the Asada being my favorite.  

Try the chile relleno taco for something different that is pure goodness.  

Also, if you are a heat lover, their salsas don't disappoint!

They have some of the best tacos I have ever ha,.  the al pastor just rocks.  The steak barrito suzia is another good choice if your looking for a bigger lunch.  Then if you like it hot there red pork tamles are quite tasty
I enjoy coming here to pig out. Service is fast, food is good, and the best thing is that the price is just right:-)

Los Compadres is awesome! I was shocked at how good the service was considering it is a take-out type place and it is usually extremely busy. They have a very large menu, so if you like mexican food then you will get a vast array of choices here! The food always comes out quickly; Ii is also always hot and freshly cooked. I recommend their chicken tacos! All they need are tomatoes, onion, and a little cilantro and lime! Me gusta mucho!
Great steak tacos and horchata. The green salsa is good too.

Just moved to Arlington Heights. My boyfriend and I had a taste for mexican food one evening. We turned to Yelp to read good reviews about mexican places around here and Los Compadres came up and i read alot of good review about it  and i always drive past it to and from work and it always seems busy so i figured the food must be pretty good. So since its down the street from our apartment i decided I would call in an order and pick it up. i ordered a torta de asada and my boyfriend got some taco deal that included rice and beans, and we both got 2 large horchata drinks. The lady on the phone said it would take 10 minutes. i got there in 10 minutes and food was already ready. So that was a plus. My torta was was not the best torta I've had. definetly not. And i would know about mexican food because im mexican.The torta had mayo in it which is not what shoukd be in there. It sould;ve had sour cream. It seemed very flat and small oh and yea it came with fries which was super wierd to serve fries at a mexican restaurant. My boyfriend wasnt too impressed with his meal either. He said they werent bad he's had better but he ate them because he was super hungry after work. so basically just settled for it because of hunger which is what i basically did also with my torta. The horchata was ok. nothing special. wasnt bad but wasnt super duper. just mediocre rice water. The price for it was a bit high for my boyfriend and I considering we just got our apartment and are trying to find good food but at a cheap economical price. just dont think we got our money's worth for the food. It cudve been way better.
   All in all, dont think we will be going back there. We've had better mexican food from other places. from now on if we crave mexican food,we will just drive dow the street to taco bell.

I'm torn between 2 and 3 stars.  There isn't a lunch menu so I ordered a la carte. The steak and chorizo tacos with onions and cilantro were good, but the salsa and refried beans were bland.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again. People who said it is authentic clearly haven't had authentic Mexican!

After driving forever to find this place it was not what I expected. The food here is terrible. The chips and salsa were bland. The horchata which is what I regularly order from any Mexican restaurant is just tasteless as well. I ordered cheese quesadillas not greasy cheese and my girlfriend ordered enchiladas that tasted as bad as they looked. To make things worst our waiter never came back to check on us after serving our food.

Never coming back here again.
This continues to be our go to place for authentic Mexican food.  The staff is very nice and the food is great!

We were the only non Spanish speakers in the place. The tacos (it was a taqueria, after all) were very good, the service was great, and the prices were very reasonable. Well worth a visit if you'd like some good, solid Mexican home cooking.

Excellent lunch buffet. Bring out fresh tandoori and nan as requested. Long variety of fresh food and desserts. Highly recommend. Clean great service fresh food. Have no idea what everything was but it was delicious . Good for novice eaters to get a sample of everything .

The absolute worst dinning experience I have ever had!!!! We arrived at the restaurant around 8pm and we stood at the host stand for about 5 mins and no one greeted us. I had to ask to be seated. We sat down and waited about 10 mins and no one came to our table. I got up to request a server and some came and go our apps and left. They were very rude and acted like it was a inconvenience for us to be there. We go our apps and finished them and had to get up and find some one to take our dinner order. They dropped off our food and never once asked how anything was. Than when we got the bill they charged us 18% guarantee. We asked to talk to a manager. The manager came over and we told him about our experience. He acted like he didn't care and didn't do anything. 

DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY HERE!!!!

Food: mediocre - nothing exceptional, especially with the number of Indian restaurants now in the Schaumburg area

Price: expensive - many more less expensive, same (or even better) quality and taste offered at neighboring restaurants 

Customer service: This is where I was the most disappointed. I received a gift card for Bombay chopsticks (its sister restaurant right next door - actually adjoined). When I handed my gift card to my waiter, he told me he cannot use it as it will only be valid at India House (I was a little confused and annoyed, but said okay). The next week I decided to go to India House, and when it came time to pay, they told me the EXACT opposite of what Bombay Chopsticks had told me (that it will only work at Bombay Chopsticks). The manager came by to tell me this, because at this point I was very irritated that they kept giving me conflicting information. There was no apology, nothing to accommodate except a simple "well you have to pay". 

With the poor customer service, expensive prices for the small quantity, and average food, I will not be coming back here.

Food: Great
Price: Over priced
Ambiance: Good
Service: Average

Small portion, high price. The price is a way over for the quality of food as many of people commented on their reviews, I agree!. There are many other good and reasonably priced Indian restaurants in the area. I strongly suggest to go other places.

Great service food was delicious but prices are kinda high. 
Not super clean place needs a lot of touch up paint and cleaning!

I was okay paying the prices listed. Yes it's expensive. But what annoyed me was the extra $6 charge for rice. I've never been to an Asian restaurant where they charged you extra for rice with your entrees. And I agree with other reviewers that the service is terrible. The reason I'm giving this 3 stars is because their portions are large and their lunch buffet is reasonable.

I would never recommend this place to anyone!! The service was horrible and when I asked to see a manager he did not care what I had to say. I have never been to a place where I was treated like this and the servers never came to check on us during our whole time there. The food is definitely not worth the prices they charge also there are many other Indian restaurants with much better service and better food.
Excellent food and service. I think the meal for two could have served 4 - so much food! :)

This is one of the best worst Indian restaurant in entire Chicago, we had very bad experience here. If there is any chance of giving negative rating I would do that.

We went here for dinner on Friday, I have ordered for chicken 65, which is not actual chicken 65 it was saucy and the chicken is so hard it seems not freshly prepared, I love Hyderabad chicken biryani so I order it but it doesn't even taste like biryani, it's wet like sambar rice or I can't name it what they serve. Price was too much doesn't worth it.Guys please stop using name Hyderabad biryani name and stop spoiling our name. And finally mango lassi we ordered 2 of them for Togo, after reaching we noticed one with water and other with mango lassi. Service was very bad and worst ,I have posted photos too.

So guys please think before going to this restaurant.
