This place was very good. The food was hot and delicious. I swear these Yelpers are hard to please because I didn't have a single problem with this place! This was first time ever trying indian and I was very satisfied. You get a lot for the buffet price of like, 15 bucks in all. I definitely recommend this place!

I done lunch buffet .The best naan -i ever have but the rest of the lunch went down hill.
Food are very ,very Americana,Not much flavor.Tandoori chicken is just awful.No flavor. Why all Indian restaurant in the Midwest all suck.? .All Indian restaurant is DC  great..

Poor quality. Insane prices. $17-22 for small bowl of flavorless goop. You have to buy rice for $6 -- it isn't included in the price of your meal. $4-$7 for naan. Took over twenty minutes for the waiter to give us our check after we had finished (we had to flag someone down and ask for it) and about the same to get the card run (we had to flag someone else down for that). Go to any other Indian restaurant on this road and you are bound to be less disappointed than I was!

Loved the decor, definitely the first thing that I had noticed about this pace, and then the smell, very robust and authentic. Our total bill was just shy of $100, but easily could have fed 4 people with a bit to bring home still! We ordered 2 portions of Chicken Tikka Masala, saffron and regular rice, 2 orders of naan and chicken pakora, STUFFED. Really flavorful and well rounded flavors. Spicy but not too spicy and so many things to choose from on the menu. This is somewhere I would come again if I had the chance.
Overpriced place!! They charge 8 bucks for a piece of plain bread!! Absolute waste of money for flavourless food!!

Went here with my wife and parents before they (parents) left to India to have a memorable evening and all everyone can remember is the rude staff and how expensive the mediocre food was.

Common guys $17 for panner burji and all I get is just half a cup of food, with no rice. When I asked them why I was not served rice with an entree they were so rude and said no we don't serve that and we have never served something like that and may be it was my first visit here. If you cannot give your customers a cup of rice I dont know what service they offer.

My dad ordered the veg thali and guess what subji was there in the thali, the paneer burji, SERIOUSLY !!! Also his thali did not come with a naan. When asked they said that our basket of garlic naan contained his naan, but could not find it. May be it disappeared on its way.

One the whole was a very bad experience for everyone and would expect someone from the management to look into these issues.

Will definitely not go back again.

4 stars for great service, taste, location (in my neighborhood), and ambiance.  It didn't get the 5th star because I think it's too pricey.

We had a very polite and attentive server, so happy about that.  This place is decorated in a modern fashion, unlike other Indian restaurant joints that looks and smells like India (sorry, no offense).  I love that they have a very decent ventilation system that prevents the very strong smell of Indian food circulating around and making you smell like curry all day long.  I love eating Indian food, I just don't want to smell like the pot it came out of.  This restaurant is located in a strip mall of Indian grocery and practically everything India House (catering and Bombay Chopsticks) and minutes away from Woodfield mall, minutes away from my house so I love the proximity.  

Let's talk food... I ordered samosa (2), they were as big as my head!   Ok, just kidding, maybe as big as a newborn's head, so I thought that was worth $6!  It was tasty and not greasy.  It came with 3 sauces one of which was a chutney.  Yummm!!!  I also ordered Chicken Tikka Masala and Lamb Biryani.  Both were amazing... MUST HAVE for sure.  

I will most definitely come back, only with a groupon deal again because the entrees were pretty pricey.  An average of $18 per entree, but most specialties and fish entrees were over $30!   Dang.

Enjoy!
I came for dinner not the lunch buffet. I found the food good, fresh and very flavorful. The chicken Tikki Marsala.

Concerning poor service for an iconic Schaumburg based restaurant.  For a half empty restaurant I had to constantly ask for a server. I mentioned this to the store manager, Nicholas Parrara, who insisted on arguing with me about my comment. I politely stated he should not make a seen, especially in front of my guest, but he insisted on wanting to argue with me my concerns.  He stated "My server stated he was giving good service" which concerned me even more on his ability to manage a restaurant.  I think the owners of the brand needs to relook at the inexperience that they are hiring in their restaurant.  I will state the food was good, but the manager did a great job of finishing our evening poorly.  It is a shame as I will need to think twice before taking any guests here to Introduce Indian Cuisine.  Well done, NICHOLAS, as you have earned a whopping 0 star for professionalism and manners.
Separately the food was good and would suggest to only do their TAKE OUT if you want to have a good eating experience.
Decent Indian food. Kadhai paneer n kadhai palak were delicious. Dahi poorie we ordered was not authentic, was served more like papdi chat. Overall servings are good, but food was expensive.

We went here last night and the food was great , atmosphere was good too .. However we had to wait awhile for our check to come. Nobody came with the check . My husband went to the front to pay and advised the Manager we have a Groupon which states we can use that Monday- Sunday , anytime. He simply stated he cannot accept it. Kinda ruined my whole dinner experience. Not planning to go back there .

Went here for a weekend lunch because they had a Groupon... I probably wont be coming back. I walked in and the "please wait to be seated" was a joke, no one even paid attention to us for three minutes until I made my way to an employee. Once we were seated we had no idea what to do, we waited a few more minutes until someone dropped off some chicken on a hot plate and still had no instructions. So we just went to the buffet and started eating.

The food/naan/chicken were all good, but this place seems very amateur. The had plates coming out of what was this metal contraption and they had actually had a rice cooker on the table instead of putting the rice in some metal tray... that was pretty funny.

We went to grab dessert and they had this disgusting ice cream scooper in a pool of orange water... not the best way to serve mango ice cream. Doesn't seem sanitary at all.

Food was 4/5 and service 1/5. It was pretty much a free for all which is pretty stupid for how many employees I saw walking around.

A good, overall Indian restaurant. Had all the favorites and gave you naan pieces with a dip for a starter. Nice seating and good service. Portions are typical, pricing is a little pricier. For instance a typical curry dish was by $12-14. Naan and rice are priced seperarely.

I'm sorry to have to do this, but this buffet has declined significantly.

I hadn't visited for several months, and I stopped by recently.  Their credit card POS system was apparently down, so they asked if I could pay cash.  I couldn't so they wanted to write my credit card number...not gonna happen.  Instead, I just told them I'd come by later in the week and pay, and they accepted that.

Today I visited again, mainly because they had Palak Paneer.  It was awful.  Tasted stale, as though it were leftovers from another day that were reheated for the buffet line.  Naan came overcooked - despite the fact that I'm a regular and specifically request it less done (and have for years).  In general, the food today was not prepared as well as I've come to expect, and I think it's clear that over time, things have declined.

I pointed these things out to the manager, who shrugged it off - did nothing to make it better.  Very uncharacteristic, but perhaps they've just stopped trying at this location.

It's still a pretty good value, but it's no longer the best option in the area.  Consistency is what matters, and they've forgotten that.

4 stars because the food is still delicious, but the prices....ugh. Becoming a special occasion place now $7 for veg appetizers? $17-21 for entrees?

Decor is starting to show some wear (its dark wood so you can see the knicks etc).

This place is overpriced worth nothing!!May be their ambience is good which I never experienced.I had a carry out order today.Food is mediocre charged exorbitantly. I would never go back to this place with the amount of better options I have in schaumburg.

Really good food!!
Please don't compare it to their baby- Bombay chopstick!! This is far far better although cuisines are different...
Love their kaju curry.. Chicken biryani and their naans! 
Worth the money and excellent quantity!
The staff is courteous and clear all your doubts in a matter of seconds :)

I went here for lunch with some co-workers for the lunch buffet. The first thing I noticed was how nicely decorated it was inside. It had the ambiance of a nice sit down restaurant even though it was a buffet. They even had a table in the corner that had its own private space. We came pretty late (past 1 PM) but there were still quite a few people eating lunch. 

I don't really eat Indian food too often, so I don't have much else to compare to, but I thought the food here was really good. Even some of the people in my group who aren't too adventurous when it comes to trying new foods found something they liked. The lunch buffet is an especially good option for those of us who haven't tried too much Indian food and can sample a lot of different things without committing to a single dish. Usually when I go to a buffet, whether Chinese, Japanese, Korean, or Mexican I load up my plate with straight up piles of meat. This particular buffet only had 2-3 meat items, although all of them were pretty tasty. I wasn't expecting to get so full off Indian food, especially with such few meat options, but a lot of the items I had were pretty damn rich. One thing that was missing that I've seen at other buffets was the papad.

Some of the items I tried from the buffet:

Naan - They brought out a few baskets of freshly made naan for the table. I don't know about other people, but I use my naan like a utensil. Everything gets dipped in or picked up with a piece of naan. I went through that stuff insanely fast. The guys working there must've taken notice and kept em coming. Bonus points. 

Tandoori Chicken - In addition to the buffet they brought out a sizzling platter of chicken for the table. It was hot n juicy without much spice.  

Vegetarian Samosas - Deep fried pastry filled with potatoes and peas. Maybe they were sitting out for a while but I thought they could've been crispier.

Paneer Makhani - Chunks of cheese in a thick, creamy tomato based sauce. Dipping the naan in this stuff was pretty money. 

Chicken Makhani - Pieces of chicken in a similar creamy tomato sauce as the paneer. I would've liked bigger pieces of chicken since they were pretty thinly sliced, but the flavor was legit. 

Some sort of Goat dish - well spiced goat in a brown sauce.

Mango ice cream - sweet and refreshing

Gulab jamun - Talk about dense. Super sweet balls of dough sitting in syrup. I felt like I gained a couple pounds after eating this haha


Overall I'd say it was pretty good. None of the items were mind blowing but it's a good option if you're hungry and have the taste for some Indian food.

The best indian restaurant in the chicago the food is really good the recipes are totally as same as you will find in india the food quality is upto the mark i think this is the place where you can give a delicuous taste to your buds and the special thing the buffet is really amazing they are having different menu every day

I was very disappointed at India House. Not really because of the food, but their money grubbing nature. I would advise that people not go here during festival time. About 9 of us went here last diwali and were handed "specially printed to go menus"  and lo and behold, the price of each dish was 3-4 dollars higher than usual. Mind you at 14-15 for a dish is anyway too much for the quality of food served, but this was really disappointing. At a time when you should be celebrating a festival, you're instead trying to make a quick buck. Congrats, you just lost ten customers!

Let me set the stage a little for this review before I get too into it. I'm in the Chicago-ish area for about two months training for a new job rooming with three other people that I'd never met before this trip. As it just so happens, one of my co-workers/temporary housemates is Indian. He visited some other Indian friends in the area and they told him he had to check this place out. So here we are.

The service was prompt and the server was great at making recommendations. I actually didn't order a thing - I just let my co-worker order a bunch of stuff.

To begin with, we were brought a bowl of naan pieces with what I can only describe as an Indian tomato soup. No idea what it was called, but it was super yummy. Then the food arrived. 

The lamb kabobs were really good. While lamb can sometimes be gamey, these were not at all. Perfectly seasoned and not too spicy, they were amazing. The biryani was also really good. Biryani is always my best friend's go-to at any Indian restaurant, but I never order it personally and now I'm wondering why, because it was also super yummy. Finally, we got chicken chili masala, and my mouth was on fire in the best possible way. I think the reason I love Indian spicy is because they're able to still pack so much flavor into the food even though at some point you really can't feel your tongue anymore. I had a second helping even though I knew my mouth would be burning.

All in all, this place was awesome! I'll definitely make it a point to come back here again before I leave the area!

How had I missed this restaurant these many years. I'm loving it. Being an Indian.. I know how the Indian food must taste.. Perfectly blended with culture, awesome food.. Ambience is too good. I loved the pani poori... Added to my frequent destinations for good Indian food.. Cya..

My neighbor introduced me to India House and then I went on my own. They made dishes customized to exclude ingredients I have a food sensitivity to.

When I came on my own with family, the waiter was willing to find out specific details about the food ingredients (such as whether it was cooked in soybean oil). That eliminated almost all the foods on the menu for me. So, I ordered the Saffron Rice. It was the most delicious rice I have tasted. I brought it home to share with my beagle puppy, who also loved it. 

For me, the food and dining experience is worth the extra money.

We had a bad experience at this restaurant.
Reason : poor quality of food, very slow service for food which is overpriced. We will not give our business to this place in future. 
We asked the server why it was taking long and he told us that they were waiting for breads. By the time the food made it to our table, the food was cold. We had to ask to get it re heated.
It was an awful experience. The taste was really bad as well.

Here for an early dinner fish korma and lamb korma with saffron rice yum yum. The food here is absolutely delicious. Beautiful decor. Nice relaxing atmosphere and friendly hosts. This is our favorite stop whenever we're in this area.

Was there last Saturday  evening with the family. Not too crowded.  Started off with Tandoori Pesh-Kush which is supposed to be A mixed platter of their Tandoori specialties. Was served a plater which consisted of a one  half inch sliver of what we guessed to be lamb no kidding ! One medium butterflied shrimp no kidding, two pieces of chicken tikka, one piece of fish tikka n rest of it  pieces of grilled chicken. 

Ordered a chicken soup as I was coming down with a cold and kept correcting the waiter that I ordered chicken soup and not the dhal soup. Was served bland mashed dhal with unseasoned ground chicken in it YUK! Absolutely NO chicken broth, no seasoning no cilantro as the menu indicate. No wonder he kept referring to  it as dhal soup. 

Ordered the Goan Fish Curry with was anything but Goan. Asked what kind of Fish. A couple of waiters seemed stumped by the question. Could be Mahi-Mahi, could be tilapia ! Was the response. How can they not know what's being served ?  

Three curry dishes ordered and not even one serving of simple steamed rice with it. Seriously guys these dishes are like 20-25 dollars each. Can't you afford to pitch in steamed rice ? Especially since our food bill without taxes n tips was around 120 dollars ?? Obviously can't drink the curry so ordered one rice and two naans for 17 dollars NO KIDDING !!!

  Absolutely will not be going back for overly priced below average meals. Terrible service starting with the Manager. Much better Indian restaurants close by within a 1 mile radius.

Best Indian food in chicago! Have had dinner thrice here so far. I was so impressed with the food and restaurant, I actually looked up the owner's and chefs. Very impressive team. First off, instead of the usual papad that is served at most Indian restaurants around, they serve you cut up naan with a tomato chutney/gravy - so good! I'm here usually just for it. Baby corn Manchuria, lemon coriander soup, veg thali, veg biryani are some of their other dishes that deserve a mention. The restaurant is slightly pricier than the avg, but I don't mind paying for the amazing presentation, ambience and super friendly staff. If you're in the area, do yourself a favor and go! You can always go to the gym tomorrow. ;)

Daaaaaaaaaaaang India House, calm yourself.  This place has really great food but it is so EXPENSIVE (especially for the small portion size) and it's way too fancy for my taste.  I mean, if you are going on a date and you want to impress your man or lady friend with high society Indian food and ambiance, this is your place.  It really is beautiful.  However, if you want a nice, relaxed, jeans and t-shirt appropriate dinner with whoever, I'd skip it. 

For those of you who like it in list form:

1. FANCY
2. EXPENSIVE
3. SMALL PORTIONS

but 

4. DELICIOUS.  ALL OF IT.

The menu is massive, and I've yet to be disappointed whenever I've gone. The food is full of flavor, from the vindaloo to the paneer to the hyderabadi to the byriani to the old standard chicken Tikka masala. One of the best Indian restaurants in the Midwest, and it far exceeds the expectations set from its unassuming name.

Always messes up take out orders, order veggie dish got chicken.. Their Rice Items -- such as biryanis are horrible semi cooked dry rice . This is second experience with India house in past two months .. I would not recommend any carryout here .. unless you want to be disappointed..  

manager just shrugs off with a sorry...and no feedback option for review at the restaurant ..when asked.

looks like management will need to look into their feedback options if they need facts and do better service.
First their is No relation for the price and the taste of the food served. Taste of the food was below average and not many options available in buffet.

I feel like I'm on an eternal quest for the best Indian food outside Canada, England, and India herself.  India House's lunch buffet seems to be legendary, so I jumped at the chance to lunch with my coworkers so that I could see what all the fuss was about.

It's definitely pricier than most other Indian buffets that I've tried out, although $13 for lunch in Schaumburg isn't a deal breaker by any stretch of the imagination.  The spread is ample; there are a variety of dishes to suit most people's tastes from the vegetarians to the meat lovers.  There's even a separate area for desserts.  For sheer quantity alone, India House gets points.

Let's dig in, shall we?  Their samosas overall were just ok.  They were flavorful enough, standard samosas but nothing that's angelic choir inducing.  Actually, that's pretty much how I felt about all the dishes that I sampled.  Non offensive dishes that didn't really challenge my palette but that were tasty enough to make me go back for a second round.  The spice level was lacking, which was a definite minus for me.  When I think of Indian food, I think of a flavorful party of various pleasing spices and textures culminating on my tongue & making even my fingertips smile.  I think at best, it was just ok.  What I did appreciate was the sticky gulab jamun (sans paneer, thank goodness) that reminded me of my childhood and of my grandmother.  I would come back for that alone.

With a plethora of Indian buffets around this area, I can't help but want more from India House.  I'll probably return for the gulab jamun if nothing else, but I'll take my spicy expectations elsewhere.
Best Indian food in the area by far with a huge menu and nice atmosphere. Little pricey but well worth it!

HORRIBLE customer service. A few years back this was my favorite place food wise but their staff including the manager was the rudest I have ever dealt with. Haven't been back in 3+ years. Way better Indian establishments then this joke. Doesn't even deserve one star IMO. Stay away.

The food was very very very good. We dined on our Lord's birthday (Christmas). The service was horrible. This may have been due to the aforementioned holiday, but we a) Did not have an actual waiter, the host came over to our table after we asked and between seating and taking patrons' names for the wait list and b) half of our to go items did not make it into our to go bag. C'mon

Also, we had a party of five (nice 90s sitcom reference) and we were charged for asking for extra rice when the initial batch was not enough - $12. We were also charged for extra naan since there was not enough for five people - $6. We were not told there would be charges for either of these until we reviewed the bill. Will not be returning, ever.
Worst food in Chicago. Please don't waste your hard earned money here. There are many better places to have Indian food.

Buffet is not the best in the area. For buffet, you can definitely go elsewhere for a much tastier and a better variety of food. The buffet food is very bland here and the dishes offered are lesser.

On their regular menu, gravies taste nice but chicken is dry and you know right away that they use frozen chicken and cook without thawing it properly. I gave it two stars only because the ambience is better as compared to other indian restaurants. But the food and service are below par. This restaurant costs more than other indian restaurants in the area.

Got another Groupon so decided to give it a try. Ordered Butter chicken, palak paneer and 4 naans. Came to $53 after tax. Luckily my Groupon cut $19 from the bill.
Way too expensive for mediocre food. The quantity was good but the quality was much below average. I recommend Cool Mirchi if you want good authentic Indian food for much less. I noticed that the place was mainly filled with non-Indians so maybe the management changes the taste to match this. In any case, I did not like it and this is the last time we will be going there.

Service is horrible. After waiting 30 min to be seated for the buffet, we never even got a waitress, the plates piled up, the water cups went dry and the manager came over to give us our bill with still no waitress. Needless to say they then added an 18% service charge on our bill for tip, which is illegal in Illinois for parties under 6 (5 of us).

This place gets five stars on Saturday and Sunday until 3 but after that it's about a three star. 

The place is decorated beautifully, it's a nice place to take friends or co workers, but the food is just a little bit better than average. 

The brunch buffet is really good though. They bring fresh naan and tandoori chicken to your table and everything else is at the buffet station.

My absolute favorite thing is their papdri chaat. Every time I've ordered it off the menu it was a soggy mess, which is why I like the buffet option. I get to pick the sauces and ingredients. 

I end up going about once a month and love their desserts. They usually have mango ice cream and gulab jamuns. Overall if you want to give their food a try, brunch is the way to go. You get a little bit of everything and it's decently priced.

I love Indian food! Now, that being said, after eating at several Indian restaurants over the years, there is no doubt at least in my mind, that this one is THE Best. Everything I have ever eaten here comes down to three things, flavor, flavor and flavor. Every spice used is so smartly blended that it comes alive in your mouth to denote its freshness and extraordinary composition. I really can't say enough good things about the food and service of this establishment. Every time, and there have been at least 6 or 7 times, I come away with a great appreciation for what they cook here. In fact, I immediately can't wait to go back. And their buffet with its inexpensive price cannot be believed. I strongly recommend this place to anyone familiar with or new to Indian cuisine.

Bad staff and serving people... Girls working at the entrance don't know anything about reservation or booking. Without checking they will right away say that there is no reservation.
The guy serving chat at the counter is VERY RUDE... if you ask him anything extra in your chat, he will start asking you that what you know about chat. And it was not just one experience but he did that to at least 4 people in our group and even others standing next to us. 
Food was ok... And expensive... So all in all not a good experience

Went here the night after we went to Bombay Chopsticks next door. These guys have been in the Chicago area for over 20 years. 

Their tandoori lamb chops are a bit pricey but are so worth it. The way they cook it in the clay oven is unbelievable - comes out so moist. We usually get the chicken reshmi kabob which also is made in the clay oven. 

Did I mention their butter chicken is the best in the city? I mean, it's hard to mess up, but you really can't do better. 

I think if you know Indian food, this is the place to go. Its not the cheapest Indian, but they do provide good value w their buffet and they bring you naan and makhani sauce to start during dinner. The ambiance is also worth it - you don't feel like you're in an Indian restaurant

Will definitely go back!

They do catering, own banquet space in addition to the restaurant!

Visiting Chicago -- coming from Bay Area and thought of trying this restaurant as wanted to have some delicious Indian food. But alas, it was not meant to be...
Ambience - good
Service - good
Drinks - diluted when asked for On the Rocks and when pointed this out to the steward, she mentioned that it got diluted while it was on the way from the bar to our table. Really .....how i am supposed to believe that, not sure...
Soup - they graciously accepted to take order for the soup (lemon coriander soup) from their other restaurant Bombay Chopsticks which is next door. Really appreciate them for doing this. But Soup was pathetic. It was a lemon syrup with green onions, broccoli, white onions, and few leaves of coriander..Who puts broccoli in that soup. I know broccoli is good for health but it cannot be used anywhere and everywhere in all the dishes...I will give 0.5 out of 5 for that soup.
Chicken Hyderabadi Biryani - No doubt,chicken pieces were in abundant, however it was more of a colored pulao with all khade garam masale. The grains of the rice were not separate as it is supposed to be in biryani. I have eaten lot of biryani before in India as well as in bay area and its much much better than what i had last night. The taste was good if I call it a pulao but definitely not a biryani from any angle.
Raita - This was the only thing which i liked the most out of all...Tastes good and refreshing
Malai Kofta - ahhhh i had better days :). This was bland, no flavors at all. The koftas were so hard that if i wouldnt have been focused enough and haven't used fork and a knife to cut it, it would have definitely slipped out of my hand to some one else's table. I am reminded of Pretty Women movie scene when Julia Roberts was in the restaurant and the speciality dish slipped out of her plate to some one's hand. It was funny.
Breads - They were OK.
In the end, I am really disappointed and I wouldn't come here again !

My favorite Indian restaurant in the burbs still. They service is impeccable the restaurant is modern and fancy and most importantly the food is good. It is a little on the expensive side. I actually prefer their dinner than their lunch buffet but nonetheless still good. This is the only Indian restaurant that I've been to where they hand you your plate with their hands on clean napkins so their hand never touches your plate.

Buffet was decent...had mostly Veg options (about 5-6) and 2 chicken options (Chicken Makhani & Chicken Curry) and a fish curry. The only decent dish was the chicken makhani and the Gobi veg dish. The tandoori they bring to your table was decent and so was the naan. I used a groupon tht made it worthwhile.
Being a brit I have eaten a mountain of Indian food and I must say this place is one of the best I've found in the USA to date

Went here for the lunch buffet. Excellent. So good that I was clenching by the time I got back to the office. After unleashing a biblical colonic fury upon the unsuspecting bathroom. Somewhere above me a dark voice yells, "Finish Him!" While screaming the song of its people; my bowels did a triple spin kick, ejecting my inner organs to their watery grave. I then saw a naked Apache, he took me through the desert. Offered me some Tums then melted into the garbage can in rainbow colors.  Leaving the bathroom with a limp and questions about reality, is a sign of a job well done... I will be back for the excellent food!

M'lady and I -- and our tiny lady, who is just a wee bit under two years young -- celebrated successfully surviving the Schaumburg IKEA by making our way to India House. It'd been way too long since we'd had an Indian feast. And a Saturday afternoon buffet? Oh man, Indian buffets are what gave me the confidence to go vegetarian back when I knee-high to a tandoor. So we were pumped.

The staff was super attentive. The food was hot, the naan was hot and delivered to the table. The place was clean. M'lady commented, "They went a little heavy with the boudoir vibe." Lush purple draperies. SEXY CHANDELIERS. Indeed, I felt a little turned-on, but I think it was from the realization I could keep going back for more chana masala and dal makhani.

Pricier than some other buffets, but also tastier. And the vibes were good: A family sitting behind us -- and their five year old daughter -- intermittently entertained m'little lady, who was laughing constantly from the dancing and peekaboo that was going on behind me. Another positive!

Overall a very good experience here. The food and the ambience were great. To start with I had ordered a couple of appetizers. Samosas were pretty decent compares to the ones that you get in india. Had ordered vegetable korma and malai kofta. Both of them had perfect spice level as I wanted. Would love to visit agin

Came to India House for an engagement party - and this was definitely one of my favorite reception-venues to date. 

The hall was decorated beautifully by the India House staff, the food was kept hot and fresh, and (apparently) the price point was excellent. 

I am not an Indian food expert, so half of these descriptions are probably wrong, but I enjoyed everything immensely. Appetizers consisted of delicious fried veggies patties with sweet brown sauce, spicy chicken, and a delicious cheese that paired wonderfully with a cool green sauce. There was a delicious curried cauliflower, spinach and cheese, and chicken tikka masala that I piled high on an excellent grilled naan. Dessert was fantastic as well. There was an ice cream that tasted like a vanilla sherbet, and an angel food cake dumpling floating in a cool, creamy sauce. I had a bite of everything. 

They have a great alcohol policy - basically, you can bring your own and pay for the bartender's service - but our bartender was frankly rather awful. She definitely didn't know the first thing about bartending, and had to use her glasses to figure out which buttons on the beverage gun to push. Drinks were SUPER strong, and many of the guests (including myself) had to tell her to slow down on the pouring.Also, the dance floor in the room was probably ready to be replaced. Some of the tiles were not secure, and I stumbled a couple of times (though that might have been due to the crazy strong drinks...).

Those things aside, the outstanding food and the great atmosphere made for a great party. Two thumbs up.

Amazing!!  India House has the most delicious Pallak Paneer.  My husband and I drive from Huntley just for it!  We call every Saturday in hopes it is served on their buffet. They have other wonderful entrees on the buffet. The mango lassi is heavenly!!

The service is wonderful.  The entire staff is dressed very elegantly. The atmosphere is perfect. Excellent decor. 

For those who are worried about spice....the food is not "that" spicy. It is editable. 

Highly recommend. You will not find a better place!!

Dined at this place with my wife on June 16th. Chicken 65 was bad; it had gravy which is not how it is made (at home or any other restaurant). Kadai paneer was good (hence 2 stars!). Gulab Jamoon was bad. Overall not a good experience at all for the price!

Hubby and I took the two little ones here for Brunch a couple months ago. It was packed, a line out the door, but we were able to score a table pretty darn quick. 

The food was amazing. Really, really good. My kids were happy.They love Indian buffet. However, they had a LOT of trouble keeping the buffet loaded. Every time we walked up to it, we would return to our table with either nothing on our plate or a very sad dollop of Butter Chicken and rice.  I figure, we probably walked off our brunch by walking to the buffet so many times.

Will we go back, of course. It is the closest edible Indian buffet. And every once in a while you just HAVE to have Indian.

I was super impressed with the decor and what impressed me even more were how many Indian patrons we saw dining at India House. I was like - this place has to be legit if we are the only non-Indians in the place. However, after sampling many dishes, we weren't too impressed with the food.  The dishes were hit or miss.  Here are our findings:

Would Order Again:

Before our appetizers and mains came, we were given some roti and a tikka sauce to dip in. Both were very tasty.

CASHEW NUT/ ALMOND ROLLS - We liked these. Imagine a hush puppy infused with Indian spices and hints of cashew/almond.

VEGETARIAN SPECIAL THALI - this was served on a tray with a selection of various dishes. My friend was super happy with her meal. She was served chana masala and jaipuri aloo. Both were very tasty. 


Would Not Order Again:

LAMB BOTI KABAB MASALA - The spicy red masala sauce was very tasty. Spot On, actually. However, the mutton was a bit too tough for my liking. I thought I was eating chunks of lamb gyro.  I will say this - there was a lot of meat.

DAL KA SHORBA (a.k.a. lentil soup) - watery and in need of more salt

ALOO GOBI - Usually aloo gobi - (well at least my friend's aloo gobi) has a bit more of a sauce element. This dish, however, did not. I honestly wasn't blown away by the flavors either. Very underwhelming dish indeed.

VEGETABLE SAMOSAS - I've eaten a billion of these and I was so surprised to not like them. the filling tasted like pepper. that's all I could taste. CAn I have some potatoes with my pepper please?


I realize im not Indian, but after sampling Indian cuisine for over a year at someone's house, you kind of know what's good and what isn't. 

Consensus: Expensive (but what Indian Restaurant isn't expensive these days?) We would come back but would stay away from the above foods in the "Would not Order Again" list.

Good Indian restaurant.  The buffet (why go for anything else) is good, the desserts are really good (fruit, mango ice cream and gulab jamin).

Naan comes out fresh (but they should give us more than 4 pieces (2 cut up pieces) as we always have to ask for more right away)

The chicken tikka is good too.  

Nice atmosphere.  There are always a lot of desis here so then you know it is decent.  Its the best around this area.

Bathrooms are okay.  I don't have too much to complain about there so for Indian restaurant, they are above standard ;-)

If you don't get the buffet here, it's pricey and slow.  Nearly $30 for two pieces of poori (bread) and mattar paneer.  Over 30 mins for Togo and they weren't even busy.  I'll give it 3 stars if the wife says it actually tastes good.

Restaurant review
AYCE Indian buffet has one less competitor with the closing of Himalaya restaurant in Bloomingdale. After finding out that restaurant was closed we desperately searched yelp for another indian buffet. Unfortunately the schaumburg location now has been changed to a banquet hall only so we ended up journey to this location. The entrance is easy to be missed as it is located in the strip mall of Tiger Direct. The ambiance is definitely classier than other Indian restaurants around this area. The food itself was good but a bit more traditional and spicer than any other indian buffets I have been to. The chicken tikka type dish was good but made with chunks of white meat instead of dark meat which was a bit disappointing. There was also a table on the side that made some sort of mixed dish and some pastry with liquid in it. I forgot the price of the buffet but it was 12+ 

Pro: spicy Indian buffet, lots of selection however the only protein dish was the chicken curry and tandori chicken which they can bring more after you finish

Cons: a little bit more expensive than other AYCE indian buffet

Hidden gem: Reserve your table with opentable to earn points

The selection at the buffet was great! The service wasn't the best, which is why this is only getting 3 stars. 

In addition to the food at the buffet, we were served tandoori chicken and naan at the table. Samosas were good.  I love the paneer makhani & aloo mutter. Some dishes were a little too spicy for me, which I was surprised about because I thought I had a decent handle on spicy foods. 

When we got our bill, we were charged for 11 people and there were only 9 of us. Two people left early but gave us the cash to pay for their meals, but including those two we only had 9 people.  The servers started talking in their own language and looked as if they didn't believe us. After a while, they finally went and fixed the bill. I was surprised that 18% gratuity was added since it was a buffet.  On our way out, instead of saying the usual, "Thank you. Have a nice day." we got dirty looks as if we lied about how many people we had dining with us.

Not coming back here, even though the food is good. I can go elsewhere for good food and good service.

This is a toughie, so I'm going with the good ole fashioned pros and cons list. 

- Pricey. We weren't there for the rumored epic buffet, so we were left with the expansive and a tad expensive regular menu. 
+ That heftily priced menu affords them some pretty swank digs, making for the seemingly perfect setting for a date... less the obligatory lone Indian diner who knows not of 'indoor voices' and yammers on his bluetooth headpiece the entire meal until you simply can't take it anymore and ask to move. Seriously, why is this a thing? Every time I go out for Indian food, there's always 'that guy' on the f*cking bluetooth headset.

- Service. I know there are good servers here because I saw other tables that had them, but our server was kind of a jerk. Like, a total jerk. There's about 10,000 items on the menu and we were curious about some of the items we were less familiar, but instead of answering our question, he chose to chuckle like a pompous d*ck and act like it was our first day on Earth when replying. Not.A.Fan. I also didn't like that when a glass on an empty table that was being set broke, our server stood back and actually laughed, like, an evil laugh. The kind a villain from a Disney flick would laugh, while all the other servers rushed to help. He did walk over there to point out a spot that was missed while the others cleaned, but then walked back to his wall to look on and smirk. It was creepy and if I weighted my review rating more on his service the stars would be closer to 2s than 4s. 
+ Other servers were the ones who brought our food and they were friendly, so that saved the service factor a bit. 

- The portions are rather small, especially when you go back to reference the price aspect and also, just to put it out there, I think it's totally lame and bogus when Indian restaurants don't just include the naan or rice with your entree. You pretty much need that sh*t to make the meal complete and I hate how that all adds up when it really should be part of the entree to begin with. Add an extra $1.00/$1.50 to the meal and give the people some freaking carbs. 
* The food was, in a word, outstanding. The only thing I wasn't totally in love with was the chili pakora as the batter wasn't the most appetizing, but the rest practically blew me away. I was honestly ready to feel a little sour about the food before I'd even started just because the jerky waiter, dummy y on the bluetooth and the child from the table next to us whose parents allowed it to walk around the restaurant, grabbing silverware off other tables to bang against the porcelain-ware had already pissed me off to the point I thought they were about to send me into early menopause. #RageFace BUT, the food redeemed almost every negative aspect of our dining experience and has inspired me to look past all of out differences and one day return for the supposed legendary buffet.

Food was delicious I tried a little of everything from the curry chicken,the lamb,the pita bread and sauce, the salad was delicious could of used more lettuce but it was still good.the tea was great nice and thick with a milky flavor. I've never went to a restaurant where the alcoholic drinks had to much alcohol in it but for 11.25 I guess it should and this one did. Loved it now one thing I didn't like was the ice cream not my favorite but other than that everything was fine

I particularly enjoyed my experience here. The menu, despite being large, is still easy to read through because it is written in sections (chicken, lamb, vegetarian, etc.) and therefore quite organized. Though our waiter had some trouble understanding our order, and a waitress kept refilling my water after one sip, the restaurant has a comfortable atmosphere and it more than makes up for the awkward service--after all, the people are friendly, and get the food on the table.

We went there for buffet. It has a nice ambience , was bit crowded. The host/servers were very courteous.

Food:
The buffet was very nice. The small samosas were nice . "Dal ka Shorba" was  bland and i guess it was added to menu just to add a dish to the menu. 
The chicken curry was nice . I also enjoyed the sizzling tandoori chicken .The best part of the tandoori chicken was that it was not bland (Most of the indian restaurants in US have bland tandoori chicken.).

They also had a CHAAT counter. It was quite amazing. The only disadvantage was that you had to wait in the chaat line for your turn.

Good buffet in $12.50.

DON'T GO IF YOU LOVE YOUR STOMACH AND MONEY. Awful service, dirty floors and tables, highest prices ever seen, thought food would be good but that was the rock bottom. Never ever coming back. I have wasted 5 more minutes of my life writing about then. I would give our server a paas add she was kind and under training. Good bye

Ask any Indian and they'll tell you this is the best Indian restaurant in the Chicago area. And their sister restaurant, Bombay Chopsticks, is the beat the indo-chinese yumminess too! We've tried a lot of different items on both menus and haven't been disappointed with any so far. Ambience of the restaurant is also nice - elegant, good for date night or family get togethers.
The lunch buffet is fantastic, especially the sizzling hot chicken they bring to your table so leave room for that.

Food quality is pretty good.

However ,taste is just okay, as it is not typical Delhi style and lacks the flavor and aroma.

Ambiance is nice and not like other India restaurants in suburbs. Variety of food is less as compared to competitors. 

Courteous service and helpful staff. May visit after an year or so but not in near future.
Food was good but the salad came with an extra ingredient: 2 black hairs. People in the kitchen should use a hair net.
everything here is amazing. we always go for the buffet and I have never had a bad experience. one of my favorite restaurants.

Awesome food classy atmosphere and the decor is modern and elegant.  Service was attentive and accommodating, we went on a Sunday and it was busy my only ONLY gripe is that the tables are cramped and it's hard to get to and from the buffet.  Otherwise a pleasure to dine here

Overpriced crap!!! $7 appetizers??? Naan was $5.  Most entrees were 17-21 dollars. The Jaipuri alu was swimming....and I am using that word lightly.....in oil. We ended up paying $200 for 6 adults and 3 kids minus the $80 groupon. When I was told my original bill was $278, I had a mini heart attack!
Weekday lunch buffet. Food was pretty good. Liked their fried fish and chicken tikka masala.
Great Indian food in the suburbs! I love their paneer makhani and garlic naan.
It's not worth it according they charge for food it's very costly and test it so so not that good

They say this is one of the best Indian restaurants in Chicago and I wouldn't doubt it. The place was full on Friday night.

The mango lassi was a sweet creamy start to the evening. 

I wanted to try everything but settled on the India House special, a platter of tandoori chicken and fish, a lamb stew, and lentils. The chicken was ok, but I'm not sure about the fish. It smelled when it came to the table and had a strong taste and it wasn't from the seasoning.  The lamb stew was tasty from the spice mixture. 

I also ordered a Hyderabad style eggplant curry.  The sauce is a medium to hot kind of spicy that lingers on the palette after you've swallowed that bite. Very good but I've never eaten eggplant where the stems and the tops aren't removed. 

Service was very good and they came by to switch plates a few times.

Went to India House after a loong time for a nice family dinner. Unfortunately, I've almost stopped going to Indian restaurants since most of them cannot seem to keep their food quality/taste consistent....this one is better in some regards and not so much in others:

Pros:
- Nice ambiance

- Food quality/taste is good but nothing exceptional (Paneer Tikka Masala was nice though)

Cons:
- Food quantity is less for what they charge for the entree

- Servers needs to be trained better in customer service (we told the server the food did not meet our standards and he just gave us a blank stare probably thinking "i don't care")


We were there on a Sat nite around 8 pm and the restaurant was just half full - quite surprising since I'd expect such sit in restaurants to have a full crowd at a peak nite like Sat. Anyways, overall a very OK experience.
Great food options in buffet but lassi is charged separately.  Great ambience also. Bombay chopsticks also adjoining. Ample car parking.

Love this place. We used to go to the one in Oakbrook Terrace, but it's been closed. So now we have to drive all the way up to Golf  Rd. (We tried other Indian places nearer our  house after the Oakbrook location closed, but they were disappointing.)

It's definitely my favorite Indian restaurant. They use good quality meat, the sauces are very flavorful, and the portions are large. I used to eat at the lunch buffet in Oakbrook sometimes, and it was never a let-down. Always looked forward to the butter chicken. And yeah, you can tell that the peas come from a can, but honestly that doesn't concern me. If you're one of those "I'm not happy unless this cauliflower was picked fresh this morning" people, you'll probably find something to complain about. But I think it tastes great and it's reasonably priced.

We've only been to the Golf Rd. location for dinner, so I have no info about the lunch buffet there. I took off a star because if I'm being honest the service is sometimes a little lacking. However, I know that going in, and I'm there for the food, not to be fawned over by the staff. 

By the way, the interior of the restaurant is nice. It definitely doesn't look like a hole-in-the-wall dive in a strip mall. It's very pretty.

Oh My God!  Talk about trying desperately to turn street food into fine dining! Who are we?  King George?  The food is the same stuff they serve from street carts in Delhi. So why are they charging me 16 dollars for a bowl or chick peas & spinach?  Because of some chandeliers and fancy wall treatment?  The service staff is dressed to the hilt, the place looks like fine dining, but the get your order wrong, then three of the wait staff is standing & watching you but no one comes when you need to tell them they got the order wrong.  Just not worth it.

I enjoy there nan and chicken makhani.It is both flavor full and fulfilling. But beware of the Chicken Biriani it is like chicken gravy and rice. This is a good restaurant but VERY EXPENSIVE. Rateing :

Terrible, FAIL. My review reflects my experience from two trips to this restaurant. Once during non-peak hours, the other during peak hours. Both times we walked into the restaurant waiting to be seated. The host looked at us and promptly turned around and walked away to cater to "other" customers without a nod or word of acknowledgement. Then he came back after 5 mins and told us the waiting time was going to be 10mins. We kept waiting (standing) and finally the seats were empty. Despite that he walked by us several times and ignored our presence. We walked out. He saw us leave and couldn't be bothered less. This type of treatment took place twice in a row. We haven't tried their food and don't want to. We would rather take our business elsewhere than give to these pretentious people and will be sure to give a miss to their next door Indo-Chinese restaurant too.

Omg, so good. The BF and I had to go to TigerDirect to get a power supply for his compy and made a slight detour to Ikea before, so when we got to TigerDirect, we were hungry. There were a few options, so when he was checking out power supplies, I half listened and half browsed the reviews on Yelp. He was leaning more towards Chinese, I wanted Indian...and we went with Indian :-) to be fair, he was totally for Indian also, just never thinks of going. 

We drop off the power supply in the car, and walk to the restaurant. I was slightly intimidated by the awesome decor, since we were just in normal clothes aka our rush concert shirts lol. But everyone was super nice when we walked in. We immediately saw the buffet and were seated in the adjacent room. Our waiter (possibly part owner?) walked over and told us if we're doing the buffet we can start immediately. He showed us the appetizer area and recommended we start there. We walked over and had no idea what to do lol, luckily the lovely lady behind the table explained the appetizers and created two of them for us. I believe I had the Onion Bhaji (had to look at the menu) and Andy (the BF does have a name) had a super thin pastry bowl with chickpeas inside that gets dipped in flavored water. Both were really delicious. We liked mine a little more. When we got back to the table, surprise! Tandoori Chicken had appeared with Naan! That was also amazingly delicious. 

Buffet time! After finishing up the appetizers and a piece of chicken each, we went over to the buffet. They had a lot of different dishes, I wish I remembered the names of them all. The samosas were really good, and the Chicken Tikka Masala was fantastic with the Naan. They also had lamb meatballs which were yums. I think I tried almost everything on the buffet table. I had a small cup of the soup, which was light and helped make room for all the other food. There was a slightly spicy dish with potatoes that was really good, and another with chunks of cheese that was great. Basically everything I tried was delicious. The BF agreed, it was all yums. We got back to the table, and surprise! There was another plate of Tandoori Chicken... So much food. We ended up eating almost two plates of Tandoori Chicken, almost two plates of Naan, two appetizers, a full plate from the buffet each, and some dessert. It was an awesome amount of food.

Our waiter (owner?) was awesome at refilling our glasses and I think thought we were amusing, since we were young white kids and dove right in to all the different foods. He was super nice and kept on trying to get me to eat more, lol, it worked. We ended up not eating dinner, just having a snack of cheese and crackers at like 11 that night. Our fantastic waiter also told us to next time come at 12 and eat until they close the buffet at 3...we can't wait to go back and bring friends for this 3 hour culinary adventure.

We were there on Christmas night.  The food was good, but expensive. The service was horrible.  I just checked the receipt and realized we were charged for naan that was brought to our table without us ordering.  Also, we ordered 5 entrees, and asked for rice.  We were charged $12.00 for 2 small bowls of rice.  Check your receipt before leaving!!!  We will not be returning.

Made reservations for 7.30 PM for Saturday night for hubby and I. The first time I called, someone hung up on me after asking me to hold on. That should have tipped me off.....But with foolish optimism we arrived there anyway.
Parking lot was full. Arrived inside the restaurant at 7.35 PM to find about 15 people crowding around the lobby. The Manager was overwhelmed and disappeared inside for about 5 minutes. When he returned he said that he had already given my table away. We were seated about 7.50 PM. Some people left after waiting for 15 minutes as they were upset at not being even put on the list. After being seated we noticed that the restaurant was packed but there were two servers and a couple of busboys who could not keep up with cleaning the tables, etc., let alone serving food The floor was dirty! 
Fifteen minutes later someone brought us water. We tried to flag down a server but she said she was busy and would return soon. Needless to say she never came back to us. Then the Manager took our appetizer order. Another 5 minutes passed and someone brought us a naan and dip compliments of the house. This was tasty. 
The appetizers were inedible. The Tawa Paneer was covered in oil and the vegetable slices were floating atop the oil. The Fish Koliwari was heavily battered and tasteless. We requested chutney and this was brought to us right away. The Dahi Aloo Puri was stale and the dahi had a sharp taste suggesting lack of freshness. We immediately asked to send it back. The server complied but there was no apology or queries or an offer to replace it. 
The Chicken Chilli Masala entree was just a mush of oily curry with chicken thrown in. The chicken was not marinated and lacked flavor. The Paneer kulcha was good. 
When the bill arrived, we were still billed for the Dahi Aloo Puri even though we tasted one spoonful and sent it back. even paying the bill took 15 minutes. By then we had been in there 2 hours and just wanted to leave so we paid without refuting the Dahi Aloo Puri charges.
To summarize: The water was brilliant! The paneer kulcha was good. The serving sizes were generous. Too bad the food was mostly inedible. As an Indian American I am actually shocked at the poor quality of what was served. 
Quite possibly the worst Indian food I have consumed in North America, and perhaps the worst restaurant experience in memory.

The service here was amazing. We came during opening hour for lunch on a Saturday. There weren't too many people at first, but when it started getting busy, we still got fantastic service. They filled our cups every time it got close to getting low and provided Tandori Chicken even when we finished our first tray.

The food itself was decent. The appetizer potatoes were fried in several spices that brought out the flavors well. The different curry chicken and shrimp were awesome. There were enough buffet items there that I firmly believe anyone can find 2-3 dishes that they really enjoy.

The best part was the bread (naan), which they kept bringing out. I wished they could have let us take some with us. The reason why it was three stars is that none of the dishes really stuck out and left me with a feeling of having to come back for more. The overall price (tip included) was $15 for lunch which I thought was on the high end for the food we got. It's definitely worth a try if you enjoy Indian food, but I don't think I'd come back here frequently.

I normally don't bother reviewing ubiquitous fast-food chain restaurants where everyone's expectations are rock-bottom from the get-go. But this place sucks even by McDonald's standards. I've ordered 5 items from this place (I often work odd crappy overnight hours and I don't have a lot of "lunch" options out this way so cut me some slack) and they've made some error or another on 4 of the 5 items.  

McDonald's corporate has spent God knows how many millions (billions?) of dollars perfecting their order fulfillment  system and you still manage to kack it up on a regular basis? Seriously people, get your sh*t together.

There is only one good reason for patronizing any McDonald's restaurant. Allegedly, McD Corporate spends billions worrying about perfecting their beverage and from what I can tell, it's working. 

I'm loving their Coke and Iced Coffee!

I only go to this McDonald's because its close to our house...
Its dirty and last time my crispy chicken was not even cut on my salad...and it was so hard to cut with the plastic utencils!
Its close but not one of the best mcdonalds...

Went there this morning and had one of the worst drive thru experiences.  The woman working named "Martha" decided that it is more important during a morning rush to be playing and texting on her cell phone then taking orders and servicing customers.  To take 16 minutes to go thru a 5 car line with nobody having multi-bag orders is crazy.  She also seems to be pretty good at making sure the computer can't show the wait times while she is on her phone since she uses the two ordering stations and the large area between them to the restaurant to put the gap of service.  McDonalds is what it is for food we all know that so the reviews have to basically come down to service with my experience today I will not be returning to this location!

Like many others, I don't go to this location by choice. The service is inconsistent at the window... At times, it's polite and friendly, then you end up with the apathetic one or the discontent one and you hope that your food is okay.

Good news about this location is that they do have the $1 any size drink, and the value menu, and they're on the way to work (for me).

I don't have any experience going inside, so I can't comment on cleanliness and the fly situation.

The only other comment about this place is that it can be hard to turn westbound during rush hour, and at times the drive-thru can be painfully slow.

If you have another option, take it.
It's 24 hours. They didn't have a lot of items but I was still able to put in a big order in.

I have a new rule, if an establishment is going to charge me for condiments, I'll take my business elsewhere.  Just build it into your price. To have to go back to my car for $.25 or charge it to my debit card is inconvenient.  They can keep their $.25 sweet and sour sauce. I usually come here twice a week because of volleyball but now I'll have to spend my money to another establishment.

This McDonalds is the most dysfunctional fast food restaurant ever.   For years they all have been so dumb, not knowing how to take and deliver a proper order. They are so lucky that they are the only mcdonalds open 24 hrs around here!!!!!

Not one of the better McDonald's I've ever been to.  The first time I went here I got a cone.  It was definitely not the most aesthetically pleasing vanilla cone I've ever had, and instead of being 49 cents like it is at most McDonald's here it's 99 cents.  The second time I went my husband and I got the Rolo McFlurrys which were just ok.  I will probably go here again eventually since I'm in the area frequently but if you have the option of going to another McDonald's I probably would.

the food here tastes exactly the same as at the mcdonalds by my house! 

decorum: fancy, cheesy, suburban

service is usually fast. it stays pretty clean. usually the clerk is a pleasure to deal with. I havent noticed desparity between the speed of service of the drive through versus the lobby. havent seen ronald or hamburgler at this playplace location yet.c

I am very disappointed in this McDonalds. I went this morning to grab breakfast at the Drive-up window, and had to wait at least 3-4 minutes before someone even greeted me through the speaker. If you are busy, at least acknowledge that you know that I am waiting and will be with me shortly.  Even further, I was halfway through my order when he yelled at me "Do you have cash?" "We are only accepting cash, our credit card machine is not working!" Why didn't you tell me at the beginning of the order that you were only accepting credit cards. The man taking my order was very rude, and curt and basically just muttered a "sorry" when I told him I did not have cash. That was a total waste of my time and I am very annoyed by poor level of service that I received this morning. I get things happen, and sometimes machines break, but at least be nice about it and not have an attitude with me. I will probably be going to a different location from this point forward.

I was they had the zero stars.  Its sad though I took the survey of how horrible the service was the other morning. I was hoping the manager would contact me.  But of course, not.   Horrible.  They people they have working there are horrible. Speaking spanish and rolling their eyes. Seriously?  Got my order wrong twice. Myself and othef customers are the reason why you have a paycheck every week.  Some people need to understand that.  But clearly this Mcdonalds is horrible.

On Oct. 19, 2015 at 10:30pm i entered the lobby to order a breakfast meal.  I watched a worker pick up garbage empty garbage mop the floor sweep the floor and then go over on her manger orders to put my hash brown in my bag sitting on the warmer.  She followed her manger order and put her garbage filled hands no gloves in my bag.

This pissed off the manger when i mentioned this to her she took the hash brown out threw it in the garbage.  
The manager then waited and gave the last cooked hash brown to a customer who just walked in she made me pay I had to wait untill 10:55pm before I left with a number 2.  If anyone gets a chance pull that video from that night and post it you will see this manger order a garbage filled hand worker to touch food without washing hands and dont complain you will be there for awhile.

I hardly ever write reviews, but kudos to the employees at this McDonald's - they're noticeably friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Granted, I always come at the same time of day (5:30 pm) and only use the drive-thru, so I can't comment on cleanliness or any of that. But the employees who've been working at that time have been incredibly cheerful and upbeat, to the point that I actually took note of it. And that's got to be hard to do when you're working in fast food! Totally surprises me that I like some of McDonald's food enough to go there when I never did before, but I usually order the McChicken or the Sausage & Egg McMuffin, and they're delicious guilty pleasures.
The reason why I give this McDonalds a 3 and not a 4 or 5 is that the service is fast and thorough but is not always the cleanest in the eating area.

This McDonalds has the slowest drive through consistently at 3:15 pm week days! Today was the last straw 13 minutes and only 4 cars ahead of me when I pulled up. Your franchise owner should want to fix this!
What the epitome of a McDonald's should be. Great service. Great food. And 24 hours. One of four nearby mcds and this is the best. Late night shines like a champ here
This location has consistently the slowest drive through service of any McDonald's I've ever been to. The food is consistent with any other McDonald's drive-through  but amazingly slow fast food.

Ah McDonald's..the joy and bane of my existence. I'm an avid fast food connoisseur and I've been to all of the MickeyD's around me and this place is the best. Friendly staff, nuggets are fresh, fries are never cold and stale, filet-o-fish buns are perfection. 4 stars only because of the health hazards that accompany indulgence in fast food.

Also conveniently located right next to where I work out at, Blast Fitness. Needless to say, this is the provider of my favorite post-workout meal (10 nuggets + McDouble) hell yeah.

This location is really hit-or-miss.  There are times when the service is very friendly and fast, and other times when the service is so-so and slow.  On a weekday morning at 9:00, I shouldn't have to park in the drive-thru parking and wait for a Sausage McMuffin with Egg and iced coffee.  However, there are times when the staff is friendly and my food is hot, fresh, and served quickly.  I guess it depends on the phase of the moon.  Roll the dice with this one; good luck!

Ok this place is bad. Been here sad to say 2 times the last 2 days. They screwed up my order both times the second day evan charged me .25 for my water REALLY its tap water I am in the industry these cups do not cost .255 a peace or they would loose money. These owners are money hungry and will nickel and dime you all the way. Go elsewhere people save yourself the aggravation.

Good McDonald's location. Really friendly people at each window, probably the friendliest I've ever encountered. I've also never had an issue with order accuracy here. Great location as far as Mickey D's go!

It's a good location to have a drive thru. However, they never seem to move the drive thru efficiently. They also don't seem to move the line in the store very efficiently, so whether you go in or not, you lose. I rarely go to McDonald's, I only go if I need an iced coffee fix, but I would prefer not to go to this location. The service really is lackluster.

I hate to admit it, but I  feed my kids McDonald's more often than I would prefer.  At times, it's become our first choice for dinner/lunch simply out of convenience.  So, since we spend a good amount of time in McDonald's, I've decided to Yelp every location we've been to that has a PlayPlace, starting with the Schaumburg one which happens to be our favorite.

The food is the food - exactly what you'd expect from a fast-food joint and a McDonald's.  We've never had any issues with our orders here.  It's always generally 'fresh' and served hot.  Service is consistently quick and efficient, and more often than not, cheerful.

The PlayPlace itself is laid out differently from most of the others ones we've been to.  Rather than the usual standard indoor climbing gyms, this one is a large Treehouse.  Of all the ones we've gone to, this one is the cleanest.  I'm fortunate to be physically small enough to be able to follow my kids up into the treehouse (important since my 3yo has no issue climbing up, but wigs out once there and can't come back down...meaning I have to go in and rescue him).  And I've actually seen the inside of this treehouse.  While it's sticky in some spots, overall, it's okay.  Maybe because it's a wider space than most of the other indoor gyms, staff are better able to wipe it down and clean it...but I know of other McD locations where I raced home to bathe my kids after seeing how filthy they'd gotten coming out of the playplace (and now you have been forewarned of upcoming reviews).

Outside and around the treehouse they have other climbing things (tiger and lady bug? - if I remember correctly), and games, including arcade-like video games.  The floor is covered with soft rubber material - astroturf style.  The room is a good size, bigger than most and takes up half the restaurant.  It would be nice for bday parties.  We actually happened to come one day when there was a bday party going on and the kids looked like they were having a great time, and playing games including Bozo-or Ronald- buckets!  Though, they did attempt to hang a pinata from the treehouse which was promptly shut down by staff. lol.

They also have a separate kid-friendly bathroom in this section, perfect so that you don't have to go into the main restaurant, especially since the kids are only allowed to wear socks...speaking of which, I appreciate at times coming across staff who do a quick check of the room for either cleaning or making sure kids are wearing socks and not playing in their shoes or bare feet.  Socks can be purchased at the counter for $1.

Also, free Wi-Fi at this location, so it's nice to be able to surf on the iPad while the kids eat and play.  I've seen many other parents do the same here.

So yes, we're here a lot, and plan to continue coming back so long as they maintain it!

Eh, not bad.  I probably wouldn't eat inside, and you have to be very clear that you don't want anything at all in your iced coffee (otherwise they really want to put sugar in it for some reason...) but the people that work there are almost always friendly.

Edit: Bumped these guys to an easy four stars as they're now literally the only McDonald's I've ever been to that can get my coffee order correct (Iced coffee without cream or sweetener).  Every time now they're right on the money!  Plus, the very nice lady there gave me the egg and cheese biscuit price for my Sausage Egg and Cheese McGriddle that I order without sausage!  So the people here are great.
Awful service.  I watched as everyone in line had their orders screwed up, then I had to correct them on my order and they were mad about it.  This is a terrible McDonalds location.
Terrible service. Never get what I order. I don't think its that hard yo read a ticket and give an order.

Holy skeleton crew. 

I've been here three times, and each time I have seen another angry customer complain about wrong orders or long wait time. I can't fault the employees, they work their butts off and don't have the assistance they need. The owner/operator of this place needs to hire more staff. One cashier, one cook, and one manager doesn't cut it.
5:45am, definitely not crowded and waited 15 minutes for my order of two bacon, egg and cheese bagels, 2 hash browns and a med coffee.  No excuse for this kind of service

I literally live kitty corner to this "establishment", for 16 years. Let's just say their quality of food and service has gotten poorer with every passing year. I can't speak for this year so far as I've opted to never return here again. 

Let's start with food. If you're a person who has any instructions on the food you order, please STAY AWAY. They somehow find a way to even mess up regular food. Do not trust these people to accommodate your needs on special orders. You cannot have it your way or even McDonald's way. They have a special way here. A FRANCHISE way. Yes they are franchised and for that they have lower, no LOWEST standards. 

So avoid at all costs. Do not leave that window unless you check your food first. Even your drinks. They are 15% marked up due to being a franchise. Their food is always cold and stale. And their window operators dont even speak English. 

I really wish I can give 0 stars. 

I go to the McDonald 3 miles away on Schaumburg and weathersfield even though this is less than a stones throw from my house. 

BUT THERE IS LIGHT AT THE END OF THE TUNNEL. Rumor has it the old Champs rest is being converted into a themed McDonald's. 

Thanks for your time

If I can give this place no stars I would. Thankfully they are opening a McDonalds on Golf (where Champs was) so between that place and the one on Roselle Rd. I can avoid this place.

DIRTY/OUTDATED
Place is seriously outdated for people who choose to eat inside. I'm talking old school metal chairs, grandma floral decor, you name it.) If you tell the manager the tables are dirty, he just yells it's just dried up old white paint on them, not dirt. (Oh, Great!) I did notice a lot of broken machines.

NOISY
This again goes if you want to dine in. Between the loud screeches and incessant beeps of a broken machine, it makes this place super noisy to go to with a friend or have a conversation, let alone eat at.

FOOD
Standard menu. Got the correct portions. But the fries I got were hot, smelled slightly different and had barely any salt on them. Very bland.

LAYOUT
Genius move putting the only accessible door just after the curve of the drive through. Need to LOOK before you cross with the bushes there. If drivers aren't slowing down, paying attention or someone doesn't look before they cross, bad news.

Overall, they should demolish this place with the close proximity to nearby locations and the cost it would be to remodel/fix everything wrong with this location.
Only three cars in front of me, but I waited 10 more minutes, also no napkin, when I asked, that lady gave me a dirty look! What's  wrong with this McDonald's! I can't see any service!

This was such a bad experience.  I went through the drive through so I didn't have to deal with people inside.  Being a Sunday morning and hung over the last thing I needed was people who were going to annoy me.  Well I pulled up to the menu and some joker over the intercom said "what can I get you" I said "i just need a minute". As I was looking at the menu trying to decide how I wanted to destroy my toilet he gets back on like 30 seconds later and said "you ready yet" I said okay okay I'll just have the egg white delight mcmuffin.  I didn't know he was in such a hurry to get me the F$%k out of there. Considering no one was behind me I could see how rushing me was necessary.  So I figured the transaction would be fast at the window.  However all I got at the window was "hi.......$10.95".  Then the cashier continued talking to the order taker about his son and what they were going to do that day and how awesome it was to be them.  They didn't give a crap about me as long as they got my money!  I'm so happy those 2 people work there they seem really close and it felt great being ignored!!! Then I drove to the next window where I got my food, I pulled out and opened my food which the eggs were runny and wet and gross, the bread was burnt and my iced coffee tasted like water.  But once again I can see how I was the one being rushed!  Great job on messing up my good and reminding me why I never go here!

Its a McDonalds people. If they couldn't understand you maybe you could have articulated better. I've never had any problems here with my orders. 

The one thing that I would change about this location is the layout: the drive-thru lane crosses right over one of the main entrances (exits). So, you have to stop way short of the car you are following or you'll end up straddling the primary pedestrian crosswalk that navigates customers from the parking area. It can get a little awkward when a customer is walking out with their food and nearly open the door into the driver side door of your car and all you can do is sit there because you cars sandwiching you in. 

Other than that - its a McDonalds and it get the job done when I need it to.

They have people who dont speak English there. But the ones you do are very nice and very helpful. They also do have a manager that doesn't speak at all ( very monotone, no smiling, no character at all).
The best McDonald's ever! Happy involved employees! Made us feel welcome and appreciated, food same as everywhere but service way above average!!

Restaurant Review
Not quite sure why so many negative reviews, but maybe my order was nice and simple. This location does have a weird parking lot, small and lots of spaces for drive thru customers to eat in their car. I had a BOGO for any drink and I ordered smoothie which was prepared correctly and fast. Otw I can't comment to much on the other issues if I had to order more food

Pro- dollar menu, drive thru centered restaurant

Con- high calorie meal!

Hidden deals-
Dollar menu

This is my favorite McDonald's! Thanks to the McDonald's Monopoly game, we've been going every single workday morning for a couple of hashbrowns and a drink. The manager has come to know is and is always friendly.

I've eaten inside in the past and it's always clean and staff is pleasant. McDonald's is known for messing up orders & forgetting items...and yes that occasionally happens at this location---but very rarely! Last week, they forgot one item from our order. We went back the next day with our receipt and they gave us the item with no trouble.
They couldn't understand me at the drive thru and messed up my order. I will not return to this location.

Have you ever just wanted to start screaming at someone?? That's how I felt today....me and my two friends went to McDonald's, and I ordered a frappe. I was sitting there, digesting it and catching up with my friends when this lady who works there walks up to me. She says "Are you going to buy something, because there a people waiting to be seating." FIRST of all, there are about ten open seat. SECOND of all, I had just bought a frappe and threw it away maybe 3 min. ago and was about to leave anyway. I never swear at people, but at that moment I just really wanted to call out on what a b*tch she was being. But like the good catholic child I am, I didn't. But don't test me......

I signed up for yelp just to write this review. There are 3 McDonald's within 5 minutes from my house and this is the most horrible one. Come to think about it, it's the worst one I've been to in my life. The service is horrible, the wait time is horrible, it's McDonald's come on. Don't ever go on a Sunday morning when they are busy and frazzled, 20 minutes waiting in one of there wait spots for breakfast sandwiches. It's just ridiculous.

OK, I'm the type who's willing to try anything more than once. In the case of this McDonald's, BIG MISTAKE! And stupid of me, I tried it for the third time... OMG... What's bad? Everything other than the location.


Menu (2/10)
It's McDonald's, so it's standard, right? As far as the menu list, yes. But if you look at what you get once you pay, blah! Yesterday was the third time I went there and I ordered a 3pc Chicken Select meal. The chicken was a half the size I normally get somewhere else. The fries was only 80% full. Two weeks ago, the chicken was 70% of normal size although the fries is full. The only consistency they have is every time I go there, I leave as a dissatisfied customer.

Price (2/10)
