It's McDonald's. The price is pretty much set for each area. But that should get me the right portion for the meal I bought. Did I get it? No.

Ambiance (2/10)
Small and a little dirty. During summer, it's way too hot for comfort. They probably set the AC to 85 degree to lower cost. I haven't been there in winter and I don't think I plan to.

Service (1/10)
At McDonald's the only service I expect is to get my order done to my satisfaction. But with the way they cut the size of each portion, there's nothing else I can do but give them a 1.

Location (9/10)
It's about 5 minute drive from my office, so I don't have any complaint about the location.

Overall score: 3/10

Ugh... I avoid McDonald's like the plague. Unfortunately because I'm pretty busy/lazy I end up here more often than I care to think about. I don't expect much, given that it is fast-food, but it's not THAT hard to be professional and courteous! Also, I really do love the food but I just hate that guilty feeling afterwards like 'yep, just killed myself a little bit more...' 

I always go through the drive-through, so I can't say anything about the inside but this is my typical experience... 
Pull up, there is always a second car in front, so I'm at the #2 speaker. For the longest time I thought this was just a cardboard box painted and set up to look like a second speaker, but I was proven wrong a couple times ago when I actually heard a voice coming out of it. 

So I attempt to place my order (one or two items usually, nothing special), trying to shout over the cacophony I'm hearing from the speaker, as if there is a grand symphony playing in the kitchen... 
Anyway, I usually have to repeat it several times since whoever told me they were taking my order was apparently joking and is paying me no attention whatsoever. 

I get my total and pull up to the window, and here is where the real annoyance starts. After a wordless, eye contact-less transaction (Seriously, not even a smile or a "thank you"! Is it because I don't speak Spanish? I feel discriminated against!), I sit there waiting for my food to be delivered. And sit there. 

After a few minutes one of the several people working the window rushes up and barks at me 'what are you waiting for?' As in, what did I order. So I meekly tell them and they bark at me 'Next window!' Okay, well thanks for telling me that... didn't know I was supposed to read your mind and know that instead of conveniently handing me my food right now since I'm sitting right here, you just HAD to put it on that stupid conveyor belt and shoot it down to the next window. 

For some reason the people at the second window are a little more pleasant, maybe because they get to hang out in the back where it's much more quiet. I don't know. But once I get my order I rush off, vowing never to return... until the next time I have about 5 minutes to feed my belly. 

And here's an extra tidbit - don't try going here late night. Even though they say they're open 24 hours - I pulled up one night around midnight and there was already a car in front of me honking and trying to get someone's attention. I waited for a few minutes and then decided to try elsewhere. Who knows what they would have served by that point?!

I gave this McDonalds three stars simply because of the people who work inside (definitely not the drive through).  If you have the time to jump out of your car and run in then this McDonalds wont be a waste of your time, the drive through on the other hand is another story.  My order is not complicated; a mchicken with ketchup and a large drink.  For some reason whenever I go through the drive through this is always wrong (I've received a big mac on more than one occasion).  Then the woman inside the window would argue with me about what I ordered...I know what I ordered thank you, it says on the receipt.  

The manager inside was very nice and professional and I've never had these problems inside. As far as the drive through, not sure what's happening there but I would avoid it.

ok let me start that i eat too much of this stuff to begin with. Today though I have to say that making breakfast at home certainly seems like a more logical and economical solution to my dilema.

I have been a regular here for the last two years. There is a blonde manager that if she is working the food is right. 

1. I ordered a fish filet no tarter. first attempt they wipe it off, 2nd there is a itsy bitsy drop in the very center of the sandwich. third time they get it right

2. ice cream cones. for get about it. inconsistancy in making of them and if you dont hold off and order at the window they are melting adn expect you to eat a melting cone. HELL NO!  remake time.

3. Today, line management for cars getting into the mcd's is stupid. just stupid. then i am told it will be a minute for my super special a sandwich minus cheese. HOLD THE ASSEMBY LINE!!!!! NO CHEEEEESE. fer christs sake. I mean what is so hard ... so I ask how long is a minute. It was a rhetorical question. he could just said about 60 seconds and i would have been fine, becuase the obvious 60=1 minute. so he cant give me a answer i drive off sans food. grumpy becuase of the exchange and was hoping to write a review .

I will try my best to never go back

PS the comment about getting blank stares if your lucky is so true



Update 10/17/2011

I will haev the sausage mcmuffin wth egg sandwich only and a coke no ice. 

Cashier..... so taht will be a sausage mcmuffin without ice adn what else? 

no no no a sausage mcmuffin with egg sandwich only and a large cock no ice. 

she repeats it back.... and then asks. 

would you like a hot pumpkin spice pie for 50 cents....?

I ask back .... is that with or without ice? 

she replies ... without ice.....

Giggles

Okay, if I could seriously give 0 stars, I think I would. 

Worst. Experience. Ever. Seriously.

I know it's silly to yelp a fast-food restaurant, but hey... I've gone too far to look back now.

The cashier was EXTREMELY complacent and rude, once she finally decided to pay attention to me.  My food took forever and once I got it, I was missing my burger!!! How hard is it to get two things into a bag (Burger and fries)!?

When I complained the lady snatched the bag out of my hand, as if she didn't believe me.  RUUUUDE.

Never going back.  Ever.

I ordered a decalf with no sugar and guess how it came? Well yeah you guessed it. While McDonalds is great at speed and efficiency, they're not at the top of their game when it comes to customer service. But hey that's the trade off I guess.
it's whatever. fast food. but not the greatest food. it's what to be expected at those prices. place is dirty most of the time. the cashiers are nice.

I wouldn't choose this mcdonalds to be the best in the area, the hours are very busy for employees, this mcdonalds has started 24/7 hours shifts on weekends but not the  best pick for a midnight meal. This is probably the busiest than the one on irving park and roselle road.
Worst McDonalds that I have been to in years.  The only thing I get from here anymore is Ice-t and yes, they can screw that up too.

McDonalds  on north west highway in  Palatine  was very very  bad the person that gave me my food could not speak english  so  got some one that  could  told me  with a 20 piece chicken nugget only get one sauce  what a shame will never go  back burger king got me now and my kids

Place was meh compared to other McDonalds, they are a bit too rushy even though there was only 2 people in the store, they also didn't give me any napkins with my to go order, do I have to pay for those too now? Lol 

Food was the same as usual I had 2 hash browns and 2 sausage mcmuffins 

I rarely ever go eat McDonalds just cuase there is always more around, but nothing was open early in the morning so that's why I got McDonalds

Do not come to this location after 9p.m. The employees are rude. The should not be working at a fast food restaurant if they hate what they do. I pulled up to the drive through and a young lady asked me " what do you want" and as I was ordering she kept on saying "ahuh pull up". I will not be returning to this location.

I'll give them one star for being open but that's about it. How do you consistently run out of cup holders??? It happens at least once per week. In the last 3 days, it's happened twice! I walk with a cane so a cup holder or drink tray is essential when carrying multiple beverages. The lack of customer service is ridiculous! No one there freaking cares about the customers! They tried to tell me that all area McDonald's were out of cup holders. Two miles or less away, another location had tons of cup holders and a far better attitude! The lack of service is enough to push me over the edge!

This place is the worst McDonald's I have EVER been to, when I went in it was dirty, the soda was watered down, my fries where cold and there was a DEAD BUG IN MY FRIES. 

Don't go here. It's disgusting.
Place was not busy, but a LOT of employees standing around....could have been cleaning to help get rid of the amount of fruit flies found....will not be returning to this location.

I went to this Mcdonalds location with my boyfriend and his sister, we were so hungry and ready to enjoy our food. Come to find out my boyfriend had found a dead fly in his fries and we were all extremely disgusted. We all couldn't finish our food and my boyfriend demanded a refund. We definitely won't be coming to this Mcdonalds again.

The food is McDonald's quality, so whatever you want to think of it is up to you.

My complaint is for other things:
1. False advertisement: They advertised Transformer toy for Happy Meal in the restaurant and what my son received was Electro character from Spiderman from 6 MONTHS ago. When I complained, they said that's all they have. My son already have 3 of the same exact toy from 6 MONTHS ago.
2. Customer service: They messed up and they told us to just come back later to buy another happy meal when they have the Transformer toy. Talk about refusing to take responsibilities!
3. Corporate: Since I couldn't get resolution from the store, I escalated to corporate and all I received was a generic apology reply that was probably generated by a software. When I tried to reply to the email, they auto replied they didn't use the email address for communication. Talk about refusing to provide customer service!

This company has turned for the worst. One of the worst I've experienced in my life. And it's particularly disturbing after I've received so many great service from other companies like Starbucks, Chipotle, Taco Bell, Boston Market, etc.

Rachel B. I'm with you 9 out of 10 times order is incorrect! 

Here is today's wrong order (served by a manager of all people also.) ordered sausage biscuit with add on cheese. Hashbrown and large coke zero 
What I got: bacon egg cheese biscuit medium Coke hashbrown that was cold.  She insisted that was large coke zero even though I know it's not. 
I drove home and immediately took survey and let them know they are horrible at orders and customer service. I then called to tell them and (6) attempts. No answer. 

Other mishaps 
Order (2) chocolate chip cookies 
Got (1) oatmeal instead

Order (2) chocolate chip cookies
Got cookie bag with no cookies

Ordered quarter pounder meal
Got mc double 

Ordered chocolate milkshake
Got vanilla milkshake

IM DONE with this place! 
Anyone else experiencing this at this location lately?

Visited today around 11 am. I'm probably being generous giving this location 2 stars. The restaurant was filthy. The service was terrible. The people working behind the counter didn't seem to know or care what was going on. They all seemed liked they didn't want to be there and the communication they did have seemed forced without any eye contact. Even though this location is close, I'll think twice about coming here again.

I am very sad when I come here today, first time in many months I have been here and first time inside ever.  As I entered the restaurant, the entrance (between the outside and inside doors) smelled HORRID. Then as I entered, it still smelled but not as strong. It was disgusting. I then had to wait 4 minutes until someone would take my order, there was no one in front of me. And another 4 minutes for my food. 

This is absolutely the worst service speed wise I have ever had at a McDonalds when there was no one in line in the restaurant (it was 3 pm...). And to top it off, when the one manager realized I was waiting, she yelled to the back of the store to get the cashier back up here. Yelling is very off putting..

The Fish Sandwich I had today was not as crispy as usual and had less tartar sauce than I would have liked but I was in a hurry and was not willing to wait another 4 minutes to get a sandwich. 

I did forget to get water, so I went back up only to have to stand at the counter another minute before someone acknowledged me. This was by far the worst meal I have had at a McDonald's to date.  

Also note the furniture, mind you this is a fairly newly remodeled place, is cracked and all beat up already.

This particular McD's never seems to get the order right, as many others have posted.  Even something as simple as a Diet Coke comes out wrong most of the time.  I can tell the difference between diet & regular (my blood sugar can tell the difference too). Tonight a man who identified himself as the Manager was extremely rude when we wanted credit for the wrong drink.  Better get with it McD's, you stink at this location compared to other McD's.  Sounds like a new Manager is needed.   Does anyone care about the "customer experience" ?

Restaurant Review
Fast food check, inexpensive check, not really tasty probably. This is one of the more updated mcd locations with flat screen screens and has undergone multiple renovations. The menu is no different than other mcd and if you want a cheap meal there is always the dollar menu. Can't go wrong when you want to get fast and cheap eats. I can't say that the burgers are good but that is another story altogether

Pro- fast, cheap, clean, modern

Con- poor quality of food

Hidden deal- Dollar menu!

Now, before you think I'm crazy for writing this much about a fricken McDonald's, hold on. I've mentioned before that I usually don't like reviewing chains.  Especially McDonalds.  But my exceptions are if they have really good service or really bad service.  This particular location happens to be really, really, REALLY bad service. They get my order wrong 9 times out of 10 when I go here and the employees are just plain rude. I'm don't get mad easily, but these people here really just get under my skin.

Example 1. I'll take a caramel latte and a nonfat vanilla latte.  Get to the window and she hands be something that says nonfat latte, when I brought this to her attention she said oh sorry its the wrong sticker thats the caramel one.  Okay, no big deal. But then the second one says that a vanilla latte, in which I told them it was supposed to be nonfat.  Again, wrong sticker but the young lady at the window tried arguing with me about what they really were.  She was really rude.  Upon leaving and drinking the coffees... the caramel one wasn't even close... it was a peppermint mocha!!!! Uhm really? You're going to argue with me over that and then its not even something we ordered. Cool. I'll give you a second chance....

Example 2. I go through the drive thru and order 3 burgers, 1 mcchicken, 2 small fries, and a coke.  I had to repeat my order 3 times at the speaker until the guy finally got it right.  Then I pay and pull up to the window and they ask me what my order was AGAIN. I tell them and wait another 5 minutes before my order gets to me.  I get home, my order is missing the mcchicken and the buffalo sauce I had asked for (and also paid for).  The girl here as also really rude to giving me attitude about anything I say or asked.  Come on people, I work in the food industry... its not that hard to get an order right! Especially when there's no one else inside or in the drive thru. 

What really baffles me at this location is how rude all of their employees are.  The customer service sucks monkey balls. There is no correcting them or saying you got the wrong item cause they'll just blame it on you.  Don't bother asking questions either, they won't answer them.  There's a McDonald's down the street from this one, that if you're from the area, is totally worth the extra couple blocks to drive as they almost always get my order right and their employees are super nice.  

End Rant.

They didn't have large fries....Are you kidding me!  Maybe its a sign to not be such a fat loser but at least be nice about it and give me free stuff. I won't be back there's other places with Large Fries I can go to at 11pm that will be nicer.

Good location, food is usually piping hot (with the exception of fries at times).  Workers are always nice, renovations help with drive-thru (now they have two).  Have only messed up an order once, and that says a lot about McDonalds.

I rode my bike to McD's. The manager told me it was their policy not to allow bikes inside the restaurant. I apologized for not finding the bike rack only to learn they don't have one. I said I refused to put my Cannondale at risk. She pointed & said something so I asked her what their policy was on strollers. To my luck, there were a few blocking areas of the restaurant. She left me & my bike alone.

Stroller belong outside! Parents don't bother folding them out of the way so they're more of an obstruction to other customers than bicycles. How often do parents clean and wipe up biohazardous waste of toddler, pet dander and car trunk? Bicycles are better maintained, tuned up, registered and insured. Mine cost hundreds of dollars more than a stroller, requires a Kryptonite lock and never sees rain or snow. Fuck your prejudice!

There are so many McDonald's in the area. Who cares that they're renovating the outside when the place sucks inside?
Employee didn't throw honey mustard packs at us when requested. Still amazing. Five stars.

Great location, very convenient, and they're quick!

I like when I can get my "fast food" fast!!  That's always a plus!

They have yet to get my order wrong or forget something.  Score!!

Hi, may I have a large tea with 2 sugars, please.

A hot tea?

Yes, please.

Do you want the sugar in the water?

Sure, that's fine.

Okay, pull to the first window.

(First window empty, pulled to second window)

(Am handed a hot cup with a tea bag on top of it)

May I have 2 sugars please?

It's in the water.

You put the sugar in the hot water but are handing me the tea bag?

No one ever gets tea here, I didn't know what to do. I've never seen this before.

(Shaking head and staring at tea cup, wondering what would have happened if I had ordered something complicated)

This place always screws up my order. They take forever to give you your food and it's always wrong... Im not going to sit here and rant but plain and simple this place is one of the worst MC Donalds I've ever been to.

Not one of there better locations, the breakfast food has always been ok, but if you order off the lunch menu something will be screwed up and it's usually the fries, check your stuff before you drive off.

Great food and incredible service! The owner was more than accommodating to our requests. He brought us complimentary soju (Korean vodka) before our order. We ended up staying awhile after our meal and instead of trying to rush us out, he brought us complimentary desserts. All 6 of us agreed that we would come back again.
As for the food...I would highly recommend the buns, Seafood pancakes, spicy pork, and the spicy rice cakes. They have a huge selection of specialty beers, cocktails and wine. 
I've been to dozens of Korean restaurants and this by far was one of the nicest and friendliest restaurants I've been to. If you've never been to a Korean restaurant and want to try it, this is the place. There's no language barriers or "weird" food to be afraid of. There's no dog...I promise! I'm Korean, so it's ok...I can say that without being offensive. ;)
Try it...you won't regret it.

Really nice folks, quick service and the food was delicious.  Two of us shared 3 of their appetizers:  Belly Buns (grilled Pork Belly...they were fantastic), Seafood Pancake (good but our least fave of the 3) & the smaller-sized Dumplings (very good).  They give you 4 small bowls of various condiments/toppings as well and then certain dishes come with dipping sauce(s), too.  

TTOWA is a smaller place so you may have to wait for a table on busy Friday & Saturday evenings.  We went for lunch on a Saturday and were seated right away as there were only 3 other tables taken at that time.  

I would have given them 5 stars if it weren't for 3 things: 
1. I ordered hot tea & they bring you just a mug of hot tea...no small teapot like you get at some other places.  This in & of itself is fine but my mug was never refilled and I finished it by the time we finished our first appetizer.  I could have asked but I waited to see if they would offer and they didn't so next time I'll know better.
2. When we ordered the smaller-sized Dumplings we ordered the Vegetable ones and we received the Meat ones...luckily we aren't vegetarians & just ate them anyway since they were good.
3. Dumplings again...when we ordered we were not asked if we wanted them steamed or fried.  We should have specified when we ordered but since both options are listed on the menu the server should have asked.  The server hurried away before I realized he hadn't asked so we decided to just see what he would bring.  We received fried...of course we preferred steamed but like them both ways so again we just rolled with it and gobbled them up anyway.

We ate there last night.   A very nice evening and we will return.

Pro's Food was good but not the best Korean I have ever had.  Wine prices very good and a nice beer selection.  We occupied the table for 2.5 hours and did not feel pressured.  

Cons - service was spotty and at times odd.  They do not know how to serve wine.  They were friendly, just not well trained.

The buns and dumplings were the best part of the meal!

We will go back.

This was a nice little gem of a place not far from my job that I found via a 'Yelp weekly' mail on local bibimbap servings.   I was curious to check it out.   I've never had Korean food before so I looked forward to the experience.

Service overall was friendly.    I was presented with Ttowa's Autumn Lunch Special menu.   They had quite a few tasty suggestions.    In the end I ordered the lunch special bibimbap with marinated ribeye.   I asked about the DOLSOT (hot stone) that was an extra $2 cost.   I was told that the hot stone helps in the preparation of the bibimbap making it cook easier.   Wanting to get the full Korean experience, I decided to go for it.    Prior to getting the bibimbap I was presented with five sampler appetizers on the house.    My faves among those were the potato salad and the miso-like soup.   

A second server that was working the kitchen area came out with my dish and she added a few spices and went to town mixing the bibimbap together.    Basically the egg yolk was cooked in to the rice, beef and other veggies that were in the bibimbap.    Between the appetizers and the meal, I was quite full.    The bibimbap was good though I found myself repeatedly needing to add some of the spices to it to give it more flavor.

Despite being full I wanted to try the complimentary donut dessert that was advertised on the yelp app.   Unfortunately though my lunch hour also was running over.   I asked if it was possible to come back after work to try it if I brang my receipt.   Unfortunately (or maybe fortunately...who needs the extra calories, right? LOL) I was told I'd have to order it then and there and they wouldn't give it later (unless of course I order another entree at that time).  I understood but was still bummed.   Oh well.

Overall though I was impressed with my first Korean meal experience.

What a surprising little place. Really nice service and cute, casual atmosphere.
The wings are delicious. The spicy chicken is as good as everyone says. It's that kind of super moist, juicy, tasty and zingy chicken that I like best. 
I'm never out here, but if I am, I'll make sure to return!

I love how this Ttowa caters to Americans who aren't familiar with Korean cuisine. Though Chinese and Japanese are more familiar amongst Americans, Korean food is usually a strange phenomenon. Fortunately, ttowa has mastered the introduction of Korean food in the American suburbs! With this, however, comes the disappointment of more Americanized Korean food for those that grew up with Korean food. 

The dumplings are great here, their speciality, and the texture and dough is delicious and chewy. We had the Sam gyup sal- which turned out to actually be dae ji bul go gi (spicy pork)- but still pretty good. The dolsot bibimbap (traditional stone bowl) is always my favorite though. They do it well here, despite the other more Americanized dishes. The banchan is also quite tasty and fresh, though very small in portions.

What also sets ttowa apart from other Korean restaurants is the excellent service. The family that runs this place know how to treat their customers- both non Koreans and Koreans. This is not usually the case at traditional Korean restaurants, so it's a nice refresher being treated well! The tea and dessert are always a plus!
AMAZING!!! Could be best restaurant in NW Suburbs for Korean. Order Bibimbap, kalbi short ribs, chicken/pork belly buns. Perfect amount of food for two people. You will be happy when you leave.

I tried this place with my boyfriend two weeks ago, and loved it so much that we came back a week later... and let's be real, we'll probably be back in a few days. We LOVE this place already!! 

We found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try, especially since it's pretty local to where we live. I really liked how it was a little further than the rest of the restaurants in Downtown Arlington Heights-- it made parking easier as well as the waiting time. 

Both times I've been there, it was on a Friday night. There were already a few tables filled, but we were able to get seated right away on both occasions. The ambiance is nice: quiet, soft-lit, casual. 

On our first visit, we noticed they had a great drink selection. We were pleasantly surprised when we found out that they served 3 Floyds! Along with ordering to beers, we ordered the combo buns and an order to kalbi. The combo buns (belly & dak buns) were a bit smaller than I expected, but they are so flavorful and savory that the bite-sized pieces were enough for the both of us! I really liked both-- I don't think I can choose a favorite between the two. 

What my favorite part about this place is that we were able to get Korean BBQ, without doing the actual BBQ'ing (not a fan of all the smoke that tends to fog the room up when doing KBBQ). The kalbi was DELICIOUS. The portions were very generous and the sauce was more than perfect. The banchan it was served with were tasty. The portions were a bit small but it wasn't a problem when asking for more. The entree also came with two small bowls of rice, which is always a plus. 

As mentioned before, we came back again a week later and ordered the kalbi again (we're obsessed) and black bean noodles with shrimp tempura. The black bean noodles might be a newer addition to the menu, but it was good! It came in a very large bowl and you can tell that the noodles are handmade. Wish it came in spicy.

As far as service, Terry is very welcoming and attentive. Our first server was great! We had a different server on our second visit, we had to ask for things a few times but service overall was still good. 

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone, especially to those who might be new to Korean food!

This is more Americanized Korean but the food tasted very good.

For appetizer had the belly and chicken bun combo. Nice appetizer size and the meat had good flavor. I preferred the pork belly over the chicken. Really enjoyed the lollipop chicken wings. The sauce was spicy and sticky.

For entree shared with the table bulgogi, sam gyup sal, and kalbi. The sam gyup sal had good texture and the brussell sprouts was an interesting addition. The kalbi was cooked well however, I thought the sauce was a little too sweet. Bulgogi was tasty.

I've had more authentic Korean at other places but overall I found the food to be flavorful and enjoyed my meal. Service was great!

We ordered Dak Galbi for takeout as it was my SO's birthday. The food is SO good we ordered double so we have leftovers for a few days. We're farther out and don't have any Korean places by us. Accidentally got a double appetizer, but hey that can be lunch. The place was packed (rightfully so). 

The prices seem steep, but in relation to the serving sizes are quite fair. The individual order of dak galbi's is easily split into 3 servings. 

On request were also given sesame leaves, lettuce, and ssamjjang so we can make wraps for variety. Their ssaamjjang is great, as is their Kimchi. 

Definitely recommend, the gent I believe is the owner is really nice too. 

Definitely want to come back on a slower day and try their Bossam, until next time!

(4.5 stars)

This is another review that's long overdue.  When we have a craving for Korean food in the area, Ttowa immediately comes to mind.  It's not an old school Korean joint, but the twists to the familiar Korean fare make for a great eating experience!  The friendly service makes this even more of a destination.  While the food is a bit overpriced, we always look forward to heading to downtown Arlington Heights for a delicious meal at Ttowa.

The standouts here include the Belly Bun, kalbi (short ribs), and the black bean noodles with crispy shrimp.  There's also a lot of love for the crispy eggplant banchan with the sweet sauce on top.  The Belly Bun (it comes with 4 pieces) is so delicious.  The pork belly has a pronounced grilled flavor and is complimented nicely by the pickled cucumber and sweet soy sauce.  The kalbi is prepared well and has a nice sweetness that you would expect from this Korean BBQ short rib dish.  Jajangmyeon (black bean noodles) is one of my favorite Korean dishes, and there's a version here as a special with crispy fried shrimp that's simply awesome.  And don't skip those chicken wings!  The spicy seafood rice cakes though we're just alright; the mussels and clams were very small.  Ttowa does have a nice beer list so make sure to grab a cold one while you're here.

The owners are friendly so the good service is no surprise.  The prices though are high for the portion sizes so it's easy to rack up a sizable bill.  Nevertheless, we'll keep coming here for the excellent food and service.

Been back to ttowa twice this week! Just can't get enough of this place. We love their belly buns and jumbo dumplings for apps. We always get a bibimbap bowl to share and then usually another entree. The short ribs and pork belly with Brussels sprouts are both great. The owner Terry is amazing and keeps you coming back for more! If you haven't been here it's a must in downtown arlington heights!

"TTOWA" means "come again" in Korean but after trying this place I'm not sure I will "come again". 

7pm dinner on a Saturday night and we were the only Asian customers in the whole place.  Every table was full plus a ton of people waiting for tables but again none were Asian.  After tasting the food I realized why.

The menu lists all the traditional Korean items but didn't taste like anything traditional.  All the dishes we had were very westernized.  Too sweet and too salty.

Potstickers were way too crunchy.  Don't know if it was overcooked or if they were suppose to be like that.  My kids would like the crunch tho!  The flavors inside were ok.  Liked that they had tofu n mushrooms in them that I can see n taste!!  Tried the veggie n meat but liked the veggie better.  Soy n Siracha as dipping sauces.  Nothing special.  None of their sauces were anything special.  All straight out of a bottle.  They probably know that they can get away with that with their clientele.  

Spicy chicken was ok but it was just chicken.  Not even any onions grilled with it.  But my friends seem to like it.  It's just not what I'm use to.

Big platter of bossam (pork belly wraps) pork belly itself was good.  But the accompaniments were way off.  No napa cabbage but red leaf lettuce.  A weird bean paste sauce...runny n sweet n this powder (which is normally a bean powder for rice cake) was on the platter.  What were we suppose to do with that?   Radish topping was so thin n broken that it looked like scraps of leftovers. 

There were 8 of us and we ordered a million things from the menu but the stars are for the veggie potstickers, the plain pork belly AND serious kudos to a Korean restaurant that does amazing business with a majority of none-Asian clients!!  

But if you are looking for traditional Korean, this isn't it.
I'm not gonna write it off totally yet.  Maybe I ordered the wrong things or went on a off day.

First time here and everything was delicious. The staff was courteous and nice atmosphere. I've been craving the lollipop chicken appetizers since we went. It was a little more expensive than places in Chicago, but I'm assuming it's due to  location. Downside is we had to drive around looking for parking, then walk a few blocks. Will definitely go back when I can splurge. We ordered 3 appetizers and one meal, drank water and the bill with the tip came out over $75

It's so good that you gotta go again, and again, and again.  The food is not only amazing, but the family that owns the restaurant, makes you feel like you're at home.  Terry is the kindest man, East of the Mississippi.

Had a pretty good meal as a group of 4 on a Saturday night. This particular restaurant is  few blocks away from Arlington Heights metra station,and seemed very quite popular.  I was quite happy to learn there was no wait at the time. We were quickly served Banchan pretty much right after we placed the orders. They were pretty good nothing really stood out though .

The Server was very descriptive when we mentioned some of us are vegetarians and he pretty much pointed out every dish on the menu that can be made vegetarian.

He insisted us to try the Dduk BokKi which were spicy rice cakes in some sauce. This was one of the best korean starters that I have had before. I would really recommend people to try the Dduk Bokki. We tried the chicken buns which seemed very popular in reviews. Tasted excellent but were kind of tiny .

For the Korean main course Bibimbap is my choice.They offer  (Dolost Bibimbap) for 2$ extra. And i would recommend the dolsot which comes in hot stonepot.

A bit more expensive for the offerings and portions but overall its a solid korean spot for suburbs. 

Service was quite good as we didn't have much trouble getting attention of the wait staff. Although it wasn't quite packed while we were eating so I would certainly think during peak times service might suffer some more.

Tip: For a yelp check -in you get a free korean dessert which contains 2 korean donuts with two scoops of Green tea and Red bean icecream . Must try !!!

I came here on a Saturday night and the wait was about 30 minutes for two. Terry our server went out of his way multiple times to let us know he was sorry and kept us in the loop about our table. His customer service was 10/10. 

The food was prepared and delivered very nicely. The bulgogi was some of the best I've had yet. We also got a free dessert thanks to yelp check in. 

Only downfall was they do not have kimbop anymore!

Hands down, one of our favorite places!!!  The friendliness of the staff, their helpfulness, the quality, taste, and portions are second to none.  Three trips already in the last year, and we find ourselves always looking forward to the next visit. In a word, phenomenal!

We had a special occasion birthday celebration dinner here, and our meal was delicious.  The young owner host is still as friendly as ever and showed me his craft beer list and it is surprisingly quite good.  He even had 3F's Zombie Dust available on this night, but I went with a very enjoyable Surly Coffee Bender (nice brown ale with coffee flavor).   On the menu tonight:

- Spicy pork and chives with steam buns appetizer
- Pork belly lettuce wraps (for two)
- Bulgogi
- Grilled beef short ribs, with a unique bacon kimchi stew (nice BBQ like flavor from the bacon)

The beef short ribs were a highlight - excellently marinated and quite large.  We found the pork belly for the lettuce wraps to be a little on dry side, but overall a very nice dinner, and you really can't go wrong on any of the dishes and their flavors here.

Last night was my second time at Ttowa. The first time I went with a large group of friends and had a big variety of shared dishes. Everything was fantastic. Last night I went with my husband and the food was even better than I remembered. We started with the eggplant buns and then split the sautéed pork belly and beef rice bowl. The entrees were served with delicious small side dishes and an amazingly good sauce. Seriously, the food was so good I plan on getting take out later this week. I really like the small, friendly restaurant and am so happy it's in my own town. Go eat there immediately!

I don't live in the area, actually drove out of my way to check this place out! What can I say, it's the food lover in me. Our waitress, didn't catch her name, was sweet. She gave off a nice welcoming feeling like you're at your mom's place and she just wants you to be comfortable and eat up! 

The food was flavorful and the free dessert was a nice threat! It was good too, not all things free are low quality.  Would definitely eat here more often if I lived in the vicinity.

Let me just start by saying I absolutely love Ttowa (). I've been to this restaurant on a number of occasions and have yet to be dissatisfied. 

For the appetiser we got the half pork belly buns and half the chicken buns. Once they arrived they didn't last gone and were gone in about 2 minutes. They are so delicious. There is so much flavour. You can't go wrong choosing either one. Or split it half and half like we did! They serve you 4 buns. Depending if you get the chicken buns it's $10 and the pork belly are $12. If you love these and you wanted to keep eating them, then you need to order this next....


Today I decided to get the Spicy Chive Pork with 10 buns. It is $19 so if you feel like splurging a little get this. It is super delicious. They give you enough filling to fill every single bun fully and still have more filling left over. The buns are super soft and easy to hold to put the filling into. It is a very filling dish. They weren't stingy on the pork filling so I ended up taking some home. This is another reason I love Ttowa, lots of places like to be stingy and not give you enough but they exceeded that. They give you plenty to eat.  I highly recommend this dish. You will be very satisfied. Everything was cooked well and couldn't fault this dish one bit. You won't regret it!

This is the best there is for authentic, yet a little classier Korean grub. It's not your typical Korean bbq where you cook it yourself, which can be hit or miss. It's also not Korean bar food. It's more like Korean fine dining but I'm not very classy when I go - I order pretty much the whole menu every time I go and eat like a pig. I bring people here all the time and without fail, everyone has loved it and been back. And I'm such a great influence, they only know how to order like I do - one of everything! No joke, I've had everything on the menu including their specials (that's how often I go) and I've not been disappointed once. If you're a beginner, try the chicken wings or seafood pancake for an appetizer and the beef or chicken bimimbop as your entree. Order a bottle of wine with that and you're all set!

I wanted to come here after I saw it on an episode of Check Please.  My expectations were high, especially after it was hyped up by my friends.  I came during a week night and service was on the slow side and the food wasn't spectacular.  I might just have to come back and try something else.  The waiter brought over 6 banchan dishes, none were that tasty.  I did enjoy the complimentary yogurt drink at the end of our meal.

Wang Mandoo - $9 - These steamed buns were good, but nothing out of the ordinary.

Dduk Bokki (Spicy Rice Cake) $9 - These rice balls were not really my thing.  

Sizzling sauteed Pork Belly $18 - This dish was good.  The sauce went well with the meat and the Brussel sprout.

Wow. Is all I'm going to say! Best Korean I've ever had! I had the pork belly. Has the perfect amount of spice and just the right amount to feel satisfied! Not to mention the staff is super knowledgeable of their menu and give great recommendations. Can't wait to bring my family when they visit from New Mexico!
Definitely try the very popular rice cakes appetizer. We tried the squid main dish and it was delicious. Definitely a place that is on our favorite list.

We recently moved to the area and had been craving Korean food. Found this place on Yelp and decided to stop in. 
They have a good selection of menu items and other specials. I will say the portions are all shareable, even the kid's portion. The price is a little high, but that may be this area. Like I said we are new to AH. The service was on point, even though it was actually busy for a Wed evening. We also checked in for the free donut and it was a substantial dessert, not like other "free" incentives for checking in.  Food was fresh and delicious...and when I asked for a to go container for my Bulgolgi he gave me extra rice. Overall, we will be returning. They also have take out. Parking was limited.

Great food, would definitely go again.  

The service was great, very friendly and fast.  Waiter recommended a few items that were a hit.

They even serve ice cream at the end of the meal

I came here for lunch on a Friday when visiting a friend in Arlington Heights. I had no idea what I wanted to eat, and neither did she, but we both picked out our top 3 and TTOWA happened to be on both of our lists to try! What a coincidence!

The restaurant was very clean and the ambience was very relaxing, we were the only ones in the place which was surprising. We started off with asian pancakes which was delicious (always a hit for my non-asian friends) and she also enjoyed the side dishes. There was a nice selection, but nothing out of the ordinary for a Korean restaurant.

The food was also very tasty too. She enjoyed her soup ($13) and I enjoyed my bim bim bop ($10), I do wish there was a lunch special though. Overall, TTOWA was a solid and enjoyable lunch! It didn't blow me out of the water, but the prices matched the food quality and service.

It was a dark& stormy night...I was craving mondoo.... TTOWA  came through& with gusto!
Friendly attentive service, manager stops by each table to make sure everyone is happy. Place is small& gets very busy on the weekends. With food this amazing they'll need to expand their digs. Try the grilled pork belly buns( oh yeah!) 
Spicy chive pork( happy place found) fiancé had the steak special ( incredible flavor& melt in your mouth tender) use the way of the Yelp to unlock a free desert

This is one my favorite restaurants! The owners are all so friendly and really care about their customers. You can really taste that they put their hearts into the food the create. I used to go so often that they knew exactly what I would order whenever I went. I haven't been able to go as much lately because work gets crazy and since it's not exactly close to where I live but I have been getting major cravings. It was to the point I tried to make my own version at home...and long story short, I failed. No one can make the taste they can here. If you go, you have to try their dak bun, belly bun, and ddukbokki. My mouth is literally watering as I write this.

I've been feeling the Asian food craving lately, so I decided to check out TTOWA. I have no idea why the restaurant consists of five letters, and I don't really know why they haven't updated their online menu recently (at least for lunch specials). So I went for the fallback option, which was bibimbap. 

I really liked it. Nicely marinated steak, perfectly fried egg. All of the vegetables were consistently cut, and the portion size was quite a bit for less than $10. The white rice was perfectly cooked and chopstick-friendly. 

I think what stood out to me was the sauce that comes with the bibimbap. Not being Korean, unfortunately I have no idea what's in it. I do know that it's incredibly flavorful and a different kind of spicy without being hot, which helps bring together everything else in the dish.  I was also a fan of the miso soup on the side. 

I'm looking forward to exploring some more of TTOWA's menu!

This place made me really really sad.

The food was not good at all and the service was even worse. Honestly, I'm really not sure why the waiter completely ignored us when he was super nice and welcoming to every other table around us. We heard him generously offer to refill the banchan for the table next to us while we sat there with our banchan plates also empty... It took him forever to even bring out the banchan while it seemed like everyone else got theirs immediately after they ordered. It took him forever to take our order. We all felt incredibly unwelcome.

The food was pretty meh. The banchan was just weird and incredibly unauthentic. The food was marginally better but this place is definitely not authentic at all. We also got the free donuts with the yelp check in and for some weird reason the donut was cut into tiny little scraps? It was really confusing.

I definitely do not see myself ever returning here.

I liked it! FYI- It is no longer BYOB! The service is good and it's a pretty low key spot which I liked. Parking is a bit tough at night but we drove around a little bit and found something.
What we got:
- Chicken wings- good but not amazing. They are super small!
- Bite sized dumplings- pretty good but next time I want to try the buns
- Pork belly dish- good, a bit spicey!
- Bulgogi- tasty but I've had better
- BBQ ribs and bacon kimchi stew- LOVED the ribs. I would come back for these. The stew was an interesting flavor. I liked it but couldn't eat that much of it.
- All the side dishes- I liked the fusiony dishes like the little fried dishes and broccoli with aoli. I'm not sure on kimchi but that's just me,

We got the free dessert with the Yelp check in which was good but didn't blow my mind. It was nice that it came with two scoops of ice cream also!
This is my favorite place to come, food taste great and everyone is friendly and helpful. Had the bimbibop with beef, very good

When we walked in we were greeted and taken to our seat. They were very kind and professional! They brought out some banchan or side dishes which were pretty tasty. They offer you more if finish them. I got the dakkalguksu or what they called chicken noodle soup, which was a little on the bland side. My bf got the soondubu which was okay not anything super exceptional. My bf sometimes comes here for the bibimbap for lunch when he has work and he thinks it's really good! Maybe try to stay away from the soups and go for the entrees!

Was my first time here when I met my parents here for lunch. There wasn't a lunch crowd so we had really great service. Get the bibimbap. The presentation, quality, and quantity are all there. The waiter was able to prepare it with the sauce. Couldn't ask for a better dish. So happy to try this place and if I'm in the area I think I would eat there. The only thing I didn't like which isn't huge is we couldn't get a pot of tea. They only had individual servings.

OK so there are not many Korean BBQ in the Algonquin area so we had to travel to Arlington Heights for this. Was worth it. 

First Arlington Heights downtown is like the best parts I like about Chicago, minus the dirt, homeless and crazy young college kids. Sadly no hipsters in AH.

I have had Korean BBQ only once before at a martial arts picnic, cooked by the Korean Masters. Was tasty so I was looking forward to it. 

The place is cozy, small and feels homey. I like that. The food was a bit more expensive then I expected, but the saving grace was the complimentary coffee after the meal!

Apparently some Korean BBQ have grills in the table to cook the meat, so my partner said. This place did not. So if you are looking for that bit of showmanship, this is not the place.

I had the BBQ pork back, simply because well its pork back come on. I wanted to experiment. 

When my dish arrived at first I thought, no way can I eat that much. Was I wrong, if I could have licked the hot plate I would.  I used the rice to soak up all the yummy sauce! The pork back, I had feared may be chewy like uncooked bacon. Not so, it was crispy, meaty and perfect.

My lunch partner had the bbq chicken, which looked like chicken wings but was not. She said it was good and only mildly spicy.

Then the complimentary coffee. This really made me happy. I was "surprised and delighted" They said it was Korean coffee, and I never knew there was such a thing. The glasses it came in looked so cool, elevated it. We asked what the coffee was and they brought us a sample. It was an instant brand, with some honey sweeter.  Sort of took the mystery out of it, but it was great. 

And do check in and get the free donut dessert. The description does not do it justice. It comes with green tea ice cream and some other flavor. The warm bits of donut were great!

All in all, great. I would give it 5 starts, but the prices were a touch high. Highly recommended!
The food here is excellent or better and the family type atmosphere that the staff conveys is helpful and warm

Forewarning: You have to understand that this review is written by a Korean person who eats and enjoys authentic Korean food. With that being said, I agree with a lot of the 5 star reviews on here. The food is delicious and it's a GREAT way for people to try Korean food. However, it's a bit of a twist on authentic Korean food. It's not fusion, but it's a little Americanized. I think if people tried the dishes at its fullest authenticity, it would be on the Travel Channel's Bizarre Foods with Andrew Zimmern. Especially if this is your first time trying Korean food. Anyway, on to my review.

SERVICE: I'm actually pretty torn, because the servers are really really nice and you can tell that the owner really cares about providing awesome, attentive service. There were actually a few issues, which he personally came to apologize for and rectify. For instance, since we were quoted 30 minute wait time for dinner, but we actually waited close to 45 minutes, he offered us complimentary dumplings. Free food? Hell yeah, I'm OK with that! But the servers were way too busy and all over the place that they forgot to put in one of our orders and also forgot to bring us new bowls of rice for us to eat with our other dishes. I mean, come on, Koreans gotta have their rice in their meal. It's just a given.

I have been living in Arlington Heights for 3 years and wish I had tried this place sooner! My husband and I have come here twice now in the last month  and both food and service are top notch! Servers are very attentive to the tables. We love their steamed bun appetizers, especially the belly buns, such a unique flavor plus they give you tons of meat.  Their pork dumplings are also amazing.  They bring out little dishes of different side items too, we love the cucumbers and eggplant chips (they might be zucchini.. I don't know but they are delicious!)

For entrees, the Dak kalbi (spicy chicken) is my favorite so far, also tried sweet and sour chicken special last time, both dishes the meat was so tender and flavorful. My husband got the bibimbap with the spicy pork in a hot stone bowl which was pretty cool too, as he was eating it the rice continued to cook and got a crispy texture to it. The spicy stuff is definitely spicy so beware in case you don't like super hot but it is SO good.

Definitely our new favorite place! They also have a pretty decent craft beer selection :)

Probably the best American-Korean restaurant in the area. The dishes are generally sweeter and less spicy. To cater to American tastebuds I suppose.

Highly recommend the spicy squid.

Absolutely delicious food. Pork Belly Platter was our personal favourite with a solid portion of meat and unlimited lettuce for wraps. Bone marrow and rice cake soup was a little bit bland, but rich. The seafood pancake was good, but small portion. Friendly staff that is knowledgable and attentive, you guys definitely left a lasting impression on us. Kudos to the chef. Our only grip was the price. Our dinner was near $100 for two. Sticker shock.

We came in here on a Saturday night and it was packed with a 45-minute wait. The host seemed like he was totally overwhelmed but promised to call us when our table was ready. 45 minutes later, we were seated.

We had an assortment of dumplings, the scallion pancake, and the bibimbop for a main (they were kind enough to put the hot sauce on the side for me). My brother- and sister-in-law had the pork belly. I love that the pork belly came with these tiny side dishes you could try, each with its own flavor.

We unlocked the free dessert option, so we also got a heaping portion of green tea and red tea(?) ice cream and a bready-date dessert "donut."

They thought that they took too long giving us our check--they didn't at all--and so they gave us a free bottle of sake! Totally unnecessary but very kind of them, and we drank it all.

The food here was really top notch. I enjoyed every dish. I wouldn't expect something this good in the burbs, and I'll definitely be back.

Very good dumplings especially pork belly.  The portions are kind of small but galbi was flavorful and samgyupsal was made similar to spicy chicken dish.  Also, we tried tofu dish here which was fine.

Overall a good spot for Korean food!

One of the best places in Arlington Heights. Excellent quality, extensive menu, pleasant staff and cozy atmosphere. Prices are good for the wonderful food. I highly recommend paying the extra for the "hot rock" which makes the rice crispy and rich. So good! 

Service is a bit slow, so don't go if you're in a hurry.

Delicious Korean food served in a modern cozy space. 
One of my fave appetizers is the seafood pancakes, with a delicious green onion and sesame oil dipping sauce. My bulgogi was amazing. The seasoning plates are petite and pack a flavorful punch.  I love the aluminum chopsticks. They're one of the few places that serve Orange Crush!

Very nice list of local or micro brews and assortment of wines.

A definite must if you are in the area and love Korean food.
Love the food! Authentic Korean food. Trust me I KNOW KOREAN FOOD. And this is it! Would definitely come back again. Definitely get the spicy pork buns!
Amazing food! Great flavor to all their dishes. The waiter is not always the friendliest.

The home of my favorite dish - Bossam! It's a pork dish, commonly served in Korean restaurants/bars but the way they prepare it is out of this world! It is on the pricey side and it's a lot of food (it's meant to be shared). But I can't help needing to go get this on a regular basis. It comes with either lettuce and perilla leaves () that you can wrap the pork in and place different toppings. Sorry my description doesn't do it justice so I'll post a pic!

I've been here numerous times before. And their dishes are good. Try the seafood ddukbokgee - and ask them to make it into a fried rice at the end after it's done. They are also known for their chicken galbi as well. 

True it's not a "authentic" Korean restaurant. It has some fusion elements to it, but I say it's unique Korean dishes (like the seafood ddukbokgee). They don't give you a lot of side dishes (like sansoo, but who cares?) but you can always ask for more. Personally, I prefer the uniqueness of Ttowa over any other cookie cutter Korean restaurant. 

The ambiance, food, service and all around good times at Ttowa makes you want to return multiple times. I can tell others feel that way too as the owner greeted several regulars while I was there. Ttowa in Korean means "to come back..." And I can't think of a more appropriate name for this place.
This is my new favorite restaurant.  We have been there twice and have been blown away with the food every time.  Staff is friendly.  You have to order the spicy rice cake appetizer.  Incredible.
Didnt regret driving from NW Indiana to Arlington Heights, IL. Food is absolutely amazing. Staff is very helpful. We will be back . . .
Excellent restaurant!  The food was phenomenal.  The drinks were very affordable, and the wait staff was friendly and attentive.  We will definitely be coming back!

I'm a newbie to authentic Korean food, so I'm thrilled to have had the opportunity to have TTOWA be my first experience! I mean these guys are top notch.

I started with a glass of wine, and followed it with a shot of chum churum amongst the fellow yelpers I was dining with. Now if that's not a festive way to start a meal, I don't know what is!

(Note: They are no longer a BYOB establishment, but they do have a great drink menu!)

I started with indulgences like dumplings and panchan, then was served an array of sides like kimchee, raw broccoli with a red sauce, apple salad, and beef pancakes. All new to my palate and all delicious!

For my meal I went with the spicy chive pork with steamed buns. If you love spicy, flavorful food - this option is for you! Not only are the buns little nuggets from heaven, but the pork mixture is to die for. It is definitely spicy, so make sure you're up for it :)

In a nutshell, from TTOWA you'll get authenticity, top notch service, a fun and friendly atmosphere, and of course... food you'll be dreaming of for weeks to come!

TTOWA is fantastic!! They serve high quality Korean food, which is really missing in Arlington Heights. I definitely recommend their Dak Tigim which are chicken wings that they call Lollipops because they really do look like tootsie rolls! They also have really great bibimbab, which generally is hard to screw up, but their quality meats add a nice touch to it. I've never dined in but I can say they have good take out service!

I couldn't wait to check this place out after seing it on check please.
The food was good, service was good, the place itself is small and dated... Really dated.
I wouldn't go back on our night out or date. It's more like a casual family place. Although everything was really spicy, not sure about kids being able to eat there.
Pork belly didn't blow my mind at all.
Rice cake seafood dish was not something I would keep thinking about nor order again.

I love this place. Terry, the owner/manager and the rest of the staff are very friendly and have excellent customer service. The food is amazing. The dak bun is one of my favorites, and the traditional mandoo is great too. I recently found out that the smaller sized mandoo only comes fried, which is disappointing because I prefer them steamed. Not a big deal though, because you can just get the larger sized ones instead. 

They also have a nice selection of craft beer!

Stopped here for a quick 45 minute lunch break during our cpr/first aid class. Service was extremely punctual and the people we're very friendly. They had amazing lunch deals and absolutely incredible food. I had the veggie bibimbop and it tasted perfect. My boyfriend had the dupbob and said the meat tasted absolutely amazing. We will probably never be in Arlington heights again but if we were we'd definitely come back.

OK, holy cow this place is good.  Shame on all of my AH friends who never mentioned it to me!

All of the buns were great, the appetizers were tasty, and the vegetarian dishes hit the spot like I never would have expected.  The 6 small sides that come with the meal are each tasty and fantastic compliments to the main dishes.

I ordered the Ojingeo (sizzling squid) and it was fantastic, but after trying a bite of a fellow Yelper's sizzling pork belly I felt like I should order more to go!  I'm a sucker for all forms of bacon, but this was way up there in my books.

The Bibimbab looked fantastic as well, and - as the name implies, mixed right in.  Worth getting next time around for a simple, but well balanced flavor.

We had doughnuts and ice cream for desert as well, and I must say this is the only time I've ever liked green tea ice cream - a great accomplishment for TTOWA.  The doughnuts were great also, and it made for a nice dessert that wasn't too heavy.

If I was any closer, I'd try to have a reserved seat weekly.  TTOWA is definitely great and worth a trip!

The food was sooooo good! I was in foodie heaven!!! The server knew the menu inside out and helped us curate an unforgettable meal! We started with the chicken spicy buns, and fried rice cakes, there was so much texture and nuance in each dish. The soft buns, are more like Russian ladushki, or little savory blini's, and served stuffed with deliciously flavored meat, fermented chili sauce has never been better. The rice cakes are crispy and creamy at the same time, like gnocchi. For our main we shared the pork belly wraps, which I swear I tasted bits of buttery cinnamon!  Divine!!!!! Go there.

My brother's college roommate is from South Korea and we wanted him to have a taste of home. My husband and I first heard of Ttowa by having their wing pops at the Arlington Heights Fest in August. We had a large party of 8 so we got to try several dishes. We started off with Dak Tigim (chicken wings), they are absolutely fantastic, a must try. We actually had three orders because they were so good. From there we ordered the seafood pancake and seafood noodle soup both were great. The nice thing about this place is that everyone can share. We also ordered, the spicy pork buns, fire grilled chicken, and sautéed pork belly. The sautéed pork belly was my favorite by bar. 

The server was very attentive as well as the owner . Overall we had a wonderful experience and will make the hour car ride anytime. I highly recommend Ttowa.
Yummy!  We dined here for lunch and thought the experience overall was great.  Food and service were on point!  A must try!

The range of flavors and dishes is fantastic. The welcoming atmosphere from the owner to the wait staff is unparalleled.  This is a must experience restaurant.  I have been several times and have had a wonderful experience every time, bar none.  I will definitely go back...again!!

First time having Bossam (serves 2 - they do it a little different here visually as far as I can tell) and I loved it.  Anytime I have bossam in the future, I will now expect it to be done similar to TTOWA.  So I guess if I have a craving for bossam, I'll be going here.  Please direct me otherwise if my experience is lacking.

Soup was meh with my fiancee describing it as "not-korean" tasting enough.  She ordered a "spicy" soup requesting hot sauce.  Unfortunately, they didn't have the standard fare to spice it up.  They seriously only added a single drop of concentrated hot sauce per her request...yea, she ended up unable to eat it at that point, lol.

Service:  So I put in a reservation for 730, but when I get there, they couldn't get me a table until 8 - ended up sitting at the bar in a terrible spot (where server traffics exit in/out).  I would have docked a star here, but their service policies excelled.  Okay okay, truthfully, they bought me off with free food (2 appetizers).

Checked in at Ttowa for the 13th time today and realized that I've never written a review! Ttowa is one of my absolute faves. I honestly can't say enough good things about it. Terri, the owner, treats us like family and greets our 3 years old twins like he's actually happy to see them, which if I'm being honest, they probably don't deserve as they are very messy eaters and not the most well behaved patrons. Despite that, my toddlers LOVE the food and we do too!

There are so many things we love on the menu and we rarely miss an opportunity to order all our favorites. Our typical meal starts with an order of Duk Bun, perfectly balanced Korean tacos (for lack of a better work) and Duk Bokki, spicy and crispy on the outside just the way I like it. I've ordered Duk Bokki at a bunch of other places and while it might not be exactly traditionally prepared at Ttowa it is elevated to a level of deliciousness not found elsewhere. We always get one to share and my oldest son gets an extra for his entree. 

Today I had the seafood and pork noodle soup. Savory, spicy broth and super tasty homemade noodles. My husband was feeling a little under the weather so he had his go to Kimchee Jiggae, like momma makes. The twins shared the Bulgogi. My little man, who I can barely get to eat a chicken nugget, would eat Bulgogi for breakfast, lunch and dinner. My daughter, who is a little more adventurous, loves the Banchan, small dishes of various pickled veggies, carmelized eggplant, kimchee, etc. Kimchee is her favorite! 

If you haven't tried Ttowa yet, you must, like now, get in your car and drive there. You won't regret it.

Visited Ttowa on Saturday night. We were seated immediately. The place was about 2/3 full. I was impressed with their selection of craft beers. We started out with a mix of the pork belly buns and dak buns. They were really delicious. We also had the ddukbokki which had a nice crisp outside and was chewy inside with great flavor. Wasn't a fan of the pineapple popcorn chicken. Ended with the donuts and icecream.  Service was really attentive. Overall 5 stars! Will come back.

Since there were about 10 Yelpers at the table, I will keep this really brief. Ttowa was a great experience. I'm sure that this spot is a Yelp favorite helped. But, that really does not matter.

We enjoyed everything from soup to nuts (or the Korean equivalent). Much of what we had was new to me. I really enjoy going to Korean restaurants - the food is exotic; the side dishes are wonderful. Ttowa in particular was great - the owner served us; he gave us a number of drinks and dishes to try on the house. The food was spectacular.

I plan to return to experience Ttowa with my family soon.

TTOWA is a must try!!

Location and Ambiance:
Location is average, and ambiance was fantastic!

Food:
The food was fantastic! Its small plate style and they have a unique twist on everything!

Staff:
The staff was extremely nice and knowledgeable of all their foods!

In summary, probably one of the best restaurants in Illinois as a whole! 

Thanks,
Connor Brady

WIthout a doubt, my FAVORITE restaurant in Arlington Heights. Menu is fantastic. I almost always get the dak buns to share with the table, then the kalbi short ribs in their addictive sauce... heaven. The little bowls with side dishes are always a nice compliment to my (inevitably) meat-heavy meal. Ask the super patient and friendly servers to identify them if you're uncertain. The beer list is great too - they even have my FAVORITE beer on tap, Off Color's Apex Predator, which pairs very well with the cuisine. Wish I could eat here every day!

I am torn - I have been here two times, and both times the food has been delicious - some of the best Korean I have had, but the service I had on my second visit was horrible.  Simply put, if I had the same service on my first visit, there would not have been a second visit.

Service was extremely slow - from being seated to leaving took over an hour and a half.  It would have been even longer if I hadn't grown tired of waiting for our server to return to our table to close our check and process my charge card since he was chatting with a table full of people and not noticing me sitting there trying to get his attention.

But, on to the good stuff...THE FOOD!  Everything we had was delicious (with the exception of the egg on the bibimbab - the yolk was completely cooked through and was not runny at all - quite the disappointment.  But it was more than outweighed by the delicious stuff, Dak Bun, dumplings and the appetizer rice cake.  

I loved the food both times and will return, hoping that the service I experienced the second time is the exception and not the standard.
Place was a mob scene but we got seated within 10 minutes anyway food was awesome as usual we get to go a lot we decided to eat in today all in all very enjoyable

Loving this tiny Korean joint in Arlington Heights! Surprised that I have never heard it before and it is not new!

The place was tiny but quaint and it's kinda tucked in between buildings. I barely noticed it. However, it's packed on a Friday night. We had to delay our reservation due to the wonderfully amazing Chicago traffic; and we had to wait about 15 minutes when we got there as they were maxed out.

We ordered tons of foods from grilled spicy  squids in hot plate, the seafood pancake aja paejun, the chap gae, dol bukki, jamboong or noodles in spicy broth with seafood and pork. Everything was very very tasty! I also loved the fact that we could eat Korean BBQ without getting stinky like smoke. I loveeeee that!! 

The owner and his crew worked their ass off to service all the tables. They're busy but they didn't skip a beat. They only thing I wish they would do better is the little side dishes. I wish they give more each and have more varieties. 

I redeemed a Yelp check in offer of free donuts and they did that with a smile and the donut was yummy. 

Not sure what Ttowa means and why they need two Ts for Ttowa. Maybe it was the same thing like if I would describe Rick Grimes from The Walking Dead. HOTT. It just seems that one T isn't enough.

4 and 1/2 must be Korean for 5 because this place is amazing! Highly recommend the pork belly and short ribs, it definitely filled the void in my hungry belly! Great wick service with top quality meets and seasonings. As a Korean bbq food enthusiast this is up there with some of the best!

I liked this place.  We came around 8 pm on a Friday night and it was BUSY, but we got seated right away.  We ordered some buns as an appetizer and I got kimchi jigae and my husband got budae jigae.  The food took a really, really, long time, so the waiter offered us some complimentary drinks, which I thought was a nice touch.  My only complaint was that the kimchi jigae and the budae jigae were extremely similar.  I normally expect spam in budae jigae, which I am not a fan of, but this version didn't have spam.  I kind of wish I would have ordered something more different than what my husband got, but oh well. Definitely go for the budae jigae if you are debating between the two.  It was slightly tastier :)

Food is very flavorful and deserves 4 stars. We tried 3 items and all were excellent. Service was dismal even though the lunch rush was over and there were hardly any other folks eating. Had to almost stand up and wave to get someone to come by our table. They also neglected to give us the numerous condiments that go with the entrees. When we pointed that out, they made excuses instead of saying that they forgot. Don't go if you are in a rush..... Meal will take longer than you expect due to how slowly things move here.

I love this place!  I've only had Korean food a few times in restaurants and enjoy everything about this place: the size,  the menu,  the beer selection,  the service!  Not sure if I would say it is a hidden gem because so many people know about it but it is more fantastically delicious than its humble exterior may suggest.  
If you haven't tried it and live in a half hour radius,  it would be a shame to miss it!
Great lunch special. Really enjoyed it. Super delicious eats. Parking is not so prime.

We had an appetizer of spicy rice cakes, and the main courses were marinated ribeye and bacon kimchi stew. Everything was amazing and delicious! 

The rice cakes are a force to be reckoned with because there is no other restaurant that makes them like they do here!

We were welcomed when we walked in and given excellent service! It is a very warm and friendly environment! I am definitely looking forward to coming back very soon! I highly recommend this to anyone who wants to try delicious Korean food with a twist and wants an adventure because downtown Arlington Heights has what your looking for... Ttowa!

I think this was a no go. Horrible service, cold food,  tiny portions, and large prices. It is no longer byob either fyi. The drive to Arlington Heights was not worth this truly mediocre dining experience.  It seems that they are resting on their laurels.

I convinced my family to give this place a shot. The owner was very understanding and accommodating with my gluten allergy. no belated reactions either. 

my parents declared the noodle soups way better than say, Chef Ping's homemade noodle soup. My brother actually said he'd come back just for the pork buns. I had the silky tofu soup that came out bubbling! it was delicious and hearty and warmed me up on the chilly day.

we're already planning our next trip back.

Ambiance: cute little bistro with limited seating. Gives an intimate atmosphere which is great for date nights.

Service: hands down best I've ever had. All servers are always smiling and so attentive. 

Food and drink: a brew will only cost you $3! For pretty good Korean beer. The food was phenomenal. Definitely get the steamed buns. The side dishes were all fresh paired well with the bugogi entree. 

Bang for you buck: the entire meal for 2 was only $32!!!!! SO WORTH IT

Overall: 5+ stars this is one of my favorite restaurants ever.

My husband and I are just sitting here shaking our heads in silence at how tasty everything was.  SO GOOD!!!  They were generous with the delicious banchan, and the servers were kind and wonderfully hospitable.  We moved into the area yesterday and they were recommending other local joints to check out.  My husband ordered the Dak kalbi and he was blown away.  Even non-adventurous eaters will love it.  I ordered the bibimbop.  I was looking forward to the crispy rice crust you get when it's served in a hot stone bowl, so I was a little sad that they don't serve it in one, but it was super tasty and the waitress made it the perfect level of spicy after asking me how I preferred it.  To top it off, we got the cinnamon donuts/ice cream dessert and our spoons were scraping the plate even when nothing was left to the eye.  Needless to say, we're already looking forward to coming back!  

For any fans of Del Seoul who move out to the burbs (like us) - we can't recommend this place highly enough!
Not your typical Korean restaurant.  Very creative, and a nice selection of craft beers.  We usually get a selection of appetizers as small plates.

So it's downtown AH, so it's a tad more upscale than the hole in the wall joints I'm used to in the city for Korean. I was ready to be overwhelmed with a table full of banchan (side dishes),  big bowl of rice all from ordering one dish - typical Korean style.

But... it's not and that's OK. FYI, banchan count is 6.

Ttowa threw me off a bit. It's been on my list to try as I'm exploring Korean food. Most of the time, it's so spicy I can barely taste anything or it's incredibly simple, it's virtuously tasteless. Here, the food was surprisingly well balanced and perfect for the Korean newbie. Plenty of flavors like kimchi, seafood, gochujang, black bean, but not overwhelmingly spicy or stinky. Really enjoyed the dak bun, beef bulgogi and seafood soup. The soup consisted of squid, mussels, clams, shrimp and noodles was my favorite, unfortunately, the actual name on the menu surpasses me. It's in the upper left corner of the menu, not hard to figure out. I was worried it would be super spicy and the owner psyched me out on the spiciness, but you know what, it was really perfect for me.

If anything, I would recommend this place for Korean foodie newbies to start here simply because the staff, the family service, is friendly and very helpful, not the angry ajumma pushing dishes around, although having the local experience makes things taste and feel authentic. Another time and place for that...

Came here for a girls dinner and this place was amazing. Service was great, really cute ambiance. 

So we kinda pigged out, hey it was girls night! So we got pork tacos- recommended by the Chef- it was perfect, they had vegetarian dumplings which also was great along with complimentary rice balls- this was one of my favorites! It was spicy and full of flavor with a great texture. 

The host talked be out of my bulogogi to a Chicken BBQ, he promised it would not disappoint and he was right! My friend who is a regular there got a BimBoBop with tofu, she enjoyed it without surprise. 

I love this place, such a great fix for Korean food, highly recommended and will be back!

FYI if you check in you get a free dessert!

TTOWA is hands down our favorite restaurant in the NW suburbs. You can read on and on about how good the food is (try the spicy rice cakes and spare ribs), but the team there is excellent. Even on busy nights, Terry treats everyone like family and given how cozy the restaurant is, he's always walking about and chatting with everyone. My wife and I make it a point to be regulars and Terry makes sure we get taken care of. Great food and great service!

Love this authentic place.  Homy fun. Great prices.  Low corkage fee which i love.  Small uninteresting wine list.  We usually just ask the server to pick his/her favorite options and we go with it.  Oh- nice rotating craft beers
Delicious. Try the pork bun appetizer and the amazing bimimab. The service is excellent, and the server made some great suggestions. Or second time here. We'll be back soon.

1) Food was excellent.
2) Service was excellent (even for being a very busy place).
3) BYOB.
4) Just go there, you wont regret it.

I'm sad to be giving this place such a meteocre rating.  My first red flag was there were only 2 tables that actually had Asian patrons.  Let's face it.... When it comes to ethnic restaurants, it's a great sign when you see that ethnic group also eating there.

But let's get to the food...I found it kinda strange that the Bibimbop was served cold.  When we inquired about it, they said that's not how it should be served & then kindly brought out another.  However that too was cold.  In fact, colder than the first.  Then a different server said that it becomes cold from the fresh vegetables in it.  But my question then is why isn't the rice, chicken & egg warm then?  I think bibimbop is traditionally served in a stone bowl that comes out sizzling.  The rice on the bottom gets deliciously crispy... And theirs had none of that.

Bulgogi is marinated grilled shortribs.  Sometimes at Korean restaurants you could cook it yourself at the table--fun to do with large groups.  This was not one of those places.  No big deal!  I'd rather have someone cook it for me anyway.  It was tasty but was very very small.  Lots of bones & not enough meat.  It seemed they were aware of this because the ones on the bottom has almost no meat.  As if they were hiding it by placing on the bottom. 

Panchan are lovely side dishes that you eat either before the meal or after the main entree is served.
