Usually when we go to Korean restaurants, they start to overtake the table in a wonderful foodie way!  I'm talking 25+ little dishes with various yummy things in them like Kim chi and pickled radishes.  At TTOWA, all we got were 5 little dishes to share at our table of 4.  I was really bummed!  The sides were barely even Korean.  1 was 3 bits of steamed broccoli, another was potato salad.

I so badly wanted a great Korean restaurant in the suburbs and was disappointed at how westernized this restaurant tasted.

This was my first experience at a Korean restaurant and I was very happy with the food!  For starters we chose some craft beers.  Yes!  I said craft beer at a Korean restaurant and a great selection too!!!  Woo-hoo!  The entrees we tried Sizzling Squid and Spicy Fire Grilled Chicken, both excellent, spicy but not too hot, just perfect!  I would definitely go back again and try other dishes.  The staff was nice, atmosphere good.
Service is good and the food caters to both the Korean and non-Korean palette.  Prices are a bit high compared to other Korean restaurants, but it's worth it for a pleasant night out.

In the summer of 2015 we tried Chicken Dak Bun at the downtown AH street festival. 

Since then we've gone back 3-4 times. We just get Dak Bun but I must say it is a super delicious meal. 4 Dak Bun for around $10.00, there's plenty of meat in them. Love it!

First let me say I love Korean barbecues and I have been on the search for a great place to eat in our area for a long time.  I usually go to 92town which is in our area and the family is so nice the food is great and they always treat us so well.
So I was skeptical when a friend recommended that I go to this new place for me in downtown Arlington Heights it had been featured on check please.
Let me say the staff was nothing but nice explained the dish that I was looking for and were very helpful from the beginning.
I will say that I found my new favorite Korean barbecue place after eating there last night.
They brought out the best kimchi that I have ever eaten they had this candied eggplant that was great and my favorite dish was better here than I've ever had it.
The only bad thing was the soup that comes with dinner was room temperature at best and had really no flavor very bland.
If you look at the Google search for this restaurant  it says that it is BYOB which it is no longer they have a nice selection of wines and beers and they no longer have the Korean sushi counter.

This place was great! We were a party of 6. The host was welcoming and polite. Our waiter was prompt and suggested a "tea" made from barley for my husband. We ordered the wings and Korean "tacos". 
After a few minutes we all ordered our main dishes: my husband and I ordered the braised pork belly lettuce wraps ($35/2), our friends ordered the braised pork belly w jalepeno and Brussels spouts, a chicken rice bowl, dumplings and they even went out of their way and made a fried rice for the other guest. Our food came with sides of kimchi, broccoli with a delish sauce, cucumber salad, and other tiny little dishes of goodies. I love kimchi. The host heard that and brought me a yummier spicer kimchi. So nice! The prices were good. We'll be back :)

Visited this establishment tonight ... here's the short story.

Great food.
Amazing Service.
Prices as expected for the level or service and quality of food.

Well done

What an awesome restaurant with delicious food!  We came on the Wednesday before Thanksgiving and didn't have reservations, but they were able to seat us immediately in the bar area in a comfy booth.

The server was very friendly and attentive, and service was very fast.

I had the All natural pepperoni flatbread as an appetizer, and it was delicious and crisp with ice chunks of topping.  I'm normally not a fan of pepperoni, but I really enjoyed that appetizer.

My main was the seafood paella, and it came with a ginormous lobster tail that was sweet and delicious.  The mussels were tiny but tasted good.  The sea bass and scallops and chorizo were only so-so.

Dessert was a pumpkin pie gingersnap mini dessert.  So sweet and delicious!  What a great way to finish our dinner.  :)

Great for large parties 
Service does not rush you and let's u take your time
Flavors are not compromised for the reasonable calories in each dish which is part of their core values 
Cedar plank salmon is very flavorful and the side veggies of asparagus carrots and potatoes are crispy and fresh and good portion size

Overall it was a fine establishment. I've been to the one in Chicago and I actually preferred this location much more. 


Parking was crazy. I arrived at about 530 on a Thursday and by the time my husband came at 545, he couldn't find a place to park. 

We had reservations and were seated right away. The place smelled delicious which is a very good sign. It was also packed. Again, a good sign. 

Our waiter was okay. I felt like he rushed us by consistently asking 'are you ready yet, or no?'  The time I asked him a question about the menu I felt like he snickered at my question. Oh well

We had peppers and shrimp for appetizers and I had the lamb shank and my husband had pasta.  Everything was very good. They were very gf friendly as well. 

We had a 20 dollar coupon, which made the bill easier on the eyes. 

I would most likely go back for drinks and appetizers.

I have to note the excellent service and non pretentious feel, I love the dessert shooters and all of the food is quite good, it really is...

A Piano man singing at the bar?!? I wasn't expecting live entertainment - brat pack songs are a steak house favorite of mine. 

The filet mignon, salmon, steak flat bread and all of the happy hour dishes were superb. The lamb chops and scallops required a second order for each item - both were that good! The presentation makes each dish and dessert alluring, especially the scallops served on a shell with sea salt. 

If you're in the area to shop at Woodfield mall, the shops at Woodfield or IKEA - come here for dinner and enjoy the ambiance and food.

Seasons 52 is one of my go to restaurants whenever I'm in Schaumburg for work. I like feeling as if I'm still eating somewhat healthy while traveling. It's been a couple years since my last visit and I don't remember the interior being so dark. I would have preferred a bit brighter lighting. I was seated in a booth near the bar and enjoyed the live music which was a nice touch for a Wednesday night. Overall the service was fine, and I thought my server found a good balance between being attentive but not overly intrusive which I really appreciated.

I ordered the wood-grilled pork tenderloin which came with a sweet potato mash, sauté of bacon, spring vegetables and zesty jus. I also ordered the caramelized sea scallops as an accompaniment. (Gotta take advantage of traveling on an expense account, haha.) There were four scallops served on a skewer over a melted lemon butter sauce. The lemon flavor was a bit strong, but overall the scallops were well-cooked and I enjoyed them. The pork tenderloin was slightly on the dry side. I would have liked more of the jus, which was good although not particularly zesty. Maybe this is a result of eating out so much lately, but my favorite part of the meal was the sweet potato mash and the spring vegetables. They were well seasoned and the vegetables tasted very fresh.

With the convenience of just being a 10-15 minute walk from my hotel, and the solid experiences I've always had, Seasons 52 will continue to stay on my list of restaurants to visit while in Schaumburg.

Stopped in for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.  The place is quite large, with plenty of tables and booths all around the restaurant.  They also have a large bar area as well.

The focus for food is on seafood.  Plenty of dishes around scallops, salmon, shrimp, trout, tuna, mahi maui, crab and lobster.  Lots of items to choose from, very healthy eats.  The seafood dishes come in salads, sandwiches, and entrees.  They also offer a wide variety different flatbreads as well.  One nice feature on the menu is the 'calorie' counter for each item on the menu.  Helps you make better selections.

I had the lump crab wedge salad and found it to be really good.  Could have used a tad less zesty mustard dressing as I felt it took away from the crab flavor, but that is just my preference.  The better have had the crab cake sandwich and she enjoyed it.  Her sandwich also had the zesty mustard dressing and she really liked it.  

Though I did not partake in any adult beverages, but I did run through the wine menu.  The wine menu was put together extremely well, very impressive.  Great lay-out, explanation and selection of wines.  The list offers winery names that are not widely heard of, which I love.  The prices were extremely reasonable for bottles.  

I would certainly hit up this place for lunch or dinner any time and will definitely run through the wine list.  Healthy eats, friendly enough service and a great eclectic wine list make this place worth coming too.

What a pleasant surprise! The great reviews definitely speak to their quality, taste, and service. My husband and I had the pleasure of trying their 'lobster & fresh mozzarella flatbread', 'asian-glazed chilean sea bass entree', 'wood-grilled filet mignon', and the wine flights. All were made to perfection! The sea bass was a tad bit bland in my opinion (usually I think everything is too heavy or salty), but oh man... that bass was silky smooth.

Make sure to ask for the happy hour menu (or the 'flights and flatbread' menu) as they are offered everyday until 6:30PM. They didn't bring this menu to us until we had asked. The wine flights are definitely worth it (unless you already have your absolute favorite wine to try). They bring you 3 flights and you get to pick your favorite wine (out of the three) for a full glass! What a steal!

Pretty darn good food with good service. I Admire their mission and what they are going for with trying new things every week. However, it is extremely expensive and one should be ready to spend a lot of money. Just to note for those who aren't prepared. Desserts that they put in front of everyone are not included even though they make it sound like it's part of your meal.

Just stopped by here for a drink and ended up staying for dinner at the bar! I am happy we decided to eat here, it's a really cool place with good ambience. Only reason for not awarding 5 stars was the service. A little bit slow but they were super busy.

We started with a gin rickey and a glass of malbec, followed by scrumptious appetizers. The pesto chicken flatbread was mouth watering and amazing. The lump crabcake was also delicious although a little on the small side. We decided to go light on the entrees! I had the flat iron steak salad which did not disappoint. Steak cooked medium and a good sized bed of salad. My wife had the grilled salmon salad which was really tasty and super fresh fish.

Will be back soon to try more off the realy good looking menu!

One of the things I like about this place is they don't over do the portions.  You get a sufficient taste of a dish without getting halfway through and wondering if you should push on and finish it, or stop and take it home for leftovers.  The vegetables are fresh, the sauces are not overbearing and, if you've looked at any of the pictures for this place, you can see their desserts come in oversized shot glasses.  It's enough for a few bites and they are the perfect sweet complement to your dinner.  

I don't go there often enough.  I should stop in sometime just for a drink and to enjoy the bar's piano player,or even just to be bad and make a meal out of a group of their desserts!

Seasons 52 will guaranteed give the best service. We were greeted right away, treated very well, and served with the upmost quality. Though my dad's filet mignon, which he usually loves at this spot, tasted a little too salty that night, our server took it back and took it off the bill, as all nicer restaurants should do. Other than this mishap, we had a great experience. The ambience is intimate and elegant, with dim lights and beautiful decorations. Wine selections are great here also. 

As for food, I really like how the menu is seasonal. It really makes me feel like I'm eating the freshest of foods. Brussel sprouts were pretty tasty and crispy. Salmon was excellently prepared. The second filet mignon dish that came out (the non salty one) was also excellent and flavorful. 

Overall, we had an amazing experience here and would love to be back! Only downsides are that it can get really crowded, and you will probably need to get valet parking!

We came for a light lunch before our Twins game. Jennifer R was our server and she was wonderful. We had the following dishes and they were all excellent and beautifully presented. 

AHI TUNA TARTARE
layered with wasabi-avocado mousse, tropical salsa, Hawaiian sea salt crisps 

CARAMELIZED GRILLED SEA SCALLOPS
creamy lemon risotto, English peas, roasted asparagus

WARM CALIFORNIA GOLDEN BEETS SALAD
Laura Chenel goat cheese, toasted pistachios, micro basil 

Dessert was a little mini Smore in a shotglass. 

Very nice place.

I've been to a few of these around the country and I'm a big fan. We got there on a Saturday night around 6:30 and were told the wait for a table was until about 8:45 but there was open seating in the bar area. We had a number of options to pick from there and we saddled up the bar and ordered a couple of glasses of wine. They have a very good wine selection that is fairly priced, and we got our pours quickly and placed our food order.

If you sit at the bar there is a piano player there, so you can enjoy some live music while you wait. Our food came out quickly and it was exceptionally tasty and just as described. We got a steak flatbread, white chili, and field greens salad. There are a number of things I like about the menu and the food - the items are reasonably sized, they control the calories by adding a nice combination to make it tasty without going overboard with sauces and other high-calorie items, the food is very fresh and flavorful (and you can taste it since it's not drowned out), and  there are a lot of options.

We topped it off with a couple of 'shooters' of desert - again, a nice-sized portion that has great flavor without being over the top.

They have free valet parking, and the parking lot was very full when we arrived and when we left, but there were seating options available the whole time.

Went here for dinner on a saturday and if you don't have a reservation, you may wait for awhile. Got lucky, family of 4 got seated by the bar. It was nice to a see a female piano player/singer as entertainment. she sort of reminded me of Sarah Bareilles, yes, she had that kind of voice.
husband was looking for fish and there's not of places in the NW suburbs that would cater to that, aside from it being fried.  
our server gave us a lot of time to decide, more than we needed to. Husband had the cedar plank roasted salmon, he really liked the roasted veggies. Daughter and myself that flatbread and son had the maui tuna crunch salad.  With a son who eats a lot, he ordered pepperoni flatbread. We were satisfied with what we had and we even ordered desserts which we usually don't.
Desserts came in a plate and you had to select what you want.  I had the creme brulee which wasn't that sweet which I liked.
Any opportunity to come back here again, I will.

We dined at Seasons 52 for our wedding anniversary tonight.  The food was delicious, our drinks were masterfully crafted and our server, Heather S. really took the time and made the effort to insure we had a wonderful dining experience.  We received a personalized card wishing us a Happy Anniversary, a champagne toast and very attentive service, on top of the great food and drinks.  Highly recommend Seasons 52 for any special occasion you might be celebrating--they will help you make the occasion a memorable one.

My fiance to be and I came here on our 2 year anniversary. The evening did not start out well, as our server brought water and then disappeared. My boyfriend and I discussed who would say something - as I knew that it would just result in us getting upset and ruining the evening. The service manager was on duty, and took care of everything- including the ENTIRE meal!

Our server came over, explained she'd been slammed, but that it was NO excuse. That we were celebrating a special evening, and it was our first time there. She went out of her way to make sure that our meal was amazing, and more than made up for everything had happened. 

We asked that they charge us for SOMETHING, and she asked why, and I said "Because neither one of us have any cash....." and she realized that what we were saying is that we wanted to make sure that we could tip her. They brainstormed, and we were charged $.1 for room rental, so that we would have the ability to tip our waitress, and the various other staff who helped make our anniversary wonderful. 

We're definitely going back, because everyone makes mistakes - but it takes stand up people to admit it, and make amends.

Even though I found out this was a chain restaurant,  the food was amazing and the waitress was very personable and explained the menu well. I was so happy to be eating at a "fresh" food restaurant with unique menu options.

We visited Seasons 52 last weekend while Grandma and Grandpa watched the kiddos (don't get out quite as much as we used to, LOL). It was super busy! Complementary valet though, so that is nice. Our server was nice and friendly and explained the menu well. I love that they have the calories shown. I am kinda into healthy eating and so this is a really nice addition. Sometimes you have no idea the salad has way more calories than the sandwich so it is nice to be able to make good choices. I totally couldn't tell that they were lower in calorie either. We had the lobster flat bread which was super thin and crispy, very good! We also had the caprese salad and they split it for us which was really nice. I had the scallops, which were awesome and my husband had the porkchop. I even had enough to take home! We shared 3 of the mini desserts which are so cute and delish! We actually wrote them in hopes they would open one where we live:) Love this place, wine was great too and really nice atmosphere!

Sad to say, the food was great, but servers spotty at best. Rushed, rude and non committal about seating, we stood about with our 90 year old guest until someone pointed us toward a booth without much interest in taking our order.

Then, when the server did return, it was to rudely rush us through our orders. The food can stay, but wait staff should be replaced.

My wife and friends visited Seasons 52 for dinner on Friday night.

It was one of the best dinner experiences I have had in quite some time.

The food was excellent and our waitress, Lisa was one of the best waitresses I have ever had. She went above and beyond for us to make sure that our dinner was a very special experience and her knowledge and effort was amazing.

We had appetizers/salads, entrees and shared desserts and everything was excellent.

We will definitely be back

Great place to eat!  Their meals are cooked to perfection and the service is wonderful!  I eat here a few times a year and always enjoy my visit!  I have got their filet mignon a few times and I can say it is up there as one of the best I have had.  My girlfriend agreed, it just melted in your mouth and the flavor was astonishing!  I love their add on lobster tail to an entree as well.  It is a bit pricey, but, not too bad.  They keep portions smaller (or to a certain calorie count or lower) so it is a healthy choice too!  Give them a try!  Great for a date night!

Yelped this place before coming. Have no idea why this place has so many good reviews considering the food sucks. I know this place caters to "seasonal market" explains why they do not have a large selection on menu.

Got filet mignon...with mushroom sauce. A lot dry ... not that great. Won't be ordering that agLobster mozzarella flat bread was okay. 

This season wasn't great. Maybe I'll try next season.

I came here for a business dinner while in Schaumburg. There were 10 of us. The table they put us at was a tad small for 10 people.

The restaurant is unique in that they apparently do a new menu every week (hence the 52 in the name). The ingredients are very fresh and they try and use local farm and market products. The menu was spectacular. I couldn't decide what to get as everything on the menu looked amazing.

I ended up ordering the Asparagus soup and the Carmelized Sea Scallops. The Asparagus soup was only okay, but the scallops were phenomenal. I was expecting only about 4-5 scallops, but the plate had about 8 of them along with the vegetable risotto.

Our server, Samantha, was very knowledgeable and helpful in making reservations. She also had a can do attitude in coming up with some additional options from the Kitchen for some of the vegetarians dining with us.

The prices seem high on the surface, but the quality and portions of the food justify the higher price.

Loved it! The ambiance is so romantic. The live piano player/singer was beautiful to listen to. Loved his slow versions of popular songs. My boyfriend was greeted by his name, Mr. "Smith" and he was so impressed by that. Our waitress was friendly, attentive, and had great conversation with us. It was our anniversary so they gave us a complimentary champagne toast and each a free dessert. Super impressed by that!!! I wasn't very hungry, so I really appreciated some lighter menu items and regular entree items. Definitely hope to be back!

Easy to schedule reservations, staff is super friendly.  Nice ambiance, you can go in work casual and not feel out of place.  They go above and beyond for special occasions.  Food is well proportioned and healthy.  Desserts come in a small glass and loaded with a ton of flavor.  Loved it!

Chris was an exceptional server. He really brought the whole evening together, like the rug in the Big Lebowski. Our entire meal was delicious and all of the staff was more than inviting. We'll definitely come back again.

Went there to celebrate parents anniversary and the ambiance and atmosphere is really nice mix between modern and cozy. Didn't try the wine but they had a vast selection. 

Only eating from the vegetarian menu, the food was good but not memorable. The best part was dessert, complimentary for parents as it was their anniversary.

The staff is very friendly and the food is fantastic! I have had the chili, the asian chicken skewers, the braised short rib flat bread. Everything was delicious. I also had the braised short rib meal with cheesy grits. I love that everything is made with fresh ingredients and is low in calories (that is if you don't order a million things off the menu, because you'll want to!) I like that they bring out the mini deserts and explain them to you. They are a nice sweet little treat!

In from LA... Hungry after a full day of meetings and a forced in work out and just not ready to eat at the hotel bar... so I go back to Season 52 (have been there once before). 
I order a beer and the shiseido peppers and the lamb chops I had before... peppers show up and are great but as it turns our they are out of the lamb chops. The CHEF (Antonio) comes out of the kitchen to apologize and recommend a similar lamb dish that they serve for happy hour. Of course I agree... Out comes this very generous portion of the most delicious lamb and Antonio personally serves me a 15 year balsamic that "goes great with it"...Where do you get this kind of attention? 
I'll be back (and I am from Austria originally so imagine my accent) and besides the extra attention from the kitchen crew service was great as well.
Way to go 52 :)

This place is the kind of restaurant you visit for a business meeting or to impress that special someone. Not typically the kind of place I like to visit, but it was enjoyable. Very pricey as well.
The atmosphere is cozy, yet professional. Casual, yet classy. 
The staff were very friendly and courteous. Very prompt as well.
The food was delicious and from what I can tell fairly healthy and fresh. I had the rack of lamb which included mashed potatoes and carrots. It was very tasty. The pomegranate sauce gave it a very sweet flavor. 
For an appetizer we had the garlic chicken flatbread and chicken skewers. I highly recommend both of them. 
Their menu does rotate from week to week and month to month so the options I described above may not be available.
All in all a nice place to visit, but pretty standard faire. It's a safe place to go for special occasions. Otherwise I found it kind of dull. But that's just my personal opinion. No fault of the restaurant.

I give it four stars for the quality of food and atmosphere. But it was nothing that blew me away.
Came here for lunch with 20+ people from work. Great food and excellent service. Would highly recommend.

Delicious food and great ambience and service !!

I made a reservation for my husband and myself for his Birthday. One of us got stuck at work (I know very sad :( ) and I had to call to push the reservation time further and the lady who picked up the call was very nice and she told us to come whenever we could and she would accommodate us. We ended up an hour late and we got a table with just 5-10 mins of wait time even when the place was packed.

Now coming to the food, We ordered Oak grilled artichokes for appetizer and cedar plank roasted salmon and cedar plank roasted tofu with vegetables for main course. The artichokes and tofu were good, you get what is promised and tastes really good. But omg!! The Salmon!! It was the best we ever had. The spices and the butter and smokiness of it, just everything about it was right, it was melt-in-mouth. I would definitely go back here just for the salmon. And mind you, this coming from someone who is not a fan of seafood is HUGE!!

Our server, Anissa, was a very nice lady. I told her that we are here for my husbands birthday which I had put down on the reservation too so she already knew. So she made a nice toast of champagne and helped  us choose from the many cute little cups of sinful sweet deliciousness. I dont remember the exact names, but I got the mocha and my husbamd got Belgian, both were to the point.

Overall, AWESOME EXPERIENCE!! DEFINITELY RECOMMEND and Will Go Back.

UPDATE- this Bridget person from the restaurant wrote a response below based on our horrible experience. I actually took the time to talk with her. She asked to please make the situation right by sending us a gift card to return and give Seasons 52 another chance.  I agreed. Result...nothing.  Their rating just dropped now to a 1 star for not being genuine as well with having no follow through.  So terribly disappointed.

First the pros...
Beautiful ambiance
Amazing service (Lel...he's amazing...beyond amazing)
Creative menu items for the health conscience

Cons...and it's significant...
My babe's steak...cooked wrong 4 times over...no joke.  Ordered medium rare...first steak was well done...second was medium well...third was still mooing...and 4th was a 30 second attempt of recooking steak #3 which just sealed the deal as a epic failure.  My scallops were delicious. But for a man who so wanted a steak that night...he ended getting salmon a good half hour after I was done eating.  Not cool. 

Unfortunately I wanted to love this place for the amazing menu. I just wish the kitchen could cook the items on there. 

UPDATE- this Bridget person from the restaurant wrote a response below.  I actually took the time to talk with her. She asked to make the situation right by sending us a gift card to return and give Seasons 52 another chance.  I agreed. Result...nothing.  Their rating just dropped now to a 1 star for not being genuine as well with having no follow through.  Such a waste of my time!

This place was recommended to me by a friend, which I would also pass this along as a recommendation. It was very good, good food, delicious cocktails, and great service. 

We split the hummus appetizer. More hummus then things to dip but was the pretty size so we didn't over eat before our dinner. 

I kept it light - ordered the goat cheese flatbread. Was very good. It's meant to be a shareable, so I wasn't too stuffed. We each had a dessert. They bring you a dessert tray so you can see what your opinions are and choose right then and there. 

Also this is a seasonal restaurant, hence the name, so the menu does vary!

OMG this place was fabulous!  We visited on Wednesday night - it was busy, and we had a short wait in the lobby.  The Ahi Tuna Tartare was incredible, so fresh and creamy; and the preparation was lovely.  The Asian-Glazed Chilean Sea Bass was also phenomenal. It was cooked to perfection, sweet and smooth.  The dessert shooters were also fab, we had Pecan Pie, Key Lime Pie and Carrot Cake and all were the bomb.  Service was also excellent, shout out to Chris!

I can't say enough about how much I enjoyed Seasons 52.  I can't wait to return.

We went for Mother's Day -- my mistake, I thought our reservation was 1:30, it was actually 1:00. My Mother-In_law is 95, with mobility issues. The host quickly assessed the situation and put us back on the list. We were seated very quickly.  It was my mistake, but the staff at the Schaumburg S52 took excellent care of us.

The food was, as always, perfect.The grilled scallops were wonderful, as well as the crab cakes.The seasonal freshness of the food and beautiful presentation makes this restaurant a stand-out.

We have always enjoyed Seasons 52, but I have another level of respect and appreciation for this restaurant.

So I've ate here a couple of times and they never disappoint. The food is all seasonal, and all "healthier" which is always nice. 

BUT - I just found out they have a Happy Hour! What?!?! They do $5 small plates and have some drink specials. Absolutely worth it - the highlights from what we had for small plates were the scallops and the meatballs. 

I didn't have a cocktail that was on special, but the Perfect Storm was really nice. They had a seasonal Pumpkin pisco sour - which I thought sounded really interesting...but didn't taste so great. Gotta go more sweet with pumpkin in my opinion. 

They have mini shot glass desserts which are always great. The perfect amount really. I ALWAYS get the cannoli, but I tried the amores this last time and I actually really enjoyed it. 

Now that I know abou the happy hour I'll be back more often!

**Also, not sure of the hours but they have a piano player IN their little bar area and that is totally a perk in my opinion

Interesting idea - they put a calorie count for most items on the menu. For a while, they said "everything under 475 calories" and that still predominates.

This, to me, is a great setting for a business dinner. It is close to the office buildings in Schaumburg. It is somewhat on the loud side, and seems to be always crowded, so I tend more toward business than romantic. Of course "always crowded" tells you something - it is popular.

Another interesting tweak is that they have mini-desserts. All of them are small and you can get one or several. 

I focused on what is unusual. The fare tends to be American, healthy, a little on the fancier side, and I've never had a bad dish in a half-dozen times here.

Our waiter, Christov recommended the lobster flatbread to start, excellent choice. He made us feel comfortable and relaxed. We had a great evening and enjoyed excellent service and superb food. I had the sea scallops and my husband had the filet mignon. He said it was maybe the best steak he had ever had. We concluded with a couple of those little desserts.

This place was great, service was excellent and food OMG!!! This place changes their menu all year round. Great selection of wine and deserts. Atmosphere is very comfortable. Great for a date. :) that was my experience.

I have been to Seasons 52 numerous times, both for business and social occasions.  The food and service was always great, which is why I stopped in there with a friend last Saturday night for a drink and appetizers at the bar. The bar was not busy, it was over an hour before closing time and there were two bartenders available.  My friend and I sat there in disbelief as the two bartenders cleaned glasses, refreshed ice, chatted with one another and other employees.  At one point I put my hand up to signal "hey, we would like a drink!"  Both bartenders looked straight at us and then turned their backs to us.  My friend timed our wait and when we hit the 15 minute mark, we walked out.  As we walked out we stopped at the hostess desk to tell her exactly what happened.  She was speechless - literally.  There was no attempt to fix the situation, no apology, nothing.  I sent an e-mail the next day  via the Seasons 52 website recapping the experience and so far, have heard nothing.  

After my friend and I left Seasons 52 we went over to Tokio Pub.  The service was outstanding and the drinks were excellent.

This was my second time coming here and I had another great experience!

Tonight was girls night so there was lots of wine and gossiping involved. Our waiter was very patient giving us our time to decide on our meals and he wasn't pushy when we had been sitting there for a while. 

I've been here on a date before and it can be quite a romantic restaurant as well. It's decorated nicely and dimly lit. I really like the atmosphere here!
 
I made our reservation on Open Table and the restaurant called to confirm w me so I appreciated that.

We chose this place because we are trying to eat healthy and everything is under 500 calories. I got the Ahi Tuna Tartare and a side of risotto. Have never tried either one of these foods before and I thought it was cooked beautifully.

We all tried a dessert which they bring to you on this beautiful platter that makes it impossible to say no to and they are served in what looks like double shot glasses. Gotta love it.

We had an early dinner reservation so it wasn't that busy yet but they do get busy so call ahead. They have complimentary valet too but I've always been able to find a spot.
Hands down one of the best hospitality iv ever had at any restaurant. The food was a bit on the salty side but very tasty. Great place to go and I will definitely go back.

Excellent service seems to be a theme... from the valets to desk hostess and waitstaff. I like it....

I have been here a couple times in the last few weeks... and it should have been sooner.  Once was for lunch and just recently for a Thur night dinner. 

Very tasty food and nice ambiance.  It's casually elegant and very relaxing... could be considered romantic as well.  

Perhaps it's the live jazzy piano from the bar that seems to provide a better soundtrack. There is a definite lack of flatware clatter and conversational noise... but you don't notice that... you just feel like you're in your own social bubble. 

Like it!  =)

I have been to this location four times now and have had on-the-mark food and service every time. I highly recommend the mushroom bisque to vegetarians. Greek salad is also delightful. I always go for the pecan pie dessert. Our server tonight was Samantha she was absolutely delightful, and so sweet!
Absolutely love this place! The stuffed mushrooms are the BEST!!! Everything I've had is so delicious! The customer service is always on point. No complaints at all!

One of the best restaurants I've been too and hands down best server ice ever had - Anissia. Food was phenomenal! Scallops and salmon were both exquisite! Little desserts were decadently good and the seasonally appropriate veggies were to die for. It was a special birthday meal and was simply superb!

TL;DR Very healthy, pretty gimmicky, mediocre craft beer offerings, no taps, BUSY, great service

We called on a Saturday morning and were told they had no open reservations for 4 that evening, later in the day we called back and they had one open up! We showed up a few minutes early and were promptly seated. 

Our server was very personable and explained the concept, everything on the menu is low calorie, cool, got it. 

We started with some beverages and a steak and blue cheese flatbread. The flatbread was excellent! I normally don't like blue cheese but this one blended very well with the rest of the dish. 7.5/10

We started with salads and soup;

Chili - it was alright, not much going on, regretted not getting something else 3/10
Warm spinach salad - DELICIOUS! Bacon is great, lots of flavor out of this bad boy 8/10
Field greens salad - standard issue salad, middle of the road 5/10

Then came the dinner; 

Turkey Skewer - This dish was all sorts of mediocre, not much to call home about, would NOT order again 3/10
Copper River Salmon - AMAZING! This dish was sent straight to us from the god of fish, the salmon had a flavor that none of us could get over, it was the most salmon tasting salmon I have ever had, such a rich full flavor, cooked perfectly, amazing 10/10

We of course had to get dessert because why not! 

We had the key lime pie cup (7.5/10), smores cup (8/10), cheesecake cup (2/10), salted caramel something cup (6/10)

A pretty solid dinner effort but the reason I say this place is gimmicky is that when you do the full multi course meal spread it ends up being somewhere around 1500-2500 calories per person, it's sort of like when an HVAC company sends you a flyer for $29.99 summer tune up but that just gets them in the door, by the time you are all said and done they have overhauled your system for $500+. So in that way it's very similar to most restaurants, you build your own healthy. If you want low calorie don't get the steak fried steak, get the grilled chicken salad with dressing on the side, no croutons or cheese.

Great quality well paired food and excellent service. Thank you for making our Anniversary dinner absolutely wonderful! Thanks our awesome waiter John who recommended our dinner choices and picked out excellent wines and desert to make our dinner great! Thank you! We couldn't resist but order every single desert on the menu and the total price for dinner was very reasonable!

My friend, who has come here numerous times suggested this place. At first, the ambience was amazing.  The hostess was kind of rude, but we all have our days. We sat at the bar, and our bartender Sonya, was nothing but fantastic. We are vegetarians so we picked two appetizers and a flat bread to enjoy with our cocktails. At first, the bartender brought out hummus and sad the others will be out shortly. Ok we thought, not too big of a deal. About 10 minutes later the rest came out. It was a flatbread, and grilled artichokes. I was trying to eat them, and she was making fun of me, because I wasn't doing it right. I just kept saying it tastes gritty, and I don't want another one. She started eating hers and said the same thinking the stem was gritty. Well, after making a horrific face and spitting stuff out of her napkin, we realized what it was. The artichokes had not been cleaned and were covered in mud. We literally took a knife to it and it was almost a clay texture. We both had eaten mud. A few minutes later the bartender asked if we liked everything. I told her I think we are going to make clay pots, because these have mud all over them. She offered to get us another one, but we just wanted the whole thing off out table. She also offered another dish, but we were so turned off by it we didn't want any. We finished our pizza since we were so hungry, but just couldn't enjoy it after that. We both work in the industry and understand things happen. However, when they do, it's nice to go the extra mile and make it right(we do). They took it off out bill... No duh... But no manager came to apologize, not even a dessert offered. I wouldn't have eaten eat because we're were so disgusted, but the gesture. I am completely turned off this place, and she now is too on her fifteenth time back.

This is my first time coming to seasons 52. And I must say it was an amazing experience. Not only is the food how to be it's absolutely delicious and Beautiful presentation    Not to mention there petite healthy desserts definitely be back

Nice place.  We sat in the bar area.  Waiter (Robert) was attentive.  We started off with the roasted peppers with goat cheese, which was awesome.  We then both decided to have the Mahi Mahi Tacos, which hit the spot.  All around great place for lunch!

Excellent food menu, great options across the different categories. I had a nice pork tenderloin and my wife had chicken. Very tasty and proper portion sizes. Desserts are the usual small portion so you can get two - more than enough.
Issue 1 - the beer selection is uninspiring and the lack draft. They go seasonal with the food, do the same with the beer. And stop falling into the beer = ale (IPA, PA, A) and get some other darker varieties on there.
Issue 2 - valet parking in the suburbs should be banned. There are ample parking spots and I don't feel the need to tip someone to park my car in the lot. If they would unblock the last row, the need goes away. Very annoying.

Great as usual.  We were there for Mothers Day.  Very attentive Staff.  Were seated right away.
Food Was GREAT.  They gave out roses for mothers day.  My Mother enjoyed it.  Never a disappointment
Had a quick lunch here after meeting. It meets my expectation for a fancy place like this

Have been here twice with friends and both times the service and food had been exceptional! Our server today, Marcos, was a gem. He did everything right. We ordered the Signature burger and other than the massive piece of lettuce, it was divine. We also shared the Ribs sandwich which to my surprise came more like a wrap but either way the Ribs were tender and very delicious. I'll definitely go back.

Another very good meal at Seasons 52.  We dined at 5:30 on Thanksgiving.  Although the restaurant was packed, service was very good and all of our meals were spot on.  For four people dining with one shared flatbread, one salad, four entrees and 6 drinks, the bill totaled $186.  Good value in my book.

I'll definitely be back. Great restaurant and even better service! The menu had a lot of good choices. The price point was reasonable even though the food was great. It's great to know of more restates with healthy food options that are tasty.

I'll have to say the only reason why I didn't give them 5 stars was because of our service.... The food, the menu and the ambiance were just perfect, but our service was definitely lacking. 

We went on a Sunday afternoon at 2pm. They weren't overly busy, I mean, it was an awkward time to be there since it was kind of late for lunch and too early for dinner. We didn't want to go when it was super crowded because we had my 2 year-old son with us. Our server did explain the menu in detail, but it took her forever to take our order, pick up our plates, and bring dessert menus.... That was the only drawback. 

I opted for the restaurant menu meal which was 3 courses for $20. I had the mushroom bisque soup which was super light and flavorful, and I had the flat iron steak salad. It was unbelievable. One of the best salads I've ever had. I was there with my family (6 of us) and everything everyone ordered was perfect and fresh! We also tried the rainbow trout, the mushroom and arugula salad, the organic field green salad, the filet and the lobster papadelle pasta. No complaints from anyone! We were all satisfied.

The desserts are super cute and I highly recommend them. I recommend ALL OF THEM! I'll definitely head back to Season this summer to try their summer menu. Definitely loved it and worth it!

I wish i could give Seasons 52 a higher rating but the food was mediocre and the only reason for the 3 stars was for the great service.  I made a reservation for dinner via open table from their yelp page which makes it very convenient.  When we were seated our waiter, Tom, asked which one of us was Melissa and then went on to thank me for making a reservation.  He even addressed me by name throughout the meal and made it much more personal.  What a nice touch!  Tom was very knowledgeable and explained their menu (according to him, they're known for their flatbreads).  

I chose to start off with a glass of wine and asked if he had any suggestions on a nice red.  He let me taste a light, fruity one and I didn't particularly like it so he went to find a more oak-y red which turned out to be a 2010 cabernet (whose name I can't remember...sorry guys).  

My friend and I decided to try a flatbread as an appetizer since they are known for it and settled on the lobster and fresh mozzarella flatbread.  It came out pretty quickly which surprised me since they were pretty busy when we came at 5:30pm (Yeah yeah we're grandmas eating that early on a Saturday, don't judge!).  The flatbread was paper thin and crispy but wasn't outstanding by any means.  There was a decent amount on lobster and mozzarella but the green onions that topped the flatbread completely overpowered the appetizer.  I highly suggest either removing the green onions or taking some off.

As for our entrees, I ordered the pork tenderloin and portobello and my friend had the cedar planked salmon.  Both of our dishes were ok but they weren't amazing and I expected better for the price (Hers was $20 and mine was around $18).  I ordered my pork to be cooked medium and it came out fairly tender which I was happy with.  It was plated on a base of creamy polenta with a side of broccolini...too bad it wasn't creamy and there were only 2 stalks of broccolini.  The polenta was rather clumpy and gelatinous instead of being thicker and creamy.  I tried a bite of my friend's salmon and that was much better than mine.  It was tender and had a nice sweet glaze on it if I remember correctly.  

If I hadn't had a giftcard to Seasons 52 I don't think I would have came.  I am glad I tried it but most likely wouldn't return.  Although service was spot on, the food wasn't anywhere good enough to bring me back especially with it being overpriced.
Met some friends for dinner here. Nice ambience but food was not memorable. Service was not on spot either.

Co-workers and I dined in for lunch as it is not too far from our office. This was my third time eating there for lunch. They have a delicious menu and there is something on the menu for everyone. I have had their seared tuna salad which is fantastic and the last time I dined in, I had the grilled salmon. We ordered deserts which come in little shot glasses and we ended up ordering one of every kind of desert. My two favorite were the key lime pie and a chocolate mousse or cake. (I can't remember what the name of it was) I will dine in again in the future.

Seasons 52 never lets me down.  The food is fresh, flavorful and the service is great.  The food is low calorie and doesn't leave you feeling guilty for what you've eaten.

A good choice, highly reccomended.

Delicious food, very friendly and prompt service. 
It was our first time at Seasons 52 and we are definitely planning to be back. 
We mentioned to our server Samantha that we are gong to a comedy show at Improv and she took notice. 
Our food and drinks were in front of us very fast. The exception was the side of Brussels Sprouts that we ordered additionally. We were almost done with the main dish when Sam brought a side of asparagus, apologized and explaining that there was a mix up. 
Shortly after, a nice cook came out of the kitchen, again with apologies and explanation. She said she knows we have a show to catch and the Brussels are almost done and would we like them to go? Sure, we said. She added that dessert is on them tonight. The way they present dessert is super quick and convenient, and we were all done in no time. The total on the check was very reasonable. 
I cannot stress enough how impressed we were with the service and the food. Atmosphere was awesome too.

It was jam packed on Saturday night before Valentine's day but the service & food were great!  
Our waiter Artur was very friendly and made the first visit to Season 52 for my wife and I very enjoyable. My wife and I were ready to order a bottle of wine but were not sure on our choice so Artur brought a sample for us to help us decide before committing to a full bottle. I had the Chilean Sea bass that that was served on a bed of black rice which was recommended by Artur and it was delicious. I was able to cut through it like butter with my fork, tender is an understatement. After dinner we asked for a desert menu but instead were presented with a plate full of mini cakes in a glass where we had the option of choosing from seven different kinds that all looked good. Overall my first visit here from the service to the food was perfect.

It was our mistake to try again on Valentines Day weekend.  The first sign that there would be problems was when we entered and saw a sea of people waiting for table and it was only 5:10pm.  But we waited our turn and were seated by 5:20, not bad for a 5:15 reservation.

The hostess brought us to your back patio.  Trouble sign #2 was trying to navigate through the restaurant.  Servers were going very which way, and guests looked perturbed by the steady stream of people walking by.  When we got to the patio, we saw a flank of small tables for two.  As we were directed to our table, we were truly befuddled.  The table were so crammed in that there was no way we could even sit at the table without telling already seated diners to move.  Unfortunately, they had nowhere to move to as they were similarly crammed in.  We told the hostess, and she promised us another table.  As we surveyed the room, we saw that we definitely did not want to sit in this overly cramped room.  Usually, this room is highly desirable, but tonight it was set up like a cattle car.

At that time, we invoked the manager's name (who had given us gift certificates after a bad experience we had last year), and the hostess arranged to get us a table in the main dining room.  Unfortunately, by then we were already embarrassed and didn't want to make a scene.  Also, we still had PTSD from our last visit, and there was no way we could even sit and enjoy a meal.  So we decided to leave.  

We are very sad because Seasons 52 was always a special place for us.  Now we cringe when we think about it.  We will miss the restaurant.  We still have your gift certificates, and who knows, maybe we will try again some day (and not around a holiday), but that may be a very long time from now.

Seasons 52 management: please remember what makes Seasons 52 special and why people like to go there, and make that a reality every night.  Don't give in to the corporate management that demanded that you increase your revenues on the holiday by cramming in more tables than you could accommodate.  Trust me, we are not the only patrons you disappointed tonight.  We had similarly bad experiences on other Valentines Day dinners in previous years and have NEVER gone back to those restaurants.  Those restaurants are now shuttered, and I have to believe they closed because they compromised on their values and went for the $$.  I hope Seasons 52 does not fall victim to the same fate.

We really enjoyed our trip to Seasons 52- it was very busy the night that we went in for dinner- but our reservation was ready right on time. Our waitress was very friendly and gave us a lot of information about the items on the menu. Really the only negative of the night for my husband and I was that we had to wait on the waitress on a few occasions, nothing terrible, but not overly attentive either. I started my meal with the potato leek soup- delicious, and moved on to the short rib for my entree. It was a little on the higher calorie side- but I enjoyed the variety and the knowledge that the menu brought. My husband had the shrimp and grits- we were both very pleased with our entrees and would definitely eat them again. Dessert was another highlight at Seasons 52- I love the little shot glass size desserts- they are perfect after a full meal- and I loved the variety as well. Overall very pleased with my first experience at Seasons 52- we will return!

I really like Seasons 52 normally, but I will say that this particular one had less than wonderful service.  I sat at the bar for probably 10 minutes before anyone paid any attention to me and then the manager (I think) came over to help me.  What was the bartender doing?? They were open for dinner, but it wasn't busy, and he was helping others.  They also told us about the $5 appetizers for happy hour but then we had to flag him down to take our order.  The bill was hard to find (yes, they put it there for you, but it's not easy to see and I usually see this type of billing at a bar at less 'fancy' spots).  

I still think their food is quite good and deceivingly delicious considering the calorie counts, but this particular location had lackluster service.

Heard this place was not good when first opened, approx. 1 yr ago ( ???)  but still wanted to try it give my own opinion.    Was not disappointed.  In fact saw other coworkers at the place during lunch, so must be good.  

Ordered the ginseng chicken porridge, recommended by a coworker.  It's a comfort food, especially on a cold winter day or if not feeling well.   Couldn't taste ginseng but the porridge creamy with shredded chicken that's just perfect. Not dry at all.   

Seafood pancake --  came out on a cast iron, gigantic, krispy and so yummy !  they didn't skimp on the seafood.  Every bite I got a bit of octopus and scallion

Will definitely go back to try more items

Went here for lunch on Thursday with a coworker.  I have been to this location at least 3 times, once downtown, and once in Oak Brook.  It doesn't matter where you go - they are all consistent across the board, which is nice.  Not excellent food, but really good.  I like that the calories are reasonable and the desserts small (so you can get more than one).  I got the sesame salmon salad with pineapple, mango, and jicama salad.  Any of the salads - steak or tuna - are solid.  The flatbreads are a good option too for an app.  My coworker got the steak and Bleu cheese one for her entree.  We also got the roasted Brussels sprouts with bacon and Parmesan to share.  They were crispy and seasoned well.  No desserts this time, but the pumpkin pie and pecan pie are my favorites.  Also good for work meetings - they let you sit without making you feel rushed.
Lovely atmosphere. Fantastic food. Great customer service! This place is one of my favorites for any occasion - girls night, date night, family birthdays, all a win! I've never left disappointed!

I recently had a birthday dinner at the Schaumburg location and my party of 14 was absolutely blown away with the service, food and ambiance! Everything was upscale, including the FREE valet parking! The hostesses were incredibly kind and attentive and knew the menu very well and helped with food selection. The menu is incredible and will have something for everyone. I will definitely come back and highly recommend.

Second time here. And this time my experience was PHENOMENAL. Food, service, everything is 5 star worthy. Big shout out to our waiter, Kyle.

I came with my parents specifically for the happy hour and wow, what a treat. Each happy hour menu item is only 5 dollars and we decided to try each one except the almonds. We ordered daily special, a whole branzino fish, two drinks and dessert.

Out of the happy hour menu items, I'd say the chicken and scallops were the best. The chicken was smoky, tender, and filling. The scallops were seasoned perfectly and succulent. The other items were fine. They ran out of the shrimp so we didn't get to try that dish, however, they offered to give us another shrimp appetizer on the house! We replaced it with the cocktail shrimp and it was great. The shrimp was fresh and deveined. The branzino was great and packed a ton of meat (never tried this fish before). I would skip the lemonades they have here because it is almost tasteless. However, it is free refills, so your call! I love the mini, cheap, high-quality dessert concept here. Usually I can never finish a full dessert just because it's too sweet but the portion here is just perfect enough for me and it's tasty. I got the apple pie and the pecan pie.

Free valet parking, place is super classy, prices are reasonable. I LOVE IT! Make sure to have a reservation though. I've been trying to come other times before but they are just packed full.

Happy Hour from 4-6:30?
On a Friday too?
$5 buys me lamb chops and half-dollar sized sea scallops???

Yes. Yes and YES!

For those plates, I got 2 chops and 3 scallops. My friend told me to not order too much because the wine flight comes with a full sized flatbread. The best part, the flight means getting a full pour of the favorite. I like how there is a paper ring around the glass with the name of the wine and descriptors like crisp, tannic, pear and keep so you can find a bottle for home. The food was really good, scallops are tender and the lamb chops have a slight sweet savoriness. The flatbread is so thin and crispy even after it has been sitting for a few hours while we slowly grazed and sipped our wines.

I've been to the Seasons 52 in downtown Chicago and I generally like their selections. Service is great, I think over the course of the evening, we had 3 bartenders take care of us. Timing is key and I'll be back for more happy hours.

What a fantastic experience! I have a problem with avocado. Every time I eat them, I get sick. I ordered the Mahi Mahi tacos here, without realizing that they have avocado in them until after my first bite. Our server, Christov, took them back, checked with me on the type of allergy that I have to see if I would be ok (I will) replaced the tacos without avocado and comped desserts for us. I have had recent similar experiences that were handled terribly by the staff and establishment. Seasons 52 went above and beyond, even though the fault was not theirs. Christov and Seasons exceeded my expectations for customer service in this type of situation. Truly professional. Thanks! 

Oh, and the food was de-lish too :)

Look no further, this is the place you want to go.  I've been here multiple times and each time has been wonderful.  The service is always prompt and courteous.  The food is always spectacular and the atmosphere is rather romantic.

All of the food choices sound delicious, but I usually go with the BBQ turkey skewer.  It has a fantastic BBQ sauce that is not over powerful and lets you really taste the turkey.  This meal is served over a rice/vegetables which goes well together.  If I recall correctly all meals are less than 500 calories.

The desserts are amazing as well.  The chocolate peanut butter one is my favorite and is a nice finish to the meal.

They usually have a live pianist in the bar area which is pretty neat to watch.  If that isn't what you're looking for the main seating area is for you.  The main area has a.pretty open concept and you can see most of the kitchen.


The ambiance of the inside is a quiet, cool, romantic vibe that makes for a great experience.

Met a friend for dinner in the bar and Andrew was our server. While Seasons 52 has an excellent menu and quality food; the service tonight was worth note. Specifically, Andrew provided an excellent experience for us and made insightful recommendations for cocktails and entrees. A perfect balance of service and style; checked in on us without being obtrusive and a great personality. Lots of places in this area have great food-Seasins 52 knocks it out of the park with the ambiance and team of professionals that make sure you enjoy your night from the moment you enter until you leave. Go-you won't regret it!

Love love love this place! They have wine and flat breads where you get to try 3 wines, and choose your favorite as your glass.
The menu changes by season. Everything is fresh. They also sometimes have a man playing the piano and singing. He takes requests.
Love it. Service has always been great.

This place has officially become my favorite to go for our anniversaries and special dates with the husband. We used to go to Shaw's in the same plaza but after being at Seasons 52 just once, I can tell that the quality in food is vastly difference and it can be much friendlier on your wallet too if you follow my tips. Now, just because I said it's a great place for date night, doesn't mean you can't go here with girlfriends, or celebrate a birthday with friends or have family dinners. Please do all that as I plan to come back here for the many wonderful occasions aforementioned. 

Food-wise please see my photos upload for this place. There's also tons of other food pics in the gallery for this restaurant as well. However, it is hard to keep up because this place is called Season 52 for a very special reason: it is for the 52 weeks in the year and the 52 weekly menu that changes! How cool is that?! 

There is one constant menu that changes only seasonally (I think every 3 months) and that is going to be the big chunk in the front and center of the menu. But if you look over to the right hand side, there is a narrow column that will tell you the specials for the week, and that will change every week! For the rotating weekly menu, they will offer a few choices for soup, appetizer, salad and entrees. This is what Season 52 is all about, and it is genius marketing because if the food is good, people will come back to try out the other menu.  It's a win win because for foodies like us, you'll never feel bored going back to the same place several times!

Now, here are my tips if you want to dine here but want to get the most bang for your buck or if you're tight on your budget. Instead of going straight to the entrees (which are in the mid 20's to even 30s, it gets pricey), go for the appetizers. They have a HUGE selection of appetizers, and they're all really delicious. The ingredients tastes fresh, the flavor is aromatic and not heavily reliant on salt or oil to mask its taste. Plus, every dish is under 500 calories. 

So for the price of one entree (portion is generally small), I actually got 2 decent sized appetizers in place. These apps are priced $9-13.  We actually ordered one entree and 4 appetizers and 2 desserts, in the end our bill came out to be under $65 for two. We were so full at the end and even had 2 doggie bags to take home. When we used to go to other restaurants of the same scale, I couldn't say we were this well fed for the amount that we spent. We have spent much more and had less food!

So here's the breakdown of what we ordered:

Appetizers: 
Grilled Garlic Pesto Chicken Flatbread- the BEST flatbread I've ever tasted. 
Grilled Shrimp Flatbread- I don't see this on the menu anymore but it was good!
Ahi Tuna Tartare- very fresh ahi tuna
Thai Lemon Grass Mussels- such unique flavor, super flavorful, the best!

Entree:
Shrimp Cavatappi Pasta- small portion but well cooked, not salty, taste just right.

Desserts
Mocha Macchiato- my favorite of the desserts, must try if you like coffee flavor!
Mango Cheesecake- yummy and mild in flavor, for those who like their desert rich.

Aside from the food, the service was really great. Our water got refilled, the apps came out quick. Our entree did take a little more time but the sous-chef came out to bring us the dish to us and comped one of our flatbread due to the wait. I ended up tipping 30% that night because I was so satisfied with the service. When customers are satisfied, that speaks volume for a business!

Service here was outstanding! We didn't make reservations which was my mistake, however we were able to sit at the bar immediately and have a few drinks to start. When there was a booth available the hostess came right to us and brought us to our booth. Mark was our server, he made the experience what it was. He gave us "what the chef recommends" on a few items including the lamb chops that i got.. He said to get them medium rare for best flavor, could not have been more spot on! My wife got the NY strip and was very pleased. We had a mushroom flat bread to start, very tasty.  
As a nice gesture he brought us 2 small glasses of champagne to help us celebrate our wedding anniversary, GREAT TOUCH!! That really left a great impression on my wife and I. Having 2 little children at home we don't get many nights out (this was our first since the baby was born) so to have such a great experience on our wedding anniversary was awesome!
Nice place, very good food. I had the scallops, really good, not rubbery. The shrimp scampi was awesome, you can tell it was all fresh and hand made. Although it is pricey, it's well worth the money.

I first came to Seasons 52 about a year ago, and have been hooked since.   The food is always excellent, the staff is very welcoming, and it is worth every penny.  The only downfall is that whenever we have made reservations (highly recommended if not mandatory) we still end up waiting anywhere from half an hour to an hour to be seated.  Make sure to make reservations, weekdays are better with seating than weekends for sure! Delicious!

Delicious seasonal food! Seasons 52 is one of my family's favorite places to celebrate! Everyone from my grandparents to aunt and younger brother all enjoy dining here. We had been to the Seasons 52 in Orlando and were so happy when they began opening in the Chicago burbs. 

This time we dined at the one in Schaumberg Sunday afternoon for my grandmothers birthday. We had a group of 12 people and we had a great time. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that although the service was friendly, it was somewhat lacking. Our water glasses were never refilled and I would have loved to get an additional glass of wine during my meal but didn't flag anyone down. For the price you pay I think consistent, but not over the top service is important.

To start with, we ordered a few different flat breads to share. The steak and blue cheeses and margarita were both very good and were crowd pleasers. I also had the corn chowder which was delicious, especially with the bacon.:)

For a main course I usually get the salmon salad or sea bass which are both very good but this time I decided to try the Sea Scallops. I am so glad I changed things up! They were perfectly cooked and the risotto that came with was creamy and so good!

My husband got the southern style shrimp and grits which was awesome!  Did I mention that most of these entrees are around 500 calories (except the shrimp and grits of course :))!? For a restaurant that is great!!! 

For dessert they offer small shot glass sized desserts. The waiter brings the options right to the table for you see and choose from. I usually get the pecan pie or key lime pie which are both delicious! So many to choose from but it's nice everyone can choose what they want. A great way to end the meal with something small and sweet.

My mom and I came to Seasons 52 today and were very pleased.  We came on a Saturday at 12:15 and it was not busy.  Our waiter was attentive and very knowledgeable about the menu.  I had a salad and my mom had a burger. Both of our entrees were excellent.  They also have a separate hot tea menu which we appreciated.  I REALLY appreciate how they have the calories on the menu.  They come around after and tempt you with delicious looking dessert, which my mom did end up getting.  

I wish they had one of these in the city!

I both had steaks and the meat was so rubbery it could only described as a fake steak! Or maybe synthetic,or the cook didn't know how to cook  the, Temperatures were the worst ever not even close what  we ordered  I do know what tastes good and what doesn't and this was so bland that I couldn't even finish 1/2 of it. Same goes for the so-called mashed baby red potatoes; tasted like boxed, but with red peels to make it look authentic. . Ugh, steaks were gross.  undercooked steaks Ugh .  (sorry  the I have to mention about the steaks ) I am always one to complain when not satisfied, but it was obvious this was just the Not the quality of food (steaks ) . While our server and hostess was very friendly, I don't think we will be going back and even worst In not going to recommend this restaurant.. So disappointed

Although their food is on the pricier side, they source local organic food that provides low calorie option entrees.  They also have change up their specialities every week, hence Seasons 52.

Love their food...just wish the service was a tad bit quicker.

Dear Seasons 52, 

I wanted to thank you for the best December Holiday Party 2013.  My co-workers and I enjoyed your food, customer service, and just the perfect classy atmosphere.  Your restaurant is so clean that you could possibly eat on the floor.  I know I'm over embellishing.  But overall, I would come back for another meal.

Your servers were more than attentive and were always to the point from the smile on their faces, their willingness to go above and beyond, to refilling our drinks, and to the service of the food.  We were never neglected, not even once.  What ever we asked for, your Servers were willing to do, of course within reason.  I have to say this was the best customer service I have experienced in a long time.   

Your food was also awesome.  We had ordered:
Appetizers:
Grilled Garlic Pesto Chicken fresh mozzarella cheese, balsamic onions, roasted red peppers, arugula
Blackened Steak & Blue Cheese cremini mushrooms, spinach, caramelized onions
Lump Crab, Roasted Shrimp & Spinach Stuffed Mushrooms under parmesan-panko crust
Shrimp Cocktail
All the appetizers were so good that I had no complaints on any.  Of course my favorite out of all was the Shrimp Cocktail but that's my love for the seafood.  The Flatbreads were also great.  It had the right balance, and nothing was overwhelming with any ingredient.  Also the crab cake was cooked perfectly.  The combination of the crunch and soft middle was just exquisite. 

Small Salad:
Organic Field Greens cucumbers, tomatoes, pumpkin seeds, white balsamic vinaigrette
I'm sure anyone can make a salad but I will still give you the praise you deserve with making this good for us.  The salad dressing vinaigrette wasn't too salty or oily.  I truly enjoyed this.

Fish and Seafood:
*Cedar-Plank Roasted Salmon & Vegetables red bliss potatoes, dill-mustard sauce, grilled lemon
This tasted so good!  The fish was cooked perfectly and not overcooked like some restaurants would.  The marriage between the salmon and dill-mustard sauce was awesome.  I would recommend this to all my friends and family who love fish.

Dessert:
Mini Indulgences... individual servings of classic desserts
Chocolate Peanut Butter Mousse
Key Lime Pie
Mocha Macchiato
Pecan Pie with Vanilla Mousse
Tropical Fruit Cheesecake
Belgian Chocolate Rocky Road
Raspberry Chocolate Chip Cannoli
Market Fresh Fruit
OMG!  Words can't describe the beautiful taste that swirled around when I tasted what I could.  I was really full but the careful creation of these were just too hard to pass up.  So, I tasted as many as I could and loved every bite.  I thought these were going to be too sweet but not at all.  The sweet wasn't overpowering and it's just the perfect end to a perfect meal.

Anyway, thank you for the experience and for letting us spend our 2013 Holiday Party with you and your employees.  I hope our owners decide to have it there for 2014.

\(*^_^*)/

Excellent food, very good service. Romantic inside, moderately noisy. Highly recommended! 

My wife and I have been to Seasons 52 numerous times and have always been very satisfied. Their menu features seasonal items under 450 calories. Veggies are always fresh and meats and fish are always yummy. 

Our favorite feature is their double shot glass-sized desserts! At the end of the meal, the waiter brings by a tray of mini desserts. They're always decadent, but not too filling.

Great spot for a healthy meal, can't take that away from Seasons 52. However, don't come here expecting the food to sweep you off your feet.I went here on a Tuesday night and the service was fine (not great), but we managed to have a good time nonetheless.

The drinks were fun and there was a good variety. We had the the steak & blue cheese flatbread and duck wing lollipops for appetizers. The flatbread was average at best--too bland for my taste-- while the lollipops were simply fantastic. The sauce was spicy enough to give your mouth a good tingle but not enough to have you gasping for water, I highly recommend having this fantastic appetizer. For dinner we ordered the turkey skewer and pork tenderloin. Frankly, nether of these are worth writing home about. They were both cooked well but the flavor just wasn't there.

Overall, I had a okay experience and would not protest coming back here. However, I would have trouble suggesting to my friends that we should go out to eat here over better alternatives.

Ok y'all, this is without a doubt, the most flavorful and satisfying vegan meal I might have ever had! Locally grown meats and produce, great service, wonderful atmosphere, the perfect place to eat after a long morning business meeting. Now, I will say, their menu changes each week (hence the 52 in the restaurant name, LOVE IT!) so I will comment on what I experienced but you may not be lucky enough to have the same! 

All 4 of us started with the butternut squash soup which was outstanding. First time I had butternut squash soup that was not overly sweetened or flavored. It was fresh and delicious. Served with crispy crimini mushrooms and a small breadstick. Everyone loved it.

The table (besides me) shared a lump crab flatbread as an appetizer and scarfed it up.

I had the Vegetarian Tasting quinoa-citrus salad, soft taco, vegetables, cedar-roasted tofu, tropical salsa that came served with broccolini. The flavors of every component of this dish was SPOT ON! Again, not overly seasoned, very well presented and beautiful. The fruit salsa on the tofu was so good, couldn't get enough. Broccolini was cooked to perfection. The quinoa was served with mandarin orange slices and mint, which I would have never put together but it was fantastic. And ohmygosh the taco was perfect! I practically licked the plate clean :)

The others had lump crab cakes, the iceberg salad and an heirloom tomato salad. I could not locate online the exact menu items as they are changed so often but everyone seemed very happy with their meal. 

The desserts (non vegan) are well presented and the perfect serving size! It's hard to say no to a "mini indulgence dessert" after a great meal. 

I WISH there was a Seasons 52 closer to Chicago and I would frequent there, but until next time. Go here, you will not regret it!

We had an amazing dinner at Seasons 52. Loved that were organic and Fresh ingredients. The waitress (Jenn) was superb! My boyfriend and I both had the seabass. It was so tender and flavorful. The desserts were just so yummy! The ambience was very nice and there was a piano player doing a great job in the life of the bar. We'll definitely be back!

I have yet to eat here, but have been several times for the drinks.  My friend and I enjoy going for a girls-night out and getting wine or cocktails, which are always great.  It is usually crowded on a Thurs-Sat night, but service is always good.

This place is fabulous.  They use seasonings for flavor, instead of fat. They specialize in flatbreads, but have a wide range of choices on their menu. They serve their desserts in shooters, so you can indulge without overdoing it.

Have been here several times and each time was a wonderful experience. It has been made even better by the amazing staff, in particular a server named Marcos. He is attentive, gives great recommendations and is very personable and makes you feel like you--request to be seated in his section..it will surely make for a memorable evening!! The food is amazing.. flatbreads are scrumptious and the drinks..OMG!! the best thing I have ever had is the Hawaiian Cosmo-perfectly balanced, not too sweet, not too tart. But be careful--they are strong!! The scallops are my all time favorite. Perfectly cooked and sweet, sitting atop butternut squash risotto with a side of broccoli. Perfectly balanced and mouthwatering. And the mini deserts.. what a concept! Satisfies without leaving you feeling overstuffed! The raspberry cannoli is my fav! The other thing I love about this place is that they have a piano player every day from 5 to 8 or 9. They sit in the middle of the bar (literally) and there are comfy tables all around the perimeter of the bar area that you can dine at. It is cozy and comfortable and that is our favorite place to sit. They also offer a happy hour menu Monday through Friday from 4-6:30 that offer drink specials and smaller plates so you can sample several different menu items. This place is one of our "regulars" that we enjoy coming to when we have our "date nights".. Be sure to make reservations as this place gets packed after 4:30 and getting a table is near impossible. Also, the bar area tables are first come, first serve, so come early if you plan to sit in this area!

Yes! My new go to Mexican joint around the corner from my house! Came here off the reviews (thanks Yelp!). Boy I tell you, all the other 5 star review don't lie. This is THE SPOT.

I like the "traditional" ambiance in here and the place is really clean. The owner was really friendly. They give you some complementary chips and homemade salsa if you dine in; salsa is really good.

I got the chicken Quesadilla dinner. It was amazing. The chicken was seasoned well and the huge tortilla was filling. My wife got the enchilada dinner which was also really good. I can for certain say I'll be back here.
Place is awesome! Very nice staff and I love the food! It's a hidden gem here in bloomingdale and I would go back anytime!
Very Good Steak Tacos , Excellent, friendly service, The decor is very nice , served us chips and salsa as we waited for our takeout order. we will be going back very soon.

For our very first visit we tried the Pollo estilo "Mi Casa" tacos and the (huge) steak burrito. Both were authentic and delicious. Bonus: the red sauce really spiced things up! We look forward to trying many more items. It's wonderful to have a place so close to home. Also it was no problem waiting for our carry out order as there were chips and yummy homemade Pico de Gallo to munch on while chatting with the super nice owner.
Excellent authentic Mexican restaurant next to DQ in Bloomingdale.  Owner is very friendly and food is great. Chips and salsa while you wait!
It's a small place, but clean. The food is authentic and delicious, and they are very friendly!

Someone just answered the telephone, they were closed for some reason for a week or so. I guess my timing was just wrong. Wanting to stop by and try. Glad they are not out of business. Heard good things.

Very friendly customer service. Clean Location. Steak and Pastor were better than expected. The quality of the meat was better than average. Large portion of chips and guac. The guac was creamy, but I would have preferred it to be a bit more spicy. At the same time, they had other salsa options that were spicy.
