Excellent service! I went her to get lunch and staff was very friendly! As I waited for my order they gave me chips and salsa! Had a torta and it was delicious best one I've had! I'll definitely be back !

I got a chicken torta meal, with no beans. When I requested it, they just gave me more rice, which is really good. :O  It was delicious!  But be aware that what they use is most likely full-fat everything for any dairy. I'm sensitive to fat, so I got pretty sick from it...but that's but my fault for being dumb. Service was nice and I did this one as a carry-out. They gave me a small bowl of chips & salsa as I waited for my food to finish cooking.

It's worth coming here just for the fresh salsa, tbh.
New to the area, and stumbled on this place ..... WOW!!  The BEST guacamole and salsa - so fresh!  Highly recommend, and the service is super friendly too .... we'll be back!!

Wow! We went to Mi Casa and had the al pastor torta, a chicken tamale, and chicken quesadilla dinners. They all were fabulous! The owner is so nice and friendly! The cooks were very kind too, thanking us for coming. We will definitely be going back there soon and will be ordering for delivery when that starts! The food was very good and authentic. Great customer service and overall experience!

This place is amazing. The service is excellent and the patio is great! The food is really good too. I had the lamb chops and they were delicious. I've also had the pizza and it was superb. Highly recommend this place. It's a hidden gem.

Came here for a group luncheon. Now, I do not live too far from here but I have not visited this place in about 10 years for reasons I do not remember.
The luncheon was nice. Salad was good. The grilled calamari appetizer was good. Everybody ordered off the menu individually so I can only comment on my entrée. I ordered this spicy Shrimp diavolo over linguini. Guess what? This dish was actually spicy. A lot of places list things as spicy and they're really not but this one was. It was also loaded with fresh tasting shrimp. I enjoyed this dish.
I may just have to return to check out other menus items.
Service was pretty good considering that there was only one server with a helper for over twenty people.

Cheers to all

So the only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because the food was good but, the service was horrible. First we walk in the hostess says we can't sit outside because not everyone in our party was 21 which would be understandable of about a month prior my family came with the same number of people same ages and they sat outside no problem. Waitress came and said its ok there is adults so we headed outside then the hostess came with an attitude and said I choose where you sit. Then they messed up my nephews order which wasn't a big deal but then they bring some desert and said here this is for you guys because we messed up with the pasta. We get the bill and what happens they charged us for what they sent out that was suppose to be on the house. Very disappointing.
I met a friend for the lunch buffet. I won't go there again for the buffet. Very mediocre. It was like $10. I think the buffet is from 11-2.

Food was sub par and service was good until we had a question about our bill. There was a lot of confusion in our own party but our server handled it was unprofessional and not appropriate. There was a ton of back and forth (which I wanted to stop as they were closing) but it was hard to get an explanation of what happened. We eventually found out that the prices have since changed by a few dollars and the menu was outdated. That's all fine, but more than one person had confusion and it could have been explained when we ordered. My group insisted that we all leave a good tip for service but the whole experience made me want to stay away for dine in or take out. The server was very accommodating and the appetizers were okay, but how we were treated afterwards was annoying enough to never return.

Great authentic Chicago pizza!  We ordered the Combination which had sausage, mushrooms and peppers.  The establishment was clean and the server was nice.  My daughter wanted the buffet but since Aurillio's considers her an adult (just turned 10 years old), it would have been $10 for her.  Seriously, I think that is too young to pay full price. Most restaurants consider you a child through 12.  I would have given 5 stars if it weren't for that.
Pizza is always great, Service is fast. They always go above and beyond for our company lunches and dinners.  Thanks Aurelio's!

The pizza is super greasy, but I really like it! They have an excellent thin crust. I will say that it is a bit expensive, but it is filling and we always have a bunch of leftovers.

They also have a really good gluten-free crust from what my wife tells me. This is a huge reason we order from here as much as we do.

Food was great.  However, customer service was not up to par. As my guest and I were waiting to be served, we overheard an employee (which turned out to be the owner) make a comment regarding "the two non tippers".  As he nodded over our direction.  We knew he was referring to us.  We went on with our lunch and brought it up to the staffs attention after we paid.  A simple report of a complaint turned into a debate/argument with the owner and his wife Sharon.

Apparently tips are mandatory at this restaurant, otherwise prepare to have employees making side comments and not giving you preference while you are there.  At least, that's what the owners made clear to us. Is that there workers deserve and earn their tips every single day.  I was obviously unaware of the mandatory tip rule.  But this would explain the extremely rude behavior of their staff.  

It's clear that in the server and serving world, tips are earned.  If employees aren't offering at the least satisfactory service, a tip should not be warranted.  And in my experience there several times, I may have received above and beyond service one of those times.  In which a tip was warranted to the server.  

I will not be dining their again ever again.  Food was excellent.  The service was absolutely wretched.

Everyone knows that Chicagoland is deep dish pizza land. In the last ten years or so, the demand for authentic Italian pizza from a wood burning oven has brought a lot of competition, and then there is Aurelio's Pizza, which is somewhere in between. Instead of catering to one or the other, Aurelio's makes a pizza that looks more like other pizzas in the Midwest. The difference, though, is that the pizza here tastes much much better. You can taste it in the ingredients. 

Aurelio's is definitely a place for families and groups. One Sunday we went out with a group of 12, and four pizzas later, everyone was full and happy with the quality of the meal. We reported a bill of $110 (including tip). The location is clean, and the service is friendly. 

They do have a bar with the basics on tap, and a few liquors if you want something stronger. You can also order a red or white wine. For the price I would just stick to water or pitchers of soda. 

The desserts are ok, and they are huge! So if you enjoy desserts, try some here. Enjoy!

My 2 star review is not because of the food but because or the confusion if they delivered or not.  My family and I dined in the restaurant last week and really enjoyed the pizza.  Our server was very nice and gave us a menu and told us they would deliver tand that her Mother lived in our neighborhood.  The pizza was so good that I've been thinking about it for 5 days.  I decided to order pizza for dinner today.  When we called to place our order and we told them which town we were in they asked if we were before or after Gary Ave.   We told them we were before Gary off of Schmale.  Then they told us that they don't go as far as Schmale.  Coming from the restaurant, you would pass Schmale on your way to Gary.  I think they should be asking if we lived before or after Schmale or even Bloomingdale Road if they don't go pass Schmale.  Now I'm just really disappointed and have nothing planned for dinner.

My first experience with the Aurelio's lunch buffet was at the Kankakee location. I get confused down there, so I'm not sure if it was K3/Bourbonais or Manteno. They all kind of blend into an I-57 haze for me. 

Anyway, I got excited when I found out that the Aurelio's in Addison, just a few minutes away from my job also has the affordable lunch buffet option. 

But they don't do it as well as the K3 store. 

They only offered 6 pizzas for selection, and two of them were duplicates. So essentially they had 4 options. And their hot entree options were limited as well. 

Fortunately, the pizza is still delicious and the service was stellar so I'm only going to knock a single star off this review. I feel that if you run a business under a corporate brand umbrella, your offerings from restaurant to restaurant should be equal in terms of quality and offerings.

My server brought me a cute little mini-pitcher of soda so I wouldn't run out of my beverage during my meal. That was a nice touch that I haven't seen many other places. 

I may return out of location convenience, but if I had my druthers I would only patronize the Kankakee location.

Food is not the greatest, not a lot of variety and you can tell food has been sitting there all day. Food buffet hours are 11-2pm. We arrived at around 1:45 and waitress warned us we only had "9 minutes" before they started putting food away. The waitress then interrupted our already short lunch to ask if wanted any last minute desserts. We responded no, instead of waitress walking to the back to let staff know we were done, she shouted " OK SHUT IT DOWN!" Definitely not coming back here. You get what you pay for i guess!!!


Terrible customer service, not worth it, do not recommend this place!

No wonder it's always empty!
Service was the only thing that was good.  Pesto pasta was mush and found a piece of paper in our rigitoni with vodka sauce.  $70.00  not worth it!
Thin crust pizza is great. Probably the best I have ever had. The service has improved. We will come here more often.

Good pizza, good service. The best part of the menu is the amount of options you're given! They've got a lot of Italian food made in a lot of different ways. Reasonably priced! For four adults we got the large pizza, didn't even finish it and had leftovers for us all the next day.

Thanks so much for opening in South Loop where I now reside. In the 90's I lived a mile from the Harwood Ave restaurant which still the best. For the first week with the new ovens, the pizza was very good. The sauce was not quite as rich and zesty as the original (a bit salty) and the crust wasn't quite as buttery. That said the pizza was great. If the bar was not set so high, my comments wouldn't be nearly so specific or tough. However I'm a thin crust fan from Flossmoor and to be the best you gotta keep pushing. I'll be back in 3-4 weeks to check things out. Thx Joe

This review is for the lunch buffet (every weekday!) which I've been to a couple of times.  For the price this is a great deal!  Each time I've been there they've had several cold salads, a few hot pasta dishes (fettuccine alfredo & spaghetti w/marinara), a baked/stuffed/rolled chicken dish (had cheese, tomato & spinach inside), grilled sausages w/peppers & onions, 5 kinds of pizza (both thin crust & pan), two kinds of soups and a whole sections of desserts (assortment of cakes, cookies & pastries).  All you can eat with a soft drink  & tax for under $10!

Their location doesn't look like much from the outside but it's nice inside and even has outdoor patio seating.  It also doesn't face Lake St. so it's easy to miss.

Place is fantastic.  Everything I have tried here is hot and delicious.  No complaints whatsoever. Service is on point with refills and cleanup.  I go here at least once a week, they do a very good job.

We ALWAYS get great service but last night was awful. Only a few tables but seemed so slow... So slow that we had to take our stuff to go. My salad and a pasta meal shouldn't take that long. Disappointed to say the least.

After reading the current reviews, I have been in there countless times with my family,  my son and his friends from NESDRA have always had a terrific time !!!  And are treated as family... You should think twice before you call someone racist ! 
We always call an make a reservation for a larger group...

You should think before you are so quick to judge people...
I was so pleased! Vito, our server, was so knowledgable and accommodating! The food was timely and delicious! BEST gluten free ITALIAN food !!!!!

Went for pizza tonite and food was good but the service was a little irritating.  The help would constantly want to sweep your plates away,  when your weren't even done.  Ii felt rushed and uncomfortable eating there because you had to make sure you didn't stop eating or they would take it away.  Also when we first walked in it smelled like a dirty mop.

My parents and I came here for a family dinner. The value is stellar - the giant pizza fed four of us with leftovers. I went for the everything pizza, which had a generous amount of both toppings and cheese. The only deterrent here is the services - it's mega slow. We had to flag down our waiter to place our order. It was a weeknight and not slammed, so I'm not sure what happened there.
Aurelio's has my favorite gluten free thin crust pizza!  The crust is wonderful.

Had the beef bracciole, and it was really well made. Tender steak, and a delicious herb/cheese filling. Paired it with gnocchi and marinara sauce, and I was in heaven!
Service by Mike was attentive without being pushy, and helped ensure that I'll be back soon!

I used to go to Aurelio's with my grandparents when I was a kid! I loved the pizza because of the sauce! Now that I'm an adult, I'm so excited to find an Aurelio's by my house! The sauce hasn't changed at all, and it's still delicious!! Even the tablecloths and benches are the same, so it brings back such wonderful childhood memories! Can't wait to come back!!!

We just moved to Addison in April and decided to order some pizza.  The prices for pizza are crazy expensive.  I was going to get 2 large pizzas and it was almost $50 so I only ordered 1 pizza instead.  Won't be going back.
Aurelios in Addison is consistently AWESOME, with excellent product and service. All future visits for us will be to that location. The Arlington Heights location stinks! (see separate review).

Absolutely terrible. I have heard great things about this place and was sorely disappointed by rude employees and failure to cater to a customers needs. Food was just ok, nothing special. Decor was poor, wouldn't come here again.

WOW!  Awful!  Rude customer service.  I'm in shock.  I was placed in a room last night next to a big group of people.  The owner was apparently called to their table and although I don't have the specifics of what even transpired with that group, what I witnessed from the owner was completely unacceptable.  The way she spoke to her customers would not be allowed in any place of business whatsoever.  What I did get from the conversation was that she mistakenly seated this group of people in error, thinking it was a party that had a reservation.  Doesn't sound like that was the customers fault to me but she certainly made them feel like it was THEIR fault with the way she was speaking to them.  The large group said they were going to just leave as it was apparent she didn't want their business and as they all got up to leave, the owner shouted "you know what?  Get out of here.  I don't need you!"  Oh my goodness, I was so embarrassed by this woman's behavior.  I, too, would have left if I were this group.  No one should be treated that way.  The way the customers were spoken too would be reason enough for me to get up and leave as well.  
I would not return to this place of business.

Lunch buffet is always on point & reasonably priced, comes with a drink as well. Their ceaser salad dressing is homemade & too good to be true!  Servers are great; friendly, drink refills and always extra napkins. This place has been here forever & will always be one of my fave pizza spots

In our continuing efforts to try every pizza place within a 5-mile radius of home, we went with some take-out from Aurelio's.

My husband arrived home with a large cheese thin-crust that was a little cool in one corner and had that "cheese has just started to get cold" look about it. (This cannot be blamed on Aurelio's, but rather, Lake St traffic.)

And yet it was one of the more delicious thin crusts I have had in recent memory. The crust was crispy around the edges and had a great flavor; the sauce, while just a hair on the sweet side, had plenty of savory to it; and the cheese was delicious, plentiful, and actually broke when you bit into it. (It is a minor pet peeve of mine when you take a bite of pizza and all of the cheese comes with it.)

The rest of their menu is large and varied, and I'd like to dine in or at least try an appetizer or two, but honestly, it will be hard to resist the pizza, which is currently up there with Home Run Inn as my favorite thin crust in the area.

=====================

11/1/10:
We've now eaten in and tried a few different things. The atmosphere is sort of odd, a mash-up of Chicago history, random old ads, and red-and-white checked stuff.

We started with their focaccia appetizer, which was different and delightful -- crispy bread stuffed with cheese and basil and served with a sweet, thick sauce for dipping. We moved on to a stuffed cheese pizza, which probably wouldn't be my first choice again, if only because there wasn't much sauce on it and the top crust got lost and turned into kind of a mess. It was good overall, and I definitely appreciated the "handle" part of the crust, which had a nice light crispiness to it and wasn't overly bready or thick. But I wonder if their version of deep dish has more/chunkier sauce.

I'd certainly be willing to eat it again, and try more of their menu, but as far as I'm concerned their thin crust is where it's at.
Grilled calmari were ok. Panzarotti soaked in grease, seems like the fryer wasn't hot enough and the oil was absorbed in the dough. Very disappointing, actually got me sick.

On my search for the perfect pizza, Aurelio's fell a little short.  It wasn't BAD, it just didn't blow my mind.  The pepperoni and sausage were both really good.  The cheese was really fresh too.  I just think that the execution of all the ingredients together is what didn't do it for me.  The crust was decent...it could have used a little more flavor or crisp to make it awesome, the sauce was really sweet, and the cheese was kind of plain, so when you throw it all together, it was just okay.  We also got the pizza bread and the bruschetta, and neither were that great.  The "bruschetta" had good bread and oil, but the tomato, celery (what the hell is celery doing on bruschetta?!?), and melted mozz topping was just no good.  Meh.

It is located right around the corner and faces the Marcus movie theaters.  There is plenty of parking near their entrance and they have a terrace for outdoor seating.  The front entrance is a little small but there is never a wait.

I've been there a few times for lunch buffet and dinner.  The lunch buffet is a great deal since you don't have to wait and you can get in and out of there pretty quickly.  They have a full salad bar with some cold pasta items and then mostly hot pasta specialties.  Each of the pastas are different with varying sauces so vegetarians or meaty or cheese preferences are satisfied.  There's also a chicken dish and sometimes Italian sausage.  The pizzas are in the back and they have their good thin crust with a deep dish specialty added in.  There are a couple of soups and a whole table full of desserts.  The standard American desserts along with their Italian homemade ones are there for any type of sweet tooth.  The prices are good value.  They have a pretty vast menu so there's always good reason to go back!

I go here all the time with my family. The menu has alot of choices but you come here for the pizza enough said. I don't what it is but the sauce is very sweet and its a perfect combination with the great crust. For toppings you have to get the carmelized onions they are so so good.
Great pizza. Their lunch is awesome.  My son would not eat any other pizza.
I definitely recommend going to Auelios in Addison. Had a great thin crust pizza this evening and enjoyed it immensely!  Keep up the good work!
I like the lunch buffet, we have the pizza at work a lot. The chopped salad gets rave reviews from people. We've used them for catering as well, and are always happy with them.

My "usual" pizza joint closed and in my great search for a pizza joint in my area, I found an Aurelio's.  I was super exciting to order from an Aurelio's (a Southside favorite) from a joint on the North-ish-side!! I ordered my usual an 18" thin sausage-pepperoni and an order of tomato bread.  MAANNN I was disappointed!  I thought about putting them on my "list of bad places", but alas I decided to order my usual from the joint, again.  Success!!  The first time, the pizza was soggy and very unappetizing however, the second was crispy, done to perfection and AWESOME!!  The tomato bread (my fave), on the first order, had chopped tomatoes and tasted just plain yucky.  Did they forget the garlic???  The second order of tomato bread was great!! sliced tomatoes and great cheesy garlicy taste...YUM.

I would've given it 5 stars, but there was no marinera sauce with the tomato bread...booooo.

I think I found my delivery-pizza joint!

If it weren't for my waiter this place could easily be a four, if not a five. The food is fabulous and the lunch buffet a great value. The ambiance reminds me of a cozier East Side Mario's. If it weren't for the waiter (GRR?) it would have been a near perfect experience. Unfortunately, he was one of those guys with a feminine arrogance to the point my standard 20% was easily taken to 10 and a clear sneer for a thank you and good bye. But I am still booking my daughter's birthday party here and have high expectations for it!

I have been going here for years and their homemade gluten free pizza is the best in the area. The GF crust has more flavor than the regular pizza crust, to the point where my family (non-celiac) will order the gluten free crust instead of the regular crust. My favorite pizza is the giardinera and ricotta (but get ready for some pain). They offer a gluten free menu which includes bread, gnocchi, appetizers, desserts and beer. Staff is extremely knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. Pizza is your best bet here!

This is my go to restaurant for gluten-free pizza. I love getting their Hawaiian pizza and their Baked Potato pizza.

My fiance and I also like their antipasto salad. They also can make fresh meatballs for their pasta per request. Just be willing to wait a little longer for fresh meatballs.

if I were to rate only their carryout service, they would get a five. Unfortunately, their table service is a little lacking.

When my fiance and I ate in the restaurant, we felt rushed to finish. We weren't even offered coffee and dessert at the end of our meal. The waitress just gave us our check and high tailed it out of there. We were eating dinner at around 8ish, and they didn't close until 10. Why the hurry?

The food itself is great. The service needs to be worked on.

Best thin crust pizza there is.

Get a Super Six - sausage, pepperoni, ham, onion, green paper, and mushroom.  That's been our favorite thin crust pizza since Joe Aurelio had his first pizza place in Homewood.

Atmosphere is friendly and clean.  You can call ahead and order pizza for your arrival time.  And they now have glutten-free pizza.

A pretty decent establishment. I've ordered here multiple times for their pizza and appetizers. The place itself is actually bigger than it looks. The indoor dining is nice, tall ceilings, typical Italian restaurant feel. They have a large outdoor patio with many tables for the spring and summer time. Their pizza is consistently good, along with the appetizers, specifically their bruschetta. We order pretty simply from here, sausage and cheese pizzas, but they're always good. The crust is crisp and crunchy, the meats are thick and flavorful. Not great, but pretty good if you're around the Addison area, or need a bite to eat while waiting for your movie to start next door at Marcus Theatre.

I was introduced to Aurelio's by some coworkers and instantly liked it. I have issues with the crust though, it could be a little crispier. That aside, the sauce is light flavored, not too heavy and not too oily. The cheese is great, you can tell it's real mozza which is important. They also have a really good pizza buffet for lunch. Most times I am not a fan of any kind of buffet, but this one I absolutely like. Great choice of pizza, soup/salad, pasta dishes and great dessert selection. Aurelio's never leaves me feeling gross after eating it, like some heavy pizzas do. Give it a try.

My husband and I love it here. We always get the antipasto salad for two, it comes with incredible rolls (i'm a breadaholic lol) and really delicious salad, and then we get the sausage pizza with mild peppers. We've also had their italian food, i get spaghetti and meatballs with extra marinara, yum! 
Best of all, they have a dinner buffet, I think it is Mon-Thurs, call and check. This is the best idea ever, because a) you can sample all their food; b) they are right next to the Marcus Cinema and people can easily go right to the buffet and leave in time for the movie, don't have to worry about crowds or timing of food!.
I took my brother there when he was in town visiting and he did a review on road food, complete with pictures, I will post it here for anyone who might be considering Aurelio's in Addison. It is a good value for the money. http://www.roadfood.com/Forums/m536363-print.aspx

One of the best Aurelio's in the chain.  Consistently great pizza.  I've been eating at Aurelios since the 1970's and do not see that changing.  Thin crust is the best of the bunch.  I'm not a big fan of the stuffed pizza.  Garlic bread is very good (ask for dipping sauce).  The real star here though is the Antipasto Salad, its still as good as the first time I tried it in Homewood many years ago.  Highly recommend!  Note: reservations only accepted for large groups.

This place had a 5-star rating in my book until recently. Their thin crust is still to die for, and they have a great gnocchi with chicken dish.

However, I recently took an out-of-town guest here for some deep dish. The crust was so tough, it was difficult to eat. The crust towered high over the sad, flat interior. The toppings were also sparse. My guest actually said, "Giordano's is better." Yikes.

Also, the service has taken a dive recently. The staff rarely comes to check on you, which makes it difficult to do things like pay the bill.

Oh, Aurelio's, won't you please come back to being one of my favorite places?

As a buffet, and I don't mean this is a demeaning way, this is the best food I've had,( accept for maybe Home Run Pizza Buffet ;) 
But 90% of everything offered on their Buffet is excellent from the Lemon chicken to the Fettuccine Alfredo to the Deep Dish pizza and the steamed vegetables. 
The service is pretty good (I mean their speedy with drink refills) and for the most part their very friendly! I should order off their menu at some point but for my hour lunch limitation, their buffet is very convenient and their prices are commensurate to the food quality. I just wish a location was closer to work! 

Definitely wish I didn't have to consider calories when eating here because everything is very rich and scrumptious lol

Our extended family all went here for the buffet during the week. We had the private room and we all got the buffet. About 30 of us.

The pizza was very good. The rest of the food was average. The desserts were all less than desirable.

We were over charged for the tip. They added 20% gratuity on top of the tax for terrible service .....for a buffet. It was impossible to get a drink refill. The server was not around 90% of the time.

I think this place is known for having bad service and charging 20% tip automatically for small groups too. 

When my sister called to ask about being over charged, the owner was extremely rude and told her that she and our family were to never come back! This was out of line and totally unwarranted.

What kind of restaurant treats their customers like this? This place has issues.

The creamy chicken with rice soup was just delicious!  So was the grilled calamari appetizer, so tasty & tender! The wait staff treated us very nicely. All in all I spent a wonderful evening here with my friend. This place is highly recommended.
This place has been a family favorite for fresh, near-perfect pizza in the suburbs for years.

I have to give Aurelio's in Addison 5 Stars. We just went there after the show and had another excellent meal!!  I asked if they had "marshmellow vodka" . No, but they had marshmellow syrup. Had a marshmellow martini. Well, you haven't lived. Ha! Comes with 4 teenie-tiny marshmellow as a garnish. Cute! We had a stuffed artichoke appetizer for the first time. It had a delicious lemon seasoning and, I think, they use Panko breadcrumbs because the stuffing was crispy-good. Had their largest thin crust spinach/sausage pizza because we like to have plenty of leftovers. It'snot just spinach on a pie. It's a special marinated recipe that's to die for.

The service was excellent. We went early -- like 5:30 or so.  Our server was very attentive...the bussers cleared our plates in the heartbeat...asked if we'd like refills promptly. I was really pleasantly surprised with the service because it was top notch.

We ate  inside, but they have a beautiful terrace out back. Their pizza is delicious!
Best pizza in Chicagoland. Not too thick - or thin, and perfect crust.

2 stars for the food, 4 for the service, but i can't give it 3 stars because it wasn't A-Ok.  It is hard for me to give 2 stars.  Look at my history, but read on.

1)  ordered fried ravioli.  Some pieces were hot, some were warm, some were cold.  But all of them tasted like it was a frozen food dropped into the fryer.  I ate it because i was hungry, but honestly, any cold cheese dish made to be eaten hot is just yucky.

2)  got their deep dish pizza.  it was came out looking so yummy.  Took a bite and it was cool.  OMG, W-T-FREAK?  Is the oven broken?  Worried I sent it back hoping no additional ingredients would be added.  Came back, the flavor was good, but now the crust is soggy.  erghhh?  isn't Chicago the pride of deep dish?  

Word to the business:  don't hurry your food.  make it worth while.  

Maybe i should have ordered a pasta dish, but  2 out of 2 dishes coming out disappointing, I can't  say much positive but...

STAFF was really friendly.  Did what they could, but not enough to make up for the lack of food.

Thank goodness it was paid for by my company, or it would have been a waste of my money.  I just sacrificed a few hundred calories.  Took one for the Yelp team.
The pizza is awful!!! It honestly tasted like bread dipped into a large bowl of tomato soup. AVOID

My family and I LOVE this place.  Spinach thin crust with extra sauce is my personal favorite.  I could eat it every day and not tire of it.  We go pretty often to the Wednesday or Thursday night buffets.  We have gone there so much, that the minute we walk in the door, the host/hostess always says "three for buffet?" :)  They remember us, which is nice, because you feel like a part of the big Italian family when dining there.  We tend to get Vito, or the guy who looks like his twin, as our waiter. 

My only problem is that while my husband and son love the buffet, I feel that most of the time the pizza seems like it has been sitting out on the warmers for a long time, and doesn't taste as fantastic as ordering a fresh pizza.  

I think we're due for a buffet night...it's been WAY too long (about a month!)
Pizza was really good. Service is very friendly. We were there on a Sunday afternoon and the noise level was crazy loud. Don't go here for a romantic meal...just go for the great pizza! I'll go back.

We love Aurelio's.  The thin crust pizza is luscious.  The crust is thin, but kind of yeasty and fluffy, too.  Excellent crust.  I love their marinara - really tomatoey and not oily.  Sausage is good.  Real, fresh mushrooms and fresh spinach, too.

Check out the buffet on weeknights - such a deal and quite tasty.  

Last time we had an awesome spinach salad - just delicious.  

They have a lovely outdoor area for the warm seasons - it has a central fireplace, trees, and lots of tables.   

They make a mean mojito, too.

My name is Beth, and I endorse this lunch buffet. 

My co-workers and I love to come here for lunch during the week. They have everything from pizza to pasta (their alfredo really is pretty good, as is their eggplant rollatini), soup to salad, and a whole onslaught of sweet stuff too. The only drawback that I have seen is that, for a mid-week lunch, it's a bit pricey. With soda and tip, it's about 12 bucks. 

Guaranteed carb overload. I need a nap.

WEEKDAY LUNCH BUFFET

I dream about it sometimes...

I used to work in the area and we would hit this lunch buffet when time and waistline would allow.

the typical spread:
-salad bar (small, but adequate)
-4 types of pasta
-4-5 entrees (usually meat/fish, sometimes veggies, sometimes both)
4-5 different pizzas (including stuffed and some kind of spinach calzone thingy that is absolutely wonderful)
MANY DESERTS!!

free drink with meal.

we usually paid $10-11 bucks each including tax and tip.

one time, I called in sick to work (I wasn't sick) and drove to this buffet anyway cause it's that damn good.

By far the best pizza in the area.  I live in Elmwood Park and am surrounded by some of the best pizza places so that's why I say that.  I love their stuffed pizza and their thin crust is good, too.  LOVE theirs soups, too!  The servers are always nice and actually seem to enjoy their jobs.  Don't think I've ever had an issue here.

Will never go back to the Aurelios in Addison. Service was horrible. It took the waitress a very long time to make it to our table initially -- we should have left then. We had to wait long intervals for her to come back to the table with the drinks, check, etc. Restaurant was not very crowded. They screwed up the order and then when she brought the pizza the waitress knocked my husband's beer all over him. It took her more than 10 minutes to bring him another which she charged us for. We actually like the pizza here but this is the worst service I think I have ever had at a restaurant and no pizza is worth it.

The service here has gotten incredibly bad. It takes about tow HOURS to get a pizza and salad here...I still think the pizza is great and I love the salad but the service is just downright almost non-existent and rude. Doesn't work.

Great pizza and great service. My husband and I order from Aurelio's all the time. 
We never ate anything else besides the pizza from the restaurant so I can't comment on how great their food is but if you like pizza you really got to try this place.

So from the outside this place doesn't look too interesting and it is kind of hidden, but once you eat there, you will be back for more!  I have only gone there for their dinner and brunch buffets (cause I'm fat like that), and they are delicious!!  We are actually going there for their Easter brunch on Sunday!  YUM!  They have a salad bar, usually two different kinds of soup, pastas, chicken, sausage and peppers, about four different kinds of pizzas and a bunch of desserts!!  I usually get only a small salad and skip the soup all together to save more room for the alfredo!!  Their alfredo pasta is SOOO good!!!  Everything is good really!  And the desserts, they have the typical dry Italian cookies and cakes mixed with moist and delicious cheesecake bites and Rice Krispie treats!  YUM!!  If you love good quality buffets loaded with delicious Italian items...then head here and be prepared to unbutton your pants!


**Note...after eating here on Easter Sunday, I realized that they up their brunch price from about $11.00 to $16.00 just because it was for Easter!  And there was nothing new on the buffet either to make the price go up...it solely went up due to the holiday...I'm really not feeling that...so I have to dock a star!**

Great Aurelio's pizza with a bit of ambiance! The pizza never disappoints at this location - always too hot to eat when it arrives at the table but you can't help digging in because it is just so tasty! My family and I have never had the buffet at lunch time (wish they would offer on the weekend or dinner time during the week!).  Most visits we have very good service.  My only pet peeve, and this is with every Aurelio's location I have been, is that there are not unlimited refills on drinks.  I think the company is stuck back in the 20th century before refills became standard.  My last visit I did notice a few little things that worried me the owners are not keeping up on maintenance - like a cracked flat screen tv - time to replace that since it has been in that condition since the time before when I ate there!  Overall though, I make a 40 minute drive out to Addison to have hot fresh sit-down Aurelio's pizza at this location.  My mouth is watering already! (get the thin crust with extra sauce - yum yum yum!)

I didn't think much of this place when passed by the outside of it. It's in a strip mall and does little to draw attention to itself. I even stopped in to get carry out here first , and didn't see how cool this place was. Once I stepped fully inside , It's charmingly cheesy decor hit me full force. They try to pull off a 1940's Italian neighborhood outdoor cafe feel , complete with gates , vines and lampposts. This is definitely not one of the trendiest places around, but at least it's not boring. There is a cool looking outdoor cafe , looked pretty nice but I never dined there.   
I have to say I'm not a fan of the pizza , the thin crust isn't bad , but they put too much cheese and sauce for my taste. It is alright though , I've just had better. The wife and kid on the other hand really like it , the wife even said it's the best yet in the area.What I do like ; the fried calamari (good) , the baked clams (very good) , the minestrone soup (good) , the Chicken Vesuvio (good), and the Meatball sandwich (good). There is also a lunch buffet , maybe even a dinner buffet (I'm not sure) , I never had it.
I am not the biggest expert on Italian (Olive Garden is probably the Italian place I hit the most) , but this place is great for family's , they have good to very good food , friendly staff , and a Gigantic menu . If you accept the fact that it's not a place for a serious date , more of a hang out and family night out joint , I'd be surprised if you don't think this place is at least pretty good.

Not sure what the previous reviewer expected, but this is not a sit down restaurant.  It's a tacqueria/grocery.  I did not eat in the tacqueria portion of the store, but it had a number of happy familes eating lunch.  My husband commented that the chips and salsa looked good. The reason for my visit was to try the San Marcos tamales.

This was my second time in this place.  The first time I was looking for carnitas--that wonderful greasy roast pork delight that you can only find in Mexcian grocery stores. Because I've had experience at other tacqueria/grocery places, I knew if they had carnitas, it would only be available on the week-end. San Marcos had the carnitas--and they were wonderful. 

I found the carnitas in the "take-out hot food" area located in the meat department.  Along with carnitas there were a variety of "to go" items. The store manager saw me at the counter and asked if I wanted a sample.  "You betcha, I'll have a taste of that".  He gave me a generous portion and BAM I bought more.  While he was wrapping up this treat he mentioned that they usually have tamales available on the week-end.  Unfortunately, they were sold out.  What a tease.

So, the tamales led me to my second week-end visit.  Again, I did not eat in the tacqueria section, but noticed a number of happy families having lunch.   Now, I am an expert when it comes to tamales.  I make my own--both masa and filling.  And, when you make tamales--you can't make one or two--you need to make one or two hundred (usually with the help of my sisters).  To find a good tamale and not go through the work of making tamales would be a real gift.  San Marcos tamales--available in chicken or pork--did not disappoint.  The meat to masa ratio was just right!  I was given a choice of two types of salsa--verde and some orange- colored sauce.    When I almost bought a container of something that looked like pico de gallo, the manager appeared and asked if I would like a sample to try instead.  I appreciate being able to try something, liking it, and coming back for more instead of buying, hating it and never coming back. By the way, this was a nice salsa.  

So, my first and second visits were both pleasantly tasty.  I'll be going a third time, and this time I'll be eating in the tacqueria.  Gotta try the chips!

We will definitely be back to try this again and other items off the menu : ) 

Service is a little slow and seems they need more employees
They are very friendly though

They need to get a menu updated either on yelp, online, a website, etc... It took us about 10 min looking online to try and find one (but couldn't) then waited 10 min to get thru on the phone to have a menu faxed

We got the gyro with fries and chicken pita with a side of mozz sticks and everything was 100% DELICIOUS!   Not one thing to complain about with the food; amazing

First and foremost, if you can't understand the words, "plain gyro, with extra sauce on it", then I'm not so sure you should be a cashier.  I don't want to sound rude, but I had to repeat my order 3 times.

Next order of issue...the gyro was given to me with sauce on the side.  i never asked for sauce on the side.  That isn't what I ordered!  Ok, I'm over that, but there is one thing that is completely unacceptable to me and that is cleanliness!  I was so grossed out about the cleanliness of the establishment.

The silverware container and the napkin holder had so much dust on it, I was disgusted.  

To further exacerbate the disgustingness, you could see all of the grease on the actual chairs.

The trash can area needed to be cleaned too.

The gyro meat almost had a rubbery texture to it and it had the over cooked edges, which caused me the need to dip it in more cucumber sauce.

So there was a good sized crowd here on day number four of business. I drove by on day number two and the lot was packed!  I knew I had to stop in to see what the deal was. Think burgers, hot dogs, fresh salads, spinach pie, gyros, Greek chicken and pork chops. Friendly staff both behind the counter and back by the grill!  

There are a lot of tables and chairs and everything was clean (I would hope so being so new!). The line was one deep when I arrived and twelve deep with about ten people waiting for their orders when I left. It takes a while to get the timing down, so we'll see how that eventually works out. 

I ordered the chicken breast plate with Greek potatoes. The woman who took my order wanted me to try the 1/2 Greek chicken. When I tried to figure out why since I wanted boneless chicken, she didn't really give me a hard fast answer.  What I know for sure is that my order took 29 minutes from receipt time to being handed my lunch. This was way too long for my liking. They felt badly and they were very kind, but they need more staff and more organization. They'll get there. Unfortunately, they forgot my pita bread, there were no utensils or napkins and the Greek potatoes weren't very good. But the chicken was AWESOME!!!  Juicy charbroiled chicken!  So good in fact that I would actually wait the 29 minutes for the same chicken again. 

So that's my first evaluation just four days into business. I hope they work out the kinks so I can get that yummy chicken again soon!

Average Greek Diner/Grill.  Standard fries.  Italian Beef Sandwich lacked the flavor I expect of a Chicago area Italian beef sandwich.  The location offered the usual Hot Dog, Burger, Gyros, and Beef Sandwiches.  I would not go out of my way to eat here, but would come here again if I was in the area and didn't have much time to search something better out.

I just called there to place an order for delivery & the woman who answered was very rude. She sounded impatient & was not very helpful. I hate being cut off when I'm speaking & she did that 3 times. I won't be going there with service like that.

Great chicken Caesar salad. It comes with a full size pita bread and all the perfectly seasoned chicken breast was diced up in convenient bite sized pieces so it is neat and easy to eat. Highly recommend. 
The parking lot was almost full and the restaurant has plenty of dine in seating.

Excellent food. Best gyros I have ever had in my life.... And that's a lot of gyros :)
Tzaziki sauce is great. Pita bread is warm and crisp on one side, soft on the other. Ribeye sandwich is also good. Greek salad was great! We drive farther to get here even though there are several other gyro places closer to home.

I would have given three stars except today, which is my third time here, I had the ribeye sandwich and it was pathetic. It was overcooked, very thin, no seasoning and there was nothing on it except a few raw onions and enough lettuce to make a side salad. If it wasn't for the moisture from the lettuce I don't think I would've been able to swallow it it was so dry. The previous two occasions I just had the burger  and the chicken sandwich and both were fair. Next time I'll drive a hundred yards north and go to Fatt Mustard.

This place just opened up and from what we experienced it is running pretty smoothly.  The cash registers are cool--I like a restaurant that strives for subtle differences.  The food is made to order, hot, tasty, and served with a smile.  We ordered the cheeseburger basket and the gyro platter.  The cheeseburger had a nice grilled taste, a bit on the thin side but overall very well cooked on an appreciated toasted bun.  The gyro platter was loaded with meat, onions, and a soft pita with a side of fresh cucumber sauce.  Very nice!  Fries came with both and were cooked to perfection.  Nice balance between softness and crispiness.  That's how I like em!  My best friend just moved into the area so we'll definitely be back.  Keep up the good work!  Maybe put a coupon for yelp users if they check in there--10% off your order or something along those lines--helps drum up more business and get your name out there!
Our gyros were superbly made as was the French fries. Look forward to trying rest of menu.
I'm a big fan of Breaded Mushrooms and Kostene's has really good ones. Also had the gyro and it was great with the Greek Potatoes. Fast delivery, too! I definitely recommend this place.
Good food, they need to work on streamlining their order process and get an online ordering site.
Loved the half Greek chicken with Greek potatoes. However, the Gyros are the winner...so far. Need to try the daily specials. Rib tips are the next to check out. Nice people running this restaurant.

I was there on Saturday and tried the chicken pita. Added the homemade tzatziki sauce too, and it was fantastic! The gyro pita and chicken soup is very tasty as well, and the service is friendly and the owners are very welcoming! There is plenty of seating as well. Can't wait to go back!
Tried this place for the first time and loved it, best gyros. I'll be coming back again

The food is always absolutely amazing. Except the customer service is horrendous. The younger lady in glasses at the counter and who answers the phone (only to put you on hold for what seems like forever, only to forget about you) is seriously the most miserable lady I've come in contact with. She makes you feel unwanted as she continuously yells at her staff. This place deserves 5 stars if only they learned how to treat their guests better.

I had the gyro meal, the gyro was fantastic, the meat was done perfectly, and the tzatziki sauce was delicious. The fries were really good as well. My friend had the italian beef with cheese and hot peppers, I gave that a try as well, and that was equally as fantastic as the gyro. I will definitely be going back to Kostenes in the future.

I was disappointed by the food and the gyros at this place. The sandwich seemed small and they gave a small serving of French fries with the order. The cucumber sauce also didn't quit smell right and the place looked overall dirty for a slow weekend day.

Friendly service all the way, from ordering on the phone to pick up. My order was ready when I arrived. I enjoyed the spinach pie and unexpected side salad. My friends enjoyed the third-pound cheeseburgers. I definitely will return. I am so glad such a good restaurant has filled this long-vacant spot.

Service is always very good. A tad slow when they get busy but never a problem.  I had the tower of onion rings with an 8oz sirloin and a hash brown patty beneath. Side of mashed and French onion soup. Wife had a sirloin and side of mushrooms.  Everything was delicious honestly.  Both steaks were cooked one level more than requested. Not burnt or anything just well instead of medium or medium well. Still delicious and we ate them but manager gave us a discount after offering new ones.   Great service again.

We came in here on Father's Day - June 19, 2016.  Please Note:  We hate leaving a sub-standard review since we have been fans of this place, be we feel we had to leave another fair review.

We arrived at 4:45 pm.  Wait time was only about 7 minutes.  No problems there.  Our waiter (young guy, maybe early 20's) was just fine. No problems there - brought us re-fills and two complimentary breads.

Our food (OVERALL) was a disappointment and for the amount we spent (upwards of $70), it left a lot to be desired. 

- Mother's 6 oz. Sirloin Steak was pretty bad.  She asked for "Medium Well" (with SOME red) and it came out clearly "well-done", and was almost charred and tough.  It also had some funny taste, which we all picked up on.  

- I ordered the smaller-size cup of soup.  While the soup WAS GOOD, I barely got anything - literally.  The size of the "cup" was literally slightly larger than a small side cup which would hold tarter sauce or a side of salad dressing per se.  For 3.99, this was uncalled for.  This wasn't even enough to feed a baby.  

- My father's burger didn't taste well - he ordered the Bloomberg Burger which supposedly came with a side of onions.  They never came with the burger and we told the waiter about this who apologized and said that the burger indeed did come with those, and he did go and bring them out a few minutes later.

- We ordered a side of mashed potatoes which never came out.  We told our waiter who actually remembered this and even showed us he wrote it down on our order slip, so the issue came from the staff in the back.  Our waiter did bring us out our mashed potatoes then.

- I ordered a regular cheeseburger - this was GREAT.  No problems on my end.  However, the fries were overly salty.  

- My brother ordered fish tacos and he said they were good, no complaints on his end.

As stated, overall for what we spent we left disappointed, especially having been fans of this place for several years.  Two out of our four meals had issues, several side dishes seemed to be forgotten by the kitchen staff, and the portion of the soup bordered on a joke.  We are not expecting to come to a restaurant and spend McDonald's type money, but also don't insult people who come into a restaurant to spend hard-earned money on a holiday by being skimpy-skimpy.

We are unsure if we would return. We may send our review here to corporate, also.  Again, we hate to do this as we ARE/WERE fans of this Outback.

Outback has really gone downhill lately. I was really craving a bloomin' onion, so I dragged my boyfriend to Outback. We immediately ordered the bloomin' onion and our meals.  The restaurant was not very crowded, but it took forever to get our food. The only good things we are were the onion and the potato soup. My steak was terrible. I ordered medium and it came out red while my boyfriends medium rare was only pink. I also had a huge vein/ hard white thing through the middle of my entire steak. We had to do surgery on it to try and salvage it. It didn't work out too well and became my dog's dinner when we got home. Service was inattentive and painfully slow. They were messing up orders left and right. I kept hearing them apologize to other tables and I think everyone got $8 off their bill for the bad experience that night. We will not be back. If anything I will order my onion carry out!

Came in for a quick lunch, got the endless soup & salad combo. Upgraded my soup to the French onion but I've had better. Just tastes like a basic beef broth with not a lot of onion flavor. Loved the giant crouton and melted provelone cheese on top though. Their ranch dressing on the house salad is great! Also ordered a mango passion fruit rita and it was surprisingly very good. Def recommend! And who doesn't love the yummy loaf of bread that they always give you? So fresh and I love their whipped butter! 

Only thing that sucks, no wifi! I was hoping to send out a few emails for work while I was here but ended up leaving to go to Starbucks to do it. Probably would've ordered another drink if I could've stayed longer to get some work done! ;)

I have not been to an Outback for years! We came today for lunch and at first thought it was closed as there were no cars in the lot...but they were open! We got seated right away (obviously) and were attended to immediately. We each did the lunch option. My boyfriend got the chicken tacos and fries and I did the fish tacos and roasted vegetables. The portions were perfect for lunch and the food was great! During our meal, the manager came over to ask how everything was. I really like when places do this because it shows that they care enough to make sure the guests are happy and gives guests an opportunity to rave or suggest things that need changing. We'll definitely be back! I think a lot of people don't think of lunch when they think of the Outback...but they really do have a terrific lunch menu!! I also like that they do not have Ziosks, like a lot of other restaurant chains! You actually have someone attend to you for your whole meal, including the bill! Great job Outback!
I asked for a medium rare steak. It was raw and inedible. It was a to go order so no wait staff to tell about it, but I won't be going back.

We ate here yesterday (Easter Sunday 3/27/16) wasn't overly busy when we arrived around 5pm, we were seated in what we thought was the best booth, tucked away in a corner away from major traffic & loud conversations. 

Our waiter was the best! I believe his name was "Jarrod" (sp?) 20s, short black hair... He made the whole experience that much better. Was very attentive and made sure everything was perfect for us. Probably the best service we've ever had in a restaurant. 

My husband ordered a Sirloin steak, Med-well which was cooked to absolute perfection, so full of flavor and juicy and it came with a baked potato and ceasar salad. 

I ordered a breaded Chicken Sandwich that came with fries, while I ordered it completely plain, it was still amazing. I had to cut it in half in order to eat it because it was so big. 

For both meals, a beer + soda, our bill total was around $36  not bad at all.face
I'm not sure what all the bad reviews are about but we will definitely be back to this location.

This is seriously going to be the last time we go here. You would think for a $175 check our steaks would have more flavor, cooked correctly and no tendons! We don't send things back because if you charge this much for a piece of steak, it should always be cooked right. Not to mention it's a waste of time, yours and ours. Your first clue is when your customers say yes to the steak sauce when asked by the waitress. Speaking of our waitress, she was sweet but very forgetful. We're sorry we only left her a $25 tip but I based it on service and taste. Back to the steaks, that I could of easily bought at Jewel-Osco, then thrown on the grill, is a joke! I just don't get it. Does your restaurant not flavor or marinate any of your meats first? Is that what the salt and pepper shakers are for? I'm sorry I even suggested bringing my brother there for his birthday. But do you know how embarrassing that feels; To treat your family to a "good" meal that doesn't even taste good? I'm done.

I'm sorry but this place doesn't deserve any better than one star based on Yelp's rating descriptions. 
If you like bland food, overcooked (and thus over-priced) steaks and crabby waitresses- the Bloomingdale Outback may be right up your alley.
If it hadn't been for the fact that we had used a $50 gift certificate and didn't come out of pocket much for our meals, my husband and I seriously would have cried. The best thing I put in my mouth there was my two yr old son's mac-n-cheese.
I'm not sure if our standards have just become too high for Outback but this was just bad. No other way to put it.

I review for the purpose of people with food allergies, but also for the general stuff too. A few nights ago, I went to this restaurant. I walked in and got seated nearly instantly. I took a look at the menu and saw that a picture of the Sesame Salad. I thought that looked pretty good. I read what was in the salad, just to make sure it was safe for me. I saw everything looked safe, but I wanted to ask what was in the vinagrette. (Please forgive my spelling). I ask my server for an allergen menu, and he says he doesnt know where one is. So I tried asking him if he knew what was in the vinagrette. He replied, "I dont know, I just work here". That insta-pissed-me-off. I asked for a manager, and he came over. I asked for an allergen menu, and he came over with an outdated allergen menu. Like, REALLY outdated. He tried telling me their allergen menu is online, but it isnt. I informed him that it was only the nutrition and gluten free menus, to which he replied, "Huh. Ill have to talk to corporate about that. Weird." So at least it felt like he was listening. So I asked him about the vinagrette since the menu was outdated. He found out from the chef and it was safe for me. I had the salad, and it was absolutely AMAZING. Ive wanted to go back just for that salad. It looked and tasted really freakin' good. I highly recommend this salad. As far as the server goes, I know he got a talking to by the manager, cause we told him about the, "I dont know, I just work here" response. Manager cringed, which was pretty funny. But I mean, other than a poor server, great food, and a pretty good and attentive manager. Thank you Outback, I will be coming back fairly soon!
Went here for Lunch.  The food (Sirloin) was a little dry but other than that the rest of the meal was pretty decent.  I plan on going back but, I'll def try something different next time.

We usually get excellent service at this location. Today was a giant disappointment. Greeter? MIA. Drink refills? Missing. Waiter? MIA. Our soup and salad was great, but would have been better with some actual wait service. Sorry to see this happen at what is usually an amazing restaurant.

We normally go here once a month. Not anymore we will travel to another one. Our server was Melissa K and omg she was terrible. Took over a hour for our dinner. The prime rib was terrible. 30 mins for salads. We had to ask for refills. Checked on us maybe once and goes you guys are fine right. I was so annoyed do you think a manager would ask us how our dinner was nope nothing. I will be contacting corporate too

Love the food but this location is FREQUENTLY understaffed or staffed with poor help. Tonight we walked in and there were a number of empty tables but my party of 3 waited for 20 minutes to be seated. I have also been seated quickly and been ignored for a half hour ... until I got up to walk out. Then they sent someone over who had an attitude.  We left and went to Wendy's.

One of the worst experiences at a restaurant and the worst Prime Rib I ever had. 
I made reservations for 6:30, got there at 6:15. Waited 20 minutes for a table. Others that just arrived without reservations were told it was a 45 minute wait. So not too bad. 
Got a table, ordered drinks, waiter got that wrong and instead of asking if we wanted to order appetizers before he left to correct the drinks, he left to correct the drinks and so ten minutes later he's back with the right drinks. Then we get to order the appetizer, but not the entrees. More wait but he did bring bread to the table. When that was gone, he asked if we wanted more bread. We told him no but wanted refills on the drinks. He came back ten minutes later with more bread but no drink refills.
Then the appetizers arrived and we got to order our meals. Just two mistakes with that, forgetting the sides for two of us. We asked for them and he left to get them. I ordered the 12 ounce prime rib and struggled to cut it with what I thought was a dull knife but it was also the toughest prime rib I ever had. I asked for a sharper knife and got one but the meat was still very very tough. So I stopped eating it. When everyone else was done, the waiter showed up again and asked if I wanted a box for the remainder of the meat on my plate. I asked him, "for what, to bury it?" I told him it was the worst prime rib I ever had. He called the manager over to our table and the manager asked if he could bring me something else. I said no, because everyone else was done and the waiter never came back to the table while we were eating to ask how the meals were. I think they were very busy, too busy to check on us. So the manager had it taken off the bill. Which was good of the manager. But when I got the check I noticed that the waiter charged me for the 16 ounce prime rib not the 12 ounce that I received. So it was good that they took it off the check. But I will never go back to this place again.

The wait to be seated wasn't as long as could be expected for the date. But once we got a seat the real wait began. It took long to get our drinks and the bread. Ordered an appetizer and had to ask the waiter for menus. Waited for him to come back. Waited for the food. Waited for a side of mayo. Waited waited waited. Overall we were at the restaurant over 2 hours for an appetizer and hamburgers that weren't anything special. Will not be coming back.

Bad everything and we will not be visiting this location again. On 1/2/2015 we decided since we were visiting our old neighborhood in Bloomingdale, IL we would have dinner at Outback. Big mistake! 

When we walked in it was standing room only and that is understandable for a Friday evening. I should have followed my instincts and left but the kids have never been to Outback so we waited. After being seated we were given a menu and it was 15 minutes before we saw our waitress again. When she finally appeared we ordered appetizers, and our meal. Our appetizers arrived in 10 minutes, which was great but after still waiting for 50 minutes for our main course I told the family get your coats, I'm paying for the appetizers and we are out of here. One of the other waitresses heard our conversation and suddenly our waitress appeared. She apologized for long wait and gave us a sad story on how they were "slammed" I told her people who were seated after us have already paid their check and left. She brought over the manager and he apologized and said our meal will be served in 5 minutes.

When the meal finally arrived the steaks were tough and flavorless; and the pasta dish was tasteless. We wasted close to 2 hours for this below-par meal.  Extremely disappointed.

If we could leave a zero, we would...
Other than the hostess, no one, not the bartender on our initial wait nor the 
wait staff we never encountered after asking to be reseated because the child next to us regurgitated his bloomin' whatever..
We left...
We might try another location later only because we have a gift card to burn up, but ordering it as a carry out seems to be the most logical choice...

Last time i was at an Outback was about 10 yrs ago. Now i know why its been so long.  This was not my lunch pick, my significant other chose this and I'm very upset. I'm leaving hungry and he spent over 30 on my sucky meal.  I'm giving it one star for the decent drink, a blueberry sangria.  I ordered the Outback special steak and it was a HUGE disappointment. It was cooked medium rare, how I asked it but it was terrible. Chewy, had no flavor. I ordered the sauteed mushrooms which were whole button mushrooms and they weren't good. Not what I expected. I also ordered the house salad which was just that, very basic. For 30.00 I ate a salad thats comparable to mcds house salad, warm bread with butter and a baked potato. Oh, the potato was good.  Now I leave, upset, disappointed and hungry. If you want steak go elsewhere!

People go to restaurants for good food, environment and a memorable experience. Unfortunately, none of them are offered at outback steakhouse in Bloomingdale.

A steak house that doesn't know how to cook steaks!

At first entering into the restaurant the hostess is not welcoming, They look at guests as an intrusion of their time. Maybe, its more important to gossip and laugh about while customers decide if they went to the right place. 

After taking our name, It takes half an hour to be seated. We observed several  tables were empty, so after inquiring if we can get the one those empty tables, the response is:

                         "oh we don't have servers for that table" 

                                                      What!!! 

That goes to show that management is unable to utilize their staff or don't have enough help to cater guests. As a customer, you want to be treated well and feel welcomed, you really don't care if they have available servers or not, if management had a good sense of customer service they would make it happen immediately.

There used to be a time when restaurants earned your business, treated you with respect and made sure that your experience is such that you would talk about it with your friends and family. Over here, i just felt like a head count, another 50-60 bucks and thats it. 

Our server was nice, on time and attentive. Their timing on bringing in appetizers 
was within 5-10 mins (not too bad) and in the meanwhile our drinks were filled as soon as they were half empty. 

The french onion soup is one of the better ones I have had compared to others however, the steak is a different story. Poor cuts of meat and loads of liquid smoke is used to make your wood fire grill. The meat was dry and tough and had lots of fat on it. This is by far one of the worst steaks I have ever had. 

After our complaints; The Manager was apologetic and offered another round of steaks or free desert. Sorry, we don't really want more bad food. We respectfully, declined to both. Also don't give an expired appetizer card expect customers to return. Its a gesture at least you can BE NICE!. Sorry, Management is ineffective and needs some training in customer service.

If i was an investor at this location, I would seriously consider pulling my money out. Number one rule in restaurant industry is food quality and customer service  which they don't have so i wonder how long they would be open. 

This location needs to revise their business strategy and just call it:

Don't comeback

Which is exactly what we will do. I will take my business down the street to Jameson and pay for better quality and service than to waste my time and money here.

Two main reasons for the two star rating: crabby waitress and ridiculous 'call-ahead' seating.  This was my first time to go to an Outback Steakhouse; hubby had a gift card and mother-in-law likes it for some reason.  I had checked online before going there and noticed they offer the option of 'call-ahead' seating, which basically puts you on the waiting list to get a table around a certain time.  While I understand that it's not the same as a reservation, they need to explain the system better on the website (might avoid some angry patrons).  So this is what I learned: if you are crazy enough to go to this place on a Saturday, even for an early dinner time, put your name on the list for a time that is about a half-hour before you ACTUALLY hope to be seated.  When my mother-in-law walked in, she gave my name as being on the list and all they did was hand her a pager, no extra info offered.  My brother decided to ask about it and they told him it would be "around 18 minutes" (which ended up being 30).  Why did the hostess not offer this info when giving the pager?  Anyhow, it was insanely crowded for being 6pm, and nearly every person that came in walked back out after being told it would be over an hour wait.  Thank goodness there are stores nearby to walk around while waiting (that is where I sent my husband and our toddler).  The waiting area to be seated seems like a fire hazard and no solution of 'sit at the bar to wait if you would like' or anything else is offered.  No one looks happy to work there, understandably.  
I'm quite certain our waitress never smiled once while serving us, but she did do her job, so of course we still tipped her accordingly.  The food was just OK; I've made far better steak at home from the supermarket.  It did come out very quickly, so I can give them credit for that much.  My drink, a margarita, was not all that great and arrived after appetizer, so minus points on that one.  Overall, very underwhelmed and will not return if up to me (it wasn't my pick in the first place).

Honestly, it takes a lot for me to rate a restaurant at a one star. Actually, if I could, I would have given them no stars. It all started when we arrived for our call-ahead reservation. We came with my inlaws and fam to celebrate Father's Day....so there were 7 of us (including the kiddo). Now I understand the concept of call ahead, and that's it's a range of time. We did have to wait 20 minutes, however, when my mother in law called about noon to make the call-ahead, she asked for a specific booth/area because my two-yr-old toddler does well if she has a choice between a booth and a chair (ya...toddlers are special that way!). The person on the phone told her it was not a problem. Well when we got there, they were told that not only did we have to wait about 25 minutes, but that the seat that we had wanted was given away about 10 minutes prior to us arriving! So yes, irritating, but not deal breaking. 
We finally were sat, and one of my biggest pet peeves is when the waiter/waitress doesn't acknowledge our table within 10 to 15 minutes of sitting. I'm not talking about taking a drink order, just a hi...I'm you're servier...I'll be with you in just a few minutes. We didn't get acknowledge for over TWENTY minutes of sitting down! And than it took another ten minutes to get our drinks! By this time, we realized that if we were going to order our usual appetizers prior to dinner, we wouldn't eat for at least another hour, so we skipped the appetizers and ordered our meals. Myself and my mother in law got a salad/soup, so you figure that would come a few minutes after our order since it's like an appetizer. AGAIN with the 20 minutes for a simple salad! And my mother in law never got her soup! 
When the meal came, it was relatively decent, except for the fact that my mother in law's steak was way overdone. This was seriously the final straw. The server didn't even bring the food out, so I couldn't say anything to him. Yes, the cooking of the meal was not his fault (for once!), but there were no apologies or asking how things were. The manager tried to do what he could, but how can you remedy bad service?? 
Unfortunately this isn't the first time this has happened at this Outback. More often than not, there is usually a problem. Sometimes it's the service....sometimes it's the quality of food. Sorry Bloomingdale Outback....if it's up to me, we won't be back :/

The food was delicious and quick to come out. Our steaks were cooked to perfection, they were juicy, and all around amazing. The sides were delicious as well as out soups. Nothing compares to their baked potato soup. The new tomato mozzarella caprese was phenomenal (though they could use an extra spoon to get the good stuff onto the bread!) Our server (can't remember her name!) was awesome. She came to our table at the perfect times and was very friendly. Loved our whole experience tonight

Outback lived up to their 5 star rating last night. We had forgotten our coupon and the manager was kind enough to give us the discount anyways. The filet was cooked perfectly and was very tasty. It was well complimented with grilled asparagus, a loaded baked potato & two glasses of Sam's seasonal which made for a perfect meal! 
We all so had top notch service provided by Melissa which made our meal that much more enjoyable!

It's not hard to mess up a franchise restaurant except if you're the Bloomingdale outback! I have given this particular location over 3 chances...figuring the staff was just having an off few days. Whoever does the training at this location is failing and management must be blind or not care!

For starters, when my date and I walked in, the three hosts were in deep gossip, they eyed us over and made us feel like we were in their way! After waiting a minute for them to finish talking, we were seated. No one greeted us at the table for a good six minutes! By the time the server came by we just wanted to put our order in. He seemed irritated that we wanted to order our food with our drinks! The food was fine, standard outback food. It took forever to get our check. No one said goodbye to us as we left. Just overall, awful customer service by a bunch of ill-trained staff who do not want to be there. 

I will go out of my way to go to the Schaumburg location. Seiously, if you'd like to see what better service looks like, go to the Schaumburg location, it makes all the difference!

This review is strictly for Christmas Eve @ this particular location.

HORRIBLE. NEVER AGAIN.

We made reservations days in advance, and they obviously overbooked because even with that my family had to wait just about an hour to get our table.

We put in our appetizers immediately, and got them in a fairly decent time. One of the appetizers was bad though, it was the avocado crab dip....I really think that the crab was spoiled or something. I couldn't even eat it. 

We had to wait an exceptionally long time for our meals to come out, even though the restaurant died down shortly after we had been seated. A manager never even came to our table to apologize for the wait or that the kitchen was backed up. Nothing. 

The only saving grace was that our waiter was very pleasant and handled everything to the best of his ability. 

I am exceptionally disappointed that a manager didn't even stop over to apologize to us, when I saw a manager go to several tables near by and even offer dessert to go on the house to other tables.

I found Outback to be easy on the pocket. But more important than affordability is the joy of eating the pumpernickel bread. This is the best brown bread I ever had and it's free!!! To top it off, it is served with lots of butter. Outside of the free bread, I am a loyal fan of their baked potato soup. I rank their potato soup higher than Houston's. When I manage to carry on in the absence of potato soup, I order the creamy onion. I am not a real soup fan but I really enjoy theirs.

I have eaten at this location several times. This place is usually pretty packed on the weekends so absent using the call ahead seating option, plan to wait about 15-20 minutes. 

I enjoy their chicken on a barbie largely because it is well seasoned. I occasionally order the outback special or Alice Springs Chicken.  My sides of choice are the steamed veggies or sweet baked potato. Yes, I like potatoes.  :-)

166 S. Gary Avenue
Bloomingdale, IL 60108 
Phone number  (630) 582-8914 

Great services , servers very friendly. As wait times for a table depends on the time.
Love the cheese fries.

This is our go-to Outback. We have been here many many times and we have seen it go through some big changes recently. The waiting area has been remodeled and they have done a great job of separating the dining room from the waiting area. They occasionally bring out samples and have some water to sip on while you're waiting. 

The dining area is pretty much the standard outback look but they have clearly made an attempt at cleaning the place up and making it a little more intimate. 

The service can be hit or miss. The food is the same. On our past 3 to 4 visits, I would say our food was well prepared about half the time. 

We are a fan of the char grilled cooking option that gives their steaks a nice flavor. 

They are conveniently located near Stratford square mall so you can expect to have a wait on the weekends and in the evenings. 

In all honesty, the only other nearby steak option I'm aware of is Jameson's and it's a matter of whether you want chain rest outback or a more elegant setting in Jamesons across the street. 

Pricing is reasonable...you can expect to spend about $40 for two people (without alcoholic beverages).

Let's go Outback tonight...we have a birthday to celebrate!

Free ice cream dessert for the birthday girl!  Thank you, Outback.  Even though our waitress couldn't get the other busy staff members together for a song, she sang a solo for us.

I have been to Australia and there's nothing Australian about the food.  The down under theme is cheesy, but in a fun way.  They actually have pretty good steaks (6oz Outback Special steak @ $10).  All their sauces are homemade and compliment the meal very well.  The shrimp scampi came with a sauce comprising of 3 different types of mustard and other ingredients.  The "Kookaburra Wings" were fantastic with its secret spice rub.  The $7.50 dirty martini went down smoothly.

I was surprised to see so many bad reviews of this restaurant, so I thought I'd add my two cents. We stopped trying other steak restaurants (for the most part) several years ago because, for the money, we are never disappointed with Bloomingdale Outback. I understand that it's not supposedly as nice to go to franchise places, but I really don't see spending any more for our meal, when we are very pleased with what we get at Outback. We always get a few certain dishes: My family loves the caesar salad and bread (and often get it to go for parties even), we think their prime rib is the best around for the price, we love their baked onion soup, I like the ribs or Outback special steak, and the kids chicken fingers are some of the best I've had. 

Other reviews have complained about the service, but we go there at least 6 times a year for several years now, and not once did we wait for more than 2 minutes before someone greeted us.
