Maybe the others came at the busiest times? We try to go before the rush at 5pm or so, and we always sit in the bar tables where it is first come first served rather than waiting for an assigned table. 

Personally, we are kinda picky at other restaurants and are rarely disappointed at this Outback.

This particular restaurant consistently provides the best service and food quality of any restaurant around. I love this place. Tonite we had the waitress Jill who said she has been working there 11 years ( excellent service), I look over the bar tender served us before (great service) I had the Pork Porterhouse, my wife the Salmon, the food was PERFECTLY COOKED. Killer food. You can tell that they  have great consistent management at this location because it's always Great. Dan from Bartlett.

Don't know why there are any bad reviews. We had to wait a little while, but that is to be expected at a good restaurant. The service was excellent, and the food was amazing. It was our first time there, but it definitely will not be our last.

I was able to put us on the wait list online so by the time we walked in, we only had to wait about 3 minutes before we got seated. Our server,  Allie, was extremely wonderful. She was very sweet and psychic. I wish more restaurants were run this way, everything was very efficient without feeling rushed. The food was cooked perfectly and I'm a very, very picky person. Highly recommend!

I'm sorry, but what are people enjoying about this place that I just don't get? Don't get me wrong, the staff is excellent. Our waiter tonight, Dominick, who looked to me like a cross between Zachery Levi and Jimmy Fallon, was extremely personable and attentive, but that doesn't excuse the lackluster flavorless food. 

To be fair, I've never cared for Outback but it's been years since eating at one so I got a gift card from my Discover card cash-back bonus and figured we'd give it another shot. No thanks.

The thing is, the food wasn't terrible, it just wasn't worth $16 for a bland steak and four shrimp. I didn't care for the artichoke & spinach dip either. My husband's chicken and ribs were just ok. The chicken itself wasn't anything better than I can cook myself and I can't seem to cook a good chicken breast so that tells you something. Had I actually had to pay for this meal out of my own pocket I would be pissed.

I think I'll stick to Lone Star, Longhorn, or Texas Roadhouse. There are so many other options out there, why do people keep coming here?

I had shrimp on the barbie for an appetizer with this "special" green sauce that the waiter brought us and it was an interesting, garlic butter based sauce.  I ordered the California avocado grilled chicken sandwich with NO tomato and despite getting the tomato I loved it, I chose fries as my side and they were ok.  We also had the bread they serve when we first sat down and the bread came out warm and it was soft and chewy.  The waiter was attentive and had my drinks refilled before I even asked.

I've been coming here 3-4 times a year. Can't really complain about anything. Service was fast and friendly. If the place was dirty, I definitely couldn't tell due to the dim lighting. 

If there is one thing outback knows how to do its cook a steak. Probably from the volume of steaks they make, those guys do it perfectly right. When you order a medium, you get a perfect medium. I'm ALWAYS satisfied with the way my steak is cooked. 

Even though I'm pretty sure this place is the furthest thing from "Australian" fare. (I'm also pretty sure there's no such thing.) This place is still a great place to go for a steak. Creamy onion soup was great too! 

Keep up the good work Outback.

Reading other reviews, I can confirm.. it's a management problem.  Tonight six of us middle-aged moms got together, as we do every week.  Except this week we made the mistake of going to the Bloomingdale OutBack.  This is not an error we will EVER repeat.  Now again.. there were six of us.. all ordering appetizers, meals and alcohol.  If we had painted dollar signs on our foreheads it would have been more subtle.  Apparently another table complained that we were too loud for their sleeping infant and demanded a free meal.   Now I have never managed a restaurant, but I can do simple math.  Annoying the matriarchs of six families and loosing all of their potential future revenue, because you are cheesed off at having to comp a meal is NOT a smart business practice.  But that is precisely what Salomon Diaz, the 'Managing Partner' (and ohhh yes I DID take his card) decided to do.  

The food was just all right and the service was unexceptional.  But considering how horrible the management is, I have to think that they were fighting an uphill battle.  We didnt let it ruin our evening - we actually laughed all the way home.  But if you are looking to have an enjoyable experience, avoid this place like the plague it is until they get new management.

Higher prices and way smaller portions. Service is terrible, even during a slow dinner time. I got the chicken and ribs with fries. The 4 ribs were placed on top of the 15 fries next to the 3oz chicken breast on the smallest dinner plate in Illinois.   Result - soggy fries, ok ribs and a bite of chicken. The waitress actually admitted the chicken was small (even for a child portion) and went back to the kitchen for another (just as small). 
Overall - terrible and a waste of money.

This place is okay if you like to overdose on sodium. Portions are a little small for the price and sometimes the steak is tough. One time we waited almost an hour to be seated before getting up to complain that people coming in after us without a reservation were being seated, it immediately became apparent they forgot about us. The manager freaked and was very apologetic. I'm not saying I would never eat here again but I prefer Longhorn if we're talking chain restaurants.

My family and I have lived in the area for 20 years and have frequently visited this Outback over the years. HOWEVER, tonight was one of the worst experiences I have ever had at this restaurant. 

We had a very nice waitress named Jessica who was great. After waiting for 30 minutes for 8 people's steaks (which seems like a normal amount of time for that amount of food), Jessica was carrying all of our food on a tray when she was bumped by another server. All 8 of our plates came crashing to the floor and my sister's coat was absolutely destroyed with ketchup splattered everywhere. She was obviously extremely apologetic, and cleaned it up quickly. 

However, the general manager came over, apologized and said that they would get our food re-prepared right away. We waited about another 25 minutes for our food, received our bill, and were SHOCKED to find out that the meal was STILL 140.00. The manager had not comped any single item on our bill. I don't mean to sound rude or greedy, and I have never worked in the service industry, but I was so shocked that they did not discount not even ONE item on the bill. I thought it was extremely rude and inconsiderate. If I were a general manager, I would have done anything I could to make the customer happy. At the very least, I would have brought out some desserts on the house. 

We still tipped Jessica very well because it clearly was not her fault. However, I am baffled by the general manager's actions. This would never happen at a high quality restaurant. It's not like one person's food was dropped, but 8 people's steaks and burgers, AND clothing was ruined. This Outback needs to be a lot more concerned with their customer service because this is a situation that should NEVER happen again. I can honestly say that I will not be visiting this Outback anymore. Very disgusted with the management. I hope this doesn't happen to anyone else. If it does, please voice your opinion and let them know that you should be receiving a discount for the inconvenience (something we mistakenly didn't do).

I hate people that say that steakhouse chains don't cook good steak. They're freaking crazy because Outback is amazing. This one is my go to place for special events. I always have my birthday here as well as my family and I go here for father's/ mother's day. 

First of all, this one has a big parking lot as it is next to some big stores. Once you go in, you're hit with that aussie vibe that they all have. They hit you up with free and unlimited bread, though i'd advise to stay away from that because I always get way too full too fast whenever I eat that. Bloomin Onion is really good. Outback specialty so I would suggest getting that as an appetizer.

As for the steak. on my birthday one year, I got a medium rare 12oz New York strip and it was the best steak I'd ever had. You don't need to shell out extra cash for the filet mignon. I always get the loaded baked potato too but the garlic mashed potatoes are pretty good too. 

Go for your birthday and not only do you get a song, but you may also get a free brownie. Outback usually has some good specials, like 10$ meals or free bloomin onion coupon. Just got to wait for a good promotion if you're looking to save a few dollars.

Love this place. Has not steered me wrong yet.

The bread is good lol

the environment is something you wouldnt expect in "australia" so not really feeling an "aussie" kind of atmosphere

the wait can be long up to an hour if you go on the weekends and eat around dinner time (5-8pm)

but the food is good and the people are nice

Went here for dinner last night around 9:20PM. When we arrived we realized closing time was 9:30PM. We were still seated and served, but not happily. From the moment we walked in I could feel the disappointment in the air from the hostess to the server. Definitely felt rushed throughout. Wasn't even asked if we wanted dessert. When I asked for a refill on my iced tea, I was offered a to-go cup. When she went to go make it, she was unable to because they had already dumped all of the tea for the night. Very disappointing, especially when paying $3 (estimate) or so for a beverage. I understand they all probably wanted to go home, but we are paying customers and should have the same type of service regardless of what time we come in.
This is consistently the best OutBack Steak House I've ever eaten at. Try the tuna appetizer. The mixed drinks are always full pour.

Went to this Outback for the first time a while back. I don't remember much about the food, which means it wasn't terrible but it also wasn't anything worth remembering. What I do remember is the delicious bread we got before our meal, and then I noticed something was moving on the bread tray and sure enough there was an ant casually strolling around our bread (which we had started eating at this point). We quickly called our waiter over to let him know. His reaction? He smashed the ant with his bare hand ON THE WOODEN BREAD TRAY. Thanks, now his guts are all over the tray, delicious! We then asked for the manager and explained to him what had happened. Instead of offering us a free dessert or something, he asks, "well what would you like me to do for you?" Um, idk, comp me a dessert? Do I really have to say it? We didn't say anything but it turns out he gave us all our steaks for half price which was nice but the whole experience was just odd and quite a turn-off. Haven't been to an Outback since.

My husband loves Outback Steakhouse!  I am a vegetarian who eats fish so he happily gets his beef fix while I get the Seared Ahi Tuna or the Shrimp En Fuego Fettuccine.  Always good choices.  My husband has a steak ordered medium rare fixed to perfection he leaves a happy camper!  

Last night I tried the new Strawberry Waffle dessert......yummo.  Strawberries, creamy center, fresh made waffles topped with fresh whip cream and berries.  It's definitely my new favorite dessert.

The proprietor Sal Diaz is a great guy who gives back to the community.  He hosts a lunch for the Bloomingdale Chamber of Commerce and gives the money back to the Chamber to fund a $1000 scholarship from Outback.  We have a breakfast which all donors are invited and hand out the scholarship to their recipient.  Sal has been doing this for four years this being his fifth.....again he understands giving back to the community you work in.  His wait staff comes in during the day and are NOT paid they help Sal promote a sense of community service.

The extra I paid for my salad was not worth it!  Plus I paid an addition .99 cent for 7 pieces of aspargus.I agree with the other reviews the staff was nice, but the quality of the food is not there and the pricy portions are small.
Outback Steakhouse's Grade:

FOOD: D+
SERVICE: A
PRICE: C-
CLEANLINESS: A
OVERALL EXPERIENCE: C-

Well, we "tried" to have lunch here this past Sunday. We checked in at a nearly empty restaurant, and asked for a table for two. We were told that they didn't have enough servers, and it would "probably" be about 10 minutes or so before they could seat us. Hello?? The restaurant had been open for an hour already, so this didn't make sense, and made even less sense when the same hostess was chatting and laughing with a server at the hostess stand while we were still waiting. What?? When we saw that, we decided enough was enough and headed out the door.....(down the street to Jamison's where we had great service and a good meal). Bye, bye Outback!
Experience was just ok. Nothing too bad, nothing that great. A little too pricey for what we got.

So it's nothing near "Australian fare", but when's the last time you woke up and said "mmm crikey mate, I sure am diggin' for some Australian!"? Answer: never.

The steaks are consistently cooked the way they should be. I'm always surprised when I order a steak 'medium rare' and get it ... medium rare. Too many places out there cook medium rare on the well done side for some reason, and I'm just afraid to order 'rare' for fear of receiving something entirely uncooked.

The manager was nice enough to stop by and make sure everything was okay, and I appreciate that quite a bit. The suggestion from the server to order a dish "light" was also appreciated -- why get twice the butter when it tastes just the same without?

So after saying how great it is, why the three stars? Because it's just a consistent chain. Nothing has "wowed" me, there's no surprisingly good special or secret item on the menu, nothing that says "gotta go back!" any more than "I can't decide, might as well go to Outback again." aaaand finally, there's one creepy creepster who has 324,281 pieces of flair on her shirt. Seriously, stop that shit. Or go work at TGI McFriendly's.
The food was good and our server was pretty awesome. Can't remember her name, but she kept us laughing and our drinks full, so we couldn't really ask for more!

Will not ever set foot in this place again. I am not a fan to begin with. It was for my father in laws birthday and reservations for 10 were made prior to arriving. We waited forever and finally when asked about the seating situation they would not accommodate us and said they only had one area for large groups and it was already occupied. The management was rude about the whole ordeal. We ended up walking out and my father in law left disappointed.  This restaurant chain is now on my list of companies to avoid.

If there was a restaurant in Australia called Chicago and it was full of pictures of gangsters and meat packers with missing fingers, it would be kind of like what Outback steakhouse is in the US. There are Australian artifacts and pictures all over the walls and the menu is full of Australian stereotypes. Outback has pretty much become a cliche because of all the commercials and that catchy Of Montreal parody. But who cares about that? What about the food? 

- Bloomin Onion
I used to order this. It's pretty much a large onion sliced into a flower, breaded, deep fried, and served with a creamy dipping sauce. It's tasty, but if you're like me and you're trying ot cut down on fatty foods, this isn't a good idea. I wanna live, dammit!

- The bread is good, and if you sweet talk the waitress enough she'll keep bringing more. It looks kind of like chocolate cake, but it's actually brown bread. 

- The steak is actually pretty good. I've had the prime rib, which wasn't that great. They couldn't get it right one time and I had to keep sending it back. Recently I ordered the New York strip, medium. It was perfectly seared on the outside and juicy on the inside. My dad got a ribeye with a lobster/mushroom sauce on top, which was way too salty. The biggest steak they have is called the Melborne. It's 18 oz. of meaty goodness. Since that's almost 5 whole servings of beef, I decided to take a pass. 

Not the greatest steak, but pretty good, and pretty reasonable price. The 12oz steak was less than $20, and it came with two sides.

If you look at my reviews you will see that I am partial to small privately owned restaurants. I usually love that personal touch you get from the owner, managers and wait staff.   

Here is the exception... 
We were able to order Outback to go last evening. You can pick your items on line. Give special instructions on ANYTHING and pick it up in their parking lot. The food came out perfectly, with sauces in individual containers, and everything was just like we were sitting at the restaurant. Plus at home we did not have to worry about the wait for a table on a Saturday night, and we saved a bundle on the drinks. 

I would recommend this for anyone who wants the great food, and not have to deal with the crowds or wait.

Outback makes a consistently decent meal at a fair price. I always opt for the outback special which comes with 2 sides starting under 10 dollars. This location typically provides outstanding service. I have had a few bad To go experiences with missing items on different occasions. The owner Solomon apologized and is working to resolve the issues.
the appetizers are more filling than the actual food depending on what you order

I came here on a Sunday around 12 and it was modestly crowded, making the noise level pretty overwhelming. The food was ok for the price. Nothing really wowed me about the flavors or sauces. We had to come here since our first choice wasn't opened until 2 so this was close by. it wasn't a place I was dying to try out and nothing really prompts me to come back.

I have yet to actually eat here... 1st try "the wait is an hour" no thanks. Second try, we call ahead, and still have to wait. Then they seat us in the back of the restaurant, next to the kitchen and three tables of whining kids (did they not notice there were only TWO of us because we left ours at home?). So we left. Yuck Yuck Yuck.

What a disappointment.  We decided to go to Outback last night not only because it is generally good, but we had a coupon for one of the million free steak dinners that Outback had promoted.  We were seated promptly.  The waitress greeted us and took beverage orders, it took a few minutes for my son to find his driver's license.  He ordered a beer and I a diet coke.  The less than pleasant waitress brought the beer and never the Diet Coke.  She assured us that she would be back to take our order and promptly returned to the service area to chit chat.  We decided not to waste any more time or money.  My son paid for his beer and promptly asked to speak to the manager.  The manager/owner couldn't not have been nicer or more apologetic.  However, there's no reason to return to this location.  A word to the waitress, if you don't like your job, quit.  It's a tough industry.  My son is in the same business and would have been fired for less.  We should have gone to the Wheaton location!!!!

Lucky for us, we enjoyed a wonderful dinner at a small Italian restaurant instead.  Bye bye, Outback!!!!
Good...but stay away from the Aha Tuna.....gross.

On my way to Tim's one evening, I had the sudden craving for Outback's chopped bleu cheese and walnut salad.  I called them and arranged a "Curbside pickup" and within five minutes (I was just down the street), I had my salad in hand for only $4.24.  It is certainly a decent size salad -- enough to serve as my dinner.  They also throw in the bread/butter so at $4.24, this deal is a steal!

As far as chains go, I've always liked Outback. Their bread is excellent, and the food's always been decent. This location gets very busy, but I found that the wait on a weeknight wasn't intolerable for 2 people. I think we waited 15 minutes.
Service was good, and their menu is updated. They've got some good fish choices.

Yep confirmed. Twenty-one 5 stars don't lie.

I ordered just a hot dog with fries and it was the best I've had in a long time. When I got it, it looked just like the picture they had on display. A well sized slightly snappy Vienna dog on a poppy seeded slightly steamed bun.  My requested well done fries were tasty and well portioned. All under $4.00 w/ tax. 

Very down to earth manager. 

IBB to try out their gyros

Awesome place! Awesome people! Awesome food! 
So far the best hot dogs I have had.. Fresh accompaniments and the hot dog bun is to die for!! 
The grilled chicken sandwich is yumm too.. Chicken was spiced and cook super well. 
Loved the house fries. Served with hot dog and the sandwich ( large portion). 
Totally easy on pocket to go place! So glad I live 5 min walk away and don't have to go far for an awesome experience. 
Coming back here soon for the gyro soon!

UPDATE: I am upping my review because  after visiting a few more times I found out they have the best gyros in the area. Its also not even close. The pita and the meat all taste fresh. 


The food was pretty good, but it is not the best option in the area. If you are willing to drive 2 more miles you can get to a portillos which in my opinion has better hot dogs and more options. The french fries were a little below average for what's around here and the hot dogs were good from what I can tell they use some good ingredients.

I counted 7 things on the menu including the 1 side which is french fries. What they do have is staples of most places. (Hot dogs, hamburgers, chicken sandwiches, Italian beef, Italian sausage, and gyros) I like to have options but some people may like this better. Unfortunately it don't even look like you can get cheese fries. 

The service was good. The gentleman behind the counter was very friendly. Probably about the best you can ask for.

Even though the taste of the food is not the best in the area the value on this place I think is where it redeems itself a bit. You get French fries with your hotdog and just guessing its equivalent to getting a medium size fries as McDonald's. You also get them with a sandwich order which is a good touch. A hot dog, soda and fries cost around 5 bucks. That's pretty good these days.

I hate rating things based on stars (cause it's all opinion based anyway) and you may think what I gave it is pretty low. I just think there are better options in the area if you can drive, however if you stop here I don't think you will be unhappy that you did as long as you can put up with the extremely limited menu.

Great food at a good value! 
Firedogs has quick service and friendly staff. I would definitely go back.

Stopped by here after volunteering to walk dogs at the shelter next door. Everyone here was super friendly. One of the owners took our order after introducing himself and shaking our hands. His business partner was working as a fireman that say so we didn't get to meet him. Some of the other staff members here are off duty firemen and cops as well. They explained to use that everything is fresh, never frozen, and made to order. My boyfriend and I both ordered hotdogs which came with fries on them. Similar to Gene and Jude's but not as greasy. Now I don't have to drive down to River Grove for a delicious hot dog. I want to try some of the other sandwiches on the menu like the gyro and steak sandwiches. The owner was even considering putting a salad on the limited menu. We had a great time talking with the staff. I can't wait to go back for more!

Glad to see this place open this week went in today for a gyro.
Was not disappointed large portion great prices great friendly staff my new go to spot for dogs and gyros.

First time visiting this place and overall my visit was positive. I ordered the Italian Beef (hot) which came with hand cut fries. The sandwich and neat was really good, although next time I will make sure to add cheese. The fries were good but not great, I always enjoy hand cut fries. What made this place a 5 star was the service. The gentlemen taking orders was very friendly and made me feel welcome. I will stop back in again to try the Gyros next round.
Took my kids and they had hot dogs and cheese burgers...I had a chicken salad.  Very good food and it wasn't too expensive.  The service was very friendly too...definitely recommend for a quick bite.

Great place to go! The Gyro was excellent, the portion was enough for two people! The meat had a premium taste. I bought my lil one a hamburger, had a taste of it, no complaints! I will def be visiting again, soon. The owners were very nice and welcoming. There was no rush, the atmosphere was calm, I didn't feel rushed while I tried to make up my mind. I wish them all the luck in the world and will try to do my part to keep them open.
This place is amazing the owners are so sweet. The food is amazing seriously the best steak and chicken sandwiches I have ever had you guys need to try it. The décor is nice and its an amazing place
Delicious, large, snappy dog.  Excellent fresh cut fries.  Very friendly owner.  I missed getting dogs from this building!  I'll be back often!
Very impressed! Great food & friendly owners! Good place for the whole family. My 5 year old son loved all the fireman decor including the real fireman suit. We will absolutely be back!

Very friendly staff. I normally am not a fan of beef hot dogs but loved these and would return for them. Generous portions of fries. Hubs had the Italian Beef. It has a large portion of meat but was lacking a bit in flavor. The place was a bit dirty but we came around lunch on a Sat, so perhaps that is why. Also, seating is lacking for large groups. Had to pull 2 tables together but there was no place to sit when others came in at one point. Would also be nice if they offered a "Kids Menu" with maybe just a plain dog and a smaller burger and fry portions. Will return next time we are in the area.

I find out about this place from yelp notification
I give it a try and was not disapointed,   I ordered gyros and they were perfect and good size  i like that they grilled the onions, no other place does. very close to home.
I wanna try their home made Italian beef.
Demitri or Jim was very welcoming.
Definitely will come back
good food - clean!  service is great!  we will return.....
review for the gyros only. really really really good. meat flavorful and tender and a large portion.

good food. owner is friendly. The gyros they have is good quality. not the lowest grade. The beef was nothing special. it was chewy. the fries are tasty but a bit greasy. 
They need to consider removing beef from the menu and focus on what they do better.
Great food at a fun restaurant.   The authentic gear from Frank, the owners, career as a fireman is a great touch.  If your in the neighborhood  you must give it a try.

Recently tried Firehouse Dogs for the first time.  The gyros and fries were delicious, the service was great and Frank was so friendly and accommodating!  I'm thrilled with this place and will return, for sure
Great Gyro, and fries are better than most places, but not as good as I hoped.  Excited to try the rest of the menu.
Gyros are excellent and fries are tasty and fresh. Great customer service, place is clean! Will definitely return.

Loving this place!!!  The beef sandwiches are amazing. Flavorful, with tons of tender meat. Today we added a Greek salad which was delicious. The ingredients were fresh and the Greek dressing was perfect. Also tried the tamales. Can't go wrong there!  This is our new favorite restaurant where the food tastes like homemade, not fast food!!!!
Good old fashioned Chicago dogs. The staff is friendly and all the food is excellent. This place is a must try.

best place ever. Expected a lot worse, not because of first impression, but because usually the newer resturants arent that good. I had a burger w/fries and a dog. It was astonishing and breath taking. BEST PLACE TO GO TO WITH NOT-THAT-BAD PRICES! Definetly reccomend coming here!

Glad this location has a new owner!  They seem to understand that a larger menu does not mean better.   Simple, delicious food. 

One recommendation.   Rosens Bun on my burger was soggy by the time I got back home just 3 minutes later.  
Larger chains spend millions developing buns that don't get soggy.   
Simply, change how you put a to-go order together and people can have delicious food at home as well as in the store.
A little pricey, food was good ,but for the price there are other options down the street

The food is great and the location is convenient.  The fries are homemade and come with all sandwiches including hotdogs.  The people are super friendly (no seriously, the owner was really cool about it when my kid spilled water everywhere) and the decor is cool--all antique Chicago firefighter gear.  We will come again!
Just Left Firehouse dogs and I can say that I left very satisfied my family enjoyed every bit of it. Everyone is full and would recommend it to anyone. The Gyro was delicious very good quality meat.

The hot dogs and gyros were very good!  The owner was so nice and friendly.  We ended up having a long conversation.  He told me about the high quality gyro meat, and that was confirmed when I ate it.  And they do not skimp on the meat at all.  Great place!
Nice place. Please go back to the 6to 1 dogs u opened with. Was there yesterday. Youve changed to a 10 to 1 i believe.

The food is amazing. The price is good. We walked in to the owner greeting us and telling us about the business. The food, the price, and the customer service was fantastic.  I will definitely be coming back!!

Tried this place for the first time. I had the beef with sweet peppers and my honey had the grilled chicken sandwich. Food was great and all sandwiches come with generous serving of fresh cut fries. The staff is very friendly and I will definitely make firehouse dogs a regular spot !

Today was my second time eating at Firehouse Dogs with my family and we absolutely love it. I get the chicken on pita and it's delicious. They have amazing fries and my kids love their hot dogs. Besides their food, the service is awesome. The owner always greets us with a smile and he is just a real nice, laid back guy. This place is definitely somewhere we will be eating a lot more often.

Decided to go this place as I noticed it was recently opened. The gentleman taken the order was very nice and friendly. Im assuming he was the owner. Prices seem fair compared to other similar restaurants in the area. Had a cheeseburger and hotdog. They were delicious! Will be back again!
Good food second time there today beef a little tough and fatty hotdog excellent chicken sandwich great flavor friendly staff will visit again

I ordered a burger, frozen, kind of like carnival food. Not fresh. The fries are not hand cut fries as some of the other reviews state. They are the frozen packaged cardboard tasting fries with lot's of little pieces, like I got served from the bottom of the bag. Hand cut fries can be had at Na Na's, down the road. Portillo's has a much better frozen burger. The people are friendly, but the food I ordered was meh and seemed over priced for what I received. The reviews here are questionable with many negative comments yet five stars given. Again, nice people but to me, very poor quality food. Maybe other things are better, I hope so. But I would not return to try them.

Great new place!  I had the Gyros.  Great taste.  It came with home cut fries, yum!  My daughter loved her hot dog and fries.  Can't wait to come back and have a Steak sandwich.   All food is made to order.

When the prior Greek restaurant closed, I was so upset since it was the only decent place in the area for Greek food.  Then Kouzina came along.  Now you can find me there at least two days a week :)

At first I was hesitant, especially after reading a negative review.  I'm so glad I decided to try for myself.  I've been meaning to write this for some time now, wanting to encourage people to give it a try.

First the new ownership and service team is impeccable, very friendly and welcoming and always great attentive service.  They remodeled the place and it looks much better and is very clean and welcoming.  I have been seated in booths in the main dining area as well as at the smaller tables in the bar.

The bread is phenomenal, I'd have to say it's my new favorite Greek bread.  Anyone who knows me knows that I judge a place by their bread, and in this regard Kouzina nails it.  It's freshly baked and has the crisp crust I look for, and the olive oil they offer has great flavor.  They will bring butter if you request it.  I could make a meal out of this alone. Well, this and one more thing...

The saganaki.  The show stealer is the saganaki!!  Insanely good!  Best I've ever had, better than Parthenon and Greek Islands.  It's a higher quality cheese and the portion is the perfect size for individual orders.  Call me hungry but this is saganaki that I refuse to share.  Order it, you'll be glad you did.  And during the week it's half price if you eat it in the bar during a specified time period.  It's so creamy and doesn't turn to rubber like other cheeses I've had.  The taste is fantastic- makes me salivate thinking about it.  Ugh, so good.

Everything I've had here is top notch- my usual order is chicken kabob with Greek rice and a side Greek salad.  The chicken is so tender and cooked to perfection, and the grilled flavor is sublime.  The Greek rice is so good, great flavor with the sauce on top.  Goes well with the kabobs.  Their salads are enormous, cold, fresh and crisp, and their feta cheese is delicious.  A meal in itself.

I've dined with others who have enjoyed the gyros platter, the salmon, and the Greek potatoes.  What a relief to have such high quality Greek food without having to drive to the city.

Kouzina, you saved the day!  Keep doing what you're doing.  You're now a permanent part of my rotation.

In this world of mixed culture Restaurants this is as close to being on one of the Islands as you will find locally. 

The dishes are wonderfully authentic, fresh and inviting not to mention the enormous Bar area that begs socializing. 

Been here for both Lunch and Dinner simply bound to delight.

Best greek food in the area. Starting with the plethora of appetizers top choose from, saganoki, grilled octopus, tarama, keftedes, ect.. you get the picture. Its hard to even venture from that part of the menu. 
Now finding an entree will be the hard part. 
-Gyro is a standard go to, much better than the fast food places around. 
-I love the mussakka, always went home wondering why i ate so much... probibly because its soo GOOD!.
-personally when i feel like fish i like the sea bass, the whole fish broiled with latholemeno on top.. suclent 
-If im feelin lamb, ill go with the chops or loins. Again with that latholemeno sauce( you put that sh** on everything! (Cc franks redhot)) 
-dessert prob go with the baklava sundea or galaktoboureko
-dont forget about the frappé on the way out..

I missed having a Greek restaurant close by.  This place recently opened and I had to give it a try.  I went with my dad and we both got gyros.  I got the appetizer and he got the full meal  (I have pictures of both so you can see the difference).  We also had saganaki.  All was good.  The gyro meat was pretty much the standard; not amazing, but, not bad.  Saganaki also was as expected.  Service was fast and courteous.  4 stars for now and I will update as I visit more.

***Update.  Now 5 stars!  I have gone back a few more times since my first review and have always been very happy with the food and service!  I haven't tried all that many dishes.  I always get saganaki.  I have also had their gyros and hummus and Kouzina fries.  All tasty!  I will continue to try more dishes as I eat here more.  I'll keep updating with pictures and descriptions of the food.  My only gripe would be some items are a bit pricey; however, if they are cooked to perfection then the price is justified!  Service here is top notch!  I've had at least 3 or 4 different servers / bar tenders and all have been amazingly helpful and provided a great dining experience!

This place has a lot of potential. However, right now it's a joke. An embarrassment to Greeks everywhere. From cheese that was suppose to be feta with ragu sauce dumped on it.... To burnt souvlakia and fries underneath swimming in oil. Service was average, bus boys were doing all the work. 
Greek cuisine is the best out there just don't use this place as an example till they get their act together!

Lunch review. 
One good constant from the last owner is Zach, a server we really like. Wish I could say the same for the Moussaka and the menu in general under the new ownership.
Zach likes it! He's still got a review up here somehow??? There's even a picture of him standing by his new bar! 

Lunch prices seem high, and in comparison to dinner, dinner prices seem a little low for Schaumburg but I think they will be pumping drinks, more on that later.
Moussaka is $15 for lunch and $17 for dinner?
Big problem right away is that I don't like bechamel instead of the usual layer of mashed potatoes in my moussaka. The other problem is it wasn't half as good as the moussaka the previous restaurant was finally knocking out the last few years. Didn't like the clunky steak fries at all.
No octopus main course on the lunch or dinner menu? What kind of Greek Menu is that?
There is a small octopus appetizer. I like my own lamb, chicken and meat dishes better than most restaurants, so my test for a Greek restaurant is the moussaka and octopus, my octopus has really improved though.

I drank mass quantities of strong iced tea but saw a flyer on the way out with $5 cocktail specials on 4 nights. I can only imagine what a $5 martini tastes like in Schaumburg and am going to keep it that way.
Service was intelligent and attentive, we like Zach. Interior is tastefully toned down from the last owner, and so was THANKfully the droning Fox Noise in the bar.
If you are heading West, exit onto Plum Grove Road and then turn West on Golf when you leave.

Ok, I was disappointed and am not going back until the menu, and/or cook changes and hope Zach survives.
I took a chance on these average reviews. You can too, but I'm not recommending it. 
Chances are very good they are going to need Groupon or other promotions so you might want to wait that out.

Unfortunately this place falls very short on food quality and flavor. I was really looking forward to the grand opening as I am a fan of Greek food.
Tried it twice just to give it a second chance. Both times were overpriced in relation to the poor quality food. I don't mind paying up for quality but this was high prices and poor quality.
The Gyro meat was sub-par, I've had far better at fast food places even. The sauce on the Pastitsio was terrible.The roast lamb was chewy and poor flavor.  I didn't bother with desert. I would think with the grand opening they would go high quality to match the high prices, unfortunately that is not the case.

Horrible experience. We didn't even get to the food actually. That has never happened. Me and my boyfriend decided to try a different, new place. We sat down, I ordered a glass of iced tea, while my boyfriend went to the bathroom. We waited 20 minutes for the waiter to bring me my iced tea, and come and take our food order. He NEVER came back. Yes! I never got my tea and we decided to leave because we were both hungry and if it takes more than 20 minutes to bring me my drink, food was probably going to take 2 hours. Omg I have never been so disappointed at ANY restaurant. Even McDonald's. We are not complainers usually and we have never left a restaurant before. The tables next to us were also looking around and didn't look happy because none of them had their food and they were there before we came. It was just a chaos. I have never expected such disappointment even from the most average food place. The owner really needs to hire a lot more waiters or something else must be done, but this place's service is a joke compared to all schaumburg restaurants. I regret we even went there and wasted so much time.

Never left a restaurant before tonight.  Walked in and noticed many open tables and they were not overly busy yet had to wait 10 minutes to be seated.  Once seated we waited 15 minutes as wait staff continuously walked past us never acknowledging us at all.   Usually you would be told that they will be with you very shortly but no one came to the table.  We stood up and walked out and we'll never return. It's a shame since our family and friends really enjoy Greek food and was looking forward to trying this restaurant out.

Food is good.  Wouldve 4star but too expensive for what it is. Gyro is the same as you would get from a fast food restaurant. Saganaki and salad were good but again way too expensive. Fifty bucks for lunch for 2? Hate giving mediocre reviews to new places but value isnt there.

I wanted to really like this restaurant as there aren't many Greek restaurants in the Schaumburg area. The meal started off well the waiting staff was attentive and bread was brought to the table. My wife and I each ordered pita gyro sandwiches. The food was brought to our table nice and hot and it was all very tasty. That said I have a couple caveats. It was obvious that the Gyro meat served was not made in house. Also, the french fries were undercooked, they were still edible but they were definitely a little floppy. Finally, the restroom wasn't quite up to standards that I expect which are quite high. It's not that the bathroom was dirty or anything it just wasn't well-maintained and could have been cleaned a little bit better with a little bit more attention to detail. I'll probably come here again although the food was overpriced.

So, my husband wanted to try here (since he loves Greek food) let me start by saying I didn't want too since it's been so many other names. However, he won and I was OK with it. How hard could it be to mess up soup and salad??? So, he brings it home and we have dinner. Not even 2 hours later, and we're both sicker than ever!!! The only thing we had in common was the soup! 
Yes, food poisoning! Needless to say, we will NOT be coming back! Greek Islands in Lombard from here on out!!

I stopped in on a whim and hoping to score some decent saganaki and I was definitely not disappointed! The saganaki was so flavorful and had that perfect crust and sizzle. Every part of my entree was delightful; the leg of lamb was just perfectly tender and oozing with juice, the potatoes were cooked and seasoned perfectly, and the little side of vegetables was amazing- this is the first time I've ever really enjoyed eggplant. It's a little pricier than I normally go for, but I think it's worth it.

Second trip in two weeks, lucky me. Excellent again, Avgolemono soup over the top. Cream base with a good amount of lemon and rice, great start  with the warm bread.  Chicken lemononada was cook with a pan search, tender.  The artichoke and spinach with lemon suace was very well put together. Rice and tomato sauce done and good flavor. Really good with sauce. One of my favorites roasted veggies, egg plant, pepper,  okra, onion were roasted perfect, nutty flavors from roasting and spiced perfectly, try them. Service from Jenny excellent, a real treat.
They serve delicious food and a very clean restaurant great updates to the decor too!

We live very close by and used to go to this restaurant when it was the other Greek Restaurant. We stopped going bcause the food went downhill.  I was excited to see the new one!
Driving past every day and finally seeing the Now Open sign we found a night to venture in.
Monday and not very busy.  Our server was very attentive and had suggestions at every course.
A warm loaf of bread was put on the table immediately with seasoned oil and a few kalamata olives (a nice touch).
Appetizer:  Saganaki and it was delicious.  Not too thick, perfectly melted.
My husband had a cup of the egg lemon soup and was licking the bowl.
I had a small greek salad filled with onion, tomato, cucumber, kalamata, lettuce and a nice chunk of feta on top with the perfect amount of a greek vinaigrette.
Entrees: 
Beef Kabob with roasted potatoes.  Ordered Medium and it came out prefectly pink.  Not dry at all.
Chicken, spinach artichoke with lemon sauce. rice pilaf (i finished every last grain)
Both served with roasted veg plate of okra, onion, eggplant, zucchini, garlic, pepper and tomato.
The owner, Charlie, was at the front the whole time and greeted us / shook our hands on the way out.  
Classy way to start a new business and make people feel welcome.
This place was horrible!!! Food tasted terrible and to top it off my gf and I got food poisoning. Time to go throw up again.
Very yummy! Stopped in for dinner tonight, Saganaki was so good and the Galaktobouriko was amazing. Definitely will be back. Good service and nicely decorated.

Loved the old Greek Village Tavern but our first dinner at the new Kouzina was awesome! Saganaki was best I've ever tasted, gyros platter was delicious but just a tad greasier than desired (but taste was worth it ), and my wife's lamb/beef burger was phenomenal! Great service as well. We'll be back!!

I first looked up to read some reviews and some were not so good. However I decided to check it out for myself anyway. And boy am I glad I did! The food was wonderful, the service was good, and the atmosphere was enjoyable. I am first generation Greek so I do the difference between real and generic and this was real. I had the combination plate and enjoyed it immensely. My dinner mates both ordered the same thing which was grilled calamari. I did not try it but it sure looked good and they both said it was. I know I will go back!

I came here for lunch with my husband for the first time. Other than being over-priced I really enjoyed the Gyro sandwich I ordered. The Gyro meat was perfectly cooked and deliciously spiced. The atmosphere was inviting and the decor was tasteful. The Greek restaurant options in this area are few and far between so I look forward to coming back sometime to explore their dinner menu.

Ugh. I was excited at the thought of a Authentic Greek restaurant coming to Schaumburg but unfortunately Kouzina is not it. I love Greek food. It's delicious flavored and spices are stapled on the food but here it was like they had never had it before. I ordered 2 things: melitzanosalata(eggplants dip) and pastitchio(Greek lasagna). I've had both these at many restaurants in Greektown,Chicago and love them but at Kouzina they just weren't authentic. The taste of the melitzanosalata was weird as if it had a lot of mayo in it or something. Also, it was bright pink??? Never had it pink. The pastitchio tasted like chef boyarde spagettios. I'm not joking the only thing about this place was the service and they all spoke geek and we're professional. I suggest that, if you have the time, go to Greek town and any of the restaurants in there are 10 times better thank Kouzina
Dolmades plate was tasty   Food service was SLOW. So if you have plenty of time and good company get some good Greek food here. If you're in a hurry you may be frustrated!

This place is the real deal! You can be in and out of there in 20 minutes or less for lunch. They have great portions and every meal comes with soup and tea. By far one of the best lunch choices out there.

I have order pick-up from here often with good results (thus, 3-stars today); however the Kung Pao Chicken seemed bland and not hot spicy.  I selected the "HOT" spicy option on the on-line menu when ordering.  Also, this was weird but the hot mustard that comes with the House Egg Roll came out of the packet in a gelatinous form; mucus like that you would see on an egg white right out of the shell except yellow.  A thorough mixing did not improve the consistency.

I am hoping this is a one-off in food quality.

It really gets under my skin when I order food from a restaurant... over $130 in take out, and the restaurant wont honor their coupons or play the "stupid"  card and say they were confused and didnt understand. This House of Szechwan in Des Plaines has a coupon on their menu they give everyone and this place refused to honor their coupon and give 4 egg rolls free after we places orders over $35!!! It just really gets under my slin. Why offer something if you wont honor it. I called them after food was delivered and they just blew me off and were like SORRY SIR OUR FAULT. Yes your fault and now since you wont even apologize or correct it, I will make sure all your patrons know. Be weary when ordering take out from this restaurant!!!!!!!

I think everybody knows this place just as a Chinese restaurant but they also serve Filipino food, which is freakin awesome! We had the sizzling sisig & kare kare & they were both delicious! My mom loves halo halo & she relly enjoyed the one here. I also ordered the tapsilog to go & even that tasted great later on!  I'm so glad my friend told me about this hidden gem cuz my family & i loved it & will be back often!

The rice that came with the sesame chicken tasted bland. The sesame chicken is ok. The shanghai egg rolls tasted like an old frozen pork that's fried. We ordered bistek Tagalog and the taste is nowhere near how it's supposed to be. My 10 year old can cook it better. Waiters are ok
Good place to eat. Typical Chinese food. Filipino menu is not bad at all. We eat here a few times a month. I would have given them a higher score but one time they gave us the wrong pickup order...

The food is great, they deliver! I'm happy.
We ordered wonton soup which was great, chicken fried rice, chicken and broccoli, Beef Kow,pot stickers and eggrolls. All that for about $30. (we ordered all small) All the food was good, especially the rice, pot stickers, soup and eggrolls. Pot stickers are huge, eggrolls are huge. I was really satisfied and I'm a Chinese food lover and now since I live in Cali it's very hard to come by these days. Def recommend!!

My family had a "Jewish Christmas" Eve dinner here this year. For years, whenever we got Chinese food, we'd go to another favorite spot of ours... until this year. My parents had recently started coming here for dinner and wanted to do Christmas Eve here. So we did.

Well, it was packed. We didn't have to wait for a table, but service wasn't the fastest. I think we were there for about two hours.... which was kind of long. After appetizers, I think we were all ready to leave. At least the servers were friendly and cracking jokes!

Service aside, let's talk food. For an appetizer, I had the calamari, which was good but just a bit chewy. For dinner, I had shrimp fried rice and chicken chop suey. SO GOOD. My family all enjoyed their dishes too. However, the portions were so huge I could barely eat a few bites in each dish before I was stuffed. And get this -- EACH of us at the table had one or two large dishes. Needless to say, there were PLENTY of leftovers. Word of advice if you eat here: order food with the intention of sharing unless you want enough food for a few meals. 

Now, although there was a huge bill that night (five people, multiple plates and appetizers), the price per dish was pretty good. My shrimp fried rice was about $9 and the chop suey under $13. 

Fortune cookies accompanied our meal. The fortunes are kind of hit or miss, but I don't make a big deal out of those.

Definitely a good Christmas Eve dinner!

[Well, this is my last review of the year. 
2015 was an interesting year!
Cheers to the future.....]
We ate for lunch and it was very good and reasonable.place was clean service  was very good and attentive. Will be back again.

Tried ordering on line today.  I wanted to add pan fried noodle to the menu.  it's not on the menu an there is no place to add it. Ordering over the phone is the worst.  I always have to repeat myself.  Talk very slow and spell things out.  The need a computer systems that automatically pulls up you name and phone number.  Also would be easier to use the computer to just to punch the order items in. Instead of writing it down.  Food is great every  time

I only order the veggie egg foo young, halo-halo, and egg rolls. Delivery is always fast, and my food has always been hot. They make one of the best egg foo young around, and the egg rolls are really good as well. Whenever I get a craving for egg foo young I always order here!

Well made a copy of my menu we had delivered tonight 
I must say they were very fast.
So why was the food cold my guess is as good as yours.
Egg rolls were good best part of the meal.
The sauce on the ribs and BBQ pork was awful .
I think my wife spent more time in the bathroom than eating.
The beef fried rice was swimming in Grease .
The chow fun noodles were all cold and stuck together.

From House Of Szechuan
ORDER INFO
Item Qty Price
101. House Egg Rolls (2 Pcs) 
103. Cantonese Barbecued Ribs (6 Pcs) 
104. Cantonese Barbecued Pork 
142. Beef Fried Rice (Small) 
206. Shrimp with Vegetable Chow Fun

I came in for lunch today to try their Sunday Filipino buffet that I've read reviews about.  I should have called first, because once I got there, I was told that they no longer have the Sunday buffet.  The man trying to seat me said they stopped it about 6 months ago.  He tried to get me to come in for their lunch specials but I said that I will just try it another time.  
Lesson learned, call first. 
In fairness, I have nothing against the restaurant/owner/workers there.  I really shouldn't rate them because I didn't dine there or order takeout, but I have to give a rating in order to post, and warn other diners that may see the reviews here and read about the Sunday buffet.  The restaurant's website photo gallery also has a picture of the Sunday buffet sign.  They should think about removing it to avoid confusing customers.
Best local oriental in area.  Big portions and good food.  Huge menu with huge portions.

We get delivery from here all the time. The food is great and they have lots of types of noodle dishes I hadn't seen on a menu since I lived in San Francisco. The Philippino food is good too. Try the garlic fried rice!

The owner is super nice.  I ordered take out a few minutes before lunch was ending and he still let me do the lunch specials. Upon arrival,  my food was ready and well packaged. Since I was carrying my baby in his car seat,  he insisted on carrying my order to my car for me.  He even threw in free cookies.  I really appreciated the help and thought he was so sweet.  The food itself was tasty. I ordered the pork belly sinigang and it was perfect.  I also had the sago drink and drank that thing in 5 seconds. The beef chow fun lunch special was huge! It me a while to finish all of it.  Def planning to come back and order again!

The food here is SO good. This is the only Chinese food I will eat. The employees are very friendly, as well. Every time we go in there, the man at the front counter always give my daughter free almond cookies.

Arrived at Szechwan at 8:30pm and asked for a table. The hostess said take-out only because they close at 9pm. I told them it looks like I'll be enjoying take-out and asked for a menu and she responded with I need to hurry because the chefs are leaving. I asked if they were open until 9 like it said on the door and she said it depends, usually they close at 8 or 8:30 and are only there until 9 if it's really busy. 

Won't go back with service like this. 2 stars for nice decor.

I've been going to this place for many years. They have a nice and clean restaurant. And their Sunday filipino buffet is okay for the price.

But some of their food is loosing taste nowadays. I ordered Tinola, Sisig, and Fried Rice and they weren't good. The only thing good I liked was the kaldereta. I don't like their Egg Roll either it has a nutty taste.

We tried the tidbits combo for two, sweet and sour chicken and walnut shrimp. Everything was absolutely delicious, but I have to say the crab rangoon was a little too sweet. My favorites were the egg roll, BBQ pork and walnut shrimp!!! There were so many flavors and everything was so tender! I can't wait to try more items on the menu next time!

Some of their foods are really good. I always order food for delivery. But everytime i looked in to what i order something is missing. This happens everytime i order food. And today im missing a large rice which is i think the most important part of the meal. And now im waiting for the driver to get the rice at restaurant and drive back again here, which i think will take time.

I absolutely loved this place! What a great price especially for the portions. I had the chicken kow chow fun and it was amazing. Definitely the highlight. There was also great potstickers, shrimp fried rice, egg rolls, and fried shrimp. The only problem we had with this restaurant was that the pork egg fu yung was lacking taste but the waitress gracefully asked us if we wanted anything else and took it off the bill. Another great thing about this place was about how nice the owner was he gave all the kids free kitty cocktails and greeted us with a smile when we came in and left. It is safe to say we will be coming back.

I ordered takeout on NYE at 6 p.m. Was told it would take an hour and a half - which is understandable, being a holiday. At 8 p.m., still no food, so I called again. Was told there were no delivery items out, so the driver must be out with it, and it would be here within 45 minutes. The guy didn't even check/know where my order was, and obviously didn't care to check. At 9:10 p.m., still no food. I was told that the driver was back out delivering orders - again, the guy would not even check on my order and was giving a generic answer. I explained how long we had waited. No offer for amends, no sincere apology. I canceled the order. Ten minutes later (about the time it takes to drive from their location to my house), the delivery guys shows up. I tip him and start to explain what happened and ask that he let his management know, and as I am speaking, he turns and walks away. 

I understand that NYE is busy. What I can't stand is bad service at anytime. If they tell me an hour and a half and I give them two hours...I expect the service they promise. If they had told me a three hour plus wait at the beginning and I accepted that, I would have been okay - but to not keep their word, not specifically check on my order when they were called, make up stories about their delay and mistake, not sincerely apologize, and send some rude kid to deliver my food that gets a healthy tip and walks away while I am speaking? Unforgivable service at ANY time.

I ordered beef w/broccoli with fr. wings as appetizer. The food tasted old and the fried chicken had a horrible scent once you bit into it. Money wasted and they are expensive compared to other Chinese restaurants in the area who's food is fresh and less expensive. I haven't nor will not order from them again
I miss the way this restaurant  was run in Mount Prospect... it has become very expensive and the employees answering the phone tend to ignore special requests.

Love the ambiance. Well decorated .. Love the wide selection of Filipino menu . My picky little girl love their crispy crunchy lumpiang shanghai. The owners are very nice and very accomodating. They even give my daughter a free bear. Will come back again

I ordered Pad Thai and Crab rangoon for delivery with grub hub, it was awful, it had a fishy smell, the pad thai dish was basically plain noodles and barely any chicken, no pad thai flavor what so ever! very disappointed and will never order again. $30 meal went to waste!

I called 10 minutes before they closed and the girl that picked up said the cooks went home early and I believe she only said that because she didn't want to take my order. I'm shocked any establishment would do that to their customers

We used to order form this place and the food was good. Then it started to get bad. The food had no flavor. We found a new place where the food was good.

We wanted Chinese today, and the place we were ordering from didn't answer their phones.

I pulled out the old House of Szechwan menus and reluctantly ordered. To our surprise the food was very good. I guess we are back to ordering here.

I don't know why people are complaining about the service, but they took care of us. Maybe they were busy during the time. Anyway, I tried this place because apparently they serve filipino food since there are not a lot of those in the chicagoland area. I was not dissappointed. The food we ordered were longsilog and lechon kawali they were good. I would definitely be coming back and bringing more people. I would like to tell you ahead that the leche flan is kinda different from the authentic filipino one.

After searching for a good Chinese restaurant I finally came across HOS. This place has great food and the staff is very friendly we have been very pleased and will continue to come and enjoy this establishment.  Thank you!!

I absolutely LOVE coming to this place! The food that I order (typically spicy Mongolian beef) is consistently great and the fried rice is amazing. I have a hard time finding good Chinese places to eat, but this one does it right. The owners are friendly and the lunch specials are really tasty with a more than reasonable price. Would highly recommend to friends and family!
Service was the best and food was Amazing. We had Filipino food and my fiancé is Filipino and she loves it.

I only gave them two stars because they have good crab Rangoon and egg rolls and delicious sweet and sour sauce but their service sucks and the front desk man was very rude and refused to give me extra sweet and sour sauce when I bought egg rolls to go.  He made a slur and said now you can go eat them in the parking lot,  like I was to cheap to eat inside at there crappy overpriced wait staff service.  Learn to treat your customers with respect and not judge them.

This was my second time having my order be WRONG. Both times I asked for a full order of Lo Mein (Beef & Shrimp) and both times they gave me the lunch special. Today a co-worker and I pre-ordered and Guess What! The order was wrong again. When addressed to the female I was paying all she had was excuses and a bad attitude which was extremely rude and tried to get loud. I told her I don't see myself coming back because they just don't get the orders right she informed me the customer that it was my choice. I let her know yes it is and with her attitude it's a wonder they are still in business. NO I WILL NOT BE GOING BACK TO HOUSE OF SZECHWAN BECAUSE OF THE MESSED UP ORDER AND NOW THE RUDENESS OF THE "CASHIER".
Terrible, just terrible. I ordered at 8.30 and the rude lady said with a tone "Driver has left already, no more orders". The menu says open till 9.00...RUDE.
A+ for EFFORT & AMBIANCE. Our Supper club did the Phillipine Buffet today. Generous variety, unique flavors and outstanding service. Definitely stop in there.

One of our favorite restaurants in the NW suburbs.  So good, my son had them cater his wedding.  Always lots of food (you end up taking a whole meal home).  Best dishes: Orange beef or chicken, Mongolian Beef, Chow Sum Ding, Garlic Shrimp.

lots of elbow rooms inside --- i came here for the Filipino dishes (which were great).  i devoured an entire plate of lechon kawali before i ordered my meal.  super friendly staff --- one staff (maybe the owner) gave my kids free drinks.  Nice place to eat Filipino dishes inside a REAL restaurant...and not attached to a grocery store
Moved from the city, looking for quality Chinese delivery. This is the worst of all 4 other places we've tried. Don't waste your time.
Super friendly service. The décor is cheery. The menu is pretty typical for Chinese food. I haven't tried any of the Filipino options yet. Our food was very good.
Owner Danny and workers are so friendly and helpful. Eggrolls are honestly the best I've had anywhere. Perfectly fried, not too much cabbage. Love them. Chicken fried rice also, great stuff.

Close to home, but this place has become a joke, their prices are through the roof and their food is nothing to write home about.  Most dinners are around $17.00 which to me for Chinese neighborhood place is outrageous

This place has been great for quite a while...until today.  THEY RAN OUT OF THEIR DELICIOUS EGG ROLLS!!! I wasn't told this over the phone, but rather my wife was informed once she was already picking up our order.  If your supply is dwindling, check your stock before putting an order through!!! This is not EGG-ceptable!!!

The best Chinese food in the northwest suburbs. Pricey, but the food is excellent and you'll get a good amount of food.

I've been going to this place for years (it was once known as Munch Inn, which is now the name of an inferior restaurant in Arlington Heights). Great Mongolian beef, fried rice, pineapple chicken, egg rolls, egg foo yung, beef with pea pods, and sweet & sour chicken. The crab Rangoon is the best I've ever had---a must order. The governors chicken and empress chicken are also very good. They also now have a Filipino menu, and the Shanghai egg rolls (smaller but you get about 12) are great with the sweet dipping sauce. 

Mary and Danny are the owners, and they are fantastic. They are always there and are the backbone of the restaurant. Very nice and attentive. We almost always order out, but we've eaten there a few times and the interior is very nice. It's fairly large and visually pleasing to the eye. It's located in a great neighborhood and there's ample parking.

They are a bit pricey, but you get quality and quantity in return, so I can't complain. Typically, we spend about $35-$40 for a family of four. You get frequent flier coupons that allow you to eventually get free egg rolls, fried rice, etc. All in all, this is the best Chinese restaurant in the northwest suburbs.
Some of the worst Chinese food I've ever had. Ordered a Boba like drink that just had chunks of rotten smelling bananas in it... literally made me gag.

Came in for a late lunch (around 2pm) with a friend.

The restaurant was fairly empty, and service was fairly prompt. Servers were polite, though knew nothing about the Philippine items on the menu.

Started with egg drop soup, which was bland and salty. Moderate egg, and no onions! Tea was OK, not too strong but decent basic black flavor. Both soup and tea were served nice and hot.

I ordered Mongolian Beef, since I haven't had this in a couple years and she said it was good. [Didn't test the Philippine foods since she couldn't really tell me much about them :( ] The portion was huge, with an enormous helping of rice, and a piece of tempura chicken.

The beef was OK, but very salty (expected in Chinese food), and the rice was very mild. Beef served over rice noodles added a nice crunch to the dish, which otherwise was very basic. Food was served hot and fresh.

Friend ordered Egg Foo Young. Again, large serving with a lot of rice. Said flavor was OK, but not as good as two places he mentioned which he often visits. (I don't recall the places he mentioned, which are in Mt Prospect) He took one bite of the tempura chicken, and left the rest.

Prices seemed a little high, but not too bad for the portion size. Service was decent, but there were only four tables to be served, so can't comment on lunch or dinner times.

May come back for the Philippine Buffet, but the Chinese was not worth the trip - and we live across town. :( Servers need to be familiarized with the menu items, or have a brief description in the menu!

Terrible. Chicken fried rice tasted and looked 3 days old. Rainbow Lo Mein was awful. I'm not in the habit of leaving bad reviews because everyone stumbles sometimes, but this $30.00 meal ended up in the garbage.

The menu is huge, Chinese, Thai and now Filipino. The owner is very nice and funny, the decor is elaborate Chinese style. They have fun tiki style drinks and HUGE portions, seriously I ordered two items which could feed four people. Always have leftovers to take hone. Great family restaurant.

Do not place a delivery or take out order here if it's during a normal eating time! They told us it'd take 1.5 hours for delivery so we decided to pick it up (45 minutes instead). In early December, we had to wait an extra FORTY FIVE  minutes in their lobby after paying because they were so far behind. Such a frustrating Saturday. 

Food is decent though, and one time when I did get delivery (random 2pm) the older gentleman that dropped it off was so pleasant and cheery. Try the potstickers and shrimp fried rice!

I'm not one to write reviews as I usually get a feel for a place by reading other people's reviews but I had to sign up an account to make a review here. 

Let me start off by saying I've been getting takeout and sometimes dining in at House Of Szechwan for the better part of 3 years. I primarily order the Mongolian Beef lunch special. Now all up until recently it was delicious and I could justify the $9 price tag. Beef was real tender and had a bunch of flavor and their fried rice that's included was good as well.

Over the course of the past 2-3 months they have definitely changed their provider for the beef. It's horrible now and just to make sure I didn't get a bad batch I gave them 3 tries over a few months. It's just downright garbage now. It almost seems as if the beef they are using are leftover scraps. Full of fat, and weird cuts of meat that taste absolutely horrible. Before the change every piece of beef was lean with no fat and tasted great. Now not so much. This was the last and final straw for House Of Szechwan for me. I'll stick to my local Chinese place that consistently puts out good food at much cheaper prices and gives you a much larger portion.

I should have known that this place isn't "authentic" considering not a single employee we encountered was Asian... but not all bad. The crab rangoons were probably my favorite. The mongolian beef & governor chicken were alright--nothing spectacular. The lo mein needs some major work! The noodles were extra thin and the sauce was not what I expected at all. I'm used to a dark broth but this was clear and somewhat slimy. My biggest complaint is that this place was expensive which is not what one expects when it comes to Chinese food. There are about 5 other restaurants between my home & HOS that I can get the same quality for less.
Not good. They use frozen pre breaded chicken in their dishes. Go to Yu's Mandarin or Chef Ping's if you want good Chinese.
Friendly staff and good food.  I love the crab ragoons.  The orange chicken is also very good.  I'm always super thirsty after eating here.  The food is very salty.

I specifically came here for the filipino buffet as advertised by Ron Villaro on TFC (the filipino channel). There is a filipino buffet every Sunday from 12-3pm for $12.95 per person. There is a coupon out online for $2 off a person for up to 8 people til 8/31/12.

This filipino buffet is by all means one of the better ones out there not to bad name other restaurants. But a buffet is a buffet, it is what it is. I was still excited though since it was a pinoy buffet and I wanted to see what they had to offer.

I came here with my brother, cousin, and godson. We scoped out the buffet asap. They had regular white rice and garlic rice(needs a bit more garlic). They had shanghai egg rolls which were tasty and big veggie egg rolls. Some of the main dishes include: Sinigang(sour soup), pancit(noodles), chicken appretada(chicken with potatos), bangos (fried milk fish), beef with ampalaya(beef with bitter melon), lechon kawali (pork belly), and beef kaldareta(beef stew). For dessert they had chinese cookies, fried donuts, and turon.

My fave dish here was beef and ampalaya and the sinigang. Everything else was decent but not over the top wow. Overall a good buffet. 

This restaurant is pretty spacious with lots of booths.

I think the food is really good at the House of Szechwan. I absolutely love their egg rolls and crab rangoons! The only thing is that they are a little bit on the expensive side and also that they do not have free refills on soft drinks. I know a lot of restaurants are cutting back on the refills but I personally am always looking to hydrate myself with some liquids! The customer service I think is good... They do have lunch specials that are pretty affordable but not everyone can make it during lunch but it's nice that it applies on weekends.

I recommend the combination fried rice and the beef teriyaki!

I've eaten there many times and ordered take out.  Always moderate to decent service.  This time July 16th dinner the service was real bad horrific all the way.  To the point it was embarrassing having hosted a party of 10.  That's the sad part the time to screw up was during a party vs other times.   Just a very sad experience. Food is 3 stars.  Service 0 stars.  No apologies from them at all.  Staff needs polishing and major attitude changes

The only things that were enjoyed were the Egg Rolls. The Pad Thai was tasteless, the sweet and sour pork was also very bland. My son was OK with the low mein but said it was just adequate. And at $60 it was not worth the price at all.

My family usually gets the orange chicken and the Mongolian Beef. Both dishes are always very tasty and on that note their egg rolls are great as well. 

The owner and workers are all very courteous as well.

OMG!  On a Thursday night, 7:30ish, dirty tables galore! Waitress took a while to arrive to take drink order. Took that and are appetizer order, egg roll and pot stickers.  Drinks took forever; delivered and wanted to take dinner order, ok, gave it..soup (ordered with the dinner) came 1st, then boom, appetizers came, egg roll & dumplings (doughiest things I've ever seen or tasted).  Order a glass of wine when gave dinner was ordered, never came, dinner arrived and asked about my glass of wine, then she delivered it.  The Chicken dish was so full of cornstarch it was disgusting, and vegetable fried rice, bland, asked for spicy. The worse thing was they decided to clear tables, using a rolling cart and dish bins, rolling this thing past while you ate, clanging and banging, we felt like we were at a diner or cafeteria. Mentioned this to our waitress, she said it was easier on their arms.  I guess I felt like we went to a restaurant to have a peaceful dinner and a nice conversation, but was really turned off by the service and cleaniless of restaurant.

Overpriced and underwhelmed. Order pork adobo, but was nowhere near what it should look and taste like. Too salty and lacks flavor. I also ordered halo halo but fillings were spoiled. I called to complain but won't give me a refund. Only offered a give me a free one as long as I come in and order. Hello?!? Why would the owner think I'll even attempt to go there again after having a rotten experience?!?! Never going back.
Plenty of tasty food at very reasonable prices. . .I have never been disappointed with the house specials or the ambience.

ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! I will never order from them again, and neither will my apartment building.  The lady that answered the phone was unbelievably surly and mean and when I complained to her, she told me I can call another Chinese place if I don't like it!! I absolutely did call another place and they had fabulous customer service, and speedy delivery.  I definitely tipped the driver well and thanked the lady that answered the phone for their wonderful service!
Unfortunately just got over a week long battle with food poisoning after getting this for takeout.. Really upset cuz usually they are great.

First of all, easily the best crab rangoons you will ever have.  A bit expensive but extremely worth it. 

Anyways, I cannot say anything about the buffet or eating in, but I have gotten take out more times than you can shake a stick.  They are consistent and quality.  The most important thing, is they are knowledgeable.  When I call and ask what ingredients are in certain dishes, they are honest and know everything to a T.  For example, I recently discovered I have higher blood pressure, so we have been cutting back on our sodium and MSG and ordered no salt no MSG the last time.  After I requested an order of egg foo young, right away the person on the phone warned me that the egg foo young sauce already has MSG in it.  It was kind, courteous, and I was very grateful.  

As far as food goes, my favorite thing to order is the orange chicken, as it is crispy and full of flavor.  My main complaint is that the orange chicken has noodles at the bottom, when I wish they was more chicken.  My life is a big fan of their beef and broccoli. 

Based on my review so far, you may be wondering why I only ranked it 4 stars - this is due to the fact that when you order from here, you end up paying double compared to most other Chinese places.  I'm not sure it is worth the extra cost, but I still pay it.  Especially for those dang crab rangoons...

One of the BEST Chinese Restaurants around. Been to many Chinese Restaurants in my day, and House of Szechwan is the very BEST! Clean, excellent service, nice atmosphere, good prices, and the food is suburb! EX: I had family come in from Europe last year. They loved the food so much they took a picture for this years trip to remember their meal. Yes, they came back, and enjoyed a 2nd time. :)

This is my first time ever making a yelp review and it's not a very good one. Not really feeling this place..... The food is definitely under average and our waitress never came across our table to check up on us or give us refills on drinks and still charged us $28 for tip. What a rip off! I should have expected that from an Americanized Chinese/Filipino joint. At least the nice elder man was consistent with clearing the table of any mess. I don't think I'll be showing up here ever again.

This place has been around for ages and has now added a Philipino section to the menu; so now there are more options beyond the usual Chinese.   We ordered Philipino deep fried egg rolls (good) and prawns, pork and breadfruit in a coconut sauce over rice (interesting).   

The place is nice enough inside (typical Chinese).  

The service was indifferent and rather unprofessional.  The waitress didn't seem interested, delivered the check before we were done with our meal and didn't bother to ask if we wanted another drink or dessert.  At the end she proceeded to stack all the plates and silverware at the table before carting it all off.   Left a bad impression;   a  poor way to end the meal.   

This is NOT the best Chinese place I've been to.  Because of the indifferent service I probably won't bother with it again.
