It did take almost an hour after placing my order online and I only live a couple of minutes away.  The egg drop soup left much to be desired.  Not enough pieces of egg white, not a single green onion in it at all, and kind of bland. 
The crab rangoon was some of the best I've ever had,  And the veggie egg rolls were fantastic!  Except for the bottom bite that had been sitting in the bottom of the container that was literally dripping in grease (but grease is to be expected with Chinese food).  
All in all, pretty good and I would order from here again.

Placed an order for delivery over the phone and it was a wonderful quick convo, the employee got everything right the first time and understood everything I said. We ordered a dinner for 2 with Mongolian beef, pineapple chicken, and beef fried rice. Had to try the crab Rangoon, egg rolls, and the baby egg rolls too. Hopefully our new go-to Chinese restaurant for glenview!

The place was great!  We went at 7:30 on a Saturday night and the place was packed. Yet we were seated right away and had good service and the food was great. I went with the advice of others and ordered the crab Rangoon and it was the best I ever had and I have had Chinese food all my life all over the country. We also had the orange chicken and Mongolian beef. Both were excellent!  I had the fog cutter drink and it should be called the put you in a fog. I highly recommend you try it if you want a strong drink. I added pictures of crab Rangoon and orange chicken.

I don't usually write reviews, however, I do so now with the hope that you will read it and avoid making the same mistake I made. The food served here is some of the most bland, blah, boring food I have ever eaten. The best thing about my order was the fortune cookie.
Terrible food, delivery for 2 took over 2 hours and was cold. Save your dinner plans for any other Chinese place nearby! This place was not even worth 1 star.
Great food there delivery is kind of slow but pick up time is very quick I enjoyed the experience when I dined inn it's a great place to get food just wish the delivery was faster then it is

This was our first visit, and many more to come. To start the house egg rolls were awesome, their fried rice very very good. I ordered teriyaki beef, it melts in your mouth. My wife and Daughter ordered Empress chicken which I was allowed to taste. Again very delicious , both meals reminded me of the double dragon meal from the Plum Garden in downtown McHenry. Oh, the staff was very friendly as well.

Little expensive for Chinese food.  Food itself is less greasy and less salty than some other places, but nothing more special than that.  Not terrible, but it's just OK.

Delivery charge is $3.00 and it took more than an hour.... Panda express could been cheaper and quicker...

Best Crab Rangoon ever. Best Governors Chicken ever. Surprisingly good egg rolls. 

This is definitely our Des Plaines area Chinese food place of choice.

First time here, on a sunny Sunday afternoon. We still got the lunch special for a really great price and the food was really good, served on very large plates that allowed us to enjoy it for lunch at home the next day.  

The service was very pleasant, our waitress was all smiling, even when my wife had some special request about her order.

This was a pleasant, inexpensive  and tasty experience!

We'll be back!

HEAVEN FORBID the Cantonese girl understand Cantonese. And HEAVEN FORBID I order beef curry chow fun noodles, even describing the wide broad noodles. I received a quart full of curry cornstarch soup and white rice. Disgusting

Definitely worth a stop if you're in the Des Plaines area and hungry for solid Chinese food at very respectable prices. I've stopped in a couple times now for lunch and have yet to be disappointed. The lunch portions are huge and for about $7.00, you can't go wrong. The complimentary Egg Drop Soup was to our table as soon as we sat down, and was very, very palatable. Their white and fried rice has yet to be under or overcooked, and the meat (I've had shrimp and chicken) and vegetables are pretty solid. Some of my cooked vegetables have been a bit undercooked and/or close to raw, but the flavor more than makes up for it. Service is great, food comes out quick, and the bill is always less than I expect. It's definitely my go-to place if I'm in or around the Northwest Suburbs. Don't forget the chili paste!

Great Chinese food. The owner is welcoming and the entire staff there is friendly. Went for the first time on a Sunday night. The ambiance is very warm and inviting with nice decoration. I had the beef with Cantonese pan noodles. The beef came in a nice gravy with water chestnuts, pea pods and sprouts. Tasted great!

If you want great Chinese, drive to Chinatown.  If you want good Chinese, go to Panda Express or Sun Shui.  If you don't know how good Chinese food can be, come here.  I've had much worse in the northwest suburbs.  Pre-cooked, slightly musty chicken.  Big portions.  Americano sauces.  Nice people.

The House had been a favorite for years until the last 3 or 4 visits. Long waits, sticky tables, bad service, and cold food have seem to become the norm. Last night my dining experience took about 2 hours for appetizers and an order of fried rice! Server waited on another customer while taking my order. We asked that the sticky table be wiped down; the bus person went to the wrong table, interrupting the family that sat there. Beverages arrived only after server was reminded twice, and after the cold appetizer platter arrived. An order of fried rice arrived a half hour after the appetizer and predictably cold. Overall bad wait service and long waits for cold food made this a bad and final dining experience at House, but it is the culmination of several such experiences over the past year or so. Please check totals on your check make sure or ask for itemization. If you pay with plastic you'll get no itemization. Just make sure you're paying for your own meal.

Chinese Restautant that does not serve Chinese Broccoli. .We ordered basic Chinese cuisine, too americanized.. Just terrible experience,  waiter knew it too that we are in a wongplace to oreder real Chinese food.
Terrible - and it will make you feel bad afterwords, too. My guess is lots of MSG.

Gave this place a second chance after a very mediocre first try. Had the $57 meal for two delivered, NOT CHEAP, had to throw most of the food away, it was horrible. The egg rolls were tolerable for left-overs. The chicken fried rice was flavorless, the empress chicken was soggy and flat out weird. The crab Rangoon was a giant load of cream cheese. The pot stickers were, nasty and the "sauce" for them tasted like straight mirin with some kind of vegetable(?) slivers. We threw the menu away.

Basically what everyone else said... typical suburban Chinese restaurant. Everything is pretty standard...

Their saving graces:

-They deliver
-They have mailer coupons... Usually for free egg rolls with delivery or a discount if you dine in. Why should I only get the discount if I dine in? Am I not still a customer if I order take out!? STOP TRYING TO FORCE ME TO SIT IN A RESTAURANT IF I DON'T WANT TO DAMMIT!
-They restaurant is decent on the inside
-It is close to mi casa (a special yay for that! manders can be a lazy little lady when it comes to food... so the closer, the better)

All in all, okay... I'd rather go to China Wok on Golf Rd near McDonalds. SO amazing.

This is a great restaurant. We got there often because my father in law loves this place, and the staff has gotten to know us... they give my kids free "kiddie cocktails" every time we come and one waitress, who is really great, even remembers their special order requests. The food is very good as well.

The food really lacked flavor. I was really disappointed. When I walked in and saw that all of the customers were Caucasian I should have known better. Wonton Gourmet is much better for a more authentic Chinese food in the Northwest burbs...or even Chef Ping.

Went to this location as it is close to home and had a two-fer coupon from Entertainment..  Pleasantly surprised.

Clean, exellent service, pleasant music not too loud, extensive menu.  Everyone chips in to clean tables regardless of if it is their section.

Egg rolls - delish, not greasy, just right crispness, perfect balance of ginger
onion pepper tomato beef- very good
orange beef ordered mild was still a bit spicy but quite flavorful

Each of our entrees was betw $10-11 but we took home enough for lunch or dinner the next day.   Will likely order delivery next time and try more of their menu.

of note: "complete dinner" - $2.50 added to  each entree for wonton soup and eggroll to accompany meal.

-----------------
second order we placed was for delivery  

Lemon chicken - very good- not too twangy
Shrimp egg foo young - best I have had in many years.
b-b-que pork fried rice- not greasy.

good portions for the money.

Probably my favorite chinese restaurant in the entire area.  It is not necessarily cheap,but the food is plentiful and damn good.

If you eat in restaurant for lunch, or order a full dinner, you'll get soup and tea.  Make SURE you get the Wonton soup, which is really good - as others have said though, the alternative is definitely not for everybody, and I found it pretty gross.

The tea, along with the rest of the meal, has always been really good.  Portions are large, and I never feel like the food had been sitting out prior to my ordering it.  

The owners are incredibly nice here, and I've never found the service lacking.   The meal seems to move at whatever pace you'd like - I've had dinner here in under an hour when in a rush, but I've also spent substantially longer if catching up with friends or family.

Overall I would not hesitate to recommend this place to anybody that has a taste for Chinese.  Try the orange chicken, it's pretty great.

My first experience there was not great.  Hot and sour soup was gross.  Other things have improved though.  Crab rangoon is good and so are the entrees that I have ordered.  Not my favorite chinese but good enough.

this place is a cut above other Chinese restaurants in the area in my opinion, it isn't great (none are) but it is better, flavors seem more pronounced, less greasy, etc etc.

This location of House of Szechwan (there are two) serves a Filipino menu which I've been enjoying, some dishes are certainly better than others and Filipino food isn't for everyone.

House of Szechwan is definitely better than your local hole in the wall Chinese restaurant. The food that they make tastes fresher, is less saltier, and more presentable. I do like their Chicken with Broccoli dish with steamed rice, and their potstickers (dumplings) and egg rolls are edible. The only other place that I can think of in the immediate area that is better, in my opinion, is Chef Ping in Schaumburg. Now that place is always packed and the service is quite excellent. But back to House of Szechwan, my friend did supposedly have a bad experience here once about a year ago. His order had a small clump of about 5 black hairs that was in his food. Kind of freaked me out, but I only have ordered once from there since I heard that. Gave me the willies!

The food here is great. If you're a fan of McDonald's, which I am. Once in a great while. The fries were soggy but some were crispy. The chicken nuggets were warm, because they weren't made right then and there. I watched them grab them off the heat lamps. What I REALLY HATE is the price. $9.45 for a 10 piece chicken nugget meal. Are you kidding?!?! Almost ten bucks for McDonald's?! I'm never coming back, that's for sure. I just thought I'd stop by the mall to kill some time with my son. By no means am I a cheapskate, but for $10 I would rather have taken him to Subway for a fresh sandwich. Not McDonalds for fried junk food. If you really really want to have McDonald's and you're at the mall, go for it. Otherwise run as fast as you can to an outside franchise. You'll save money in the long run!

I went to this location and had a males hair in my food! I just asked for my money bak on my fry but was so disgusted tht i coukdnt even eat my other food! My hair is blonde this hair was black and short!There food isent great. It's over priced! I don't know how they consider this location a playplace. The play area is super tiny! If your at the mall u might as well go somewere else in the mall to eat.
Go to a different Mickey D's. My daughter asked for her soft serve in a cup but was given a cone. The manager came over and tossed it into a soda cup. Really good customer service?????

Overpriced!! They take advantage of Mall customers.  You can go down the street (5 minutes tops) and pay significantly less.  Almost every cashier is rude because of the volume of customers.  Plus $.34 for refills?  The owner is making enough from the inflated prices, why try to be greedy with refills when almost every other McDonalds has machines out on the floor.  I will not say I will never go to a McDonalds again because I love their food, but I will never go to this one again no matter how many times I go to this mall.  Better options in the mall than this place.

We were very excited for this place to open and have a new option for dining in Bartlett. We came on a week night and it was not too busy. We were told we could sit wherever. We had read reviews before going and most said the service was not that great. Our waitress was very friendly! We did feel like the service was a bit slow and lacked some organization but we realize this place just recently opened so cannot really blame them! 

The food was excellent!! We shared the Drunken Pigs and Artichoke Spinach Wontons and were satisfied with both! We then split the Thai Flatbread and Southern Burger--and loved each as well! The drinks were also great and our waitress didn't even hesitate to make us something that wasn't on the menu that we had requested! 

The atmosphere like an old Pub, although I might choose some different lights to fit the old-time feel of the restaurant more. They also had some kind of stereo and empty boxes near the kitchen entrance that they should try to cover somehow. Again, we weren't really that bothered by it as we know they are still perfecting everything.

Overall, a hit!! We'll definitely go back! We'd recommend this place and are hopeful it stays around!! Cut them some slack--they're new...they're working on making things JUST right!

I previously left a 5 star review when I thought ownership finally turned this place around. I'm not sure what happened or if ownership changed again, but the place has quickly headed in the wrong direction. The food isn't bad but it's just decent bar food. The beer selection had gone downhill a bit. And the service was questionable. Seems like between this place and lucky jacks, there is so much potential, but little effort. And get rid of those slots! I'm not sure how much you make off those, but it's so tacky and quite depressing. The only thing going for it is the awesome bar that is from the 1800s, but slightly modified.

Terrible!!!!!!  We are long time residents of Bartlett, wanted to grab a bite and a cocktail. It was 6:30P on a Wednesday. The place was empty. Sat at the bar, ordered a few Apps and as we were waiting a COCKROACH crawled across the bar. We told the waitress to cancel our order and she killed the COCKROACH. Unfortunately, where there is one there are many.
 I had high hopes for this place. But once you see that, you can't go back.

Yay for a new independently owned business in Bartlett!!  I try to stay in tune with what is going on in our hometown, so when I heard that the old Papa Pacino's formerly Bartlett Tavern & Grill was reopening with a slightly twisted concept, I knew we would be in there pretty quickly to give it a try. Earlier today, I heard from one of my best sources for local news (BAM's!!) that Platform 18 Tavern & Grill was planning a Grand Opening Party for 09/12/15. I don't like to wait, so I called and learned their doors were open and they were ready to show us what they've got! 

Parking. There is no street parking immediately in front of the building. But there is a lot right behind the building and street parking around the corner as well. It's just a few short steps around the corner and we don't pay to park in Bartlett, so that's a plus right there.

When we walked in, we were greeted by a man and a woman sitting at a table right inside the door. They were definitely talking business and before long, I realized the gentleman was likely one of the managers. We scoped out the TV situation since we had our choice of tables. Every TV had something different on, so we quickly chose a spot in the middle where we could pretty much see them all. 

Our server arrived with menus and took our drink order right away. I can't imagine they have been open for more than a few days, so the menus seem to be temporary. Copied sheets of paper with tiny font that was pretty light. I didn't mind too much, but my husband was tilting the menu toward the light from the front window to be able to read the details. I think it's likely that the menu is still in flux which is why it didn't seem very permanent yet. They also run a Happy Hour Menu on Tuesday through Friday from 5-7pm with sips & bites. I could have easily made my meal off those bites, but instead I opted for the pair of chicken tacos and he ordered a bowl of chili to start things off. 

His chili arrived along with my tacos. His chili was perfect. Exactly what he expected but better!  It included ribeye and pork shoulder both of which added to the nice texture. It was definitely a quality starter dish. I had ordered the tacos without the queso fresco. Our server had showed us the printed happy hour menu which outlined the toppings since all of those details weren't posted on the wall. Needless to say, the tacos arrived with the queso, but after our server talked with the manager, he stopped by, apologized and explained she had put it in the system, but their system didn't print it out for the kitchen. He fixed their system and minutes later, I had fresh, hot chicken tacos sans queso in front of me. They were worth the wait. They use two warm corn tortillas, chicken breast, onion, cilantro and a tomatillo salsa. For $5, the portion was very fair with plenty of chicken. The onion and cilantro were a little heavy handed, but the salsa complimented the chicken quite nicely. 

We both chose a burger and fries for our entree. They offer multiple varieties of fries - duck fat, bacon fat, truffle oil or plain. We wanted to see what their plain fries tasted like before getting too creative. Plus, both of our burgers already had bacon on them, so no need to overdo it during the first visit. The coleslaw is super pretty. A bright purple cabbage. I am not a big coleslaw girl, but it was good. We liked the plain fries and dipped them in some BBQ sauce to jazz them up. The burgers were served on nice buns. Definitely not wimpy burger buns. The bacon was perfectly cooked. My onion straws were more like seasoned onion petals/large pieces, and they were really good!  Every portion that hit the table was just right. Maybe too many fries, but better to have too many rather than not enough. 

The price was right. The food certainly had some unique twists on the menu that I can hardly wait to try over time. The server was sweet and kept our glasses full without having to ask her to do so. And the manager owned the error whether it was the server, the chef or actually the manager's fault. I appreciated how he handled that hiccup. Go give them a try. I'm looking forward to hearing what you all think too!

I want to love this place. Especially because we live down the street but also because Bartlett needs a good pub with great food. The food has been good, not great. But for convenience sake, we keep coming back. After multiple openings and closings, they can't seem to figure out how to do business. We went there today (a Sunday) at 1:30 for some football and burgers, and they were closed. Inconsistent is the name of the game here. Get it together, Bartlett needs you.

Now I am a long time Bartlett resident and eagerly went to dinner there on Tuesday night at 6:30, looking forward to the "Tap" reopening with a new menu.

Interior.
As soon as my husband and I walked in, we were surprised how  little had been done to the dark interior that never impressed us as the business went through several changes in the last years.  Why is this place still so dark?  Now that they have new menu, it does not do the chef any service that you can't see his food.
Still same noisy bar atmosphere with video gambling machines.

Menu
Now focusing on small plates is a nice touch.  Menu had various flatbreads, burgers, sandwiches and "large plates" (which are full entre meals).
The menu is small so when we were told there was no flatbreads, that was basically 1/5 of the menu that was gone.
My husband order the chicken large plate and orders the spinach w/o garlic and was prepared accordingly.  I wanted a flatbread, but instead ordered the BBQ chicken salad w/o olives... it came w olives.  No big deal, it was tasty but more like a lunch size portion.  So dark, it was hard to really see all the ingredients.
No dessert offering.
And sadly, no Friday fish fry.

Summary
All in all, its still a bar that just offers nicer appetizers than before.  I was hoping if would be a restaurant that had a good liquor menu, too bad.  I wish them luck, as I hope they heed the comments of all the reviewers.  Perhaps I will return once they improve, but as of now, I couldn't recommend it to any of my friends.

I've heard such great things about the restaurant I decided to try it for my birthday with some friends last Tuesday. When we arrived at 530 there were not many people there; however, it took a long time to order drinks. We then had to get our server to order dinner at about 610. That's a long time to wait to order food. We all ordered soup and an appetizer which then took 20 mins to get. Our food came out just a few minutes into the soup. The soup was great but most of our entrees were mediocre at best. It did get crowded and with only two servers the service was slow, but if the food was fabulous that might have been ok. Maybe it was an off night for them but don't think I would try it again. There are other Bartlett restaurants that are so good. Also overheard servers saying by 630 they ran out of several items on their menu which isn't that big to begin with.

Oops! Looks like they've been closed for a couple of week's. Too bad, so sad. Inconsistent food, service and management unfriendly to customers will do that to a place like this. Lasted about as long as I thought it would.

We were visiting the area, and stopped in for dinner here last night. We didn't try any of the drinks, but seemed to have a great drink menu. The atmosphere was super cute. The food was delicious! And the staff were super pleasant. Overall, great experience and we would visit again.

OK I don't see this place lasting very long because the new owners who fired all the previous waitstaff (who made good drinks!) don't seem to have a CLUE.  They ran out of Rock n Rye, which I loved in my Old Fashioneds I ordered there.  I would go simply for those drinks and now I couldn't have one.  Lame.  The soup I tried was very ordinary and the truffle fries were amazing.  But nothing else on the menu excited me. Too heavy on the meat and fried items.  No food or drink specials.  No music playing (unless you want to spend all your drink money playing songs on the jukebox).  Close to empty and just not a fun vibe on a Friday night.  Used to be much better. Simply put it is now quiet and lame and I am close to done.  Why is it SO DIFFICULT to find out how to run a decent bar?  HINT- decent music and drink and food specials for starters!  You want to lure people in, not keep them away!

I HATE having to do this. Hate it but I HAVE to. My bf and I went there three times over the course of the last 6 weeks. Saturday nights. First time was great. They were fairly busy.  Good food, great service, amazing old fashioned(s).  Second time.  My food was not good (ordered the pulled pork, same as the first)  Overdone and presented differently. It tasted so different as well. BF loved his flat bread. Drinks were a-ok again.  The issue was our server. Brought us our drinks and our food but never saw her again. Never even asked how it was. Had to flag down a server who told us she wasn't going to BE our server at the beginning of the night because she "had kids to get home to." (after she cleaned the table because it was filthy) Uh ok. Got our tab she said "make sure it's right because I'm just going off of what I saw in front of you." Had cash out with the bartender because, again, no one was coming to grab our money.  Mind you, there was a server at the beginning that had her tab walked out on because she came and asked us if we were "her two beers". Then proceeded to tell us she was walked out on. Sorry? Third time we were there.  Why a third time? Because that's our rule and it's literally right down the street from his house. And I swear there is potential. Promising, as this was the same server from the first time.  Nope.  Both ordered burgers (asked for med got super well done. Like CHARRED) and old fashioned(s). Got Whisky Sours?  Ordered a second drink, came out in a glass half the size of the first glass.  Not cool. And it was a Whisky Sour AGAIN.  Had to flag down the server.  I don't understand because there are so many girls working and they aren't that busy.  They were busy the first time. I promise you, I am being fair in my review and I hate to do this because I have a business myself but three times and 2 of those times were terrible? This place has the potential to be good.  I really think so.  There is def a disconnect between management and staff.  I have some opinions on that but I'm not sure if the guy we saw there twice drinking and schmoozing was management/owner or not. I hope they figure it out because it can be good!

If you are looking for a local dive/drinking hole, head over the Bracht's instead of comparing Platform 18 to the previous establishments that came and went.  Reading a couple of reviews here and some on FB, I was a little hesitate to give this location another chance.  

However, the food is excellent and the beer menu can be found no where else in Bartlett.  Finally, a place where you can get good food and good beer close to home.  I can only speak for my experience but the service was friendly and fast.  I had a burger and it was cooked perfectly.  Most places have no clue how to cook "medium or medium rare" but they were spot on.  The drunken pigs are one of a kind and worth the visit if just to get those.  

I realize some long time Bartlett folks might be turned off as they are expecting another hole in the wall with lite beer specials (which they have), but keep an open mind and try something different.  Food that is familiar, yet creative. Craft beer!  Can't find such a good selection at any restaurant close by.  Give this place a shot, you will not be disappointed.  

My only negative comment, the slot machines (while probably profitable and likely attract regulars) are a tacky feature.  I know establishments see this as revenue but it distracts from what could be a one of a kind place in an area hurting for it.

For was actually very very good. The service was very rough. When my husband and I first sat down it was crazy busy. The bar was packed for happy hour. The waitress had trouble getting to the table. Which ok ill excuse that. Not even  ten minutes after we were seated the place cleared out. There were three servers and a bar tender which was enough. Our waitress was standing by the bar looking at the restaurant  not doing anything but when you would make eye contact when you needed her she would walk away. The otheer two young waitress  were great busted it they were serving, taking orders,  backing the bar  and budding their  own tables.  The food was great though my husband and I had a burger and fries. I ordered  the truffle fries which were amazing and my husband had the bacon  fat fries which are      sooooo good there naughty.  The restaurant  does need a really good deep cleaning. Their decorations were very ... umm a good try. They were trying to go for a repeal prohibition  feel. Which is a great idea but they wanted wood crate  liquor boxes so they wrote gin  on a paper box.... for the decorations they could have taken another  $40 and finish the look... looked cluttered not cute. All in all great local  burger,  cute atmosphere love the idea need to execute  The vision a little better and ok service (potential  to be great)

Surprisingly good. Didn't read the reviews before heading there. Prefer to be my own judge. It's early days and the restaurant deserves a chance. Menu has a fair range, prices are reasonable and the food was flavorful and superior to most other restaurants in Bartlett. I typically don't post restaurant reviews, but am eager to see this location finally land on a winning proposition.
Closed AGAIN!  When is the owner going to learn that the only type of establishment that is going to be profitable in that location is a neighborhood bar & grill similar to Lucky Jacks?!?!?!
This place is really dirty and so is the owner. There's mold all over the place. I recommend looking elsewhere for food.

Food and service mediocre. Both of us had burgers so you can't really go wrong. My husband had cream of broccoli soup which was very bland. This is the second time we've been. First was when they just opened so we understand they were working their kinks out but this time was after they were closed for a month fixing their HVAC and according to their statement "working on customers comments & complaints". We had the exact same experience both times. We had to get our own high chair, no big deal, but then they just left the chair it replaced in the middle of the tables, creating a very awkward situation for other customers. We ordered drinks and hen it came time for refills we had to wave down the other server because our server never came back except to bring our food then ultimately our check. It got busy as we were sitting there but you still have to pay attention to all your guests. The slot machines take up too much room. If you're trying to create a bar/restaurant you want people to come back to you at least have to be able to accommodate them. I can honestly say we will probably not be back. We really had high hopes for this place as Bartlett needs a good bar/restaurant downtown. This, unfortunately, is not it.

Really nice people who were working.   We only got appetizers and they were good.  It's nice to go out for a drink and snack in Bartlett and have a different option.   Plus, the bar (original from the old Bartlett tap) is totally awesome.

Headed out to Platform 18 for date night with my hubby. So excited for a new restaurant in Bartlett. Based on articles in DH and Trib, walked in and we were kind of disappointed that the interior of the restaurant hadn't changed at all, other than a fresh coat of paint and new signage. Kind of busy, but was able to get two seats at the bar, felt very comfortable. Two large, flat screen TV's, Cubs game on. Approached by bartender Katie (no smile) for first drink, but had to ask for menus (was given one, had to ask for another). Menus on paper (enough said)  from then on, had to ask for everything. No explanation of happy hour specials, for food or drinks. In fact, after the first drink, Katie never returned to ask if we wanted another drink or to see how we were doing. Poor service. 2nd round initiated by us. Was shocked as to how the Katie treated the other waitresses. Very degrading. We ordered the sliders, fish tacos and trio of fries. The food was served on small trays, which is fine, as long as you are given a plate to eat off of. No plates were offered. Went to use the bathroom and was completely disgusted by the rusty grate and dirty floor. Nothing has been done to upgrade the bathrooms much less clean them (see pictures). The shame of it all is that the food is phenomenal!! The sliders were like eating filet. Tried to save some to take home...didn't happen. The fish tacos were to die for. Perfectly fried fish, lightly seasoned...just the right amount of heat with the sauce. Trio of fries was amazing! Would have been great to have a few dipping sauces for them, but would definitely order them again, if we could bring ourselves to step into Platform 18 another time. It's a disgrace that such scrumptious food is bring served by unhappy staff in an uncleanly place.

The food was very good, I had the fillet medallions with roasted peppers and potatoes. I also tried the American burger that my wife ordered. The fries were also very good. My meal was a little pricey but the burger was very reasonable. I will definitely go back.

Great food and great service. The process of waiting in line is not that intuitive, but it worked out. Michelle was a great server and the bus staff had water and coffee in the table within 30 seconds of sitting down. 

This is the money that Honeyberry could have earned today, but I'm glad they were so awful and that we ended up here.

Love the traditional pancake house atmosphere. The restaurant itself is pretty spacious; it's great for  couples, families, and even large groups. Every time I've gone here (both on weekdays and weekends) it's been pretty busy, but never more than a 10 minute wait. 

The menu is pretty much pancakes and waffles, but it has all the other basics and some specialties here and there. 

I ordered the blue crab meat Benedict with a side of chocolate chippies. The Benedict was okay, but it was worth trying just once. I was a bit let down knowing that it didn't come with any other sides besides pancakes, especially for how much it was priced at, but oh well. I loved the chocolate chippies! 

My family ordered ham and eggs and corned beef hash and eggs. Portions were pretty small for the prices. 

In summary, this place is decent. The price and portion ratio was a let down. Definitely is more for the pancake and waffle lovers, but if you're more of an omelette or savory breakfast person, I'd go somewhere else.

So, I don't know if this place is going to close soon but it feels like it.
I've also been a customer for years but this visit was a disappointment. 
One, they are skimping on ingredients, for instance there was virtually no chicken in the chicken chipotle crepes, two tiny bits, and the cherry kijafa crepes are no longer made with the same delicious filling but rather with something that tastes like canned pie filling. The food is still good but these changes are a bad sign and are discouraging to long term customers. 
It's a shame that a traditional pancake house has become more akin to a typical family diner.

I've been going to this Walker Brothers location since it opened; I even remember when this location used to be a Ground Round! It's a family tradition if we want to go out and have breakfast.

There is a good reason why we've been coming here for over 25 years-it's just excellent.  The breakfast here is top notch and you really get what you pay for. The decor is beautiful with the gorgeous woodwork, stained glass windows and chandeliers.

The food is the main attraction of course.  I've never had a bad meal here; I feel like I've had almost everything on the menu. My personal favorites are the Santa Fe Omelette, Dutch Baby with strawberry syrup/fresh fruit, the 49's, Swedish pancakes, corn beef with hash and the Crunchy French toast.  The coffee is soo good, hot and fresh, orange juice is fresh squeezed and hot chocolate for the kiddies is delicious and piled high with whipped cream!

Don't be intimidated by the line on the weekends, it goes fast.

Sign up for their emails; you get a preview of their monthly specials and the kids birthday get $5 off.
Yummy yummy in my tummy. Great gluten free pancakes, delicious hash browns and quick service despite there usually being a long line to get in on weekends

Walker bros is always a family favorite out in the Chicago burbs. German pancakes, huge omelets, and thick bacon are great reasons to frequent this spot. I've tried it all, and the egg dishes are always my favorite. Service is consistently very nice and hospitable also. Be sure to tip even though you're paying at the front! Also beware of long lines over the weekend, as every family out in the burbs gets excited for a hearty brunch at walker bros.

Breakfast for dinner is the best! Lol. Food was amazing! Everything was well seasoned. The bacon was perfectly crispy. The pancakes were nice and fluffy. But most of all the staff here were super nice! We're only in Chicago for a vacation and we were craving for breakfast for dinner and drove an hour to get here. It was 15 minutes before closing when we arrived and the staff still served us. They were nice and friendly, they didn't rush us at all. They even came and talked for a bit. Super nice place! Would definitely go back here again!

It's busy bc it's good. That Apple pancake was life. Wait staff was attentive and great.  Eggs were great. You can't finish the pancake in on sitting. It's sweet but good. 

Only thing I found out of the norm was the young man walking around with tray of glasses of orange juice.

This was my first visit. The stained glass in the windows and the hanging lights over every table are pretty fascinating to look at. You feel like every seat's hanging light could be from a different grandparents house. I love the fact that they have "The Great Treat" on their menu. It's 3 pancakes, 1 sausage link, and a candy bar--for grandparents and grandchildren only.

Actually, that's why I came tonight. My grandpa used to make the most awesome buckwheat pancakes. I've never found a place that has made it quite the same, but I figured I'd give it a try. I mean let's be real they weren't horrible pancakes, but none will compare to those made with love. They were just okay...slightly bitter...but that's buckwheat! That said, $8.84 for for 6 medium pancakes and a water is a bit pricey!

I don't know if it was because I was by myself, but I was tucked in the back right in front of the dish tub where everyone's dirty plates where placed. It wasn't horrible, but annoying to keep hearing clanking every so often about 2 feet from my head.

My server was pleasant. The cakes came out pretty quickly too. I just wish I would have understood that I didn't pay at the table. I sat there for a bit looking like an idiot with my card on the receipt. Oh well, now I know.

I think I'd go again, but I'd try something else. There were some dishes that looked good as they passed by me and the server station...

I am not a big breakfast food fan...I eat breakfast maybe 10 times a year and, when I do, it is just as likely to be a ham sandwich as it is bacon and eggs. Maybe it was because I had just woken up and wasn't thinking straight, but when a friend asked me to go to Walker Brothers one Saturday morning, I agreed. I knew full well that there would be a gigantic line - the place actually has a waiting vestibule with permanently placed railings to keep those waiting corralled. We got there and parking was a total nightmare. I had to park across the street in a strip mall and then walk across like 6 lanes of busy traffic.

I entered the "feeding line" as I will refer to it and there were maybe twenty people in it, all in their weekend best - denim shorts, t-shirts with air brushed names of the dismal places they had vacationed three years previously. Suddenly I found that we were a quarter way down the line - the line was moving MUCH faster than I had anticipated. I would say we were in line maybe 10, certainly no more than 15 minutes. This surprised me, but I guess they have it down to a science.

The host led us through the beehive of activity that was the restaurant and seated us at a table. I ordered a cup of coffee....here is the thing, I don't drink a lot of coffee, but some years ago, I was really into it and was fairly familiar with some of the more exotic coffees and growing regions out there, so I do KNOW a good cup of coffee....Walkers coffee was surprising. It wasn't super strong, but it was excellent - and I mean, it was really, really good!!! I mentioned it to our waiter and asked what it was - being in the food industry myself, I wasn't surprised to hear that it was their own private label. 

I ordered the Santa fe omelet - it was big and looked as though it was baked in an oven. Typically when people do that, the outside browns and the texture turns to the texture of a shark's dorsal fin....this was neither burned, nor overcooked...it was likewise, very, very good. I ordered a short stack of pancakes instead of toast and...well, they were very good as well.

Excellent service, excellent - nay, amazing coffee - and the food was perfect. I honestly cannot find fault with this place apart from the fact that I don't like breakfast food. If the wait had been 40 minutes as I suspected it would be, I would have had a total meltdown - 4 year old temper tantrum right there in the foyer...but the line moved quick...I don't know...I want to find fault with this place for some reason, but I just can't. It was a great experience all around.

Love, love, love Walker Bros!!! First off the service is always great no matter which location. I've been to the Arlington Heights one by myself before (was waiting for car to finish being looked at by Ford) and I felt so comfortable! Sometimes eating a meal alone at a nice sit down restaurant can be awkward, but they managed to make it feel natural. My most recent visit though was for my birthday breakfast with my husband! I ordered my favorite, Crispy-Crunchy French Toast. As soon as I saw it placed down in front of me I couldn't help but drool a little. They've perfected the mix of crunchy outside with soft and sweet inside. The little slices of bananas and the dollop of whipped cream on top totally took the cake. I did my happy dance with almost every single bite. My husband ordered the potato pancakes, which is a staple I order from many different restaurants. Luckily enough I was able to have a little bite of his- it was my birthday, after all. Again with the crunchy outside and soft inside!!! Just the perfect "fall apart in your mouth" option. The pancakes were savory and buttery. You really didn't even need to top them with everything! It was the perfect start to my birthday, and it really would be the perfect start to any day!!! Make sure you try it, because you won't be disappointed!

I decided to check Yelp and get a recommendation on a place near my job to have lunch at. I chose this pancake house today. The outside of the restaurant has a nice appeal. I walked in and was seated right away. I immediately noticed how clean and bright the place is. The restaurant has a lot of charm, I loved all the different chandeliers. 
As soon as I sat down I was brought my silverware and water. The waitress came soon after. I ordered eggs benedict, I'm on a benedict kick lately, and I opted for the pancakes instead of fruit. My food came right away and I must say, I was very impressed. The eggs were cooked just right, the sauce was on point and the english muffin was toasted and buttered perfectly. The pancakes were also delicious. I'm embarrassed to say I ate almost everything. My drink was refilled constantly and I have nothing to complain about. Great job!

This is a fantastic breakfast house!  Above average food and excellent service.   I've eaten here twice with the same good experience both times.  Price are typical for breakfast - not super cheap but certainly not over priced by any means. Try them out if you have a chance.

I know this place is famous for pancakes, but my boyfriend and I ended up ordering an omelette and getting the side of pancakes, WHICH COMES WITH THE OMELETTE! It was more than enough food for the two of us, and we even had a pancake left over. Omelette was very satisfying, but the pancakes were definitely something different. It did not taste like the pancakes I've had anywhere else. I feel like there was a bit saltier than a typical pancake, and it made such a huge difference! I wish I could go back to try their other pancakes like their famous german pancake and the apple-something pancake. Oh yeah, the waitress was also very nice!

We were there around 11:30 am on a Saturday, and we waited for maybe 20 minute in line, which was totally worth it. I'm getting hungry just writing this review... Hope this review was helpful! :)

I've loved Walker brothers in the past but this time was very disappointing :( when we sat down my boyfriend and I got coffee, orange juice, and water. The coffee mugs were stained with grime from previous users, the water glasses had flecks of dirt on them, and my spoon was not clean. We both looked past this and ordered our food. 

I ordered scrambled egg whites with ingredients including turkey sausage. My server put the turkey sausage on the side when I asked for it inside and charged me 4.25 for it. My boyfriends bacon was old and tough and the hash browns weren't hot :( We each got a basic entree and our bill came out to be $48! We could not believe it. The value does not match the price of the food, service, or cleanliness standards for the restaurant.  We probably won't be back!

Intro:
A delicous place that gives great deals at a fair price.

Decor:
The place is very clean and vibrant. Always well organized and has a very good design to it.  

Service:
The service is always good.  Waitresses and waiters are always answering questions and making recommendations.  Definitely nothing to complain about here.  

Food:
Always hot, delicious and fresh.   I usually either get the Sant Fe or Mediterranean omelet and it's always consistently good. Well worth your money.  I usually get the whole wheat toast with with a side of spicy vegetable topped hash browns.  Also excellent tasting coffee and your mug is always full.

Price:
Always fair in terms of what you get.

Overall:
Excellent service,  great food and clean place with several great locations.

After reading the reviews, my wife and I decided to try Walker Brothers. We were very glad that we did! The food and service was excellent. The atmosphere was very upscale,  with lots of wood and chandeliers, and the staff is very friendly and attentive. We ordered the apple cinnamon pancakes and western omelette. They were both good portions, and good choices. I would highly recommend this restaurant!

Went there for Sunday brunch. The place seems like your typical, local brunch spot. The decor is dated but it feels warm. The food was pretty delicious. I wish they had hazelnut coffee but otherwise everything tasted great. Our waitress was a little out of it but she was nice.

This place gets a lot of hype and I'm not sure why. The food is just ok. I guess they're famous waffles apples and I didn't think much of it. Nothing more than get at IHOP. I've been there a few times and nothing really stands out and that's pretty impressive because I feel like something always stands out. I feel like when somebody says hey you want to go to Walker Brothers I'm always like nah. Not impressed

I will forever love this place. Quality food,
Amazing service and never disappointing. You can order anything off the menu and be happy! I cant eat at any other breakfast places, they never even come close.

I love this place it is great food at decent prices could be a little cheaper for you it's good food! I really really think that this place should be bigger for the amount of people that are here it's always seems to be busy. I really think overall the voices and a plus but would love to see your bigger one put in down the road. The service was extremely helpful and quick.

Absolutely delicious! Always love going to Walker Bros be it this location or the other one in Glenview. Be prepared to wait a while in line on the weekends. My favorite here is the Santa Fe Omelette with Wheat Germ Pancakes. Oh and do yourself a favor and get a glass or maybe even two of the fresh Orange Juice. After dining here you'll never go back to Ihop or Denny's.

I had to wait in line but we got our seat less than 5 min. I had a blueberry pancake and it was different than other restaurants. Blueberry was a lot more fresh and it was pretty good portion. I also liked the bacon on side. It was very thick and crispy. They had plenty of seats and pretty good parking space. Service was pretty good too. In would come back this place again.

I have been going to ALL of the Walker Brother Original Pancake Houses for years and years and never had a problem with ordering a special order of my apple pancake WITHOUT apples until Sunday, November 6.  When I order this pancake I always get a german pancake as well so that I would be able to take leftovers home.  The apple pancake came and looked like it had been dropped or didn't rise completely because it was almost as flat as the plate it was on.  I commented to the waitress and she said she had never seen one that looked like mine before either.  The reason I order without apples is because I like the thickness of the pancake and like I said I NEVER had a problem before - EVER; and, I get this Apple Pancake quite often WITHOUT APPLES at the Arlington Heights restaurant too.  I asked our waitress if she would go to the Manager and ask if I could get another one as this is not how it usually looks and she agreed (I had never had to ask this either!)  Well she went to the Manager and asked if I could get another one and he/she said no because it would look the same as the one I got!?  What's up with this?  I NEVER had a problem before and now this Manager is saying I would have a problem because they don't come out right since there are no apples and this Manager didn't have the audacity to come and talk to me at our table!  What kind of customer service is this???  I am quite disappointed with this and will now order this pancake at a completely different restaurant - not a Walker Brothers!  I have been in the restaurant business via family and have worked as a hostess so I am not new to the business and how people should be treated... this is not how it should have been handled!  Shame on you and your management Walker Bros!

It had solid, but not spectacular food.  No ambiance.  My husband has raved about it, so we met his family there.  We arrived at 8am to beat the rush and our party of 8 was immediately sat.  The omelette was good.  The eggs were light and fluffy.  We ordered the Denver omelette and substituted sausage for ham.  What was odd was that all the cheese was right in the center of the omelette only, but not folded like a French omelette.  Because of this, only 1/3 of the omelette bites had cheese.  We also got the apple cinnamon pancake.  It was light, fluffy, and eggy more like a German pancake opposed to an American.  All the cinnamon and apples were caramelized on the top.  We ate our omelette first and still the pancake was too hot to eat without blowing on it to cool down.  It was worth the wait though.  Really tasty, I would order this again.

If you are going there for breakfast you'd better make sure for some details, like being there early enough, find the parking spot, standing in line at least around 15 mins and be fast eater and leave the restaurant as soon as posable to be respectful for people who are hungry and  standing in lines...lol
Fortunately my friend got there earlier and I didn't have to wait forever, but he had to wait for me until I found the parking spot and the point is after driving around I couldn't make it and parked  all the way across the street and walked a little too.
I had eggs and bacons with rye toasted bread, well nothing special. He got Apple pancake with ice-cream. I had the bite. The pancake literally was HUGE not bad but too sweet for me.
 I have been honest to you and you can make an idea either go or not, but I am pretty sure I won't make any compromises for something Huge and too sweet!  
I am guessing that I am more lover of a  nice, calm and enjoyable than too crowded, popular and stressful for some point.

Amazing pancake place!!!

But the egg eggs Benedict Venetian are the sleeper hit here!

I ordered inside the restaurant, to go.  The young girls I ordered from were pleasant enough.  They still were uncomfortable to talk to.  I think my over-niceness personality threw them off and probably was put off by it. 

Food - I ordered eggs, ham, and toast.  My fiance ordered eggs, sausage, and pancakes.  The reaction our faces gave when we opened were, "we should have gotten breakfast from another place".  We felt like we paid for overpriced McDonalds breakfast.  The portions were McDonald's portion, but higher in price.

Taste - I think our disappointment of the portion of the breakfast affected our taste buds.  I'd hate to say it but I was just not happy with the amount of food we received.  Although, the ham was good, the over easy eggs were good, and the toast was good.  But it was just such small portions that I can't get it out of my head.  

Sorry guys but if you are going to charge what you charge for breakfast, then you should add some hash browns or home potatos, or something else.  It's just way too skimpy and you charge more than other places and their portions are bigger for less money and the taste of the breakfast is great as well.  Also, your pancakes were so small!!!  What was the size of the pancakes about?  I almost felt like I was being punished because of how small the pancakes were.

Anyway, thank you for the meal.

I've never written a review anywhere before, but I'm so mad and upset I feel like it's needed. The food was amazing but the service was terrible. Our server was very discriminating towards us. Me being white, my boyfriend and his parents being Hispanic. We ordered our food, asked for things that we needed once our food came out nicely. Anything we said our waitress had attitude, a rude face expression or some slick comment following back. Mean while I'm watching her with every table. Reading her lips, watching her face expressions. She was nice and normal with all her tables around. All of her tables around were also white families. I think this is completely wrong and unacceptable. The one star I gave this review is towards the food only.

First of all the food is just bad, I don't know what you people in this contry are used to eating but this is just bad, not tasty at all it does not have any flavour at all, at all. Service is terrible, I ordered hash browns on the side to my omlette and they brought me hash browns with onion more onion that potatos, more onion that anyone can ever eat! So i kindly asked if they can just bring me regular hash browns so they did but it took them 25min I was done with food by the time they brought it to my table. I was suprised this place was packed and even more suprise it has such a great reviews.

My first time here. Near amazing. Not a fast food/breakfast place. Good service & as your meal is cooked to order, it takes the time it needs. Well worth the prep wait & the upper range pricing. Fresh, well crafted meals, balanced seasoning, nicely presented at a relaxed pace. No push to turn tables here. I had the Blue crab meat eggs Benedict - perfectly poached eggs, lightly sauce with a sprinkling of capers & a lemon wedge - just great! Fresh squeezed juices including grapefruit, great service, extra attention to cleanliness, all add up to just an exceptional experience. Unless you just want typical fast, "Denny's" breakfast & pricing this place WON'T disappoint!

Many great items to choose from, the buttermilk pancakes are pretty standard so get adventurous and try some of their speciality pancakes.  Can't go wrong with the crepes with potato pancakes on the side.  Word of caution for those who do not know, no such thing as free refills herw.

This place was absolutely amazing!  Being from out of town it's hard to find good restaurants but Yelp steered us on the right direction!  Alex (our waiter) took great care of us and gave us great suggestions. I highly recommend the Dutch pancake and the Apple Cinnamon pancake!  Fantastic!!

The best $$$ place for breakfast but worth every penny. My main reason I love this place is that they don't rush you eating, excellent fresh brewed coffee that just tastes great. Whether you order an omelette, French toast or even their famous Apple pancake I've never had anything go wrong. It may be called a breakfast place so if so this is my favorite. Fresh everything plus excellent service.

This was one of the best meals I had while on vacation. The apple pancake here is AMAZING. It is so good, it could be my last meal and I would die a happy woman. The delicious, eggy pancake is as big as the size of your plate and like two inches thick. It's topped with a hot caramelized apple topping consisting of sweet apples and delicious cinnamon and sugar. When the hot apple topping is poured on top of said pancake, it starts to crystalize creating a sweet, crispy, crunchy, sugary delight! It's like having the best apple pie in the world for breakfast. I think the pancake must have a bazillion calories, but it is probably the best breakfast I have ever eaten. It was so good I had to stop in not once, but two times on my recent visit to Chicago. The coffee is amazing as well, and pairs wonderfully with the pancake. I also had a side of bacon, which was good but nothing special. Obviously Walker Bros is a big hit in the suburbs of Chi Town because there was at least a 30 minute wait each time we went. Let me say the wait is definitely worth it. If you are in the Arlington Heights area, do yourself a favor and get to Walker Bros.

I felt it was imperative that I up their rating to 5 stars after dining here tonight. I asked for sunny side-up eggs but got eggs with hardened yolks. I pointed the mistake out to the manager who explained to they don't serve eggs that way because they don't reach a temperature considered safe for consumption. She offered me basted eggs which keeps the yolks runny. I accepted and they were delicious. AND to top it off, she gave me 3 more pancakes on the house for a measly 5 minute wait!
I had the cherry crepes and they were heavenly! Will definitely visit again next time I'm in town.

Cudos this place is great for breakfast. Service is phenomenal and super high speed. Never saw this in any breakfast place ever. However, charging for a small orange juice $4.25 is ridiculous and no refill. Anyhow we will be back but most likely not order any orange juice.

This is a Chicago (suburbs) institution. It's only second to Egg Harbor Cafe in my book.
Their German take on breakfast make Walker's unique to the hundreds of other breakfast places in the area. While the pancakes are great - and the namesake of the restaurant - I encourage everyone to to break the mold and try some of the other items on the menu. There is no risk...everything is good.

Prices just went up on menu they will charge you a upcharge / scam fee to switch a side item when it is no good cheap carbs anyways. Also no wi fi ! for what you pay in high priced little portions. Food is fresh!
This place is A+. Been coming here lately and everything here is made to perfection.  Will be coming back for sure! Eggs Benedict are unreal.

I've been here many times, each time it seems, quality/service goes further dowhill.  A friend & I were here for breakfast @ 10 a.m. on a Monday.  She loves the apple pancake, or I would have chosen another spot.  I Ordered what I usually do.  American cheese omelette, EXTRA cheese, & an english muffin.  When my omelette arrived, it looked more like a small souffle'. When I put the fork in the center, it flattened out to an empty/ hollow inside, with just a lining of egg & a dot of cheese.  It looked not right, & my friend commented too.  The English muffin....they keep getting smaller. This was the size of an oreo cookie.
Anyway......I should've sent those nasty eggs back, but didn't want to fuss.
3 hours later, I had a very bad stomach ache w/ nausea.  Bad.  I had nothing else to eat.  Today, the stomach ache continues.  The culprit is that nasty looking "omelette".  100% certain.  Who knows how old those eggs were & how they were stored.  They need to be more careful how their kitchen does things! Someone can get seriously sick from bad eggs.  I won't be back.  Ever.

Santa Fe Omlette is pretty fluffy and flavorful served with spicy pico. Pancakes were soft and the syrup was heavenly. The decor in the diner was pretty and the place had a good Feng Shui. Good service. Worth coming back.
Pricey but good quality.     Blueberry waffles are amazing here. Very crowded on weekends!    What they do here is done amazing,  but I guess you get what you pay for.   Not a quick breakfast place.

Been coming here for years. The key to an amazing restaurant is consistency!  In over ten years of coming here it is always the same great food. Not a bad meal in the house. Plus the servers are all super friendly. The omelettes are amazing. I have eaten every single dish and I can say that nothing is bad here.

More restaurants need to adopt Walker Bros.' style of seating.  I came here on a Sunday in the late morning with my mom and aunt.  We waited in line for maybe 10-15 minutes while waiting for a table.  I love that I didn't have to hunt down the hostess stand to put my name in.  You simply stand in line, and they seat you when a table is available.  Beautiful!

The monster omelets are both massive and delicious.  I was undecided between sweet or savory that morning, but when I saw that the omelets also come with pancakes, that sealed the deal!

I had the cheese omelet (cheddar and swiss) and opted to add sausage as well.  Walker Bros doesn't skimp on the ingredients, which made for a very filling and satisfying breakfast.  My pancakes on the side (served with whipped butter - yum!) were also very good.

The apple pancake is really good, but the sweetness may be too much for a meal.  Definitely ideal for sharing though.  

The service is attentive and courteous.  Our waitress was very friendly, and they kept our beverages full.  When we finished our meal, we couldn't help but notice an employee pacing back and forth while staring at our table.  I get it, it's Sunday morning, and you want to turn tables.  We didn't camp out for much more than 10 minutes before we paid our bill though.

I would definitely come back, as the food is definitely above average for breakfast, and the prices and wait were reasonable.  If you expect to linger and catch up with your dining partner, you may want to reconsider (or go when it isn't so busy).

The food is alright, and the service is fine, nothing really to complain about. 

There's nothing here you couldn't just make at home.

Being a city girl I find that you can almost never trust reviews for places in the suburbs.

My boyfriend and I came here expecting great things based on the reviews and we left feeling "meh". It was just ok. 

We didn't like that almost immediately after we were seated a man came rushing over with a pitcher of orange juice (we assumed was complimentary) that ended up tacking on another $10 to our bill. It was a bit deceiving.

The apple pancake was ok and the buttermilk pancakes had a weird taste to them. The bacon, however, was a nice thick cut and full of flavor. I don't think I'd come back here, but I'd definitely like to know where they get their bacon.

Like their other pancake houses, this Walker Bros is like the rest. You're assured a good breakfast cooked to your liking and I haven't been disappointed. 
I did notice a change in their coffee and for the better, much richer and more aroma than in the past. 

I always get the WB combo which is the best of both worlds. I like having hashbrowns with the cheese and onions as well as eggs and pancakes and then you have a choice of bacon or sausage! 

The grandkids just love their pancakes there with crispy thick fried bacon. 

This month and every month there is a 25% off special and for October it's the apple pancake, one of their signature dishes! 

Start the day off right with a hearty breakfast at WB!

We had a nice experience here on Christmas Eve morning. The dishes and silverware are very clean. Our coffee was great and refilled often. We thought the food was good as well. Everything came out fast too.

Something has changed about this Walker Brothers location... maybe it was just an off day?  I'm hoping so!

Our server (whose name I have either forgotten or did not get) was pretty slow coming to the table for the first time.  Although she apologized, she also made a sideways comment about "not being on her game today."  Which was totally true, because she continued to be pretty absent, and then make excuses for it.  Examples:
1) Busser brought juice.  She says 'oh, I was supposed to get that for you.  Oops.'
2) Runners/other servers brought food.  'Oh, I really wanted to deliver that to you myself.  Oops.'

I understand that WB gets busy on the weekends, hire severs who can handle the capacity in a friendly, non-frazzled way.  Also, teach them tact.  We were sitting in the back in plain sight of the side station in the southeast corner of the restaurant.  One of the servers was standing back there, obviously complaining about one of (or many of) her tables while making snide facial expressions.  I watched her the rest of the time I was there, and she genuinely looked as though she hated her job.

The food wasn't exactly up to snuff either.  I mostly always order 49ers.  Did the recipe change?  They tasted syrupy.  I don't put syrup on my 49ers.

I do enjoy Walker Brothers as a special treat and a memory from my childhood.  I'm hoping this was just a bad day.

In many people's experiences I believe there are not many places that compare to a morning at Walker Brothers. 

I had the French Toast, which was great. We have them the ultimate test! one of my family members requested her bacon Chrispy, whereas another asked for regular bacon. They got it right. So you KNOW you have a great cool at this location. 

Even the waiters are very respectful and always make sure you have what you need; not a rude bone in their body. 
WB, you've done it again.
Just simply the best breakfast place! The blueberry pancakes are to die for. The fresh orange juice is delicious! I had a omelette which was made just right. Can't wait to go back and try new items!

To start this is my first time eating at this place. And the food wasn't bad, I just felt it could be better. The overall environment feels outdated, I'm not sure if that's the theme they were shooting for or what. And I kinda felt that my waiter was a little on the aggressive side, but I guess others would just call that good service. Overall, I wouldn't pass on eating here again but it's not one of my go to spots.

Amazing amazing amazing! 

The pancakes are to die for.

The service is quick, consistent, and pleasant.

I really love this place, if you haven't gone - YOU SHOULD !

AMAZING food, they are known for their apple pancakes, ive had it , omg delicious!! I had their eggs and hash browns with a side of potato pancakes w sour cream. I had them last time and MUST get them every time I go... 
  Its busy on the weekends so be ready for a long wait...Our waiter was nice, he took a while to get our drinks but other than that.. A swell guy

I've been going to the various Walker Bros. locations for most of my life and it's always been a great experience, plus a solid suburban go-to brunch spot when I have guests in town. The apple pancake is the legendary star of the joint, and something that always wows visitors, though I do recommend sharing one (with ice cream, of course) rather than dealing with the inevitable sugar coma that results from eating one all by yourself.

Just about everything else is top-notch - the omelets are big and fluffy, the bacon is big and just the right level of crispy, and all the different varieties of pancakes are excellent from the simple buttermilk to the blueberry pancakes that have both blueberries in the batter and a delicious blueberry compote served on the side.

The only thing to note is that the Sunday brunch rush is always a madhouse - expect to wait in line for up to an hour and then be rushed out the door by leering wait staff who want to turn your table ASAP, so if you're looking to catch-up with old friends on a Sunday this is not your place. Most of the days and times you should be fine.

Went there this morning, haven't been in awhile to this location.  There was no host to greet and seat us.  We waited awhile so we just sat our selves.  The waitress came by and just tossed over a few menus.  She was not very friendly at all.  We ordered our breakfast service was reasonably fast.  I don't know if today was an off day but everything we ordered, there was four of us was tasteless.  We all were very disappointed.  We go to breakfast often, I do not think we will go back.  It's not worth the cost.  This used to be a great place.  So sad.

Awesome breakfast.  Had basted eggs & bacon with a side of buttermilk pancakes.  I'm not sure what their secret is, but these were the best tasting eggs I ever had.  Pancakes were awesome as well.  I wish I could've tried everything on the menu.  Good, fast service.  Why only 4 stars you ask?  Bacon was tasty but in my opinion it was overcooked.  If I liked crispy bacon then I'd give it 5.

This place has great food and drink. It's clean inside and the staff are polite and friendly. Some stuff is a little over priced but it's we worth it. There will be a wait of you come at prime time but it's delicious.
this is the only place I have ever had the 49 flap jacks and they are the best.  That and the apple pancake are amazing.

Breakfast served all day! What more can one ask for. This location is in a central location and is quaint and has excellent service. Ordered the Santa Fe omelette which came with 3 pancakes! Pancakes were fluffy and delicious. The omelette was huge and I could barely finish it. The coffee here was fresh and the waitress kept filling it at regular intervals. Made me happy.

I will admit that I was a sucker when I walked in. The stained glass and woodwork inside of that place completely surprised me. I've heard great things about the place for years and I am ashamed it took so long. Good service. Good food. Great prices. Will be back for sure.

This is by far the best breakfast place in town.  My husband and I went here and could not even get in the door to give our names on the waiting list.  Mind you it was July 4th weekend and I am sure that had something to do with it.  We came back for dinner and our food was phenomenal.  I had a chicken sandwich and my husband had a crepe.  I didn't have a breakfast item but my food was also exceptionally good.  Nothing but good things to say!  Service was awesome.  The food was awesome.  The only think I can complain about is that they did not have any barbecue sauce for my sandwich.  Other than that I highly recommend this place.

The food here is pretty fucking good. Got the Santa fe omelette with ham and it was phenomenal. It came with a side of delicious salsa that perfectly complimented the omelette. My friend got the veggie omelette with bacon and it was so cheesy and fluffy. They both were. The hash browns were crisp to perfection. 

My only complaint is that it costs like $3 just to add meat to an omelette and they don't serve biscuits and gravy.

The wait to be seated is not very long and goes quickly.

I'm a HUGE fan! Their breakfast and pancakes is so wonderful! I love their lox! I love their pancakes. Very fluffy! Yes, you wait in line, but it is fast moving. The serving staff does an amazing job as well.

I just found out their sister company is the Original Pancake House, but who cares, it'll never be as good as Walker Bros (food wise, service is great at both restaurants)!!

Yes, the line is long. Half an hour to an hour wait is inevitable, but it's all worth it, I promise!! (Trust me, I used to go all the time.) The mushroom omelet (comes with AMAZING mushroom gravy), the dutch baby, and the apple pancakes are my three favorite breakfast entrees at this location. The apple pancake is even sold frozen, along with the Kona coffee beans!! 

As for drinks, I recommend the fresh squeezed orange juice or the Kona coffee. 

Great for families and friends of all ages.

Ugh, I need to go back and visit again.

My favorite breakfast restaurant in the burbs. I've been coming here for years and pretty much everything on the breakfast menu is good (although I've never tried the lunch items, so I can't speak for those). The French crepes with frensh strawberries are my all time favorite, although I love the pecan Belgian waffles as well. The interior decor is old world classy (think stained glass windows and bronze art nouveau statues). The only real drawback is the wait can be very long on weekend mornings, but I think that's typical for most breakfast restaurants. I also like that they're open late because I get a taste for breakfast for dinner every once in a while :)

I've gone here a few times now for breakfast and it's a great place!
I've gone on the weekend when the lines are literally out the door and during the week when you can be seated right away.
The decor is very nice, there is intricate wood work all over the restaurant. It's clean and very well kept.
The service is excellent: attentive, friendly, and helpful.
The food: the omelets are amazing( I highly suggest the Santa Fe), the pancakes equally great ( the pecan are my favorite) and the French toast! They have one covered in corn flakes ... It's amazing. Your portions are huge so you'll be busting at the seams if/when you finish your plate.
This is a great community restaurant that has a dedication to quality service and food. Check it out!!!
I love pancakes! Pancakes! Oh my golly pancakes!!!

Don't be too discouraged when you come into walker bros pancake house and see the long line...it moves pretty quickly and the wait will be better for everyone if you don't make a big deal about waiting (they dont take reservations!) 
 the cinnamon apple pancake is delicious! definitely big enough to share with another person! My boyfriend got the crunchy french toast and its really good, the corn flakes give the french toast a nice crunch, hence the name..We also got a side of the spicy habanero hashbrowns which are really spicy but really good!!
I would come back for sure!

Total breakfast place with a bit of lunch options but mostly breakfast. I had the veggie omelette it was bigger than your usual omelette and packed with lots of veggies. We also ordered the german pancake which was huge and delicious! Definitely recommend this place for breakfast its really good!

Ok so my wife and I have heard so much about this place. Went today and still don't know if the food is any good. I have been in food service for 30 years, and this was a new one on me. People standing in line, No one  knows what is going on or who is next. They didn't take your name, number of people in your party. They don't tell you how long your wait may be, nothing !!! It was the most bizarre experience I've ever been a part of. Horrible way to run the front door. If we ever go back, we'll see how the food is!!

When I moved to the Northwest suburbs 18 years ago this is the first restaurant I went to with my roommate and her family. I've love it ever since and have been countless times The food is absolutely amazing. I've never had a bad experience with the food or service. The eggs Benedict is amazing. The pancakes, Dutch baby, French toast, and apple pancakes are absolutely wonderful too. The thick crisp bacon is one of a kind not you standard bacon served at most breakfast places. The service is outstanding as well. It is a little pricey but worth every penny.

I just love Walker Bros! Their omelettes are delightful and the german pancake is definitely worth the extra few minutes. They even have a baby version - the dutch baby! I live out of state, but I have to stop in when I come back to Chicago to visit the fam.

This must be what pancake heaven is like. Oh.My.Stars. I should tell you that when a friend suggested we meet here when I was in town, my first and immediate thought was, "apple pancake". This is the stuff legends are made of. I haven't been in years, and it was just as amazing as I remembered. Our waitress was great, too. She swung by when it looked like we needed coffee but also just let two girlfriends catch up.

Best pancakes I have ever had. Love to order these for takeout on lazy weekends. The German pancakes are delish and you can share one with someone else---unless you're really hungry! Give 'em a little squeeze of lemon and you have pure perfection! Seriously the best thing I have ever put in my mouth!

This is a great place to go for breakfast.  This place never disappoints.  My favorite is the Venetian Benedict - so delicious!  We've had crispy French toast and crepes - family favorites!  We try not to come her on Sundays after 9am because it gets really crowded.  Saturdays are less crowded also.  So far, we've been to this place twice and never had anything we didn't like.
Beautiful stained glass windows and soda fountain decor throughout. Great service. Delish decaf. Amazing menu items. Silver dollar pancakes! I will be back again!
Best breakfast place ever. The buttermilk pancakes just melt in your mouth. I love love love Walker Bros.

Kudos to Walker Bros for giving me the best experience in a long time! I came in on Wednesday night with my family for brinner. I am something of a regular at this location, seeing as I live within walking distance. I haven't reviewed it until now because I have been indecisive about how many stars to award. Usually it's super busy and the food is good (sometimes so-so, sometimes great) but service lacks and it is always pricey. But this time was the bomb.
Service was amazing- an almost empty restaurant certainly helped. We had a server and a trainee attending to us, and they were very detail-oriented. They even brought out a new glass of water with no ice for my dad when they came around to refill the rest of us with ice water.
The food was AMAZING. I had an apple pancake, which is a definite splurge for me. I usually resist because it's so big and for the past few years I've felt the quality has gone down some. But the one they gave me was a 10. A+. 5 Stars. Ooey gooey, piping hot, crispy outside, soft inside. Delicious. The rest of the fam loved their meals as well.
So I guess I've found the secret. Come in for dinner.

Because I know this place gets packed on the weekends, we try to go during the week. If we're in the area on a Sunday, we're in line before 9:30am while church is still in session.   

Don't get discouraged when you get there and the line is wrapped around the building. Because most people gather to eat here in groups after church, there's an illusion that there is a long wait for a table. The line moves relatively quickly, because you have to wait until everyone is present in your party to be seated.
